Comment Head: Rita Hayworth and spectacular film making
Comment Body: I think the reason this film stands out a classic is because it has so much heart. I've always thought the story is what makes a great movie, and this one had a brilliant one, based on the short "Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption" by Stephen King. The screenplay adaptation of this short novel elevates the dialog and the moving performances of Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman into a masterpiece. The plot twists and turns in directions that defy the best of imaginations...ones that only Stephen King could write. I am truly humbled by the writing. But as a film it is more than that. It's over-riding theme of "hope" transcends the message over the walls of Shawshank to the green grass, and the beaches of Zihuatanejo.

Comment Head: The Movie Gives Me a New Life
This flick will set you free

Comment Body: "Sometimes I feel sad that Andy is gone. I have to me remember that some birds are not born to cage. its feathers others shine. And when they run away, the part of you that I knew arrest them is a sin, is happy. Yet the place where we live It is more empty and lifeless without them. I think I miss my friend"I'm still wondering how it took me so long to watch this ingenious piece, but okay. Starting with the life lesson about "Freedom" that was passed:In the film we have so much to learn about it, we can see that when our freedom is cut unjustly we do not know what to do and everything points in just lowered his head and move on. But no was what Andy did, he had hope but also worked hard to (say around 20 years digging a tunnel? My God, there is perseverance). All this with patience and wisdom (The guy is f ******) And even with all the difficulties, even with all the obstacles of the Director of guards of the rows, and still getting two months in solitary confinement, the guy does not give up.What about hope: Even though every reason in the world to give up, he He did not give up, even when Red said "Hope can leave a madman "and he replies:" Hope is a good thing, maybe the Best of all, and nothing that is good must die "And even there that hole, he made a difference with their peaceful way, intelligent and both strong and then continued on.On how not learn is in the society:What happened is that the guys were both arrested time already had become accustomed to that reality, for them, it was to be free be trapped inside, the concept of freedom for them changed fully as they surrendered to it and had their freedoms cut, no longer knew what it used to be free and to enjoy to life again. We can see the example of Brooks, there even being arrested, he felt free, he was someone there and built his character there, but unfortunately ended up settling in a lifetime caged and to be returned to their free life, I did not know what to do and He ended up committing suicide. Fortunately it was not what happened with Andy, he He insisted so. Red ended up bending a little, but in the end with the help of his friend, entirely given your life back.This film is a great lesson. It is something to be taken to heart and take as an example for life. Everything about him, the construction of the script, develop the story, the flawless performances, was something millimeter worked, and think, worked very well. The characters are extremely catchy, since its characteristics to his dialogs, which are very rich, very intelligent and were used an excellent narrative. This movie made me have a roller coaster of emotions, from ups and downs, to laugh, to cry but also be moved. Anyway, all I can say is Andy and Red did give me a wide grin that lasted one hour and after the movie and I went to sleep happy. 5-star favorite, great masterpiece lives up to all excellent reviews and the excellent grades he deserves.

An ultimate master-piece. The best movie ever made. Period.There are movies, there are great movies and then at the end of the tunnel, there is SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION. Initially, a failure at box office but a winner of hearts and emotions forever. This movie changes life, it helps people get eternal hope. The strength of the movie is its connection with the audience. One can easily relate with a scene or a character or a moment in this gem of a movie.Shawshank Redemption is a movie which strikes a chord with all its viewers. Two words that define this movie are: Hope and Friendship. It shows the ever-lasting bonding of 2 men and their journey together in the confines of a prison. The simplicity of the movie is admirable. The scenes are believable, the struggles are realistic and one gets attached to the pain and sufferings of Andy Dufresne. All the characters have done an incredible work. Tim Robbins (Andy) and Morgan Freeman (Red) carry the movie and are outstanding to say the least.Whenever you feel sad or upset, whenever you need hope or whenever you want some will to overcome the greatest obstacle, Shawshank Redemption will uplift you in ways that just cannot be simply described in words. It will touch your soul and leave you mesmerized, captivated and wanting for more. You will definitely identify something very personal in your own life.I personally use the quotes in this movie in my real life. They help me whenever I feel depressed. 1.Fear can keep you prisoner, Hope can set you free. 2.Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies. 3.Get busy living, or get busy dying. 4.On the outside, I was an honest man, straight as an arrow. I had to come to prison to be a crook.It is my all-time favorite. I have watched it more than 30 times and still the charm fails to fade away. Every time it leaves me spellbound with its sheer brilliance. It gets better with every showing. The movie connects with you, it moves you and most importantly, it gives you HOPE!!!

This movie is probably the best movie ever made to inspire people who lack conviction and the will to push that last step which may open the door of unlimited opportunities. Wonderful acting, direction, sound, camera work and the most wonderful thing about this film is its script, taken from a short story of stephen king. Marvellous is the word to describe its narrative and story projection. I wish i can watch similar movies before dying. Frank darabont, you are a champ bro. Hell yeah! It is a simple film, yet it has an everlasting message. Frank Darabont didn't need to put any kind of outlandish special effects to get us to love this film, the narration and the acting does that for him. Why this movie didn't win all seven Oscars is beyond me, but don't let that sway you to not see this film, let its ranking on the IMDb's top 250 list sway you, let your friends recommendation about the movie sway you.

Comment Head: Shawshank Redemption is a classic movie with a great cast and excellent writers
Comment Body: Coming from Sandusky, Ohio (about 35 minutes from Mansfield Reformatory) myself; Shawshank Redemption was an instant classic. About 2 years after this acclaimed movie came out my family had an Exchange student from Caracas, Venezuela named Christian and he loved this movie so so much. We all watched this movie at least 222 times that year. It is hard to believe that The Shawshank Redemption has been out 21 or years and every time it is on TV all I can say in Morgan Freeman's illustrious voice is Poor Andy Dufrane. Just starting out in show business Shawshank Redemption is a great study piece in all aspects of filmaking. Being this is my very first review, The Shawshank Redemption is a powerful piece of Classic American Film. This historical piece will forever live on in the Enteric plane. Thank you Mr Steven King for allowing this fabulous writing to be turned into a Movie

Shawnshank Redemption is one of the greatest films of all time. And this is why.Tim Robbins a accountant who is wrongly convicted of murder and sent to Shawshank prison where he friends up with Morgan Freeman and his gang. The beautiful cinematography and dialogue make the film emotionally moving and beautiful. Morgan Freeman narration is brilliant alongside his chemistry with Robbins.This is a must see movie for any movie lover. With it being on most streaming websites it's easily accessible to watch this classic.Follow me for more movie reviews soon.

One of the finest films made in recent years. It's a poignant story about hope. Hope gets me. That's what makes a film like this more than a movie. It tells a lesson about life. Those are the films people talk about 50 or even 100 years from you. It's also a story for freedom. Freedom from isolation, from rule, from bigotry and hate. Freeman and Robbins are majestic in their performances. Each learns from the other. Their relationship is strong and you feel that from the first moment they make contact with one another. There is also a wonderful performance from legend James Whitmore as Brooks.He shines when it is his time to go back into the world, only to find that the world grew up so fast he never even got a chance to blink. Stephen King's story is brought to the screen with great elegance and excitement. It is an extraordinary motion that people "will" be talking about in 50 or 100 years.

Now, I see what everybody was talking about. It took me 4 years to see this, in my opinion, masterpiece. If you have not seen this movie rent it anyway you can. The performances delivered by Robbins and Freeman are, to me, the pinnacle of both their careers. This film cannot help but evoke tactile imagery to the fullest capacity. You feel what the main characters are going through the sensation is uncanny. Robbins (Andy) and Freeman ("Red") are a balance of the human spirit. Andy is your freedom-seeking hope side and "Red" is your rational, pessimistic counterpart. Find your equilibrium in "The Shawshank Redemption." Now, I see what everybody was talking about. Watched this movie more than 10 times and I love it every time. It has all those things that a movie fan wants to see every time a press play. I usually don't like jail or war movies that much, but this one is very special and hasn't left the 1st place of my favorite movies list. The actors are superb, two of the greatest actors still in this time worked their best ever and even the "bad guys". Someone once told me that if you really feel like you hate the "bad guy" is because is an excellent actor, and it is so true! Prepare for a long couch and pop corn time but for sure, and no one ever regret it. Recommended to anyone that is willing to go through many emotions (the good ones).

Comment Head: Shawshank Redemption: Still stirring it up?
Comment Body: Shawshank Redemption showcases the best elements of human endurance. The justice involved in both sides of the fence is heavily weighted towards human dignity. It is still valid today as we look at men and women enduring prison and racial injustices involving the treatment of black prisoners. This comes out in Morgan Freeman's performance and the reactions to his parole hearings.Tim Robbin's performance, shows the utter joy and excitement of beating the system in his expressions during the record scene, and the arrival of the library. The writing and dialogue show intelligence behind the conversations of those whom are usually found to be marginalized. The character development of Red and his friends is absolutely astonishing as they play off of and rely on the validity of Tim Robbins pulling off a truly amazing performance. The Bad guy: is always hard to write about. But he did good making us hate him, whatever that may entail, bless him. The cruel scenes are depicted with horror, while withdrawing dignity from the character's card pile; and turning it over to the viewer. You can crawl into their skin, but won't need therapy. The movie IS therapy.

I have never seen such an amazing film since I saw The Shawshank Redemption. Shawshank encompasses friendships, hardships, hopes, and dreams. And what is so great about the movie is that it moves you, it gives you hope. Even though the circumstances between the characters and the viewers are quite different, you don't feel that far removed from what the characters are going through.It is a simple film, yet it has an everlasting message. Frank Darabont didn't need to put any kind of outlandish special effects to get us to love this film, the narration and the acting does that for him. Why this movie didn't win all seven Oscars is beyond me, but don't let that sway you to not see this film, let its ranking on the IMDb's top 250 list sway you, let your friends recommendation about the movie sway you.Set aside a little over two hours tonight and rent this movie. You will finally understand what everyone is talking about and you will understand why this is my all time favorite movie.

This is definitely a classic. Its suspenseful and funny. Never left me bored once. Very well written, I fell in love with every character (except the bad ones). The friendship and bonds developed between the inmates was a thing of beauty to watch. I fell like all aspects of the prison was covered, between the downtime the characters spent, to the bets and bribes, to the inmate activities. The plot takes you back a few decades, so the clothing attire and mannerisms needed to match the era. I think the actors did very will with keeping up pretenses. Very engaging film. Would recommend to anyone with a little time on their hands and willing to witness one of the greatest movies of all time.

What can I say... When I was a kid, I didn't like The Shawshank Redemption. In fact, I was disappointed with this movie. Because, to me, they had to be happy ever after! The years have passed, and I'm old enough now, and I felt really stupid because I didn't like this movie. Oh my god. This movie wasn't made for children, It was made for grown ups. It's language - a child would never understand the message. A child would just enjoy the pictures and the songs. When I saw that movie again, 2 years ago, I understood why they couldn't be together, I understood the message of the songs and I understood the fact that this movie is one of the most brilliant movies created.

Comment Head: Get your best friend to watch this movie with you.
Comment Body: Hmmmm!What a movie. My two pennies' worth is that you get your best friend to watch this movie with you, because this movie explains the definition of what true friendship entails The Shawshank Redemption epitomize everything you want in a movie. The suspense,thrills,frills,intrigue,pain,and hope exhibited in the movie was phenomenal. What more can I say about Morgan Freeman,his performance in the Shawshank Redemption was great and he exhibited mastery in delivering his lines. Tim Robbins,he truly justified his selection to be the lead actor in the movie. Please watch this movie and thank me later.

Comment Head: when the film teaches you to live
Comment Body: I saw this movie the first feeling that you will try to not feel the same person. The banker Andy Dufresne, masterfully played by Tim Robbins, is accused and punished by ergs for the alleged murder of his wife and her lover. He will be sent to Shawshank Prison, where he is director of Norton, whose corruption leads to the use of convicts to be able to enrich. In this prison, much like a hell, Andy will find support as Red, Morgan Freeman in his best performance but only earned him a nomination for an Oscar. The result is a strong friendship between the two, so much so that, for the persecuted Andy, Red becomes like an island of sanity in a sea of ‚Äã‚Äãsharks who take advantage of him. But here is the teaching of the film, grown because your passions will redeem you, and you always have hope because hope is perhaps the best thing for a man! The intelligence of Andy and his hope will allow it to redeem himself and save a life ... that of Red. The considerer one of the best films in cinema history and a must see for review. I am surprised, but not that much, why did not win anything really important ... is considerable an injustice like the absurdly missed Oscar for Best Picture in Taxi Driver, 2001 Space Odyssey, Clockwork Orange, Awakenings, and Kane to the directors M. Scorsese, S.Kubrick and O.Welles!

I would say this movie is the best movie made till now. The way Tim Robbins plays his part is definitely one of the best performances I have ever seen. I've seen a lot of movies, and this is movie is special. It has an amazing storyline and worth watching. On the other hand, it is all played very natural, for me it doesn't feel like I am watching a movie, it's like I am watching someone's memories. The way the director and writers have put this movie together, it gives me the idea I am there with them. Also, the way Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman show their emotions, you can see they are first-class actors. It is 2 hours and 20 minutes of sympathizing with the main character. There are so many lessons in this movie which you can use in the modern days. If possible, I'll show this movie to my children and try to let them explain why the choices were made and ask for their opinion.

It was the most impressive movie that I've ever seen. It taught us if you are in even in jail, you shouldn't lose your hope.Because "Hope is a good thing. Maybe the best of things. And no good thing ever dies." Although there is going to be appear some unnerving problems in your life even you are rich or poor, white or black, happy or sad etc. You will have to fight all about this problems although if you feel like a weak. But if you lose your faith and hope there would no point what you are against or why you fight. Because your best friend is your hope. There is no meaning to live if you don't any hope any goals with you. Don't let them to steal your hopes from you otherwise you will just become like a walking dead.

Comment Head: A testament to the human spirit
Comment Body: Timeless classic and doesn't have to brag itself to be known as the most riveting drama of all time, a brilliant main role combination of Freeman and Robbins, exceptionally finished. I think It was a very good movie because the story was very catching, and the film was very exciting because I got him very passionate continue to watch from beginning to end. The film, in my opinion deserve a 10/10. It's an excellent movie, it's a movie you must see. It's an engagingly simple, good-hearted film, with just enough darkness around the edges to give contrast and relief to its glowingly benign view of human nature. Morgan Freeman, who is simply a great actor, a man who has never struck a false note in his career, both narrates this tale and anchors it with his authoritative playing.

if you haven't watched this movie yet, you are missing out my friend. it is one of those movies where the plot moves ahead and you don't have an exact idea about what lies ahead until the final 20 minutes. Having said all that, the film is satisfying, but cloying. Andy is the minister of the healing power of hope. He educates the inmates on the healing power of Mozart. He builds a library. He asks Red why he stopped playing the harmonica. When Red replies that it's no use in prison, Andy looks at him soulfully and replies that "here's where you need it the most." Despite the somewhat unbelievable friendship between a white, upper-class, innocent banker and a black man in 1949, it's a valuable lesson that may seem inspired to children who haven't heard this story a couple hundred times. You would want to clap and jump out of your seat when Andy's genius and patience is on display for the world to see. excellent movie, excellent plot and Morgan Freeman's narration is the added bonus.

Thia is the Best Movie of Prison Escape Ever in my view as of its suspense & drama before they even escape with showing technical ways of brilliant mind ..... MOrgan freeman showing his Class as Always .... with exceptional camera work of close cell scenes ..... Best Location & Escaping route ..... Credit to sound producer as well as casting directors for amazing supportive cast not even making minor mistakes .... Good thing not showing extreme make ups as it was less action & more drama type .... I Personally love it because it was released on my birthday exactly ON birthday ...... heads off to director & producer for coming up with the best team for best movie.

WARDEN NORTON: I believe in two things: discipline and the Bible. Here you'll receive both. Put your trust in the Lord; your ass belongs to me. Welcome to Shawshank.RED: I could see why some of the boys took him for snobby. He had a quiet way about him, a walk and a talk that just wasn't normal around here. He strolled, like a man in a park without a care or a worry in the world, like he had on an invisible coat that would shield him from this place. Yeah, I think it would be fair to say...I liked Andy from the start.ANDY: I guess it comes down to a simple choice, really. Get busy living or get busy dying.WARDEN NORTON: Lord! It's a miracle! Man up and vanished like a fart in the wind!RED: Same old sh*t, different day.CAPTAIN HADLEY: What is your malfunction, you fat barrel of monkey spunk?BROOKS: Easy peasy japanesey.RED: I have to remind myself that some birds aren't meant to be caged. Their feathers are just too bright. And when they fly away, the part of you that knows it was a sin to lock them up does rejoice. Still, the place you live in is that much more drab and empty that they're gone. I guess I just miss my friend.ANDY: Remember Red, hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies.ANDY: You know what the Mexicans say about the Pacific? RED: No. ANDY: They say it has no memory. That's where I want to live the rest of my life. A warm place with no memory.RED: I find I'm so excited that I can barely sit still or hold a thought in my head. I think it's the excitement only a free man can feel. A free man at a start of a long journey whose conclusion is uncertain. I hope I can make it across the border. I hope to see my friend and shake his hand. I hope the Pacific is as blue as it has been in my dreams. I hope.

This film has it's own character, out of any time and place. If you know anything about Justice or Prison, then you can easily see the reality portrayed. The storyline is perfect, with deep layers of emotions. Watching it many times, I see why the younger generation wants to see this picture. So many of the films with Law and Order(no pun intended), are not real. Being more of a period piece, this is a teaching tool on how to do those projects. The convictions alone of the actors, is so refreshing, very few films have this involved with the Director. Will watch it again and again, some of my favorite Actors also...

Comment Head: Probably the best movie of all time
Stephen King's adapted novella, the Shawshank Redemption is a film you gotta see because it is simply a MASTERPIECE!!

Comment Body: I am not a HUGE Stephen King fan. I'm just not into the scary stuff. But this film is absolutely AMAZING. Over the years I have watched this film numerous times and it just never gets old. I can't begin to imagine what an inmate that has spent the majority of their life behind bars goes through after being released into the world once again. The trials and tribulations have to b huge. This film helps the rest of the world to understand what they go thru. AND I LOVE how Tim Robins gets the cash at the end and Morgan Freeman shows up. Just outstanding. I'm sure. This is one of the films that has helped to push me to be an actor. I just hope I can be half as talented as ALL talent in this film.

Comment Head: Greatest movie since The Seventh Seal
Comment Body: Best movie ever.Tim Robbins acting is exquisite and Morgan Freeman's narrating is mesmerizing.How Stephen King can create such a story is beyond me.I love how you almost feel like a part of the prison family Andy and Red has and how you get to follow them. You also get to understand how an ex-con tries to adopt to a life on the outside after spending their whole life behind bars.What I disliked with the movie was that I felt a particular plot point was thrown together in haste but after that the movie resumes to it's 10/10 stars standard.

This movie is just amazing. Star cast, superb photography, brilliant achievement, and a spectacular argument. It's one of those movies that make only far away, and never forget. I've seen him several times and I miss him a lot of people. Comment Head: So Inspirational it has Saved Lives

Comment Body: At a port town, a crowd of passengers disembarks from a steamboat; among them, a grizzled cowboy with a gun at his hip. Two lawmen escort him out.Newsie: Extra, extra, health benefits of smoking! Extra, extra, read allabout...hey! Watch it, mister!The cop had shoved him aside.Newsie: Extra, extra! Bill Williamson's gang...They walk out of range, ending up at Blackwater Station. The cowboy gets on the train without speaking a word, and takes a seat as the steam engine leaves town. Two ladies behind him, and a young lady and a preacher in front of him, hold their own conversations.Lady: Well, I for one am grateful, Mrs. Bush, that they are finally bringingcivilization to this savage land.Mrs. Bush: I could not agree with you more, my dear. My daddy settled thisland and I know he'll be looking down on us, pleased at how wehelped the natives.Lady: Yes they've lost their land, but they've gained access to heaven.John listens to the young lady and the preacher in the seat ahead of him.Jenny: But Father, do you mean unless an innocent receives communion, they'redestined to go to hell? That hardly seems fair.Father: What I mean to say, Jenny, is that there is a great deal of differencebetween an innocent and a savage.Jenny: I never thought of it that way.Lady: Yes they live like animals. But they're happier now.Jenny: Not only do people now have motorcars, father, but I heard pretty soonwe will be able to fly.Father: No, angels can fly, Jenny.Jenny: No, no, apparently people can fly. Didn't you hear? Out in Kansas a maneven got a car to fly.

Comment Head: A master piece abbreviated by a movie
Comment Body: There's no movie based on a fictional novel could embrace perfection like this movie.Hawking had to be proud.Tim Robbins has proved that his dramatized talent is extremely rare.While Morgan talent has been essential movie after movie i can't find a role for freeman in one hand with the existence of the philosophical dimension on the other hand.The movie in general spreads how the bureaucratic employers are working when it comes to save a life and then how would they react when they have to make a choice between their benefits and others life.Dufresne defiantly reflects the justice face and while the warden reflect the true face of opportunism,Stephen King couldn't imagine there's an actor can wear Dufresne so perfectly as Tim.

Absolutely the best film i have ever seen, nothing compares to the cinematography, the acting and the story itself. it's a great piece of art that will live on forever and be a part of cinema history for many more years. I can remember the first time i ever saw this movie, my now late mother showed it to me and told me that it was a really good movie.(this is when it came on HBO i think) i couldn't believe my eyes even at the age of 11 i was already into the best of movies, and when i watched the story unfold in front of me and witnessed the pure cinematography of it. It immediately became my favorite film of all time. And to this day, 17 years later i am a filmmaker myself and someday strive to make a movie half as good as the shawshank redemption.

Comment Head: You must to see this film
Comment Body: A story of friendship and endurance set in the reality of prison life, The Shawshank Redemption is best known as an Oscar-nominated film. However, this theatre production is based instead on the original novella written by Stephen King relatively early in his career.The direction in this piece is stylised, with a deliberate slow rhythm and pace, particularly in the first act, greatly reducing any sense of menace that you would expect from this so-called tough prison. It is almost Brechtian in style. This becomes frustrating as it takes much of the emotion out of the production; a vital piece of the human connection that then means the audience is less invested in the outcome of the possibly innocent Andy Dufresne and the lovable rouge Red. This underplaying of emotion results in a restrained and difficult to engage with character in Dufresne, played by Ian Kelsey. There are moments of anguish from Kelsey, but with the direction holding such a tight reign on the characters, the moments are too far and between. Patrick Robinson's Red fares a little better as he addresses the audience with a charming older storytelling voice, but is still not given enough freedom to truly embrace Red's charisma. When using this deliberate stylised direction, the impact on the reality of the stage fighting also showed, again detracting from the idea of brutality.The second half picks up the pace slightly and the play overall is watchable with good performances all round from the cast. However, without the rawness derived from emotional context, the prison life never feels as if it is unbearable to be in or watch, meaning the power of the ending is lessened.By Isabella Fraser

Comment Head: One of the top movies of all time!
Comment Body: First of all, the actors chosen to play the key roles were absolutely suitable and fitted each other. More specifically, Morgan Freeman is remarkable. In addition, the direction of the movie was flawless. Excellent Photography! Furthermore, the music was stunning. Wonderful sounds to accompany this epic film. Concerning the story, it was really touching. From the beginning of the film, you get stuck in front of the screen to watch every single scene. You travel in a world of anxiety, pain and ultimate redemption. I love this film so much because of the perfect combination of all the fundamental elements. It is almost certain that you will get emotionally attached with all the characters. To sum up, The Shawshank Redemption is a movie you should watch. It is totally a piece of art.

The Shawshank Redemption is a well-crafted prison drama and another great movie to add to Frank Darabont's impressive filmography. Morgan Freeman is the standout as one of the most endearing characters in cinema history, while Tim Robbins and a host of excellent character actors fill out an outstanding ensemble cast that make you feel like you are there with them in that prison. This is an emotionally satisfying film with many memorable character moments sprinkled into an otherwise pretty standard plot. While I find it to be a little too sensitive at times, this is an excellent motion picture and a must see. It may deserve to be generally regarded as (one of) the most overrated film(s) ever made, but it is above all a wonderful, uplifting and deeply touching tale of hope and perseverance that certainly deserves to be remembered as one of the best adaptations of a Stephen King story.

One of Tim's best performances. He deserved all awards & nominations for this film. Definitely one of the best films I've ever seen. The best part of the movie is the whole thing. Although some parts of the movie were a bit violent, it was done with taste and I felt it was important to the story as a whole. Although the film was rather long, it still was able to hold my attention... I was never in a state of mind where I was wondering "When is this movie going to end", and that is very rare with me. I cannot believe I went so many years without seeing this film. It is very much a must-see film. It is great to view for ages 12 and up. This movie has such great story-telling, and uses great dialog, unlike anything you'll ever see in other films. Very well-done to the directors, crew, and especially the cast members. Outstanding.

Comment Head: Possibly the best movie that will ever be made.
Comment Body: Cinematography just isn't what it used to be. This movie is not only my personal favorite but also the favorite of the approximate 1.5 million people who have rated this title. The way that this film is made cannot be rivaled by today's standards. The writing, the acting, the scenery, etc combine to make this possibly the best movie that will ever be made. I don't think that this will ever be matched.I have seen Shawshank about 100 times, this is no joke. Every time I watch it I feel the same way that I did when I watched it for the first time. It will never get old. Every time I watch this I begin to sympathize with Andy and enjoy watching his friendship with Red grow. I am in complete awe until the closing credits begin to roll.I sincerely believe that no one can match the power of the Shawshank Redemption.

This movie is so good that words can't possibly be enough to explain its awesomeness. It starts out on a pretty dark note with killings and crime but as the story progresses we see how crime or rather criminals is not always simply black or white, its layers of Grey one cannot objectively see but only feel. We see how the lead character Andy Dufresne grows as a human, accompanied by Morgan Freeman or as people call him " Red ", his voice sounds like liquid gold. Over the movie you will feel many things, happy would be one of them but wait for that moment because when you finally reach the point where Morgan Freeman is telling you about the Blue of the Pacific and the camera pans out to the ocean, it will be all worth it in the end.

Comment Head: I was reading Stephen King when other kids were reading Judy Blume & Laurence Yep, etc..
It's really worthy of number one position.
Comment Body: This is my first review here, and i'm glad it's about Shawshank Redemption. What I really loved about this movie is how a man with sheer determination can accomplish even far-fetched goals. It also shows how to pick ourselves up when we are at our lowest. The movie also highlights friendship.I think Red's friendship with Andy is the very thing that kept Red from ending up like Brooke. I really loved the part when Red said "I'd like to think that the last thing that went through his head, other than that bullet, was how the hell Andy Dufresne ever got the best of him". Overall, it really is a masterpiece and deserves the top position.

The story begins with the trial of a young banker, Andy Dufrense, victimized by circumstantial evidence, resulting in a conviction for the murder of his wife and her lover. After a quick conviction, Andy finds himself serving a life sentence at Shawshank prison, with no hope of parole. He exists in this prison only in appearance, keeping his mind free from the drab walls around him. His ability to do this results in the gaining of respect from his fellow inmates, but most of all from Ellis Redding. Ellis, commonly referred to as Red, finds gainful use of his entrepreneurial spirit within the drab walls of Shawshank by dealing in contraband and commodities rare to the confines of prison. Andy's demeanor and undeniable sense of hope causes Red to take a deeper look at himself, and the world around him. Andy proves to Red and the other inmates that in the conventional walls of Shawshank prison convention will find no home in his lifestyle.

This is one of the few films that I found to be an improvement over the original story. There were a couple spots in the novella that were a little weak. Don't get me wrong, the story is great, but the film made some improvements, and in doing so, made a better story. I will add a note about Stand by me, another adaptation of a S. Kings novella. This time, the story took the city of Portland Maine and made it Portland Oregon; a brilliant move. The stories told within the story were removed except for a few short snippets. The pie eating contest was important, but many of the other stories told within the original novella were a little too strange and took away some of the vigor of the story for me. Two great stories, made into two greater films.

Comment Head: Great Movie but there is a doubt about an incident
Comment Body: This is a great movie, and I watched it many times -- with every time I watch it , my love and understanding of the movie grows.One of the best movies involving jail terms.Not only have a strong story line, but also backed up by great direction and very strong acting.The voice of Morgan Freeman is a catalyst.There is one part for which I did not get an explanation from the movie -- why did the warden kill Tommy Williams? Of course, Tommy Williams could prove that Andy was innocent, but what benefit would the warden get by stopping him? I did not find any reason for that act.

Comment Head: Amazing actors, story and direction - a superb film
Comment Body: This film is on e of the ultimate experience for viewers that watch movies because they wish to be transported into another place and time. I promise that once the story starts you will be swept away against your will and returned beyond your imagination. Literally and experience that will make you cry with joy. This is superb film from start to finish with outstanding acting, direction and storytelling. I cannot imagine a finer art work on the subjects covered in this indelible story that transcends all generations and walks of life. It's more than a film or a movie. The Shawshank Redemption is a pure American Classic and we, the viewing public are much better by being blessed by the opportunity to see it.

Comment Head: I can watch it over and over and over again ...
Comment Body: There's not many movies I can watch over and over again, but this is one of them. It just feels pitch perfect. Well written, perfectly casted ... the cinematography is flawless. By far, Darabont's crown jewel. Everything just works so well. And Morgan Freeman's (now ubiquitous) narration is the heart and soul of the film. A dark but uplifting tale about hope and friendship. A timeless, Hollywood masterpiece.I sometimes wonder if films like this will ever be made again? Would it even be possible for a movie like this to be greenlit today and compete with Fast & Furious 23? Probably not. If you haven't seen this movie, waste no time, find it and watch it.

What a great movie. What journey and what struggle. The film maintains the viewers' interest thought in the middle just for a moment you might get the impression the film is a little too long. It is a classic. The acting is superb. The plot is strong enough to keep you glued to the screen, and the twists and turns make you feel you are watching a real situation from life, with artistic beauty about it. You never know how the movie will end, and then there can a twist yet in the tale that may turn out to be the very essence of the movie. The film is rightly an academic content by now. Apparently, you may feel the film is a little boring due to a prominent and beautiful woman missing, but the fact is the film does not fail in keeping you interested in it until the very end.

Comment Head: WE used this as the top screenplay in script class

Comment Body: I'm not a professional critic, so I will put it the simplest way I can. This movie is one of those movies you keep coming back to every few years and watch again. It will never get old either.The prison represents life itself, the lives we were born to at least, and it tells us another life is possible out there and for that we must be able to break out of the life we are born to. The film shows the birth, maturation and re-birth of a person who does not belong to the society at large. In the final the man is reborn in mud, filthy just like before, but this time he is going to live the life he chose.

Comment Head: One of the best movies of all time!
Comment Body: This movie is excellent, regarding every aspect! You can't stop watching it 'till its last second! The acting is great, all actors are amazing, the story is kind of genius, very well-conducted, specially for a long movie as this one! And of course, it was written by Stephen King, one of my favorite authors. In fact, I think this movie gets the #1 place in all book adaptations from him! Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins matched perfectly, two amazing artists. Every detail of this movie grabs your attention without you even notice! The first time I saw this movie (maybe 2 years ago), I started watching knowing that it was elected as the #1 movie of all time, here in IMDb, but even though I was not expecting too much, I'm now a huge fan of it! I totally recommend, worthy watching! ;)

Comment Head: If you read this, and you haven't watched it yet... what are you waiting for!?
Comment Body: No wonder this movie is currently highest ranked on IMDb. It has a fantastic story line, great actors, and it triggers all of the emotions. It is also one of those movies that will(should) never get a forced sequel because it is fine as it is. I guess a well-made TV remake wouldn't be bad, but I think this type of plot has been covered enough.The other day I was with a group of friends and we were discussing several great movies. I was surprised to find out that there are still millennials who have not seen this! If you haven't seen it yet, make a plan and go watch it. You will not be disappointed.

One of the finest films made in recent years. It's a poignant story about hope. Hope gets me. That's what makes a film like this more than a movie. It tells a lesson about life. Those are the films people talk about 50 or even 100 years from you. It's also a story for freedom. Freedom from isolation, from rule, from bigotry and hate. Freeman and Robbins are majestic in their performances. Each learns from the other. Their relationship is strong and you feel that from the first moment they make contact with one another. There is also a wonderful performance from legend James Whitmore as Brooks.He shines when it is his time to go back into the world, only to find that the world grew up so fast he never even got a chance to blink. Stephen King's story is brought to the screen with great elegance and excitement. It is an extraordinary motion that people "will" be talking about in 50 or 100 years.

Comment Head: Amazing. Well scripted. An Iconic film
Comment Body: A must watch. This film really hits home. It's amazing so much can be fit into such a short film. Hanks is amazing. Delivering an amazing performance that does not disappoint. No matter how many times I watch this it has the same affect. I would not recommend for young children. A real hit. Will always be remembered. A movie you can watch 1000 times. If you enjoy this movie you will also enjoy castaway as well as many other movies that Hanks is in. It is a shame that some of the cast of actors has passed away. I hope you will enjoy this film as much as I did and it will make a positive impact on your life. There are few great films and this happens to be one.

Comment Head: Written to hit your sad notes...
Comment Body: A little anal rape and before you know it, you've made a martyr of a man. Good martyr though, except that he stays alive through out the entire movie. Well told in classic Morgan Freeman style but Shawshank redemption, whilst being a very fine example of Cinema, is lacking in much. It is very tense and dramatic but simple in it's premise, innocent man will escape from jail. In between are an abundance of clich√©es and well used jail house scenarios, as seen in many other lock up romps. The difference with Shawshank is how polished everything is. It's not a surprise when Frank Darabont is behind a helm. He has proved to cast well and have perfect characters execute a story to the most professional of levels. I think that the movie would have been better if they had been following Red and Andy get's busted when Red comes meets him in the sandy finale. Maybe executed by FBI and Red was involved in the sting operation. you may not agree.

Whenever this movie comes on I have to watch it and I love it every time. This movie is not a depressing movie overall and even though there are sad moments in the movie; there is also has a lot of humor about life as well. The warmth in the friendship that builds up between Andy and Red is what make this movie so great. There is even excitement and suspense, although not when we expect it. But mostly the film is an allegory about holding onto a sense of personal worth, despite everything. The redemption and friendship theme of this movie is what makes it easy for us all to easily identify with these characters and evoke such emotions while we watch for the first time or the 20th + times you see it Like myself.

This 1994 classic is my favorite movie of all times. surprised it was not picked for any major Oscars. The acting from Tim Robins is superb as well as Morgan Freeman's acting and narrating. The supporting cast are all above average in their performance, though nothing to hail in any large degree. The story has a clear flow through out the movie. The Hero (Tim Robins)has to overcome his demons from the start. His end goal is to be in peace with himself. to sum the movie up its a some what a count of Monte Kristo story. instead of getting out to get revenge, the hero accepts his destinations and battles his inner-demons.

You get busy living or you get busy dying. The phrase that came out of Andy Defruense mouth were legendary. I read the book a year ago in my high school and it compared nothing to the movie. The few times in this life the movie was better than the book. There wasn't much of a cinematic feel, no artsy angles or vibrant colors. It was an analogy to a man trapped inside of an inartistic world set free by prison. Again, it is not artsy but it is one of the greatest stories ever told. The first time viewing this movie, i believed it to drag on, but i watched it again and again, loving it more and more every time. It is a surprise it never got an Oscar.

One of the best movies I have ever seen. I love Stephen King, and I am always excited to see one of his books turned into a movie. For people who have not read the book (but also for the book lovers) the movie will be an exciting experience till the last scene.Even now, after more than 20 years, modern movies cannot be compared to this one. Morgan Freeman is as always excellent. U get an mix of emotions watching Shawshank redemption. You feel sad, happy, compassionate, all at the same time for prisoners... Brooks as a character and his story-line broke my heart and i still feel the sadness for this character.

This is by far the best prison movie ever. The movie has everything a movie in this genre needs and it all blends together perfectly, a bit like the industry decided to release a "best of" record and this was the result. One of the movies greatest strength is it's balance; it doesn't deny the miserable conditions inside a prison while not taking advantage of it, and despite the sorrow it is nothing but a feel good movie.Tim Robbins as well as Morgon Freeman are doing an excellent job portraying their characters and the prison environment is displayed with excellence. It is easy placing your self in that prison and it routines.Despite my love for the movie I can't say I agree with it's #1 ranking on IMDb, but it most simply be due to the fact that people can't find anything they dislike about it.

Great movie!I remember watching it as a kid and not really understanding the concept and angle that the directors and crew were trying to make. I watched it again in high school a few years ago (More like 8) and totally got the concept! My top 5 favorite movie of all time. I think I might actually go watch it again now before my huge audition tomorrow. I can't think of anything that I can compare this movie to. Its gained its own identity with me and I think anyone who hears the title would understand exactly what I was talking about seeing as though its one of the top movies of all time. If there could be a second make to the movie I would love to be a part of it! Hopefully kids today would take the time to watching such a great movie and understand what it means to be an actor! These guys put this together well.

Comment Head: Nobody believed him, all hope lost but in confinement he finds friendship and a way out
Comment Body: Great movie and highly recommended for anyone seeking a Monte Cristo type story. Set up for murder. Sent to prison for life. Agony and loneliness is evident. Found life thru knowledge for education. Friends and loyalties were made. Hope came and was squashed. That leads to anger and action. Friends worry without knowledge of future of protagonist. Hope is obtained for more than just the protagonist. Great for people whom like; biographies, emotional, male bonding, facing obstacles, seeking hope of the future, prison life, life building skills, justice prevailing, getting even with those whom treat people horribly, creating something good in a bad situation.

The story is narrated by "Red" Redding (Morgan Freeman), who has been inside the walls of Shawshank Prison for a very long time and is its leading entrepreneur. He can get you whatever you need: cigarettes, candy, even a little rock pick like an amateur geologist might use. One day he and his fellow inmates watch the latest busload of prisoners unload, and they make bets on who will cry during their first night in prison, and who will not. Red bets on a tall, lanky guy named Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), who looks like a babe in the woods. But Andy does not cry, and Red loses the cigarettes he wagered. Andy turns out to be a surprise to everyone in Shawshank, because within him is such a powerful reservoir of determination and strength that nothing seems to break him. Andy was a banker on the outside, and he's in for murder. He's apparently innocent, and there are all sorts of details involving his case, but after a while they take on a kind of unreality; all that counts inside prison is its own society -- who is strong, who is not -- and the measured passage of time.

One of my all time favorites. Shawshank Redemption is a very moving story about hope and the power of friendship. The cast is first rate with everyone giving a great performance. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman carry the movie, but Bob Gunton and Clancy Brown are perfect as the Warden Norton and prison guard captain Hadley respectively. And James Whitmore's portrayal of an elderly inmate Brooks is moving. The screenplay gives almost every actor at least one or more memorable lines through out the film. As well as a very surprising "twist" near the end that almost knocked me out of my chair. If you have not seen this movie rent it or better yet buy it. As I bet you'll want to see this one more than once.

Loved this movie! Great story, amazing and remediable characters. The Plot keeps you guessing, I was on the edge of my seat the whole time I watch it!Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman give performances that will knock your socks off! There on screen friendship makes me weep for something as close and meaningful in everyday life. This is a movie to watch on a rainy day, with a big bucket of pop corn and a cold soda. As time goes on this movie will stand the test of time, it will be considered a classic, up their with greats like Brian's song, or the lethal weapons franchise.

Comment Head: Terrific Film Based on a short story by...
A Very Good Movie To Watch
Comment Body: A Very Good Movie To Watch............. I have never seen such an amazing film since I saw The Shawshank Redemption. Shawshank encompasses friendships, hardships, hopes, and dreams. And what is so great about the movie is that it moves you, it gives you hope. Even though the circumstances between the characters and the viewers are quite different, you don't feel that far removed from what the characters are going through.This movie is not your ordinary Hollywood flick. It has a great and deep message. This movie has a foundation and just kept on being built on from their and that foundation is hope.Finally Hope is key to being Alive.............

Comment Head: A must watch for every film lover
Comment Body: The story of a one common man caught in circumstances creates an atmosphere which makes a viewer on the edge of seat. Stellar direction and acting. Morgan Freeman is a great performer who has shown the way a human being can excel in his endeavor. The film is an all time excellence in all departments of Film Making be it Editing, Sound, Direction, Production Values, Art Design, Sets & Costumes. The story line is the crux of the film where it takes a 180 degree turn and we see something which is beyond our expectation. The casting of this film along with top line & bottom line artists is well planned. The background music score is excellent. Out of the top 100 films I rate this as the best.

Comment Head: One of top five best movies I have ever seen!
Comment Body: What else to write about The Shawshank Redemption that haven't been written before? I usually like action movies and comedies and this movie has no comedy and no action. The movie was filmed by Stephen Kings novel so it has to be great. The story is set in 1947y Portland, Maine where a banker is is sentenced to two consecutive life sentences for murdering his wife and her lover. He will meet all sort of characters in side the prison good and bad, from inmates with good hart to sadistic prison guards. It is not a strange that The Shawshank Redemption is number one on the IMDb's top 250 list because there is no other place for this movie. I highly recommend seeing this great movie to everyone who haven't yet watched it.

Whenever I see a movie that takes place in prison I feel sorry for the characters, as they must go through difficult and dramatic situations. But rarely I seen in this kind of movie the instinct of freedom, that grabs the viewer and holds it to the expectation of how the story will end. Although there are difficult situations, there is also good ones who manage to balance coexistence, and makes the film not be so dramatic. I think that for a film to succeed, the principal actors must have good chemistry to demonstrate the talents in their performances, and the chemistry between Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins is unsurpassed.It's a great film, well directed and the performances are flawless.

Comment Head: One of the best films ever!
Comment Body: Having watched it too many times, I still find myself thrilled and touched by it. I do not see it as a film "made in prison" but more like "in life". It is the strength underneath that makes you what you are. Sometimes it needs more than a good director, a writer or an effective cast to create a masterpiece. "The Shawshank Redemption", for me, has it all! ... First Morgan Freeman and then Tim Robbins, push us towards a world made of realism, darkness, acceptance and redemption, and finally victory over those who believe that power over other people makes them powerful... such a joke indeed. I really believe that one must watch this film at least one time. There will be much to learn.

It's not THE GREATEST FILM I EVER SEEN/SAW but it's so good and every time I watch it, I still cry. It's this film and The Green Mile that enjoyMorgan Freeman aka God Tim Robbins aka Susan Sarandon's ex bar give great, fantastic performances.Sorry this review is short or unworthy to be read, but I can't really explain my review without gushing over it, but I recommend it to anyone willing to watch

Can Hollywood, usually creating things for entertainment purposes only, create art? To create something of this nature, a director must approach it in a most meticulous manner, due to the delicacy of the process. Such a daunting task requires an extremely capable artist with an undeniable managerial capacity and an acutely developed awareness of each element of art in their films, the most prominent; music, visuals, script, and acting. These elements, each equally important, must succeed independently, yet still form a harmonious union, because this mixture determines the fate of the artist's opus. Though already well known amongst his colleagues for his notable skills at writing and directing, Frank Darabont emerges with his feature film directorial debut, The Shawshank Redemption. Proving himself already a master of the craft, Darabont managed to create one of the most recognizable independent releases in the history of Hollywood. The Shawshank Redemption defines a genre, defies the odds, compels the emotions, and brings an era of artistically influential films back to Hollywood.The story begins with the trial of a young banker, Andy Dufrense, victimized by circumstantial evidence, resulting in a conviction for the murder of his wife and her lover. After a quick conviction, Andy finds himself serving a life sentence at Shawshank prison, with no hope of parole. He exists in this prison only in appearance, keeping his mind free from the drab walls around him. His ability to do this results in the gaining of respect from his fellow inmates, but most of all from Ellis Redding. Ellis, commonly referred to as Red, finds gainful use of his entrepreneurial spirit within the drab walls of Shawshank by dealing in contraband and commodities rare to the confines of prison. Andy's demeanor and undeniable sense of hope causes Red to take a deeper look at himself, and the world around him. Andy proves to Red and the other inmates that in the conventional walls of Shawshank prison convention will find no home in his lifestyle.By creating the film's firm foundation, the meticulously chiseled screenplay paved the way for this film's success. Frank Darabont outdoes himself with the phenomenal adaptation of Stephen King's equally noteworthy novella, Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption. In this novella, King demonstrates that he can break free from the genre he dominates and still create a marvelous piece of modern literature. Though the film mirrors the novella in many ways, Darabont illustrates a focused objective of improving upon the areas where the novella came up short, resulting in one of the best book to film transitions ever.

Shawshank has everything you need from a movie.Cinematography and direction, both combine to make the film something unique.This is an engagingly simple, good-hearted film, with just enough darkness around the edges to give contrast and relief to its glowingly benign view of human nature.Freeman, a wonderful actor, both narrates this tale and anchors it with his perfect playing.I read elsewhere this "if you don't love Shawshank, chances are you're beyond redemption". Well I do agree completely.I never, ever, ever heard from a friend of mine who I recommended it that he had not liked it.

I haven't seen too many movies that I would rate a 10, but I had no problems giving this one top score.Movie-making seems to be like golf; for a truly excellent game, ALL the elements must come together. Everyone involved must have perfect "form". Director, Darabont, must have been at the top of his game when he put this gem together. Of course the actors were excellent; Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins seldom disappoint. The thing that makes this movie exceptional is that Darabont coaxed the best performances out of the supporting actors also. Bob Gunton and Clancy Brown were utterly believable (and bad guys don't come much worse than them).The other essential ingredient for a successful movie is simple: It must have a well thought out plot with a perfect beginning, middle and end. So many movies fall over by getting at least one of these aspects wrong. Not so with Shawshank Redemption. Just like Goldilocks said, "This is just right!" Buy this one for your home collection because you'll definitely want to see it again

One of my all time favorite movies. Although there's not much action, the plot and acting pulled me in. Throughout the movie the suspense keeps building and building with everything happening to Andy you just feel bad for him. It all leads up to him escapping which he rightfully deserves to.Clearly Tim Robins was devoted to his role as Andy Dufresne. The way he stays in the same exact character through the whole movie is impressive. He always has a mild composure with little outbursts of anger and rage which I think he uses perfectly. Morgan Freeman as "Red" was impressive as always. Taking almost the mentor role for Andy to help him get through being in a jail until finally escapping.

The Shawshank Redemption is a 1994 American drama film written and directed by Frank Darabont and starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. Adapted from the Stephen King novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption, the film tells the story of Andy Dufresne, a banker who is sentenced to life in Shawshank State Prison for the murder of his wife and her lover despite his claims of innocence. During his time at the prison, he befriends a fellow inmate, Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding, and finds himself protected by the guards after the warden begins using him in his money laundering operation.Despite being a box office disappointment, the film received multiple award nominations (including seven Oscar nominations) and outstanding reviews from critics for its acting, story, and realism. It has since been successful on cable television, VHS, DVD, and Blu- ray. It was included in the American Film Institute's 100 Years...100 Movies 10th Anniversary Edition.[3] It is now widely considered one of the best films of all time.

The actors act in the best possible way which gives it a unique and memorable touch to the film and its characters which always carry in our memory for its history in jail and obstacles by crossing the characters.

Comment Head: There is a lot of life and humor in it, and warmth in the friendship that builds up between Andy and Red
Comment Body: "The Shawshank Redemption" is a movie about time, patience and loyalty -- not sexy qualities, perhaps, but they grow on you during the subterranean progress of this story, which is about how two men serving life sentences in prison become friends and find a way to fight off despair.The story is narrated by "Red" Redding (Morgan Freeman), who has been inside the walls of Shawshank Prison for a very long time and is its leading entrepreneur. He can get you whatever you need: cigarettes, candy, even a little rock pick like an amateur geologist might use. One day he and his fellow inmates watch the latest bus load of prisoners unload, and they make bets on who will cry during their first night in prison, and who will not. Red bets on a tall, lanky guy named Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), who looks like a babe in the woods.But Andy does not cry, and Red loses the cigarettes he wagered. Andy turns out to be a surprise to everyone in Shawshank, because within him is such a powerful reservoir of determination and strength that nothing seems to break him. Andy was a banker on the outside, and he's in for murder. He's apparently innocent, and there are all sorts of details involving his case, but after a while they take on a kind of unreality; all that counts inside prison is its own society -- who is strong, who is not -- and the measured passage of time.Red is also a lifer. From time to time, measuring the decades, he goes up in front of the parole board, and they measure the length of his term (20 years, 30 years) and ask him if he thinks he has been rehabilitated. Oh, most surely, yes, he replies; but the fire goes out of his assurances as the years march past, and there is the sense that he has been institutionalized -- that, like another old lifer who kills himself after being paroled, he can no longer really envision life on the outside.Red's narration of the story allows him to speak for all of the prisoners, who sense a fortitude and integrity in Andy that survives the years. Andy will not kiss butt. He will not back down. But he is not violent, just formidably sure of himself. For the warden (Bob Gunton), he is both a challenge and a resource; Andy knows all about bookkeeping and tax preparation, and before long he's been moved out of his prison job in the library and assigned to the warden's office, where he sits behind an adding machine and keeps tabs on the warden's ill-gotten gains. His fame spreads, and eventually he's doing the taxes and pension plans for most of the officials of the local prison system.There are key moments in the film, as when Andy uses his clout to get some cold beers for his friends who are working on a roofing job. Or when he befriends the old prison librarian (James Whitmore). Or when he oversteps his boundaries and is thrown into solitary confinement. What quietly amazes everyone in the prison -- and us, too -- is the way he accepts the good and the bad as all part of some larger pattern than only he can fully see.The partnership between the characters played by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman is crucial to the way the story unfolds. This is not a "prison drama" in any conventional sense of the word. It is not about violence, riots or melodrama. The word "redemption" is in the title for a reason. The movie is based on a story, Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption, by Stephen King, which is quite unlike most of King's work. The horror here is not of the supernatural kind, but of the sort that flows from the realization than 10, 20, 30 years of a man's life have unreeled in the same unchanging daily prison routine.The director, Frank Darabont, paints the prison in drab grays and shadows, so that when key events do occur, they seem to have a life of their own.Andy, as played by Robbins, keeps his thoughts to himself. Red, as Freeman plays him, is therefore a crucial element in the story: His close observation of this man, down through the years, provides the way we monitor changes and track the measure of his influence on those around him. And all the time there is something else happening, hidden and secret, which is revealed only at the end."The Shawshank Redemption" is not a depressing story, although I may have made it sound that way. There is a lot of life and humor in it, and warmth in the friendship that builds up between Andy and Red. There is even excitement and suspense, although not when we expect it. But mostly the film is an allegory about holding onto a sense of personal worth, despite everything. If the film is perhaps a little slow in its middle passages, maybe that is part of the idea, too, to give us a sense of the leaden passage of time, before the glory of the final redemption.

Comment Head: Life in a prison, Andy's way....
Comment Body: Undoubtedly, Shawshank Redemption is the greatest prison drama ever made. Andy's life is turned upside-down when he is convicted of killing his wife and send to the prison. He has to fight all the evils of the society he was never trained for. He makes friends with Ellis Redding and his bumpy journey in prison continues.Very few movies have the great combination of story, music and casting; SR hits highs on all notes. Morgan Freeman gave his best performance as Ellis Redding and his narration is one of the many reasons why this movies is considered among the greatest.Favourite Quote : "... and when they put you in that cell, when those bars slam home, that's when you know it's for real. A whole life blown away in the blink of an eye. Nothing left but all the time in the world to think about it."

Though I have seen many movies related to prison break or prison escape but this movie has broken all records of how sophisticatedly a prisoner can escape from a heavily guarded prison without anyone noticing. Dufrene was innocent in his wife's brutal murder. But somehow his innocence was unnoticed in the court and was found guilty and faced back to back life sentences. Also the narrator and backbone of the movie was Morgan Freeman. His unexceptional narration made the movie even more fantastic. Overall, I just want to conclude that if this were to release again, it would have broken all records and won many Oscars again.

The Shawshank Redemption is without a doubt one of the most brilliant movies I have ever seen. Similar to The Green Mile in many respects (and better than it in almost all of them), these two movies have shown us that Stephen King is a master not only of horror but also of prose that shakes the soul and moves the heart. The plot is average, but King did great things with it in his novella that are only furthered by the direction, and the acting is so top-rate it's almost scary.Tim Robbins plays Andy Dufrane, wrongly imprisoned for 20 years for the murder of his wife. The story focuses on Andy's relationship with "Red" Redding (Morgan Freeman, in probably his best role) and his attempts to escape from Shawshank. Bob Gunton is positively evil and frightening as Warden Norton, and there are great performances and cameos all around; the most prominent one being Gil Bellows (late as Billy of Ally McBeal) as Tommy, a fellow inmate of Andy's who suffers under the iron will of Norton.If you haven't seen this movie, GO AND RENT IT NOW. You will not be disappointed. It is positively the best movie of the '90's, and one of my Top 3 of all time. This movie is a spectacle to move the mind, soul, and heart. 10/10

One of my all time favorites. Shawshank Redemption is a very moving story about hope and the power of friendship.I have never seen such an amazing film since I saw The Shawshank Redemption. Shawshank encompasses friendships, hardships, hopes, and dreams. And what is so great about the movie is that it moves you, it gives you hope. The cast is first rate with everyone giving a great performance. James Whitmore's portrayal of an elderly inmate Brooks is moving.His portrayal is one of the most saddest and realistic in any movie period. The screenplay gives almost every actor at least one or more memorable lines through out the film. As well as a very surprising "twist" near the end that almost knocked me out of my chair. If you have not seen this movie rent it or better yet buy it. It will truly be a unique experience.

as a die-hard king fan for 30 years, i have routinely been disappointed in the movies based on his books. this is quite possibly the best movie adaptation i've seen. overall, i was impressed with the performances of all the characters. maybe the only thing i wasn't clear about or didn't understand was the fact that some of the guards had accents that didn't seem to be louisianian. the accents seemed to be more boston-ish. however, it has been a while since i've read the books so maybe i'm forgetting a detail or two.ultimately, i recommend this movie to any stephen king fan, and to anyone in general! it's excellent!!

This movie is the best movie ever for me ! He deserve the first place ! Story : "Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency." -This short story said everything about this movie, i liked all the personality, specially the hero of the movie. The Director Frank Darabont he had know how to play with all the personalities and their roles. So great thank to him because he make a great movie. For the stars, "Tim Robbins" he's my best actor all time ! 14 October 1994 is a special day, so always remember it ! :D I liked everything about the movie, even the Soundtracks. I think in our day we missed the movies such as The Shawshank Redemption :(

Comment Head: Not the Best and Not the Worst - But Still Pretty Good
Comment Body: A movie worthy of the label, 'very good' ‚Äì but being number one out of all movies ever? No way, are you kidding me? One should go back to snacking on those wacky mushrooms ‚Äì please. Better yet let us all have some, those hallucinations need to be shared by one and all. It was a good movie...very good in fact. And without question, this is some quality entertainment. I really did enjoy the one time I saw it. I have to say though, I did not wet myself with glee when I watched the flick. It just seemed like the plot was far-fetched and a bit tiresome. The premise of good triumphing over evil is outstanding. It is too bad that the action of defining good and evil is clearly sitting outside the reality-room in 'Redemption.' 'Spoiler Alert' 'Spoiler Alert' Prison guards = bad and hardened criminals = bad? Why? I can understand Tim Robbins latching his wagon to this ridiculous notion ‚Äì but Morgan Freeman? Sorry it just doesn't compute. For me ‚Äì a very good movie ‚Äì but not a great movie. I will give this "King" drama an 8/10

The Shawshank Redemption garnered widespread critical acclaim from critics and has a "certified fresh" score of 91% on Rotten Tomatoes based on 64 reviews with an average rating of 8.2 out of 10. The critical consensus states "The Shawshank Redemption is an uplifting, deeply satisfying prison drama with sensitive direction and fine performances." [19] The film also has a score of 80 out of 100 on Metacritic based on 19 critics indicating "generally favorable reviews'.[20] It is currently rated an average of 9.3[21] out of 10 on IMDb by almost 1.4 million voters making it the highest rated movie on the website. The film has been critically acclaimed for depicting Jean-Paul Sartre's ideas about existentialism more fully than any other contemporary movie

This is the best movie I have ever seen. There are so many lessons in this movie. Somehow, all of those lessons are really necessary for life. At least, I think so and I need them for my life. My habit is to read quotes from movies. And from Shawshank Redemption, there are the most quotes that I like. The movie has no special action or no high-tech scene. However, it just smoothly flow. And also, it just slowly makes me feel. Well, I think it worth for 10 point. Actually, I am really lazy to type such kind of long preview like that. My sentences are not good. My English is not good too. But I still try to write this review because I like this movie very much.

This movie I'm not going to call this film the IMDb #1 movie, but I really can't deny that this is fantastic. The cast, the score, the writing, and the power are all here in this film, and filled with strength. It's one of those movies that you will continue to think about even after the film is over. It is about a friendship, a life, an evil, and a hope. A hope that is considered in many ways to be bridge to insanity inside the prison walls. We see these people as years of time goes by. We see friendships grow, and topics change. It really puts you in the prison, and makes you feel what's like to behind those bars. You feel the friendship, the hope, the darkness, and the pure horror of it all.

I am in love with this movie..What an endurance of patience the protagonist had.Its a sheer display of how a person can get what he wants.With all of the aesthetic touches and attention to cinematic detail, the most beautiful part of the film lies within its thematic material, such as its focus on the human desires for the most abstract concepts, like hope and freedom. These themes, which concern things the human spirit undoubtedly yearns for, seem so intricately woven into the plot that it easily draws its audience in to its story. Though full of hardened criminals, your heart will go out to these men as they display the most basic of human emotions, and deliver some of the most quotable lines in a film to date. Like a great novel, this film manages to succeed at greater things than simply entertaining an audience. Darabont tells his story most masterfully, illustrating principles and inspiring his audience to think. He leaves us a poignant film with a powerful message of hope, and redemption, something we all seek.

Comment Head: The movie that opens your mind and gives you hope
Comment Body: This is a movie that truly deserves a 10. It truly opens your conscience an lets you look at life differently in three ways. You realize that your world that you think is OK, is actually like a prison. That's the way that makes this movie depressing.The other way is a bit more positive. It makes you realize that things that you worry about are not actual problems. That happens when you see the people in the movie that have the real problems.The final way is the most positive. This movie gives you hope that someday everything will be better. If you are feeling sad missing somebody, this is definitely the movie you should see.

this is the great and powerful movie , but doesn't mean is #1 for me , each one have #1 movie so don't judge me . for me Godfather 1 is #1 This is a masterpiece. A timeless masterpiece. Initially, I didn't like this film all that much - I found it rather over-hyped and boring. This was until the advent of DVD, which gave me the feature I needed for this sort of film: subtitles. Comment Head: The best movie I have ever seen
Comment Body: Andy, who is a young and successful banker, has been sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of his wife and lover. This movie revolves around the events in his life from when he comes to prison till he escapes from it. This the one of the best movies I have ever seen. The best message conveyed by this movies is of eternal hope. Andy was sent to the prison though he didn't commit the crime. Over the years, he retains hope and earns the respect of fellow prisoners, especially he bond with a longtime convict, Red. Over the time, Andy finds ways to live out life with relative ease as one can in a prison, leaving a message for all that while the body may be locked away in a cell, the spirit can never be truly imprisoned. And finally he escapes from the prison and frees himself. This movies truly depicts the meaning of the quote "Hope is a good thing maybe the best thing, and no good things ever dies".

The movie is primarily filmed inside a prison. One great thing I liked about the movie is that it is not shown from the perspective of its hero (Andy Duferene) but it is shown from the perspective of Red(Morgan Freeman). The film starts with a courtroom scene where Andy is given two life sentences as he is convicted for the murder of his wife and her lover. Then the story goes inside the prison and stays there. We see how Andy is different from others. How he risks his life for getting beer for his friends and things like. Red is the closest person to Andy in person. Andy, by his skills, impresses the prison staff, so they allow him to write letters to government officials for funds for prison library and also they utilize it to run their scams. The movie doesn't seem to show pity over Andy's condition. It purely deals with it in a subjective manner. Andy do many good things in prison, like he helps his prison mates to get a high school diploma.Overall, the movie is worth watching.
