Comment Head: One of the best movie i have watched!!!
Comment Body: If you were to take a poll today and ask anyone from Gen X and back what they think of Shawshank Redemption, chances are you'd get an overwhelmingly positive response. The story of a banker convicted of a double homicide, Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), maintains his innocence and finds a way of surviving 19 years of harsh prison life, all the while creating an unlikely bond with fellow convict Ellis "Red" Redding (Morgan Freeman). I could see why some of the boys took him for snobby. He had a quiet way about him, a walk and a talk that just wasn't normal around here. He strolled, like a man in a park without a care or a worry in the world, like he had on an invisible coat that would shield him from this place. Yeah, I think it would be fair to say...I liked Andy from the start.

When the odds are against you, there's only moving forward or turning back. When Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) is sent to one of the toughest prisons for two consecutive life sentences for murders he did not commit, the mere thought is enough to make anyone insane. Prison life is tough, but Shawshank prison gets the cake for displaying just how harsh it can be. Corrupt guards, brash punishments and bare minimum accommodations are only half the picture. Just as soon as he's about to break, he makes a discovery that requires incredibly true determination and hope. The Shawshank Redemption is a screenplay adaptation of Stephen King's novella; Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption. Writer and Director Frank Darabont was able to capture a realistic representation of what prison life might have looked like in the first half of the 20th century. Although the budget was very modest for this film, it really looks like they didn't need anymore. A cast that consists of veteran actors helps to meld the film's respect with their performances. One very noteworthy performance was from Morgan Freeman's character: Ellis Boyd (Red). He was also the one who narrated most of the film and that's always a treat for the audience.Thomas Newman who was responsible for the soundtrack did a great job enhancing the scenes whether it is eerie or joyous. Although at times I felt that there needed to be a more powerful theme to reflect the scene which fortunately was only in a few scenes. Nevertheless, the captivating themes are something to remember in this film. Memorable characters, a great soundtrack and an excellent plot all make this a highly recommended movie to watch. There really isn't much to nit-pick about this film which is what really brings it to the top. Like all highly rated/regarded films, there tends to be some form of overrating which is understandable, since all great things attract jealousy.

Comment Head: Get busy living or get busy dying
Comment Body: The fact this movie stands at the IMDb top for years now should be enough to convince you to watch this asap. Based on a novella by Stephen King, Frank Darabont's film is perhaps the most accomplished prison drama ever. If you liked Papillon, you are going to love Shawshank's Redemption. But this is more than just a bleak prison drama. Not that there aren't grim situations depicted here. Several points in the story are not for the faint of heart for their cruelty and outright sense of injustice. The ordeals of one Andy Dufresne (in an unsurpassed performance by Tim Robbins) and his fellow cell mates are in fact so harrowing that will make you beg for justice to be done and pray for salvation. Is there hope and light at the end of the tunnel? Let's say that this movie belongs to that group of films (like Sixth Sense and Jacob's Ladder) that have a little secret and when the time for catharsis comes, after all the trials our hero has been through, it doesn't just rain, it pours. It is that precise moment that turns what would have otherwise been a finely crafted drama into a timeless classic. As the protagonist at one point says, hope is a good thing, perhaps the best of things. And it is hope that fuels this expertly told tale of fight against adversity and why this film resonates so strongly with so many people.

SR is one of the greatest movies I have ever seen. It's story is about a man who is accused of murdering his wife and her lover. He is sentenced for life in prison . After twenty years of great troubles in the prison he escapes from the prison by much hard working and patience. Then he lives happily ever after overseas. Movies background displays the life in prison, it highlights innocent people in the prison. Even they did bad things they deserves redemption. But not all of them. Some deserve punishment, some deserve freedom. It isn't easy to choose who deserves what. This also shows the corruption in authority. They only care about money. They doesn't care about lives of the inmates. For example the fat guy who cries in his first night gets killed by guards. If the authorities care about lives of inmates they should punish the responsible for it. But they don't even raise a question.

The Shawshank Redemption is a 1994 American drama film written and directed by Frank Darabont and starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. Adapted from the Stephen King novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption, the film tells the story of Andy Dufresne, a banker who is sentenced to life in Shawshank State Prison for the murder of his wife and her lover despite his claims of innocence. During his time at the prison, he befriends a fellow inmate, Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding, and finds himself protected by the guards after the warden begins using him in his money laundering operation. Great movie with excellent actors and soundtracks. But I've seen better. Morgan Freeman is a great actor, as good as Tim Robbins. Unfortunately, we won't see second part. The story is very good, sometimes it makes me feel a 30 year old prisoner. I'm loving it! I recommend it for everybody. Thanks IMDb for his great top 250. If there wasn't no IMDb, I wouldn't see the movie.

Right from the opening credits, this film shows quality. It stands above other comedies due to the lack of filler material - every line is memorable. The cast is great; the two leads make the most of their characters (both as brokers and bums) but never overstep the mark, thanks partly to the tight editing. The plot becomes a little bizarre, but by that time you're already hooked, and the ending of the film is pure joy. To my mind, no recent comedy has been this good; it mixes high and low brow jokes without resorting to toilet humor, it doesn't pull any punches (spot the social commentary), the performances are masterful and the script achieves depth without sacrificing the one-liners or slowing the pace.

Nothing to Say when You wanna say everything !you think that's a turnoff title, remember all the smart-ass things people said before Forrest Gump happened. Shawshank ‚Äî the name refers to a maximum-security prison in Maine ‚Äî is already being touted to join Gump in the Oscar race. Why not? The academy regularly drops its drawers for films that celebrate the triumph of the human spirit. And this baby strums that theme hard as inmate Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a Shawshank newcomer in 1946, strikes up a 20-year friendship with a lifer named Red (Morgan Freeman). They're both in jail for the Big One: murder.

In 1947 Portland, Maine, banker Andy Dufresne is convicted of murdering his wife and her lover and sentenced to two consecutive life sentences at the fictional Shawshank State Penitentiary in rural Maine. Andy befriends prison contraband smuggler, Ellis "Red" Redding, an inmate serving a life sentence. Red procures a rock hammer and later a large poster of Rita Hayworth for Andy. Working in the prison laundry, Andy is regularly assaulted by the "bull queer" gang "the Sisters" and their leader, Bogs.In 1949, Andy overhears the brutal captain of the guards, Byron Hadley, complaining about being taxed on an inheritance and offers to help him legally shelter the money. After a vicious assault by the Sisters nearly kills Andy, Hadley beats Bogs severely. Bogs is sent to another prison and Andy is never attacked again. Warden Samuel Norton meets Andy and reassigns him to the prison library to assist elderly inmate Brooks Hatlen. Andy's new job is a pretext for him to begin managing financial matters for the prison employees. As time passes, the Warden begins using Andy to handle matters for a variety of people including guards from other prisons and the warden himself. Andy begins writing weekly letters to the state government for funds to improve the decaying library.

This is my first review in awhile. Figured I would just review a classic because I don't have a lot of time. GREAT movie, classic, always a good watch on a rainy day with all my classics: Green Mile, Forest Gump, Usual Suspects, Pulp Fiction, Etc.Just wondered why I had to scroll to the bottom on IMDb in order to review. Could use a meta bar next to the rating review at the top of the page please. I will inquire.I love the book format this film shows. The narration and the climate build-up until the inevitable escape, leaving you edging to see how he does it, not leaving out how connected we were with the dean to wonder how he did it. I don't think anyone wanted to follow him down the rabbit hole.

Best movie I've ever seen in quite a long time. it has everything. intrigue until the last minute, passionate and heartbreaking story.The story begins with the trial of a young banker, Andy Dufrense, victimized by circumstantial evidence, resulting in a conviction for the murder of his wife and her lover. After a quick conviction, Andy finds himself serving a life sentence at Shawshank prison, with no hope of parole. He exists in this prison only in appearance, keeping his mind free from the drab walls around him. His ability to do this results in the gaining of respect from his fellow inmates, but most of all from Ellis Redding. Ellis, commonly referred to as Red, finds gainful use of his entrepreneurial spirit within the drab walls of Shawshank by dealing in contraband and commodities rare to the confines of prison. Andy's demeanor and undeniable sense of hope causes Red to take a deeper look at himself, and the world around him. Andy proves to Red and the other inmates that in the conventional walls of Shawshank prison convention will find no home in his lifestyle.

The reason I became a member of this database is because I finally found a movie ranking that recognized the true greatness of movies like this.One of my all time favorites. Shawshank Redemption is a very moving story about hope and the power of friendship. The cast is first rate with everyone giving a great performance. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman carry the movie, but Bob Gunton and Clancy Brown are perfect as the Warden Norton and prison guard captain Hadley respectively. And James Whitmore's portrayal of an elderly inmate Brooks is moving. The screenplay gives almost every actor at least one or more memorable lines through out the film. As well as a very surprising "twist" near the end that almost knocked me out of my chair. If you have not seen this movie rent it or better yet buy it. As I bet you'll want to see this one more than once.

Comment Head: A testament to the human spirit
Comment Body: To me this is one of the classic. The story of a is unique prison break but with a lot of drama and suspense. Spiritually moving old-fashioned prison movie. I loved it. All the character got their own uniqueness and importance. Overall you have to watch it to feel it. Freeman, who is simply a great actor, a man who has never struck a false note in his career, both narrates this tale and anchors it with his authoritative playing.Top-notch performances, exceptional cinematography, and masterful direction combine to make this film something special indeed. So, yeah I love this film. It's a story about hope and dreams and one whose emotional impact is as great as the Pacific Ocean is blue.

Comment Head: Get busy living or get busy dying..after a house fire those words mean a lot more
Get busy living or get busy dying
Comment Body: Every time I start losing hope about the future I watch this movie. "Get busy living or get busy dying" is my favorite quote. Simple as that. What amazed me is the fact that this movie is still No# 1 in Top 250 movies of all time votes after all these years. This means something about the general consciousness of the people of our times. Most of us are trapped in some sort of prison. Out there, somewhere is our Zihuatanejo, our true dream place, our destination. Is it a place on earth ? Heaven ? Tim Robbins acting is great and the unique and special voice of Morgan Freeman draws the audience into this strange world. There are so many memorable quotes. Bible scriptures are also quoted in interesting ways and angles that enrich the plot and storyline in a special way. Highly recommended to watch on Sunday nights, just before you face that scary Monday morning.

Despite its age,it's still as amazing and excellent today as it was after its release. Very impressed and I'd definitely recommend it to everyone. The plot twists are also very enjoyable. I might just go and re-watch it now.

Well, well, well, I finally got round to seeing this so-called masterpiece; praised as the best film ever and frankly, I agree.What makes this film a true viewing pleasure is a number of components. Firstly it is superbly filmed, capturing every moment at the best possible angle making it easy to watch. The performances are fantastic Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman play their parts exponentially well, so convincing you lose yourself in the Shawshank world. The music also makes the key moments of the plot ever more intense and moving. Another point is that it is not too long and drags on but is not cut too short; the perfect length.In conclusion, I would highly recommend it and I really enjoyed it with its exciting storey, great performances, fantastic music and the ideal length it is truly worth the title of the best film ever!

Comment Head: A story about being a human

Comment Body: n 1946 a young New England banker, Andy Dufresne (Robbins), is convicted of murdering his wife and her lover and sentenced to life at the Shawshank State Prison - twice over. Quiet and introspective, he gradually strikes up a friendship with the prison 'fixer', Red (Freeman), and over the next two decades wins the trust of the governor and guards, but in his heart, he still yearns for freedom. Darabont's adaptation of a Stephen King novella is a throwback to the kind of serious, literate drama Hollywood used to make (Birdman of Alcatraz, say) though the big spiritual resolution takes some swallowing - ditto the colour-blind relationships within the prison and the violent disavowal of any homosexual implications. Against this weighs the pleasure of discovering a first-time director with evident respect for the intelligence of his audience, brave enough to let character details accumulate without recourse to the fast- forward button. Darabont plays the long game and wins: this is an engrossing, superbly acted yarn, while the Shawshank itself is a truly formidable mausoleum.

Wow, this is really the best movie ever made. Even though this movie contained a few mistakes, I'd like to rate it full-on-full. I want to tell this to all the people who haven't seen the movie, it's a must watch. You might think that 'Forrest Gump', The Best Picture Oscar winner can beat it, let me tell you, IT CANNOT! I'm serious! It is about a man, Andy Dufresne who has been put behind the bars for the murder of his wife and her lover, a Professional Golf player. But just like every other man in The Shawshank Prison, he too is innocent. Then he meets a, Ellis Boyd Redding, a smuggler/businessman and makes friends with him and his gang. Andy then asks him for a small rock hammer witch is soon delivered to him. He one day sees the names of prisoners written in the cell. He to goes to writ his name on the wall that is so weak that is comes out after which, he starts digging a hole in the wall. After 20 years of being in the jail and realizing how corrupt the warden is when he kills his friend, he escapes the prison and gets the warden so good that he suicides. The last thing that I'd like to say is that it should be rated 9.5 on IMDb but still, that's just a suggestion. 9.3 is good.

I just rewatched this brilliant movie thinking seeing it a second time it would lose its impact. I was wrong. I was just as touched and amazed by this movie. This movie has everything a great film needs. From great story with a beautiful ending and fascinating characters, to great performances by every actor, to beautiful music and stunning cinematography. I could go on for ages why this movie is amazing. It doesn't have a single weak link in my opinion. Does it deserve to be #1? Maybe not. But it is one of my all-time favourite movies, and I enjoyed every single second of it. I would definitely recommend this movie.

This film is yet another in an ever-growing list of excellent works of art that explain why I love Morgan Freeman! As usual, he holds your attention in the most powerfully subtle manner! Tim Robbins is FANTASTIC! He's so amazing in this role! It's worth watching at least three times. There's some hard-hitting stuff but that's to be expected in a prison film. The ending is so poignantly beautiful and simple yet has an incredible emotional impact if you allow yourself to be transported to that time and in their place. It helped me have a little more compassion for inmates and ex-convicts. It's not for anyone under 18, so don't allow minors to view it. I highly recommend it to anyone who hasn't seen it. You won't be disappointed!

*SPOILERS* I'll just get it out of the way now. This is the prime example to prove that Morgan Freeman is among the greatest narrators ever, if not THE best. Tim Robbins, the lead in this movie, creates a great duo with Morgan Freeman, with the dialogue shared between the two feeling natural, as well as superb acting from both. The story line is what presents the backbone for these great performances as the narrative is a major part of what makes it one of the greatest films of all time. A man is accused for his wife's murder, is sent to prison where he serves life sentences which gives him the time to redeem himself (though he did not commit the crime is accused of) and eventually escape. The movie is full of great writing, acting, directing and cinematography and deserved to win at least one Oscar out of its seven nominations.

Movie/Film is called shadow of life or imagination. We watch for entertainment or learning or just for fun. All movies can't achieve the goal to satisfy its viewer but "The Shawshank Redemption (1994)" does beyond expectation. Those who fade up with their life should must watch The Shawshank Redemption (1994). Its a movie of inspiration. After watching the movie you realize it deserve the No.1 movie of IMDb top movies of all the time. Without watching the Review can't express its beauty. I've watches more than thousand movies but its the best. Still waiting for a movie in which I can give 10 out of 10. It got 9 form me but its my highest rating.

It is the best movie in the history of cinema. One of the best movies of all time. Don't deprive yourself of the pleasure of watching such a stellar movie. Go now and watch this movie if you have never seen it. Perfect casting, amazing story, emotional performances. Just perfect. Probably one of the best films I have ever seen in my young life. Giving this a 10 won't do it justice. The Shawshank Redemption is just pure story telling at its best. No wasted moments and no pause of time ,just absolute, pure narrative. The cast is perfect with Morgan Freeman as Red completely stealing the show with his soothing narration style while Tim Robbins gives out a really great performance; a falsely convicted man who keeps it to himself. A film about hope and friendship in the toughest of situations, Shawshank is uplifting, provocative and awe inspiring. An absolute must watch.

Comment Head: Andy Dufresne, a successful banker, is sentenced to lifetime imprisonment when he is convicted of the murder of his wife and her lover.
Comment Body: In my opinion, there are two different types of good movies (if not more). One type is the one where you can watch hundreds of times and still not get bored of it. The other is the one where is so memorable that watching one time will result in you remembering it forever, even if you never ever watch it again. Shawshank Redemption is the latter.The movie itself contains no fast-paced action or fantasy, but the gradual progression of the movie makes way for character growth and realism. In nearly 150 minutes, the viewers find themselves living and growing with Andy and Red, urging for them to make a move and yet never quite certain if they will.I don't really have any words that I can say about this movie other than the fact that it is the type of masterpiece that makes you think hard about everything.

I really liked this move and this is why my first review it's about it. First time I saw it, I was maybe 12, and even then, I was fascinated with it. A story of a life spent in prison and learning how to live with it, not giving up even everything seems lost, it was just breathtaking. The second time I saw it, I was a bit older and understood it better. I won't write about acting or the technical things but the movie as a whole. It is in deed a masterpiece. Only a few movies can say about themselves that everything was alright and if anything were different, it would't be such a great film.

This is one of the best films I have ever seen, the first time I saw this, I became so enthralled, I couldn't take my eyes of it, I was glued to the T.V I have watched the film several times since and find it just as enthralling. The true friendship between the 2 characters was so powerful. The story was incredible, it made me laugh, and cry, the film was totally emotional. There wasn't any special effects in the film, but I think that is good The acting was great throughout. A defiantly must see film if you haven't seen it before. The ending shows such poetic justice, it was great. I think Morgan Freeman is a great actor in anything he does

Comment Head: a must watch film for every film lover.
No fluff, no gimmicks, just an incredible story
Comment Body: This is a great movie. The entire movie is filled with life changing themes that reveal how important integrity, friendship and hope is in this world. One person with a big heart can make such a difference. For being a simple drama without any real action, romance, or special effects, Shawshank Redemption does a phenomenal job of drawing in the viewer and creating intense scenes at every turn. The characters are vivid and easy to relate to. When so many movies today revolve around computer generated graphics, explosions, fight scenes, and sex, it is refreshing to watch a movie that reminds us all of what life is really about. Life sucks sometimes, but Andy looks past his circumstances in order to better the world he was forced into. The friendships he makes and the way in which Andy brightens up the world around him is inspirational.

Comment Head: The Title Does Not Do Justice To This Movie
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption title rendered little inspiration to actually see the movie. It wasn't until word of mouth from those I trusted finally encourage me to see this film. It started with the violent death of his cheating wife and her lover by Andy Dufresne. He is wrongly convicted and sentenced two consecutive life sentences. He is sentenced to the fictional, but tough, Shawshank Penitentiary. As a white collar guy in a tough prison Andy befriends two fellow inmates. Morgan Freeman's poignant narration throughout the movie highlight the story and gives it credence. Tim Robbins character is able to win the favor and protection of the guards by using his financial skills to do their taxes. That enable him to earn the trust of the prison warden to do the books in a money laundering scheme.The ending of this movie has some very interesting twists and turns highlighted by a graphic narrative from Morgan Freeman.

Great Movie based upon a true story. Beautiful cinematography. shows the life of a prisoner who is an innocent human being in reality. He is accused of killing his wife and is later sent to jail but he is so smart and intelligent that he's able to make himself calm for the whole time he is in jail and also able to establish good relations with every1 there including other prisoners. The turning point is when he surprises every1 by escaping the jail through an underground tunnel which he digs through the room where he is being kept. He crawls through the tunnel and ultimately makes his way out of the prison cell without being caught or detected by the guards. At the end of the film he is seen as a free man at a remote location far away from his work and home with loads of cash and wealth. Great story. Everyone must watch it.

Mind Blowing and superb work by the actors and all of the crew.Nice Work!The way he escapes,showing love,using his mind e.t.cthe film tells the story of Andy Dufresne, a banker who is sentenced to life in Shawshank State Prison for the murder of his wife and her lover despite his claims of innocence. During his time at the prison, he befriends a fellow inmate, Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding, and finds himself protected by the guards after the warden begins using him in his money laundering operation.Despite being a box office disappointment, the film received multiple award nominations and outstanding reviews from critics for its acting, story, and realism.

The Shawshank Redemption is a film that plays out the story of Red's, Morgan Freemans, experiences, encounters, and friendships while imprisoned for murder. Red begins with his first encounter of Andy Dufresne, Tim Robbins. Andy was quit peculiar in the way in which he carried himself and his quietness, which intrigued Red. Andy requested a rock hammer from Red, from then on Andy and Red's friendship began to grow. The film shows the hardships prisoners experience, including being jumped and raped by the "Sisters." But the film also displays what good can be done within the prison, such as Andy, an experience banker, volunteering to do taxes and give financial advice to the guards in return for a better life behind bars for him and his friends. Andy uses his privilege to rejuvenate the prison's library and offering assistance to prisoners to obtain there high school equivalency. The film is spanned out over 40 years, showing the long term sentences these men have served. There are several themes as work in this film, but the most prominent one is the power of hope. Throughout the movie, glimmers of hope are expressed by the men but then soon shattered. The beginning scene of the bet of which "New fish" would cry was soon realized to be cruel and led to a prisoner's death. Throughout the movie, Red (Freeman) had lost all hope. Red displayed this loss of hope with his uncaring attitude displayed at his parole hearings. He had no motivation to express to the board that he was a changed man and was ready to return back to society. He said the same speech at almost every hearing which lead to his denial until he later regained hope for a brighter future and spoke of his regret to the parole board. Hope was also displayed through music, the singing French woman and the harmonica. A glimmer of hope was displayed for Red when his friend escaped prison, this hope grew when he was unexpectedly granted parole. Through Red's narrative, it seemed as his Red's fate was to be the same as Brooks, "Institutionalized," but Red prevailed and pursued his long lost friend, Andy. The letter that Andy left for Red under the lava glass near the oak tree stated, "Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies." This changed Red, he now understood the saying "Either get busy living, or get busy dying," and he chose life. Symbols used throughout the film were rocks and pinup posters of iconic women. Rocks were used ultimately to hide the true purpose of the rock hammer, but they were also a symbol of hope and normalcy. The posters of the iconic women, such as Rita Hayworth and Marilyn Monroe, were posters to cover up Andy's true desire which was to escape this unjust imprisonment and return to his normal life. An example of good sound effects is the scenes leading up to Brooks' demise. The sound effects create a sense of understanding and realism; soft music is played as her narrates his final letter to his friends back at prison. Shots of the hustle and bustle of the city, cars whizzing by and honking at Brooks, the noisy and bossy grocery manager. In the final scene of him committing suicide, the noise of his pocket knife is very prominent and creak of the chair as he mounts it to carve his name in the rafter, and the sound of the chair being kicked away and the tension on the rope is heard. This is very realistic and somber. The music is soft which created an emotion of sadness and does not drown out the important subtle noises. A movie that shares some of the same themes and motifs is Green fried Tomatoes, this film portrays a significant amount of time and displays the power of hope as well. In conclusion, this film displays the power of hope and how it effects people when hope is lost. Andy's unwavering hope brings "light" to others around him, possibly saving their lives.

Comment Head: One in the Top-10 List of Mine
Comment Body: As far as I am concerned, I think it is a movie well worth watching. I am a senior high school student in China, and I really do not have lot of time to lead a free life as most of students abroad (stated in many books and stories in China). As is known to many people, there exists a strict examination (The National College Entrance Exam) in China, and each student only have one chance to attend it during his/her lifetime, so nobody will give it up and everyone is fighting for it.Just like Andy, Red and many other people in the Shawshank. Maybe most of us living creatures do not have a real freedom.It is a jailbreak story in many people's eyes, but it isn't just like that in my aspect. I regard it as a kind of redemption as the title of the movie. As is stated in Oxford Dictionary, "REDEMPTION" is "the action of saving or being saved from sin, error, or evil" or "a thing that saves someone from error or evil". In my opinion, both of its meaning was highlighted.I do not want to talk about this movie from performance, even if it is the soul of a movie. But I think there must be a more important thing.Red is a man lost his heart, even if he is always speaking ill of the guard, his eyes is like a silent street, he can bear anything, and he will not have a quarrel, he sentenced himself to death. Though he said he had been totally changed in the jail, nobody would like to APPROVE him of get out of it. But when he tell them his true words inside his heart, he was soon set free. It is just like a kind of joking, but I think it is of high applause. I don't know how to express it in an exact word in English, it means "Ë°ÄÊÄß" in Chinese.As for Andy, the other main character in this movie. He is an energetic bird looking forward to freedom, which is wise enough as well. Carving the wall, behind which is freedom. It takes him nineteen years. But it is fair. In his past life, though he was freer than that in Shawshank, he was also trapped. Trapped by his daily routines, by his wife's abandon or by those business and title he earned. For many of us, one should work until his sixties or older, and when he could enjoy his life, there is not very much left exactly. Andy used nineteen years to gain a freedom, and he got it faster than we.Maybe the western cannot get my idea, but in fact, a people in China even need to work in his seventies. There are thousands of rooms left empty, but most of people cannot have their own house in his whole life. That is the reason why I am longing for freedom.Owing to the blessing of the god, I have my own house with my family, we have cars. What's more, we do not have trouble in earning a living. Maybe I could say I am a born First-Class, but too many of us cannot be like that.WE NEED REDEMPTION.I have to say it is the Top-10 Movie I have ever watched. And it even can be the best TWO out of all, the other one is Leon.

Comment Head: Orange is NOT the new black
Comment Body: The caption basically shows you my opinion of that movie. It is a top film with a great storyline and perfectly described characters who are performed by actors knowing their craft well. Furthermore I also praise Darabont for turning King's short story into an almost 3-hour long drama without losing the basic message of the book and its atmosphere. Namely how different the two main characters are who represent a certain life philosophy : Red is the pessimistic one who never raises hope because life taught him that there is none but Andy is the total opposite: He never loses his hope even in such a terrible place. Nevertheless it is definitively NOT the best film of all time! Come on my fellow IMDb voters, how can you deliberately ignore the other movie masterpieces?! It is the without doubt the best prison movie (The Green Mile?!) and also one of the best book-adaption but there a better movies...admit it!!

3576 reviews already in there .. what more can one possibly add ! and still i have the urge to write one .. for i feel it would be injustice not to ! the is my first review on IMDb .. and i'm very sure my last one too !This movie is a CLASSIC in every sense of the word . i wonder if there ever be another movie which brings about such a strong emotion from within. i have never experienced something like THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION ! and the most wonderful part about the movie is that it stays with you .. the characters .. the actors .. the plot .. the narration ! you can almost hear MORGAN FREEMAN every time you think about this wonderful piece of work. please don't miss this .. please watch it TODAY !

Comment Head: One of the greatest movies ever made
Comment Body: So the shawshank redemption is a 1994 prison movie staring Tim Robbins as former banker turned double murderer Andy Dufrense. When Andy's wife and her lover are found murdered at a country club Andy is blamed and sentenced to two back to back life sentences in the notorious Shawshank State penitentiary ran by a sadistic head guard named Byrom Hadley as well as the corrupt warden Samuel Norton. When Andy decides he wants a rock hammer to carry on his hobby of shaping rocks he meets Ellis Boyd "Red" Reading described as "a man who knows how to get things" Red is also "the only guilty man in Shawshank" as all other inmates claim they are innocent. Andy and Red quickly become friends as Andy repeatedly tries to convince all the other inmates that remembering there are places outside of Shawshank and they should not accept they may never leave the prison. Andy then takes a young high school dropout named Tommy under his wing to help him get his high school qualifications it is this boy that brings forth the revelation of Andy's innocents after telling the story of about a old cell mate who claims to have committed an identical crime which he got away with. After Andy's young friend is shot dead by Hadley Andy asks an inmate to get him a 6ft long piece of rope. the next morning Andy does not show for roll call and Red fears he has committed suicide however the do not find Andy hanging in his cell like Red expected they do not find him at all the night before a plan that took 19 years to get ready took place and Andy had escaped Shawshank prison. This is by far one of the greatest movies of all time Frank Darabont showcases his skill for the first of many times collaborating with Stephen King this movie should definitely be brought on blu-ray right now if you haven't seen it what are you waiting for.

This movie is the highest rated since it has something that can keep a viewer in touch with the word 'freedom'. some sequential incidences are quite enough to remind us the complexity of life that are increasing in modern times. even if someone is not habituated in some unwanted or unpleasant places or circumstances, gradual involvement in those situations can change everything.viewers can very easily reveal why this masterpiece is so famous inconsiderable of generations, times and places. how much a hopeful mind can go or what should s/he can do to pursue his/her ultimate freedom.this is a must watch movie for them who seek life into art-works.

Comment Head: The Shawshank Redemption - Best Movie Ever!
Tied for the best movie I have ever seen

Comment Body: Why do so many people love this film? We see a story that offers us all hope. There is hope, real hope, all of us can have. As a Christian, I see many reflections of the Gospel in this film. It is interesting to me, how so many love the film, yet reject Christianity and the message it brings. Again, it's simply interesting. It may say more about the Church than about those who love the movie. A question I always ask myself, who has the greater redemption in the film, Andy or Red? On the surface, many can see it as Andy. After all, he is wrongly convicted. He goes to prison. He escapes. He has his ultimate redemption. One can easily view the film in this light. However, I believe Red has the greater redemption. Here is why. Andy is goes to prison without committing the crime. Andy has a physical redemption. Yet, it is Andy who always has hope, always has a plan, and always brings light. To his inmates, to the world he inhabits. Red is guilty. His crime, his sin, has pervaded into his life. He has lost hope of what might be. His life is prison. He cannot escape, even as he gets out into the "real world." He is still not redeemed, spiritually in his soul. Andy's journey through the dark tunnel is a foreshadowing of the darker journey Red is walking. And we don't know if Red will survive. Yet Red has a redeemer. It is Andy. Andy never gives up on Red, even after he has escaped. He does everything he can to keep connecting, communicating, and reaching Red, to say to him - this is not the end, there is hope. You only have to take a step. You have to get busy living. Red does. He finds hope. He is truly redeemed. As a Christian, I see great connections between this film and the Gospel. I see in this story large elements of the Greatest Story. We have a Redeemer. He was without sin, He was not guilty, yet He came to us, in a world filled with sin, darkness, and death. He came to our Shawshank. He came to set the captives free. In this world, He healed, He taught, He educated, He cared for, He encouraged, He worked miracles. In this world, He continued to be wrongly accused, persecuted, beaten, mocked, and sentenced to death itself. He entered into the dark hole. He traversed through the darkest tunnel we can imagine. He rose again. Yet this was not the end. It was the beginning. The beginning of His work to continue reaching out to us, communicating to us, doing everything He could to say there is hope. He wrote us a letter in His Word, the Bible. He gave us the means to take the journey, a bus in essence, by His Church. He promised He would be there. And He is. He is waiting for us. He give hope and a home. Now and forever. Red's redemption can be a portrait of our greater redemption. We can say, like Red, "I find I'm so excited that I can barely sit still or hold a thought in my head. I think it's the excitement only a free man can feel. A free man at a start of a long journey whose conclusion is uncertain." We can be free, truly. We can have hope, fully. Now in the world. Forever, in the world to come. "Get busy living." Well said, Red.

Comment Head: An amazing movie everyone will love
Comment Body: So, I first would like to say that this was a very good movie. While watching it I realized I was watching the highest rated movie in IMDb. It definitely deserved that rank. I was hooked right from the beginning. I will put an disclaimer for anybody who wants to see it that it being a rated R movie there is vulgar language, violence and showing of alcoholic beverages. Also there is a scene where there might be nudity but from what I can remember I think the most you'll see is some guys butts. The main plot of this movie is about a banker, Andy, who goes to prison because he is accused of killing his wife. He meets a guy named Red and they become best friends. This movie had the right amount of everything without having too much of something. It had comedy, drama, action. When watching this movie it made me think. One of the things I thought about is that life can change on the outside world when you're locked up for so long in an enclosed space. You also can feel so out of place that you'd rather go back to your enclosed space because that's all that you know and feel comfortable with. The movie explains that if you have hope then the outside world isn't too bad. This is a movie that I would recommend any adult to see. Even if you think you might not like this movie or it's not your cup of tea I believe you'll still enjoy it by the time you finish watching the film.

Do I need to tell anything else? No, but I will, in Portuguese. The Shawshank Redemption was released over 20 years and is still the best of all. For many years simply ranks first in the Top250 IMDb. The performances of Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins are sensational. The plot, based on a short story by Stephen King, is exquisite. The director, Frank Darabont, also directed "The Green Mile", which, incidentally, is also based on a short story by Stephen King. The most wronged film in Oscar history. Gave chance to compete with another fantastic movie, Forrest Gump, which was more commercial, mainly because of the participation of Tom Hanks, who was high at the time, since it came from films such as Philadelphia and Sleepless in Seattle.

This movie show's me many things about life. Everyone who didn't watched it must watch it at least one time in his lifetime. The actor play is on professional level. The things that this movie want to tell to all of the watcher are things that many people aren't learned still from life. Movies in top10 from top250 which are from 90's must be watched from everyone no matter young, old, white or black. Watching this movie it gives me one beautiful adventure. Every time when I think about this movie my mood gets better. In everyone hard moment I think about it and e feel much better. The rating of this move is not chance it's real.

Comment Head: a brilliant movie ,i was to late to see
Comment Body: Andy Dufrene a banker who was convicted of murdering his wife and her lover which he constantly denies .He is sent for life sentence to shaw-shank state penitentiary where he befriends prison contraband smuggler, Ellis "Red" Redding and spends his time doing unconventional thing to keep himself sane.The movie is narrated through the voice of red played brilliantly Morgan freeman who is the prison contraband supplier .Throughout out the movie we see red narrating many prisoners of shaw-shank but mostly focuses on Andy.The Entire movie focuses on various major activities of Andy through out his time in prison. the story also focuses on the subject of the mind state of a long time prisoners their inability to know whats their purpose outside prison ,unless they don't have proper support their only chances are either going back to prison or death.This is a true master-piece from frank Darabont (direction and screen play) and Stephen king .This movie is a 142 minute master- piece .please don't miss this movie

This is simply one of the best films ever made and I know I am not the first to say that and I certainly won't be the last. The standing on the IMDb is a true barometer of that. #3 as of this date and I'm sure it could be number 1. So I'll just skip all the normal praise of the film because we all know how great it is. But let me perhaps add that what I find so fascinating about Shawshank is that Stephen King wrote it.What makes this film one of the best ever made is the message it conveys. It is one of eternal hope. Andy Dufresne, played by Tim Robbins, has been sent to prison for a crime he did not commit. But he never loses hope. He never gives up his quest to become a free man again. His years of tenacity, patience and wits keep him not only sane, but it gives his mind and a spirit a will to live. This film has a different feel to it. There has never been anything like it before and I don't know if there will again.I'm not going to say any more about this film, it has already been said, but just suffice to say that I am glad that Forrest Gump won best picture in 94. I would have been equally glad if Pulp Fiction or Shawshank would have won. It is that good of a movie and one that will be appreciated for years to come.

Comment Head: One of my favorite movies of all time
Comment Body: One of my favorite movies of all time. Powerful,thought-provoking and finally irresistibly uplifting. Thanks to quietly dignified performances and Darabont's own inventive direction, The Shawshank Redemption remains a first class example of how to approach potentially weighty issues with conviction, style, lightness and wit. Shawshank is one of those rare movies that defines the whole reason I love films. It tells a fantastic story, masterfully written, acted, and directed. You can't help but become emotionally invested in the characters and story, and because of that, the film leaves you emotionally drained by the film's end, but still with a sense of hope.

Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) is sentenced to two consecutive life terms in prison for the murders of his wife and her lover and is sentenced to a tough prison. However, only Andy knows he didn't commit the crimes. While there, he forms a friendship with Red (Morgan Freeman), experiences brutality of prison life, adapts, helps the warden, etc., all in 19 years A great movie unrepeatable, The Shawshank Redemption is a 1994 American drama film written and directed by Frank Darabont and starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. Adapted from the Stephen King novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption, the film tells the story of Andy Dufresne, a banker who is sentenced to life in Shawshank State Prison for the murder of his wife and her lover despite his claims of innocence. During his time at the prison, he befriends a fellow inmate, Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding, and finds himself protected by the guards after the warden begins using him in his money laundering operation

Comment Head: Without A Doubt. One Of The Best Movies Ever.
Comment Body: This movie is a cult classic, so. so many memorable lines, so many good actors, such good directing and such a brilliant plot, such an inspiration for a lots of movies after this, i wish i had something bad to say about this movie, i actually enjoy finding faults with movies, but i can honestly say after seeing it, rethinking it and re- watching it, i can say a movie like this is a 10/10 ,not the BEST movie in history, i don't know if you can choose any movie for that title but it would be in the top 10 movies ever made. And i think i'm a pretty judgmental person, i nitpick the slightest bit of a continuity error and if a movie is 10/10 i would drop a point just for that 1 mistake. And i'm not like ''OMG THIS IS THE BEST MOVIE EVER AND NO ONE CAN PROVE ME OTHERWISE!!!!' no, a movie might come around that is probably better, i think there are 1 or 2 that are better already but plot and twist-wise, this is the best in that category, this movie is really REALLY worth seeing.

Comment Head: Shawshank Review - A True Modern Classic
Comment Body: There are thousands of written reviews for this film on this website and the majority of them positive. I know I am just adding to this long list of positive reviews, but I feel this film deserves to be my first review on this website. While this film may not be my favourite film, it is most definitely a film I respect. When I was young and watching 'The Goonies' and 'Back to the Future' I thought films were only made to entertain and were not made to convey a clear message about humanity. This film was the first film I watched that made me understand that the film medium could provide the world with such philosophical messages and could teach young people, like me, that life must be valued. Pretty deep right? Well this is the message that the film carries. Red values Andy's friendship and life. He does not want him to die and wants him to survive and when I was watching this film I thought... wow! Two prisoners, one who definitely killed another person, can be so rational and kind. I learnt from this film that the world is a horrible place and emotions can get the better of people; but through it all, it is about moving on and making sure that one is not affected by the emotional trauma that has arrived at their front door and instead take that trauma and improve themselves and other people like Andy did throughout the film. By the end, when Red and Andy are embracing on the beach, free, I see two men who have been through years of pain and self-pity clear of all negative thoughts; I see two friends that through all the emotional trauma that we see them going through are still strong.Now I can talk about themes and the impact that this film had on me all day long, but I have to praise everyone involved in this film. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman embody their characters perfectly and when I watch it now as a 17 year old who has seen his fair share of great performances these stick out as real people and not simply a performance. Frank Darababont, who not only directed the film but also wrote it, crafts a film that is very entertaining to watch but that also conveys these themes effortlessly and writes some very memorable lines that really affect one's perspective on human nature. The scene with Brooks is a scene that had me close to tears and that showed me the impact of being 'institutionalized'.Anyway, I have said enough about this film. It is very good and really pushed me into seeing films in a different light. If you want to read any more reviews or my list on my favourite films of all time please check me out. Thank you for reading this.

Comment Head: My favourite Movie ever! WARNING CONTAINS SPOILERS

Comment Body: Parents need to know that this movie is rated R for a reason: The gritty world of Shawshank Prison is populated with sadistic guards, a corrupt warden, and predatory fellow inmates. Two characters have sex (their clothes are on, and it's not graphic), one lovable character hangs himself, guards shoot an inmate and frame it as an escape attempt, inmates attempt and, we are told, succeed in raping Andy, and guards beat and kill an inmate in the opening scenes. But the film also shows inmates forming a loving community of friendship and support despite oppressive conditions.-Common Sense Media

Firstly I love this film. It's a story about hope and dreams and one whose emotional impact is as great as the Pacific Ocean is blue.The Shawshank Redemption is a perfectly woven, superbly performed, and flawlessly shot cinematic masterpiece that is sure to never be forgotten. Along with Darabont's other prison outing, The Green Mile, he has crafted a pair of subtly affecting dramas with real heart. Shawshank, however takes the prize. Phenomenal stuff. Interesting that although the hero of the film is the convicted former banker Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), the action is never seen from his point of view. The film's opening scene shows him being given two life sentences for the murder of his wife and her lover, and then we move, permanently, to a point of view representing the prison population and particularly the lifer Ellis 'Red' Redding (Morgan Freeman). It is his voice remembering the first time he saw Andy ("looked like a stiff breeze would blow him over"), and predicting, wrongly, that he wouldn't make it in prison.From Andy's arrival on the prison bus to the film's end, we see only how others see him - Red, who becomes his best friend, Brooks the old librarian, the corrupt Warden Norton, guards and prisoners. Red is our surrogate. He's the one we identify with, and the redemption, when it comes, is Red's. We've been shown by Andy's example that you have to keep true to yourself, not lose hope, bide your time, set a quiet example and look for your chance. "I guess it comes down to a simple choice, really," he tells Red. "Get busy living' or get busy dying'."The key to the film's structure, I think, is that it's not about its hero, but about our relationship with him - our curiosity, our pity, our admiration. If Andy had been the heroic center, bravely enduring, the film would have been conventional, and less mysterious. But we wonder about this guy. Did he really kill those two people? Why does he keep so much to himself? Why can he amble through the prison yard like a free man on a stroll, when everyone else plods or sidles?

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever
Comment Body: Superb. Great. Masterpiece. Unforgettable. Excellent.Brilliant. No, no , no. I have been thinking for months to find a word that can describe the film. Nothing's found yet and , to be honest, I think nothing will be found forever.The movie can't be expressed by words. Words are unable to talk about it and I have nothing to say about this masterpiece. But I'm hopeful to be able one day to express my feelings about it because "hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies" When it come to the Shawshank Redemption, I prefer to remain silent because "silence is full of unspoken words"

Best movie I've ever seen. I keep this movie on auto-play. Great casting. Tim Robbins portrayal of Andy Dufresne, an innocent man in prison, who has to break the law while in prison, to live a free life as a fugitive on the run, outside of prison. James Whitmore as Brooks Hatlin, gave a wonderful performance as a man who spent his whole life as a caged bird, once given his wings, he has forgotten how to fly free. Instead of living in a cage again, he opted for a pine box. A solitary man, in a solitary cage, for all eternity. Knowing that the character of Ellis "Red" Redding, in the book, is supposed to be a middle-aged Irish man, Frank Darabont's casting of Morgan Freeman solidified this character and brought to life the authoritative demeanor that only Morgan Freeman could pull off. There were many other actors who were considered for the role of "Red" but Morgan Freeman pulled off a commanding performance.Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne, was a great casting coup. Seeing him play an innocent man who is forced to conspire with the prison warden, in order to be free of the resident prison bullies, commit money laundering, in order to plan the perfect jailbreak and live life outside of prison as a free man, with a new identity that is "the 3rd cousin to Harvey the Rabbit."Clancy Brown as Capt. Byron Hadley, the sadistic jail warden, who gets off on beating prisoners who don't do what he says. Great character actor. William Sadler & Bob Gunton are another great character actors. Bob delivers a great role as a "holier than thou," bible-thumping Christian with greed & corruption on the brain. In the end, Karma serves her justice in the form of a .38 to the head. the movie is full of suspense and has you rooting for the "innocent" guy at the end. Worth watching over and over again.

An emotional ride with truly believable characters which have more heart than most modern movies. well worth its position at top of the table... a masterpiece, a movie which all movies fail to reach, it doesn't need superhero's or special effects, it just has a solid story which could happen to anyone, a fluidity which speeds by and left you wanting more at the end... what happens?... we all want to see how the lives of each of the main characters turn out at the end.. we know (Spoilers) they meet up after prison.. but how do they spend the rest of their lives?... together forever?.. or just a passing visit.. a movie this length which wants you to see even more.. is groundbreaking .. anyone who has not seen this movie.. shame on you all.. if your on netflix tonight and dunno what to watch this is the movie for you and trust me you shall not be disappointed.. Morgan freeman's voice alone should merit a watch.. Tim Robbins.. a role of his career

Well how i can start, before watching the movie for the first time i told myself that i would be fare and judge the movie far from the fact that it is ranked no.1 on IMDb , so here it is I opened it and couldn't move away from the screen for 142 minutes, it is not just any movie it is honestly a piece of art ! The movie talks about friendship, love , crime , passion, corruption but the most important of all is HOPE, "hope is a dangerous thing" that is the fact we should all know, but how many of us can face the danger? Which amazed me more in the movie that it gave us the fact that some people are dead even if they look alive, because if we don't live as we want we are already dead people! Yes it is the best movie I've ever watched, and I wish to see other masterpieces from Darabont in the near future.

Comment Head: Well-crafted saga of crime and innocence, abuse and retribution
Comment Body: Most often when we see a prison film, we think of Oz with a bunch of ruthless convicts, shower rape, and cartons of cigarettes. Shawshank gives a much different perspective. While it has subtle notes of the norm, there is much more emphasis on how one does and passes time, hard time, in a penile system wrought with conflicts. We have a true innocent--a well-read and good-hearted man, Andy Dufresne, caught up in a prepubescent justice system, void of forensic evidence and ballistic reports, teeming with graft and greed on the behalf of the "God- fearing" warden. In this world, the guards are more murderous than the inmates, friends stick together more than families, and becoming conditioned to the system gives parolees nightmares about their impending freedom. This story is akin to The Count of Monte Cristo and Alexandre Dumas even gets a brief shout-out in a library scene. For more reason than I can state in this brief review this is one of the best movies I have ever seen, and one of a seldom group to which I have given a perfect rating. It is worth the two hours of screening time and you will find yourself rooting for Andy and Red to the very end.

Comment Head: The best Movie i have ever seen !!

Comment Body: This movie is based on a novella by Stephen King, but don't let that put you off. It's not a horror film, rather a thumpingly good ode to friendship, hope, wit, wiles and wisdom, brimming with crackling characters and topped with the most twisteroo of twists since The Crying Game. Found guilty of killing his unfaithful wife and her lover in a fit of passion, sullen accountant Andy Dufresne (Robbins, casting off his goofball image to display more layers than the proverbial onion) is shipped to the Gothic wind-swept corridors of the Shawshank State Prison for life. It is here the movie gracefully unfolds. With a beautifully rounded script, writer/director Darabont conjures up a spellbinding personal odyssey stretching through the years from 1946 to 1967. Dufresne, all the while protesting his innocence, slowly overcomes the hellfire tortures of the prison system - an unblinking range of beatings, rapings and abject humiliations - while managing to inspire his fellow inmates to lift their degraded horizons. Among them is Red (Freeman, in a matchless supporting role), the lifer who can, given time, provide virtually anything. And for reasons best known to himself, Dufresne requires 40s starlet Rita Hayworth, provisioned in poster form. The mood swings rigorously through every emotion as the cranky, wiseguy and downright crazed array of criminals bare the brunt of the turbulent life within the doomy Shawshank catacomb. Then it gets really mean, gearing up for its injury-time shockers. Dufresne, a whiz with figures, is bullied into running the warden's (Gunton) petty accounting scams, giving him the chance to execute his and the film's final, greatest miracle. If you're miserable enough to look for gripes then, yes, it does drift on too long and who needs prison buggery again? Yet the ending has such poetic completeness you're too busy contentedly chuckling to worry about sore behinds. This may have confounded American audiences - it flopped big-time on planet Yank - but a more divine movie experience you will not find this side of Oscardom. Spread the word.

Kings movies always have a way to confuse you which is an admiring move being that the plot twists are what make a great movie. Not everyones perspectives are the same so i suggest you go ahead and give the movie a watch for yourself!

Shawshank Redemption is hands down one of the best movies that I've ever seen and probably will be one of my favorite movies of all time. I think what really made this movie stand out to me was how vividly all the actors portrayed their roles. The warden, Andy, red, brooks, the officers, the homosexual men. All these personas portrayed by the various actors gave life to the story and to each and every moment within a movie. It truly is a 10 of 10 IMO. Also I think I simply enjoyed how Andy got what he deserved after he escaped from prison. There's a lot to say about the plot and all the actors but I really became enamored by Andy as a character and just seeing him free made me enjoy the movie that much more.

the best movie ever. I really enjoyed the music and cinematography in the film. I can definitely relate to the characters in the film. I can close my eyes and envision myself in their reality. Such a wonderfully written movie with a very inspiring storyline. I would recommend this film to my children and my generations to come. the only downfall is the movie is quite long and there are plenty of parts that needed to be edited out and put in the "Deleted Scenes" section. I lost my grandmother when I first watched this film and it made me think a lot about life and about my meaning of existence. This movie inspired me into thinking and viewing the world in a wider sense and with an open mind.

Comment Head: My one problem with the movie
Comment Body: I enjoy this movie and have seen it multiple times. My only issue with the movie is that the character, Red (Morgan Freeman) is not accurate for the time period of the movie. I seriously doubt that Red because of his race would be such a leader of all inmates in the 1940's. And, the "go to" inmate for buying items? I doubt it. Some strong willed white inmate would have corned that market. He might have been a leader of the African Americans in the prison, but not the whites. Now before that starts some race debate about the topic, I only am pointing out how the times were in the 1940's, 50's, etc. My issue with that topic is that I think we should accurately portray society as it was no matter how ugly it was, not as we wish it had been.

its one of the I liked the first Blade film if slightly. It was a fun movie with some very cool moments, but didn't live up to the hype. The third, 'Trinity' is a mind-numbing disaster. Oh the difference a good director can make! Guillermo del Toro (Cronos, Hellboy) has the reigns here and clearly had a good time with the movie: it briskly bounces from one energetic action sequence to the next, with a fair number of frightful sights thrown in to liven things up. This is a good thing -- with a wafer-thin plot that takes enough turns to keep your attention, Del Toro knows exactly what kind of movie he's making: a pure action flick. And he delivers the goods. The movie is dripping with cool, and while it may not be a classic, it's a fun flick to throw on and let it suck you in.

I remember watching this movie whilst I was very young. My mum cried, basically as soon as the title popped up until the credits. Sometimes you forget things and then there are times when you remember something very vividly. I recall this movie making me feel very sad but it was a deep sadness not easily fixed with a "it's just a movie" comfort. Freedom is one of the very few things we really have and I simply cannot imagine being locked up, no matter for how long, and for something incredibly unfair. When Andy escapes and at last breathes in deep, I breathed with him and I felt looking at freedom as ours. Even though I really enjoyed this movie I have been unable to watch it again for fear of feeling too much again, it was that good.

Storyline fantastic , this is pretty much a flawless film which will leave you wanting to watch it over and over again.In a short conclusion this is one of the greatest movies ever made , this is a short review because this is all it needs , if you have not yet seen this movie you are missing it out. Amazing film all round !!

simple approach to art can be a virtue when chaos reigns in the world. Just like the neo-folk music that serves as its soundtrack while providing an emotional salve for its characters, "Song One" initially serves as a lilting if sometimes downbeat respite from the cacophony that often passes as cinema today.But even a stripped-down emo-ode to the healing power of music needs to build up to a satisfying crescendo. In her feature debut, writer/director Kate Barker-Froyland tends to tiptoe away from the dramatic high notes that audiences often crave and comes up a stanza or two short from a fulfilling resolution.Often, "Song One" feels like the timid B-side of last summer's more satisfying music-biz saga, the much less woe-is-me and a lot more let's-have-some-fun "Begin Again." Unlike many low-budget indie titles, however, the novice filmmaker does have the benefit of a couple of actual stars in her cast. They go far to help carry this story about how a young woman reconnects with her family in New York after a car accident leaves her estranged brother ("Boardwalk Empire's" Ben Rosenfield), a Brooklyn-based busker, in a coma.As Franny, a rather sullen globe-trotting anthropologist working on her doctorate, Anne Hathaway‚Äîlooking like the early Liza Minnelli with her gamine hairdo‚Äîisn't quite as distraught as she was while winning her 2012 supporting Oscar as miserable prostitute Fantine in "Les Miserables" or as a weepy astronaut in last year's "Interstellar." Still, her big-screen crying jag continues apace as she and her mother (Mary Steenburgen, who does what she can as a self-absorbed intellectual whose props include American Spirit cigarettes and a twee accordion) take turns sitting vigil in the hospital while hoping for a miracle. Remember when Hathaway charmed us as a quick-witted gangly Everygirl in "The Princess Diaries" and "The Devil Wears Prada" that could make us laugh? Where has she gone? Back to the plot. Lacking a sanctuary while back home‚Äîher mother has symbolically given her bed away to her mail person‚ÄîFranny stays in Henry's room and, like the anthropologist she is, steeps herself in what he has been up to while pursuing his music dreams. Besides recordings, there is a journal stuffed with scribblings: lyrics, deep thoughts, photos‚Äîand, lo and behold, a ticket to an upcoming concert by his favorite balladeer, James Forester.If you get an inkling that Franny and hipster-poet James will get involved romantically after she tells him about Henry's situation and his admiration for him, that would be a bingo. Johnny Flynn, the English actor-musician who plays James, duly possesses the soulful eyes and shy presence of a folk artist. And he certainly sings and performs well enough, both on guitar and violin. It is not hard to believe that countless giggly girls in their summer frocks would line up after the show to see him.He is also kind enough to stop by to see Henry the next day. Alas, his character is soon revealed to have all the personality of a very sincere though slightly damp sponge. It also is a little too convenient that he has been dumped by his girlfriend, which has blocked his talent for composing new material. Guess who will be his next muse? Bingo again.What time Franny doesn't spend with James in clubs is devoted to appealing to Henry's senses with familiar sounds and smells in the hopes it will stir him. She records street noises for him to hear. She buys takeout pancakes from his favorite all-night diner and pours syrup on them in front of his nose. Franny even shells out money for an antique gramophone to replace one that Henry broke and spins some scratchy records on it in his hospital room. Will her efforts pay off? Will we be able to tolerate her and James' somewhat ill-advised relationship long enough to find out? One wonders what Hathaway saw in this only partially-baked story. It turns out Barker-Froyland was an assistant to "Prada" director David Frankel, and it is nice to know that the actress is supporting her climb up the Hollywood ladder.But for those hoping that Ms. "Les Miz" will sing again for her supper, given the subject matter of "Song One," you will have to settle for Hathaway's intentionally amateurish crooning of America's soporific '70s chestnut "I Need You." At least she knew better than to revive "A Horse With No Name."

Good movie yet it has an everlasting message. Frank Darabont didn't need to put any kind of outlandish special effects to get us to love this film, the narration and the acting does that for him. Why this movie didn't win all seven Oscars is beyond me, but don't let that sway you to not see this film, let its ranking on the IMDb's top 250 list sway you, let your friends recommendation about the movie sway you.Set aside a little over two hours tonight and rent this movie. You will finally understand what everyone is talking about and you will understand why this is my all time favorite movie.Will surely watch again.

Comment Head: An instant and classic masterpiece of all time!
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is a very moving picture. Top class performances by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman even lift the movie higher. Supporting performances by Bob Gunton, Clancy Brown,James Whitmore are also commendable. The screenplay is top notch, it hooks you up to your seat till the last moment. Background score of the movie is exhilarating at many parts and deserves a special mention. The locations are also good, giving the viewer a realistic feeling. In the end it conveys an important moral of life- patience and tolerance always pays. I wonder why this movie was a commercial disappointment. It is and still remains one of my favorite movies. Enjoy watching the movie!

I highly recommend this. You should watch it. It is a good movie. Watch it now. Watch this. Watch it. Do it. Now Go.What are you waiting for?This is a movie about a man who goes to prison. He meets people. They talk. They talk a lot. People die. People get free. He does not get free. People talk more. More people die. Morgan Freeman stars as a man named "Red" in this flick. Watch it. Bob Gutton stars as the Warden. He is a meany.Do yourself a favor and go watch it now. Get busy living, or get busy dying.

A good film. But I find it is over marked for the standard of film. Morgan Freeman's acting cannot be flawed but Tim Robinson, as good as he was, never seemed to show enough energy or desperation to portey the role. The direction of the film is insane. The camera work seems to let it down though, where there is a lot of wide screen moments, which could have been close ups. This would have emphasised the acting. In my opinion the role Tim Robinson played could have used a better actor, however I do think he is a very talented actor. Perhaps a better actor could have been Brad Pitt. His acting in Se7en shows that he can play an angry, loving and deperate character and I think he would have done the role more justice. Overall the film was very good but not as good enough to be the best film ever.

Comment Head: its just an escape . But not from prison , from ordinary to extraordinary
Comment Body: According to me.As i have seen this movie for over 11 times .I don't believe it is a one time watcher .It is too good .Especially the casting the story is told in such a way that even I ( a moderate movie lover) understands the concept and loves to say a word or two. Even though Andy Dufresne is the lead .The character that stays in our minds is obviously Morgan Freemans' RED .He has shown some thing that is not so ordinary.And the Warden,,,Man i hate him so much that i love him.... That's it it ends here and it starts here.as told it is an escape,not from prison but from ordinary to extra ordinary .And i simply love it .And i love the way it is told

The Shawshank Redemption is hands down the best movie of all time. I will type that again, Shawshank Redemption is the best movie.....EVER. Everything about this movie is amazing. This is Tim Robbins best work, Morgan Freeman is perfect as Red in every frame of the film and everybody else is great in their roles. Every time I see this film I love it just a little bit more and it still stands as one of the best examples of hope ever to be put on film. It also has one of the lines in film history, which I have quoted often in my life, "Get busy living, or get busy dying." So overall, a total Masterpiece. 5 Beards Out Of 5 Check out my video review @ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5PyYKla1G8

Comment Head: The Best Movie of All Time!
Comment Body: The best movie of all time! Great acting, great story, great emotions and breathtaking moments. When you see the way that Tim Robbins and Morgan freeman acting, you suddenly feel and think that there is no better actors for this roles and this film. The escaping scene of Tim Robbins.. There are not many words to describe this moments. The happiness and the relaxation that he feels is indescribable. But showing us the way he feels this feelings is more than indescribable, it is amazing! The story of each character is fitting the best way that it could.
