This movie is based on a novel by Stephen King, it gets more exciting here.Interestingly, it is not King's horror film, rather a good odd friendship, hope, and freedom with amazing twist and turns. Great films stir emotions. They have an impact that lasts long beyond the trip to the cinema. They give you an opportunity to reflect on your life, to ponder on the moments and they can inspire. It's a story about 2 men, in prison in the 1940s, 50s and 60s and what happens to them. Simply but amazing,

Can Hollywood, usually creating things for entertainment purposes only, create art? To create something of this nature, a director must approach it in a most meticulous manner, due to the delicacy of the process. Such a daunting task requires an extremely capable artist with an undeniable managerial capacity and an acutely developed awareness of each element of art in their films, the most prominent; music, visuals, script, and acting. These elements, each equally important, must succeed independently, yet still form a harmonious union, because this mixture determines the fate of the artist's opus. Though already well known amongst his colleagues for his notable skills at writing and directing, Frank Darabont emerges with his feature film directorial debut, The Shawshank Redemption. Proving himself already a master of the craft, Darabont managed to create one of the most recognizable independent releases in the history of Hollywood. The Shawshank Redemption defines a genre, defies the odds, compels the emotions, and brings an era of artistically influential films back to Hollywood.The story begins with the trial of a young banker, Andy Dufrense, victimized by circumstantial evidence, resulting in a conviction for the murder of his wife and her lover. After a quick conviction, Andy finds himself serving a life sentence at Shawshank prison, with no hope of parole. He exists in this prison only in appearance, keeping his mind free from the drab walls around him. His ability to do this results in the gaining of respect from his fellow inmates, but most of all from Ellis Redding. Ellis, commonly referred to as Red, finds gainful use of his entrepreneurial spirit within the drab walls of Shawshank by dealing in contraband and commodities rare to the confines of prison. Andy's demeanor and undeniable sense of hope causes Red to take a deeper look at himself, and the world around him. Andy proves to Red and the other inmates that in the conventional walls of Shawshank prison convention will find no home in his lifestyle.By creating the film's firm foundation, the meticulously chiseled screenplay paved the way for this film's success. Frank Darabont outdoes himself with the phenomenal adaptation of Stephen King's equally noteworthy novella, Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption. In this novella, King demonstrates that he can break free from the genre he dominates and still create a marvelous piece of modern literature. Though the film mirrors the novella in many ways, Darabont illustrates a focused objective of improving upon the areas where the novella came up short, resulting in one of the best book to film transitions ever.While maintaining some of the poetic and moving dialog of the novella, Darabont also proves that a film's score can generate a great deal of emotional response from its audience, as dialog does. He employs the cunning Thomas Newman, son of the legendary Hollywood composer, Alfred Newman. Darabont shows recognition for the film's needs by employing Newman, who makes the gentle piano chords whisper softly to the viewer, as if a part of the scripted dialog. Newman lends himself to individualism and tends to drive more towards the unique in the realm of score composition. His effort in Shawshank did not go unnoticed, as his score received an Oscar nomination in 1995. While unique and independent, Newman's score never once intrudes on your concentration or distracts from the film.With work from vast array of talented scene designers, costume designers, composers, cinematographers, and various other Hollywood artists, the cast of The Shawshank Redemption had a strong foundation to work with. The marvelous cast of this film will dazzle you with some of the most convincing performances you will witness in a film. While both Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman shine as Andy and Red, respectively, the true spectacle of acting lies within the plethora of amazing supporting actors who easily disappear into their roles. Most noticeable of these, the veteran film star James Whitmore, who portrays the elderly Brooks Hatlen. Brooks, a man incarcerated for an unmentioned crime for so long that he finds himself attached to the Shawshank and the daily life he has lead. Each of these actors show a true dedication to their art, and a focused purpose in their motivations, creating a convincing setting that never once caters to anything unbelievable.With all of the aesthetic touches and attention to cinematic detail, the most beautiful part of the film lies within its thematic material, such as its focus on the human desires for the most abstract concepts, like hope and freedom. These themes, which concern things the human spirit undoubtedly yearns for, seem so intricately woven into the plot that it easily draws its audience in to its story. Though full of hardened criminals, your heart will go out to these men as they display the most basic of human emotions, and deliver some of the most quotable lines in a film to date. Like a great novel, this film manages to succeed at greater things than simply entertaining an audience. Darabont tells his story most masterfully, illustrating principles and inspiring his audience to think. He leaves us a poignant film with a powerful message of hope, and redemption, something we all seek.Darabont shows us that artists still work in the Hollywood studios and production facilities. These artists show their capability to produce art; real art that inspires you to look at the deeper aspects of life and the world around you. The Shawshank Redemption delivers much- needed breath of fresh air for anyone who realizes the capability of film. It proves that masters of the craft still live on this earth, and still bless us with timeless masterpieces that we will never forget.

Comment Head: Best Crime Movie i ever seen
Comment Body: One of my all time favorites. Shawshank Redemption is a very moving story about hope and the power of friendship. The cast is first rate with everyone giving a great performance. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman carry the movie, but Bob Gunton and Clancy Brown are perfect as the Warden Norton and prison guard captain Hadley respectively. And James Whitmore's portrayal of an elderly inmate Brooks is moving. The screenplay gives almost every actor at least one or more memorable lines through out the film. As well as a very surprising "twist" near the end that almost knocked me out of my chair. If you have not seen this movie rent it or better yet buy it. As I bet you'll want to see this one more than once.

Every movie I have ever watched more than once - and i have watched a lot - has at least one scene that i would either skip or use to go grab something from the fridge, turn up/down the AC or something. Except The Shawshank Redemption. From the opening scene till the very end, i want to do nothing but sit through and watch, feel and react to each part of the story.Everything in the film fits together in an amazing harmony, engaging all your senses and emotions from the very beginning. This is my humble opinion, and I am not surprised to see it on the top of so many lists.A true example and a benchmark to many film makers, from story to acting, cinematography to editing.

This movie is not your ordinary Hollywood flick. It has a great and deep message. This movie has a foundation and just kept on being built on from their and that foundation is hope.Other than just the message of this movie the acting was phenomenal. Tim Robbins gave one of the greatest performances ever. He was inspiring, intelligent and most of all positive. His performance just made me smile. Robbins plays Andy Dufresne who was wrongfully convicted of murdering his wife and her lover. He is gets to life sentences but yet never gives up hope. In he becomes friends with Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding played by Morgan Freeman. Freeman who gives the finest performance of his career has unlike Robbins lost hope. He is in deep regret of the crime that he committed. His way of deflecting the pain away is by trying to not feel anything at all. With his friendship with Andy he learns that without our hopes and dreams we have nothing. Andy also becomes friends with the rest of Red's group. James Whitmore also gave a great performance as Brooks Halten who gets out of prison parole but in the words of Red he has been "institutionalized". The directing by Frank Darabont was just magnificent. He kept this movie at a great steady pace along with the writing and great cinematography. He portrayed prison life in such a horrifying way, but not in terms of the physical pain but the stress and pain that wares mentally on the inmates, some of which deserve a second chance.

I am 22; And I was craving a well plotted movie the other day. And quite frankly I was quite bored of fantasy movies. I wanted to watch something that had to do with the system. I decided to go through the list of top movies of all times, according to IMDb. The Shawshank Redemption was ranked number one based on popularity. I watched the trailer and I immediately fell in love with the fact that it was narrated by Morgan Freeman and that it was about the prison system in the previous century. The movie The Shawshank Redemption Is about a character named Andy Dufresne, an introverted,young,successful banker. In 1947, one fine morning, Andy finds himself guilty of a crime that he repeated says he didn't commit. However, the evidence says otherwise. They charge him for murdering his wife and her lover. Double life sentence. He soon finds himself in one of the harshest prison in the country. There he meets Red and his friends. Andy takes his time but slowly, tactically, befriends them. Andy's wide range of skills helps him get on good terms with the prison guards, and even the Prison Warden. The Warden soon finds Andy so useful that he starts making Andy help him with his bank statements, allowing him to launder money without any suspicion.Soon Tommy Williams enters the picture, and what he discloses changes everything. The movie was very well directed. However, I wish the story focused a little more on how Andy manages to create a false identity. Overall, the movie was very interesting. I loved how they portrayed all the inmates and their problems. I very much appreciated the fact that they didn't show the prison rapes in details, and left most of it to the imagination. Andy's unreadable characteristics were very well played by the actor Tim Robbins. Throughout the whole time, I simply couldn't figure out whether he was really innocent or not, until Tommy Williams enters the picture. Andy's and Red's friendship develops very realistically. The little jokes they share were very amusing, especially the first time they talk, when Andy asks Red why his name is Red. The villainous Warden's character was very unpredictable. His "Strict Christian" image was brilliant. It made it seem that he might have a little bit of goodness inside, but as the story unveils, he turns out to be pure evil. The movie overall was intriguing. It does show some real issues that inmates go through- discrimination, sexual frustration, institutionalization and all forms of abuse. I think the movie is very eye opening. I think the message it wants to send out is that one should get to know the system and how it works so that when the system turns abusive, one can do something about it.

He look not fear in the prison. In addition, he really intelligence and no one know his plan for escape the prison. Comment Head: My best movie of all time
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is a Prison tricky film. The prison itself becomes a metaphor for the society, or even to retard people from being completely free instead.Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne, an intelligent banker convicted of killing his wife and her lover is wrongly sent to Shawshank Prison. The first and best friend that he makes is Red, the elder statesman of the yard, played by Morgan Freeman, the one that obviously a great actor who never ever did wrong in his career.At Shawshank, they communicating us about how to survive in here, and what you need to maintain a stage of humanity, which literally reflect us about reality of life. The warden, sexually abused by inmates and even beaten by guards harasses Andy. Sooner or later, Andy gets used to his new living arrangement which someone called home, but still has hope that he will leave Shawshank. As well as he try to reminds others to be hopeful.Shawshank Redemption is not to reform you, but totally drive you crazy. It's not just a film for entertainment; it's educating us about what life really is. Even though the film offers us a prison and corruption, it's definitely warmth my heart and so do you.

Comment Head: "The Shawshank Redemption" Stockholm Syndrome - you and I are the patient!
Comment Body: Stockholm Syndrome (Stockholm syndrome), Stockholm effect, also known as the Stockholm syndrome or complex known as hostages or hostage syndrome refers to victims of crime for offenders generate emotion, and even help turn a complex offender. The emotion caused by the victim against the perpetrators feel good, dependent on the heart, and even help the offender. August 23, 1973, two ex-convicts criminals Olsson and Olofsson, in Stockholm, Sweden, with intent to rob after the city's largest bank failure, the four bank employees hostage, police and criminals in a stalemate after 130 hours, because criminals give up and end. However, this incident took place a few months after, the four bank employees hostage suffered, still kidnap people reveal their feelings of compassion, they refused in court charged with the kidnappers, and even raise legal defense funds for them, they show does not hate criminals and criminals not only did not express their hurt them but then they take care of gratitude, and the police took a hostile attitude. What is more, a female staff member Christian hostages actually fell in love with the robbers Olsson, and engagement with him during his imprisonment. This two robbers hostage taking up six days ago, during which they threatened Shou Fu's life, but sometimes also exhibit benevolent side. Unexpected changes in mental intricate under which four hostages ultimately resist government efforts to rescue them. This incident inspired the social scientists who want to understand the feelings of kidnappings hijacked between those with a combination in the end took place in Stockholm bank robbery this from a fatal exception, or the combination of this emotion represents a a common psychological reactions. Later, studies show that since researchers called the "Stockholm Syndrome" event, surprisingly common. If you meet the following conditions, any person may suffer from Stockholm syndrome. The first one is to you truly feel your life is threatened, make you feel, as is not necessarily going to happen. Then people believe that this violence will do at any time, without hesitation. The first two, this violence would certainly give you impose small favors, the most critical condition. As in your case to give you a variety of despair drink. The first three, in addition to information and ideas he controlled, and any other information not let you get completely isolated. The first four, so that you feel no escape. With under four conditions, people will have Stockholm syndrome. In a sense, the formation of the Stockholm syndrome, the same throughout the "institutionalized" at home. "Institutionalization" is an important concept famous movie "The Shawshank Redemption" (Shawshank Redemption) deduction. Prisoner old Reid (Morgan Freeman) said of "institutionalized (institutionalized)": "At first you hate it (prison), then you get used to it, after enough time you come to rely on it, this is the system technology. " The film was institutionalized symbolic figure of old cloth prison librarian, he was imprisoned for 50 years in Shawshank prison under (system), which is almost exhausted his lifetime time. However, when released from prison when he was informed that you are going, not only did not full of joy, but faced with spiritual collapse, because he can not do without the prison. To this end, the old cloth at a knife to kill, in order to continue to serve their sentences in prison. He fell in love with that room unforgettable deprived of his freedom of prison, so after his release, he finally chose to commit suicide. Old cloth becomes part of the environment, once out of the original environment, everything loses its meaning. In fact, we are more or less every Chinese person suffering from Stockholm syndrome, or political education on! Merely reflect more as a chronic symptom, more seriously, is the "mass Stockholm Syndrome." We all the time is "institutionalized (institutionalized)"!

This movie is without a doubt is one of the most brilliant films. It encompasses friendships, hardships, hopes, and dreams. And what is so great about the movie is that it gives hope in a dark place like prison there can be love,fun, happiness, kindness and hope...It is a simple film, yet it has an everlasting message. A classic piece of unforgettable film-making.Frank Darabont directed only 2 movies and both of them were amazing. What more can be said about this film? Pulp Fiction and Forest Gump were released in the same year and I would still choose this movie over the other 2. Can't believe this movie didn't take home any Oscar. It's absolutely brilliant and captures the mind with its simplicity. Hollywood doesn't make them like this anymore.

I am aware that by now almost everyone knows the plot of this film, but since this is my first reviewed title on IMDb, I'll do my part in explaining it."The Shawshank Redemption" is based on the Stephen King's short story "Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption". Set in New England, the film tells the story of a young banker named Andy Dufresne (played by Tim Robbins), who is wrongfully convicted of murdering his wife and her lover. In prison he befriends Ellis Boyd Redding (Morgan Freeman), nicknamed "Red" by his friends, and his gang. But he also catches the eyes of "The Sisters", a gang of rapists and bullies led by Bogs (Mark Rolston). He then must make up his escape plan, while aiding the guards and most importantly the warden (Bob Gunton) to cheat on their taxes.I was deeply impressed by this film since the first time I watched it, and has remained my favorite film ever since. All of the main actors play their parts beautifully (Freeman in particular), and the ending is the most powerful I have ever seen.A must-see for everyone.

I know it is absolutely shocking to you that the #1 movie on IMDb's Top 250 is my (and many, many others') favorite movie. Why, you may ask? (and I would respond with a quizzical look and say what do you mean why?) Because it is simply perfection in every facet of the film making process. The direction is magnificent as Darabont gets wonderful performances from his entire cast and paced the movie perfectly. It's a long film, but doesn't feel that way. Darabont of course also gets credit as the writer, and the writing is masterful. There are so many memorable lines. The cast is amazing and the performance by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins are unforgettable. God I love this movie. The end scene makes me shed a tear every time.

Other than just the message of this movie the acting was phenomenal. Tim Robbins gave one of the greatest performances ever. He was inspiring, intelligent and most of all positive. His performance just made me smile. Robbins plays Andy Dufresne who was wrongfully convicted of murdering his wife and her lover. He is gets to life sentences but yet never gives up hope. In he becomes friends with Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding played by Morgan Freeman. Freeman who gives the finest performance of his career has unlike Robbins lost hope. He is in deep regret of the crime that he committed. His way of deflecting the pain away is by trying to not feel anything at all. With his friendship with Andy he learns that without our hopes and dreams we have nothing. Andy also becomes friends with the rest of Red's group. James Whitmore also gave a great performance as Brooks Halten who gets out of prison parole but in the words of Red he has been "institutionalized".

The Shawshank redemption is an excellent movie that was executed perfectly. Based off of the Stephen King novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption, the movie did an exceptional job of recreating the story. The Shawshank Redemption is a top class movie that needs to be seen by anyone and everyone with the perfect features to make it stand out in the crowd of movies.The acting in the movie The Shawshank Redemption is one of the main reasons that the movie turned out to be so wonderful. Combining the skills of Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman proved to be a pair for the ages. With two characters, one quiet, reserved character and one popular, outspoken character, both played by actors with similar personalities. Appreciation was shown for the acting in this movie when Morgan Freeman was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role (Academy Awards 1995). Although he lost, it is still impressive considering he lost to Tom Hanks in Forrest Gump/ These two actors were not the only actors vital to the production of this movie. Each individual side character was played by an actor perfect for the part. No actor could have done justice to any of the characters like the actors who starred in the film did.The story of the movie was possibly one of the best told stories of all time. Although it is a recent story when compared with stories from all time, it does the perfect job of immersing you in the lives and feelings of the characters and of keeping you hooked on what happens next the whole time. Stephen King started off by writing this masterpiece of a story in his novella and Frank Darabont worked with this masterpiece and wrote and directed one of the top one hundred movies of all time (AFI Top 100). The story is told over a just longer than two hour movie, that does not go on too long or too short. After the viewer has finished watching the movie, they are perfectly satisfied.The Shawshank Redemption has a Motion Picture Association of America rating of R, or restricted. This rating should be lowered too PG-13, known as Parents Strongly Cautioned. Although the movie does have slight hints at sexual activity and scenes with murders and suicide, this does not outweigh the benefit of people seeing this movie. No person of the age above thirteen, or maybe even lower, should be denied the right to view this movie. The Shawshank Redemption has the potential to have an enormous effect on the lives of those who view it. And even if it does not impact their lives, it still could easily change their perception of a good movie or just be an enjoyable two hours of their lives. Without such heavy restrictions on the age of those who can view the movie, maybe it could have a chance to be more widely viewed, and ultimately more widely appreciated.The AFI Rating of The Shawshank Redemption shows it ranked as the number seventy two American movie of the past one hundred years (AFI Top 100). I strongly disagree with this rating. The Shawshank Redemption, although it didn't cause any revelations in the movie world (mostly because it was too recent to have done so), is one of the best filmed movies of all time. I personally would rate The Shawshank Redemption in the top ten of all movies, and number one on my own personal list. The less official Internet Movie Database ranking of movies has The Shawshank Redemption as the number one movie of all time (IMDB Top 250). This is a much more agreeable rating for my own opinion on the movie. Having seen five of the top ten movies on AFI's renowned list, I do not believe any of them compare to the quality and entertainment value of The Shawshank Redemption. Although I earlier agreed with AFI's rating of The Shawshank Redemption in the top one hundred, I believe it should be much higher than the ranking they decided on.Overall, the Shawshank Redemption is a movie that will go down in history as one of the best movies ever created. This future historical relevance is not an exaggeration. If anything, The Shawshank Redemption is an underrated movie. It's not too often that there comes a movie that is as well made as The Shawshank Redemption, so when one is, it is important to fully appreciate it. The Shawshank Redemption is a grade A movie made up of the perfect components of story and acting which come together to make one of the best movies of all time.

This movie gets more interest as compared to other movies that its filmed inside a prison,the movie starts with a scene in which Tim Robbins (hero) is being convicted with murder of his wife and her lover,and then movie gradually shows Andy's (Hero) positive behavior towards the welfare of other prisoners. At a later stage of movie Andy manages an easy but well planned escape from the jail. The whole movie describes how other see "Andy". Overall movie was Good because the movie moves in an orderly way. Comment Head: All about the story. Inspiring for most, but not for skeptics.
Comment Body: This is not a movie to be watched just for the heck of it. You can't just stumble upon it as you can when looking for an action or comedy movie. Not to say that it can't happen, but if you're going to watch this movie, you have to focus on it and watch it all the way through within a week. I don't know if it is a good representation of modern prisons or prisons from the time it takes place, but regardless of that, you feel for the two protagonists. I found the predicament of Andy to be completely horrific and unfair (though I wish I could find a better word to use here than "unfair"). Some people might find the message of hope to be kind of corny, which is a view that I can understand but don't share and I'm a guy that finds many things to be corny. The life of the prisoners is brutal, partly because of the guards, but partly because of the conduct of the prisoners. Andy is easy to sympathize with, but also easy to root for because of his perseverance and hope. I like Morgan Freeman's character, Red, too. There is an air of dignity that sets him and Andy apart from the other prisoners. The one rather implausible character point that I found was Andy's selflessness. His ability to sympathize with his fellow inmates and his willingness to better their lives does not necessarily do anything to his desire for the same benefits that they reap. His motive is certainly to help his fellow inmates, but I don't feel like he would as a human just let his hard earned rewards be wasted. The one other main character is the warden, who can either be viewed as a good heartless villain or a guy that the screenwriters forced a mean personality onto with no good reason. I'm not saying that either one is true, it just depends on where you're coming from. I read another review that criticizes the way the warden's quoting of the bible is sort of demonized and was a biased act by the producers. Personally, I disagree with that, because there are plenty of people in real life who use biblical passages and religious motives as an excuse to do bad things. One thing about his character that I didn't really understand was why he is so reluctant to let Andy go free. The story is rather like that of Mr. Holland's Opus in the sense that it is divided up by the minor characters that come and go throughout. You can see how Andy and Red make a difference in the lives of the other inmates and each other. The mystery of how Andy escapes at the end is pretty good, but not something that requires you to have remembered a lot of things from earlier to understand. For anyone considering watching it, I would recommend that you watch it alone or with someone who won't talk through it. Also, don't watch it if you're looking for anything outside of a good or emotional story. Overall Rating: 8.9/10

Comment Head: after a long time the innocent man was able to get him out of the shawshank
Comment Body: When i saw this movie ,I was so impressed with how every single subplot was given a great deal of respect and attention from the director.The opening aerial shots of the prison are a total eye-opener.The final segment of the movie testifies to the fact that the final resolution of the story comes about only when Red is faced with the same fearful situation as Brooks.i think this film is the best story ever told on film.I love this film.I watch this film 100 times.i will watch this movie more and more until i die.i also encourage my generation to watch this movie.Sometimes i share the story of this movie with my friends.then they watch it and became the fan of this movie.I want to give some credits to the director.

amazing movie. Like the main actor so much. Everyone did a great job. It was overlooked in 1994 but gold always shines. It becomes so popular afterward. And it definitely deserves the fame. this movies reminds me about a lot things that I kinda forget in the daily life. What we are living for? What is the value of freedom. When you have the freedom, you won't feel anything about it. But when you lose it, freedom becomes the most important thing in your life, as important and necessary as the air. The movie is highly recommended. Tim Robinson is my favorite actor. I would highly recommend this movie to all my friends. I think they will all learn something from it.

Comment Head: Life of an innocent man in a draconian prison run by an evil warden.
Comment Body: I have forgotten how many times I have seen this outstanding, heart wrenching film.From start to finish, it has you captured into what life was like for an innocent man in the harshest prisons in America. The main character is of all things, a banker. He is framed for the murder of his wife playing away with another lover behind his back. Next thing you know the husband lands in prison and fighting to stay alive from all the inmates and prison officers. Luckily his accountancy profession saves him and rewards him at the same time. He makes friends with RED and ends up building up the library to a delux place of relaxation, reading and music playing for all the prisoners.The ending just blew my mind.You must see this film, but be warned.....it is absolutely addictive viewing.

This film includes great actors such as Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.I find The Shawshank redemption to be one of the most intelligent movies of my life time; brilliant and captivating. The story is not for the faint of heart it shows the courage and resilience that the human spirit is capable of. Invoking the desperation of all of us...wondering; in this situation, how would we handle it? This film/ story is definitely one of my favorites from Stephen King's book of short stories. If you haven't taken the time to watch this you're missing out. I watch whenever I can and always feel satisfied at the end. From the music, to the attention to detail with the wardrobe, this movie is all-around a classic and should be put on your top 10 best list....today.... There's no way you could regret it.

Comment Head: One of the Best movie I have been seen

Comment Body: Sometimes, a classic can come from an unexpected source. That's the case with the Shawshank Redemption. When you only hear about the plot, you'd guess that it may be very enjoyable, but it's been done before. The film is about a prison break. That doesn't sound like an original idea. Shawshank Redemption is based on a Steven King novella named 'Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption'. Usually, the film adaptations of Stephen King's novels aren't very strong. The picture was directed by Frank Darabont, who didn't have much of a success record back in 1994. The two leading actors are Tim Robbins, who portrays Andy Dufresne and Morgan Freeman, who portrays Ellis Boyd Redding (simply known as 'Red'). While they are both very good actors, you wouldn't expect them to have a perfect chemistry. The film also didn't very well in the box office upon its release. So despite all of that, this film has often been referred to as one of the best films of all time. I think that's a fair point to make. You don't expect an all-time classic going into the Shawshank Redemption, but that's exactly what you're going to get. This films sucks you in and blows you away.Andy Dufresne is sent to Shawshank prison in 1947 because he murdered his wife and her lover, or so we believe. He's very introvert at first and doesn't interact with any of the prisoners. That is, however, until he asks Red if he could get Rita Hayworth to Shawshank. Red simply replies that it will take a little while, but he'll manage, since he's a man who knows how to get things. It eventually turns out to be a poster of Hayworth. When Red asks Andy why committed the crime he's been sentenced for, Andy states he's innocent. Of course every other prisoner in Shawshank state that they are innocent, except for Red, who tells Andy he's the only guilty man in the prison. Red and Andy develop a friendship over the years and the chemistry between the two is simply amazing. Andy befriends most of Red's friends, like Heywood (played by William Sadler) and the old man named Brooks Hatlen (played by James Whitmore). Andy's first couple of years in Shawshank are extremely difficult. The 'sisters' have an eye on him and especially their leader, Bogs (played by Mark Rolston). They attempt to rape Andy on several occasions. The prison is run by the corrupted warden named Samuel Norton (played by Bob Gunton) and his chief of the guards, Byron Hadley, who brutally assaults prisoners to demonstrate his power. In May of 1949, Red and his friends are selected to tar the roof of Shawshank, which keeps them outdoors for a couple of days. Andy confronts Byron Hadley about his financial issues. This eventually leads to an improved prison live for Andy and his friends. Andy helps the prison guards with their financial situation and eventually even does all of the wardens finances. In 1954, Brooks Hatlen is released from Shawshank after having stayed there for 50 years. He can't live a normal live outside of the prison walls and decides to hang himself. Red clarifies that Brook has become institutionalized. After Bogs and the 'sisters' nearly beat Andy to death, Byron Hadley assaults Bogs so so hard he is never able to walk again. Andy continues to control the wardens finances and explains to Red how all the 'dirty' money is washed clean. He made up a person on paper, named Randall Stevens, so all the trails lead to him, but because he's fictional, the I.R.S won't be able to catch anybody. In 1965, Tommy (played by Gil Bellows) arrives in Shawshank for a two year sentence. He's a young guy who loves Rock and Roll. He wants to be educated and Andy starts to teach him. At one point, Tommy hears Andy's story and reveals that Andy is innocent. Andy confronts the warden with this statement, but he's afraid Andy will reveal to the outside world what happens within the walls of Shawshank, so he puts Andy in isolation for two months. During his stretch in isolation, Tommy gets killed by Byron Hadley, because he knew too much, although the warden says he tried to escape. Andy meets Red after getting out of the isolation cell and tells him about his future plans, although Red waves it off by stating Andy's being unrealistic. Andy tells Red to never give up hope. Andy decides he's been in prison long enough and escapes through a tunnel he dug during his time in prison. The following day, Andy travels to Zihuatanejo, a place in Mexico. He leaves with half of Norton's money. The next morning, Byron Hadley is arrested for being a corrupt guard and the warden shoots a bullet through his own skull. After serving 40 years, Red is released from Shawshank. He goes through the same motions as Brooks did and you get the feeling he'll also hang himself, until he remembers he made a promise to Andy, so he searches for an old oak tree near Buxton and finds some money Andy's left for him. He decides to make the trip to Mexico and rejoices with his old friend Andy, while stating he finally dares to hope.This is, simply put, the best film ever created. It's incredibly powerful. The film really sucked me in. The chemistry between Andy and Red is undeniable and the performances from Robbins and Freeman are superb. The supportive cast also does a fantastic job. Clancy Brown as Byron Hadley really looks like a despicable bully and Bob Gunton as Samuel Norton plays his role as the corrupt warden perfectly. This film never drags and the remains entertaining for all of its 142 minutes. Films, in my opinion, don't get any better than the Shawshank Redemption.

Comment Head: One of the best movies i have seen

Comment Body: One of the finest films made in recent years. It's a poignant story about hope. Hope gets me. That's what makes a film like this more than a movie. It tells a lesson about life. Those are the films people talk about 50 or even 100 years from you. It's also a story for freedom. Freedom from isolation, from rule, from bigotry and hate. Freeman and Robbins are majestic in their performances. Each learns from the other. Their relationship is strong and you feel that from the first moment they make contact with one another. There is also a wonderful performance from legend James Whitmore as Brooks.He shines when it is his time to go back into the world, only to find that the world grew up so fast he never even got a chance to blink. Stephen King's story is brought to the screen with great elegance and excitement. It is an extraordinary motion that people "will" be talking about in 50 or 100 years.

In this Stephen King short story adaption, were amazing. One of the best prison movies. It is a story about hope and dreams. A friendship between inmates. Old fashioned movie without being boring. The story is captivating. Powerful acting. The story is narrated by Morgan Freeman. That makes the story even more interesting. One of the best movies of the nineties. "The Shawshank Redemption" will instantly become a favourite of anyone who watches it. I recommend it to any fan of Stephen King. And also to any fan of Morgan Freeman. But obviously if you are a fan, you should have seen it by now, except if you have missed it. It happens, I don't blame you, you gotta catch up!

The Shawshank redemption was and still one of the greatest movies of the 90's. Not only I watched it at least 30 times in the last year but I have been fascinated by the message of hope it conveys; I can sit here and tell you all the great things about this movie but you need to watch it to understand that there is nothing like it; Academy Award winner Tim Robbins and Morgan freeman clearly did a wonderful job. If you don't love Shawshank, chances are you're beyond redemption. The human kindness and cruelty in this movie are beyond what you can imagine; The director lovingly and patiently sculpts his large cast of characters against a magnificent scenery.

An excellent thriller movie to watch! So many years passed but it is still a superb movie. Freeman has played an excellent role in the movie.I wish if this movie had some kind of sequel. The movie is that much great that if we watch if 100 times we'll still enjoy it. I really liked the movie because of it's thriller. I liked the movie " Shutter Island" because it is as thrilling as this one. The part where Andy gets to know about the killer is the most awesome part of the movie. The best part after that was the escape through a dirty place, everything in the movie was fantastic. I do not have the words to praise this movie. Even 1000 lines are not enough for it.

My advice would be to watch this movie in full before you judge it. Actually, the movie itself is nothing special, but it has some good stuff. From an artistic standpoint, there were some plot elements and character developments I didn't think were totally needed. They do, however, drive the story, which seemed to be their purpose, so I can accept them. The leads' combined talents and charisma have a lot to do with this movie's success. I found the acting to be sensational, the dialogue incredible and the director's abilities to be up to par and then some. It reminds me of some of those Croatian films that were popular back in the 1990s. My final rating comes in at seven out of 10 stars.

Comment Head: A great movie about two men who meet in prison
Comment Body: I had to watch the movie for my English class but can i just say it was one of the best texts we have studied. The whole movie is just constantly interesting and even if you don't watch the film for the actors or the writers or the produces, you stay for the story. Because lets be honest, there is nothing better than a prison break story. The constant changes in story lines, learning about each characters lives in and out of the prison walls, the relationships formed and broken, and the beautifully narrated story is one great film that helped me really see things from an interesting perspective. All in all, i give this movie 10/10 because there are many prison movies out there, but this one takes the cake.

Comment Head: One of the finest film in the world

Comment Body: From the moment I first watched this film, it became a favorite. There is a lot of drama, action, and compassion in this film. By the end, you feel yourself caring for the entire cast. Morgan Freeman is at his best in this film, and I have to say the same for Tim Robbins as well. James Whitmore stole my heart from the second he walked on the screen. It is a bit long, but the story moves at a great pace and you don't realize how long it is until you seethe clock. If you haven't seen this movie, you should. You will love it. Stephen King is a brilliant writer and Frank Darabont's screenplay does King justice. It is truly a must-see! It does not disappoint in any way.

One of the best movies of all time. The acting in incredible, the story is captivating and engaging, and every actor comes through in a big way. A truly wonderful movie. If you have not seen it, you will not be disappointed when you do. The story, chiefly about the 20-year friendship between Freeman and Robbins. Andy Dufresne (Robbins) is sentenced to two consecutive life terms in Maine's Shawshank prison for the murders of his wife and her lover. Set in the 1940's, the film shows how Andy learns to get by in the brutal confines of prison, even earning the respect of his fellow inmates, most notably the longtime convict "Red" Redding (Freeman)

Comment Head: Andy was in a good film (misquote from film)
Comment Body: Greatest movie ever made, sounds like a clich√© but it is true this time. If you are figuring out what to watch between this and the godfather (because that's what the top 250 said) then choose this one! It has elements in it that we can all relate to or inspire to and elements in which we can all escape to through another world we don't know about. I chose this film as my first review as i thought it was worth my while so take the hint please! If you like sci-fi fantasy be prepared to not be amazed in this area but i would say it is a fantasy through the eyes of Red (Morgan Freeman's character) because he does go on a bit about how he has never seen someone like Andy (Tim Robbins) before. If Morgan Freeman thinks he's cool then he is cool therefore this film is cool end of.

Movie is really a masterpiece. I had already watched it many times and i am going watch again many times in future.An amazing movie. Easily one of the best movies made during the 90's and definitely one of the top 'prison' movies of all-time. Pretty much everything about this movie works and works extremely well! A simple story that touches the bottom of the heart. The concept of this movie is the best and unique. No Action ,Fight ,Drama ,Romance. Just a sober bond of emotions. The work done by Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman deserves a great applause.Watching these actors work together is a real treat, and they more than make up for the script's deficiencies. No Oscar is bad luck of this movie but 16 awards is what it deserves.Powerful, poignant, thought- provoking and finally irresistibly uplifting. At end i would recommend everyone to watch this movie once.

One of my all time favorites. Shawshank Redemption is a very moving story about hope and the power of friendship. The cast is first rate with everyone giving a great performance. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman carry the movie, but Bob Gunton and Clancy Brown are perfect as the Warden Norton and prison guard captain Hadley respectively. And James Whitmore's portrayal of an elderly inmate Brooks is moving. The screenplay gives almost every actor at least one or more memorable lines through out the film. As well as a very surprising "twist" near the end that almost knocked me out of my chair. If you have not seen this movie rent it or better yet buy it. As I bet you'll want to see this one more than once.

Comment Head: One of the best movies I seen so far!
Comment Body: First of all sorry for my not perfect English, it's not my native language.In my opinion "The Shawshank Redemption" is one of the best movies which I seen so far! Twenty years ago this movie was a "low-key prison" film that didn't get back its costs. But now it has become one of the most popular movies of all time! Everything is amazing there: actors play, shooting scenes, the story itself of course... I already have seen it more than 10 times and I believe that I definitely will do it again once more!This is first movie and the only one which I rated with 10 stars!

An amazing movie. One of the best movies made during the 90s and definitely one of the top 'prison' movies of all-time...Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman at their best. A true classic. If you haven't seen it, I recommend you go watch it as soon as possible!After being convicted of murdering his wife, something he denies, smart and banker Andy Duffrain (Tim Robbins) is sent to Shawshank prison, which is run by a corrupt warden (Bob Gunton). He makes friends with some of the inmates but his closest relationship is with Red (Morgan Freeman) a wise lifer who is a you want it, he can get sort of guy. After many years there, and after the last straw from the warden, Andy does something that will be remembered throughout the history of Shawshank prison. The lot of this film is equally incredible with story and characters, we love whats going on the entire film because every moment is important to the ending of the film, and the characters of the movie are just perfection, Andy and Red as best friends is probably the greatest friendship I have ever seen a film and that makes it impossible to dislike them and how colorful and fun the supporting characters are, what an incredible and beautiful movie that shows the horrors of prison. The cast is just incredible, Tim Robbins plays his most memorable and best performance of his career if you ask me, and Morgan Freeman has also his greatest role to date and truly deserved his Oscar as much as everyone else that year, they were just incredible.

I've always enjoyed a good prison series/film, but this one exceeded all others! My favorite part of the film was definitely when the main actor made an alliance with Morgan freeman! Such great chemistry there, there were also some tense moments. It is not one of them films which I can easily watch over and over simply because it is such a long film and because it takes a while to forget the plot, and if you have already watched it, the build up to seeing the main actor escape the prison is no longer a tense surprising moment.So clever and the casting was perfect! I think the film sells itself! In perspective i would rate this film 10/10 for everything, even with the age of the film (1994) it will always be a "one to watch" film for generations to come.

The Shawshank Redemption is in my mind undeniably the greatest movie ever made. This film breaks down the essence of human existence, embodies the human condition, and shows that when knocked down there is always hope. Just as Andy said "hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies". That is what this film is it is not just a prison film it is not just a redemption story it is truly a lesson. This film is a masterpiece only a few films in existence come remotely close to this movie but none can compare.I would recommend this film to everyone because what you get out of it is all based on your beliefs but everyone can agree that this is a masterpiece that should endure throughout the ages.

When I started watching the movie, I thought: This is going to be another one of those movies drama in prison, where the guy suffers and escapes and lives happily forever. Just waiting there. Not so. The film reaches the spiritual side of things. Shows how this affects people psychologically. Having cut his freedom is yes, one of the worst things in the world, even when there is no fault. But when you get used to the place, the rules, what is inside you, it becomes your place, your truth. And then you go out. Now what? How do I live? I do not know no more walking on the street! This can really drive someone insane. Another important point is the issue of corruption in jail. Not that common place fell to be the focus of this thing. Was already structured, it was not something that needed to be nor explained. Corruption in the chain is already so common to us, which is not something that needs 20 minutes of film to explain how it works - despite the great scene in the library where Andy pro account as Red in Shawshank laundering scheme works.

It is very rare that you will ever come across a movie of this calibre in your entire life. Masterpiece is the only way to describe it.From the moment it starts, you're hooked. You learn of Andy and being sent to prison. The acting is phenomenal, and of course, the viewer is treated with narration from Morgan Freeman throughout the movie.After that, you get to know each character well, all excellently written and diverse. The script is highly intelligent, and the dialogue flows in a smooth and believable way.You find yourself gripped for EVERY second as Andy's perfect plan unfolds, into a tremendous climax, leaving you emotional as you have seen his struggle.If anyone considers themselves a movie fan, then they not only should have seen this film; they should own it.One of the best!!

The Shawshank Redemption is a great movie. Morgan Freeman did a really good job on acting.... i love it. I was really learning some things in this movie. I like Morgan Freeman films because he is really a good actor. I recommend you this film to watch at least once, because this is a legendary film.I love it when in the end he founds the box with this letter. And then he travels to this place where his friend Andy was repairing the boat. I really enjoyed watching this legendary film. And also this film was made by a true story so it really makes it very very very very very very very good. I hope they will make good films in the future too inspired by a true stories.

Comment Head: One of the best movies I've ever seen.
Comment Body: The story of a man struggling to survive in one of the most hostile environments possibly know by any human being took my breath away. He did not deserve to be there, he was innocent from the beginning, but instead of claiming his innocence, he worked from day one to find a way to scape from all that. He never quit fighting. A lesson to us all. The plots are amazingly driven. The characters arc is strong and understandable from begging to end. Photography is captivating. Acting is precise, and reach the soul of the subtext all the way. The director really knew how to pull together an award winning team. Every aspect of the script is taken care of. The producers went the distance in this one. A masterclass in acting, directing, photography, production but most important, scriptwriting. Thou I did not read the book, I guess the film did justice to it. I'm sure Steven King feels really proud of it. A must see to everyone who loves good films, or pretends to break into the film industry.

The Shawshank Redemption is a 1994 American drama film written and directed by Frank Darabont and starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. It is ranked #1 in IMDb's "Top 250" list and is considered one of the best movies of all time -Says WikipediaParents need to know that this movie is rated R for a reason: The gritty world of Shawshank Prison is populated with sadistic guards, a corrupt warden, and predatory fellow inmates. Two characters have sex (their clothes are on, and it's not graphic), one lovable character hangs himself, guards shoot an inmate and frame it as an escape attempt, inmates attempt and, we are told, succeed in raping Andy, and guards beat and kill an inmate in the opening scenes. But the film also shows inmates forming a loving community of friendship and support despite oppressive conditions.Must watch movie.before u die !!

The story begins with the trial of a young banker, Andy Dufrense, victimized by circumstantial evidence, resulting in a conviction for the murder of his wife and her lover. After a quick conviction, Andy finds himself serving a life sentence at Shawshank prison, with no hope of parole. He exists in this prison only in appearance, keeping his mind free from the drab walls around him. His ability to do this results in the gaining of respect from his fellow inmates, but most of all from Ellis Redding. Ellis, commonly referred to as Red, finds gainful use of his entrepreneurial spirit within the drab walls of Shawshank by dealing in contraband and commodities rare to the confines of prison. Andy's demeanor and undeniable sense of hope causes Red to take a deeper look at himself, and the world around him. Andy proves to Red and the other inmates that in the conventional walls of Shawshank prison convention will find no home in his lifestyle.By creating the film's firm foundation, the meticulously chiseled screenplay paved the way for this film's success. Frank Darabont outdoes himself with the phenomenal adaptation of Stephen King's equally noteworthy novella, Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption. In this novella, King demonstrates that he can break free from the genre he dominates and still create a marvelous piece of modern literature. Though the film mirrors the novella in many ways, Darabont illustrates a focused objective of improving upon the areas where the novella came up short, resulting in one of the best book to film transitions ever.While maintaining some of the poetic and moving dialogue of the novella, Darabont also proves that a film's score can generate a great deal of emotional response from its audience, as dialogue does. He employs the cunning Thomas Newman, son of the legendary Hollywood composer, Alfred Newman. Darabont shows recognition for the film's needs by employing Newman, who makes the gentle piano chords whisper softly to the viewer, as if a part of the scripted dialogue. Newman lends himself to individualism and tends to drive more towards the unique in the realm of score composition. His effort in Shawshank did not go unnoticed, as his score received an Oscar nomination in 1995. While unique and independent, Newman's score never once intrudes on your concentration or distracts from the film.With work from vast array of talented scene designers, costume designers, composers, cinematographers, and various other Hollywood artists, the cast of The Shawshank Redemption had a strong foundation to work with. The marvelous cast of this film will dazzle you with some of the most convincing performances you will witness in a film. While both Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman shine as Andy and Red, respectively, the true spectacle of acting lies within the plethora of amazing supporting actors who easily disappear into their roles. Most noticeable of these, the veteran film star James Whitmore, who portrays the elderly Brooks Hatlen. Brooks, a man incarcerated for an unmentioned crime for so long that he finds himself attached to the Shawshank and the daily life he has lead. Each of these actors show a true dedication to their art, and a focused purpose in their motivations, creating a convincing setting that never once caters to anything unbelievable.

I don't think Shawshank is perfect. To be honest I don't even think it deserves the #1 at the IMDb Top 250. The thing about it is that you can't point anything wrong, there is nothing that anybody would really dislike. The highest note is somewhat odd though, it would not make my own top 10, despite of all the compliments I could make about it.There are a few memorable quotes, the always great Morgan Freeman, but nothing that i would call outstanding. A good movie, definitely worth watching, but not one of those you would watch over and over again until you got all dialogues by heart.

This is one of those rare films that is flawless! no matter how hard i try i cant seem to find anything wrong with it. it has a great script, great acting, and a feel good tone to it. Morgan freeman and Tim Robbins are great this film is a must see! This is truly one of the greatest films ever made! i highly recommend it to everyone! It also has pretty good cinematography and it feels real. You get lost in the story and it feels like you are apart of the story! This definitely deserved all of the awards that it received. Even though it has a long running time it still manages to run smoothly without any dull moments. Bravo!

Comment Head: A movie you must see before you die!
Comment Body: Everything has been said about this movie ...so many reviews,but if you are reading my review then trust me on this..there is no movie been made in any language,country or in this planet which can match this masterpiece ..this is a simple movie ..nothing special about it..2 main characters talking for 2.30 hours ..then why everyone giving it a 10?? just go and watch it to understand that this is beyond a just called movie it's an experience of a lifetime..Every second you spend to watch it will be more then worth..everything you will experience while watching it will stay with you for your lifetime..everything you knew about class movies will be re-written by this ..it might turn out to be a life changing piece of work for you..A MOVIE U MUST SEE BEFORE YOU DIE.

One of the best performances of Morgan Freeman and probably the best one for Tim Robbins. I never get tired of watching it again and again. This story, keeps you aware the entire duration of the movie, and the soundtrack, one of my favorites composed by Thomas Newman gives the tale even more grandeur. It's an impeccable direction from Frank Darabont, as he did on The Green Mile. Also it might make you reconsider some aspects of your life and to value more your time. The photography, costume, art direction, all of them are astonishing which deserved many more prizes and recognitions than it received. It's definitely one the best films made on the 90's and it's a piece of art int the film history. Nowadays I wish and I hope in Hollywood were made such great films as The Shawshank Redemption, but it seems lack of new ideas and making remakes every year. In my humble opinion, what Hollywood needs it's an entire REBOOT, not only with screenwriters but in direction and production.

Comment Head: The Best Movie I've Ever Seen
Comment Body: When I've seen this movie, I had just one movie with a 10-rating and didn't believe this could beat it (in my opinion). However, when the credits started, I knew why this is on the top: People have large expectations on "The Shawshank Redemption" and also their all-time favourite movies, but it seems it can touch nearly every person deeply. I really love this masterpiece from the beginning to the end, but I don't think it's perfect, the beginning is a little bit too violent and mostly I don't like erotic scenes (because it seems like the movie wants a cheap upgrade). This is just nitpicking and doesn't change the fantastic atmosphere, characters, soundtracks, story and all the deep messages behind it.10/10

Comment Head: Three words: simple, inspirational and great.
I have to say this maybe my favorite movie ever
Comment Body: This has to be for me one of the best feel good and most inspiration movies ever. I have to agree that this is a movie that one should own not borrow or rent. If I ever had to say to someone watch this movie this would easily be the one.There are so many reasons for loving this amazingly good movie, but one for me is the life lessons that we learn from this one. This is one of those movies which you remember forever. You remember the feeling that you had after watching it. Simply the best movie I have ever seen, great acting, great directing and great writing makes it the best movie there is. Truly deserves to be on the top as the #1 ranked movie on IMDb.Not only the lead actors have performed well but also the rest of the cast, everyone has given their best performance. The story keeps you attached till the end. And when you see the end you get a great feeling, you feel from the inside that this was something really good.And the direction is amazing and some of the scenes are so beautiful to see and the island really looks like a heavenly place.

Freeman, who is simply a great actor, a man who has never struck a false note in his career, both narrates this tale and anchors it with his authoritative playing. Anyone who read the Stephen King novel knows red turns from a white guy to a black one. and the guard casually ripping the poster at the end is different but other than those small changes, everything else is on point. This is the best prison movie ever made in my opinion. Certain ironies play out very well in this film. For instance the head sister who get cripple when Andy has had enough of his ilk. A 'life-affirming' tale about life imprisonment, The Shawshank Redemption is the kind of old-fashioned entertainment that is easily overvalued in an era of diminishing expectations.

It is clearly one of the best movie I've seen. It's a shame that it didn't win the Oscar for the best picture or best director. Direction, screenplay,acting everything was brilliant.Tim Robbins was simply outstanding in every aspects. And there was Morgan Freeman. I am a huge fan of him. This duo made this movie excellent, of course along with the director Frank Darabont. The plot evolves around two imprisoned men Andy Dufresne(Tim Robbins) and Red(Morgan Freeman). The former was imprisoned for murdering his wife and her lover. With the time goes on Andy helps his friends and become a popular figure.But the director kept the best part of the movie at the end.

I dunno, I'm a 90's baby (born in 1990) and I loved this movie. It just has so much going for it. Great and well fleshed out characters, the soundtrack, the story telling itself, just everything to me is fantastic. I guess it's just one of those things that just feels organic for some and not so much for others. Don't delve too much into WHY you didn't like the movie as much as others did, just accept that the movie just didn't have the same impact to you as it did to others, because I don't think this is one of those movies you can really explain.I feel the same way about The Big Lebowski. So many people name it as one of the greatest comedies of all time, and I just think it's meh...*puts up flame retardant shield*

Truly one of the greatest films of all time, TSR is an unbelievable film, that shows with hard work and passion, even first time directors should be taken seriously. I absolutely love Morgan Freemans character, and I love Tim Robbin; in fact the entire cast is awesome! Not a single frame of film was wasted in this picture. Every frame has a meaning and some sort of emotion to it... I don't think there will ever be another movie quite like it... I can tell it took yrs of planning an d scrutiny and Im sure wasn't easy to do. I love Frank Darabont, and it seems anything he touches in it's first iteration, turns to gold... sad what happened with The Walking Dead, but this truly is a masterpiece.

Truly one of the best movies I've ever seen, might actually be the best! Everything is good about it, the acting, the story, the setting, the characters! Set aside a little over two hours tonight and rent this movie, you will not regret it, I'm pretty sure nobody did regret it! It's not a complex movie by all means, it has a simple story, no special effects, but, maybe, the fact that it doesn't have hundreds of special effects truly helps it in feeling real. The harsh life in prison, the fact that he's just a simple man, and doesn't have connections in there, keeps you on your toes and thinking that Shawshank will be this inmate's grave. Stop reading so many reviews, and go ahead and watch it!

This is (just like Shutter Island) one of the best movies I've ever saw in my whole life. This film is really long, but it doesn't matter, for me it wasn't long enough! :) I really liked the whole story, from the beginning till the very end. It is a pretty sad movie at some points, but at the end it's actually a 'feel-good' movie. After watching this you realize how happy you have to be because you are a free man. Some people spend they're whole life in prison, and that's pretty sick. Because yeah, you life only 1 time, and now I really know how lucky I am. This movie is now number 1 for a very long time, that means 1 thing: you definitely need to watch this, you can't die without watching this movie! You won't regret it :). It is pretty funny to see Morgan Freeman acting in his younger years, then you realize how old this movie actually is. Time flies by, and that's actually one of the lessons you learn from this movie.

Nowadays movies are full of clich√©s and remakes of old good movies, but compared to this one they are like crap. Tons of money are wasted on 3D effects, sound and other 'extras', but the movies are bad. Ain't we living our own dramas every day? This is a masterpiece movie and i regret that no one make such good movies anymore!

The Shawshank redemption is about a man who is wrongly accused of murdering his wife and her lover and sentenced to life in prison. In prison the man makes friends with the inmates while improving the prison's library. He also gives financial advice to the prison security guards and personnel. The theme of this film, The Shawshank Redemption, is about finding friendship and having hope while being at a hard time in your life. Andy Dufresne is play by Tim Robbins and is the main character who is accused of murdering his wife and her lover in a jealous rage. Morgan Freeman also plays a huge part in this film as Ellis "Red" Boyd. Ellis or Red as he preferred to be called in the film is Andy's best friend in prison. There are five main plot points in my opinion within this film. These points include when the inmates are betting on the new arrivals, when some of the inmates are re-tarring the roof on one of the buildings, when new library books finally arrive after all of Andy's attempts, and when the warden of Shawshank discovers that Andy has escaped. This films theme is similar to the retelling of the mythical story of "Perseus" by author Edith Hamilton. There are several techniques that were used throughout this film but a few really caught my attention. The first technique is a motif, this is the repeated showing of the crow that Brooks rescued and raised. The birds represent a hopefulness of freedom but it also represented the loss of hope after prison. When Brooks is released, he also sets "Jake" the crow free and continues to look for him in a park nearby hoping that he will return to him. However, when Jake does not return it represents the loss of hope in Brooks for life after prison. Another technique that attributed to the emotions of the film was the lighting aspects. In the scene after Andy escapes where he is standing in water while it is raining with his arms spread wide, the light is directed down on him with his back in the shadows. This lighting technique in this scene adds to the feeling of triumph, of hope and of freedom. This film absolutely reflects the feeling of hope onto the viewers.

Comment Head: Best prison movie/buddy movie/escape flick ever.
Comment Body: Robbins kills as does Freeman. Amazing supporting cast. Everything is flawless from the camera work to the editing. Some might say that the side stories and other occasional story slowdowns drain it a bit but in my opinion these elements really only serve to better the buildup for what is maybe the greatest ending of a film ever. The location the film was shot in is also perfect and really adds to just how fun this movie is to watch. I wouldn't dare to tempt anyone with spoilers but if you haven't seen this movie then you are really missing a huge moment. Not just in cinema history. But also in terms of appreciating life. And freedom.

Comment Head: Fantastic! A must see for all generations.

The acting is impeccable and the story is compelling. This movie is like an onion, in that it has so many different layers and is so complex and yet, it is simple. I appreciate that AMC plays this movie frequently on their channel because it allows the masses of people who have cable television access to at least part of this film. Thank you for your contribution. It is truly a masterpiece that will transcend time.

Now let's talk about the movie. This is movie is really dramatic in a way, but it motivates you somehow, the main character gives you that power to live more better your days, when you see him struggling in that crazy prison. As everyone, the main character needs a friend, to get over the worst thing in prison, and he gets Red (M. Freeman) who remains his buddy until the end. The movie also show us how a prisoner gets so used to the prison life, that after he can get out... he doesn't know what to do with his life anymore. After you see Shawshank Prison, you are thinking about life in another perspective... and after that, you fell like seeing this movie again... and again! Great movie, and 10 stars from me, maybe the only one with this grade.

Comment Head: One of the best movies of all time
Comment Body: If you're in the mood for a good movie based on a true story that takes place during a seemingly simpler time and played by really great actors, then this movie is a good choice. A man wrongly accused of murdering his wife is sent to prison where he meets his new life long best friend, Red. It is the type of movie that pulls you in close so that you can't help but to like these "criminals". It's not often that any movie good or bad has a good ending. This movie has a very good ending and leaves you with the answers you were looking for. You laugh, cry (or at least feel like you might),get mad and cheer for the good guys and the mild mannered sarcasm. A man who never should have been in prison in the first place ended up making it a much better place, exposed tax scam, educated others, provided tax advice, made life long friends, developed allies and THEN receives his redemption. It's a battle of wits, showing of strength and endurance of pain (emotional & physical) throughout the movie. I have never met anyone who hasn't absolutely loved this movie.

Comment Head: A film about patience and resilience.
Comment Body: A film about patience and resilience. Everything in life with determination and planning can be done. Good script and good fluidity. Justice is not always done ... but there will always be a way out. Tim Robins and Morgan freeman show good chemistry. The story is verisimilitude, without being too fanciful. Certainly good public acceptance, it is no wonder that it is the first on IMDb. Got good reviews. It's an optimistic film that shows us the good side of perseverance and calm. Nothing's desperation to end well ... as good conquers evil ... if it is strong enough for this. Although slight, for a film of prison, known to be strong when needed. Excellent movie.

Comment Head: The story of friendship, loyalty, hope and wisdom

Comment Body: It is a strange comment to make about a film set inside a prison, but "The Shawshank Redemption" creates a warm hold on our feelings because it makes us a member of a family. Many movies offer us vicarious experiences and quick, superficial emotions. "Shawshank" slows down and looks. It uses the narrator's calm, observant voice to include us in the story of men who have formed a community behind bars. It is deeper than most films; about continuity in a lifetime, based on friendship and hope.From Andy's arrival on the prison bus to the film's end, we see only how others see him - Red, who becomes his best friend, Brooks the old librarian, the corrupt Warden Norton, guards and prisoners. Red is our surrogate. He's the one we identify with, and the redemption, when it comes, is Red's. We've been shown by Andy's example that you have to keep true to yourself, not lose hope, bide your time, set a quiet example and look for your chance. "I guess it comes down to a simple choice, really," he tells Red. "Get busy living' or get busy dying'." The key to the film's structure, I think, is that it's not about its hero, but about our relationship with him - our curiosity, our pity, our admiration. If Andy had been the heroic center, bravely enduring, the film would have been conventional, and less mysterious. But we wonder about this guy. Did he really kill those two people? Why does he keep so much to himself? Why can he amble through the prison yard like a free man on a stroll, when everyone else plods or sidles? People like excitement at the movies, and titles that provide it do well.There wasn't much going for it: It had a terrible title, it was a "prison drama" and women don't like those, it contained almost no action, it starred actors who were respected but not big stars, and it was long at 142 minutes. Polls and rentals reflect popularity but don't explain why people value "Shawshank" so fervently. Maybe it plays more like a spiritual experience than a movie. It does have entertaining payoff moments (as when the guards from another prison, wearing their baseball uniforms, line up to have Andy do their taxes). But much of the movie involves quiet, solitude, and philosophical discussions about life. The moments of violence (as when Andy is sexually assaulted) are seen objectively, not exploited.The movie avoids lingering on Andy's suffering; after beatings, he's seen in medium and long shot, tactfully. The camera doesn't focus on Andy's wounds or bruises, but, like his fellow prisoners, gives him his space.The Morgan Freeman character is carrier of the film's spiritual arc. We see him at three parole hearings, after 20, 30 and 40 years. The first hearing involves storytelling trickery; the film has opened with Andy's sentencing, and then we see a parole board, and expect it's about to listen to Andy's appeal. But, no, that's when we first see Red. In his first appeal he tries to convince the board he's been rehabilitated. In the second, he just goes through the motions.There's an underlying problem. Behind bars, Red is king. He's the prison fixer, able to get you a pack of cigarettes, a little rock pick or a Rita Hayworth poster. On the outside, he has no status or identity. We've already seen what happened to the old librarian (James Whitmore), lonely and adrift in freedom.Frank Darabont wrote and directed the film, basing it on a story by Stephen King. His film grants itself a leisure that most films are afraid to risk. The movie is as deliberate, considered and thoughtful as Freeman's narration. There's a feeling in Hollywood that audiences have short attention spans and must be assaulted with fresh novelties.Tim Robbins makes Andy a man of few words, quietly spoken. He doesn't get real worked up. He is his own man, capable of keeping his head down for years and then indulging in a grand gesture, as when he plays an aria from Mozart's "The Marriage of Figaro." (The overhead shot of the prisoners in the yard, spellbound by the music, is one of the film's epiphanies.) Because he does not volunteer himself, reach out to us or overplay his feelings, he becomes more fascinating: It is often better to wonder what a character is thinking than to know.Darabont constructs the film to observe the story, not to punch it up or upstage it. Upstaging, in fact, is unknown in this film; the actors are content to stay within their roles, the story moves in an orderly way, and the film itself reflects the slow passage of the decades. "When they put you in that cell," Red says, "when those bars slam home, that's when you know it's for real. Old life blown away in the blink of an eye. Nothing left but all the time in the world to think about it." Watching the film again, I admired it even more than the first time I saw it. Affection for good films often grows with familiarity, as it does with music. Some have said life is a prison, we are Red, Andy is our redeemer. All good art is about something deeper than it admits.

"The Shawshank Redemption" is a movie about time, patience and loyalty -- not sexy qualities, perhaps, but they grow on you during the subterranean progress of this story, which is about how two men serving life sentences in prison become friends and find a way to fight off despair.t is a strange comment to make about a film set inside a prison, but "The Shawshank Redemption" creates a warm hold on our feelings because it makes us a member of a family. Many movies offer us vicarious experiences and quick, superficial emotions. "Shawshank" slows down and looks. It uses the narrator's calm, observant voice to include us in the story of men who have formed a community behind bars. It is deeper than most films; about continuity in a lifetime, based on friendship and hope.

Comment Head: This is a truly the most beautiful movie i've ever seen. Highly recommended!
Comment Body: Parents need to know that this movie is rated R for a reason: The gritty world of Shawshank Prison is populated with sadistic guards, a corrupt warden, and predatory fellow inmates. Two characters have sex (their clothes are on, and it's not graphic), one lovable character hangs himself, guards shoot an inmate and frame it as an escape attempt, inmates attempt and, we are told, succeed in raping Andy, and guards beat and kill an inmate in the opening scenes. But the film also shows inmates forming a loving community of friendship and support despite oppressive conditions.This is a truly the most beautiful movie i've ever seen. Highly recommended!
