No wonder its #1 on IMDb!!! AMAZING MOVIE!!!
Get busy living, or get busy dying.
Comment Body: Of all the prison movies I have ever seen, The Shawshank Redemption is easily the best of them all. And of all the movies based on Stephen King's novels and novellas, this is the best adaptation. It was a shame it did not win any of the Oscars it was nominated for. I think it is one of the best movies to be made in so many years in cinematic history. It gives you insight on what life would be like if you were in prison. This movie focuses on a man sent to prison for the murder of his wife and her lover, which he did not commit. Tim Robbins is one of the most talented actors around. He plays his role with a lot of heart, soul and conviction. His best film role to date. Morgan Freeman is also very talented, he also played his role with a lot of heart, soul and and conviction. This is also his best film role to date. And finally hands off to Bill Gunton for his role as the wicked prison warden. His character is an absolute bad ass. The Shawshank Redemption is a true masterpiece.

Comment Head: Excellent story, Excellent directing, Excellent acting
Comment Body: I will start with a basic summary:This movie starts out with a banker(Tim Robbins) who supposedly killed his wife and her lover while drunk. This led to a conviction and prison sentence. Most of the story takes place in this prison, Shawshank. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are the main characters, who become best friends who use their friendship as a means to escape from the hell of prison and the devil in their warden. Tim (Andy), a brilliant man, manages to make a slightly better prison life for himself and his fellow inmates by helping out the warden with basic office things. However, this was not enough for him. He need to escape, and escape he did in the most spectacular way. Now, I will give my opinion on the film:This film is something that you should devote time to watching when you have no interruptions. Turn off your cellphone and unplug your home phone before watching it because the greatness of this film is something that shouldn't be interrupted. The story line is perfect. The acting is perfect. The characters are so deep and gripping. The setting is excellent. If you have money, I would definitely recommend that you buy this in blu-ray (if you have blu-ray player) and connect it to a surround sound system, because you will want to hear every spoken word, every fallen leaf, every gust of wind, every detail.This is one of about only 5 movies that I give a solid 10 stars.

I should say that usually I'm not much into drama. But the beauty of The Shawshank Redemption magically forced me into watching the whole film three times over the years.Its the kind of movie that is so powerful and realistic you become glued to your seat until the end. The twist at the end gave the movie a perfect finish without affecting the fine gist of the whole movie. Shawshank Redemption teaches us, improves our feelings about the world and changes our expectations about 'luck'.Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins deliver their best performance to date. If Tom Hank's movie Forrest Gump was not made in the same year, this would most certainly be the winner of the 67th academy awards.

Yes. No need to watch this movie, instead just play it on DVD, close your eyes and just listen to Morgan Freeman's narration of a prison Life, Hope, Friendship and the days in Shawshank. Every important move in this movie is described by Morgan and his voice is such a plus that it lift the movie to next level.In a scene, where the entrance of the prison tower was shown in the top angle, it shows the world in to which the prisoners are entering. It is a sample scene where the director relied on cameraman to convey the message instead of 10 line dialog.Everyone expects Morgan and Tim to become friends after all both of them are big actors. It is predictable. But the way the friendship develops is truly amazing screenplay.Many sub-plots, people with different attitude were shown in the movie. Not all of them are good people. But most of the characters are in transformation phase where they repent for their mistakes.Poetic scene ? Many scenes are there. But the one in which Morgan, Tim and others drink beer at the top of the roof of one of the building and the way Morgan narrates the scene.. Amazing...It contains a twist which is a ingredient for any thriller movie. Yet that brilliant scene is so subtle that everyone appreciate.Will there be any other movie in our life time where it can be simple yet be so powerful and heart touching ?. Doubt we will see such a movie soon.As many said before, don't rent it.. instead buy this movie and keep it safe for next generation to see this movie..Hats off to Morgan, Tim and everyone who acted in this master piece...

Therecare a lot of movies where plot takes place in a prison, with 'innocent' in-mates, cruel warden and a breathtaking escape but I'm almost sure that the director wanted to pay tribute to Bogart& Bacall's Dark Passage. There are some particular elements in the plot that resemble the 50 years old film such as; the ending scene on a south American Pacific beach (here Mexico then it was Peru), a bus ride thru the Mexican border, an innocent fugitive etc. (Morgan Feeeman of course is not Bacall...ha ha ).The rest of the story, or better to say almost all of it is an entirely different . Tim Robins and M.F work together with harmony , even pouring some humor into the gloomy atmosphere of the Shawshank prison.

We bought a piece of land. It was embarrassingly overgrown in weeds. It had trash deposited on it. We used swingblades to chop through the growth to get down to the ground. One day as I was swinging, a man walking down the road said, "You bought a bunch of weeds." It was true, but they were my bunch of weeds. I kept working. It's like there was nothing beautiful to see, but I saw it - I could see beauty, when there was no beauty there to see; and, yet, there was beauty there to see, it just was unseen to most eyes - but it was there.As spring came, something else came - daffodils. They were everywhere; vibrant yellow on green stems; life amongst death; beauty amongst ruin. Nature itself was saying there is hope; life was springing back with death and ruin its backdrop. Chickweed flourished everywhere; lush green, much greener than grass. The ground was a blanket of green; the lushest weed that had ever brought such pleasure to my eye. It flourishes in the spring, it dies out in the summer, and reappears in the fall. Its like waiting for a friend to come, then go, only to come again."The Shawshank Redemption" reminded me of such hope and life amongst despair and death. Of good and evil, with awfulness many times seeking to overcome goodness and put it out, only to see goodness, even if brought to death, shine through the darkness.A tagline for this movie says, "Fear can hold you prisoner, hope can set you free." Brooks hanged himself; Red embraced hope. I thought of Revelation 21:8 where it says, "But the fearful, and unbelieving, and the abominable, and murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone: which is the second death." The first kind of person mentioned is the fearful. I thought of Brooks, he had a chance at life - but, he chose death. He was fearful. There will be those who enter (chose) eternal death because they were fearful. The prison doors have been opened, they are told they can have liberty and freedom, and yet, like Brooks, fear holds them prisoners to death; they seal their own death, they enter eternal death.Red came to the same place as Brooks, yet, he made a different decision; he chose the hope set before him.Red, along with Andy, enjoyed their paradise. They chose to hope, and to follow that hope; that hope led them into life.As for our land, that "bunch of weeds" to the man walking by, it too has followed hope into life. People now say, "You sure got it looking good." We even had a land speculator contact us - wanting to buy our land. She ain't for sale. I may not be able to fully accomplish my hope on that land in my lifetime - but, I can hope. Every day, I can hope. Every spring, I can see the daffodils come back after winter. I can see the lush green chickweed come and go and come again. Andy and Red had a boat and the Pacific Ocean.A plastic Wal-mart chair under the shade of the trees, with the seemingly ever-present, gentle breeze is my Pacific Ocean.Hope can set you free.

Comment Head: I saw this in the cinema - yes i'm the one!!!
Comment Body: It wasn't even my idea. It was a female friends idea. I hadn't read any reviews. So i went and i watched it. And i thought it was quite a pleasant, well-made film. I didn't think it was the best film ever made. It was obviously different to your average Hollywood Blockbuster (the same year's Pulp Fiction it is not!)- slow paced with a director happy not to rush things.And here we are nearly 20 years later and it's a lot of people's favourite film. It's not my favourite film but it's grown on me and i've been forced to reappraise it. And now i think it's a lovely film, lovingly made and when you've had enough of aliens blowing up The Whitehouse, scantily clad students dancing and wise-cracking cops shooting everything insight this is the antidote and really there should be more films made like this. It puts the "good" in "feel good movie".

Comment Head: Worth watching this movie when u lose your confidence
Comment Body: Whenever i watch this movie a new confidence boosts me up. This is the success of the movie. No matter how old you are , if u have the confidence in you u can succeed. I could see more awards & praises for MOrgan Freeman but I would say Tim Robbins did well to the character as a banker. Each & every character didn't spoil the flow. Superb editing & screenplay. Kudos to the entire team. Movie is 20 years old and looking fresh even one. Friendship is another keyword that has been incorporated at the right amount. I could compare Life is beautiful movie with this one. It also inspired me to have the confidence at all time. This is one of my favorite movie of all time ..

Comment Head: In everybody's's list of great movies for a good reason
Comment Body: Two thousand four hundred and five IMDb users have bothered to write a review of this movie. I read all of them and did not find a bad one. Of course I didn't! I had not seen the movie and that is true. Every single one of my friends and acquaintances has, and not surprisingly, recommended it with the highest of praise. The fact that I had not did put into question my claim to be a movie lover. Now that I have, I admit it serves me right to have been questioned so.It is a damn good movie for all the reasons everyone wrote in their reviews and why critics also raved about it. I have no excuse for not watching it before other than my prejudice toward any movie having to do with jails, the prison life etc..Halfway into the movie, I was not convinced my prejudice about movies dealing in any way with prison would change, but the acting was good enough to keep me going. I was very happy with the direction this movie took, especially with the ending. Not since "The Birdman from Alcatraz" and Escape from Alcatraz have I enjoyed a movie that has prison as the setting; I don't expect it will soon either since my phobia with that is not going away soon. Finally, having seen Shawshank, I can now have an intelligent conversation about movies with friends and acquaintances without risking admonition for my failing to see the movie. Anybody that hasn't seen it yet and claims some knowledge of movies deserves, as I did, to be castigated. I've made my peace with the matter and I'm moving on.

Great movies. I've seen it countless times but it is not enough. This film manages to redeem Hollywood in the eyes of people who feared it long lost in a dark sea of clich√©s and predictability. Darabont shows us that artists still work in the Hollywood studios and production facilities. These artists show their capability to produce art; real art that inspires you to look at the deeper aspects of life and the world around you. The Shawshank Redemption delivers much-needed breath of fresh air for anyone who realizes the capability of film. It proves that masters of the craft still live on this earth, and still bless us with timeless masterpieces that we will never forget. http://www.qtv.vn

This is a classic, I have seen this movie many times over the years and it still create interest and drama to me. I am literally glued to the screen watching this movie. I ready like how the main character was able to use his educational ability to help not only the prisoners but also the administrators of the prison.it ready shows having a education or skill can assist your in life. But it also showed that you can be manipulated base on what situation you find yourself. Morgan Freeman is a classic, as usual is play a stunning role and capture the audience on the screen. Hats off to the producers and directors of this movie who really told a story about innocents, persecution and survival.

Comment Head: Ties with Forrest Gump as my #1 ATF

Comment Body: so much beauty in the friendship we see in this film, greatest film I've ever seen. when this film was up for the best picture oscat, im glad it was, the Oscar goes to, and not the winner is, because that year the was no winner. just such beauty in every film up, not to this date have a never seen a line up like that for best picture and the best actor. tom hanks, no doubt played the best role of he's life but morgan freeman played a role of the century. tim robbins was outstanding in fact the whole cast were terrific.if this film is the last film im ever gonna see then let it be it, because I've watched something worth dreaming forever about.

Comment Head: Good movie and a must watch for good movie fans
Comment Body: I watched ShawRed as the first movie on my PC when i bought it. Some how the engineer who formatted my drive put this movie along with few other movies for me to see as he had limited collection of movies. I watched this movie and I simply loved it, especially the end. Along with time this movie has grown over me and the more i think about it, the more i like it. It truly deserves all the recognition it is getting, though i do not consider it better than Godfather but still i find it a masterpiece movie. Great acting by both leads, Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. In fact, everyone acted well in this movie. The direction deserves standing ovation and Frank Darabont, the director also deserves hats off for his very gripping screenplay. It is very difficult to maintain much interest of audience in same interior scenes if they keep repeating themselves but DOP has done a fine job too. All n all a master movie and for new generation it is a must watch to know what movies were made just twenty years back.

The Shawshank Redemption is an instant classic by far.This is probably one of the most greatest movies of all time.Tim Robbins did the role tremendously.Morgan Freeman made the movie what it is today.I love this movie.Im telling you if you haven't seen this movie watch it right now.you will fall in love with the movie.The first time i saw this movie it almost brought tears to my eyes.The director Frank Darabont is a genius for this movie and we also have to thank Stephan King for writing the book.Both of those guys are amazing.please if you haven't seen the movie watch it, it will blow your mind.those who have seen this movie don't you agree with me?? This movie is great.

Comment Head: Unique creation of Hope and passion in reel
Comment Body: As a matter of rarity would it have ever happened, while u watch a movie u wish let this continue forever, let there be no end to the story. With its essence of hope, desire, honesty, purity, passion, brilliance and much more "Shawshank Redemption" is one such creation in reel. It started with a question "whats so special about this movie to top IMDb". It ended with much than just an answer. It made me get up from my bed, start my notebook and share my happiness with you all. I have never done this before. To acclaim the screenplay, acting, direction would need more than just words of English dictionary. On a lighter note, be the best in what you are doing, you never know, it may become your savior one day. It is a must watch for everyone. Hope Against hope and life beyond boundaries are one of many points I take away from this movie. Before I sign out, Frank Darabont, Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman take a bow.

The Shawshank Redemption released in 1994 in my opinion is one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. The movie has a great story and even better characters. Tim Robbins plays Andy Dufresne a city banker, wrongfully convicted of murdering his wife and her lover. He is sent to Shawshank prison in 1947 and receives a double life sentence. Andy forms a friendship with "Red" (Morgan Freeman), the entrepreneur of the jail. Both men face many trial and tribulations while incarcerated. But in the end the only thing these two men have in the world are each other and hope, which to them is the only thing "the man" can't take from them. The movie is full of great acting, with a theme of hope and friendship it illustrates human triumph over hardships. Nominated for 7 Oscars this movie was powerful in every way. What you will take away from this movie in the 150 minutes will give you a lifetime of lessons from the heart.

Comment Head: The Best Movie ever made in the history of the Cinema

Comment Body: truly, the most inspiring a wonderful movie of all time. i first watched this film about four weeks ago, and that was when i realized i was missing out. in the past four weeks, i have watched this film 9 times: more than i've watched most other films over many years.to use an old clich√©, the whole is greater than the sum of it's parts, is very apt. no single part of this film is stellar. but for some reason, it all pulls together to provide an emotionally packed, awe inspiring film.***SPOILER*** the feel good film of all time, it keeps you amazed all the way through, culminating in an ending which could break even the strongest of souls.this is one film where it will never grow old, and the ending will never, ever fail to move me.

One of the few movies that really succeed into telling a story as much as grabbing you with it, few other movies do that. As a powerful message that you can relate to and be inspired by. Genius if you're able to buy it don't think :"Should I?" well here's my answer of course you caca-dudy... You know if you can't there's always the TV not like that's gonna get away from you. And yes there are other movies you may like MORE than this one but it's undeniably one of the bes at every category (except comedy but that's why Johnny's there) and if you watch this movie and hate on it or EVEN think that it is overrated then you can go to hell and i don't certainly don't wanna know you. Why is (as far as i know) the best movie ever? Because of the effect it lives you with such a powerful message of freedom friendship and glory (just like Stand by me) can not get overstated, buy it if you can't or see it on TV i don't know as long as you see this masterpiece, that's all it coounts, damn it!

This is a great movie with a great storyline and tremendous performances. The movie is best viewed in the television edited version because it is a story for the whole family if the language and unnecessary sexual scenes are omitted. I have spent many Sunday mornings watching this movie on TNT. I was totally shocked when we rented the movie for a trip and watched the unedited version. Morgan Freeman is wonderful as usual. Tim Robbins plays his part perfectly although he does not appear to possess the physical attributes necessary in some parts of the film. The plot develops with perfect timing and the music works well with the time, location and story. It is a movie that can be seen over and over again due to its timeless plot.

Comment Head: Tim Robbins & Morgan Freeman were outstanding..Will watch again
They don't make them like this anymore.

Comment Body: Wow!!! And just in case I haven't made my self clear enough, WOW!!!! There are movies you kinda enjoy, good ones and even the occasional welcome surprise. And then, seldom, you come across a movie like this one. The kind where the end titles have already gotten to the soundtrack part, but you still haven't budged not believing what just hit you. This is a story which will take you on a truly beautiful journey, through all possible emotions, always under the steady guidance of Morgan Freeman's unequaled narrative. Tim Robbins is simply brilliant, making the evolution from docile, even fragile, inmate to jailbreak mastermind a riveting experience. All in all, I have always found it surprising, given the bleak prison life dominating the film's story, how this movie is foremost a tale of perseverance, true friendship and hope.

Comment Head: a movie for every one to like ..not like the pure drama movies that has its people.

Comment Body: Possibly the greatest movie i have ever seen and definitely the best in this genre and storyline . great cinematography, acting (specially by Morgan Freeman) & directing . the best thing i loved about this film was the switching of the narrator and leading character from time to time . another great thing about the film is the direction of photography and filming. also great adapted screenplay . watch this film alone and with attention and it will really get you involved and thinking and thats the beauty of it. watching it once wont give you much of the taste of it so its best if you watch it at least a few times . Definitely an urgent . don't continue with your life until you haven't seen this.

Comment Head: Very Good movie.... in all aspects
Comment Body: This movie deserves all the accolades it has received over the years. The character development was excellent. The acting was excellent... and the storyline itself was very good, and developed beautifully throughout the film. I have watched this movie several times (as it is one of those films you can watch again and again), and each time it still captures my attention through to the end. I wont dive too much into details on the plot of the film (as it is a very well known movie); but will note that it is a definite 'must see' for all those who consider themselves "movie connoisseurs". There are not too many negatives (if any) that can be said on the film. I will state, however, it's current #1 ranking on the IMDb Top 250 is a little bit high though. Morgan Freeman(Red) was extraordinary in this film. Tim Robbins (Andy Dufresne)has nothing on his resume close to his performance here (maybe his performance in Arlington Road). As for resumes, if this is not on your 'movies seen' resume, you need to improve yourself!

Comment Head: Never Give Up Hope: A Great Message to Live By
Comment Body: This wasn't the first prison movie I've seen. The ones I had seen before this consisted of gangs of criminals brutally murdering each other. Or it involved drug dealers who ran the prison, without the slightest sign of any law force slowing them down.This movie has those elements, but doesn't exploit them as many prison movies often do. There is no epic fight or riot scene in the end. That's what I enjoy about this movie. It's not about deranged dealers, psychotic killers, or blood thirsty rapist. There normal people (more or less) living in this world that many will never have to witness. (Be thankful for that.) I'm not really sure if this is a spoiler or not because it doesn't change much in the story, but Tim Robbins plays a man falsely accused of killing his wife and her lover. It was a misstep to make him innocent, as it would of made his character more 'real' to have made a mistake in his life that he deeply regrets, as Red has. Red, played by Morgan Freeman, is the actors best role to date, and he's had many great roles in his career. You sympathize with this character greatly and you actually come to care for his fate much more than you do Andy's (Robbins).Overall, I think this a wonderful film that is very well written (based off a great short story by the master of horror, Stephen King), well directed, perfectly acted, with a satisfying ending (though I can see how some can call it a typical 'Hollywood'ending).That being said, is classifying it number one on IMDb justice? No. I'd be more than happy with it in the top 100, but the fact is there are better films out there, some which aren't even in the top 250. So I give it a final score 8/10, I think I'm being fair when I say that.

Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins are absolutely fantastic in this movie. Its a movie you can watch over and over again without getting bored. It keeps us on the edge of our seat. Fantastic directing, and to learn it was originally wrote by Stephen King (the best writer of all time in my opinion) just makes it even more brilliant. If you haven't seen this before you need to, its a movie for life. The ending is phenomenal. But be warned there is violence in this movie and some disturbing scenes, but to be honest without them it wouldn't be that good. I love this movie and i wouldn't be able to understand anybody who would dislike it. Watch It ! You will love it.. P.s there are always people who seem to be looking for a similar movie, Midnight Express is based on a true story, it may not be exactly like TSR but its close to its brilliance.

After reading reviews countlessly recommending the reader to watch this film if they hadn't already I decided to dedicate some time and money to get the film on blu-ray and sit down with some food and drink and prepare to admire a so called "masterpiece". I wasn't disappointed....a lot.The film grips you from the beginning, the story line promising, good actors being introduced right left and center, however the film has its moments where some sub plots make you lose interest, I found myself drifting off into a day dream a couple of times throughout the film. However then it got back on track sensing a great finale which it delivered.I still thoroughly enjoyed the film and believe 8/10 is justified, it is by no means perfect and by no means the best, but it is up there and I do recommend it.

Comment Head: The most beautiful movie of all time.
As good a movie as you'll ever see
Comment Body: My gosh, where to begin with this movie.....practically everything was nailed, spot-on. The story is as compelling and ultimately uplifting as one will ever find in cinema -- from the very get-go we see Andy Dufresne in a courtroom, being sentenced to life in prison for the murder of two people. So instinctively, we believe this must be true -- after all the judge did rule him guilty, right? But over time Andy grows on us, until we learn of his actual innocence, and by the end of the movie one can't help but root him on in his pursuit of freedom. Tim Robbins is the perfect assignment to play Andy, as Robbins' lesser-known status as an actor (as opposed to Tom Hanks, who was considered for this role) eases his task of being the quiet, tranquil Andy who prefers to keep to his own business. Andy's easygoing yet pensive nature makes him the ideal protagonist, as he is an independent thinker yet he can peacefully interact with all others.His friendship with Red (Morgan Freeman) is the backbone of The Shawshank Redemption. Red, a contraband smuggler, may be different from Andy in almost all respects, but over the years Andy earns Red's respect through his acts of courage and selflessness. This movie teaches that title does not have to dictate behavior -- a man who is in prison can be as kind and generous as anyone outside of prison walls -- it all depends on how far you're willing to look into that man's heart. I also love the fact that the friendship of the two men heightens very gradually -- that seems far more realistic than the instant-friends that one often sees in all mediums of story telling. This one takes time to develop, creating a profundity in the relationship and contributing to one of the movie's themes (time). This theme teaches us how much things can change over time, and also lends to the purported notion that Andy and Red have been in prison for a very long time.Red's narration is one of the standout features of The Shawshank Redemption. It is both poignant and insightful, allowing us unlimited access to his mind, which makes our empathy for him so real. While in most other films we learn about characters only through dialogue, in this one Red divulges practically everything to us. His abandonment of hope and eventual love for Andy makes him a tragic figure that should pull at the heartstrings of all viewers. When we first see him attempt to receive parole in 1947, he seems to be no more than an unfeeling criminal. But by 1967 when he's trying to leave Shawshank Prison after 40 years of incarceration, we hang on every word of his memorable "rehabilitated" speech. And when he meets Andy on the beach in the final scene, and the two peacefully embrace with a hug as the camera fades away, it is hard to hold back tears of joy.A significant aspect of this film is its theme of institutionalization. We are made to scrutinize exactly what prison does to people. How does a man adapt to freedom again, once he has been released? All Brooks Hatlen could land was a job as a grocery bagger and a room in a halfway house. This inauspicious lifestyle, plus the insecurities of being away from familiar faces while among all the technological/social changes since the start of his 50-year sentence, overwhelmed Brooks, as we all saw in a speechlessly dramatic suicide scene. Red lived in much the same fear before he decided to take off and cross the border to visit Andy. So we're forced to ask ourselves: does even a finite prison sentence essentially end the free will of its recipient? Is it better to leave the inmate in prison in certain cases? This cuts deeply into the philosophy of society's legal system.But the overarching theme of The Shawshank Redemption is hope. Hope is a wonderful, vital virtue that should never be absent in any human heart. Andy echoes this through his audacious acts (be it offering financial advice to Hadley or playing classical music over the prison intercom (which is one of the finest scenes you will ever see in cinema)). He vocalizes his faith in hope to his inmates when he claims that his two weeks in solitary confinement were the "easiest" he'd ever done, all thanks to the music he kept in his head. He tells Red "get busy living, or get busy dying" and uses the death of Brooks as his evidence, much to Red's initial chagrin. Yes, Andy is built into an icon for hope in this movie, and that is what makes it so universally successful in its appeal. Hope can and should be adopted by every human being who graces the earth. This notion is expressed through Andy's entire struggle, as well as in Thomas Newman's incredible musical score for the film (which is so good it has been used in multiple movie trailers before to evoke emotional response). This precious lesson, told through a film in which literally everything is perfectly mastered, is what makes The Shawshank Redemption one of the greatest films ever made.

Comment Head: The best prison film ever made.

Comment Body: Probably one of the best movies I have ever seen. Its one of those movies where you just sit and reflect for a while after the final credits roll. Great plot, script, and acting. One of the best ever made. When Andy escaped at the end and screwed the warden over, my gosh, it does not get any better than that. It also has one of those twists in it where you think that one thing is going to happen and the completely opposite does. Near the end, when everyone thought that Andy was going to commit suicide and we all thought that he was going to be in the cell dead, he was gone, vanished. When the warden revealed the whole in the wall hidden by the poster I don't remember felling better for the outcome of a movie than I did at the end of this film.

Comment Head: Thought-provoking, greatest film of all time....
Comment Body: Shawshank Redemtion is the best film I've ever seen, I personally think that they should make so many more unforgettable films like this elsewhere in the world. Overall this inspirational motion picture is definitely out of this world. In my opinion this Movie is thought-provoking and it touches your sole in many ways.Andy Dufresne who was unlawfully sentenced to life in prison for the murder of his wife and her lover, became great friends with 'Red' a convict who was an influential inmate inside the Shawshank prison, they became a surprising partnership inside Shawshank prison Night after night, day after day, Andy tried to adapt to prison life, however he realised he shouldn't be in this indescribable road to hell so thats where his plans begin....

Comment Head: What a movie !! A little hope can push you forward ..

Comment Body: This movie, in spite of several violent scenes, is well acted and has a great plot line. The casting is excellent and the movie has moments of brilliance and is overall an excellent movie. The ending is satisfying and even though the characters are prisoners they have an air of honesty and a desire to simply (a) accept responsibility for their crime and (b) to be able to live a life of peace and pursue happiness. Far too many times, in movies and on TV, men in prison are shown to be soulless/corrupt/violent/without redeeming qualities and yet our prisons are FULL of people who are INNOCENT of the crimes they are in prison for and the cops/prosecutors are NOT always right and they are, in many cases, as corrupt as the worst offenders. This movie is a classic and has withstood the test of time. Take care and may God bless you.

Comment Head: The greatest film in existence - The Shawshank Redemption.
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption, is without a doubt the greatest film the world has ever come across. From the moment i sat down to watch this, the mutual hype made me sceptical whether it will live up to my expectations, but it could not have blown me away any more than it did. Tim Robbins takes the leading role and in my opinion couldn't have done a better job, along with Morgan Freeman who delivered a fine supporting role. The compelling storyline, directing, casting and more importantly, acting throughout the cast made this my favourite film ever. I gave it 10 out of 10 because of this and out of the hundreds of films i have rated, it was the only one with a perfect score. This film is about as 'must watch' as it gets, and anyone who hasn't must do so right away otherwise they are severely missing out.

hi i'm 14 years old and this movie is my favourite film of all time. everything about it is stunning, the set, the characters, the acting, the story, the directing, the writing, the music - everything was fantastic and complemented the point of the film.everyttime i watch it, i seem to feel cleansed and happy. a whole lot of people would just say that it is a depressing and boring movie, but when you watch it and understand the plot and watch it through to the end the "redemption" makes you feel "redeemed".while i probably enjoy a casual simple movie (whether comedy or action etc...) on a rainy day this movie is definitely my favourite. i strongly recommend this to anyone looking for an inspirational (although i'll admit it is a bit weird to be inspired by convicted felons) movie with clever twists and ingenuity. a 10/10 for me

This is now the 2,340th Review of this Title. However, I'm still writing it because this movie deserves to be written about. It really exceeds the 10/10 scale. An awe-inspiring story of hope, this is just one of those movies that you know you still want to watch in 20 years. The movie premise itself at first sight doesn't seem like it will be all that interesting. However, from the first minutes, you realize the superior writing, acting and cinematography unrivaled I would say by any other film I've seen. Throughout the movie, I find myself constantly connected to the characters, wishing that the warden would overcome his cold-hearted nature and concede to let our antagonist, Andy free from the torment that was The Shawshank Prison. I almost let out an audible sob when Tommy was shot. If you're looking for something to bring you up, to give you hope, you've come to the right place. This movie is probably the most soul-touching piece of two and half hour film out there, encompassing friendship, suffering, hope, and freedom. This movie is really what I believe that this should serve as the model for Hollywood. It's about time that they learn that for a movie to be good, it doesn't need excessive gore, or explosions on screen, or special effects, or sex scenes or any of what comes with the modern-day Hollywood production. This movie is pretty simple. Just men talking. If you haven't seen this movie yet, now the #1 movie on the IMDb leader boards, you don't know what you're missing. A must see for anybody and everybody of age. (10/10)

Comment Head: A brutal, yet astonishing film that remains believable in every aspect...

Comment Body: Can a man find redemption if he truly repents for the crimes he'd committed? Can the human spirit triumph even in the darkest of places, like a prison? Is hope a dangerous thing? These are the questions you will be asking yourself after watching this Fillet Mignon of a film masterpiece. Based on the incredible writer Stephen King and directed by the diamond in the rough film director Frank Darabont, the Shawshank Redemption is one of the greatest movies of all time, in my opinion. It's one of those movies that whenever it is on TV, I can't help but watch it from start to finish.The story is narrated by the soothing voice of Morgan Freeman, named Red. And he tells us of the time a new prisoner, Andy a former bank executive convicted of murdering his wife and her lover, came to the Shawshank Pennitentary. At first, Andy has a tough time adjusting to prison life, even getting beaten up a few times by the fellow thugs. But soon he finds his place doing the taxes of all the guards and the warden.There are so many good things about this film, I can barely think of all of them. The story in which it was based was indeed an enthralling one, Frank Darabont directed it and did a great job, not to mention the grade-A casting.I'm not sure what the main theme of this movie is, but if I had to guess, it would be about hope. And that hope cannot escape anyone, even those in positions where they feel like there is none. And that redemption is available for any man.I rate this movie a 10. I never considered giving it anything less.

Comment Head: Movies cant be more engrossing than this...

Comment Body: Some people say that cinema art has one purpose. Awake all our senses and lead us to it's own paths ..,well this movie does it very well ...is Art!!!!.... It's a picture about friendship , the value of life and the importance of education ..... the point its to be free wherever you are....some people are not in prison but live in fear for everyday difficulties and lose all the courage they have about life but our characters have the strength to feel free inside and catch their dream outside the prison. This movie directed perfectly !!!! Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman saw to us their tremendous talent !!! . A must see !!! p.s : is the best movie i have ever seen !!!

The Shawshank Redemption is a true classic film of the 90's imagined by the great mind of Stephen King and stars two amazing actors, Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.The story is one of hope and misfortune. The main character Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) is accused of a murder for being in the wrong place at the wrong time. After a very unfair trail he is sent to the infamous Shawshank prison. During his stay at Shawshank he befriends Ellis Redding (Morgan Freeman) who helps him on his journey of escaping the prison. The course of the movie shows the classic dark idea of life in a corrupt prison. Warden Norton is that Warden that you just can't trust and one that is on a power-trip crusade throughout the movie. The inmates of Shawshank all have a different story and Morgan's character Ellis explains how over-time, the inmates become institutionalized and have a hard time functioning outside of the prison as it's all they have known.It doesn't take long for Andy Dufresne to come up with a escape plan. Towards the beginning of the film Ellis helps him to get carving tools to "carve chess pieces," but over time actually carves a tunnel through his cell wall and keeps it hidden with posters of super models over the years. Throughout Andy's stay in Shawshank he forms a close bond with Ellis and he tells him when he gets out to go to this place and look under a stone. You won't find out why until the end of the film.Despite it being written by Stephen King the ending is actually a happy ending. Not quite sappy but a good ending and a ending that seems well deserved. It's amazing how Shawshank Redemption took a relatively simple idea and turned it into a classic. The old clich√© of digging your way out of prison by tunnel and being unjustly accused for a murder in a time where there was no such thing as forensic science actually happen quite a bit in those days, but the way it was imagined and executed in this movie is just classic and one for the ages.

Comment Head: An imprisoned banker finds hope in the least expected place
Comment Body: I've watched a number of movies during the years. I'm not sure whether that number is north of 500 but it's definitely close. No other movie has had the effect that Shawshank Redemption has on me every time I watch it.The movie describes the years in prison of Andy Dufresne(Tim Robbins), a banker who is convicted for the murder of his wife. There he meets Red(Morgan Freeman), another convicted felon, who -like most movies featuring Morgan Freeman- is also the narrator of the movie.Throughout his years in prison, we watch Andy go from some prisoners' boxing bag, to prison's librarian, to prison guards' personal banker. We experience with him the pain, the frustration, the sorrow. Tim Robbins gives a magnificent performance opposite Morgan Freeman's Red, maybe the only role outshining Mandela in Invictus. I won't bother you with technical details about direction, cinematography and art direction. The All-Time Best Movie place here in IMDb is by it's own a testament of the excellence that is the Shawshank Redemption. Few (if any) movies will provide the viewer with such a feeling of catharsis by the end. I hope I haven't spoiled it. If you haven't already watched this masterpiece of a movie, rush to the nearest DVD store. Every human being able of watching a movie should watch this movie at least once.Cheers

From the intro setting up the mood for the 1940s with If I didn't Care that strangely feels like Bioshock or Fallout from the other era defining themes such as the relevance of Rita Haywood from the 50s to Tommy Williams emulating the James Dean Rock' n Roll character to set the mood of the 60s. This is something that has not been addressed when reviewing this movie, how it seamlessly transfer from era to era is genius in itself. The camaraderie between Andy and Red is flawless and the viewer truly believes that these two are the leaders of Shawshank and are the best of friends. By leaders, just look at the scene where Heywood is about to be slit by Brooks and Andy and Red are notified right away to solve the problem; great scene symbolizing their importance to the group. The only flaw which keeps it from being a perfect 10 out 10 movie is that it suffers from the same stereotype that prison movies are littered with, and that is the inclusion of sodomites. I know that's what happens in prisons, but is just disgusting and cringe worthy seeing this on screen; however Shawshank Redemption implies what the Sisters do to Andy and never graphically show it on screen and that is the saving grace. That is why it only loses one point and not several, anyhow. The movie's message about hope is more heavily implied near the end though, how Andy never loses hope while Red is closer to being institutionalized. The line get busy living or get busy dying always sends chills down my spine because of its relevance when Andy says it when he knows that the system is absolutely corrupt when his only witness that could get him a new trial is killed so that Andy could keep laundering money for the warden.

This movie is one of the best movies ever made. I remember when i was watching it. I was feeling during the movie every emotion that you can imagine. The cast, well you know the cast... they play their roles with outstanding performance. The movie has some moments of awesomeness. Its great. Its perfect. Scenes, photography, scenario, plot, things that keeps your attention with intensity (and its not an action film), it has everything. I recommend it without hesitation. An excellent masterpiece that surely will be remembered as one of the greatest films ever. If you haven't watched this one yet, do it. Stop reading this review and go watch that movie!

Comment Head: Be ordinary - watch the movie - stay inspired

Comment Body: Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) is sentenced life in prison for the murders of his wife and her lover although he was not guilty of either one of the crimes. Sent to Shawshank Prison to do hard time, Andy, a banker has to learn to live life inside the prison's walls. He befriends Red (Morgan Freeman) while they both embark on a journey that reveals many things about themselves as well as each other. This is hands down one of my favorite movies of all time. It is a story about two men who withstand decades of harsh prison life while exposing the buoyancy of the human spirit. The movie reveals the significance of dignity and formality and also how knowledge and confidence can go a long way and ultimately be a way to survival. It explores the depths of friendship, forgiveness, and freedom.

Comment Head: some things are better left unsaid, but i can't hold it on
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is a beautiful film with a perfect cast and a wise plot. It had its good times, had entertainment and lead us to some reflections about life. Sadly it had some predictable conversations and seemed to be just another Morgan Freeman's movie. It dares to almost offend our intelligence the fact that the prison officers didn't check that poster carefully one single time in twenty years. And I have two questions: was the American justice that weak back in 1994? Were the condemned all smart and good people as this movie portrayed?If it deserves to be at 1st spot here? Maybe. If it became one of my favorite movies? No, just a good watch.

This is the greatest movie I have ever seen. The only movie that can compete with this, in my opinion, is Forrest Gump. This movie is absolutely fantastic. If you have not seen this movie, stop reading now, and watch it. It has some of the best plot twists of any movie I ever saw (spoilers), the biggest one perhaps being when they really make it seem like Andy killed himself, but then it is revealed that he escaped. That was the biggest "whoa" moment for me and it continued by showing exactly how almost everything he had done over the past 19 years was a part of his elaborate escape plan. I can guarantee this will be one of your favorites as soon as you finish watching it, that's what happened for me. I love this movie, and I could watch it again and again. This movie definitely deserves to be number one on IMDb, and I have no idea why it isn't as highly praised by the critics as it is by normal people. But that seems to happen a lot, doesn't it?

Comment Head: He starts to get both other prisoners and guards on his side when he offers to help one of the most
Comment Body: He starts to get both other prisoners and guards on his side when he offers to help one of the most notorious guards with a tax problem in exchange for bottles of chilled beer for everyone in his work party. From then on, Andy always seems to be working on one thing or another. He improves the prison's tiny library, and helps those prisoners who want to study. He also handles the guards' tax returns, and even helps the swindling Warden (Bob Gunton) cook the books. Over the years, he gains the respect of most of the other prisoners and guards. More importantly, he never loses hope for the future ‚Äì a hope he tries to pass on to the other prisoners. He never stops believing in life's possibilities, but to make the most of them he needs to be free.

Comment Head: The -prison-drama-movie- you are going to WATCH & feel & enjoy even if do not like prison life movies
Comment Body: Competitor: Forrest Gump & Pulp Fiction. . The story sets in 1940's, Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) is convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment, for the murder of his wife and her lover. . Morgan Freeman is Ellis Boyd also known as Red, plays a fantastic role that makes the movie even more impressive. Befriends Andy in prison and then the 'adventure' begins... . This movie will keep you thrilled and excited, you would not want to miss anything. Anything that bothers me about this movie is THE ENDING. I do not want to spoil anything here but you should know that this kinda ending is predictable and somehow raises questions about the characters sex life. I am just saying. . . . AND YES I AGREE THIS MOVIE SHOULD NOT BE NUMBER ONE IN THE IMDb TOP 250. THIS MOVIE IS GREAT BUT NOT THE BEST!!! NOT THAT I WANT TO DISCOURAGE YOU FROM WATCHING IT! GO AHEAD WATCH IT AND LET ME KNOW WHAT YOU THINK. . P.S. DO NOT just watch one movie and judge the rest...watch them all!! ' My rating: [8.5/10]

Comment Head: The Greatest Film Of All Time
Comment Body: What more can be said about this film? It was a short story given a big budget but flopped at the box office, likely thought of as just another prison film. Then people began watching copies and by word-of-mouth the characters, the plot, the sheer brilliance of the story grew so as it became almost legend.Gripping, harrowing, horrific, and finally uplifting due to its totally unexpected ending you may well find yourself appalled, laughing, sad, angry and finally even shed some tears whilst watching this intelligent and moving film. The ending is exceptional.A cinematic masterpiece, now enhanced by being available on BluRay and well worth obtaining.

In my book, 37927=24601. Both incredibly important numbers that happen to be the prison numbers for both Andy Dufresne and Jean Val Jean, respectively.Greatest movie ever made. A movie that makes you want to be a better person. No movie has ever matched it, and no movie ever will.To quote Red: "I find I'm so excited, I can barely sit still or hold a thought in my head. I think it's the excitement only a free man can feel, a free man at the start of a long journey whose conclusion is uncertain. I hope I can make it across the border. I hope to see my friend and shake his hand. I hope the Pacific is as blue as it has been in my dreams. I hope. "

This is a film that is heavy on character and dialogue and delivers on both. The performances by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are outstanding, as are each of the supporting actors. This film was adapted from a short story, 'Rita Hayworth and The Shawshank Redemption,' written by Stephen King. Perhaps it is because it's adapted from a short story as to why this works so well as there are only minor changes and nothing essential is left out, leaving the film makers with the ability to strengthen and stretch out the main focus, which is the bond created by the two main characters. In my personal opinion I would say this film is one of the most successful book to script adaptations in film history. The direction is brilliant in the way it is almost not noticeable as it relies on the actors and their interactions with each other to keep the audience interested. Cinematography is worth a mention also as each shot is captured beautifully. In summary, Shawshank is a must see and a well deserved film classic.

Comment Head: Definitely one of the Greatest Movies Ever.....
Shawshank takes you through many emotions.
Comment Body: Morgan Freeman is fantastic in this film as he guides Tim Robbins through his 20+ years at Shawshank Prison. This movie takes you through many different emotions. Everything that takes place in the prison makes me definitely not want to ever go to prison! Tim Robbins gives a superb performance as Andy Dufrense an innocent man sent to a very vengeful prison. If you have never seen this film, you will be amazed by everything that happens. Great ending by the way.The warden played by Bob Gunton is the perfect 2-faced bible-toting, under the counter dealing bad-guy in a position of power over others. Somehow this movie summed up life over the last fifty or so years looking back on who was in power running the country and big business.

"You know the funny thing is, outside, I was an honest man. I had to get into prison to become a crook" It is lines like this, that can effortlessly just make me shut my mouth, and marvel at this work of art. Morgan Freeman plays by far the most under-appreciated supporting roles in film history, and deserved the Oscar in my opinion (just watch the fifteen minutes after his prison sentence, particularly in the end, at Buxton, (I am being very subtle so I don't spoil anything!) and you will know what I am talking about). Take nothing away from Tim Robbins; sometimes, that one acting performance defines a legend. And honestly, if you are reading this review without having watched the movie yet, ...well, Go get it!! As far as rating goes, I would say "Let all other ratings be relative to Shawshank"!

"Most of the reviews would contain.."the best movie ever", but that doesn't matter, what matters more is 'hope', hope for this movie to be different than rest of the movies..and i'am sure that after watching this masterpiece, you would sit and smile for a moment and the narration of Morgan Freeman would be in your minds for a long long time. Some movies such as the 'Shawshank Redemption' can possibly change your way of doing..at first while watching the trailer and the rest, you would begin to think that this movie has no action, comedy or whatsoever that would interest you, but the most interesting part of the movie is the 'movie itself'. The plot, the story, the acting, characters and everything would surely blow your mind and every time you watch this movie, you would feel more good and faith. In a nutshell, one of the best movie ever made and a must watch for all of us.."

Comment Head: Touching, heartwarming yet powerful! One of the greatest films ever and one of the greatest novel adaptations ever.
A must for your DVD collection
Really good movie, but a bit over rated
Comment Body: This movie for me was a really great drama. Although some people would act as though this freaking movie was genius, which in my opinion is a little bit over rated. Tim Robbins does do a great job in seeming as though hes just a good guy, and morgan freeman, well hes just morgan freeman in another role. The movie is a tad bit long and the action is none. But the acting is great and the ending is to pretty great. I liked this movie a lot but I did not finish this movie thinking that it was one of the best films of all time, like I was led to believe. All in all it was a great film that I give an 8 or just below that, like a 7.9. So as long as you got the bong out and some munchies and your not a punk kid with A.D.D. which by the way I have myself. You should definitely like this one. Two Blunts up.

Comment Head: Simply one of the best movies ever !
Comment Body: This is, by far, one of the best movies I've ever seen. It's simply moving. Incredbly perfect in all the aspects. The story is unbelievable, with great actors and a director who really knew how to make the story work.Andy Dufresne really got the bad luck when he was incriminated for the murder of his wife and her lover. He had all the clues against him, and not a really convincing alibi. He made some friends in the prison, including his best friend, the guy who could get things("Red"), and the director of the prison. Using his experience as a former banker, he helped the director of the prison to make lots of money corruptly.He helped the director in exchange for some favors. But the director didn't helped him when he most needed him, and, to make it worse, he killed the only witness who knew the guy that had really killed Andy's wife and her lover.What anybody expected is the end of this story, which I wont give away. I can only say that the hope Andy had for things to work out had materialized, and the good guys lived happy forever.Masterpiece.

This is one of the few films to which I had such an initial reaction. Most films are not truly appreciated until a second viewing, however I was blown away by this film and it still stands as one of my favorite films of all time. The central relationship of Andy and 'Red' is one of the main reasons why this film is so good. I don't understand how anyone could find this disappointing. The cast was perfect, especially Tim Robbins who I feel didn't get enough credit for his role as Andy. Morgan Freeman, who was also terrific got most of the praise for his role. Without knocking him, I feel that Tim Robbins was the star of the film and his character was completely believable. All of actors did a great job and you feel emotionally engaged with them in contrast with many Hollywood 'Blockbusters' who are like robots!

oh man !! what a movie .. i cant stop my fingers to write about this movie . you watch it and watch it again and it gets better to you . the whole movie has a strong believe on HOPE .its clearly states a message that one can stand strong to his hopes . sometimes it takes time to complete but have a strong believe and patience . you cannot judge what is going on and whats going next . no action , no fighting ,no heroic sequence . A simple story of a prison with a rock solid , output ,which surprise you for sure. A story of a prisoners who gives you a lot of emotions . full of heart touching moment , some joyful moments and some surprising moment

Last year on my birthday about six friends and I went to an Italian restaurant and had some wine and pizza. We started playing a game where everyone had to say their five favorite movies. Every single person listed Shawshank Redemption as one of their favorite movies. One person a was a lawyer, one a banker, one a physical therapist, one a writer, and one an actress and they all love the movie. Why is this? What is it about Shawshank Redemption that is so widely loved? I think it's because of the friendship between Andy and Red, for one. For another, you really care for Andy and root for him to get out, and then he surprises you with his gentleness and ingenuity. For another, the music is wonderful. For another, I think the movie is about humanity, really. How do we keep our humanity amidst terrible inhumanity? Through art, through music, through appreciation of beauty as well as love for mankind.

Comment Head: Carl the Critic: The Shawshank Redemption
Comment Body: OH MY GOD!!! Such an amazing film! It's nice to know that Stephen King can do more than stories about Evil Spirits killing things. This film is perhaps on of the greatest films ever made! It is a movie about truth, justice, bravery, and prison rape (what more can one ask for!) Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman make a perfect match for this film, and despite one or two moments of slow tension between Robbins and everyone else in the film, it is very deep, powerful,thought provoking, jaw dropping, eyes widening, and spine chilling from beginning to end. The only thing I don't understand is "WHERE ARE THE WOMEN!?" This film is 99.9999999...9999% men and only 0.0000000...0001% women (at the very beginning having sex) but that is seriously the only complaint one can make about this film, other than the fact that it is long and depressing. The ending is down right perfect, and I had found myself in awe when I saw Andy (Tim Robbins) crawl through a 500 yard sewage pipe only to come out the other side a free man. What makes me curious about the film is why haven't people noticed that he was carving a hole behind the posters? He had changed them occasionally, there must have been some time when someone walked by and noticed a hole in the wall. The film's realism sucks you in like a vacuum cleaner to the point where you feel like you are a prisoner in Shawshank just chilling with Freeman and the gang of prisoner who bet on which prisoner is gonna cry first.

The Shawshank Redemption is easily one of the best movies ever made.It is a simple yet powerful story that really touches your heart. The strength of this movie lies in the fact that the director does not use anything flashy to entice the viewers in this movie. The music by Thomas Newman adds depth and character to the movie and certainly enhances the overall appeal of the movie. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman prove that good acting trumps over everything else. Frank Darabont also deserves a lot of credit for his direction. It does not feel that this is his first movie. The cinematography of this movie is also excellent and Roger Deakins has done a wonderful job. The biggest strength of this movie is that it tells us to be brave in adverse times and not lose hope even in bad times. We can learn a valuable lesson from this movie and also realize the value of patience. Anyone who has seen this movie will agree with me and most of the people will love to see The Shawshank Redemption again.

The Shawshank Redemption is simply one of the most emotionally strong movies made, Even Though it's not Divine, But The movie is still very powerful and interesting. The Cast is very Strong and Believable. Tim Robbins as Andy and Morgan Freeman as Red are just perfect.Bob Gunton as Warden Norton also did a great job. Like most of the movies created from Stephen Kings creativity this too is a great piece of gem. The Direction is one of the strongest of the 90s and the movie itself is has become the pride of the 90s era. All though the movie has many flaws but they are not really noticeable and does not really bother you. The movie is not the greatest you will see, but i can assure that its a movie worth watching for sure.

When I was seen the movie at the first time, I didn't really get the message of the movie. It's was so slow, but it didn't put me to sleep. I didn't know how the whole story would go to an end. I still able to enjoy it. I made myself to see it again, and finally I understood why it had so hight rate on IMDb. The movie started with Andy. A bank director, whom was sued for killed his wife and a man. Police fought exhibit to charge him for committed a murder. Andy was sent to jail for lifetime. In prison Andy met Red and they learned each other and became friendly. Red was a black man. He had been in prison almost 20 years at the time Andy came.Inside Andy always wanted to free himself out of the prison. It wasn't him, whom committed that horrible murder. I fell sorry for Andy. He paid his life for someone else, but nobody believed, he was innocently. What I was so surprised, Andy on the first time at the prison had planned to get out. Hope always inside him. That gave him strong to keep his plan to 20 years. And finally he was out of the prison.Red was different. He admitted, he was a murder when he was young. He apologised for what he did and wished to be a free man just like a bird. But every time he had a conversation with the whole manager, he always got denied. It's made him to feel hopeless. At the last time Red almost gave up all the hope. He didn't want to waste his time anymore. His speech was so amazing, fully emotion. Red just wished to go back at the time when he committed a horrible crime. He wanted to tell the kid, that what he did was so wrong. But he coundn't, he didn't have a miracle to do so. This time he got approved.What I learned about this movie was Hope and Friendship. Like Andy said "Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of thing, and no good thing ever died". He right, if we gave up hope, would we have a future?

this is one of Steven kings greatest movies ever i have watched this over 50 times in the last 15 years i know that Steven king is well known for his horror movies i would say that even though this is not a horror it is better than all of his horror movies. i am a big fan of Steven king so i am Rather amazed by the way he did the shaw-shank, at first i did not think that it was a Steven king movie but when i got a box set of Steven king movie for my 15th birthday an saw that it was in there i realised why it was so good i would recommend this to any1. but as a huge movie buff i watch a lot of movies.i became a big fan of Steven king when i saw Carrie. i think that Steven king has a great imagination and also puts a lot of effort into his work. the shaw-shank was a masterpiece for the way he bet raid the warden as a sadistic person. the way he used Andy as a smart but cunning inmate was amazing.

I only watched this movie a week ago and it is already won of my favorite movies. And Stephen king is my favorite writer and this is one of if not the best stories he ever wrote. And it was not even a novel it was one of the stories in different seasons as well as stand by me and apt pupil. my favorite quotation is Red, I do believe you're talking out of your ass it is a funny quotation. I would recommend this movie to all of my friends and family.10 out of ten for this movie. I wanted to watch it over and over again. So this is my first review so i think i made a good choice for my first review. angry ants first review.

The Shawshank Redemption begins with the hero of this story, Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) being convicted of murder, and sent to Shawshank prison. While there Andy meets a man who is a very longtime convict, named Red (Morgan Freeman). With the help of his new friend, Andy will change Shawshank prison in a way that no one will see coming.I was absolutely shocked when I first saw this movie. At first I had no idea what to even say about it I thought it was so good. The Shawshank Redemption is in my opinion not only one of my favorite films of all time, but one of the greatest of all time. Tim Robbins delivers one of the best performances of his career, and was probably deserving of an Oscar nomination, along with Morgan Freeman who had an amazingly powerful performance as well. Overall The Shawshank Redemption is one of my favorite, if not my favorite, movies of all time. It is what I believe to be Frank Darabont's masterpiece.

Comment Head: An Amazing Movie... The Greatest? I'm not too sure
Comment Body: I want to start out by letting everyone know: I read Rita Hayworth and The Shawshank Redemption first, this may change the views I have towards the film (though not by much, but we'll get to that later).Shawshank Redemption is by far the best emotional roller-coaster that I've ever been on. I laughed some, I cried some, and I felt a genuine love for the characters and their struggle. In some ways, I want to say this is the greatest film ever but then I think about it, it's not the greatest film. There is a lot about it that makes it fantastic, some elements have the potential to be "The greatest". Here's the thing though: it's not the greatest movie I've ever seen, I just can't find anything that I dislike about it. This may not make a whole lot of sense, but think of it this way: for a very long time my favorite movie was Pulp Fiction (Tarantino), the raw feeling I got after watching Pulp was so new to me that I couldn't help but stand up and say "That was the greatest movie I've ever seen." Immediately my friend disagreed with me, but Pulp just worked for me. I watched Shawshank with this same friend, and we had a discussion about how we felt about it. I didn't feel the raw emotion that I felt after Pulp, he agreed, but I also told him I thought it was excellent, he agreed. What he told me after that was: "You know, I can see how it's the number 1 movie on IMDb, there's almost nothing to complain about, so there are fewer people who are going to hate it." He was absolutely right, there's just nothing to complain about.Now to the cast: Robbins and Freeman play a fantastic duo, (Freeman was a great choice for Red, even though Red is described as Irish, for real, in the novella) and like always Freeman plays his best. I'm not too acquainted with Robbins, but he did everything right, and he made Andy Dufrense a likable, but mysterious and distant character that Dufrense is. Freeman plays Red fantastically, flat out amazing, the nonchalance and joking nature of Red is captured perfectly by Freeman. The rest of the cast does very well, especially James Whitmore, who plays Brooks, the oldest convict in Shawshank State Prison. His role is one of the few in all of history that's brought me to tears.Seeing how there's no action, there's not much to talk about in the effects department, so I'll move on, straight to the story. I have a theory that Stephen King is not a good writer, at least I don't think so, but he is a fantastic storyteller. Shawshank is no different, the plot unfolds well, few details are missed, and the pace is perfect: not too fast, not too slow. I think a lot of the credit there goes to Darabont though, he did a fantastic job bringing an often under looked Stephen King novella to life, and I have no complaints on his work.In my opinion there's not a whole lot to say regarding this film, it's fantastic, but you have to watch it to understand why. So, pick this one up, I think this a movie with a broad base, which is very hard to dislike, no matter if you turn your mind off and enjoy (it's still followable) or if you like to think about every detail. I highly recommend it.

Comment Head: One man does not allow himself to be held down by fear but relies on hope
Comment Body: I would have to state that The Shawshank Redemption is my all time favorite movie. The cast of characters who were selected for the film fit their roles perfectly along with the plot and music. The Shawshank Redemption is sure to keep your attention. The message of the movie provides hope that will inspire and deeply move the viewer.The story is about a man who is wrongfully accused of a crime and is sentenced to life in prison. It is in prison where he meets an inmate that will eventually become his good friend for the remainder of his time. After suffering under the warden's tyranny for so many years Andy relies on hope to make a daring move. I would definitely recommend this movie to any viewer because it will not disappoint.

The Shawshank Redemption is a movie about two best friends finding hope in their condemned lives. Andy is a banker who was wrongly convicted of killing his wife. His wife was cheating on him and murdered during her affair. Andy befriends Red a fellow inmate. During their time in prison together they become best of friends. They work through their hardships together. Throughout their story this group of inmates lives an unordinary prison life. This is shown from drinking beer while tarring the roof to doing the officers taxes. This is a remarkable story of the ups and downs of prison life and the new people they become. Andy states that in his free life he was a law abiding man, but he had to come to jail to become a criminal. This is commented on when he begins laundering money for the warden. Towards the end the camera shows Andy slumped on the ground leaning up against the prison, which is very neat. This view is from far away up above and gives the feeling of Andy being rather small. This is an amazing angle as it helps show how he is confused about escaping because he will miss his friends. The lighting throughout this movie allows us to see everything appropriately, but helps to set the mood of each scene. This can be seen when Andy is in the movie room about to be attacked the lighting is very dark. This is just one example of the many great lighting choices. This has been my favorite movie for a long time. This movie allows the viewer to look into the men's hearts and minds. Perhaps one of the classic themes to this movie is the narration throughout the movie that is performed by Morgan Freeman. I believe it is clear how great this movie is as it is ranked #1 on IMDb for all time movies. This movie will always be one of the greats, and will withstand the test of time.

Comment Head: a great prison movie and very emotional
Comment Body: I recently saw this film at home and was hooked right into the movie. The Shaw shank Redemption was one of the greatest movies i have ever seen and i am glad they did not make a sequel or it probably would have been a let down. this was very emotional and some scenes are hard to watch such has the raping scenes but also there was a lot of emotion between Andy Dufresne and red becoming friends and trying to live in this prison.it was very realistic in how prison life is hard and what it does to you after so many years. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are great in there roles. the ending where red goes and meets Andy in Mexico on the boat made the movie even better because it does not leave me with a feeling of emotional and sad feeling but emotional and happy feeling of friends meeting up again after a period of time and after going threw so much in prison. this movie was great and i recommend it to every one who likes to watch good films. my rating: 10/10.

Comment Head: One Movie to rule them all
Comment Body: It's no surprise as to why this film tops the list. Morgan Freeman gives the performance of a lifetime and everyone will agree that he was robbed of a lot of awards that he deserved. Frank Darabont took a huge risk in putting a well used and clich√©d idea to the screen and did what no director could ever do. He made the movie better than the book.I first watched the shawshank redemption in 2004 (10 years after it first came out) and remember myself being so intrigued and moved by a movie. I have never felt this much enthusiasm about a film before. It is without a doubt, the best motion picture of all time and if had been released now instead of 1994 I reckon it could have beaten Avatar and The hurt locker at the Oscars.10 out of 10 for the movie, the director and the actors who gave heartbreaking and moving performances, my hat goes off to them.

Comment Head: I saw it out of sheer boredom..but never regretted later
Comment Body: I had seen this movie quite a few years back, but still i vividly remember each and every dialogue,every character,every scene and even the background theme associated with every scene .The very name "shawshank" sends a chill down my spine.I was so deeply moved by the movie that it made my eyes feel watery for almost a week.The haunting soundtrack kept on lingering on mind and my urge to watch the movie resurfaced every now and then.***Spoilers ahead*** It's a poignant tale of an innocent man (banker) wrongfully convicted for committing a crime of passion (killing his wife and her lover).When he is sent to jail (Shawshank prison)for the aforementioned reason,he develops a special bond with a jail mate "Red" ( played by Morgan Freeman) supposedly the only guilty one at Shawshank.During his time in prison he comes across many harsh realities such as the dull eerie life in prison,the atrocities on prisoners and most importantly the real culprit behind the crime (the one who actually killed his wife).To exact his revenge he develops a master plan using his banking knowledge and outwits the jail guards by a surreptitious escape from prison to lead a new life in another part of the world.The movie scores in following aspects Dialogue:Witty , memorable¬Öjust simply great¬Ö..and yeah not to mention the smart,strong and powerful narration by Morgan Freeman.Character formation:Every character carried some background information.Background score:That's the USP of this film..The background theme during the scene where Andy dufresne is brought into the Shawshank prison and the camera rolls high above the prison is just so mesmerizing.Acting: Top notch acting by the lead actors and backed well by the support cast.Story: Powerful,thought-provoking,tear-shedding and most importantly not a clich√©d one.To sum up this movie gives a powerful message of hope and redemption ¬Ö.something we all seek in life.

The movie of a lifetime. I'm not going to compare it with the Forrest Gump or the Godfather series, but this movie stands out saying 'I'm the One!'.Remarkably perfect screenplay, wonderful dialogues and an unmatched cast, this movie takes you to a journey through a life of a prisoner. You never get bored of the movie even for a split-second though the movie goes beyond 2 and a half hours if I remember. You realize what it is to be a prisoner and its horrible after effects and the deferment of human rights there. Perhaps you may have committed a crime, but that surely makes you think twice before you commit a mistake/crime.Unmatchable cinematography and this movie indeed sets a benchmark for the ones to follow!

First, the Shawshank Redemption has been my favorite movie ever since I saw it for the first time a few years after its initial release. I know I have seen it more than 50 times and it never gets old. The film is a heart-wrenching tale of a falsely accused man forced to do a life term in prison due to an ironic twist of fate. Along the way, Andy makes friends amongst his fellow prison mates; as well as some friends in higher places. These friendships greatly influence the plot and outcome of the story. The film has a dark side, too as the brutalities of everyday prison life come to the forefront. Also, the film possesses a lighter side with its portrayal of hope and faith and how those traits can rise out of desperation. This film is a must see, and anyone who watches it will undoubtedly laugh, cry, and wonder as they follow the trials and tribulations of Andy Defresne and his close circle of friends as they experience life behind bars inside the deep, dark, and dank Shawshank Prison.

Comment Head: Without The Shawshank Redemption, which can be called best?!
Comment Body: Without The Shawshank Redemption, which can be called best?! These day, i check in every day in time with my suit, and live a peaceful life. some day, i feel not good, i need refresh my soul, i need bring some light into my heart. so i get The Shawshank Redemption and watch it. It has been 15 years after Frank Darabont made The Shawshank Redemption this greatest movie until now. It says:"the greatest makes every one feel in the same greatest way",The Shawshank Redemption is something like this. When some one got be sentenced to spend his rest entire life in the prison, the more hope he carries, the more dangerous he is. but Andy told Red, hope is good, and goodness never die. so Andy can hold his hope and dig the tunnel to out of Shawshank, when he finally crosses the tunnel, and shout aloud under the rain. the faith of hope breaks every nest.

Comment Head: A fantastic piece of film making that stands the test of time.
Why it's the best movie of all time
