Comment Body: This story takes place in prison but that is not to say it is a prison movie, because The Shawshank Redemption is so much more.In all reality this movie is a story about human nature at it's worst and best. It's about friendship and loss, full of emotion, irony, humor and nostalgia. All wrapped around one hell of a satisfying plot twist and revenge sequence against the story's antagonists you'll probably ever see.The icing on this scrumptious cake is one hell of a divine original scoring from composer Thomas Newman, the man who scored The Green Mile and American Beauty. It is haunting and often very moving. I realize that for many people one small segment of music in even a great film isn't enough to invoke a desire to watch the entire film. However there is a approximately 10 second segment of the score near the end of the film that will break your heart. You'll know which segment I mean if you see this film and if you're the right kind of person with a good soul, it will move you to tears. Somehow the movie manages to pull off an epic feel despite the backdrop being prison bars and walls. You really feel you've gone through the years with the two main characters in the film, by the end you really feel for these characters as if they were your friends. Making the end of their journey in this film affect you strongly. I would call this the best prison movie ever but for the fact that it really isn't a prison movie more than truly magnificent story that happens to take place in prison. This is however one of the best films ever made and I highly recommend it. This movie, especially the last 15 or 20 minutes will stay with you for years to come. It haunts me to this day.

Comment Head: Inspiring and Amazing. This is my favourite film

Comment Body: One of my favorite films, I saw it awhile ago, and this film holds special magic that took away the day I watched it any bad feeling or anything I felt about that day. Story about humankind above all, and friendships, and the power of people believing in you, in a yet real way and not too cheesy way, that leaves you with a great taste in the mouth, and charisma of the two characters is excellent. The plot seemed a little far fetched first, but again, character development and power of human behavior is what makes this film so great. THere's something that strikes you to the emotion, and some simplicity in the film as well, that the moral and theme is, enjoy life, and don't forget those that are dear for you.

This is definitely the best film I have ever seen, Tim Robbins Plays the Best Role Of His Career Portraying A Convicted Murderer In Shawshank Prison, The relationship with him and "Red" grows through the movie, there are many ups and downs through his prison life and he comes through most of them, Tommy gives him hope of finally being free but the idea is foiled after not long. Then a perfect ending follows. Quotes Such as "Get Busy Livin', Or get Busy Dyin'" and "Hope Is A Good Thing, Maybe The Best Of Things, And No Good Thing Ever Dies" more memorable from this movietruly amazing film I would recommend it to anyone, of you haven't seen this you must watch it before you die!!!

Comment Head: One of my own personal favorites

Comment Body: Usually when i watch a film i become analytical of certain aspects (ie acting, direction etc.) but on this occasion I totally became lost in the film, totally gripped by the drama and storyline. It's not often you can become lost in a film lot but this totally draws you in.Probably the best film I have ever seen and a 10 out of 10 is certainly rare by anyones standards. Not often can a film hit such a wide audience like this one can. It is truly versatile in its production.Well casted, the characters are totally believable and at no time can you doubt a reaction or performance.If you haven't seen this yet, you must watch as soon as possible!

I only just viewed this film, which my mum said would be good watch in my revision breaks. And it is! its very hooking in the sense that you cant stop once you begun, but i had to as i did an hour of revising before hand, having 30mins of viewing time. Then i gave up revising when i had enough of this stop start routine and watched it through. And i think its influential to any type of person out there, and if you have time to watch it. As its most probable my "now" favourite film. As i really like horrors and sci-fi's i thought i wouldn't like this. but anything that Stephen King writes or Frank Darabont directs.I recommend this to anyone.

Comment Head: Peace for all n great stories forever..... and they lived happily ever after

Comment Body: #2 out of 250... dnt get me wrong the movie is great, but I cant imagine how this movie is so well liked. sure it has a great story line, plot, and ending. everything a good movie needs. but it is all talk. every part is predictable. i knew right from the beginning that the one new cell mate who told Andy hes innocent was going to be shot and killed. yadayadayada was all i heard for the 2hr 30 min movie. i loved it, but expected a lot more after reading the comments before watching... i don't know why, but i just expected more from this film. i just felt that it culd have gone the extra mile and be deserving of the best film ever made.

Comment Head: This just might be the perfect movie
No words can explain how good this movie is
The Greatest Film to Never Win an Oscar
Comment Body: Far and away, "The Shawshank Redemption" deserved, with every fiber of its being, to win the Best Picture Oscar for 1994. Morgan Freeman, who, until "Million Dollar Baby," had been robbed of an Oscar for films such as "Driving Miss Daisy," had his pinnacle performance for "TSR." Beautifully crafted, totally captivating, and flowing effortlessly with Freeman's narration, "TSR," for all its gray colors, paints an exuberant portrait of life behind bars--the wrongly convicted Andy Dufrane (Tim Robbins) adapts to prison life, all the while calculating an escape that spans three decades. Keeping his friends close, and enemies closer, Dufrane takes a seemingly innocent hobby and turns it into a redemption that takes him to Mexico, with Red (Freeman) serving his time and following suit.If there is a film that speaks more to the believer in all of us, I haven't encountered it yet. It doesn't matter what hour of the evening, or what mood I'm in, if "TSR" is playing...I'm watching, and loving it just as much as the first time around.It's been fourteen years...if you haven't seen it, ask yourself, "What the hell's wrong with me?"

This movie shows a great friendship between main characters Red and Andy. People should strive to gain an understanding and have immense respect for one another. Andy gave hope to Red throughout their friendship. I learned there is a right moment for everything, because Andy planned to escape from the prison when no one had any idea. When the warden was caught saving that money, by filing false claims, he ended up killing himself. This shows that justice seeks to find itself in the end. This movie was shocking, because no one would have thought about how Andy planned his escape. However, if you watched the movie closely you could see hints about how Andy was strategic on his every move,like a chess game is played out.

Comment Head: A beautifully told story of friendship and hope
Comment Body: Andy Dufrunse (a young banker) is convicted for the murder of his wife and her secret lover, and is given a life imprisonment sentence which he will serve back to back. At Shawshank prison, he befriends the prison hustler, Red (who is known for getting things). Andy soon becomes a respected prisoner at Shawshank, he sets up the library, does tax returns for prison Warderns, helps fellow prisoners pass their collage degrees and so forth. His friendship with Red grows stronger. Red and his crew suspect that Andy is about to reach a breakdown... you will also think alike as well - given the set up of the film. But wait a minute, the film delivers a killer twist that will leave your mouth wide open... you will be amazed just how little it takes to break through toughest prison walls. I

Best movie I have ever seen.If you did not see it you don't know what your missing out on. I can't believe I waited this long to watch this movie. But I saw it was going to be on TV tonight so I sat down and watched it. It was time well spent. The acting was excellent (especially Tim Robbins), the storyline was interesting...everything was great. As another reviewer mentioned, the time flies by when you're watching it. When the movie finished, I looked at the clock and was amazed that 3 hours had gone by. A movie about life, about freedom and about friendship. This movie is just perfect.Each time i see it, i learn something else. This movie gives you a different meaning about freedom. Great performances of Morgan Freeman

Comment Head: Tied for my favourite film, a truly moving, inspiring masterpiece

Comment Body: i just love this movie. It is a must see for absolutely everyone. even if you end up hating it you will be better off seeing it than not :) there are reasons why the film should not have worked and reasons why it should, but because of the brilliant cast and excellent directing and adaption of Stephen kings novella this has become one of the best films ever created and is superb in its entirety. i remember watching it for the first time when i was about 15 years old and it had been recorded and i missed the ending of the film, it cut out just after Andy fell out of the sewage pipe in his escape. I couldn't believe it, i had to spend ages trying to attain a copy of the film so i could finish watching it and well it as definitely worth it :) i have given this film a 10/10 and deservedly so. it is inspiring and brilliant

The 'The Shawshank Redemption' is one of the best film ever made!!!Personally i think it is the number one not far away from other great films.What i love on this film is that it shows how people can reach freedom and happiness even when they are desperate. It shows that there is always a hope and anybody can reach his dream if he believes in himself...When i first watched the movie i was very surprised with the happy ending.I almost cried. I also liked the Morgan Freeman's description that makes the story more attractive. Other things i like on the film is that it 'talks' about life's simple and important values such as friendship , partnership , fellow feelings and simple moments of life enjoy.

Comment Head: Amazing! One Of The Best Movies Ever!
Comment Body: This movie was nothing short of amazing. I had watched it a couple years after it came out but I rented it recently and I have watched it over and over. The acting is amazing, the suspense is great and the events in the movie are gut wrenching, tear jerking and sometimes even stomach turning. This movie shows you what some prisons can be like in some places at different points in time. The cast is great, with Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne, an innocent man who is sentenced to 2 back to back 20 year life sentences for "murdering his wife", Morgan Freeman as Ellis Boyd 'Red'Redding, an old man who has done years for a murder he committed when he was a teenager, Andy and Red become good friends in prison, there is also Clancy Brown who plays Captain Byron T. Hadley, a vicious prison guard with no remorse or conscience, and Bob Gunton plays Warden Samuel Norton, a crooked prison warden. I highly recommend this movie to anyone fit to watch a movie so disturbing in scenes. So go out and buy this movie, you don't even have to rent it to see if you like it, trust me, you will. I'd buy it but it isn't exactly an easy one to find here.10/10--Amazing..Highly Recommended

Love it!!! What more can I say?! I love the storyline, the ending - not what I expected. Strong and intense performances from Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. Shawshank is a classic. Captivating and so moving with so little in the way of action. Morgan Freeman putting in brilliantly scripted, brilliantly acted narrative. A film with many emotions which pulls you in from start to finish. Genius Film making of the highest standard with some standout performances. A impressive, engrossing piece of film-making. Very good performances. Simple story but well told. An altogether truly brilliant film. A very watchable, well shot movie.

Comment Head: A Truly Awe Inspiring Film - A Masterpiece
One of the best movies of all times!
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is one of the most well written, played and directed movies of all time. Incredibly humane and realistic, it will keep the viewers interest at top throughout the whole movie without making him tired, will travel him in the same journey with the actors and leave him after the end with a sweet taste in his heart and his mind. "Fear can set you prisoner, Hope can set you free" claims the movie and you will really believe it. This is only one of the many massages the movie is sending. The story is so real that is breathtaking. The acting is excellent from all the actors, even in secondary roles. It is a movie that I enjoy to watch at any time, touching me each time. It is really a classic masterpiece!

this film is possibly one of the greatest all time, anyone who watches and thinks it is bad, they need shooting, love this film and can watch it loads of times and not get bored. upsetting at some points but still amazing. Morgan Freeman's character Red loved, him, he saw things on a different side, and a more realistic side, whereas, Andy saw things as a more fantasising which he always believed could come true. There are points in the film which many would say, i have seen this before or we all know wot is going to happen, but in this film, you never know wot to expect, there are many points which are very unexpected. To end this, my word on it is amazing, i loved the film, and if this is not considered one of the best films of all time then i don't know what could be.

Comment Head: The Magic Of Movie making captured in all it's glory.
Comment Body: I must have seen this movie over twenty times, and every time i watch it feels like the first time i'm watching it. words escape me in describing how good this movie is, and i dare say that "The Godfather" became second on my list because of it. Simply Amazing, simply invigorating, simply a masterpiece. If the 20th century's best piece of art was to be searched for, then search no more. This is the definitive piece of art that movie makers should look up to. The minimum length for a comment is 10 lines, but what more can i put down to describe such a movie. i own four copies of this movie 2 regular edition DVDs and 2 Special Editions. do i need to say more. Do yourself a favor and acquire a copy, you'll be glad you did.

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever!
Comment Body: All the things that could have been said about this movie, have been said. I honestly can't understand why this movie didn't won the Best Picture of '94. Knowing that Forrest Gump is a good movie and Pulp Fiction a great movie. But both can't match the story told in The Shawshank Redemption.Showing similarities to The Green Mile with Tom Hanks, this movie tells a story about hope, dreams and friendships. Furthermore it shows how ex-cons struggle with the new world, once they get out of prison. I'm grateful that Tom Hanks didn't take the role of Andy Dufrense, as he was the first choice for the role. Not that he wouldn't have done a good job, but Tim Robbins belongs to this role. Just as Tom Hanks belongs to the role of Paul Edgecomb in The Green Mile.Every single plot in the movie gets equal attention and could be a movie on its own. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman never played better in any of their movies. The rest of the actors are also very good. The story in this film is simple, but the way it's told makes it perfect. Not many movies can tell such a simple story with such class. Therefore this is one of the best films, but also one of the best stories ever told on film.

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever
Beautiful And Stunning A True Masterpiece Of Cinema
Comment Body: Rarely do movies come along that change a persons perspective on life, but for The Shawshank Redemption this statement is granted. From start to finish a beautiful adaptation of what movies are supposed to be like, displaying humanities most important elements, hope, joy, retribution and redemption, they all come into play and thats what makes it a cut above the rest. Society changes views on certain aspects of life but somehow hope always stays at the forefront, for change, for a better life. To change ones situation and to free the soul of a prison of emotion. Shawshank doesn't have special effects or big blockbuster openings and endings, but it does have one thing that is more deep and special, it has a message that appeals to the good in everyone, that no ones situation is indefinite and that where there's hope, there's life.

Comment Head: The Greatest Movie I've ever seen
Comment Body: I've seen some of the most famous movies of all time Ben-Hur, Lawrence of Arabia, On the Waterfront, Gone with the Wind, etc; But this is my all time favorite movie, Morgan Freeman is unbelievable as Red, same goes for Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne, This is a Movie about a man named Andy Dufresne who is imprisoned for not 1... but 2 life sentences for the murder of his wife and her lover, while in prison he meets a fellow inmate by the name of Ellis Boyd Redding mostly known as Red. And they go through so much together, the ending makes me so happy inside that Andy and Red are able to meet on the outside and live the rest of the lives on the outside.

Comment Head: A good, but not great, film

Comment Body: This is one of the most moving, beautiful movies I've ever seen. You can feel the desperation and the hope. I encourage everyone to see it. The language can be a little graphic, but is probably appropriate for a movie such as this. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are surrounded by outstanding character actors who only enhance their performances. They add something to every scene. My favorite scene is that of "Andy" and "Red" discussing Mexico and the character of Andy sums up the whole movie with the line, "Get busy living or get busy dying". I've always loved this movie and watch it on TV whenever it's showing. I finally bought the 10 years anniversary DVD addition.

What can one say about the Shawshank Redemption that hasn't already been said. I remember when it came out but refused to see it because of the title although I am a big fan of both stars. Besides, I had gotten so burned by critics saying that this movie is a four star or that one only to go and see them and find that the movies mentioned were ordinary or most certainly not the four stars the critics gave them. Even Roger Ebert is guilty of this. So, because of bad information I usually wait for the DVD to come out and that's too bad because I'm denying a good movie some money it could use in it's theatrical release. But so many movies coming out just isn't worth my money. I saw the Shawshank Redemption in rental and turned around and bought a copy. I like prison movies anyway from the TV movie Against the Wall, the story about Attica to the Chicano epic Bound by Honor to the great OZ my all time favorite prison story. The Shawshank Redemption transcends most prison movies because it has heart and is told in such a leisurely fashion that you can absorb it and enjoy the art and superb dialog and the brilliant acting without feeling hurried. Many posters have already commented on this wonderful movie and although I wouldn't say it's the greatest film ever made I do enjoy it and am glad that it's in my library.

Comment Head: No bad one time in life but all the way bad in a bad life
Comment Body: I've watched more than 5 or 6 times I guess and whenever it appears on any TV channel. The characters, everything about them, height, weight, age and even the race or education was set properly and perfect. I'd always get the imagination that I'm watching some footage taken on real time and during the daily life of the people live in a prison. They were so real and the theme was not a fictitious one and may anytime happen to any of us anywhere and we shall fing ourselves in a situation like in this film. The part about himself, the sentence he said about being a crook was wonderful and explained all what about thw film is. This is all what I can say about the film.

Shawshank Redemption is truly an inspirational film--a work of art. What makes this film so special (asside from the excellent acting from both Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins) is the message of hope, even in your darkest hours. Robbins plays a man sent to jail for a crime he did not commit--the murder of his wife and her lover. He is found guilty, and sent to Shawshank Penitentiary. He meets Freeman, who has spent most of his life in Shawshank for a crime he committed when he was a young, dumb kid. Freeman feels that Robbins wouldn't last past his first night in prison. But after being repeatedly sodomized by "the sisters" and manipulated by the warden, Robbins remains resilient and hopeful. He gains Freeman's respect as well as his friendship. The men go through three decades of unhappiness as the pinup on Robbin's wall changes from Rita Hayworth to Marilyn Monroe to Racquel Welsch. Each one hiding a secret that grows bigger, with time. Something that Robbins doesn't even confide in his best friend Freeman.After one final betrayal from the warden, we find out what those posters were hiding...The gateway to Robbins' freedom. I'll spoil no more for you...but recommend you watch this film yourself. It's quite inspiring and uplifting.9/10

Beautiful. Simply Beautiful. The essence of this movie captures u from the beginning to the end. I found myself emotionally attached to the characters in this movie. I don't believe anyone could ever surpass the true, "essence" of The Shawshank Redemption. The game that Morgan Freeman brings to the table can't be surpassed with his calm-demeanor narration and always stunning acting and capturing of the true character of "Red" in the movie. The friendship that Red and Andy make also will capture your heart. The mysterious Andy DuFresne is played beautifully by Tim Robbins. Other characters such as Warden Norton, Brooks Hatlen, Haywood, Byron Hadley, Tommy, and all the others, are also beautifully played by their actors. The story is clearly presented in old-fashioned way that will capture you, like i said, from the BEGINNING.

Comment Head: A True masterpiece and simply the best!
Comment Body: The Best film ever made. A true masterpiece and an epic that will never be beaten. The acting is of the highest standard with some excellent and true quotes, such as "It comes down a simple choice, really. Either get busy living, or get busy dying," and the story line is fantastic with the most amazing end to the film, that leaves you in astonishment. Morgan freeman plays his role to the highest standard and it is definitely his best film in his career. I am a huge film lover, but I have to say i have never seen a film that touched me quite as much as the Shawshank did! If you haven't seen this film, I promise you now, you are missing the best film of all time.

This has got to be my favourite movie of all time. i watched it a few years ago for the first time on a rental copy and HAD to buy it! I've watched it many times since! the cast and crew are superb! I don't think i could imagine anyone else playing any part in this, they all did they're job brilliantly! Film is about a guy who gets wrongly accused of killing his wife in a revenge style attack and gets sent to prison for life. Through-out the time he spent there, he came across enemies, friends and people he could use as an advantage for his plans. In the end, the people that thought they knew Andy realised that they did'not know what he was capable of after all.I recommend this film to anyone.10/10

Back in 1994, 'The Shawshank Redemption' opened to lukewarm reviews and mild economic success, securing less than $30 million at the domestic box office. Though nominated for a very respectable seven Academy Awards, it failed to win any of these, up against the likes of 'Forrest Gump' and 'Pulp Fiction.' Since then, the film has steadily grown in popularity and now stands as one of the most highly-regarded films of the 1990's.Convicted for the brutal murder of his wife and her lover, a crime of which he claims to be innocent, Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins, 'Mystic River,' 2003) is ordered to serve two back-to-back life sentences at Shawshank Prison. Life is hard. The prison guards are brutal and unforgiving, many prisoners are ruthlessly antagonistic towards Andy, and the warden is greedy and corrupt. Nevertheless, Andy forms lifelong friendships with many of his fellow prisoners, most particularly Red (Morgan Freeman, 'Se7en,' 1995), the "man who can get things." Clinging stubbornly to the knowledge of his own innocence, Andy never loses his hope that justice will inevitably prevail. Despite being a story filled with suffering and adversity, 'The Shawshank Redemption' remains one of the most uplifting and inspirational films of all time.

When I read the back of the DVD in the store I thought to myself several times. Why bother this is just another prison movie. But eventually I had no excuses left not to buy this DVD I heard great reviews about it. Yet I still settled myself down for another movie. After watching the movie for 30 minutes I was already starting to wonder why on earth I hadn't bought the DVD of this movie sooner. And the first thing I did when the movie ended. was playing it again. The fact of the matter is that "The Shawshank Redemption" is one of the few movies of the last decade or so that you can actually watch over and over again without getting that feeling of "I already know how it's gonna end".This movie is a must see for everyone and deserves nothing less than a 10 out of 10...

first off, excellent movie. great characters. second, when Andy breaks the sewer pipe during the escape, crap shoots out. That is possible only if the pipe was plugged up and under pressure. Even then the pipe would still be full of crap up to the hole after that loss of pressure. yet the pipe was fully empty when Andy looked in. Also, the only pipe that can drain directly into the river is a rain/storm drain pipe. Crap will come from only the sewer pipe which means that Andy would had have ended up in a septic tank which is what most likely be used in such a rural area. third, how the hell did Andy fit into warden's clothes/shoes???? how did Andy cut out the bible pages so perfectly to fit the rock hammer? how come nobody got visitors? Who is Allen Greene in whose memory this movie of?

Comment Head: "Fear can hold you prisoner, Hope can set you free"
Every second of this movie is spectacular.
Tells a powerful story well, but I wish it allowed more development of supporting characters
Comment Body: I watched "The Shawshank Redemption" last night with my husband, partly to see what the fuss was all about. I found it a well made moving film, but a little too sentimental. Red's character was complex. He was very noble (well, he is played by Morgan Freeman) but he was in prison for being a murderer, and the speech he made to the parole board at the end of the film showed his dilemmas and the darker side of his personality. Andy was complex too as the other prisoners saw. I thought the characters were too clich√©d in the way that the warden and the guards were bad, the prisoners were good, except for a group of prisoners (the Sisters) who were bad. Aside from Andy and Red, the characters fit clearly on one side of the good/bad divide. I would have liked to see more sides of their personalities. The film delivers some surprises by the end: it was wonderful not to have any inkling of Andy's escape, his plans for revenge, or his gift to Red, providing Red with his freedom. The script develops the story skillfully and makes the audience care deeply about the prisoners, not just Andy and Red. I would have liked to know what happened to the prisoners after the corrupt warden and the bullying guards were arrested. "The Shawshank Redemption" tells a powerful story well, but it would have an even more powerful punch if it allowed more time to discover the prisoners' inner natures: the darker tone of the "fishing" scenes at the start really isn't returned to. I loved Banks' pet crow and the nod to "Birdman of Alcatraz". That film was a strong portrait of both the Birdman and the experience of being in a prison. Ultimately, I didn't feel that "The Shawshank Redemption" gives a picture of what it's like to be a prisoner locked away in a corrupt institution for decades. For one thing, I can't see an entire population of a prison reacting to Mozart on the loudspeaker with awe: surely there must have been more prisoners who prefer Hank Williams.

at the first time I saw the movie, I had a high expectation on this movie, due to its position in IMDb.com..then, I watched this movie, expecting what is called one of the best movies ever, and when the credits came up...I was speechless...indeed, this movie looks simple, and sentimental... nevertheless, I have to admit its perfection..in terms of pacing, music, acting, movie length, twist, and ending...I've been comparing this movie to other movies around, still I find this better than those...even the classic ones...I'm still looking for another contender for the best movie ever, but yet, this movie still tops all of them...11 out of 10

Quite simply the best film it has been my pleasure to have watched. When it first came out at the cinema in the mid nineties, it wasn't tremendously successful, however as a regular cinema goer at the time, I was lucky enough to see this magnificent film. As soon as I left the cinema, I promptly recommended this film to everyone I knew. As soon as the video and then the DVD was released, it was purchased immediately and watched and re-watched several times. Even though I know the entire storyline and all the twists etc, I still watch the film whenever it comes on TV. I still watch the DVD at least a couple of times a year, some would call it sad, however it totally deserves the title of 'My Favourite Film'

A very, very good film. Yet it only gets a nine. The ending of Andy sanding the boat is too cheesy. Red setting off into the distance on the bus was enough. Definitely one to watch multiple times though. Now go down to your nearest retailer and buy a copy now !!! Now go down to your nearest retailer and buy a copy now !!! Now go down to your nearest retailer and buy a copy now !!! Trust me, you'll be glad you did. I am so glad film four is free now in the UK. Another film i'm looking forward to is Trainspotting. A most excellent film. The best film to have come out of the UK in years. Running out of stuff to say. Just had to voice my depression at the ending... so there ya go .

Stephen King rocks! Not only can he terrify us with his stories of the macabre, BUT he can also dazzle us and bring us to tears with his dramas, such as the Green Mile, Stand by Me (The Body), Hearts in Atlantis, Dolores Claiborne and YES...THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION! This movie is my favorite because the ending (last 25 minutes) just keeps getting better and better and by the last few minutes you think it's going to end and you want more to happen to make it the best happy ending possible and it IS. It keeps going until all characters get their comeuppances, good or bad! This is a movie about HOPE. As King entitled this part of the novel Different Seasons "Hope Springs Eternal"! A++++++++++

Comment Head: Prison Life in the 40's and 50's was a story of survival.
Comment Body: Shawshank Redemption is one of the most insightful and thought provoking movies I have seen. With the character "Red's" narration, it comes across a little like a documentary because of the details of prison life presented. But we are being told a story in such a way as to keep us interested enough to hear the outcome.I view the character, Andy (at least later in the movie) as an undetected mouse in a board meeting or fly on the wall who observes more than the average person. Red describes him as wearing some kind of cloak that shields him from the effects of the prison. This is revealed as hope later on. Andy somehow refuses to allow his hope to be crushed or snuffed out.He accomplishes so much during his incarceration, much of it due to his undaunted perseverance and redirected energy. It is brilliant and insanely brave when he asks the guard if he trusts his wife. Pushed to the brink of destruction, he barely gets the words out to the effect that the guard can keep all of the inheritance if he gifts it to his wife.The story reminds me of the Biblical Joseph in an Egyptian prison, a documented instance of undeserved confinement.The spoiler that I have for those already initiated is: Andy places his own copy of the Bible in the warden's safe the evening of his planned escape. The warden is mocked when he reads his own quote to Andy inside the cover and the hollow for the pick-ax is revealed. I wonder if Andy's routine included locking up the warden's Bible, or was this a one time sting for the warden's sake?

I loved the plot in this movie. Throughout this movie i felt like i was Andy. I wasn't watching Andy, i was Andy. And Morgan freeman was my best friend. This only says that the acting was superb. This movie is always on TV and though i don't think i have watched the whole thing one time through, i have seen all of it in different parts at least 30 times, and each time i long that i haven't seen the movie from start to finish. So i recommend all to buy it, as its something i need to go out and do myself. Mordan Freeman is one of the greatest actors of all time and after seeing this movie, you will believe so. This movie is defiantly in my top 5 list. The only movies i would say have better acting is the first to god fathers.

In all honesty, this was one of the biggest surprises I'd seen in the movies in a long time. This is also one of the few movies that I can safely say that the majority of well minded individuals will find entertaining. But now, into the actual content of the film. For starters, the opening sequence with the imperial walkers is not only one of my favorite cinema memories; it's also a staple point in the advancement of sci-fi films. Though the love story may have seemed a bit trite to some, I found it tasteful and appropriate. Once again, I was blown away with the final light saber sequence and though I won't spoil it, let's just say that a very important character drops one spicy meatball.

One of the best movies I have ever seen, well acted, directed, everything was perfect. . the movie is about a escape from jail. but it was totally different from other movies like "the great escape" "escape from Alcartaz" . the shaw shank redemption is a different movie in a sense that, its not only about a escape. its classic, emotionally inspiring,its about a hope("Fear can hold you prisoner. Hope can set you free". .then The twist that makes you worth watching it all along and leaves you with tremendous wonder. It's a good thing though, even for those of you who is too dumb to watch character driven drama and prefer mindless action movies. Tim Robbins and Morgen freeman were great. fine performances without the use of a lot of violence or graphic violence to get attention.

Comment Head: How do you know a movie is one of the greatest?
Comment Body: Since "The Shawshank Redemption" was released in 1994, it has been played on various cable channels (TNT, TBS, etc) approximately 130,842 times. You know what: it keeps getting better and better. If the cable networks developed a Shawshank channel, it would consistently receive higher cable ratings than any other channel (even if they played the pan and scan version, instead of the widescreen). The movie is that good.Every element of the film is near perfect. I have watched the movie in its entirety at least 10 times and I get something new from it each time. Watch this movie. I repeat. WATCH THIS MOVIE.

Comment Head: The Greatest Film of All Time.
Comment Body: I wrote my first review of this movie back in 2006. I feel I did not do it the justice it deserved.I grew up in Mansfield, OH, not very far at all from the Ohio State Reformatory. The old "castle Dracula" Administration building is all that is left now. A new prison (Mansfield Correctional Institution) was built on the site where the other buildings existed along OH-13. I remember the impending demolition just waiting for this movie to finish filming......Thank God it waited! The story begins in 1946 when Portland banker Andy Dufresne is tried for and wrongfully convicted of the double murder of his wife and her "lover".Andy arrives at Shawshank state prison in early 1947 and is greeted harshly by ruthless authority and by thugs who seem to enjoy beating him up. Andy keeps strong and keeps very much to himself for the first two years.Andy finally decides he needs a hobby to keep his mind occupied. He approaches the well known prison entrepenour, "Red", and asks if Red might smuggle something into the prison for him... This kick starts the relationship between Red and Andy that the movie centers its attention on.There is a gentle tug of war between the two regarding ideals. Red, guilty of murder and sentenced to life with parole, sees no hope in existence outside of the prison walls. He tries, throughout the film, to convey to Andy that "hope can drive a man insane" and its best to just accept your fate. Opposites must attract because Andy was Red's polar opposite and it began to catch Red's attention. Andy would confront the police guard to ask for beers for his friends. He'd play music over the Shawshank PA system from the Warden's office. He'd write the state once or twice a week for years and years to get funds for a new library. Andy Dufresne dared to dream and he turned the negativity of Shawshank on its head...and just may have changed Red's view on things.The villain in the movie is Warden Norton. The Warden notices Andy's skills and intelligence early on and took full advantage. He entices Andy to be sort of an "administrative assistant". He started out in doing tax returns for the guards, which he was very good at. In time, the Warden enticed him to use his banking skills to mastermind a money laundering scheme that would make the Warden "a millionaire when he retires". Andy had to "go to prison to be a crook". This kept his mind occupied.About 2/3 the way through the film, a young kid is admitted to Shawshank who knows who killed Andy's wife 19 years before. Andy is ecstatic and he takes the news to the Warden. At risk of the money laundering scandel being brought to light, the Warden ensures Andy he's not leaving Shawshank. Andy gets two months in the hole. The young kid gets shot.Andy, the beacon of hope for this movie, decides HE WILL get out. And HE WILL get his freedom.We go back to Andy's first meeting with Red 19 years before the escape...the little chess piece chiseling 6" rock hammer that he asked for... He'd been chipping away at the concrete wall in his room for 19 years and NOBODY SAW IT COMING.Andy busts out of that stinkin place, crawls through a 500 yard sanitary line and "comes out clean on the other side". Andy is gone and is free like a bird.Red, with his inspirational friend gone, does begin to lose that hope that Andy almost convinced him of. Life at the prison begins to suck. Red, after 40 years, gets paroled. He has no idea how to adapt on the outside. He might just commit suicide.Only one thing stops him...a promise he made to Andy... Determined, Red puts on his hat and suit, clamps his travel case shut. Give busy livin, or get busy dyin...thats god damn right. He bolts town and meets up with Andy on the beach in Mexico. Red, once a young crook, now redeemed old man.

This is a fantastic film and deserved the countless awards that it was given during the 1990's! The film is visually astounding with a fantastic cast of legendary actors. Films that have twists are always impressive and Frank Darabont does this film justice by creating an original and at times, very moving screenplay. I would suggest that anyone watches this film as it takes its audience on a roller-coaster of emotions from pity towards Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) at the start of this movie when he is convicted of murdering his wife, to the moving performance by James Whitmore as Brooks Hatlen, the lonely and 'institutionalised' old prisoner. The ending made me cry and made me want to go and visit the 'big hayfield up near Buxton'!! I must have watched this film hundreds of times and I still get nervous when Warden Samuel Norton (Bob Gunton) goes into Andy Dufresne's cell and realises something astounding about the prisoner...

Comment Head: Without a doubt, one of the greatest ever
One of the best movies ever made
Comment Body: If you can't watch a movie which doesn't contain any explosions, wild car chases or corrupt cops, then this movie probably isn't for you. However, if you enjoy a good story with great acting and execution, then you really should look into "The Shawshank Redemption".So why is the movie so good? The movie as a whole is simply breath-taking. In addition to the exceptional story, everything is "just right". I've seen loads of movies with good stories, but most of them seem to fail in other aspects (poor acting, poor camera-work and such) making the movie as a whole not live up to its potential. "The Shawshank Redemption" is NOT one of them. It actually manages to pull it off, resulting in what I deem to be one of the best movies ever made. I give it a 10/10, without any hesitation.

Comment Head: If you haven't watched it, i am begging you to...
Comment Body: I thought i've watched some really great movies in my life. The ironic thing is, every time i watch a movie that is great, i'll miss much of it because the TV is busy advertising some rubbish prime time movie like charlies angels.Shawshank redemption is not a good movie, it's a GREAT movie. Thankfully, i got the DVD and finally watched it from start to finish. I've never watched a show that made me feel like watching over and over and over again like it has. The way the director captures human emotion, makes this one hell of a great prison movie.The movie is great at the start, but none better when it comes closer to the end. Believe me, there will be a point your jaw will just hang open in amazement. I love this movie, if you've not watched it, please do so...

Some individuals get bored with the beginning of the movie because of the slow pace, but one has to remember this isn't about action its about drama and a well told story, and the ending makes me smile every time. The well chosen dialog in the start shows the viewer this is not about your normal prison movie or any sorta of manner that could be included in that genre, but instead has well thought out banter. The cinematography is nothing new to any of us but thats not so important as the story and the way the angles show what need to be shown. Simplely put its a beautiful story, well written by King and is shot and made very worth peoples while. My mother watched it for the very first time a few weeks ago, before always complaining that it was boring and she could never get into it, now she sings it praise.

Comment Head: "Fear can hold you prisoner, hope can set you free"
Comment Body: "Fear can hold you prisoner, hope can set you free." What a great tag line. It makes you think of how good your life is when you get to be free.It is hard for me to put my feelings into words because "The Shawshank Redemption" is one of that kind of movies that makes you think. The movie has been very educating for me."The Shawshank Redemption" is not an ordinary prison-movie. It is an epic story about friendship. I almost start to weep when I think of Red (outstanding Morgan Freeman) and Andy's (excellent Tim Robbins) strong relationship! In the film Tim Robbins' character, banker Andy Dufresne is being accused to have murdered his wife and his lover while they were having an intimate moment. The jury finds the defendant guilty as charged and Andy is sent to the infamous Shawshank prison which was known for its cruel punishments for misbehaving. While being a new meet in prison Andy is being harassed by the Sisters, inmates who want to taste some of that fresh meet. Everything happens on Red's point of view. Red is the guy who can get almost anything you want by smuggling stuff in. He is a provider who will someday give Andy the key; Rita Hayworth.The film is full of injustice but even if you are locked up you can find your soul-mates. Also after being imprisoned for a long time it will grow on you. It becomes your home. But not for Andy. He knows he's innocent. Maybe the Shawshank isn't so hard to crack..."The Shawshank Redemption" is based on a short story by no other than king of horror Stephen King. I have found his prison-movies to be very very good because, well, the pictures about his stories have always been little downbeat. Maybe because of the supernatural side, I guess. I have this short story on my bookshelf and it's almost as same as the movie. The only thing's that different in the short story is that Red was a ginger-haired, white Irishman. Freeman's Red is also Irish but we all know the difference. It doesn't make any difference, really.The lesson of this movie is to never give up hope. Life can sure kick you but kick back. Be smarter than life."I hope I can get across the border. I hope to see my friend, and shake his hand. I hope that the Pasific is as blue as it has been in my dreams. I hope." -Red

Comment Head: Fear can hold you Prisoner, Hope can set you Free
Comment Body: I doubt anyone can argue, that this Movie is the greatest one ever made. If there is no better movie ever made I will not be disappointed. More about that later though, one of the movie's strongest aspects, the acting.Before watching this movie I had never heard of Tim Robbins, and after was left wondering why, the way he developed the character of Andrew Dufresne was incredible, why he hasn't been in many, many more big productions.But the real star in this Movie was Morgan Freeman,maybe it was because he's Irish, his role as Red the 'The man who knows how to get things' was incredible. A convicted murderer, and the only guilty man in shawshank really was what made the movie, amongst other things, so good. He would have to be the best narrator EVER!! he makes you feel as though when he speaks, you're him watching the events unfold as they happen from his perspective.The other co-stars all put in great performances, notabley Bob Gunton as the Warden, William Sadler as Heywood a fellow inmate and James Whitmore as Brooks. Clancy Brown did a great job of making you hate his character Captain Hadley, at some parts you just wanted reach through the screen and kill him yourself. And Mark Rolsten as Boggs the gay prisoner, made you shudder.But the highlight of the acting was on the on screen chemistry between Tim Robbins and Morgn Freeman the best male lead duo that I have ever seen, the way they inspire each other and the conversations they share add another dimension to the movie.The plot is good, with the ending coming as a complete surprise to me, probably because i was expecting something a little different to what I had expected, which is what makes this movie brilliant. Frank Darabout has done a great job as Director as he has shown us again later in the Green Mile. I cant believe this film did not perform in the Cinemas or did not win any awards. Words cannot possibley describe in detail just how good this movie is, go and see it for yourself, but be prepared for some real, prison violence. And remember, a good thing never dies.

Comment Head: Excellent: an inspiring tale of hope and redemption
Get busy living, or get busy dying...

Comment Body: This movie is by far the best movie i've seen in my life, i'm only 18 mind, but still, excellent, i would recommend that anyone who hasn't seen it watch it. The actors really play convincing parts, even the minor roles are played out well. I really can't say a bad thing about this movie. I wouldn't want to spoil the movie for someone who hasn't seen it. All i can say is watch it!! this movie should not in anyway be turned down because "it is just a prison movie" this movie is much more than this...It is really cheep as well, if you want to buy it in HMV i bought it from there for ¬£1.99 which i thought was an absolute bargain!! go buy it for yourself now if you haven't got it!!

Comment Head: A must see for any serious Movie Lover
Comment Body: One of my favorite all time movies!I've watched it at least 12 times and enjoy it as much each time I see it. One of the best adaptations and truest to the original Stephen King stories that I have seen. The other being "The Green Mile". The combination of musical score with the well written and delivered lines of Morgan Freemans narration still can well the tears up in my eyes. His narration and acting in this film surely should have garnered him an Academy Award! He's an American Icon in my book. Superbly written, superbly directly, superbly filmed, and superbly acted. You'll never be disappointed to have this DVD in your collection.

Comment Head: One of the best of all time
Comment Body: I have seen this movie at least a dozen times and I will probably watch it a dozen more. It is a feel good movie with excellent acting. I am a huge Tim Robbins fan and Morgan Freeman does a superb job as "the man who can get things". The majority of the supporting cast were just as good. The storyline is honest and fun. I believe most people will enjoy what this film has to offer. If you think you might be turned off because this is a prison movie please reconsider. I doubt that once you've seen the movie you will consider it a clich√© prison flick. Most movies today are entirely too predictable. This movie is guaranteed to surprise and excite as the plot and ending unfold.

If this movie isn't a masterpiece, then nothing is. The story and the actors feel very real and they just charm you from the very beginning. You can feel all the emotions that appear in the movie, when something is unfair you just want to break an expensive object and when something good happens you sit there, smiling like a little sun. Tim Robbins is excellent for the part of Andy Dufresne and Morgan Freeman couldn't have been a better choice for the speaker and the role itself.Even though the movie is full of surprises it allows you to figure out a few things yourself every now and then. But in the long run it consists of many unbelievable twists and turns and there's just not one boring second. I'm not surprised about the rating either, this movie just deserves to be as high up on all lists as a movie possibly can be. If you haven't seen it, you know what I want you to do next.

Comment Head: Potentially one of the finest movies of all time

Comment Body: The only movie I've ever rated a '10', Reference Standard.Regardless of my own interpretation of this art, I say "Greatest Masterpiece Ever Filmed." with confidence based on the numbers and insightful comments posted by other viewers. Indeed, it is only a matter of time before this movie surpasses 'The Godfather' as being rated as the 'Top All-Time' movie on the top movie website.With that said, there is nothing I can add to the hundreds of comments posted before me. Everything about this piece from the rich story and character development to the symphonic climax should be studied by anyone interested in film. You simply must view this movie--and view it with a critical eye--as a reference standard of quality story telling.

Comment Head: The Longest Film I've Ever Seen

Comment Body: An emotional story of how nothing can break the human spirit. A truly deeply effective story about the relationship between a new prisoner and a cynical lifer. Morgan Freeman's performance is one of the best in cinema history. And Tim Robbin's portrayal of a wrongly convicted man is played to a tee. This is one of the most perfect casts ever to be set in a movie. Every actor in the movie plays their part perfectly. This movie is undeniably powerful of how prison can take your life, your freedom but there is one one thing they can't get to, that they can't touch, hope. If you only see one movie for the rest of your life make it this one. You will not be disappointed.

Comment Head: Hope springs eternal, it truly sets you free in this movie
Without a doubt one of the best movies of all time

Comment Body: If I watch a film and I am unable to look away for one second, to me that means the film is simply brilliant. I could not turn away from the screen when i was watching The Shawshank Redemption and it is a film that you must see. It contains a powerful message and is a very strong film. From start to finish you get right into it and is a tear jerking film in some aspect. The acting is great and Morgan Freeman is as perfect as ever. The reason why I love this film is because the message is powerful and teaches you something important which not many films do. The plot is that a man is wrongly accused of murder and is sent to Shawshank Prison. His dream is then to break out and along the way encounters some heartbreaking moments but fails to fall and continues to fight on.

There is a scene early in the movie when the viewer is introduced for the first time to Shawshank prison. The camera takes us on an extraordinary panorama, beginning at ground level and rising up until we see the inmates crowding around like ants. It must have been shot with a sky-crane or something because there is no break in continuity. The view just goes on, up and around in a breathtaking cycle. The effect is reminiscent of the 360 degree battlefield panorama of Rod Stieger's Napoleon in 'Waterloo'. It is almost arrogant, except that it's wonderful. From this point on, I knew I was about to watch something very, very special.The film depicts the institutional brutality that sadly continues to be the hallmark or imprisonment, and how one comes to terms with it, or not. We quickly discover what happens to those who don't. Some hysterical white-collar inmate cracks-up and is beaten to death on his first night. It is a monstrous example of the ironically named 'correctional facility' at work.Morgan Freeman is another actor as remarkable for his voice as his other abilities. He is perfectly chosen as narrator.For almost 2 hours we endure the gloomy, threatening claustrophobia that makes up much of prison time, and what inmates do to gain some little respect and make life endurable. In this regard it has a lot in common with 'Midnight Express'. Except that here we are dealing with an innocent man.Music scores are perfectly chosen. The sound effects equally well matched. The viewer is taken upon a journey so complete and plausible - assisted by strong acting and excellent script - that when the extremely unlikely escape is discovered, we are left believing that too.The idea that a thunderstorm should fortuitously arrive at the very hour of need to mask the sounds of hammering, and that it would be possible to find sufficient air in the enclosed sewer-pipe, both stretch our credence a little.My favourite moment features the abscondment-on-parole of Red, who goes in search of a certain Field with a certain tree. After so long steeped in the dank, evil reek of prison one can almost smell the scents of summer, the mown hay. All is silent except for the whir of insects and distant birdsong as soft sunlight filters down through trees. The contrast is perfect, the ambiance tangible. These are surely the things to savour most when freed from permanent brutality.This, and the movie 'Fried Greeen Tomatoes' seem to perfectly counterpoint each other. They are both of equal quality and address parallels of endurance and relationships from male or female perspectives. I love 'em both as much.I'm told that each bombed at the box-office. Not enough pyrotechnics and CGI effects I guess.If you haven't seen either of them; get busy. But watch them on a decent telly with a quality independent sound-system.

'The Shawshank Redemption' is a prison film and a good film about characters. The film is about a man who is put into prison for murdering his wife, a crime that he did not commit. He ends up helping the prison guards out, and some complicated issues arise. The film is about characters, loyalty, revenge, and freedom. This film is one of its kind; it is almost spiritual as it touches on many different aspects of life. The story is thoroughly engaging as are the characters, and the different situations that the characters are in keep the viewer guessing and hungry for more. This film is a rare gem that lives up to its expectations.

Comment Head: If you haven't seen this film watch it now. Forget about work or exams or what ever, watch it.

Comment Body: This movie touched me, but I'm finding it hard to review.It is the story of a man who, after being convicted to life in prison for the murder of his wife and her lover, still manages to find hope and a reason to live. We see him first come to grips with the way his life is, then we see him begin to see how he could change it for the better.It is full of memorable characters who each have something to share with us if we are willing to listen. It will make you angry when an injustice is revealed, it will make you smile at a small bit of good fortune and even the hardest hearted person would have a hard time not shedding a tear during certain scenes.Redemtion is possible and may be right around the corner!

Comment Head: What a great way to spend two hours on your backside
Comment Body: WOW what a great way to spend two hours on your backside - This is one of the greatest films ever made. I love all of it, Tim Robbins acting fighting the skinheads, teaching the inmates, helping with the guards finances, and digging the tunnel a wonderfully written part and a self crafted bit genius from Morgan Freeman made this film sparkle! GREAT FILM! please watch it... I think the prison warden looks like Graham 'turinp' Taylor the ex England Soccer Manager! funny - I love the shoes joke at the end very good. It did remind me a little of other films when Morgan Freeman leaves prison. But Tim on his boat at the very end is a smile raiser!

Comment Head: A wrongfully accused banker goes through the trials of prison life while trying to hold the hope of living free again.
Comment Body: This movie does an excellent job of portraying all characters in this movie and showing how each individual deals with the fact/probability that they might never see life outside of prison walls, while also showing how certain inmates manage to handle freedom once being let out of prison. A truly inspirational movie showing the strength of hope and willpower while not being too extremely over the top and using an ending to make all viewers feel good about how everything resolves itself and lets viewers have the entire story come full circle with a true sense of irony at the very end. An awesome film that is well directed with an excellent "mood" surrounding the entire movie. The acting keeps right up with and for the most part exceeds the directing.

Comment Head: A Truly Captivating, Uplifting and Important Masterpiece
Comment Body: Captivating, Uplififting and Important are three adjectives most appropriate for this picture. Captivating as this film did literally hold me captive under Morgan Freeman's spellbinding narration in addition to his sublime acting from Freeman, Tim Robbins and the supporting cast. Uplifting as this film truly made hope spring eternal and has done for film-lovers across the globe. Finally this picture is important as there are many people in this world who have given up hope, are denigrated and dejected and may even feel that there life has no purpose but this film has renewed life to many people. It tells the story of Andy Dufresne(Robbins) who is convicted of murdering his wife and sent to Shawshank Prison for life and forms an unlikely friendship and bond with Red(Freeman) and his gang, who initially reject him, that's all I'll prefer to tell you of the film to maximise it's impact.

Perhaps the most perfect film ever made. Words simply cannot express how much I love it. The dialogue is wonderful on the ear, the soundtrack actually story enhancing, the cinematography expansive, the direction sublime, and the actors - simply perfection. All of the characters in this film were endlessly interesting, textured and rich. I think everyone in this cast deserved an award. This film continues to haunt me (in the very best way). I watch this film several times a year, and never cease to be amazed by all of the performances. This film should be placed in a time capsule as an example of excellence in film for the end of the last century. Have I gushed enough for everyone?

i think this film is a superb film because it's really heart warming and tearful. Also the film is good because it tells you what prisons were like in 1947 the scene i like the most is the end because the way he broke out of prison with the hammer and stone and when he escaped through a tunnel of filth. it was good because he kept it secret by covering the hole with the poster.When the warden walks in and looks at the bible and the hammer shape is in the book at it says salvation will set you free. The scene where brooks hung him self because he didn't like the outside world. It was also sad when tommy got shot because he knew who killed the bankers wife and lover.

Excellent movie! I've seen it for several times but I can't stop watching it. It's memorable! The actors play is magnificent! Hope is what we need most! Redemption is just a word like every other word. In a corrupt system, hope never dies. Andy is not only just a smart guy. He takes advantage of the whole corrupt system. There were and there will always exist innocent people in jail. How you can prove your innocence is a matter of common sense which is not evenly distributed. Hope is always needed as long as corruption never end. When hope dies, everything else dies slowly. And in the end a question: what would one like Andy do not in 1966, but in 2006. Could he still get into prison, could he still escape, could he still take financial advantage over the system? I hope he could!

The Shawskank Redemption is a movie of immense talent, looking into the deepest feelings of prison, and surviving it. It all starts when Andy Dufresne, a successful banker and a geologist hopeful, (Tim Collins) is wrongly accused of his wife's and her lover's murder, sent to prison, and makes new relationships and learns to deal with prison, along the way meeting someone in particular, Ellis Boyd 'Red' Redding (Morgan Freeman). Ends hopefully, not with that much of a cliffhanger but still much room for good to happen, not too much for bad, and definitely one of my all-time favorite movies. A good look at the troubles, realities, and heartbreaks of prison. Good quotes on hope.

I voted a 10 (excellent). WOOOOOOO!!!!!!! It was intense, sad, dramatic, funny, and heartwarming all at the same time. I love history, so this story brought what i knew to life. It led me to question many things about life's trials and tribulations and the strength it takes to overcome any struggle. Morgan Freeman is one of my favorite actors and his narration of the film is truly special. His role of Red is one that demonstrates true character adaptation to real life scenarios and experiences. It is one that will be remembered for a lifetime. Tim Robbins takes the reality of prison life and demonstrates a new side to life in there, one that is different from many others. His heart and soul change over the course of the film, and it it truly exciting to see this adaptation. I LOVED it, and so should you.

Comment Head: Simply the most wonderful, moving film ever made
Comment Body: A simple, but fantastic story.This adaptation of Stephen King's novel is one of the few exceptions to the rule that the book is always better than the film. The book, whilst brilliant, does not really reveal the warmth between the two leads, played by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.It is simply a wonderful story, with fantastic, understated performances by the two leads in particular, but also by the whole supporting cast.The Shawshank Redemption is beautifully filmed and directed, this is the perfect movie all round. It is criminal that it did not win the best film Oscar.

Comment Head: Powerful interaction between soundtrack and dialog
Comment Body: A big part of this film's appeal is the interplay between Thomas Newman's soundtrack and the simple yet profound dialog. The CD score stands up as a great work on its own. It alternates between brooding piano and powerful orchestration, with a few oldies added for context.Three scenes, named by corresponding tracks, are especially poignant. The first is "Brooks Was Here," followed by "Zihuatanejo" and "So Was Red" (that title carries over from the Brooks track). To me, the third is among the most moving sequences in film history. You can't top Morgan Freeman saying "Get busy livin'..." as the inspiring music plays in the background.

I was forced to give this movie a rating of 10. Because this movie is a lesson on how life itself is, it deserves much more.The last comment poster asked who the reader's "Andy" was. I ask that poster who his "Red" is :). A little cheeky, but an important question, because Andy always needs Red to survive and make meaning of what is around them, of what is their life. Andy is a viewer in some respects, picking up and learning and teaching in a nonchalant manner.I also believe, perhaps, Andy and Red often exist in the one and same person.

Shawshank Redemption along with Casablanca, Citizen Kane, Star Wars, Goodfellas, and the Godfather are worth every amount you spend. Even though this movie isn't at all like the Stephen King novel "Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption", this movie has done some amazing changes with comparisons to the novel and ultimately, I thought the film was better than the novel itself. I was blown away by the storyline, especially when Morgan Freeman was narrating. However, it was a disappointment that the film never won any of seven academy award nominations. If you are looking for a film to watch: one that has an amazing script you hardly see in today's films, one that has some great actors, and one that shows a strong bonding of friendship... this is the one to see! I give this film a 10 out of 10 because it was worthwhile watching and was worth every penny I spent on the 10th anniversary DVD.

It's my personal favorite. A man discovers himself after he is sentenced to life in prison, and can escape and move to Zihuatanejo, his greatest dream. It's something that represents the human condition of looking for what you want, but quiet few can achieve their goals as Andy Dufresne did with patience and courage.The rhythm of the movie is slow and subtle, as a fairy tale but with the harshness of reality.You can watch it over and over again and keep enjoying the ride...it's a classic and classics prevail!

No other movie has portrayed the resolve of the human spirit as well, or as classy as The Shawshank Redemption. Emotional and brutal, this movie shows us what hope can really do for a man. It has men connecting in a strong straight way. What better place then a prison to forge the friendships that will last a lifetime. Steven King, for a horror writer, writes some of the human dramas out there. I can't believe this is not the number one movie. The Godfather was good yes, but it falls short of this film. If you haven't seen this movie, what the hell is wrong with you? Go buy it you will not be sorry, and if you are, there is something wrong with you.

a perfect movie, no flaws. anyone who appreciates film will enjoy this movie. Twists, excitement, and wisdom are all displayed in this movie and it is the best movie i have ever seen. it is impossible to seriously give this movie a 1. it deserves at least a 9. A movie like this deserves to be number one of all time. freeman is outstanding while Robbins has a breakout roll. no flaws in acting, no flaws in story line. king has done it again! a marvel movie that will keep you glued to your seat for the entire time. 2 hours of pure excitement. i can not even begin to imagine a movie that is better then this, INCREDIBLE!!

Comment Head: They don't get much better than this

Comment Body: Time flies when having fun is the least you can say about this movie. One of the few movies that let's me forget all about time and reminds me that you don't need CGI and a quazillion of dollars to make a great movie!!! I got a similar feeling when watching "The Green Mile". It probably has something to do with the balance of the movie (I'm no expert but it has to be something like that). It has the perfect balance between all kinds of feelings/emotions without trying to pull you to one side of the "emotionscale". Don't think that this gives you a dull movie!Just get it, sit back and enjoy!!!

This is one of those movies that you have to watch when you find it on TV even though you've watched it 10 times. Great acting. Great storyline. GREAT MOVIE. This movie is almost perfect. I seen it a dozen of times and it keeps getting better. Best movie ever. Why? Because the satisfaction you get in the end! You know how he did it and you can almost feel how he must have felt! This movie is pure glory. This movie is the best description of the word hope. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are both great actors and they have some kind of chemistry. And the one thing this movie is so great is that you don't want it to end. You know it is going to end but you want it to go on and on and on. But unfortunately, every beginning has also an end. That is from another movie which we all know and was by the way very disappointing

Shawshank Redemption is the most perfect movie I've ever seen, right from flawless acting and razor-sharp screenplay to an amazing background score. A lot of thought has gone into every scene and every scene flows smoothly into the next with no abrupt transitions. Though Andy Dufresne is the central character of the movie, the characters of Brookes and Red are also vital to the theme of the Shawshank Redemption. Scenes of brutal violence in the prison have the intended effect on the audience without being too gory.One of the few movies that have driven home the power of hope so effectively, this is one movie that will lift your spirits in times of gloom.

Aftet watching this movie once, it was in my Top 20, after watching it twice it was in My Top 10, and after watching it multiple times, it's going to take a hell of a good movie took knock it off my #1 movie of all time.Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbin's in easily both of their greatest performances of all time, make this one movie that will hands down go as the best movie of all time without an Oscar. The first hour or so is moving beyond a shadow of a doubt, but the last two will draw you to tears and inspire you beyond words.Watch it, watch it and watch it again!!!

Comment Head: Quite Possibly the Best Movie Ever Made
Comment Body: It's hard to imagine that maybe the most uplifting film of all time is set inside the walls of a prison but that is the case in The Shawshank Redemption. The film is about friendship, loyalty, and patience which may not seem like the most intriguing elements until you have seen them brought together in this film. Opening with the incarceration of Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) for two life terms for the brutal killing of his wife and her lover the film seems to be heading into dark territory. Instead what we get is an examination of the triumph of human spirit. Shawshank Prison is the meanest prison around, or so says Ellis"Red"Redding(Morgan Freeman) in an early narration. This is where Red and Andy first meet and where the development of one of the most rewarding screen friendships begins. Tim Robbins who plays Andy gives his best performance. He carries himself in a manner unimaginable considering his predicament. His patience and strength are a marvel. Morgan Freeman turns in the performance of his career as Red who narrates the film as well as provide the realism that Andy has suppressed back. Andy is a patient man who walks the yard of Shawshank like he doesn't have a care in the world. The film's success lies in the relationship between Andy and Red. Their friendship carries them through the struggles of the prison term and us through the film. One of the most memorable endings in film history comes from their life long bond. I am being vague on details because I do not want to spoil the film for anyone who has not seen it. As far as I am concerned it is something that you should do immediately. The Shawshank Redemption does so much well. But above all it is a story of hope. The ability to persevere through any situation is the hallmark of this remarkable film.

The best films are those which you just watch not knowing anything about it...not hearing any publicity...no mad movie premier parties just a tape in the video player, watching it with my granddad. I had just left school and film was a passion of mine. I loved watching and making them. I always loved the way films immersed you in and didn't let you go until the credits. This is the absolute prime example of that. Great story, acting, characters and a twisting slam-dunk of an ending. All my favourite films have that quality, seven, six sense and the game. Its just a shame that over the past few years there hasn't been any films which i can honestly add to that list. So come on Hollywood give us proper gutrenching twists not big grizzly apes!!!!

I'm just wondering or if we get told in some way if the letter that Andy had sent to the newspaper from the bank had any information about his innocents in the murders of his wife and her lover. This is because Capatin Hadley was arrested outside the prison and the only way that I could see this happen is if Andy had sent some information in that letter to the paper.I'm also just wondering if Norton had any sort of information about Andy's innocents. I haven't read the book "Rita Heyworth and the Shawshank Redemption" which is roughly based on the movie. It would be nice if I could get a reply from someone who has an answer too one of these questions.

I remember the first time I watched this movie. I was only 10 and i had turned on the TV to watch and i saw this movie called the Shoshana redemption and i thought what a interesting name. But the movie wouldn't have been excellent without the awesome casting of Tim Robbins(Andy), Morgan Freeman (Red), Bob Gunton (Warden Norton), James Handy (Brooks) and Clancy Brown (Captain Byron Hadley). The movie conveys lots of mixed messages but the most important to me is that even though we can be in dark and scary places there can always be light. Only fault that as the years went by, Morgan Freeman didn't look his age. Other then that it was a good movie with a good message that you keep watching over and over again.

Comment Head: Inspiring wonderful and Should be seen many times
Comment Body: I love this movie for many reasons. The acting doesn't get any better. One gets easily pulled into the stories and characters with no hesitation. When a story can effortlessly make you care about the situations and troubles it presents, it deserves praise. This movie may not have a revolutionary plot, but it it still everything a good movie should be. One may think the ending is too "touchy feely" but i think it adds to the overall appeal ,remember it's not called the "Shawshank Damnation". See it and enjoy and remember, it's OK to to cry over happy things too!Final Analysis: I will watch this movie many more times before I die

Wow!..thats basically what I have to say. The beginning is amazing, all the trauma is amazing...and what an ending...after I saw this movie I was at piece and just wanted to open a nice cold beer. Definitely one of the best, if not the best, movie I have ever seen. Before I saw this movie I watched the Godfather, which I also found amazing and well before that I had my mind set that Pulp Fiction was amongst the best movies I have seen. Without a doubt it is an excellent movie, but this movie just blew me away. If you haven't seen it, I really recommend that you do. I wont let out anything about the movie, because id hate to spoil such a movie for you guys. But one recommendation I give, is watch and relax while it blows you away. Genius! Well thats all I have to say, peace.

Comment Head: Great Movie ... the kind of movie to buy for repeat viewing
Comment Body: This movie is about hope. Sort of like "Here comes the sun" by the Beatles. However, unlike George Harrison's sweet melody this film has a dark grit that makes it palatable and relevant to the life of any struggling person. Andy Dufresne is an innocent man convicted to life in the awful Shawshank prison. He perseveres and, in the end, he is saved though what is meant by saved you will have to see by watching the movie. The Shawshank prison is a powerful metaphor for human struggles and limitations. And, in the end, what can any of us do besides persevering in good works? Andy Dufresne shows that this perseverance has value and ultimately triumphs over despair.

Comment Head: two of the best actors of all time give the performance of their careers
Comment Body: pair two of the best actors of our time (Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman) with one of the best writers of ALL time (Steven King) and what do you expect? one of the greatest pieces of film of all time...my only complaint is the length of the film, but for what you get, it is well worth it...one of the most moving, powerful films i've ever seen, Tim Robbins gives the performance of his career, and Morgan freeman is near his best from beginning to end, i never lost interest in "shawshank redemption", and there was never a time i didn't care what was happening to any character...although it is very constrained in environment, it gives the viewer the sense of freedom and independence among the inmates, despite their confinement by far one of the most emotional and moving films i've ever seen, i've rarely felt so deep for the characters in a movie

Comment Head: Makes absolutely no sense, when you think about it

Comment Body: I've seen this movie about 7 times now and every time i still get the shivers that i had the first time watching it.This movie is absolute my nr.1 movie by far and is not just a film but also leaves a vision on life and to appreciate a good friendship in the deepest meaning. The quotes given in the film are typical and makes you think of how you should live your life. It made me think about stuff.the movie touched me in such a way that i thought of certain attributes in life suddenly more beautiful.If i ever need to be reminded or have a wake up call, i play the shawshank redemption. I was later on surprised that it was written by Stephen King, a guy that is most known for his work on thrillers/horrors.

Comment Head: Get busy living or get busy dying
