Comment Body: This is by far the most underrated movie ever made. The movie itself is just so well done that I don't ever get tired of seeing it. I found out about it 2 years after it came out and since then it's made an impression on me that affects me even to this day. The movie is brilliance and it's done so well that it upsets me to know that it didn't do as well as it should have in the box office. But it's a similar thing that paralleled The Wizard of Oz and Gone with The Wind in 1939 it did it again in 1994 with The Shawshank Redemption and Forrest Gump. This movie though as whole is one of the best films put together that shows morale code, fear and hope. It shows what can be taken from us, from freedom or someone (Tommy getting killed) from any situation that was put together but hope stays with us and cant be beaten or stolen from us unless we let it and this movie shows us that in an honest way that isn't exaggerated. To me I'll never get tired of seeing this movie nor get tired of what it means. Hope.

Comment Head: I thanked my DVD shop owner
Comment Body: Must see, please do not read the reviews on this movie until you have seen it, you would repent your decision if you came to know the story.So much detailed, full of suspense - yet nobody could guess what (the hell) was going on! The poster, small hammer (or whatever), the book keeping - and above all the HOPE - I am so much impressed by this film. It never looked like a movie of such a fantastic end. Well, one could guess that Andy (Tim) might not have murdered his wife, but it was difficult to imagine the depth in story. I am inclined to read the novel now. Would you believe, this movie was recommended by the DVD shop owner, who I thought was interested only in the hit (read well-known) movies.

Comment Head: A movie that changed my life

Comment Body: I bought this film just due to its high score on IMDb. I was not disappointed. My comment to my wife after seeing this, was "nothing actually happened, but I could still not take my eyes from the screen". This movie works like emotional magic to a guy who normally swears to action, horror and FX movies. Hats off to the actors, the script writer and the director.And no hats off to the IMDb people who make me write 10 lines. I don't care if I'm banned from writing more reviews by adding these final meaningless lines. I've used IMDb since it was born, and this is the first time I've actually felt like telling the world a movie is worth watching. It's probably also the last time, so just ban me from commenting further.

Comment Head: The best movie I have ever seen
Comment Body: I like this movie for the following reasons. first its screen play is perfect. The hero acted in a correct fashion. He lived the character. Through out the movie he displays a balanced mind. I like the movie because it talks about hope and how hope will bring happiness. I always used to think about it when ever I lose hope in doing some work or in solving my own problems. The two characters Hero and his friend were shown of opposite in nature. Hero always talks about hope and his friend talks opposite to hope. This makes me feel what really life will be without hope and with hope. One more thing It teaches is It does not matter where we are but what we do.

After watching this movie, you come to think about how important and valuable your freedom really is.I think everyone should watch this movie. The story is very well shown and played, the actors were amazing and I didn't see any failure except that eventually, the end goes by really fast, but maybe it's better like this, when the happy things aren't described, your imagination can make the most wonderful story out of it.On the not so good series, I'd point the captain of the guards, who seemed to have some good feelings at some moments of the movie, and who ended killing the young guy in such a pitiful and disappointing way. Also the director of Shawshank died without getting what he should have receive for being such a bastard, which was quite unfair.But well, the worst punishment you could get, is not physical, nor material, it's when you discover you ruined your life, and lost your time.I gave this movie a 9, because nobody and nothing is perfect.I can guarantee that you won't regret watching this, even if it takes away 2 hours of your free time, this movie could make you realize how to spend the remaining ones of your life in the most clever way.GO FREEDOM ! :-)

We were supposed to read The Shawshank Redemption book for English class, at first my classmates (also myself) thought that this would be a boring story. We were wrong. The book is incredible, stephen king is a genius, but moreover, the movie was brilliant, never before in my life I've seen such movie with an excellent plot, excellent actors and an excellent direction, this is by far one of the greatest movies of all time (along with a clockwork orange), I'm just a fan of it, here in Chile we don't get to see many books by this author but what the hell, a great book and a excellent movie, should be considered the greatest movie of all time :D

I had originally owned this film on VHS. It grew on me to where I was watching it nearly once a week. The tape had gotten so bad that I could no longer enjoy the film. i have replaced my VHS tape with the 10th year anniversary two-disc special edition and i have really enjoyed the many extras made available. The commentaries from Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman and others contribute so much more that i would recommend to the first time viewer, if there are any, to view these bonus tracks prior to the movie. The extras sell the film all over again. I continue to watch this film a couple of times a month. The film lifts my spirits and jump starts my soul. Thank you Frank Darabont. oh, and Stephen King for a great experience with this film which has become one of my all time favorites...

Comment Head: Watch this movie. Then watch it again
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is without a doubt my favourite film of all time. Ranked 2 in the top 250 films it is clear others agree with me. And when you watch this you will too. The plot may sound familiar (guy goes to jail, guy escapes jail) but this is nothing like i have seen before. It's about Andy Dufresnes (Tim Robbins) determination and persistence which keeps him going through his 19 years. But the film is also about Ellis Boyd Redding (Morgan Freeman) commonly known as "Red". He does not claim innocence and is the only guilty man in Shawkshank. When Dufresne arrives Red makes a bet he'd be first to crack. But Andy stays strong which surprises Red. He uses this strength to keep going day after day and he passes this feeling onto Red when he tells him of a box planted under the tree. This gives Red some hope, It gives him something to look forward to and that will keep him going day by day. Without Andy Red would have nothing in life. And when you have nothing in life like Brooks did... There is nothing to keep you going onto the next day. This film is brilliantly scripted. The acting is top class and you get the feel of the innocent man amongst the guilty. The corrupt guards and wardens add to Andys story of wrong convictions and unfairly treated. He just happens to be the only innocent man in Shawshank.

The performance by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins in this movie is so incredible realistic that you are really ought to believe this story is true, as said in the end. Not just a 'one-to-watch', the best movie ever, which, in my honest opinion, beats the godfather with ease! I cannot tell anything about the movie, because I'll mess up the story for the ones that haven't seen the movie yet, but believe me, the twist in the end of the movie, it's just fascinating... The whole person of Dufresne is fascinating, the calmth in his whole appearance, the way he's living his life in jail, in one word fascinating. The same thing goes for Morgan Freeman though, it is just incredible, wonderful, fascinating... Just... Just watch it. You'll love it.

Comment Head: Hope, thy name is Shawshank Redemption
Comment Body: If there is one word which entails the entire message of this film, it is HOPE. Though I have never been a Stephen King fan, this is one story which makes him deserve accolades over and over again. When I was watching the movie, halfway through it, I admit I was bored. And when Tommy (Gil Bellows) was shot, I was like "Who the hell recommended me this movie??". But still I just wanted to get this movie over with, so I watched further. And when that scene comes where the warden throws a pebble at the poster and it tears right through!!! My God!!! My mouth was agape the whole time!!! What a fantastic ending!. The movie indeed has the best finale in cinematic history.(The Usual Suspects comes a close second..). Performances were superb.. (..I still think Tim Robbins deserved a nomination more than Morgan Freeman..). The wardens were damn good as the tormentors. But overall, I believe the story itself deserves a special place in the annals of great cinema!!!

Brilliance. Total Brilliance. From the perfectly casted roles, to the haunting music; the all-encompassing narrative provided by Morgan Freeman, to the magnificent storyline and plot, this movie blends all these elements of good film-making. So much so, that even something as commonly overlooked as having just enough comedy to provide relief from total somberness, but not enough to distract from the misery of prison life brought by the equally criminal actions of those in authority at the prison; this, too, was executed with perfection. This movie is the blueprint for what I would consider to be the perfect movie. I challenge anyone to come up with something they would "do better" than what those who made this movie did.

Comment Head: Great but still a little over rated
Comment Body: I'd be lying to you if I told you that when Andy brakes out of his cell and crawls to freedom, I wasn't just as happy as the masses of people that call this their all time favorite move. And to say that I wasn't riveted when he is locked i the office and turns up the music while being threatened by the guards would also be untrue. But at the same time, this movie is most certainly not the second best film ever because of one simple reason: It can't decide if it wants to be real with occasional hints of hope or imaginative and dreamy. It drags you along for two hours of hard depressing facts and victory only in the most modest portions, then, for whatever reason, has a Hollywood ending of him digging through the wall then picking up the bank account that there's no way in hell that he'd be able to get in real life. This is great entertainment and I give it a ton of credit for having the ability to maintain my attention the whole time. But at the same time, the ending proved a little disappointing because it betrayed everything that this movie was trying to be.

Comment Head: Get a hope and keep it.
who is responsible for the death of the old man

Comment Body: This film is one of those you would like to keep and watch over and over. Not a typical jailbird flick. Rather a story about struggle and overcoming and greatness. A happy end in this one feels true and believable although it wasn't necessary.Another interesting thing is that none of the characters in it is made to be hated. No classical "bad guys". Everybody here serves a certain purpose to the story, thus directing the fate of protagonists.I couldn't believe it was Steven King who wrote this. I generally don't like his stories, but that should obviously go for his sci-fi novels only. They all start well but finish ridiculously. However, it turns out that the man also penned "the Green Mile", another story that became a film that left a true impression. Gotta stop berating Steven King.

*Possible SpoilerI was fifteen years old at the time this film was released, and it instantly became one of my favorite films after the first time I watched it. Part of the film was shot 10 minutes from where I grew up at the Wyandot County Court House in Upper Sandusky, Ohio. A classmate of mine's father was a juror in the opening scenes of the film. The rest of the film was shot about 45 minutes from my home in Mansfield, Ohio at the historic Mansfield Reformatory. Every year, the famous prison has haunted tours and sleepovers during the Halloween season, and is open for historic tours during other parts of the year. There are many websites devoted to this site. Being a fairly rural area of the state, it is quite an honor to have lived near the filming of one of the best films of all time. As I have grown into an adult, I have grown to appreciate the artistic value of the film even more. Morgan Freeman delivers his best performance (all of his are great though). "Red" is the epitome of a man who just wants to be part of life. Although confined inside walls, he can function normally by doing things to make others happy, in turn making himself happy. He is much like any working man that lives on the outside. Andy (Tim Robbins) just amazes you with his selflessness. He sacrificed his own well-being for others many times during his stay at the Shawshank. It took him a longtime, but his desire to live eventually freed him. The film left me surprised many times. But once you have got to know Andy, nothing he does will surprise you. He's the guy you knew back in the day that had all the luck. (We've all known guys or girls like that). This film is 10 out of 10. It has moments of suspense, mystery, action, surprise, drama, sadness, and even a little comedy if you know where to look for it.

Comment Head: Best movie ever. Why? Because the satisfaction you get in the end!
Comment Body: This movie is almost perfect. I seen it a dozen of times and it keeps getting better. Best movie ever. Why? Because the satisfaction you get in the end! You know how he did it and you can almost feel how he must have felt! This movie is pure glory. This movie is the best description of the word hope. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are both great actors and they have some kind of chemistry. And the one thing this movie is so great is that you don't want it to end. You know it is going to end but you want it to go on and on and on. But unfortunately, every beginning has also an end. That is from another movie which we all know and was by the way very disappointing.

Comment Head: Sometimes movies grab you and let go after you are done watching it. This one keeps on holding.

Comment Body: Sci-Fi, Heroic fantasy are good stories and can make good films? But how can we compare movies that make you enjoy cinema and a movie that adds dimensions such as thinking a long time after the show, and that makes you behave differently?Human relationships, hope, will, friendship are eternal themes... If you want to watch a movie that will move you, watch this movie. If you want to entertain, go and watch LOTR, Star Wars.Classify movies depending on your personnality, your moods, your own tastes, is good. To my mind this film is really great and i'm not surprised at all if it is nowadays ranked in 2nd place.

Comment Head: hope is a good thing maybe the best of things and no good thing ever dies
Comment Body: The great words spoken by Andy to Red. Never give up. Shawshank is a movie based on a book by Stephen King. When I tell people this it is hard for them to believe. This is the best adaptation of a King story that he has not written the screenplay for. Even though some of the characters in the movie don't fit the descriptions from the story they work.The movie shows the life of a prisoner convicted of a crime that he says he did not commit and the great friendship he develops with Red and the daily problems a prisoner faces. This is a great story and I never get tired of watching it. I have seen it 30 times and it gets better every time.Get busy living or get busy dying.

Comment Head: You can't know the impact of this film by watching it...
Best movie experience i've ever had
Robust, majestic film-making makes Shawshank an all-timer
A great movie made of a good novel by Stephen King.
Comment Body: This is one of the best drama movies I've ever seen. It seems that Stephen King's jail novels are always a success movies, as The Green mile was even better than this. Homewer, these two movies are so different they really can't be compared.Tim Robbins plays one of his best (if not the best of all) roles and I could not imagine anyone else to this role. The story is stunning and this time, the movie is actually better than the book.When you start to watch this film, you can't stop, until the film ends. That describes how interesting and addictive this movie is. I recommend this to anyone, except to the most eager action fans.

I made my Stephen King debut with this particular story when I was in my late teens. Frank Darabont shot a wonderful adaptation which is not very common. Great actor Tim Robbins played the unfortunate Dufresne with such a grace that you never think that the guy was very small in size in the original story. Morgan Freeman is in his prime playing Red, the most useful person in the jail. The suicide of the old prisoner and the last scene where both friends meet are the most emotional ones. And of course we should salute the most beautiful supporting actress ever, Rita Hayworth. Darabont never tries to steal parts from the original story. May be this is why the film is always remembered as a good piece of art.

Rather than just enjoy movies, critics like to play "The Greatest Film" game.  A few years back, it was rare that a contemporary film was picked as greatest.  "Citizen Kane," "Le Grand Illusion," "The Gold Rush" and other pre-1950 films usually got the nod well into the 1980's.Then, for some reason, most likely the Internet opening up a voice for the average person to rate film, contemporary films started getting in. "Schindler's List" was one that comes to mind.  "Shawshank Redemption" is another.While picking the same old, stale films year after year doesn't seem to be logical, picking newer ones has a certain risk.  Many films amaze and beguile audiences when they come out because they are geared to what currently sells.  As years passed, the flaws become apparent and they drop out of sight, while timeless films initially received lukewarmly, or even critically, such as "The Wizard of Oz," "The General," or "Intolerance" soar.  Will "The Shawshank Redemption" drop into obscurity, too?  I don't think so. Why?  One can try to explain.Two possible reasons are Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.  I don't know if either are underrated actors or not, but I rarely hear people remark how completely they transform themselves from role to role.  This is certainly the case here. The two performances, and the chemistry between the two men is the core of the film and reinforces one of its primary messages: never let anyone make you lose hope.  The fact the setting, prison, is alien to most filmgoer's experience, doesn't matter.  "Shawshank" could never be considered a "prison" film.  It contains a story as archetypal as "The Odyssey," a long journey, through many dangers, that ends with the traveler (this time, two travelers) seen to a safe shore (literally!).Another great strength of "Shawshank" is how it operates on different levels.  Like Jon Avnet's "Fried Green Tomatoes," it has its most obvious message--about not losing hope and surviving--set highest.  But as "Tomatoes" had a gay subtext that could be acknowledged or ignored, so does "Shawshank," that prison is a dehumanizing experience that ends up ruining people for life rather than just letting them pay their debts to society and move on.Given this country's conservative bent, it is somewhat bizarre that a film that carries this message is so adored.  All I can say is the other aspects of the film allow one to ignore it and still enjoy it, which is probably fitting since films where the message is the most important thing, such as those of the '50's and '60's, now show their age badly. In the final analysis, though, regardless of what elements we pick at, we ultimately can't say why "Shawshank" is so great.  We just know it is by how we feel and how others feel.Two final examples of the latter.    The moment in Andy's escape when he stands in the sewage lagoon outside the prison and holds his arms up in jubilation as the rain pours on him is always a part of trailers and coming attractions.  Indeed it was part one of the film's original ads.  Why should the filmmakers give away the ending?  Because there is nothing to give away.  One can see the film 100 times knowing Andy will escape and still want to see it, because it isn't about an escape plot.  It's about Andy and Red's journey and what they teach each other.The second example is that the Lifetime Channel, which generally shows either classic "Chick Flicks" like "Thelma and Louise," or made for TV things about unfaithful or homicidal husbands, showed this as their feature presentation one evening and this is a film that really has no women in it at all.Of course, one can argue a "Chick Flick" is really just a film that values exploration of deep human feelings and relationships more than car chases and explosions.  If that is the case, then "Shawshank" is the greatest Chick Flick of them all.And I think the Greatest Film Game never fit more than here.

Comment Head: One of the best acted films I have seen

Comment Body: I think this movie is clearly a 10. To call it the second best movie of all time might be a bit over the top. However, it is impressive that it has got almost 120.000 votes. Anyway, I thought it was really interesting. Tim Robbins is a very good actor and so is Morgan Freeman. Anyway, there is one thing that annoys me, and that is the focus on what one might call "transgression". I mean the warden and sadistic prison guards - all this is a bit too far out I think and works to the movies disadvantage. The love of transgression is always followed by some kind of sentimental prejudice. However, that does not damage the movie as a whole. It's really an amazing story which keeps you guessing till the end.

This masterpiece has taught me the meaning of the word hope. The ending was far better than winning the lottery or even accomplishing your dreams.Superb acting by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, a job beautifully executed.When my little girl is old enough to understand the concepts of life, hope and dreams I will be sure to watch this movie beside her, God permit.If you have not seen this movie, I highly recommend you do so. I will do my best to remember the words of wisdom and caring actions demonstrated by the character Andy. If we all did, we would all live in a better world.10/10

I never intended to ever watch this movie. A girlfriend of mine told me "you'll love it." And after I finished watching it I was stunned. No movie other than "The Accidental Tourist" has had such an influence on my life. This movie is about hope and it shows you that it can never be lost. It also shows you that the weakest looking people may actually be the strongest. The thing about Shawshank Redemption is even if you hate dramas you'll appreciate this movie nevertheless. This movie stopped me from being an action genre junkie and turned me into a connoisseur of great movies. Even though there is no science-fiction in this movie you'll still feel that its magical. However, the first time you view it will be the best. Go see it.......it'll make your day brighter!

This movie is the greatest source of inspiration within my life. I mean the line that says, "Hope is a good thing; maybe even the best of things and no good thing ever dies." That line just brings hope (haha) to my daily life. The acting in this movie is sensational. Ever since I saw this movie I have reached a whole new level of appreciation and respect for Tim Robbins. Morgan Freeman is awe inspiring. Some people don't appreciate this type of movie and disrespect the meaning of the film. It is seen to others as a modern portrayal of the crucifixion and resurrection of Jesus. This movie is spectacular and any one who doesn't like it or hasn't seen it is insane.

The ending of this movie might be the most rewarding ending I've ever seen, from a movie-goers point of view. Not only is Andy an innocent man, it seems he suffers more than all the guilty men around him. After he climbs out of the sewer and tastes freedom after decades of unjust imprisonment, his passion for his newly found freedom is almost palpable from the theatre seat or my home sofa (wherever I'm watching it). I challenge you to find a movie with a better ending. Questions: Is Andy raped by the "sisters" or no? I thought Morgan Freeman's voice-over was kind of unclear on this point. Number two. What are the odds that the tin box that contains the money and note wouldn't be all rusted out?

The first time I saw this movie, I went in with a negative attitude. It looked drab and boring. No explosions, no special effects, no stunts, no females... no chance it would be good, right. Wrong! The on-screen duo of Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman should be the envy of any actors that ever have to share a set with other actors. The supporting cast was remarkable, and the storyline is second to none. I'm glad I sucked it up that first time, because without that first time watching "The Shawshank Redemption", I would have never been able to watch it the twenty times that I have. Will go down as one of the best movies in the history of cinema, and will get no argument from me!

Comment Head: A film I keep returning to
Comment Body: Despite all of it's flaws, it is a good film. A film I can watch over and over. It sticks, it holds, it is like great mascara and hairspray rolled into one big great mess. Andy is like me. Red is like me. Brooks....I like a lot about it. It's spellbounding. A picture worth a thousand words breathtaking. Living inside it, not imagining anything else. It is a wonderful amazing piece of rubbish.I'd like to thank Darabont, the screenwriter and the director, for finding a heart in a story to give to the masses. We love you too.Give it up for Mr. Andy Dufresne!

Best Scene : Red's last parole speech  "rehabilitated? it's just a made up word, a politicians word so young fellas like yourself can wear a suit and tie and have a job"Another great comment is when Red says of Andy that he "had a walk and a talk about him that wasn't normal" like "a man out for a stroll in the park"I can understand why this movie is listed at #2 of 250 on the IMDB user rating.Is there any doubt that Freeman is one of the best actors in history.oh yeah, personal best movie ever... BETTER OFF DEAD

Comment Head: Excellent acting, great suspense; pity about worn-down motifs
Comment Body: This is a very thrilling movie that kept me spellbound. The acting is first rate. Morgan Freeman is superb and so is Tim Robbins. The reason why in my opinion it only deserves 8 out of 10 rather than 9 is that the story is not that great. Anyone who has seen his or her share of prison films will have come across all the standard ingredients: brutality by the staff, abuse by fellow prisoners, corruption at the top, we have seen it all before (cf. for example Brubaker). Despite these reservations, the acting, music and direction makes up for it. An evening well spent!

If your like me and have bought the limited edition DVD then you should of seen it.  I thought it was pretty good but gave the same insight to the film that I've always had.  I mean it was interesting because I love the film so much but I wanted more of an opinion from producers and directors. Anyway what do you think?

Amazing that a movie with this much misery can be about hope. Great performances throughout. Thomas Newman does a fantastic job with the soundtrack here as he does on American Beauty and Road to Perdition. Also he took cousin Randy's role in Finding Nemo.

1 VERY MINOR SPOILER INCLUDED.I will openly admit that the whole reason I watched this movie is because it is ranked number 2 on the IMDb top 250. I will further admit that, yes, the movie is great. But #2 of all time? Mmmmm... no. There aren't particularly any flaws with the film, aside from the fact that it spans a 20 year period and nobody seems to age at all. The performances are stellar and it desrves to be lauded as a great film. If you haven't seen it, see it, you will be glad you did. I was.

I've seen the film almost a dozen times. I am fascinated. The most important thing in the film is the intelligence which allows Andy to survive, to build his own world, to separate him from the surroundings. Unfortunately, J feel it is impossible in the real world.

Comment Head: Most dramas wish they could be this
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is right up there with my favourite movies. Its probably the best deep story example of a movie that I like.The film is a touching tale of the dehumanizing effects of a life in prison, a modern version of which can be seen on HBO's Oz. I digress, the first time I saw this movie, I was actually touched by the story.I began to feel crappy for Andy, I understood Red's bitterness, disgusted when Andy crawled out the crap pipe. The movie tells a very very powerfully depressing story, but to keep the watcher from getting mad has an amazingly uplifting ending, that makes the story seem worth it.Amazing, enough said.

This is one of King's best movies. It's about a guy who is accused of killing his wife and is sent to prison. He meets a man named Red in prison who he sort of inspires to do more with his life. Near the end something happens that you would never expect and is very interesting. This is a great movie and the director did a great job in showing Stephen King's book and not wrecking it.

IF for any reason your feeling unhappy and despair, this is the movie that will surly change and improve your mood.THE movie is truly remarkable, from total despair, sadness and no hope, which appears from every element in the movie, characters, sound, walls, closed doors, injustices ...AT the end (possible spoiler) came light, warmth, love, hope, peace and mostly the unmatchable feeling  freedom and of the free spiritWHAT an outstanding movie.

Comment Head: A Hymn to the Determination and Belief of Man
Comment Body: A hymn to the determination and belief of man, 'Shawshank Redemption' truly deserves its place as the second best film made in the IMDB poll.How on Earth we all missed this one when it was at the cinema is truly baffling; but it has now gained the worldwide recognition it so richly deserves.Robbins is absolutely superb as Andy Dufresne and actually surpasses Freeman's performance (about the only actor to do this) as 'Red'. It's pointless describing the story, suffice to say that it stands head and shoulders above all other movies as a testament to the endurance and power of the human spirit, that almost no matter what situation we find ourselves in, we can endure and prevail. Incredible, thought-provoking and a cornerstone of modern day storytelling.

Why talk so much about this movie when the movie already speaks for itself as one of the best film of all time. The movie is too good to be explain by me; you have to see it for yourself.Exceptional.Max- 9.5/10

This ranks as one of my all time favourite movies. There is so much to love about this movie, the characters, Morgan Freeman's narration and the story. The movie runs for quite a while, but it hardly seems so. A definite must own movie.

Hey there, I must tell you I just saw the movie and it's been out like eight years or so ...Great movie even now in the 21st century. I'm sure it'll still be great many years from now, such as "Gone with the wind"- another classic. I'll sure be seeing it again and then some. I'm not gonna spoil it because I'm sure by now you've seen it or if not someone has already given you or you've read the synopsis. However, just trust me in my words, " Don't rent the movie, BUY IT! It's that Good!!!!" Well, take care and look no further this is the last advice you need  :-) go see it, your "hopes" will come true!...

The best movie ever made. Perfect acting, direction, script, music etc. It was seriously robbed at the Oscars in the worse Academy Award mistake of recent years.There is no film better. That's all there is to say.

Comment Head: If I could only watch one movie for the rest of eternity, this would be the one!
Comment Body: Just watch the movie.  I don't care what kind of movies you might typically be a fan of because this one carries true meaning.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are at their best.  If you are ever feeling down, then pop this in the player because it helps.  I just love this movie.  I only hope I can look forward to a movie in the future that will touch me the way this one has!See it!  I promise you won't regret it.

Comment Head: Excellent from all aspects, script, performances, and photography
Comment Body: This film has the best of what films are supposed to be. This not your everyday prison movie. This a story of friendship and hope. The story and the resulting script are riveting. You are gathered into the story and become engrossed with the progress of the action and the character development.   The performances are superior at both the star and supporting levels. Morgan Freeman is superb as is James Whitmore. The filming is so good that you forget you are watching a movie and practically believe you are viewing the real thing. One of the top ten.

People say that Shawshank is a fairy tale, or that it doesn't represent real prison life.  I say, fine, ok, you're right -- but that doesn't stop me from finding it one of the most beautiful films I have seen. I've watched lots of movies, old and new.  None have left me feeling as breathless and vaguely intoxicated as Shawshank.  Not a one.  Casablanca, Citizen Kane, Rashamon, etc... great movies all, without doubt.  But Shawshank still sits on top of my canon. Call me shallow.  Call me unsophisticated and easily manipulated by saccharine cinematic swill.  Whatever.  That's the last thing on my mind when I watch the camera pull back as Red and Andy embrace on that beach in Mexico.  I'm thinking about the power and redemptive value of a true friendship.  And Shawshank is, in this reviewer's opinion, the single most evocative and powerful portrayal of that sort of friendship ever committed to celluloid. I dare you to watch it without a tear in your eye.

This film is a film which is moving, dramatic and emotional. It has characters being introduced all throughout the film and makes the film never ending, like Andy's sentence. Freeman and Robbins are both talented actors and bring to the film their own qualities, you never get tired of seeing them. I first saw 'The Green Mile' before i saw this and thought that Frank Darabont made the most moving film ever, but i was wrong. 'The Shawshank Redemption' has scenes of laughter, sad and shear disgust, this is what makes it so powerful. This film is number one in my DVD collection and never get tired of watching it. I honestly recommend it to anyone who likes a late night movie full of emotion.

In every way shape and form, through and through, the greatest movie ever. This doesn't mean my favorite.  This means the art direction the music the story the acting the lighting the ect ect ect were flawless.  Total package of perfection.

Too bad about Tim Robbins' politics, because this is one of the best movies ever made. I never get tired of it. Plot is tightly woven and everything fits together. I particularly enjoy Morgan Freeman, but there are no weak players. This movie deserves to be at the top of the list.

Comment Head: Not as Good with repeated viewings..
Morgan Freeman's performance is truly great!
Comment Body: This film is definitely in my top 10 of all time list.  It is a powerful story and probably the best movie about friendship ever made.  But hands down the one element that makes it a great movie is Morgan Freeman's performance.  I've seen this movie a dozen times or more, and his narration never fails to hook me.

Comment Head: One of the best Stephen King adaptations ever!
Comment Body: I absolutely loved the origional novella "Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption" by Stephen King on which the movie is based, and the movie perfectly reproduced the emotional response i had from the novella. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman were definitely the best choices to play the two leads. I thought that Robbins in particular deserved an academy award for his portrayal of Andy Dufresne. If you havn't seen this movie yet, rent it right now! You will not be disapointed.
This show was great. In my opinion it is the best show that Tim Robbins is in, Morgan Freeman's best show as well (besides Se7en). But still a great film.10/10

Comment Head: If you like `The Green Mile' you will love this movie.
Comment Body: This is one of my favorite movies and the very first movie I ever bought on DVD. Because I am a fan of Stephen King, I had to see this movie. The movie is based on a short story from King's book "Different Seasons" (Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption). The story is about a banker (Tim Robbins) who is found guilty of killing his wife and her lover. He is sent to prison and develops a friendship with several of the inmates. However, the main focus is on Andy's close relationship with Red (Morgan Freeman) who has been in prison most of his adult life. I don't want to give up too much for those who haven't seen it. (I'll leave that up to the other posters). If you like `The Green Mile' (another Darabont movie from a Stephen King book) you will love this movie.

Comment Head: A story that proves "hope is a good thing, but faith is better."
Comment Body: Not the best movie of the decade, but damn close. Shawshank made Tim Robbins a star, and rightfully so. His cool, steady depiction of a condemned man is magnificent. His character Andy's refusal to voluntarily be changed by not only the betrayal of his wife, being wrongly accused of her murder, but also the harrowing experiences of prison life is palpable to say the least. It doesn't hurt to have one of the 5 best actors of our era, Morgan Freeman, as your supporting man. The friendship between the two makes this story not only believable, but also thought provoking and inspirational. The Shawshank Redemption is truely one of the all time greats.

Comment Head: Terrific drama with great unpredictable ending

Comment Body: Shawshank Redemption would be on any's top ten films of 90s. Very emotionally powerful and inspiring, the movie was on par with the much hyped movie Forrest Gump if not better. It was a prison tale that should be lots of despair, misery and violence yet Shawshank manage to portray the sad as well as hope and salavation of the mind in human beings. Andy(Tim Robbins) as a man who was wrongly convicted of life imprisonment and refusal to give up and despair and efforts to find any means to escape was amazing. His final escape act was a lesson for me in perseverance. A def must watch! The novel by Stephan King which Shawshank is based on gave a little more thoughts into the main characters'mind and you must read the short story if you like the movie.

What an amazing movie.  The performances, even by the bit players, are fantastic, the story is wonderful, the mood is great...this is about as close as you can get to a perfect film.  The fact that Steven King wrote it makes it all the more amazing.Although one might be tempted to think of this as a prison movie, it's not; it's about hope and redemption.  The hope is embodied in Tim Robbins' character (Andy); the redemption in Morgan Freeman, Red (whose redemption comes as a result of Andy's hope).

The Shawshank Redemption is a perfect film in every aspect. It has a beautiful score (Thomas Newman) and amazing cinematography. The acting is brilliant and the movie stands up well to repeat viewings. The only minor negative that I have for the film is that the main characters don't seem to age enough in the 20 or 30 years that they're in prison. But this is just a minor quibble. Don't let it deter you from watching this movie. It is a great story and every household should have this in their collection.

One of the best movie's I've seen. As for prison-movies, if you've seen this one you dont have to see any other, it surpasses them all. I was quite unfamiliar with the acting of Tim Robbins before i saw this movie, and I must say he did an excellent job. Morgan Freeman is always superb as a supporting actor, and this movie was no exception. I recommend this movie to anyone that's not scared to watch an intelligent movie with good dialogues, it's not for the pure action-fans a la Robocop, it's a serious movie, but never too mellow.

I've seen the shawshank redemption upwards of 10 times and never get tired of it.  Tim robbins delivers his best preformance as well as morgan freeman. The two play prison inmates who become friends and devise a plan to escape. After that alot of sad things happen to them rape, beatings, solitary confinement, etc.  Morgan Freemans character is released while Tim Robbins succesfully escapes after bringing down the corupt warden and head guard. The acting is superb as well as every other aspect in the film.  I highly recomend this film to any avid movie buff like myself.8/10

Comment Head: Great movie, Freeman is unworldly good
Comment Body: Shawshank deserves to be named one of the top 10 movies ever created and its a shame it came out the same year as Forrest Gump. Any other year in the 1990's and it would have obtained the Best Picture Oscar. Morgan Freeman gives the greatest performance of his career and considering all the memorable performances he's given, thats really saying something. Robbins is also terrific as Andy Dufrense, the wrongly convicted wife killer. James Whitmore also gives a memorable performance as the lovable Brooks Hatlen. Frank Darabont really outdid himself with this masterpiece. A must see for all ages!My rating : @@@@@ (out of five)

Comment Head: It's a tear-jerker, but it tears of happiness! :)
Comment Body: BIG SPOILER AHEAD! I was supposed to see the Green Mile instead of this movie, but Blockbuster didn't have it in and recommended this movie.  So I gave TSR (The Shawshank Redemption) a go. And I was really glad I did! Some moments of the film had raw violence, some moments were really depressing, some were amusing (It's Dumas not dumb ass!), and some were really powerful and happy and positive.  I personally thought the ending was flawless.  The main character in the story didn't have the good ending thrown at him, he had to go thorugh some sh!t to get it (literally!) Whenever I think of TSR, I always remember how it ended at the beautiful and bright beach with the two old friends hugging.  Everything was so good and happy even though it was the complete opposite in the beginning.  I expected this to be a very dark movie but it just had that atmosphere in the beginning and that was about it.  But I hate the fact that the boss of the prison had that teenage kid killed!!! That sucked!!!  But anyways...See it! I give this a 10/10!

Comment Head: The greatest movie to ever be made period.
Comment Body: What can I say about Shawshank Redemption this movie has everything you possibly can in a movie like great writting,great acting,and great directing.Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins give thier best performance of thier life in this great movie.Frank Darabont does a great job with the writting and  Directing.I'm surprised this movie didn't win any oscars.Who cares this movie is still the greatest thing to ever hit the theater.This movie is going to be remember forever.This is truly a great movie in every category.A classic to always remember.

Going into this movie I was not very excited.  It turned out to be one of the best movies I have ever seen. It is absolutely phoenomenal and extremely moving.  It shows how infallible the human spirit can be with hope guiding it.

Redemption is a powerful tool and the dynamic tim robbins plays his character to absolute perfection. After being convicted for a crime of passion he did not commit, we follow the eyes of andy dufrane and his sometimes brutal encounters in the shawshank prison. Loss, entrapment and the powerful word 'hope' are some of the initial thoughts i have about the film, but the ending where a lanscape of the perfect shade of blue in the form of the ocean attests the beauty of this film- where there is hope and the psychological will to out- manuver the seemingly futile surrounding walls forms the heart of humanity and its existence

Comment Head: One man's lifelong fight for freedom, and one of the finest films of the last decade
One of the greatest movies in film history.
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is probably the most widely loved movie in all of Western culture.  It's fleshed out characters give it the uncanny ability to deeply touch most of the people who watch it.  We relate to Freeman's character who has lost hope in society.  Robbins' is the friend who redeems us and gives hope back.  Gunton, who plays Warden Norton, is one of the most overlooked villains of all time.  He makes the greatest villain because he is the most realistic and relatable.  He isn't a crazy murderer, he is a corrupt religious official.  I believe this movie gets better when you have already seen it and know what happens.  Seeing the wardern get what's coming to him is consistently satisfying.  And of course, the famous beach scene leaves me on a high every time.  11/10

It is the best movie ever. I can`t stop watching it! You must see it! A Guy is put to jail for murdering his wife and her lover. The movie is more about Andy Dufrane... and his actions in different situations. It has a great end, and like i said... probably the best movie ever in the history of movies...

Comment Head: The best movie i have ever seen....
Comment Body: Best movie i have ever seen. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are amazing here... just brilliant! I would recommend it to anyone who loves a real movie, with and excellent story, acting and spirit.

Comment Head: quite simply, one of the most inspiring movies of all time.
Comment Body: You cannot but feel a sense of unbridled joy when Andy stretches his arms out and feels the rain fall on his face the moment he is free. i own the DVD and i watch it at least once a month and i never fail to get chills on my neck on that scene.once again: one of the most inspiring movies of all time.

Shawshank Redemption is the type of movie that all prison movies should be. In fact it is the type of drama that every drama should be. To date I can't think of a film that has just as much or even more character development than this film. And what better place to have it in? Both Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman make this movie what it is through the characters. Through Robbins, we can see a character who is determine and will never give up. And through Freeman we see a man who knows the truth about life inside and the bold truth. We see most of that through Freeman's reflection in his role as the narrator.    I love everything about this film. The cast, sets, characters, scores, script, everything. There are only a few movie that are just as good as this; but shouldn't be compared because like some movies in the film industry because it is the key to cinematic brilliance.

Comment Head: The greatest film of all time
Comment Body: I have just watched this film for the third time and it still knocks me for 6 and brings tears to my eyes. It is criminal that this film did not win any awards. That does not matter because in  time if not already it will without doubt go down as the greatest film of all time. Nothing gets anywhere near it.

Comment Head: Rusalka's fourteenth film review: A new kind of "Morality Play"

Comment Body: Such a great film.  Great acting, great cinematography, the list goes on and on.  Undoubtedly a great film, not necessarily good enough for #2 of all time, but great.  Don't miss this one.  I give it 10 out of 10.

Comment Head: The best prison movie ever made!
Comment Body: My cousin always recommends good movies to me and when he suggested this movie, I was not surprised that this was another gem.  This is my all time favorite movie!  I can watch it over and over again.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman were gypped out of Academy awards for their roles in this movie! This was as entertaining as it was exciting as it was suspenseful.  I actually read the Stephen King novella, Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption and was amazed that they could make such a long movie out of such a short story.  However, the movie was great.  I give this movie 11 out of 10!  That's how much I enjoyed it!  HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS MOVIE!  I don't want to give away any of the story to those who have not seen it, so I will end my review here!  SEE THIS MOVIE!

I have seen this movie twice and even the second time it was still a very special movie although you know what is going to happen...Big compliment for writer Stephen King! (I am wondering if it really happend, although it is too good to be true). Wonderfull acting, great story...with emotional moments but not overdone in any way. My favorite scene is when Andy receives the old books and records (big black CD's from the old days:-) and plays a part from a opera through the prison intercom! If you do have the chance: watch it!

Comment Head: Who are the 2400+ cinematic idiots that gave this a 1?
Comment Body: Sure, everyone is entitled to his opinion, but in the case of The Shawshank Redemption, the statement "This movie is not a 1 on a 1 to 10 scale" is not an opinion, it's a fact.  There are no sensible arguments that can be made for this being a 1.

Everything about shawshank is memorable. Both Tim Robbins And Morgan Freeman deliver wonderful performances, the dark mood settings in the prison and Andy(Tim Robbins)response to these drab settings, the superb cinematography, the masterful plot with its unique twist, the soundtrack,the simple idea of hping to be free. What more can i say, its truly a modern day masterpiece.

this is a one of the best ever made movies.when i first saw the picture i was very impressed.the end is just great.personally i hate hollywood stupid happy endings but this one... it's just so good u did a good job all of u who vote for this movie tudor

This is truly one of the best films I have ever seen. Usually I don`t like these kinds of movies, but in a strange way this film was different. The time just flew away, this i a must see movie. So if you haven`t seen it yet, so go and rent it, you will not regret it.

Based on the Stephen King Short Story, This movie, a prison story is a unique tale of a man wrongfully placed in prison, who was married and wife murdered by someone else. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins plays the lead parts  and makes this a movie worth seeing.

I think this is an excellent film, I'm a bit of a "prison film freak" so among all prison films I'll rate this one as the second best. obviously Escape from Alcatraz with Clint Eastwood is the absolute best one! Well back to Shawshank.. The way the film is made is just extraordinary!! I Love the way Morgan Freeman plays his sympathetic character.. last part is a bit disappointing, cause it's too similar to escape from Alcatraz.Well anyway it'll get *******/**********

With all due respect to Forrest Gump, this was the real best picture of 1994. Tim Robbins gives the best performance of his career, and Morgan Freeman is his usually outstanding self. The story is totally engrossing, and never loses your attention. And if you are watching the movie for the first time, the ending will throw you for a loop. This is one of the most underrated films of all time. It deserves must more respect than it usually receives.

Comment Head: One of the best films of the 90's
Comment Body: Rarely a movie that tries to be touching achives its purpose.  More often then not I find myself wanting to throw up at the serious of movies. While Shawshank redemption was very touching, I was to busy being engaged in the story line and the charecters to worry about the inspirational aspect of the movie.  Every single character serves a purpose in this movie.  Tim Robbins gives a great performance as an innocent man in prison for the murder of his wife.  His character doesn't dread on the horrible reality that is before him, he just takes it.  His character seems so loss in his new reality and needs some guidence which he finds in other inmates.  Shawshank redemption offers a realistic view of prison life, and at the same time creates one of the most engaging storylines ever.

Comment Head: Totally transcends its "prison drama" subgenre--one of the best films ever!
Comment Body: **POSSIBLE SPOILERS (nothing too specific)**Watching The Shawshank Redemption is a downright religious experience; it is truly a film to treasure, and one that nobody who sees it will ever forget. Director Frank Darabont's translation of a Stephen King novella to the screen is not a great film because of the story itself-the plot is actually quite simple and could be carried out in under an hour with relative ease-but because of the way the story unfolds.  Shawshank is a lengthy film (clocking in around 150 minutes), but it doesn't feel so long because the leading actors are spot-on perfect, the pace is beautifully metered, and the emotions (which are never the least bit contrived) build to one of the tensest climaxes in American cinema.The story is told not from the perspective of Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), banker imprisoned for a double-homicide he didn't commit, and the main character in this epic tale, but from the perspective of Red (Morgan Freeman), `the only guilty man in Shawshank Prison.'  Red has been in Shawshank for twenty years; he's a well-liked inmate among his peers because he's the guy that can obtain some of the luxuries of the outside world. If you want a box of cigars or a poster of your favorite pin-up girl, Red's your man.  Often, throughout the course of the film, we wonder why Andy isn't telling the story-after all, he's the character we sympathize with most.  In the end, we know why, and we're glad Red told the story, since the film ends up being more about him than Andy.  Andy, instead, is just the vehicle for Red's realization that hope and perseverance can free the human mind.While Red is the resourceful handyman, Andy is the smartest man in Shawshank.  He hatches a plan to get the other inmates to accept him by having the guards provide them with alcohol, he comes to be the tax preparer for all the guards in Shawshank as well as several neighboring prisons, he revamps the prison library, and even becomes the personal accountant to the warden, a cold man who, we learn, is just as criminal as any inmate.  Yet all the while, we don't realize just how smart Andy Dufresne is.  We believe he'll get his revenge on the legal system that landed him in jail, but this movie isn't about vengeance.  It's about making the most of a bad situation, and about the lengths a person will go to free himself-physically and spiritually.The film was nominated for seven Academy Awards in 1994 and lost all of them, mostly to Forrest Gump and Pulp Fiction (both solid films in their own right).  In any other year it may have won all seven.  Freeman definitely deserved every possible accolade for his performance, while Darabont's direction and Roger Deakins' stark cinematography bring great effect to the story.  The Shawshank Redemption is one of the most successful films ever on video, and rightfully so.  It's one of the best films ever.

Comment Head: The most moving film in history.

Comment Body: Shawshank Redemption is - no doubt- one of the best films I've ever watched. Not only the quality of the performance of Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins but also the most amazing and interesting screenplay makes film worth watching. The film surpasses  Papillon(Butterfly) - one of the best jail-escape film ever shot - in many aspects. Dustin Hoffman and Steve Mcqueen are both fine actors with a couple of Oscar Nominations but Morgan freeman is surely the real suit for the role. Tim Robbins amazes the audience with his cold-blooded behaviours from the very beginning till the end of the film. If you haven't watched the film yet, it's the one you should borrow at first chance.

Comment Head: He liked it no, he loved it, hope he's not obtuse.
Comment Body: The best prisons in the world seem to have a crawl space behind the wall though which only the most deserving souls can escape.  Granted, in this case it required a number of years, a few laundryroom visits by the sodomites and the execution of a key witness before the final crawl to freedom could take place. All in all a great movie with that Papillon good feeling of freedom at last. Love it I do.

Comment Head: Quite possibly the greatest movie in existence.

Comment Body: I saw this movie about a week ago and I really enjoyed it. I also have the movie and I've seen it about three or four times. It was also on TV. Morgan Freeman was terrific as Red. I think that everybody should watch this movie. 10/10

Comment Head: Mind Blowing, especially the first time!

Comment Body: I have seen this movie now a couple of times and I can say that it is one the best movies ever made! It's not an ordinary movie, it's something special. Both Robbins and Freeman did an Outstanding role and that's one thing why I love this movie so much. This is timeless movie, one and only of a kind. This should be on everyones must see list! Superb..

Comment Head: Better every time i see it.
Comment Body: This is one of the great films of all time. One of the 10 best I've ever seen. The cast is perfect. Tim Robbins was great! So too were Morgan Freeman as Red (a part actually written for a red haired Irishman) and Bob Gunton as the Warden. James Whitmore shows that small parts still require great acting and he is as good as ever. I recommend this film highly.

Comment Head: One of the greatest movies ever made
Comment Body: Excellent stars and supporting actors make this a once-in-a-lifetime type movie. The script was so well written it made it seem as if everyone was actually inmates in Shawshank. Every time the movie comes on tv I watch it and at the end STILL cry of happiness. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are outstanding together!

better than any movie out there. this is the best of the best. frank darabont did a great job adapting stephen king's novella. it's the great story and acting that make the film what it is - a masterpiece. i'm just surprised forrest gump beat the movie in the oscars - NOT RIGHT! Shankshank should've received BEST screenplay, director and film.

Comment Head: Amazing Film, more drama than a high school romance
Comment Body: This is probably my favorite film and deserves all credit is gets on this site and more.  It gets no mentioning from AFI or other official lists, but I would easily put it in the top 10.  It is probably the most riveting story in a movie ive seen, from the beginning you are on Tim Robbins side and how can you deny that both he and Morgan Freeman give the best performances of their lives.

The first time I've seen this movie was on December 31st, 2001. My parents and I were getting ready to down to the city and celebrate the New Year.My father said it was a great film and it was just on TNT or TBS. I decided to watch it, and wow. This has to be the greatest film of all-time.The acting was excellent, the directing, the writing. Everything. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins gave excellent jobs. On my all-time favorites list, this ranks #3...1. "Rat Race" (2001) 2. "Catch Me If You Can" (2002) 3. "The Shawshank Redemption" (1994) 4. "Terminator 2: Judgment Day" (1991) 5. "Spider-Man" (2002)The only bad aspect of the film was that the ending was too weak.SPOILER ALERTWhen Freeman's character met Robbin's character on the beach, it was just dull. I don't even think they ever said a word. They just faded out. Couldn't they have shown what happens next? Oh, well.SPOILER ALERT OVER.Everything else was great and there were even some funny moments, like when the Prison owner guy found out how Robbins' character left the prison.Since 12/31/01, I've seen the movie four more times, bought the screenplay and bought the DVD.10/10

Comment Head: On of my all time favs!
Comment Body: This movie is so timeless...it is definitely an instant classic. This isn't even my type of movie, but if you have a heart, you will be extremely moved by this touching story. I would never hesitate in recommending this movie to anyone!

Comment Head: I'm so glad a site has this near the top
Comment Body: This is by far my favorite film, if not the best ever made. The direction and acting is beyond description, to the point where it could have been a silent film and we still would have known what was going on. A most triumphant start to a career for Frank Darabont, who has taken Stephen King's novella of about a hundred pages and made it into a masterpiece. It's about time a website ranked this movie towards its top, because that's exactly where it deserves to be. 10/10.

This movie makes me feel like the energizer bunny - I can keep watching and watching and watching...It's incredible.  The Shawshank Redemption is of the few movies which I can watch always, even if I know what's coming.

Awesome Movie. Great performances by the whole acting cast especially Freeman and Robbins. I thought the warden was an excellent played character also. The screenwriting was awesome. Too bad this movie was out the same time as Forrest Gump or perhaps it would of had way more accolades. Still one of the greatest movies ever.

Comment Head: The antidote to all action stunt fests
Comment Body: I won't say it's the best film ever, but The Shawshank Redemption is certainly the best film *I've* ever seen.  There are no big stunts, no state-of-the-art special effects, no naked women.... In fact there are none of the things that are normally "required" to make a film commercial. (Perhaps this accounts for its modest showing at the box office.)  What it *has* got is humanity, subtlety and a great story with a brilliant payoff! One of the first DVDs I ever bought and by far the most played.

Comment Head: A really amazing film about friendship and perseverence.
Comment Body: There is just so much good in this film.I'm really surprised that it is ranked as highly as it is.  I don't agree that it is the second best film of all time.  I do think it is an extraordinary movie, tho.I could go on and on about it, but many other people have already done that. But it is obligatory to say something, isn't it?  How about:You can make this movie very strange by getting lightly buzzed and pretending that Tim Robbin's character is actually Nuke Laloosh from Bull Durham.  ;)

Comment Head: Once upon a time, you find a great story where each picture tells more than 1,000 words...

Comment Body: Perhaps the most thoughtful, entertaining, and emotionally powerful and moving movie I have ever seen. There is nothing like both of the performances put forth from Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. I am inspired every time I watch the movie, and will keep going back for inspiration again and again...Truly a remarkable piece of filmaking; I believe it is one of the best movies ever made.

Contains Spoilers 1.- The reason there was no racial tension was that in 1940-60s Maine, the black population was less than 1%, in one of the most conservative states, so, no, there was not much racial tension; and so, after a month, Andy asks him to get the hammer, he just didn't walk up to him the first day there. I was in lockup for a night in Louisville KY with 30 others and in an hour I was BSin with a homie who got popped with 6 ounces of blow.  I got nailed for not producing a valid license.(left it in the hotel).2.- All the relevant (except "the sisters") prisoners were criminals, and doing time, and were not saints.3.- Andy can get a REAL (not fake) driver's license and S.S. number for a bogus identity. Granted this is a movie, but yes, you can get real documents by mail. He was in prison for years before he started his phantom identity, he would have been able to ask any con for help. And THEIR picture would never end up on the license, because they didn't start putting photos on licenses until the 70s and 80s. This was the 40s - 60s, when white collar crime was just starting to expand.4.- He doesn't get gang-raped many times and doesn't end up traumatized. He fought them off.5.- A white yuppie banker can pull off what none of the lifers can? And the "he never lost hope" excuse don't cut it.  Because it's a movie.6.- The prison guards NEVER once open up his books (where he kept the rock hammer). At any prison of medium security the raids include the books as well, never mind a maximum security facility.  Because it's a movie.7.- Red remembers Andy's instructions EXACTLY, even when these were told to him only once and at a relaxed, casual moment. And after months, the place Andy described remained THE SAME. Remember Andy told him right before he escaped and Red was paroled soon after.What bothers me about bad reviews is distorting the facts to make up the bad review.

Comment Head: Doesn't need to redeem itself for anything, it's perfect.
Comment Body: ****Starring: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, and Bob Gunton.The story follows Andy Dufresne, a man wrongfully accused of murdering his wife, but he is really innocent.  He befriends a few prisoners, and then finds a way to escape the prison.The movie is one of the greatest movies of all time.  It has every single element that makes this wonderful.Very highly recommended.

What is so special about this movie? Thats what I asked myself when I saw it as one of the few IMDB top-rated movies I didn't know yet. Now I know why it deserves to be there. It is the best prison movie ever made. Most prison movies try to accuse the prison system by showing an increasing level of violence and spectacular escapes. Shawshank Redemption is somewhat different. The main actor is portrayed from the view of a second person and most of the time we see what this person sees. Shawshank prison is not a monastery, and while there are some violent scenes, most of the violence we only learn by the narrative of the second person. The time saved from depicting violence is spent showing the feelings of the inmates. Beyond the perfect technical work in producing this movie, the plot slowly builds up to incredible moments of courage and purity. I guess this is what essentially makes the movie so great, without being pathetic the movie makes us wonder about our own motives and decisions. Very thought provoking.

Comment Head: In time, this masterpiece may be considered the greatest movie ever made
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is not only the greatest film of the last decade, but in time, this may become, in the eyes of moviegoers, the best movie ever made.  The story of wrongfully accussed banker Andy Dufresne, and his friendship formed with con Ellis Boyd Redding in Shawshank Prison, has become as universally acclaimed and loved as any other in recent history. This is the 'Casablanca' of it's time.  A near-perfect movie that can be watched hundreds of times and never lose it's impact.  Perhaps its the way the movie handles the timeless theme of hope, and the trials one man has to endure to be attain the proverbial redemption of the title.  Maybe it is because this movie is truth, simple truth, about the triumph of good over evil, the triumph of reason over madness, the triumph of hope over everything.

This movie is excellent.  It really makes you feel good.  It's about hope, the fight for life and most of all, poetical justice.  Excellent performances by the cast, visually stunning and has a great deal of realism in it.  I totally recommend it.  A+

The Shawshank Redemption was story about how perseverance, hope and innocence will change a man's destiny. Tim Robbins was eloquent and portrayed a character with acting prowess of razor sharp perfection. Wrongly accused of murdering his wife, he ends up in Shawshank Maximum Security Prison, for life. Here here he befriends Red, played by Morgan Freeman ( a role he definitely deserved the Best Supporting Actor Oscar ), your typical Jack of all traits in the prison. Their story was one of trust, hope and friendship which was ultimately the forte of this movie. Robbins acting was methodical, straight-foward and deservingly captures our sympathy. A great supporting cast also gives added strength to an already perfect movie. The background music score haunts me even until today as it successfully depicts the sad, helpless and claustrophobic mood of a maximum security prison. Rich, crisp and vibrant cinematography together with Director Frank Darabont's vivid imagination and direction style  brought to life one of the greatest motion picture ever told! 10/10

I dont mean to be controversial here, but I read the book some time ago, and over the last couple of days, watched the film again. And nowhere I can remember, can it conclusively prove that Andy Dufrene did NOT kill his wife and that Glen geezer. All we have to go on is him saying that he didn't and the fact that we all like him as a character. Yes it does seem against his nature, but a lot of murders must be against peoples nature's, but they still happen.Anyone else agree that he could be the killer?

Shawshank Redemption is a compelling, moving, and beautiful story which is darkly funny at times. This movie's #2 spot on IMDB is debatable, since it is essentially a formulaic Hollywood story with Hollywood characters... i.e. evil institution (guards) and noble rebels ("some" prisoners) within a microcosm (prison). Andy Dufresne is so incredibly friggin' smart (for a banker) that is almost super-hero like. Though this is definitely a worthy film, in terms of sheer greatness, Shawshank missed Cool Hand Luke by *this much*... If you want a really top-of-the-line awesome prison movie, Cool Hand Luke is the one to see.

At first I just want to say that this is and always be the best film ever until the opposite is proved. I have only one question after watching it:The scene when Andy gets to Shawshank, Red already telling us (as a speaker) "... when Andy wanted Rita Hayworth, I said No problem" (sorry if I¬¥m a bit wrong in the quote) W H Y on earth is he doing that? Why does Frank Darabont want us to know that before he actually does the scene later in the movie???Answer anyone?? ... but still... Best ever. Got it on DVD as a Christmas present from my brother after tearing the videotape out through the years. Thanks Bro! =Calle=

Comment Head: Gets better every time I see it

Comment Body: *** SPOILERS *** I just finished watching Shawshank for the third time. Even though I know exactly what's going to happen in every part of the movie, some scenes are so beautiful and powerful that they still make me cry. The first 30 minutes of the film feels like a normal prison film, nothing special, but a good build up for things to come. The film really starts taking off with the scene where they work on the roof. After that it just gets better and better. In the end you are overwhelmed with the beauty of this movie.My favourite parts are when they are working in the roof, when Brooks is released, when Tommy gets shot in the yard, the part where Red describes how Andy escaped and the part where Red find the note under the rock. Every scene in the movie is great and most of them are relevant to the main story. The narration by Freeman is great, I can't think of any other film that contains so many wonderful quotes. The music is also beautiful and fits perfectly into the movie.It's very hard to tell with words how good this movie is. Just go watch the movie and hopefully you will feel the same things I feel.

The Shawshank Redemption is, by far, one of the greatest films of the 90's, if not of all time. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are perfect as the two leads in this very moving, human story. With excellent direction (Frank Darabont), a fantastic story (a short by Stephen King), and a great supporting cast, this film is a masterpiece.

Comment Head: Not just the other prison movie Stephen King wrote

Comment Body: No spoilers here.A remarkable Stephen King penned story.  King has often found ways of getting to wonder about even our most strongly held values.  Most consider people in prison as throwaway members of society, and those that guard the prisons as public servants. King twists this into the protagonist prisoner (Robbins) against the hopelessness of prison and the brutal display of power by the warden.  The story is beautifully narrated by Morgan Freeman as ex-con Red.It lost out to Tom Hanks' portrayal of Forrest Gump for Best Picture, which is a shame, but I'll never forget the impact it made on me.The film has an edge, and a heart.  I couldn't recommend it enough.

Recently on cable television, this classic movie has stirred the hearst of many.  It is a very compelling film, and it arouses one's emotions to their zenith.  The casting is perfect, the performances are the penultimate of theatre, and the result is a must-see drama that belongs in the DVD library of all serious collectors.

Comment Head: The best movie I've ever seen
Comment Body: This was a movie I wanted to see for some time, and when I finally got to see it it didn't disappoint me. On the contrary, it was the best movie I've ever seen.Very good story. This is a movie I'll watch a lot more... the best ever!

Comment Head: The best movie--caution could contain spoilers!!
Comment Body: This movie is the best movie around. Tim Robbins plays his character superbly (is that a word??). Morgan Freeman was an awesome choice for Red. At first glance, I thought is was a so-so movie. Then I saw it again, and again. The plot became so intricate; instead of being about Andy and his trying to find the truth, it became about Red and his own internal struggle.Anyway, I recommend this movie for anyone who loves movies of any kind.

Comment Head: A message of hope, well recieved
Comment Body: At one time this movie was my faveorite of all time, but then I saw it repeated 2000 times on Turner's cable networks.  Although the book by Stephen King is much better than the movie, the message that hope lives on, remains.  I have to admit that I never liked Tim Robbins untill I saw this movie, but I thought he did an excellent job in what is one of the great movies of the nineties.

Comment Head: Uplifting story of hope and the resilience of the human spirit.
Comment Body: This movie was faithful to the excellent Stephen King novella it came from:"Rita Hayward and the Shawshank Redemption".  In spite of injustice, corruption, and brutality, prisoners were able to rise above this and form true friendships.  They were able to put real love into action toward each other.  When the protagonist, played brilliantly by Tim Robbins, locks himself in the warden's office and plays an exquisite aria from a Mozart opera, the whole prison stops and listens.  All are moved by such beauty, beauty they haven't experienced in a long time, if ever.  It is my favorite scene from any movie I have ever seen.

Comment Head: Quite possibly the best movie of all time...
One of the greatest movies ever!
Comment Body: This is an example that Hollywood CAN do a great movie that doesn't solely build on special effects.This is also a proof that not all movies need to have more "pace" or "action". The ingredients in this movie is the interaction between two great actors, Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, a very good support cast, a superb story by Stephen King and a professional crew. This "soup" is very tasteful and gets 10/10 by me.

Comment Head: I don't know why I had to wait eight years to see it.
Comment Body: ***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS***One of my friends raved about this film so I looked it up on IMDB and there it was at no 2 in the top 250 movies with over 42000 people giving it 10 out of 10 so I gave it a try and wished I had watched it years ago.Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne and Morgan Freeman as Red both give first class performances and the friendship that develops between them is heartfelt, Especially when you feel that two people of completely different social standings that would not pass the time of day on the outside world bond so well in the confinements of shawshank prison. There is no facetious acting and even the scenes where Andy is violated by the `sisters'  there are no grisly scenes but still the viewer is left in no doubt what took place. some people call it bland but to me it adds to the appeal  of the film and in-keeping with time scale the film was set in.This story appeals on so many levels and I can see why its in the top ten films in IMDB and the tag line It takes a strong man to save himself, and a great man to save another completely captures the film essence and I know it will not be 8 years before I watch it again. But having to wait years to watch it I must qualify for the sadster of the year award !!9/10

Comment Head: Reviews by Joe, Steve, Derek, Brad, Dan, Chris
Comment Body: CONTAINS SPOILERS Review by Joe: `Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption' the original short novel by legendary author Stephen King, sparked the start of a superb movie and ongoing legend. Andrew Dufresne, a fairly young man committed murder and was sentenced to life in Shawshank prison.  There are some elements of this film that differ from elements of this novel.  And yet many things are the same.In the novel, Andy was a short, partially bald man, who was quiet and shy, and in the movie he was a tall intimidating stocky figure.  I think this difference is important in one particular scene: the prisoners are tarring the roof, and Andy overhears Hadley, a man who is angry at the world, talking about his inheritance from his deceased brother.  Andy speaks up about the taxes of the inheritance and Hadley gets furious.  I think that if in the movie he was the man described in the book, it would have made this seem weak, and Hadley probably wouldn't have thought him worthy to even speak to him. I think this movie was put together well, but to be honest, I like Stephen King's short novel better.Review by Steve: The movie was very good.  Andy's life in prison was real.  Andy really got cheated out of 20 years of his life.  Andy's in jail for something he didn't do. I especially like the scene when the warden was talking to the media. When the warden was in front of the building talking it looked like the warden had a crown on.  Showing that he was a king he had all the power. I didn't like the ending of the movie.  It was good for them because it was what they both wanted. They both wanted freedom and that's what that scene showed.  But they should have had some sort of action, like gone sailing, fishing, showed them both out to sea doing something.  Being free.  Not just on the beach hugging each other.Review by Derek: I think that the directors should have filmed the movie in Charleston, Maine because I've spent a lot of time there.  I wish I would have had a chance to see the whole movie but from what I saw it was a great movie. I liked the movie cause it seemed so real.
