But what I didn't like was how the guards and the warden thought that any one who got in the way or their business they could kill them or put them in solitary confinement.  Plus I didn't like how guards treated inmates like slaves. They couldn't just face reality and treat them like equals. But it happens in prisons all over the world so that's why I liked Shawshank Redemption.Review by Brad: I liked the movie compared to the book.  I think that the movie was way better. The movie seemed to be way more interesting.  It was complimentary to Stephen King's ways of writing an intricate portrayal of an actual event that took place in Maine. One of the things I liked about the movie is the way camera angles portray power.Review by Dan: A Review of Shawshank Redemption from an Inmate's View I found the movie not nearly as enjoyable as Stephen King's `Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption'.  The points I found I did not agree with are they have Red's character as a black man in the movie when in the short story he was a white Irish man but it kinda adds a little laughter to a serious theme.  Second they have Andy Dufresne as a tall skinny man when in `Rita Hayworth.' he's a small and a heavy man with not much of an aura. Thirdly they have one warden Mr. Norton when there is three in the short story because it seems to the viewer that 19 years did not go by, but in a way its good so the viewer can focus his hate towards one figure. That's what I didn't like but there are more pros than cons.  The film makers did an excellent job with the lighting, the angle of the camera and the music. With these three combined it gives the feelings of dread and despair as black as death.  Freedom as high as a bird and sadness as deep as an ocean. With all these in mind it makes a great movie on a scale from 1 to 10 I'd give it 8 ¬Ω.Review by Chris: This movie was madcool. Some specific parts about this movie that I thought were pretty phat was like when the music was played by the Italian lady's singing and they all looked free.  When later on in the movie the music is really fast and strong after he's finished climbing out of the pipe and really is free.  I also like how Andy never gave up against the sisters and then finally Hadley beat the p*** out of Boggs,the guards helped him because he helped them that's pretty killer.Madcool-really good, very interesting Phat-cool interesting, awesome, madcool Pretty Killer-same

Comment Head: Get Busy or Get Busy Living
Comment Body: CONTAINS SPOILERS!!!!!! Frank Darabont's brilliant adaptation form the Stephen King novel Different Seasons, "The Shawshank Redemption" captures the audience's attention and does not let go.  As in "The Green Mile", Darabont takes us through a journey of an innocent man confined to prison walls.  The film begins with Andy Dufresne  (Tim Robbins)  being found guilty of two counts of murder and shipped off to Shawshank Prison.  There we meet Red Redding (Morgan Freeman).  Andy and Red begin a memorable friendship that is evident though out the film.  The corrupt warden (Bob Gunton) makes Andy's life miserable. Over the years, we see Andy growing, getting books for the prison library, and teaching his follow inmates.  We see Red going to the parole board and never allowed freedom.  Darbont has the audience hoping that he is finally going to be released.  More years past and Andy decides to get busy dying or get busy living.  Suddenly, we hear sirens going off and the warden shooting himself for a cowardly way out for his dirty deeds.  Andy escapes.  But how does he do it?  Telling us how Andy crawls his way to freedom, Red begins to narrate the rest of the film. After nineteen years, Andy obtains his revenge and freedom at the same time.  The steps at which Andy takes to escape leaves the audience speechless.  Red begins to miss his friend and every once in awhile he would get a plain postcard, which we all knew was from Andy.  Red is once again sent before the parole board.  He tells them what he thinks of them. They finally parole him.   The audience can not get any happier.  Andy and Red are free.  Yet Andy told Red about a place he loved to go the night before he escaped.  Red hitchhikes to that place and finds a tin box.  Inside the old wore out box is money and the place Red could find Andy.  Red takes a bus to a beautiful place by the ocean.  As Red walks the beach, we see Andy. The film is long but, the time flies because the audience is into the movie.  The performances of Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are phenomenal. "The Shawshank Redemption" is one film a person can keep watching because everyone always finds themselves still rooting for Andy who finally got busy living.

To me, it's the supporting cast and the attention to detail in this time period movie that make it an outstanding movie.  It's in a class with The Godfather and A Man For All Seasons.  Outstanding finish after considering how we viewers suffered through the prisoners' treatment at the hands of the guards and administration.

Comment Head: Not just a great prison movie, one of the great movies of all time.

Comment Body: What can I say that hasn't already been said. A fantastic movie which has been played to death on TNT. Still, it's a great film. One of those films that jocks say is their favorite film to show they're film buffs. Anyway, a great movie with a lot of heart.

"The Shawshank Redemption" is one of my favorite films. It was filmed in and around where I live (in Ohio), and I have actually visited the old prison where they shot much of the movie. I would love to know where they filmed the scene where Andy buried the letter and money in that countryside. It looks very familiar.  Anyway, I thought Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman were at their best, and had great chemistry together. The casting, so important to making a film work, was well done.  Bob Gunton ,as the warden, does a great job. There is something intriging about escaping from a hopeless situation and changing your destiny. This is the first Steven King work I have actually enjoyed. Also, the background music really adds to the overall enjoyment and quality of the film. I am glad to see it is also considered one of the greatest films of all times by others.

One of the greatest movies of all time! The back bone of the film is the relationship between the two characters played by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman(both, great acting) .I like the way their friendship is depicted.How it evolves and stuff.Couldn't be more similar to life!Anyway it is a kickass movie!No-one should regret the time they spent on this!

I'd like to remind those few Nay Sayers that have labeled SSR as an overrated film that it sure wasn't overrated by the Academy in 1994. In fact, it didn't win a single Oscar! Thanks to IMDB, the public has spoken -it's truly a People's Choice! Obviously, we each have a right to our opinion, and I respect (though cannot understand) the opinions of those that have expressed dissent about the film. Rather than remain in a quandary as to how it could have been elevated to number 2 all-time, perhaps you should try watching the film again to see if, by chance, you missed the boat on it the first time around. There's no vote-fixing going on here, folks! I stand in harmony among those who have been enlightened by this masterpiece and lend my hand in lifting it to the top.

Comment Head: How can anyone hate this movie?
Comment Body: Its understandable, I guess, to dislike this movie, but how can anyone truly hate this movie. There is nothing to hate. Anyways, did anyone notice in this movie that the warden aged a little, but the captain of the guards(played by Clancy Brown) did not. The story started in 1947 and ended in 1966. Did anyone notice this?10/10
The movie was just brilliant. Just the right actors had been picked and the movie was just great. I recommend sincerely if you haven't already seen it.

Comment Head: Just emotions - if someone need more comments
Comment Body: First of all: this film is one of the "must see".It's not just a collection of perfect moments. It's not just a work of good teammates. It's a single moment from the start till the begining when you live along with the characters of the film.And the last but not the least: it very hard to make film after strong book. Different seasons is worth reading and definitely very impressive. When I watched the start I honestly doubted that it will impress me that strong.

Comment Head: One of the best movies I have ever seen
Comment Body: I have seen The Shawshank Redemption after noticing that it was second in the 250 Top Movies and I must say I have no regrets about this. I can honestly say that this is one of the best movies ever made and I am glad to add it to my collection. If you haven't seen it yet get it and watch it.

Comment Head: Set in a prison, but about triumphing over any adversity
Comment Body: An excellent tale about enduring incredibly adversity and eventually triumphing.  The incomparable Morgan Freeman sets the tone as narrator. This should not be seen as a "prison" movie, even though it is set in a prison.  Tim Robbins, as the other major character and the man whose trials rival those of Job, is a good everyman.  When this film was nominated for a lot of Oscars, Kathie Lee Gifford made a great show of ridiculing its title (on "Live with Regis and...").  She hadn't seen the movie and would probably be embarrassed to be reminded of the episode.

This is a moving picture that will leave you with an experience. There are still films I need to see, but so far this ranks as without a doubt my favourite. No other film has provided me with such a tremendous emotional rush in its last third, or set itself up so well to do so with everything before it. A fantastic story told by the best of direction, acting and music. The Greatest.

Tim forehead robbins does a classic job as a hot shot banker who was wrongfully accused.  in this crusade robbins and "Red" morg freeman become good buds and with william sadlers upraving comedic factor the movie simply goes down as one of the greatest philms of all time. frank darabonts finest film and bub gunton plays a great role as the warden.

While "the Godfather" is the current number 1, I have to say that, although I love the Godfather, it never gives me the same feeling as "The Shawshank Redemption". It gives me goosebumps everytime I see it. You actually pitty the inmates, even when you know what they did. But the best part of the experience is the way the story let's you be Red and look at the terribly strange new inmate and watch him give everyone a better life.

Comment Head: Good film but there are a lot better
Will we ever see it's like again?
Comment Body: For me this film is about as close to perfection as I can imagine. Somehow a first time director's adaptation of a fairly average and forgotten novella by a horror writer has turned out to be one of the most beloved movies ever made. Watching this film is truly a magical and life affirming experience, which profoundly affected me after seeing it for the first time. Andy's journey as he crawls through "a river of s*** and comes out clean on the other side" as red puts it, has become an inspiration to millions of people. The film's central message, that hope can lead us by the hand through the darkest times in our lives, and give us the courage to go on, is surely one of the most eloquent and beautiful sentiments ever delivered through the media of cinema. This film has become a modern phenomenon, a cultural benchmark, and has proved the incredible power that movies still posses.

this movie has it all.  it has an exraordinary plot and the storyline between morgan freeman and tim robbins is one that i have never seen before. no movie has a "buddy to buddy" relationship as in this movie.  this movie made me cry at the end, although to be honest, it was kidna predictable how he would redeem himself.  the ending was also predictiable, but still, why does a movie not have to be predictable to be great?  being predicatble makes the viewer happy that the movie is headed in a happy direction.

Comment Head: I movie that reminds us why we love Cinema

Comment Body: Shawshank Redemption is the greatest prison film ever made, in fact it is probably the greatest film ever made. Morgan Freeman is absolutely brilliant and is mirrored by a surprising Tim Robbins this is a devastating, heartwarming, riveting cinema at its very best everyone will remember this film 10/10 and justifiably so.

WARNING:***SPOILERS THROUGHOUT*** DO NOT READ IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN THE MOVIEI originally rented this film because I had read it was an escape movie. That was all I had really heard about it.  The title didn't seem very familiar to me, but I thought I would rent it.  I was slightly worried that I had ruined the ending for myself, but I was worrying for nothing.  From the very first scene the movie had me.  Morgan Freeman's performance was PERFECT.  The music was great.  The plot was surprisingly varied and it pulled me in.  And  of course the escape scene was the most uplifting thing I've ever seen in a movie anywhere.  The plot is so simple.  A man beats the system.  It affects anyone who is human.  If you have disregarded my warning and are reading it without seeing it, don't worry.  I haven't ruined it. This is one movie that has to be experienced.  There is absolutely nothing else I can say.  Those of you have seen it will know what I'm talking about. It seems like I'm at a loss for words, and that's true.  Everyone must see this movie.  If you haven't seen it, stop reading, go out, and rent it or buy it or borrow it or steal it or download it-just see it.  This is worth any rental price.  It sounds simplistic to the point of irrevelence.  It sounds like any other movie.  It sounds boring.  BUT ITS NOT.  It's beautiful!  It's perfect!  My writing skills are usually much better than this, but I can't fit this movie into words.  JUST SEE IT. NOW.  "Get busy living, or get busy dying..."

My friend and I have agreed that any man between the ages of 20-40 will have one or more of the following as being in their top 3 movies of all time : Star Wars, Blade Runner, Pulp Fiction and The Shawshank Redemption.A fantastic source novella, skilful direction, career performances by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman....the list goes on.The plot can't be summarised easily - suffice to say that there are no car chases, no gunfights, and no actors from Dawson's Creek.This movie is one of only three I can recall where I specifically noticed EVERY person leaving the cinema with a HUGE smile on their face.

This move is by far one of the best movies of all time. It deserves to be in the top 5. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman do an excellent job, I couldn't pick anyone else to play the role better. Their performance was outstanding. I recommend this movie to everyone, if you haven't seen it, you should.

Though Freeman is our times Micheal Caine, his performance in this flick is quite sufficient or rather staggering. In Oscar terms, "I would like to thank...", haden't been disapointing to me. To reavel the plot or resolution is to say how "The Mouse Trap" ends. All I can say is see the movie. It might be a "guy movie" but it is the best drama ever....

Comment Head: Unorginal Prison Fairytale my hairy foot!
Comment Body: ***SPOILERS***    ***SPOILERS*** Imagine me as an old man with a beard sitting on the stoep (porch) waving my cane at people passing by."How dare you call the Shawshank Redemption an unorginal prison fairytale! It is not supposed to be a run of the mill prison movie. Its not supposed to be The Birdman of Alcatraz! It's not supposed to be MIDNIGHT EXPRESS! It's not even supposed to be Stir Crazy, you wippersnappers! The prison is only the backdrop! It's about overcoming the odds when you are at your rope's end. This is a movie about hope and finding it in the darkest and dreariest of places."This movie could easily have been set in Nazi Germany in opressed Germany, in a concentration camp, in a 19th century work house! It's about breaking free from things that oppress us needlessly! (Spoiler starts here) Andy is the only person in prison that doesn't belong there! If he had done something bad he would have accepted it, but he didn't, so he tunnels through a wall to freedom. (Spoiler ends here)."Sentimentalism can be bad in a movie if handled incorrectly, but Darabont uses it better than other Capra impersonators out there (even beating the Coens with their Hudsucker Proxy). And there is nothing wrong with sentimentality in The Shawshank Redemption. And I can't see what cliches you are talking about. Just because good things happen doesn't mean they cliches."This is a meditative movie. It's also has a lot of little things to enjoy for repeat viewing. So get off your high-horse and enjoy this movie."This is all I have to say."Get back onto his chair and blows bubbles out of his pipe.

An excellent adaption of Stephen King's novella "Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption".Morgan Freeman is outstanding and his narrative is very lulling and makes the film all the more compelling.Tim Robbins, too, gives a fantastic performance - and the supporting cast (particularly Bob Gunton as the sadistic warden; he also appeared in the King adaption "Dolores Claiborne" (1995)) give fine performances, too.Despite being riddled with prison cliches, this movie is great.And remember: FEAR CAN KEEP YOU PRISONER, HOPE CAN SET YOU FREE.
You do not need to know about the plot or the characters or the actors, know only this:Shawshank redemption is an amazing film. You must watch this, you will not regret it.

oh,this is really a very good one i've ever seen.Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies.remember?from the movie,u can get that.if u never see it,go ahead now,or u will regret,i am sure.but to my disappoint,it doesn't get any awards. and when the old man left the prison,he found he was not able to touch the world,really hard for him to do that,and in the end he rather die.it truely shows many prisoner's feelings.i was deeply moved. and this is the one shows the humanity,u should watch it!

Comment Head: How could I have missed seeing it before?
Comment Body: Great movie, I don't know how I missed it. Nothing was out of place, whoever casted the movie did an excellent job.It instantly became one of my top 5's. I will watch it again(I don't usually watch twice, at least right away). I'm glad I bought the DVD -can't say that about all movies.

Comment Head: A Reflection of prison life, and what Hope is
Comment Body: Though the prison system in the US may have changed by now under extreme "political correctness", but still "seeing" is believing. Twenty years are a long time, and the odds are against any one that plots an escape: the longer the time, the less believable an escape is. Perhaps the too neatly arranged escape hurt this movie's credibility, still the movie succeeded in being an entertaining window into a morbid world which may be too dark for the outside to see.  If I agree with one thing in this movie, it is "Never give up hope", as Andy states it.

To really appreciate this one, you cannot simply watch it once and put it back on the shelf. Instead, the first time you should watch it for enjoyment, the second time to really get the raw sensation. Every time after that is just the biggest thrill.The first time I watched this movie, I fell in love with it. But, it wasn't until the second time that I really appreciated it for all it's subtle overtones. Only then does reality slap you in the face and give you the wake-up call you've been needing.It is the type of film that allows you to try on someone else's shoe. You are exposed to a way of life which most of us will never understand and end up experiencing a really heart-felt moral joyride.And to top it all off, you have Morgan Freeman in his most powerful role yet.

The Shawshank Redemption is my favorite movie of all time.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are handing out the best performances of there life in this film.  Its about how a banker named Andy Dufrense (Tim Robbins) goes through prison.  And along the way becomes best friends with Red(Freeman).  This story is all about hope and friendship.  This films has several very moving scenes.  From the rooftop scene to the ending (the best ending ever).  And the movie kinda has 4 endings.  (4 best endings ever).  Should have taken home best picture, original score, screenplay (Frank Darabont), and cinamitography oscars.  But was over looked by forrest gump (which is good, but not better then shawshank) and pulp fiction (still yet to see).  "Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies"... thats damn right.10/10   A+

Best drama ever. I've got many favorite movies, and I've always been unable to name my all times favorite movie, since my moods change, sometimes I want comedy, sometimes action, and sometimes, drama. One thing I am sure of tho, and that's the superiority of The Shawshank Redemption amongst it's genre. It may not be completely realistic, it may have a few cliches, but I don't see why some people seem to think that an utterly entertaining and well made movie suddenly isn't just that anymore if it has a few silly things in it.For the last 12 or so years I've watched movies like a true fanatic, thousands and thousands of them, and I've pretty much seen all the ones that count. Everyone has a right to opinions, but I'm telling that you truly do think that this movie doesn't _deserve_ it's place in the top 5 of IMDB, you are clueless.

Comment Head: A Masterfully Crafted Emotional Roller Coaster Ride
morgan freeman on top of his game
Comment Body: shawshank was one of the first videos i ever purchased.  this film has it all; great character development; poignant humor; heart-in-throat drama. this was the first time frank darabount directed a stephen king story - the second time was The Green Mile.  needless to say, the darabount-king hookup provides strong filmmaking for the theater-goer.a must see.

I think the hungarian title of this movie is more apposite: Prisoners of hope or Slaves of hope (A rem√©ny rabjai). It sounds beautiful in hungarian.This movie created a genre that can't be defined. The story is about hope, "a good thing" as Andy Dufrense calls it. "Maybe the best of things".And that's the point. Hope dies last. Every decent man should appreciate this movie.

Shawshank Redemption, a true heart warming epic has sat in my heart among my favorites. Tim Robbins has given the performance of his life, even after watching the movie again and again, i cant stop thinking what he did, how patient and intelligent the guy was that even his closest friend morgan freeman cant think of what he can do or what he did. The strong dialogues and the delivery makes an unstoppable emotional attachement between the characters and audience. If you havent seen it, dont blame me why you are missing it.

Comment Head: Webster couldn't come up with the proper words
Comment Body: I am what you might call a movie fanatic.  I have literally seen thousands of movies.  I have a movie collection of over 1000 different movies.  When asked, "what's my favorite movie?", I can think of a favorite movie in a category, a favorite movie by a particular actor, a favorite movie in a particular year, a favorite style of movie, and a favorite in practically anything else you can think of.  However, there is only one movie that I felt it necessary to sign up for IMDb, there is only one movie that still sends chills up and down my spine when I watch it, there is only one movie that stands out among the rest, there is only one movie that leads the pack over the thousands of movies I watched in the last 9 or ten years, and there is only one movie that I can truly say is my favorite, number one movie of all time, and that movie is Shawshank Redemption.  This is my first review and when you look up the top voted lists on IMDb and you see Shawshank Redemption in the top 3, you will know that I, too, was mesmerized by this movie.  The only movie, in my opinion, that was ever worthy of a 10. Phillip

A Masterpiece! This film possesses such beauty; the story line is amazing, the music 'rhymes' perfectly with the film en the acting performances are outstanding. There are few great films but in this case I have nothing but praise. The best film I have ever seen.

The Shawshank Redemption is a superb motion picture. The story is great. I love movies like this where you root for the underdog, in this case wrongfully convicted Andy Dufresne, skillfully played by Tim Robbins. The cunning of Dufresne is amazing, and the movie throws in a nice moral lesson on the importance of friendship. Also the directing and cinematography are great.  Everyone should see this. bye.

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever made.
Comment Body: WARNING, SPOILER AHEAD!  DO NOT READ UNTIL YOU HAVE SEEN THE FILM.This film is one of the most hotly contested films ever made.  Some, like myself, love it and it takes pride of place in their video, DVD collections. Others detest it and I think the reason for this is that they have completely missed the one point Mr Darabont was trying to make.The prison in the film is a representation of life itself, Andy didn't choose to be there he was put there by circumstances beyond his control. This is supposed to mean that in life sometimes thing happen to us, partners leave, jobs are lost etc.  that are beyond our control and we simply have to deal with them.  Andy makes the best life he can for himself in the situation he is in and makes a friend in Red.  He then, through his ability to maintain a level of hope that things will get better, inspires those around him by teaching Red the value of hope and teaching the ill fated Tommy to read etc.  In the end he escapes from prison and puts all that is wrong within it right.You can tell Darabont, like many of us, has had times where life seemed pointless and everything was against him.  What he tried, and succeeded, to say is no matter how bad things get if you believe that things will get better they will.I recently read that Tim Robbins frequently gets members of the public coming up to him in the street and telling him how important the film was to them.  How it helped them get through a time in their life they where truly miserable and, as his character said in the film, gave them hope.

The Shawshank Redemption is a brilliant, timeless story of a young man named Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) who is convicted and imprisoned for the murder of his wife. While in prison, he befriends an older black man named Red (Morgan Freeman). This film masterpiece just takes you through the years Andy spends in prison, and the hope that human spirit can keep alive even in the most hopeless circumstances. Tim Robbins exhibits a quality in this film that is inexplicable but charming. You really fall in love with his character and I genuinly believe (Robbins) acting in this film is perhaps one of the most moving performances ever caught on film. This really pushed me to respect the cast and really open my eyes to their acting abilities. This truimphant tale will leave a bittersweet trail through your heart as it did mine. ****

hello, this film was the most spectacular as it gives us something which captures the human spirit and triumph as in malaysia, i have been watching it hundred of times and what could i say? no other movie could beat this one even in the new millennium keep it as the memorable collection.the ending caption will cheer us all.

If you are looking for a movie about strong human feelings you should see this one. Stories like this make you believe again in people's strength. It's amazing how faith and hope could take the character so high, up to the point of taking everything jail had for him. His need of freedom takes his mind away from that terrible place.Man, every time I see the scene where he is down the rain and he looks up, i get chickenskinned. This is a beautiful story.Everyone of the actors did a great job.

I felt for Andy and Red throughout this movie. I wanted to help them fight the warden and those who abused them. I laughed some, I cried most but above all I believed. By the end when Andy and Red find happiness, you will be cheering for them!

"The Shawshank Redemption", like "Lord of the Rings", is an exemplary film. There is absolutely nothing wrong with it. The actors all do a fine job, from Morgan Freeman to Tim Robbins. The plot is outstanding, probably because it used one of Stephen King's best novels as a screenwrite. And the setting, well what can you say? Shows prison from a whole new standpoint. As of now, this film is tied with "Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring" for the best movie I have ever had the pleasure of viewing.

Comment Head: A first class piece of film-making
Comment Body: The prision movie is one of those rare genres where more or less every film turns out to be a winner (The Great Escape, Pappilon, Midnight Express¬Ö), but The Shawshank Redemption of 1994 may well take its place as the best of them all.  Frank Darabont's hugely impressive picture cuts a remarkable balance in paying attention to the harsh realities brutalities of prison life whilst also successfully conveying the power and determination of the human spirit.  Tim Robbins is Andy DeFrans, a banker sent to the maximum security Shawshank prison for life for the alleged murder of his wife and lover, where he strikes up a friendship with the seasoned convict Red (Morgan Freeman).  The film has enjoyed huge popularity and acclaim since its surprisingly passive 1994 release (perhaps due to the attention surronding Forrest Gump) and almost certainly deserves its label as a contemporary classic; few films carry such a magnetic, absorbing and attentive pull.  The result is something that not only ranks as great entertainment but a chance for the viewer themselves to enjoy and appreciate a first-class piece of screenwriting and film-making.

Comment Head: One of the best movies I have ever seen.
One of the best of the last 30 years
Comment Body: Best prison movie since The Great Escape.  One of the most satisfying climaxes of any movie ever made.  Morgan Freeman should have won the Oscar for best actor.  Relative unknown Bob Gunton (one of those actors you see, but you never know his name) is also brilliantly despicable as Warden Samuel Norton.  Like many classics, despite its modest box office appeal, Shawshank will grow in stature through the years and will be recognized as an all time great.

Comment Head: easily the best from stephen king...
Comment Body: watch it twice, thrice or how many ever times, the shawshank redemption is one movie that you can never call boring, especially for the way it has dealed with abstract terms like humanity and hope. the movie does have its flaws such as Red being the only guy who's hair has greyed after 33 yrs in prison. but then, when you watch such a great movie, these flaws are easily to be forgotten.what is to be remembered is the victory of the human spirit.

I've never imagined movie with such great depth, this one moved me!I think this must be some serious piece of film making in a long time. At some point of the film, I even felt like I'm a part of the movie. (I laughed with Andy and his pals at their lunch when they are talking about a 'new fish'. Wait a minute, I'm a prisoner!?)So when you're in the midst of hopelessness, this would be your life jacket.Cheers! (At the rooftop)

I watched Shawshank right after it's release on VHS and was completely overtaken by it. I went out and bought the video as soon as I could and to this day it remains the gem of my collection. It is simply the greatest movie ever made. No matter how many times I watch this film, it seems to get even better than the last. There isn't a single flaw anywhere in this movie! The greatest aspect though is Morgan Freemans narration. Nobody should go without seeing this movie at least once.

This very sophisticated and beautifully storytelling, the way a great movie is supposed to be.When I saw the trailers and clips from this movie when it was first released, I thought to myself; "Yeah right, another self-conscious Oscar-nominated prison dirge with it's heart fastened firmly to it's sleeve".  I expected it to be another "worthy" movie like CHATTAHOOCHEE or the usual 80s telemovie types.  It wasn't until I sat down and watched the tv release that i really got involved with the story.I particularly like the way the story has heart and feelings, but is not sappy or pretentious.  There is humour, pathos, tragedy, and irony in equal measure.  So if you're like me and usually don't like ponderous prison dramas, I reckon you should see this movie anyway, and you should  find that it's surprizingly refreshing storytelling.

I cannot believe this movie came out in 1994 and I just saw it for the first time today. I have been missing out! This is my new favorite movie of all time. If you haven't seen this movie yet,you MUST see it. It's Morgan Freeman's best work ever and he should have gotten an oscar for it. I have never liked Tim Robbins,but his performance deserved an oscar also.

This has to be my favourite film from a Steven King novel and one of my all time top ten.  The story is fantastically told and the acting brilliant-a real credit to one of the best stories for a long time.  I wont spoil the storyline for anyone who wasn't watched it but suffice to say you will not be disappointed.

Now, when i first was getting ready to watch this movie i didnt think it would be very good. But when i saw it i knew i was wrong. I think this is the best movie ever made. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins were perfect together. I have never seen a better on screen team!! YOU HAVE TO SEE THIS MOVIE!!

This is why people watch movies.  To escape from everyday life and sit completely absorbed in someone else's story.  And what a wonderful story it is.  On the outside it looks to be a sap of movie, the kind of movie that shamelessly wants to jerk some tears.  But it bold enough to break free from the prison of other formula films.  The cliches are all there and in familiar places but on a higher level and they are warm and welcome.  This is the kind of movie that I will finish watching and feel the need to rewind it and play it again.  This is truly one for the ages.

Just when one had thought no one can best outstanding movies like the Godfather along comes a movie like Shawshank, which simply blows the mind. It is a masterpiece of movie making and one which I never hesitate to watch - again and again. As long as movies like this come along every once in a few years, I will always have faith in the movies

The Shawshank Redemption was ,is and will always be the best movie ever. It has everything, drama, comedy, action, suspense,  adventure, great ending, and it kept getting better and better. It also has saddness, too. But more happiness. I will say it again, The Shawshank Redemption was the best movie, is the best movie, and always will be the best movie EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!

The first time I watched this movie, I thought to myself this could easily be one of my all time favorites.  The second time I watched it I knew it was my all time favorite.  This movie is about building relationships and getting a second chance.  The acting is superb and gave me a whole new outlook on Morgan Freeman as an actor.  His naration of the movie is excellent.

Comment Head: there's a reason for being one of the tops...
Comment Body: Great characters.  Beautifully filmed.  Moving...sad, yet beautiful and top shelf story telling.  There has to be enough accolades to warrant viewing this here so I won't blather on about what a great flick this was except to say it was.  Watch it and if you don't agree on it's placement...you must be...unbelievable.

Comment Head: THE BEST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN
Comment Body: This is my favorite movie of all time. But it is only for certain kinds of movie watchers. For people who only want to see action and certain female upper body parts this film is not for you. Ask any real movie watcher, they will all say that this is a great movie.

To say that "The Shawshnak Redemption" is a truly great film doesn't do it justice. Having read a lot of the comments already on here about this film, there really isn't much more I could add to it. *SPOILERS* However there are two things that might not have been said about his film. Regardless of how much I love this film and rank it very high. I have one problem with it & that is that it is too long. Mainly I say this because there are parts where this film could have ended and I would have been just as satisfied. My personal point for this film to end would have probably been when we see Andy Dufrense driving on the highway beside the Pacific. Either that or when Red narrates about how he hopes he can make it across the boarder and how he hopes to see his friend. The other comment I have about this film is that they tell you what is going to happen...in a way. The scene in which we hear of Andy's desire to "get busy living or get busy dying" The scene in which he wants to go to Mexico & open a hotel on the beach and fix up a boat & take his guests charter fishing. In that scene Red listens to Andy & then tells him "You shouldn't do this to yourself. This is just Sh!*ty pipe dreams." Hearing that after having seen the movie as many times as I have I thought it was amusing for that to be said. Still I would rank Shawshank in my Top Ten easily. Far and away the best movie of 1994 and was snubbed for Best Picture. Not to mention Morgan Freeman. But almost as bad was the fact that neither Tim Robbins nor Frank Darabont were even nominated. 9 1/2 out of 10

Comment Head: Sentimental yet strongly moving story of injustice, optimism, retribution

Comment Body: to me this is the greatest movie of all time...!IT has every thing a movie watcher could ask for.it's not too long it's not too short,it keeps you guessing,and the ending you wouldn't have guessed in a 1000 years.morgan freeman and tim robbins are absolutely wicked,MORGAN FREEMAN is one of best actors in the movies today...!

This is my favorite movie of all time and I have viewed it many times.  It is the only movie that produced quotes which I use in my life.  This movie flows from beginning to end, the characters are perfectly cast, and the story line is impeccable.  Can you imagine anyone other than Morgan Freeman doing the narration for this movie?  Anyone else as Andy Dufresne?  Get busy living or get busy dying..Damm Right!  This movie has one of the best final scenes ever filmed.

Comment Head: This film is just so damn good
Comment Body: I have never ever felt the feelings i felt watching the masterpiece of a movie, its really manages to play hard on the watchers emotions, I think I was feeling happy , then sad then angry and in the end a sense of justice...This film is probably the best film I have ever seen/felt it does the job 10-10

This is easily the best movie of the '90s.  Or maybe one of the best movies of the '90s.  Stephen King's sure does show us that he can make awesome books besides horrors.  He also made The Green Mile.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are excellent in this excellent movie.  they both should've won Academy Awards for this one.  Definitely.  I love this movie.  I must have saw this movie about 20 times.  It is as great as the critics say it is. The direction for this is amazing.Overall the whole movie is great and I am surprised that Stephen King made such a good novel.  I've made my mind for the best movie of the '90s. Rating 11 out of 10. (Best Movie of the '90s)

Comment Head: one of the best movies ever
Comment Body: i dont know what to see about this movie that hasn't already been said. as good as movie as forrest gump was, the only major award it should have won over shawshank was tom hanks as best actor. an argument can be made for zemeckis for director, but seeing as shawshank redemption is such a better movie, and most of the movie takes place in location, (shawshank prison) i think darabont is robbed not only for not winning the oscar, but not even scoring a nomination. and seeing as he would be the best director, i would think that if you're directed your film best it would logically be the best picture. tim robbins is also robbed of a nomination, and i think hanks just edges him for that trophy. the biggest travesty of all is that shawshank doesn't even win any of the oscars it was nominated for. if you havent seen this film recently, go pop it in the dvd or vcr and just sit back and revel in its magnificence.

Comment Head: Forget the IMDB Top 250 ranking- this is still a great movie.
One of the FINEST movies ever made...
Comment Body: Simply one of the FINEST movies ever produced by Hollywood. Great in all aspects - acting, story line, cinematography and dialogue!Dont miss this in your life time!I rate it 4 over 5

This movie is quite simply one of the greatest of all time.  I have never felt for characters in a movie like I have in this one.  It would have won the Academy Award for best picture if it weren't for Forrest Gump.  I love that movie too, however, I think Shawshank is a more enduring movie.  It's tale is more about the human spirit, and overcoming probably one of the most difficult situations anyone could ever face.

I absolutely LOVE this movie, and I've seen it many times over, but I've never thought of it in biblical terms before.  I'm also not very religious so the Christ parallel did not occur to me.  Now that you mention it, it's almost too obvious.

Comment Head: Alongside with Braveheart and Shindler's List one of the best movies of the '90s.
Comment Body: Fantastic film that dramatically and powerfully displays the strength of the human will. With unforgettable performances by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, The Shawshank Redemption is a masterpiece. Subtle use of color (moreso lack thereof) helps to generate moods and feelings that resonate with the gripping plot and near-perfect dialog. A must see.

Comment Head: A film that expands (and sometimes alters) your take on the world.

Comment Body: This is the best movie of all time!!!  It has all you need and more. Amazing performances by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins.  This movie is a CLASSIC and will stand the test of time.  The story has everything but it clearly presents the true ideas of friendship and relationships between people, especially under the worst situations.  Anyone who hasnt seen this movie- DONT WALK_ RUN- to see it!  It will stick with you forever

Comment Head: A modern masterpiece, simple yet supreme.

Comment Body: This would have to be one, if not the greatest movie i have ever seen. Why Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman and Frank Darabond did'nt win a thing from the work they put into it is so beyond me, this has the perfect quality of what Oscar Winning movies are made of. Compared with many other heart wrenching films made to date this movie is Good, Better, Best.

Comment Head: Everyone in the fam loves it!
Comment Body: One of the best movies I've seen, and one of only a few I am willing to watch more than once. The kids have even watched it more than me. The pacing is slow but constant and the tone it sets pulls you in from the start.

Comment Head: One of the Greatest Movies in the history of cinema
Comment Body: This film is destined to become a true classic. This masterpiece of filmmaking is worthy of its place on the Top 250 and should be #1. The film gives time to its characters and time to the story unlike other films. We see the world through the characters and feel as they do. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman give outstanding performances well worthy of an Academy Award. The ending is the greatest of any film and is so because of the time given to the characters and story. The score captivates the feeling of the film and gives the feel of Andy and Red's true redemption. This is a must have in any collection and deserves all the allure it has been given.

Hope. It¬¥s obviously "the" word that defines this movie. In fact, there¬¥s five reasons that makes this film almost perfect.1) An incredible fidelity to the original story by Stephen King 2) Great performances by both actors, Freeman and Robins. 3) A simply perfect ambientation 4) When you see it, you feel deep in your heart a new reason to live, no matter what 5) There¬¥s nothing "out of place".As Red, I hope this movie never dies. I hope that someday someone understands that is five million times better film than "Forrest Gump", his competitor on Oscar¬¥s. I hope that Frank Darabont makes another film such as this. I hope you read this. I hope.

Comment Head: Best Story leads to best Movie
The Shawshank Redemption, the movie of perfection
Comment Body: ***SPOILERS***   ***SPOILERS*** When I saw the movie for the first time I was a child of 8 years old I guess. I was completely obsessed by this movie. The movie took too much time so my parents didn't allow me to see the end of the movie. I was mad as you can understand ;) Now Im a boy of 16 years old and I saw the movie 8 times. Im a bit of a movie freak, if I have the time for it I watch one every evening. I have seen a lot of movies. But not such good as The Shawshank Redemption. This movie is a perfection. It has a perfect story. The movie is very long, but I have never bored while I was watching. The sound and music are also perfect. When Brooks leaves the prison and sees the daylife again the music is totally perfect. You are going to think about some things you have done in your life. That's the same when Andy escapes and arranges the beers for his friends. Red says about Andy when you him sitting in the sun (when he has arranged the beers) with a little smile on his face: 'I think he did it to feel normal again'. That are lines when you start thinking. And when Red is allowed to leave prison you got a kind of a winner feeling. Then he sees Andy again, that's the perfect end. This movie was not a simple prison breakout. But a movie with the best story I have ever seen. I can say to everyone that you have to see the movie. Im sure you will think the same way as I do. When you see it multiple times you will understand the movie better and better, and I hope you will love then as much as I do!

Comment Head: stephan king and frank darabont put together a masterpiece
Comment Body: when stephan king asked frank darabont to go behind the prison walls once again, it was a second match made in heaven (the green mile).  these are two of stephan king's best novel's brought to screen with darabont's master script writing.  why are they the best?  because they are actually believable and extraordinary tales which don't involve fantasy, magic or gothic horror.

This is the one and only film that even though it is over two hours, I wanted to watch it again, the second it finished. No other film has ever bought up such emotions from me. I will stand by this as The Greatest Film of all time proudly.

Comment Head: Odd that this movie is so high on the IMDB top-250....

Comment Body: When I first watched "The Shawshank Redeption", I thought it was a O-K movie. Something in the characters and the motion picture score would draw me back to see the movie again. Now, it is one of my all-time favorite movies. It is a classic. The story, adapted from a Steven King novel, stays true to the book. To me, there is something intriguing about a person changing his destiny, especially against all hope. The casting of the key players in the movie are right on target, and Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins work very well together. So, when you get a great script, talented actors cast properly, and a movie score that captures the mood and drama of the scene, it makes for a memorable movie.

What else is there to say about this movie?  Every single element is great from the direction all the way down to the score, which accents every moment fantastically.  And then there's the acting, which I cannot praise enough for everyone's excellent portrayal.  There is not a single moment in the movie which I felt an element to be untrue to how the characters would actually be all the way to the extras which is an extremely rare achievement.  But the thing that makes this so great is that for some reason it never seems to get old no matter how much I watch it, in fact, it even gets better and better because I realize how much of a gem this really is. If you are one of the few not to have viewed this, please do yourself a favor and watch one of the most incredible movies of our time.

Never have i seen a movie so well directed the script was genius....one of the best movies ive ever seen.....10/10 eaisly!!!  Morgan freeman and tim robbins made this movie work....if forest gump came out a year later this movie would have swept the oscars.

Comment Head: No Best Picture Oscar - Absolutely Criminal
Comment Body: This film is without a doubt, one of the all time classics. It has everything - drama, comedy, suspense. Watching this film leaves you with a good feeling - it makes you realise that true friendship is hard to find but something to really cherish.  The story of Andy & Red (The 2 main characters), and how they go about living in the prison is moving, gritty and very realistic. I recommend this film to everyone, young and old, it will appeal to everyone.  Its a brilliant film capped by a brilliant ending. 10/10

You know what would have made this movie a whole lot better? It's if at the end, when Red (Morgan Freeman) made his final long,windy speech to the parole board, he had been rejected onceagain, and the movie ended right there?  Maybe then I'd considerthe average rating (9.0) and rank (#2) on the IMDb top 250 list to bewell deserved.

This movie is absolutely the best movie I've ever seen. I can't help but sit down through this whole movie and not get up once even though I've seen it over and over again. Every part of the movie I'm saying to myself "I can't get up now, this is my favorite part". Although, my two favorite parts are the beer scene and the end of the movie. If you haven't seen this movie yet, go out and buy it. Don't rent it, you won't take it back!

Having seen such a movie again and again, you subconsciencly begin to look for flaws or errors that will somehow lift it off its pedestal, just so you can put your already tiresome mind at ease and not give it another thought. But with this movie, im still looking, so i'm beginning to got used to the fact that this movie will, and more than likely, always be jumping to the top of my mind whenever i try and define 'what a movie CAN be'.It's already a classic....

Frank Darabont's film based on Steven King's story is absolutely inspirational. Great performances all round and it keeps the viewer attached throughout. The Shawshank Redemption is quite long, yet you don't notice it, instead you notice the genius that has gone into this film's creation. See this film, no matter what your movie preference.

Simply - the best movie of all times.  Great performances from Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.  Delivers all emotions through a great story - laughter, sadness, joy, anger.  Really shows the range of Stephen King.  See it once and you'll want to see it again and again.

There is nothing that i can say that has not already been said in a very positive way about this movie.I simply loved it.I do wish however that a "Special Edition" DVD of Shawshank would be released that would include the 1 hour TV feature of all the actors making comments on it.The current dvd does not have enough included for a great movie of its stature. This movie will certainly become a classic.Watching this movie actually makes me feel proud to be human.It re-affirms my belief in mankind.Now if only every president,prime minister and leader would watch it and get the same feeling from it as i did......geez....maybe they would WAKE UP and realize that "Life Is To Short"....Get Busy Living or Get Busy Dying!!

There a few films that I have ever felt honoured to watch, and the Shawshank Redemption is one of them. Freeman and Robbins give career-defining performances. Really, I can only say - go out and rent it now. This is a truly inspirational film

Since everyone has already covered the bases, and don't feel like retyping all the same acclaims, I will simply say this touching, powerful film is single handedly one of the GREATEST FILMS EVER of the 20th Century!!!  If you haven't already seen it for the wonderful acting, wonderful plot or wonderful directing, see it for Morgan Freeman's stupendous performance alongside some other class actors!  This is one of his best works, which says a lot :o)

Comment Head: Transcends its source in leaps and bounds
This is my favorite movie of all time.
Comment Body: Many people seem confused why this movie is rated so high by so many.  I am confused how you can walk away from this movie and not think that is one of the greatest movies you have seen.  I am more baffled some people gave it a "1" rating.  To each his own I suppose.  For those who don't understand what makes this movie so great I will explain.*SPOILERS* Probably the number one thing about this movie is the acting.  Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins play the most believable and likeable characters ever.  The movie is like a good hit of ecstacy.  It builds up for so long that you really come to like Andy and hate the warden.  Then before the end he escapes, the warden throws the rock through the wall, the warden kills himself, and finally they are on a beach in Mexico.  All the special effects on earth couldn't give me a rush like the end of this movie.  It just creates this moving emotional feeling inside and you feel as vindicated as you know Andy and Red must feel.Of course there are many other great moments in the middle of the movie. For example, when they get to drink the beer and when the guy passes the test.  I could go on for hours about this movie so I'll stop now.

Like few movies do, the shawshank redemption capture that feel and atmosphere of a good movie. I find myself watching this movie over and over. It does a good job of wowing you whilst shocking you. Do yourself a huge favor and watch this movie!

This film is the best one-off ever made. From watching the Green Mile and from what I heard about the Majestic, it seems that Frank Darabont will never make a movie as good as this again. It is emotional, ambitious, and breathtaking in equal measure. The last 30 minutes are the best on celluloid.

Comment Head: Quite simply the best film ever made.
Comment Body: 'The Shawshank Redemption' is quite simply the best film ever to be produced. in no way, shape or form could it be improved in any way. there is absolutely nothing to fault about it. it is brilliantly written and the acting is second to none, Morgan Freeman is currently the second best actor in the world. The whole story is masterfully told with a severe twist in the tale that will leave even the most heartless of people feeling happy. Anyone who has not seen this film, must see it. for me, it deserves the accolade, 'A Spanking Piece Of Cinematography'.I love the shawshank redemtion and anyone involved with it.

On reading the comments of others left on the page i was surprised. I would rate this as worthy of being 3rd in the top 250. The film may not be an action packed ride from start to finish as you may expect a jail break to be, but this is because it is not what the film is meant to be about. If you have read Kings original short story you will see that the adaptation of this film does it justice, as so many attempts of making films from his books have not, with the exception of stanly kubrick's adaptation of the shining. The acting by tim robbins and morgan freeman only adds to the prominence of this film in expressing the adversity that was suffered by prisoners back in the 40's.

Comment Head: Not perfect but still I recommend it very much because it¬¥s a great film!
Comment Body: This film should not be(as many else films)in top 3 of the 250 best films ever made.First I want to say something about the acting, that is one of the things that makes this one so good.Morgan Freeman is fantastic and so is Tim Robbins(both of them are very good actors even if Freeman is better).The script is also fantastic and the whole complex of the film is brilliant.It¬¥s a film that might will bring you to tears, even if it in the end goes to far and everything becomes silly.I mean it could they could have cut out the last fifteen minutes but it¬¥s still a frightening film.The message in the film are that you will survive as long as you have hope.4,5/5

If you were to look at a plot synopsis for this movie, there is little chance that you would be interested in it. However having watched it on recommendation from a friend, I was staggered at how good this movie is. I don't know what it was, but something grabbed hold of me and made me appreciate this movie. Tim Robbins is excellent as Andy Dufresne and he never won an Academy Award is beyond me.After all the cliched buddy-buddy movies made in the 80's, it's nice to be able to sit down and watch a tale of genuine and lasting friendship.

If you haven't seen it yet, this picture will reaffirm hope in life, humanity and the movies.  Morgan Freeman proves himself as one of the best actors of our time.  Tim Robbins has a humble, underplayed style that fits well in the picture.  Probably one of the best scripts ever written.

This is one of the best movies I have come across. The acting of Tim Robbins is excellent but it is Morgan Freeman as Red who steals the show with a breathtaking performance. The story continually kept me interested and Tim Robbins' struggle against nearly every inmate in shawshank. Its possibly only his great friendship with Red that keeps him sane.It was also strange to see one of the sisters in the movie who continually try to rape Tim Robbins, played marine hard man Drake in "Aliens", which is also one of my all time favourites.Great movie. Rating 9/10.

Comment Head: One of the best pictures ever made
Comment Body: This is one of the best pictures ever made. The acting, directing, screenplay...are so wonderful! But, for the Academy, the best picture of 1994 was...Forrest Gump (!!!!!!!!!!!!). This movie must have win the oscar for Best Picture, Director, Adapted screenplay and direction of photography (at least). You will never forget this movie. Go to see it, now!

Comment Head: The film that started my love for dramas
Comment Body: ***SPOILERS***   ***SPOILERS*** I was twelve when I first saw this movie in 1998. I was flipping through the channels on my TV when I was first introduced to the character of Andy Dufresne. I watched with amazement and was fully absorbed by the happenings and events that took place. When a commercial break came on, I was impatient for it to end so I could find out what would be next. The beginning of the movie has Andy being imprisoned for the murder of his wife and her lover. He says he didn't do it. And I believed he did, until the plot twister changed my whole perspective. Red is the man narrorating, and to me, is the main character about how is life is changed around over the twenty years he knows Andy. And if it's anything that made me cry, it was at the end where Red is finally free. This film started my compassion for movies with meaning behind them, and if you view this picture, be ready for a new look on life.In other words, DON'T pass this movie by. Enjoy!

Comment Head: One of the greatest film ever!
Comment Body: Great movie, I have seen this movie almost 100 times, and i guess i can see it another 1000 times more.it leaves a such a great effect on me, which is hard to explain in words. Just Love it!:)

Comment Head: A Perfect Gem of a Film

Comment Body: This is an excellent movie. I usually get depressed watching prison movies. Even though the pace of the movie was slow, it is so well made that it keeps your interest alive all the time. The narrative style also added to the relaxed pace. I am sure anybody who watched the movie would come out feeling good about life. The message is pretty clear - even though the obstacles in life seem to be daunting and often impossible to overcome, with hope, will-power and dedication, everything is achievable. Tim Robinson and Morgan Freeman were simply great and played their roles to perfection. I also liked the concept of institutionalization - after a while some people would rather want to be in prison than be faced with a whole new world which has changed so much from what they were used to.

Comment Head: Is this the greatest movie ever made?
Comment Body: It is certainly the best prison movie. It's definitely the best outing for Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. It's certainly the best movie of the 90's.If you haven't seen it - buy it for your collection today!

Comment Head: No other movie portraits the triumph of the human spirit like The Shawshank Redemption Does
Comment Body: This is probably the best movie of all times! It is certainly my favorite movie ever. Tim Robbins does an outstanding job here! I don't think there is another movie that captures the triupmh of the human spirit. It is certainly inspirational. Andy Dufresne is the perfect example of perseverence and faith. Excellent movie!

Great movie, great actors.Tim Robbins & Morgan Freeman really blows your mind in this motion picture.Andy & Reds partnership is well worth while. Andy is - as promised, full of surprises and saves his best for last.

Comment Head: To those of you who think this movie is overrated...
Comment Body: I've heard alot of people say this movie is overrated, but none of them seem to remember to give a comparison.  If this movie is undeserving of its status as one of the best movies ever, then what movie is better?  I'd really like someone to supply an alternative so I could rip their choice apart and show them exactly why it's not as good.

Has to undoubtedly be one of the best movies of all time.  Casting, acting, plot, cinematography, musical score.  Everyone should see this movie to know what a good movie is.  The plot twist at the very end was in itself a work of art.  10/10.

**** SPOILERS HEREIN**** proceed at own risk!!!!!it is simply no wonder that shawshank redemption is as insanely popular as it is. the movie is the greatest flag-bearer for hope and the determination. i have been wanting to see this movie for a long time and recently caught it on television as part of a stephen king horror special series!!!!the movie begins at quite a slow pace and after about half an hour i was wondering why this movie was so highly rated. but slowly the movie unravels and soon i was totally caught up in its brilliance. sometimes harsh, sometimes serene, sometimes wishful, sometimes dreadful. the intensity of the despondence at shawshank prison is almost tangible.tim robbins and morgan freeman are outstanding in their roles. each character is brilliantly etched and is a delight to watch. the screenplay is the highlight of the movie and there is always a feeling of something larger lurking behind the damp grey walls of shawshank.for those who have seen the movie, an interesting point would be that the name of stephen king's novella is "rita hayworth & the shawshank redemption". well well!!the movie though has to be watched. it is an experience every human should go through. it takes the light at the end of the tunnel to the next plane.an elevating 10!!

A film is only as good as the after effect that it leaves on you. Shawshank leaves you with a warm glow of fulfilness, which in my opinion is matched only by The Usual Suspects. Tim Robbins, gives a once in a life time performance, as the silver spoon banker wrongly thrown into prison.The plot is second to none... which is one of the reasons this film is loved by so many. The simple but involving story grabs you, so as you feel almost at one with the prisoners, only to then reveal the clever twist at the end. At which you realise how you never were a part, but only a pawn in this masterpiece.

Comment Head: Perhaps the best prison story ever
Comment Body: Tim Robbins gives the performance of a lifetime as Andy, a man wrongly accused of killing his wife and her lover.  He is an unconventional prisoner who forms a friendship with Red, played brilliantly by one of the greatest actors of his generation, Morgan Freeman.To give away any more of the story is a crime, because this is an incredible movie that needs to be seen by everyone.  I give "The Shawshank Redemption" a 10 out of 10.

If you didn't like The Shawshank Redemption, then you don't understand the concept of the film.  Shawshank is the epitome of good film-making -- a fresh, interesting, verisimilar, detailed story coupled with acting that makes Tim Robbins stand out in my mind as Andy Dufresne himself.  The imagery is beautiful, the story has few, if any, holes, and Morgan Freeman plays the character of Red, the film's narrator, exceedingly well.  To those who find it unnatural that a murderer has matured into a wise, thoughtful man during a long tenure in prison, I suggest that there is no more logical place for such a transformation.  Red has had 20 years (upon Andy's arrival) to think about the crimes of his youth, and has grown as a  result.   In short, Shawshank is a movie for people who like good stories.  It will make you laugh, it might make you cry, and in the end, you'll simply feel good about life itself.

I had been meaning to watch this movie for a long time, but I got the chance only yesterday, when I watched it on HBO. I can only say that for eight years I had missed a chance to witness a brilliant work. Tim Robbins is really good, so is Morgan Freeman. But the movie is not about any central character. The movie as a whole is devastatingly perfect. I saw Forrest Gump and thought it was awesome, deserving of the Oscar. But eight years since, I have to change my mind...

Comment Head: One of the finest movies of all time.
The best movie I have ever seen.
Comment Body: I just can't find a single flaw with this movie.  It's so perfect.  The acting is fantastic, the character development is superb, the plot and script is incredible.  I bought the DVD and never get tired of watching it.  This movie truly belongs among the greats, such as The Godfather, Citizen Kane, and Schindler's List, and this is the only movie I would place above the others in this elite group. There is no single element that makes it such a fantastic movie; the combination of every aspect of the movie being executed perfectly makes it great.  A true masterpiece.

Tim Robbins plays innocence man send to jail for his wife's murder. Morgan Freeman plays his closes friend in jail and forming an unlikely pair of buddies. They never give up the dreams of escape outside of prison. There are certain points you miss the first time watching the Shawshank Redemption. This movie does more that entertain, it make you think how something is planned.

Comment Head: This is a truly great movie. See it!
Comment Body: No long summary here.   It's about two guys in prison, that probably don't belong there, that have lots of time to reflect on life.  You will like them.  The characters are deep.  They will remind you of real people.  You will feel richer as a person after seeing this movie.  It's inspirational, philosophical, yet doesn't preach.  Beautifully filmed, acted, and directed. It doesn't get much better than this.

This movie is the best drama I have ever seen. The acting was powerful. The plot was powerful. The mood was powerful. It must just be luck or if not, extreme skill to make a movie so good as this. Every actor in this movie takes life as serious as he really would in life, from the evil warden to Red to Andy--they all make it worth while. This is probably one of the few good prison movies out there (Green Mile was excellent too), but it is soooo great! The ending makes it all worth while also, being the best part of the movie (I'm not going to say any spoilers, but just let me say that you'll find out a lot more than you expected). I can't imagine how much pain you would have to go through to be wrongfully imprisoned for so many years. If you are sensitive about subjects like this, don't see the movie. But if you love drama at any level, I HIGHLY recommend this movie to you. It definitely deserves its high rank in the top 250. Go ahead and see it--you won't be disappointed. 10/10.

In life we are all challenged with gross injustices.  To some it may be being passed over for a promotion, or to others it may be something as trivial as being served the wrong plate at a restaurant.  How we deal with those injustices shape our lives or end our lives.  In Shawshank we see how one man is dealt with one of the largest injustices known to man, and accepts the injustice.  He never asks for sympathy, for he believes in a way he deserves his fate.  However, when the new world that he enters deals him a new hand of unfairness, our man once again accepts the misdeeds that are dealt him.  The irony of the story is the only illegal thing that our man Andy does is what sets him free and redeems his life.

Haven't seen this for a couple years, guess I should give it a try again. It was enjoyable and clever at turns, but a little formulaic.  I was also very bothered by the lack of racism portrayed in the film.  Racism is a very bad thing, but it was also so very pervasive in the 1930's that portraying it as basically nonexistent is tantamount to historical revisionism.  That left a bad taste in my mouth.

Comment Head: superbly written and acted, worth seeing and seeing again
Comment Body: Probably the best Stephen King film adaption ever, but you don't have to be a King fan to enjoy this awesome movie. The plot centers around the (wrongful?) incarceration of Maine banker Andy Dufresne(excellently portrayed by Tim Robbins) after being convicted for the murders of his wife and her lover. However, the film (AND story....read it) go beyond that and detail the cruel, corrupt inner workings of the prison, the emotional and mental state of the inmate, and the conflict of inner bars versus outer ones. The supporting cast is also uncommonly good, led by heavyweight character-actor Morgan Freeman as the veteran con "get-it-guy" Red. With moments of brutality, beauty, humor, and an unexpected twist, The Shawshank Redemption is easily one of the best films in recent cinematic history.

Shawshank Redemption is a great film. This is one of the best dramas ever made, and probably Morgan Freeman's best film.  One of the reasons why it was so good is the voice-over in the film. Morgan Freeman has a superb reading voice and works well as a narrator. I think the best scene is when Andy plays the opera music and all the prisoners look up to the speakers as if it is a God or idol.  It shows a glimpse of freedom in the eyes of the prisoners. Also the story-line was excellent, but I dont think that it was explained clear enough what happened in the beginning. But it still is one of the best films made.

"hope is a good thing. maybe the best of things. and no good thing ever dies."with a line like that, how can it not be good? King is a genius of writing. Darabont is a genius of directing. dream team.

Movies are all made for a purpose, most of those purposes are to make money - heck if they dont make money they cant make a movie, but some movies go beyond just trying to make a buck and really stand out as one of the best in their genres.This is one of those movies.

This is one of my favorite movies of all time.  The story is exciting, intriguing, and believable.  That acting is some of the best I have ever seen and you really feel involved with characters.  It really makes you think and is highly entertaining.  Morgan Freeman is one of my favorite actors and his performance is once again mesmerizing.  Its one of those movies you don't mind seeing over and over again.  I loved it.

I realize it every time I see this movie... This is the best movie I have ever seen! It's just great! I mean, the story is strong and so are the actors. The music fits perfectly in the movie and it's one of the most clever movies I've seen. After seeing this movie for the first time in '96 I thought WOW! I went to rent it and watched it again. It got my attention that it was based on a novel. So I ordered the novel. It's my favorite book now. I must have read it more then ten times. After that I saw the other stories were filmed too. So I went to rent them too. They are very good too, but The Shawshank Redemption is the best. 5 Years later I'm one of Stephen King's and Tim Robbins' biggest fans in the world. Everybody who hasn't seen it yet: take my advise and watch it. You'll share my opinion: it's the best movie you'll ever see. Now it's finally available on DVD in Holland too, so I can watch it with hopefully lots of extras...

This movie was an apparent outcast at the theaters because I never even remember ever hearing about it.  However, thanks to TNT and TBS this movie has become my favorite movie of all time!! It's moving and entertaining. It captures your attention and is intriguing enough to keep you focused. WOW, what an awe-inspiring masterpiece!

This is the greatest movie of all time.  It is based on a Stephen King novella.  He is the best author there is.  This movie stars Morgan Freeman. One of the best actors there is.  This is a highly emotional masterpiece. It draws you and and does not let go until it wants to.  A great date movie. A great anything movie.  See it.

And what a way to say it! Until this one, I have never before rated a movie 10. It is by all accounts the best movie I have ever seen. Frankly I felt a little bit bored by the story but suddenly it was as if the story had taken a turn and everything fell into place. The first two thirds of the movie started making perfect sense. Then it takes another turn, perfectly underlined by Morgan Freeman's marvellously confused expression being questioned by the warden. From this part on the movie is a bit more ordinary but still a beautiful drama.The Marriage of Figaro has gotten new meaning.

Wow, this film was really something! I'm glad I started to watch all the top films of imdb.com's "All time Top 250 Movies" list. Sure, The Godfather triology and Seven Samurai were great movies too, but they were way too long and I felt they rather gave me pain in the buttocks than a touch in my mind. This movie, on the other hand, has this distinguished feature; you don't want it to end. I haven't felt that way since I watched the Matrix at the cinema back in its old glory days (that goes for both the movie The Matrix and cinemas, they're out of date nowadays :)). It also made very clear to me that I never want to go to an american prison, just as little as I would like to go to a turkish prison...

This is one of those rare films that actually exceeds the book by which it was based upon.  It's that good.  Not only is this a damn good  flick, it actually made me a fan of Tim Robbins and told me what I already knew about Morgan Freeman; He's one of the best actors alive.  I really can't say much more.  This is one of my favorite movies ever and there is no way that I can make that point any clearer.  If, for some reason, you haven't already seen this, go get it now!!!  If you don't, you're seriously depraved.  What a movie!!!!

I read a review once that said "If you are not even feeling slightly uplifted by the end of this movie, you are made of stone." I couldn't have said it better. Some scenes may not sit well with the easily disturbed, but there you are.Go see it. 9/10.

Unfortunately I did not get to see this film in the theaters.  When this film was released in 1994 I had grown tired of the "prison" movie.  I had already seen TANGO & CASH (T&C) and LOCK UP (LU) both of these films starred Sylvester Stallone.  I had also seen Death Warrant (DW) with Jean Claude Van Damme and figured that this would just be another run of them mill movie about a guy wrongfully imprisoned.  Eventually I rented this film and boy was I wrong!  Unlike the earlier mentioned films this was not an action flick but an emotional story about the hardships of prison life and the struggle an inmate encounters trying to maintain hope of eventually leaving the prison.  I so enjoyed this movie that I obtained the original novel and found that while there are some changes to the story they are relatively minor and do not detract from the theme of the story.  In my review I will compare the book to the film.  Spoilers may be present in the review.1.  In the book Andy Dufresne is in jail until 1975.  In the movie he is only in jail until 1967.2.  In the book Andy's poster at the time of his departure is one of Linda Ronstadt.  In the movie it is Raquel Welch.3.  In the book Andy served time under several wardens and head guards.  In the movie Warden Norton was in office for Andy's entire prison stay as was the head guard Byron Hadley.  Actually in the book Byron Hadley was the head guard when Andy arrived in Shawshank and had retired by the time Norton became warden.  4.  In the book Red is describe as Irish and although no reference is made to his race I assumed he was white.  In the movie Red is black being portrayed by Morgan Freeman, and the character Red indicates that he is Irish.  While this does not contradict the book I think by making Red an African American it differed from most readers conception of Red.  However, Morgan Freeman did such a fine job in the role of Red it is impossible for me to think of anyone else in that role.5.  In the book Andy, with help from a friend in the outside world, invests all his money prior to his arrest under a false identity so that when he leaves Shawshank he has money to start over with.  In the movie Andy departs with Warden Norton's ill gotten gains to start his new life.6.  In the book no warden commits suicide and no prisoner is killed after the warden stages a fake escape attempt.  Both these acts occur in the move.There are other small differences between the movie and the book but none that alter the overall story.  I would suggest to all that this story is worth reading and watching.  There is a reason that it is ranked so high in IMDB's ranking chart.  Just a bit of trivia for Stephen King fans.  The character of Andy Dufresne also has a key cameo role in Stephen King's book APT PUPIL.  It is Andy Dufresne that unknowingly helps escaped Nazi henchman Kurt Dussander set up a life in America.  This occurs while Andy is working at the Maine bank prior to going to Shawshank.

I've been hearing a lot of positivt things about this movie for a long time, and finally I had the opportunity to watch it myself.My expectations were high, but to be honest I didn't expect it to be this good! This film is just excellent, and I warmly recommend it to everyone!

as with many others i first saw this film on video and after watching it i was stunned by what is a very simple story told in such a way that at the end of the film i knew i had watched a cinematic masterpiece. the performances of robbins and freeman are excellent but i believe all the cast make this film what it is. a modern classic

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever made
Comment Body: This movie is excellent. That is the best word to describe this movie.
