Tim Robbins was in top form as Andy who claims innocence to the criminal charge of murder and Morgan Freeman was very believable as Andy's friend, Red. I found this film to be very real yet at the same time it had a layer of magic to it. The characters were all very interesting to watch, some warm and brotherly, others frightening and souless. Even though I am female, I felt a kinship to Andy and found myself in his corner routing for him the whole time. He did not fail those of us that were watching. A definate in my personal top ten.
this is the best film that I have seen it is breathtaking the plot is excelent and the ending is magnificent

Comment Head: The Triumph of the Human Spirit
Comment Body: CONTAINS SPOILERS "The Shawshank Redemption" is a film about banker Andy Dufrense(Tim Robbins) who is framed and sent to a maximum security prison for the murder of his wife and her lover.He befriends Red Redding(Morgan Freeman), who is the only guilty man in Shawshank, the prison.  Through a few brutal years, Andy finally manages to get through.  He helps prisoners graduate high school, opens a prison library, and works on the taxes for the crooked warden(Bob Gunton). Little does anybody know what his secret is, an escape.Based on a short story by Stephen King from 'Different Seasons', this is the best film about the triumph of the human spirit.  Frank Daranbot delivers a top notch drama.  This film also features an excellent musical score by Thomas Newman.  Morgan Freeman delivers,in my opinion, his best role.  Though a little cruel at some points, this film will make you want to see it again.  One of the three best films of the 1990s.  Second on my all time list.

Comment Head: This wasn't supposed to be comedy... oh, well
Comment Body: Like "Pearl Harbor," (AAAHHH!) this film had comedy despite the fact that it was a drama. For example, when Andy is ordered to turn off music that is annoying to the Warden (but not to the rest of the prison... they just listen), Andy turns it up!But, unlike "Pearl Harbor" (AAAHHH!), this film actually needed a bit of GOOD laughter, whereas "PH" (AAAHHH!) was laughable in itself, with unneccesary BAD comedy.Anyway, I read the novella first and let me tell you, the film (edited-I watched on TNT) has many differences and add-ons. For example, that bit of comedy wasn't in the book (heck, NO comedy was in the book). Also, (spoiler) when Andy has disappeared, the Warden didn't throw his hand-carved chess pieces at the poster-he tore it down. Also, the novella wasn't 100 pages, whereas this movie (on TNT, with commercials and edits) was 3 hours whole!I am STILL deciding on where to put this better-than-most-films-these-days movie on Favorites list. I am tempted to put it near the top (not at the top-there are better films), but somewhere online someone said that it was a middle-movie (an okay one). Another person declined, but after watching again, they agreed. So, I'll put it somewhere in the middle.I liked it very much, but it's not my favorite movie ever, nor the second. Rather... ah, heck, I can't decide right now!Rating: 4.5/6

This I have to say was one of my favorite movies of all time. I didn't see it until 1998 though. I had heard about it, but never actually had seen it. But when I did, I went out and bought it on video. I've always liked Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins has become a favorite of mine too. For some reason I like prison movies. It's just the suspense that really gets me. Movies like Escape From Alcatraz, The Green Mile, Instinct, and The Last Castle are among my favorites. To anyone who has not yet seen this movie, go rent it tonight, you will not be disappointed!

I have a rather small film collection, but "The Shawshank Redemption" is one of the movies that is a part of it.  This film is done beautifully, from the soundtrack to the acting.  I'm no film critic, so I'll leave the in-depth reviews to those who are more capable, but I will say that if you haven't seen this film, make the trip to the video store.I give it a 10.

I have never been impressed so much by any movie like I have been by " the shawshank redemption " This movie flows like a river. The further you get in the story the more it captures you emotionally and before you know it you are one with it. The story is about triumph of human spirit. Amazing..........WOW.I proudly own a DVD copy of this movie and sure will be watching with my grand children. Although lot of people are are amazed that this movie didn't win an oscar, all I will say is this movie deserved beyond Oscar. An Oscar would have tried to imply that this movie is in class with the others, which it is not.

Comment Head: I'm not that biased--ok, I am. Still worth reading, though.
A masterpiece that leaves you feeling changed.

Comment Body: This film says everything about the world we live in today, but most importantly give us a sense of hope in our future existence. As a film which basic plot, if considered could of so easily been a flop at the box office. Shawshank turns out to be a movie of the ages, through it stunning cinematography, editing and directing, in no way forgetting its remarkable ensemble crowned in my opinion by the astronomically well realised narration of Morgan Freeman. Tim Robbin execution of Andy not only boasts an inate sense of naturalism that Stanislavski himself would be proud of but characterisation that conveys all emotion that encycles the movie. I short a movie of a generation and of the ages. A must see for any true fan of cinema.

Comment Head: Simply the very, very, very, very best

Comment Body: I've always loved this film. Today I got to see the top 250 of IMDB for the first time and couldn't believe my eyes. There it is, numero duo, number two! But it is there for a reason. This movie is a work of art (that's rare nowadays). The prison environment, the relaxing sound of Morgan Freeman as a story teller and the atmosphere are a combination that makes you almost part of the film. I just can't find the right words to describe the film, but it is still a piece of art. For those who still haven't seen this film: Enjoy.

With L.A. Confidential running a close second, this is the best film in a surprisingly good decade for movies.  Finally, somebody gets Stephen King right.  The film is based on one of his short novellas, and director Frank Darabont absolutely nails it.  Of course, he has a lot of help from Morgan Freeman, Tim Robbins, Bob Gunton, Clancy Brown, and Gil Bellows.  All give amazing performances.  Throw in Darabont's screenplay, Roger Deakins' cinematography, and Thomas Newman's score, and you have a bonafide masterpiece.  If you don't dig this movie, please check your pulse.It's a real shame Hollywood did not know how to market this back in 1994, because word-of-mouth came too late for the film to make money or win the Oscars it deserves.  So when you see Shawshank for the first time, you'll wonder how in the hell Forrest Gump won best picture.  To this day, I've never left a movie theater feeling better than when I saw The Shawshank Redemption.

Comment Head: I can't express it in words but I've written a 68 word review!
Comment Body: This is a sad film. Its extremely good but its also black in the way that a brick wall in front of a motorway is dangerous. Until the last two minutes its an unrelenting depression. Bang! its sad (the sound of its dark feelings hitting my head.) I can't say anything about this movie. Its beyond good. It is FAULTLESS. Watch it! Then you try an review it.

In my opinion, the best film ever made.  This film is totally plot driven, and is totally unique in story-line.  The directing and cinematography are astounding, with aerial views of Shawshank prison. One example of this is when Andy plays "Duettino-Sull 'Aria" from "The Marriage of Figaro".  The camera flies up into the sky like a bird, while all the inmates look up at the speaker.  Truly an amazing film.  WATCH IT!!!!!

I was stunned when I saw The Shawshank redemption for the first time. Now, more than almost 20 times later, I still can't believe the Academy awards jury, how could they not think this the best movie of all times. So moving, so genial, so breathtaking, just great! The first time I saw the movie I 'didn't really intend to watch it, but as it came out, I couldn't stop watching. You really feel for Andy, you really get involved. And than the ending. Who could have thought.....

Superb acting, superb cast , superb story, superb setting, just a very superb film.It is a great shame that this film was released during the time Forrest Gump came out, otherwise it would have done a lot better at the box office.However, I am glad to see that it is finally getting the acclaim it deserves. SPOILER ALERT I have only seen this film once , but my mum suggested that i watch it and i was blown away by how much this film touched me. This film is far better than Forrest Gump, and has  more emotion to it. I nearly cried when the librarian hung himself when he left prison.Many of my family and friends class this film as one of the best films of all time and in our household we own 2 copies of the film, one  which i own and one which my mum owns. We are both big movie buffs and regard this film as being one of the best and greatest films we have ever seen.

Wow, what can I say. This film just blew me away entirely. I was never much of a Tim Robbins fan, but now I want to see everything he's in. He carries off his role in this movie with this wonderful quiet dignity and patience. I recommend this film very highly.

Comment Head: One of the great love stories
Comment Body: When I look at the IMDB Top 250 list, I am generally dismayed by both the films that are missing and those that should not be there. However, I am delighted to see The Shawshank Redemption right up at number 2. This movie is absolutely superb, far surpassing the story on which it was based. The plot is brilliant, and once again it shows Morgan Freeman to be one of the greatest actors of all time; it amazes me that he has been given so few awards.When Tim Robbins was interviewed, he called this a "love story", and that is exactly what it is - a story of a wonderful (and completely non-sexual) love between two men, a love that is born in an incredible hell-hole and helps to raise them out of it. It's the sort of movie you can watch over and over again and never get tired of it.

This movie is one of the best dramas that I have ever seen.  The movie follows the life of a hot shot banker who is convicted for the murder of his wife and her lover.  He proclaims throughout the movie that he is innocent however.  As the movie progresses we see things inside this prison that we hope never really happens.  There are incidents of brutality, graft, and even murder.  The guards of the prison use the main character, Andy Dufresne, talent as a banker to do their tax returns and the warden uses him to make a fortune.  Andy said it best when he said, "The funny thing is - on the outside, I was an honest man, straight as an arrow. I had to come to prison to be a crook."  Everything was different inside the prison.  This movie shows that no matter what the conditions are they can never completely break someone's spirit which is shown by this movie's happy ending.

Comment Head: Quite possible one of the best films ever.
Comment Body: When this movie first cam eout, I didn't know much about it, my mother, who had seen it, had mentioned something about it being "very good" amd a "prison movie." I managed to catch it abotu a year later on the Movie Channel, I have to tell you, I sat in awed silence for the next two hours.   Shawshank Redemption isn't just a movie about a bunch of guys in a prison, it's a movie about hope, friendship, and "coming through clean in the end." The film is slightly over two hours long, and involving an amazing cast of well acted characters, amazing aerial shots, a wonderful score of music, and inspiration, and the ability to find strength in yourself, that maybe you didnt' know was there. It was a shame this film came out the same year as Forrest Gump, this deserved every award it was nominated for, I highly recommend to anyone to see this film, because it is among one of the best i've ever seen.

Comment Head: No bad word could possibly be said against this film.
Comment Body: When I first saw this film I was completely blown away, it was on T.V. late at night and I was recording it after hearing about it, but after it began I couldn't stop watching it, then again the next day. This film can not be viewed by anyone just once, everybodies performance in this film is excellent, most notably the lead characters. direction, writing, just everything is amazing, and the way it makes you feel when the film ends is quite unlike any film I have ever seen, and doubt ever will again. This is a film that EVERYBODY just HAS to see, something that I have been telling all my friends since.To illustrate how good this film is I was once asked what my favourite films were, I was in a big group of people, in which many walks of life were represented, I mentioned the Shawshank Redemption and every single person there gave out a sigh of appreciation and a slow nod.

Comment Head: How Raquel Welch got back on the wall
Comment Body: jake1st@yahoo.com asked:  "Finally, can someone please tell me how he got that poster of Racquel Welch back on the wall after he climbed frontways into that tunnel?"For someone who was apparently closely observing this film, you should have noticed how it was attached to the wall. It was hanging from above. Thus Andy Dufresne would only have to lift it up (like a flap) and it would flap back down behind him.Watch it again if you don't believe me. I believe this is shown twice, if not more.

Comment Head: Saying this is the best film ever made is like claiming McDonalds to be the finest restaurants in the world
Comment Body: I am very disapointed to see that this very average american hollywood film is rated as high as #2 on the top 250.Seeing as the many dozens of reviewers has written before me I will only state why this film qualifies as one of the most overrated films of history.The ONLY thing this movie has is the story and the cutting filmnarratology and even this does not stand out from the rest very much. Based on a mediocre book, this film is a good display of craftsmanship, not art. The way the film tells its story is not creative or new in any way, instead it follows existing hollywood tradition by the book.

Comment Head: the ultimate tale of hope in the face of adversity
Comment Body: Shawshank needs to be watched more than once to fully appreciate it. This is a story that is so disparaging at times you want to cry for the character, its so totally immersing that by the end, you feel everything that they feel and along with the happy ending, is laced the whole tragic waste of life that leaves you feeling sad as well. The film itself is simply the finest piece of film making in history. There are no self-indulgent filming techniques used, no abstract elements to the story and the acting is sincere.Based on a story by Stephen King, your getting a character driven story that is acted superbly, the part of Red, played by Morgan Freeman could not have been cast any better, he is utterly superb, as is Andy, played by Tim Robbins and the rest of the supporting cast.If you haven't seen this film, shame on you! You owe it to yourself..

This has got to be the best film that I have ever seen. It is Funny, Emotional and thoroughly enjoyable...It makes you search for a better side of yourself. And it just makes you feel good about yourself. And realise that "Hope, Will set you Free".

Comment Head: One of the best film ever made
Comment Body: The first time i saw the Shawshank Redemption i hadn't heard much about it. It was recommended to me by my big brother who had seen it in school. I was amazed, never had i seen such a capturing movie. I was stunned, and especially because this movie had not spend millions of dollars on hi-fi special effects. Tim Robbins played brilliant, I dont understand that he isn't payed as much for his films as; Tom Cruise or Tom Hanks, they couldn't have played this role as convincing as he did, he was fantastic. This is truely one of the great master pieces of the past century.

One of, if not the best movie ever made. A classic that will last forever. If you have not yet seen this movie, do yourself a favor and BUY it, don't rent it. This is a movie you should own. I'm not a person who only likes certain genres of film. I watch all kinds of different films and this is at the top.

Comment Head: the archetypal battle of good v. evil
Comment Body: Based upon a novella written by Stephen King, The Shawshank Redemption is unique in that its delivery is more effective as a motion picture than as a work of literature. Enter Andy Defresne- a man convicted of crimes that he did not commit. Such is his reality, and our deepest fear. Tim Robbins offers a stellar performance, depicting a realistic character weighed down by his situation, yet while in the presence of this adversity he does not abdicate hope. His tenacity is unparalleled, and is undoubtedly a characteristic to be admired, if not imitated. Accompanying this man?s quest is a case study of the corruption inherent in American corrective facilities. While many atrocities are brought to light, the resulting product is one of the most life affirming movies I have ever viewed as Andy eventually reaches his 'destination.'

This film never loses its quality no matter how many times you watch it. When I had access to a DVD player, it was one of the first films I bought.I have had a bereavement in the family recently and watching this film certainly lifted my spirits.

Comment Head: The best film you will ever see
Comment Body: I have watched this film so many times, it was my first buy when I bought my DVD player. It is the way that Andy triumphs over the system that can't help but put you in a good mood

This film is certainly not disposable, it stays with you for a long time after you watch it.  I have to say that of all the films I have ever watched this is the most captivating.  I remember going to the cinema when it was first out and only choosing it because I had missing the beginning of another picture; how fortunate I was.  To see it on the big screen made the full directing and acting quality of this film apparent from the start, this is not lost on the small screen.  It truly is a classic and I cannot imagine any other film knocking it off my top spot

Quite possibly. Never before have I seen a film that has satisfied me in every way. The story line is excellent, the acting superb. The way the story fits together is wonderful. I cried tears of joy at the finish, partly because I was so happy for the characters, and partly because I realized I had watched one of the best films ever.

After seeing this movie a number of times, I felt time it was about time I commented on it. IMHO this is one of greatest movies of all time. It has been called a "feel-good" film but I disagree with this it is in fact a joyful movie. Its story acting, direction, location in fact everything are incredible. The movie touches a person on so many different levels; the hate for the "sisters", the sorrow and the joy for Andy, the beauty of their friendship and the feeling that everything could be resolved in the world if there were more films like this.To actually rate this movie on any kind of grade is wrong as it exists of level all of its own

this film is quite simply "the greatest film of all time" and I could wax lyrical about it all day, but I probably would'nt do it any justice by doing this.I saw an programme made by channel 4 (u.k. tv channel) which basically took you through the film, and how this powerful film has effected people's lives. It didn't surprise me, but never the less really does sum up the effect this film can have on some people, when the presenter said that this film has actually stopped some people commiting suicide, because as these people said " it gave them hope ". Truely I think this is an amazing thing, and the ultimate accolade to the best film I have ever seen.

The Shawshank Redemption is one of those films of which people used to say "they don't make 'em like that anymore". Well, Frank Darabont had the courage to do it and the world owes him a debt of gratitude. With the advent of the 90s there was the feeling that Hollywood, and Hollywood audiences, could never again accept such a thoughtful, emotional and "feelgood" movie as Shawshank. It shouldn't have been made in this era but thank God it was. Stick it in black and white and it could quite easily have come right out of the 50s along with It's A Wondeful Life. Most 90s films to which the critics automatically responded with the word "classic", Pulp Fiction, American Beauty, Fight Club, may or may not endure "the test of time" but there's no such doubts about The Shawshank Redemption. It is a true classic.

The first time I saw this movie it took my breath away, everytime I have watched it since it still has the same effect on me! One of my favourite films of all time!!!!!!!! I have recommended it to other people who have said 'it's only a prison movie', but after they have seen it they ALL changed their minds! And agree is a life changer not just a movie.

This is the best film I have ever seen. there where so many twists and more than one plot running at the same time. A great piece of film making. I feel the ending was the perfect ending, I know how they where going to end the film, with Morgan Freeman on the bus hoping to see his friend. my all time best film.

Comment Head: Call the police!!!!! There's been a robbery!
Comment Body: (Note: Some plot-spoilers included)Yes! That's right!  The Shawshank Redemption would like to report that it was robbed of seven thoroughly deserved Oscars.Why? From it's ascentive messages of hope to the powerful redemptive affects felt - not only by the characters but also the audience, Frank Darabont has created a true masterpiece.We all know that Freeman and Robbins provide superlative performances, while less credit is often given to James Whitmore as Brooks - the backdrop to Red's ultimate redemption - showing what could have happened to Red without Andy.  An amazing assortment of minor characters litter this film, and while admittedly there are a lot of prison cliches, they manage to work - cliches aren't always bad remember - they have to be said by a lot of people first!Cinematography: Hello? Did you see the scene when Andy first arrives at Shawshank with the overhead view of the prison - which shows emphatically the extent of the "closed wall" syndrome that leads to the "institutionalized" sections?  Ohh, and don't forget THAT scene - you know what I mean - Andy using the recurring metaphor of water once he's escaped! The metaphor of Christ's journey ending in the washing away of Andy's memories of Shawshank in his crucifiction pose takes the breath away. This film is truly special.After reading the original novella by Stephen King, I looked forward to watching the Shawshank Redemption when it was bought for me on video - and Darabont not only does a great job at directing, but his adaptation of the novella is superb as well.The ending, while not containing the big budget special effects that most modern films seem to require as a neccesity nowadays, is a wonderful conclusion to a film that reaffirms faith in humanity. Thank you to all concerned in making the film.

having watched "shawshank the redeeming feature" broadcast here in the u.k. last night i thought it was time to add my voice to the plaudits rightly showered on this wonderful movie i have never met anyone who doesn't believe that it is one of the greatest films ever made it crosses demographic,age and sex barriers like almost no other film that i have come across it is an impossible film to ignore and notwithstanding repeated viewing it maintains it's capacity to inspire and captivate in my view it is rightly lauded as one of the best five movies of all time p.s. well done mark kermode and channel4 for last night's documentary-more of this type of thing please dvd extras have shown that there is definitely a market for these sort of documentaries

Spoiler Alert A few films can presume of the importance that a film like The Shawshank Redemption does. Shawshank Redemption is considered by some critics as one of the best movies in the story of American film (listed as #2 by the Internet Movie Data Base,http://www.imdb.com). For many other people the film is considered as one of those films which theme is universal and that transcends throughout the ages and decades. And this is because topics like freedom, justice and injustice, greed and honesty, and perseverance are mixed in a manner that specifies what the human condition is and will be.The performances given by Tim Robbins and the always acclaimed Morgan Freeman give the film the emotional touch that is easy to get as a viewer. The story is centered in a person called Andy Dufrense who was convicted for the murder of his wife, him, being a young and intelligent banker was one of the most promising persons in his category, but all his potential was brought down with his conviction, undoubtely unfair since it is obvious a person like Dufrense wouldn¬¥t be capable of such a thing like murdering the person he loved with all his heart. Also the story of the "institutionalized" Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding played wonderfully by Morgan Freeman, a man who lost all hope of ever going out even if he had already payed more than he had ever expected for his crime, until he met Dufrense, who as anyone could see teaches Red the meaning of what to have a dream is, even if it takes you 20 years to accomplish it.Greed comes in form of Captain Byron Hadley played by lancy Brown, an unscrupulous man, who ironicly although he directed the place were the "bad" element of society is reformed he was no better than the ones he subdued. Hadley since he first met Dufrense sought in him his golden egg gouse and used him to fulfill a fraud becoming Dufrense now into a real criminal, which he wasn¬¥t until he got to jail. When the opportunity to prove Dufrense¬¥s innocence comes, Hadley makes everything as possible to avoid that even though the assesination of a young person was in the middle. At the end, Dufrense escapes from jail through a hole he had dug for 20 years covering the evidence with several posters from the hollywood divas from those times from Rita Hayworth to Jane Fonda.But, let¬¥s talk about Andy Dufresne for a while, let¬¥s take the scene at the roof of the building in which Andy gets beers for his coworkers in exchange for work. At the end of the scene we can see the smile of Andy, a happy man, who was happy with small little accomplishments. Andy was someone who was talented and yet, all he wanted was a yat in Puerto Vallarta near by the beach and that would be the heaven for him. In a world full of intelligent people who use their talents to get to the top, andy was one who needed little to be happy.Of course the success of this film is based on what most of the famous films do, an utopic idea of society or how the human being should have been. Andy is the prototype of how all of us should be, never loose the sense of hope, always fight for what you want, greed and money is not good, and of course, being like this you will always succeed. After all, a movie that should be seen by everyone.

Comment Head: For all those who haven't seen it yet (and don't want the story ruined)

Comment Body: The best movie I have ever seen -- by a mile.  Everything about it is brilliant.  A classic you can watch time and again without tiring of it. The acting is fantastic throughout -- Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are at their very best.  And rookie director, Frank Darabont has created a real masterpiece.

I'm a fan of King's work. And I confess that, when I first saw the Rita Hayworth And The Shawshank Redemption, I didn't like it very much. After I heard the coming adaptation in 1994, I thought to myself "It's gonna be a cliche prison movie". But when I first watched it on the big screen, I was totally shocked. I think they made a great favor to Forrest Gump and Tom Hanks that year. The 6 academy awards was meant to be for this film. I still get the same excitement while watching this one over and over again. Now I'm waiting for the DVD version for the  film. And I also like to see a special edition for this one....

Comment Head: Very well-acted, well-told, and entertaining tale...
Comment Body: but the #2 movie of all-time ??!!? It's all opinion, of course.  However, I doubt even Stephen King or Tim Robbins would vote for this enjoyable saga as the #2 all-time movie.  It is a marvelous adaptation of King's short story.  Robbins, Freedman, and Gunton are all terrific, as is James Whitmore in his short role. My biggest criticism is the slow detailing of Red's every move after being released from prison, and before going after the fortune.  That part was a bit labored and overlong.  Nonetheless, the movie was witty, exciting, and well-acted, but was purposefully limited in scope.  Very good, yes! Excellent? Perhaps.  Great?  I must demur on great.

Comment Head: Oh, just read the review below!

Comment Body: I saw this film about 4 or 5 years ago after hearing nothing but praise about it. After reading the blurb I couldn't wait to get the tape in. Since then I have seen the film numerous times and am still not bored. It truly is a classic in every essence of the word. In my opinion possibly the best film of all time, maybe 2nd only to Forrest Gump. They truly don't make film's like this any more.

I must say that I was I little surprised to see the euphoric comments that other users have bestowed on The Shawshank Redemption. Although I thoroughly enjoyed the film, I would not place it with the cinematic greats. It has an excellent storyline that both surprises and ultimately satisfies, and is well acted. However, there is little flair in its direction and some of its characters are a little cliched. To sum up, the Shawshank Redemption is an enjoyable film with some well thought out twists to the tale, but the 2nd best film of all time? I don't think so.

What a remarkable film this is. I remember the first time I saw it. It was on video, since I was only 11 when it came out, and I sat down, and I had heard that it was a terrific movie, but I had no idea just how truly GREAT this movie is. After the first viewing I knew it was one of my favorites. I've only seen it three times, so as not to wear it out, and each time, I am blown away.Morgan Freeman is already one of my favorite actors, (Along with Kevin Spacey, James Cromwell, and Edward Norton) and his performance here is simply the best of his career. His "Red" is a weathered man who has lost hope. He's not a "bad" man, even though he did kill a man in his youth. Morgan Freeman is calm and collected, yet his on-screen presence is so powerful. We are drawn to him, almost more-so than to Andy because Andy keeps to himself, while Red narrates. This is partly the point, to turn the audience into an inmate. We only know as much as they do about him. He isn't revealed to us directly very much. And we eventually find out why.I love the way the men of this prison use almost a hierarchy and establish their own little kingdom, with the jail, obviously as their castle. I like watching Andy as he strives to be normal, doing whatever he can to get his mind off of the fact that he's in prison. One of the film's best moments comes when Andy makes a deal that allows all of the roof workers to have a beer, and to just sit around, and be carefree for a few minutes. But for others the prison is normal, all they know, their only life. They call it "institutionalized" but what it really means is hopeless. And it's a constant battle to keep that from happening. And eventually it seems, that everyone caves in to the fact that they will die at that place.This is unquestionably one of the most powerful and moving films of all time. (WARNING: SPOILERS!!!) There are four ending sequences that come one after another that move so fluidly and with such grace that I am in awe just thinking about it. 1. Andy's escape and all of the explanation that goes along with it. The long tunnel of crap, Andy's joy in the pond while the rain pours upon him. 2. The day after and everything that happens to the warden and the guard are done brilliantly. 3. Red's parole hearing. At this point he just doesn't give a crap about anything anymore. He talks about his regret, not because he thinks it will get him out, but so that they will know that his punishment is not so much prison as it is wishing he could've made a better decision. Wishing that the young Red would've had guidance. 4. The reunion at the end while Red narrates. The most wonderful lines come when he's on the bus, and we hear his voice over about how he has shrugged off his "Institutionalization" and is ready to not know what happens next. This is the absolute perfect tone to end the movie on. What sheer brilliance. It is sad that this film didn't win ANY Oscars. It certainly deserved to.

Any other year, this would've won Best Picture.  Probably Best Director, Best Actor, Best Supporting Actor, and Best Screenplay too.  This film had the misfortune of going against juggernaut Forrest Gump, and there was no way that it could beat the hype surrounding the good (though not great) Gump.  Still, seven years later, it looks like this is the film from 1994 that people will remember long after Forrest has faded away.

Comment Head: A tremendous story and well done film.

Comment Body: A wonderfully scripted film complimented by the acting qualities of Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman.This is by far the best film I have ever seen and I would recommend that every movie fan see it.

Comment Head: quite simply one of the greatest films in living memory!!
Comment Body: the film is unique as it seems like the same old story but keeps you absolutely riveted from the opening line to the end credits and one of the things which i personally like the best is the way that we never really find out if he is innocent or not if you have not seen this movie i strongly suggest that it is one of the things that should be very high on your things to do list but dont just listen to me you can see that it is number 2 on the list

I saw this movie last week and I must say that it is the most wonderfull movie ever made in human history. It contains all elements that makes a movie big, and how big, damn I was completely blown away when the movie ended. Its about a man (Andy Dufresne)(Tim Robbins) who is judged guilty and ends up in "ThE ShAwShAnK PrIsOn", he meets Red (Morgan Freeman) and become friends, I've never seen such a great acting like this two together. Andy Dufresne is the hope itself and has to face a hard time in prison till...Im not gonna reveal the movie any further because YOU MUST SEE IT, Its just the best movie ever made, Memento, Schindler's list and American History X were awsome but this one will blow you completely away! 10 out of 10 and even more if it could be. --------ENJOY IT--------

best movie ever. better than all other movies. even godfather which is number one on this site's top 250. best movie ever                                         17 out of 10                                           ***** out of ****

Could not sleep at night after watching this film. One of the BEST DAMN films EVER made. Simply loved it. Rented it without much expectation, but boy what a surprise. Never have I been so moved by a film. Also see American Beauty, Green Mile. A MUST SEE! 10/10

This movie is so much more than you expect.  There is a deep kind of faith in it which makes this movie great.  Its sad that this movie did poor in the box office it deserves so much more. a must see. its always on tv so see it.

Comment Head: Best movie that I have ever seen.
Comment Body: This movie is truly moving. It draws you in and takes you along with the characters as they live their lives. The plot is extremely well developed. Every character has a lot of depth and the acting is top notch. The end gives me goose bumps every time that I watch it. I can never get enough of it. I have seen the movie at least 50 times and just writing about it makes me want to go watch it again. You will not be disappointed with The Shawshank Redemption.

i first saw this movie on tv many years ago. i loved it from the start. ever since then i have seen clips and quotes from it all over my daily life. watching it again, i realize how truly wonderful it is. not only is the acting some of the best i have ever seen, the script is very well written and the message it gives stays with you. this movie is the best i have ever seen.

Comment Head: Superb, moving, possibly the greatest film of all time
Comment Body: It is tough to summarize the true power of this truly great film. It was moving, thought-provoking, and powerful. It was truly robbed of the 1994 Best picture, just because Forrest Gump was more succesful in theatres. Shawshank was much deeper, and i was a great injustice. Shawshank chronicled the relationship between two jailed inmate through the 40's, 50's and 60's. It was a film about how no matter how hard a man is broken, beaten down, and crushed emoionally he still can keep hope. I truly loved this film and it grows better with each viewing. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman gave great performances in this film. Frank Darabot had great direction over this film, and Stephen King's short story was great. This is a must see for anyone. Like I said before this is in my opinion the greatest fim ever made.

First-time director/screenwriter Frank Darabont expands Stephen King's 1982 short story 'Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption', into one of the most definitive, moving and uplifting films to be made in recent years. 'The Shawshank Redeption' is not just an acute prison drama, it remains a detailed an emotional study of humanities endeavour against hardship and repression. A standout performance by Morgan Freeman and dazeling direction by Darabont, are abetted by elaborate panoramic cinematography, a touching score and a malicious imposing character - the oppressive 'Shawshank State Prison' itself. A melodrama of wasted lives and male bonding, nominated for 7 academy awards dispite a lukewarm box office reception.

Comment Head: The best Stephen King adaption ever...
Comment Body: ...followed,very closely,behind by Stand By Me.The novella Rita Hayworth... is one of his best as well,so when I heard that it was being made into a film,i was worried at how it came out.All that worrying was for nothing.Superb performances(Sorry, but where was the Oscars for Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Frank Darabont etc),a script that sticks to the novella but doesn't get bogged down in over plotting(like Pet Semetary) and some brilliant direction make this one of the truly great films of the 1990's.Pity about The Green Mile (1999)...

When I saw this movie on the top 250 movies of all time list (it appeared as #2) I thought I was in for one of the best movies ever made.  Yes, it was an interesting story, but it seemed much too unrealistic to be among the top 10.  I mean sure, The Sixth Sense, one of my favorite movies, is unrealistic, but we realize that going into the movie.  It doesn't play itself off as a real movie about real friendships.  The movie was worth seeing, but the way everything fell into place was really disturbing for me.  That's not real life.  I give the movie a 7 out of 10, in that, it was a good movie, but it certainly wasn't the best.

I saw this movie after I saw "The Green Mile." I loved "The Green Mile" and thought that I should see another prison movie with the same director. Boy was I glad I did.  The one thing I love about this movie is it's wonderful ending. I felt like that was the best thing that could have happened at that time. I loved it. The only thing I didn't like was that I felt that the wardon got off easy. He died instantly. In my eyes he should of had to go to prison and live a horrible life. Oh well. This is by far one of the best movies I have ever seen and I encourage everyone to see it. I cannot believe that someone would dare give this movie a 1. If you did, please e-mail me so I can thoroughly yell at you. Oh, did anyone else notice that the music seemed very similar to the music in "The Green Mile?" 10/10

Spoilers ahead... This movie, which was entertaining from start to finish, had the greatest ending that I have ever seen.  Too many movie makers have unhappy endings just because it seems more realistic. (see Sean Penn's "The Pledge")  The ending to this movie couldn't have been more perfect.  I'm usually pretty good at predicting how a movie is going to end, but this one had me fooled all the way.  Tim Robins and Morgan Freeman had great chemistry throughout this picture.  I encourage everyone to see it.

Comment Head: If you want to escape in a prison, choose Shawshank.
Comment Body: What a great movie, written by: Stephen King. Original title: Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption. This movie has got 7 oscar nominations, but didn't get 1. I don't know why, because this was one of the best movies in 1994.It's about a man Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) who is guilty on a double murder of his wife and her boyfriend.In this whole movie you find out about his life and if he's guilty or not. Great acting by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. (10/10)

This one is a winner.  It was a sad movie... and unacceptable for young kids to watch but a real good movie.... I am a big fan of the two main actors.. Tim Robbins,, and Morgan Freeman. Does anyone know if this movie was based on a true story?What a wonderful ending also... and as I said before in other comments, I love happy endings.

Comment Head: Someone needed to make a film with as much power as The Shawshank Redemption!
A great story, with great performances
this is my favorite movie of all time!
Comment Body: I love this movie, best movie ever made. I garuntee that if you see this movie for the fist time, it will be in your top ten after you finish watching it. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins both diserved the best male oscar award for this picture.

tim robbins and morgan freeman are great in the film it movies you in every way the movie is based on 20 years of these men lives and goes up and down the whole way and made very realistic and people can relate to it you cant not like this master peace it's the best movie ive seen in a while .

If Hollywood were the bakery section at your local supermarket, "The Shawshank Redemption" would be that sweet rich carrot cake they sometimes have--obviously commercially produced to appeal to as many people as possible, but nevertheless infinitely better than a plastic-wrapped snack-cake like "Forrest Gump", which goes down easy but leaves a funny taste in your mouth for hours afterward.Of course if this movie were a cake, I suppose it'd have a file in it.

Comment Head: Extremely Well Made, Well Acted, and Cheated at the Oscars
Comment Body: After I saw Darabont's "Green Mile" I heard that he had another movie, and I had to see it.  I taped Shawshank on TV and watched it, not expecting a lot. Well, it wasn't as good as "Green Mile," but it was pretty darned close, and it was quite similar in terms of themes and character types.  I thought the warden was terrific.  I was so engrossed in the movie, I wanted to strangle the man myself.  Although many say the movie was predictable, I was quite surprised by the ending.  As in the case of the "Green Mile," the awards Shawshank richly deserved were passed on to other, not so good, films. The only downside was the portrayal of the characters.  The movie basically said that criminals are good guys, and the prison guards are villains. Isn't it the other way around?I give Shawshank a 9/10

Comment Head: The greatest movie I have ever seen!
Comment Body: I LOVE the Shawshank Redemption. It gives the story of a prison inmate in his many years at an institution. This movie is so great, I cried in the middle of it! When Brooks dies has got to be the saddest moment in movie history. I cried for a good 10 minutes. He let his bird go, and he took his life. Very sad stuff. It's great how they start up a library helping the illiterate inmates. It shows some of the atrocites that inmates go through even if they are innocent. A VERY GREAT movie and probably the best of all time. I give it an A++++++.

Comment Head: The film has lingered with me for a long time....
Comment Body: Great lead performances by Robbins and Freeman. An outstanding supporting cast, fine cinematography by Roger Deakins, well-chosen shots by editor Richard Francis-Bruce, a haunting musical score by Thomas Newman, and a well-realized adaptation of the short story by Stephen King as adapted and directed by Frank Darabont.  What still amazes me about the overall positive response to "Shawshank" on the IMDb is how it touched viewers years after it was released into theaters. I saw the movie in the theaters after it received a few weeks after the Oscar nominations were announced. I was blown away by the movie then and it still gets to me now.

Comment Head: A more spherical attitude towards this excellent movie
Brotherhood and altruism blossom from Andy Dufrane
Comment Body: It's rare to find a modern movie of this caliber. 'Shawshank' is not cheapened with some feel-good Hollywood romance, heroic fight scenes, or a fast paced, edge-of-your-seat escape plan. In place of this ever-present drivel, this movie excites the heart and warms the soul through the excellent performances, exquisite story-line, and unforgettable quotes. Andy demonstrates a heroic spirit and an indomitable will to touch the lives of those around him.

Comment Head: Some films are just magical in their own way
Comment Body: This film appeals to anyone, thats why its #2 on IMDB. This film for some reason made only 28 million at the box-office. I love Forrest Gump I really do, but this is the best picture if the year. It has some sorta quality that is rare in films that instead of pulling you away, it draws you closer. The 30th time you watch this film, you will still be drawn in closer. The film is magical. Don't ever forget that.

I have just finished watching this movie for about the sixth time and I still feel the inspiration of hope in my heart from the movie's glorious ending. I give this movie a 10 out of 10 and yes this is my favourite movie. I'm sure there's others which tie in my taste for best picture I just can't bring them to mind right now. (Actually, come to think of it The Breakfast Club ranks pretty high up there as well.)I just wanted to say that this movie is very well done all the way from the acting, the storyline, to the musical track it wins on all three fronts for me. And I also wanted to say that it may have been robbed at the Oscars or almost passed through unrecognized by the public in its theatrical release, or may have even made not that much money it seems to have been redeemed itself on the IMDB with a well deserved #2 ranking among the favourites IMDB voters voted for. A must see.

I see like 1400 people rated this movie a 1 out of 10.  Please, if you are one of these people, email me so we can talk, and so i can ultimately rip your soul apart and see what it is like to be non-human.  As far as the movie goes, im sure not many people have seen it, if you havent, please do so, you wont be sorry.

Interpretation, spoilers: Brooks represents complete complacency with life, so much so that any disturbance causes anxiety and suicidal ideation. Red also, for a time, represents this complacency. This movie is not simply a prison story, its message is generalized to mankind in general and it can be assumed that this complacency also represents modern man's need for routine - to the detriment of authentic living. It takes an unjustly imprisoned man, Andy, to demonstrate to Red the life-or-death importance of hope and the freedom allowed by hope. As shown, hope entails slight fear because it necessarily interferes with order in life. Andy illustrates that this fear is a part of living, and renunciation from it results in an ingenuine sort of living. Red soon realizes - given the rock hammer, the poster, and the mexico plans - that Andy had never given up his hope despite 19 years in prison. Hope and a sense of freedom and allowed even in prison, but not to all (music scene). For Red, it takes an actual physical freedom to live with a sense of hope. Andy, by exuding auras of hope from the beginning - though he would be expected to despair the most given his innocence - helps Red reach an epiphany of sorts; certainty and hope are mutually exclusive, and hope is always to be preferred. The Brook's path is shirked, and Red chooses life in all of its confusion, because true hope is omnipotent.

I would describe this movie as as close you can get to movie perfection. There are points where you will laugh. Points where you will cringe. Points will you will feel so angry and points where you will feel so sad. But, ultimately, you will come to realize that with faith and hope, anything is possible. (Warning content and quote given ahead) The language is a bit extreme, but it is set in a prison, and as the character Red says in the movie, "Prison ain't a fairy tale world" (Paraphrase). This isn't a family movie, but every movie fan needs to see this at least once. This is my favorite movie.
Very few movies can move moods so subtly and then surprise you at the end, but this one did that for me.A skillfully evocative piece that shows the rewards of morality and undying faith.

Comment Head: A Film With a Life of Its Own

Comment Body: This movie is one of the best movies I have ever seen no matter who you are you should love this movie and if you havn't seen it, see it! Tim Robbins gives a performance that is probly one of the most unforgetable also Morgan Freeman gives just as good of a performance. This movie has no flaws and it is SO good

I have seen TSR about 5 or 6 times now, and every time I watch it, it's getting better! Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are great together and the end of the movie is the best movie ending ever!! A tale of courage and friendship. Go see it!!!

Comment Head: You're insane if you don't like this movie.
Comment Body: Two words: Flawless masterpiece.  While not the greatest movie ever made, it should certainly rank extremely high.  Unless you're completely repulsed by the idea of a prison film, or if you're too immature to appreciate good drama, you're going to absolutely love, love, love this film.  This film was largely overlooked at the time because of the mega-popular "Forrest Gump" (an extremely excellent film in its own right), but it holds up because of a timeless quality that very few films possess (I know the film's only 7 years old, but I think that's long enough).  If you're uncomfortable with some of the more graphic themes of the movie, it's still worth a look (certain cable networks regularly show an edited for TV version of the movie).  This is a must see for anyone who calls themselves a film-buff.

I watch it at least once a week. Changed the way I live my life. Better than medicine when your feeling down or depressed. Still searching for some people out there who haven't seen it. I love watching it with someone who has never seen it, just to see their reaction. It's like I'm watching the film for the first time. The best movie ever, "that's god damn right"!

Comment Head: be careful, because you will be drawn into this one
Comment Body: Sat down one evening and happened to catch this about  5 min. into it, and was stuck on the couch for 2 hours. Have no doubts about picking this up for a quiet, entertaining, enjoyable evening. Great story, well acted and engrossing. Robbins and Freeman are excellent, like Hoffman and Mcqween in Papillion. If  you don't find tears in welling in your eyes and a smile on your face seek resuscitation.,   ENJOY!!!

Comment Head: Far too good to be missed!!!!!
Comment Body: I have seen this movie many times and I still get that wonderful feeling every time I see it. I love it so much that I have so far bought 6 vcds for my friends and they all love it. And if you want to know why, just see it for yourself.

One of the best films I've ever seen...it got all the elements from life. Hope, struggle, suffer, friendship, joy and all the other things all performed by the best actors around. Morgan Freeman (as always) and Tim Robbins make this movie something that everyone should see, It's pure pleasure all the way...

Comment Head: Quite simply, the best story in the history of motion pictures.

Comment Body: This film is up there with the classics!  Is a deeply moving story, which portrays friendship, trust, hope and corruption.  The ending is superb, and brings a smile to my face every single time i watch it.  It shows a very realistic view of prisons in the 1930's where the officers were almost, or even more corrupt and evil than the inmates.  This is film which will never become outdated or even considered to be 'coming of age'.  With superb acting from Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins, it has to be the best film I have seen in a long long time.

This is quite a story, and the film does an incredible job of telling it. The acting is magnificent, and the quality of the direction makes this film a pleasure to watch.  A great film for the human spirit, and the importance of freedom to our well-being.  I voted 10/10 for Shawshank.

This is my favorite movie of the 90's. Fantastic script & dialogues, excellent actors, direction, photography. The best prison movie ever. One of the few movies you can see thousand times and never get bored. I recommend it to anyone that haven't seen it so far!Antonis

Comment Head: simple, pure, beautiful cinema in a world of mediocrity
Greatest movie never to win the oscar.
The movie medium at it's finest
Comment Body: This is what movies are truly made for.  This is movie making as an art form.  This movie deeply conveys more human insight than I thought possible in something so short and simple as a film.  It deals with sin, love, friendship, fear, greed, persistence, frailty, hope, courage, cruelty and a whole array of other human traits, and it deals with all of them in an amazingly complex and full manner.  This is a prime example of a creation that allows us to understand another's soul.  It does this through words, sounds, facial expressions, in short, everything that a movie can offer us in condensed form that we often don't pay attention to in life.  We have to pay attention here.  We can't look away.  If you can come out of this movie without finding something out about yourself you haven't really experienced it, perhaps you've just watched it.  I give very few movies a 10, because nothing man made can ever really be perfect, but some things come close. This is one.

Comment Head: Hope is a dangerous thing; can kill a man.
Comment Body: A phenomenal film. A rare gem that surpasses entertainment, resonating with meaning and enlightenment. The film, and the Stephen King novella it derives from, are a treasure. Even if you're not a big reader, seek out Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption. It's contained in a collection of 4 novellas - one for each season. After you've seen the film, it should be apparent which season Shawshank is allocated. The book also has enough deviations, including a different ending, to keep you enthralled even if you've seen the film several times.

I love films and this might just be my favorite. A simple movie about hope. A feel good movie, that will make you cheer for the human spirit! Great cast of characters. Wonderful acting by Robbins and Freeman, a true must see movie...

Comment Head: A terrific movie with layers of meaning...
Morgan Freeman's come a LONG way
Comment Body: This ain't "The Electric Company."  Although all of the performances in this film are masterful (showing by turns both the depravity and the humanity of the prison experience) Morgan Freeman's role as "Red" is truly the centerpiece of this film - so good it defies description.  All I can say is that of all the movies I own on DVD, this is one of my proudest purchases; a film I can play that not only shows off how good digital quality looks but that shows off how an excellent screenplay and great actors can come together to make a cinematic masterpiece.

Tremendously involving drama. In my opinion, the best new movie in the last 10 years or so. My only quibble is that the film deals with prison life in a somewhat unrealistic, non-threatening or idealistic way compared to some prison movies but otherwise it is terrific. The main characters are quite human and engaging. I found myself almost projecting, mentally, into the group as they share their day-to-day experiences in the joint. Also, the film has a happy ending where the good guy succeeds and the bad guy gets his.

last summer I saw ( for the 6 time) this film again I don't know why but I was terribly shock by this film and today it always make me feel bizarre . I don't know how they do this film but it was really good. I think that this film is one of my favorite with the sixth sense and terminator 2 (sorry but it remind me my teenage) .

Comment Head: some random thoughts about a great film

Comment Body: This beautiful film from Frank Darabont is an absolute joy to behold.  a wonderful blend of drama, warmth, sadness and joy.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman have never been better, giving performances that should have won the relevant oscars hands down, but they and Frank Darabont(director) were absolutley robbed on Oscar night. This is a film that deserves to be watched again and again.Let's not forget Thomas Newman's moving score that captures the film's mood perfectly, where you can close your eyes and feel the emotions running through your whole body. This film is also a rarity in that this is probably the best film adaption of a Stephen King story since The Dead Zone.The Perfect Film?  I think perhaps it is.

Comment Head: Best movie i have ever seen
Comment Body: This is the best movie i have ever seen, because of the purity of the scenario and the stresses. The film emphasizes nearly all good and bad characteristics of the human in a way that everybody can understand and taste. I felt myself like i was there and the camera was my eyes.Everbody who wants to learn more about the value of the virtues he/she house , must see this film before he or she dies.

There is not much to say about this movie. Shawshank has it all. Good characters, story, and acting. It is not my favorite movie, but is probably the greatest movie ever made. Watching this movie made me think what life is really like. I was moved by every minute of the movie and when it was done.... I almost thought it was real life.Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are brilliant. You couldn't ask for anyone better for the part. Their acting in this movie made you cry and changed the turn for the movie industry. This movie is worth every second, so don't miss "The Shawshank Redemption".

I'm always simply out of words after watching this film. The score, the actors, the plot, everything just strikes me. I've seen this on DVD about five times now and it hasn't lost one bit of it's glory. If you haven't seen this film, see it now. If you saw it and didn't like it, maybe you should give it another chance.I remember seeing it from TV when I was about 12 or 13. I Didn't really have any opinions about it then. It was good, but nothing special. I decided to buy the DVD anyway and after watching it 5 years later I finally got more deeper into the movie.This is one of the best, if not best movie ever made. And I mean it.

I'm not much of a film critic so ill only write a few lines.This film is amazing, the script is by far the best ever, the story-line is so original. The acting is done superbly especially Morgan Freeman. The characters are really written well, and the film will keep you guessing about what is going to happen next. The ending is truly amazing! If you have not seen this film yet, SEE IT!10/10

This film was honestly able to make me laugh, and cry. It moved me from start to finish. I have seen several films in my lifetime, and I have given this film the distinct honor of my favorite, and the best film of all time. It shows the character development and friendship between inmates of several years. Everyone should see this film, because It is incredible. The scene where they are drinking beers never fails to make me cry or at least get teary-eyed.

Hello, my name is Ed and I would like to say that at first this movie looked kind of stupid when I was at Block Buster but I remembered that at IMDB it got a 9.0 rating and is the 2nd best movie of all time so I rented it. When I got home I watched it and I was amazed by it. This movie is incredible. The movie is not really about prison but about people and the hardships they face and endure. While I was watching it there were several parts of the movie where you think it is over but there is realy more to see which was great because you don't want this movie to end. The story unfolds and more stuff is going on in the movie then you think. My advice for anyone who wants to see the greatest movie ever is to go out and either rent this movie or buy it. It is worth it. You wont get sick of this masterpiece.

Comment Head: probably the best film ever made
Simply a hell of a film
Comment Body: Not exactly a movie you would think to have Stephen King in the credits, which gives the film a sense of irony. When watching the film, one experiences many emotions, and though not enough to make most people cry, enough to leave you reeling. Our hero Andy (Tim Robbins)quite frankly goes through a lot, but is steered toward the right direction because of his undying hope of getting out. Andy also leads fellow inmate Red (Morgan Freeman) "to the light", and teaches us all how important hope is to have within us. I guess another good point is just how many films can you name that have happy endings, and aren't in any way at least slightly corny?

Comment Head: A trully work of art, where the word art itself comes up short!
One of the best pictures I have ever seen
Comment Body: I first saw this masterpiece two years ago and since then it has been on my favourite movie list.  This is one of those movies that once you see it you can't stop watching it.  It has a very very good story line. The only thing that is bad about this movie is that most people have to see it from the beginning to like it and really appreciate it.

Comment Head: It doesn't get any better than this
Comment Body: The best film I've ever seen.  As soon as I got a DVD player I made sure this was among my first purchases.  I watched it 3 times that week and a several more times in the following few months. If you haven't seen this film yet, rent it today.  Better yet, buy it, because you'll definitely want to see it more than once!

I love this movie I guess that I have seen it over ten times,I don't know what makes this movie good, but I must recommend it. When I was in the Video store I was very sceptical about it but that changed 10 minutes after I started the film. I hope you will enjoy it as much as I have.

There is no movie that I love more than The Shawshank Redemption. I have seen the movie at least 10 times, and it never ceases to amaze me how well it is performed. The plot line is one of the best that I have seen in a long time, and Tim Robbins plays his character as if he were living in that life. The most amazing thing happened after I watched this movie: I started to regard everyone with the same "look inside of me instead of at me" view, and have lately even started to think "innocent until PROVEN guilty" and not "he looks guilty so he must be." If you have not seen this movie, you are missing out on an extremely well written and performed piece of art. I highly reccomend it. In fact, I urge anyone who has not seen it to rent it tonight.

This is one of the really great movies. Excellent casting. The actors worked together to form an exceptional cast. Telling the story through the eyes of another inmate added a pleasurable twist to the movie. Definitely one of the core films of any video library.

This movie is great.   It combines a heart touching story with great actors. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins are spectacular along with a great supporting crew.  The movie also depicted the book in a very accurate way. I highly recommend this movie.

Comment Head: quite simply the greatest film ever made
Comment Body: First and foremost , the shawshank redemption is a brilliant piece of film-making. It follows the story of andy dufresne(an excellent tim robbins) and his struggle to maintain hope inside a maximum secruity prison.It also focuses on his friendship with the prison"fixer" red(beautifully portrayed by morgan freeman). It has such an intelligent script that makes the film`s final appeal the indefinable quality of "feel good". Frank darabont must be wondering what he has to do to win an oscar now as he has also made the excellent "green mile". I dont really want to say too much about the story as i will let you discover the twist and turns that happen in shawshank prison.But i will say something , i was totally gobsmacked by the extraordinary twist in the tale. If you have not yet seen the film , forget about renting it , GO BUY IT ON VIDEO AND DVD NOW and enjoy 137 minutes of the greatest film ever made.

Comment Head: What can I say, a brilliant film!
Comment Body: I saw Shawshank quite a few years ago now. However, upon visiting the IMDB Top 250 list and finding it two from the top, I was not surprised. Despite the fact that I saw the movie is 1996 or 1997, I can still remember some of the poignant momments in the film and how the entire film made me feel (heartfelt and happy!).Overall, I think Shawshank was an absoloutely amazing film. It showcases great performances from both Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins, and also demonstrates the quality of writing that people should expect from somebody like Steven King.

The Shawshank Redemption is by FAR my favorite movie. It is the touchstone or benchmark I judge all other movies by. It has everything I love about movies and nothing that I usually hate. This is the only movie I think I can give a rating of 10.

Comment Head: The best film from a Stephen King story....
Comment Body: "The Shawshank Redemption" is the best film from a Stephen King story. The best by far.  This film fits together so intricately and the end seems almost impossible.  It's what everyone wants, of course, but it just doesn't seem possible.  This movie could not be more perfectly cast, and the direction is impeccable.  The story draws you in.  This movie and "The Green Mile" are alike in the sense that they capture your attention for the entire film.  These films are powerful and well-made.  "The Shawshank Redemption" sits on another level.  It is a film that will not grow old.  It will stay fresh and fulfilling as the years go by.  This is a must-see film.  To go without seeing this movie is quite a loss.  Do yourself a favor and see this quality flick!

Comment Head: One of My all time 10 best.
Comment Body: A must see if you're even wondering. This will also become one of your favorites. Great characters, acting, screenplay, everything. They did a great job of getting Kings book to the screen. One of the best and most memorable endings in movie history. Sit back, dim lights, shut off phone, and enjoy!

Comment Head: I can understand why this was the number 1 movie for so long!
Comment Body: Tens of thousands of IMDB users couldn't be wrong, this movie REALLY IS THE BEST. I am an avid movie watcher, and I LOVE this movie. I rate it as a 20 out of a possible 10.The scene on the beach at the end is the best, it makes me cry every time!Make sure you own it!

Comment Head: Quite simply the best movie I have ever seen
Comment Body: I have seen many movies in my day and none top The Shawshank Redemption. Tim Robins and Morgan Freeman are spectacular.  The story is told from a narration given by Freeman who plays the character "Red", a prisoner who befriends Tim Robins character Andy Dufrain.  It is a tremendous story of human triumph.  As the movie rises to an incredible climax you will find yourself pumping your fist in the air in delight. This is a movie I never get tired of watching again and again and each time I feel delighted.  A true masterpiece!

Comment Head: A masterpiece, shame it was put down by Hollywood politix...
It's more than a movie, it's a management style.
Comment Body: One of the best movies made. It also provides a beautiful analogy for a common (mis)management practice.  See this movie and put your job in perspective. We are all Andy, being used by our bosses to advance themselves, shown off to their friends, etc. but never really given any actual credit, and held in place by those same bosses, lest they lose the status that keeping us under them provides...Or you can just see it because it's good. Tim Robbins is great, Morgan Freeman is great.

Comment Head: A case for banning trailers, posters, and media
The best cinematic way of storytelling

Comment Body: <<WARNING: EXTREME SPOILERS>>I won't argue that this is a really good film. It is. But I've always felt it's been built up a bit too much. It's well-structured, well-paced, and Morgan Freeman gives a brilliant performance, along with all of his co-stars. But it's still something of a modern fairy tale. We never doubt that things will turn out all right in the end for Andy and Red, or that Norton will get his comeuppance. This, combined with a tendency to get cloying, particularly with the opera record and the spunky kid, effectively knocks it out of the running as one of the all-time greats.All this aside, however, it's impact can't be denied either. Frank Darabont may have let his sentimentality go raging out of control on The Green Mile next, but he just enough restraint here to move us almost to tears. And this same emotional black-and-white treatment allows plot points that might have been laughed of in a more cynical film to feel perfectly satisfying. Tell me you didn't raise a fist in triumph when Norton blew his brains out. And regarding sentiment, it certainly wasn't 1994's worst offender. Matching Forrest Gump for saccharine value would tax even Darabont's skills.

I loved every moment and line from this this movie  right from the opening scene to the end credits.the movie is about andy dufresne a man convicted of murder who is put in shawshank state prison.He strikes up a friendship with the prison fixer red.After having a rough time in the prison he manages to make it in prison becoming very successful with the library and with the guards and the warden.There is the an arrival of a new inmate  which turns the plot right around,leading up to the greatest ending ever seen in a movie.i highly recommend seing this movie,in fact go see it right now!. I promise you will love it(im not lying!).thankyou, now go watch it!.

I am neither a Stephen King nor a prison movie fan, so had not bothered to watch this film until recently... That was my loss. Shawshank Redemption, like all great movies, falls into no category. It defines its own space. It is an incredible story woven across time and between two characters. It is about Spirit and Justice. And friendship.Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins should have shared Best Actor Oscars for this film. I hate to admit it, but Stephen King has talent.

I have seen this movie like a thousand times, and I enjoyed it every single time, because every single time watching it, I remarked new anecdotes that I hadn't in the previous watching. Morgan Freeman is definitely on his best performance ever,(I just love the part where he sits in front of the rehabilitation committee for the last time and tells them how it feels to be in prison for more than 20 years), and Frank Darabont can surely be proud of directing an intelligent movie, but Tim Robbins deserves to be mentioned due to an excellent performance as well as all the other actors. I appreciate the way in which this movie combines two crucial topics of every life: Hope and disillusion ! And I guess I also liked it because there aren't any women in the movie! No offence!

one that will stay at the top of my list for a very very long time. i've watched this movie ever and over again and i still am amazed by how good the movie is. it's a very enlightening movie that will make you think about many things about your life and what have you done in live. i guess every one of you have watched this excellent peace of art, so i guess you have the same feeling as i have right now. too bad this awesome movie do not enter my country in indonesia, so not many people can appreciate the sheer quality of shawshank redemption.a very touching movie indeed.

The Shawshank Redemption is the type of film which has divided its audience into two categories: those who loved it, and those who don't care for it. There is rarely anything between.  Flawless acting, passionate direction, and a memorable score have made the film a powerful cinematic experience, and at times, it can be thought provoking.  It never lacks in pace, there is always a steady rhythm to the film.  The Shawshank Redemption is a modern masterpiece.Rating: 10

It is one of the most fantastic films I have ever seen. Thanks to a colleague of my company, she introduced it to me. Actually, I have noticed the film for a long time in video&audio shops in my city. But maybe the cover and the translation of the movie's name are not attractive, it didn't catch my attention. I saw it in a cold winter afternoon. And when the film ended, I thanked GOD for taking me such a good film to me. Tim Robbins and Freeman, from then on, became my most favorite actors. The end of the film is make me moved. It may the best end for the audience and Andy and Red. Somewhere you have no memory, in paradise maybe. I wish I could take time there someday.

Comment Head: Yet another brilliant masterpiece from King and Durabont.
Comment Body: This ranks right up with my favorite movies of all time.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman give excellent performances in this movie.  It kind of annoys me that this movie won no award.  It should have swept the Oscars and the Academy Awards.  Still this movie should be seen again and again.  It is one of those movies that just won't get tiring and maybe it might just attract fans in the new century.  I give it a ten out of ten!Trust me go see this movie!!!!

Comment Head: So far the best American film I have ever seen.
Comment Body: This movie is so far the best American film I have ever seen. I am surprised it didn't receive the Academy Award for Best Picture and Best Director. The story is touching and the actors delivered excellent performance. It captured the subtle human emotions one expressed when he faced a sudden traumatic misfortune in life and demonstrated how he kept hope and faith when he spent years of difficult life in prison. It also has a good portrait of true friendship between the two main characters in the movie (Tim Robins and Morgan Freeman). I am sure I will own a DVD for this film and will watch it again and again over the years as every time I watched it, it reminded me of the courage, hope and faith one should have when faced with obstacles in life. I can't say enough good thing about this film. If you haven't watched it yet, I highly highly recommend it and you won't be disappointed.

A great film. Period. Those of you who haven't watched it yet, make sure to do so. Don't listen to those who say it isn't a great movie - obviously most of the rest of the world does think it was an absolute great movie. Watch it and judge for yourselves.

Comment Head: One of my five favourite movies of all time.
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is one of the wisest and most touching films I have ever seen.  It tells the tale of the friendship between two convicted murderers: Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) and "Red" Redding (Morgan Freeman). Many things make this a good film: its genuine depiction of prison life, the wonderful performances from Robbins and Freeman, the great music from Thomas Newman.  For all of these qualities, The Shawshank Redemption is worth seeing.What makes the film great for me, though, is the way that in its depiction of prison life, the film becomes an existential display of how most of us live our own lives.  ***SPOILER AHEAD***  Throughout the film, we are confronted by how people choose to accept their freedom.  Brooks, the old librarian, who has been in prison for almost his entire life, becomes scared of the freedom he enjoys, and can not take it.  The same fate almost befalls Red, but his redemption comes as he is able to accept the unpredictability of his life, and draw inspiration from Andy.  The film rings absolutely true, I know many people who are too afraid to chase after their own dreams, and would rather stay in a mundane yet predictable and secure job.  "Prison life consists of routine, and then more routine," Red says in the course of the film.  So, I imagine, do many people's lives.  The Shawshank Redemption is about breaking away from the routine, taking risks, and going after your dreams without compromise.

Comment Head: ONE OF THE BEST MOVIES OF ALL TIME
Comment Body: The movie was filled with inspiration and hope.  Great script and acting by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freemen.  I can never get tired of watching this amazing film.  An amazing well written screen play and camera shots too. I recommend everybody to see this film!

Comment Head: Brilliance of Stephen King visualized by Frank Darabont
Comment Body: The Shawshank redemption is simply excellent! a story that goes right to your heart and goes really deep in to the soul, and it shows us that hope does matter, without hope, we have nothing to go for.Wonderful acting by the modern legend Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins the story is brilliantly told, and the movies should be one second shorter and not one second longer, Stephen King and Frank Darabont really knows what to do to keep the story fresh all the way!you should definitly get this movie!!
Simply the best film I've ever seen.  Inspiring, uplifting, well acted, and beautifully filmed.  It is a crime that Forrest Gump was even considered for best picture the same year this film was out.

Comment Head: Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins great collaboration.
Comment Body: Shawshank is a story about a man who is wrongly convicted for the murder of his wife and her lover.  He finds himself in the pits of hell or what is commonly known as Shawshank Prison.  There he learns about the power of truth and friendship as he changes the hearts of those he knows and lives with.  This story is not about the problems of our justice or prison systems and the horrors that prisoners face, not only from their fellow inmates but also from those there to "manage" them; rather this story relays the close bond that people form in tough situations and how our will to survive is not just about whether or not we live but how we live.
