To quote William Wallace from Braveheart, "every man dies not every man lives."  This is the story about choosing to live and live with dignity and friendship in the face of all hardships.  Highly Recommended

I think most of what I think about this movie has already been said in a number of positive and negative reviews already available for reference.  It certainly is what I would classify as a great movie, but since I haven't seen as many films as I would like, I'm not sure whether it would be appropriate for me to call it a "best of all time".You know when you see the end of a movie and it leaves you so shocked it takes your breath away(think "Sixth Sense")?  Let me put it this way:  have the Resolve carpet cleaner handy, for you will be dropping drinks throughout the movie.  It surprises you at every turn.I'm not a movie reviewer, and all I know is how I reacted to seeing it the first few times.  My family couldn't watch it with me, as my constant "Oh my God!"'s annoyed them.Just take my work for it and see it.  It can't hurt you.

Comment Head: Possibly the best movie of the 20th Century....
Comment Body: This movie has everything - hope and dreams, twists and humor, horror and happiness, success and failure. It is so many stories to so many people. I have seen all but the first 10 minutes 100 times, since every time I am surfing the cable channels and see it I stop and watch it, usually until the end. A fantastic story.

Superb acting and dialogue paint this moving tale of hope and friendship. With beautiful cinematography, complex characters, and witty yet poetic dialogue, the Shawshank Redemption is movie art at its finest. I find myself so enraptured by it, that I am unable to leave until the movie is complete... and I've seen it about 100 times. This is not a movie to watch while doing something else.

The Shawshank Redemption is the best film i have ever seen. The story by itself is just awesome, and the actors in this film are really superb It is not right that the godfather stands before this film.Shawshank Redemption should be at first place!!!!

Comment Head: NOT THAT GREAT!!! OPEN YOUR FRIGGIN EYES!!!!!!

Comment Body: Words are far too poor to embrace the magic of this film. This movie along with the brilliance of Morgan Freeman, Tim Robbins and the plot twists and spirit created by the master Stephen King is a masterpiece. I have never felt such a mixture of emotions from one film. And this film certainly delivers the kind of electricity that touches one's soul.

This is simply the definitive American film about the endurance of the human spirit.A wrongly convicted man spends twenty years in a brutal prison, never losing his hope for freedom. A beautifully written and directed film by frank Darabont.A true representation of what the art of film can be elevated to. One of the greatest films ever made.

Sometimes, when you see a film, it touches you in such a way that you find it difficult to describe. 'Shawshank Redemption', is one such film. Everything is just class. Freeman should have had an Oscar for his performance as 'Red', and I find it amazing that 'Gump' beat it to best film. Don't get me wrong, 'Gump' is a good film, but in my humble opinion the only film that can come close to this is 'the Godfather'. The ending to the film is just incredible, one of the few times that I have ever almost cried during a film. I won't give anymore away about the film. Just go and see it.NOW.I mean turn off your computer and get a video or DVD of it by any means possible. I agree that this is one of the GREATEST films ever.

Excellent, powerful drama about two mens' friendship and escape from Shawshank prison.  Robbins and Freeman excel in perfect roles.  Sharp script and touching subplots add to this enduring film.  Freeman's narration illuminates beauty and power of Stephen King short story upon which it is based.  Directed by Frank Darabont ("The Green Mile").

I had never heard of this movie.I missed it when it came out in theatres.But fortunately it was my destiny not to miss it.It is amazing!It has absolutely no "leaks",no parts in the plotline where you say "hey,something's wrong here".Freeman and Robbins give an excellent performance. It is one of the very few Hollywood movies I've seen,which actually contains large quantities of drama and feeling.Don't miss this movie,cause if you do you've lost one of the best experiences of your life

This movie is a great example of how a person can be wrongly convicted in today's legal justice system.  The movie also shows how someone's patience and determination can lead to their success in the future.  The movie is a great drama and one of the best movies I have ever seen!

Comment Head: 15 minutes short, or actually long of perfect.
Comment Body: Hard to believe that Tim Robbins could be so good in such a serious role. As usual, Freeman is fantastic and the supporting cast was effective. The only imperfection to this great film is that it runs about 15 minutes too long. Not to say that the last several scenes were unnecessary, but certainly dragged, after the climax of the film had been achieved. Nonetheless, a great movie with a brilliant twist.

SPOILER ALERT This movie--as I just watched it for, say, the 100th time this morning--is just incredible.  It gives me shudders everytime I watch it.  My favorite part is when the jerk realizes how tim robbins gets out.  What mastery!  I then felt true shudders when he scrambles out of the sewage pipe and rips off his shirt.  I can only imagine being thrown in jail, innocently, spending years there, and not only to be set free but get back at the jerk, and have money at the end.  The movie is thought-provoking and intense from beginning to end.  I love Morgan Freeman too.  The movie taught me many lessons, and reminded me that the simple flight of a bird and the blue of an ocean is something not to take for granted.  Freedom is definitely my biggest priority.

i read novels ...a lot..& i have never come across a movie (based on a novel)which could even equal the book version ...that is...until this movie came along. My God! what a movie..i dare even say that it was better than the book...novellette actually.Hats off to the movie makers. Andy is a classic case of 'never judge a book by it's color'. Morgan freeman in his best ever role...he can really play those all-knowing-incharge types. When i got to know how Andy escaped,...it was the shocker of a life time.Not even in my wildest dreams could i have done what Andy had done to escape. The warden was thoroughly chilling with his alum effected mouth. 'the sisters' were a real good throw-in...spice to the brew. A thoroughly enjoyable movie with more turns than a twister. Watch this one first, then watch something else.

What a fantastic movie!  Tim Robbins gave the best performance I have ever seen by an actor and Morgan Freeman was excellent, also.  There are some unbelievably moving scenes in this film. I foolishly passed it by at the theater and at the video store.  When I saw it on cable for the first time, I realized it was a truly special movie.  Why?  I could not put my finger on it until I read the summary on the video box in the store.  It really is a triumph of the human spirt with a tremendously satisfying ending.  This is one of the best movies I have ever seen and it will be added to my collection this Christmas!

Comment Head: one of the five best films ever made. Four Stars ****
Comment Body: This masterpiece belongs in the company of The Godfather, and other films often mentioned reverently as the best of all time. I am not going to compare this film to the other finest made, as that is often difficult to do, how does one quantify what is the best, without shortchanging other films. Simply put, this is a timeless story, which encompasses the best elements of all films, suspense, horror, comedy, tragedy, and puts them together in a seamless tapestry, as rich and colorful as life itself. Superlatives fail to illustrate the quality of this work, as complete and satisfying a film that has ever been made.

Comment Head: one of the best films i've ever seen!

Comment Body: This movie is the bomb!!  Great Movie!!  I don't have enough thumbs to recommend the Shawshank!!  Great actors in a great story.  This is a great movie to sit back with your girlfriend and just chill out.  It's just superb.  A must have in anyone's video collection!!

Comment Head: One of the best films ever
Comment Body: There's not much left to say about this film. Saw it last night for about the fifth time and I am still as impressed as I was seeing it the first time in cinema. Intelligent, moving, funny, and sad, this movie is just perfect. Freeman and Robbins are brilliant, so are the supporting characters. Too bad that there are not many more films like this one. A must see for everyone!

Comment Head: AN EXCELLENT STORY OF ONE MAN'S HOPE FOR FREEDOM
Comment Body: I HAVE NOT SEEN MANY FILMS ABOUT PRISON LIFE. I KNOW WHAT I HAVE SEEN FROM TELEVISION (REMEMBER THOSE TV SPECIALS "SCARED STRAIGHT"?), MAGAZINES, ETC. THEY ALL HAVE ONE SIMPLE THEME: PRISON IS "HELL" - AND THOSE WHO HAVE COMMITTED A CRIME, FOR WHATEVER REASON, DESERVE THEIR STAY IN "HELL".  SOME PEOPLE GO TO PRISON FOR ALL THE WRONG REASONS IN THE WORLD AS WELL - SOME ARE UNJUSTLY SENTENCED FOR CRIMES THEY DIDN'T COMMIT.  THIS IS THE STORY OF ANDY DUFRESNE - A MAN WHO WENT TO SHAWSHANK PRISON FOR ALL THOSE WRONG REASONS.  ALSO, IT EXPLORES ANDY'S FRIENDSHIP WITH ELLIS BOYD "RED" REDDING - A MAN WHO WENT TO PRISON FOR A CRIME HE COMMITTED. IT'S A STORY OF HOPE IN THE MIDST OF "HELL".  A MUST SEE FILM.  EXCELLENTLY DIRECTED BY FRANK DARABONT.

Comment Head: There is not a single human emotion that this film does not bring out.
One of the best films ever made and the most underrated film ever
Comment Body: This movie is simply amazing. The acting is superb, especially from Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, the direction is one of kind and the ending sequence is so touching that you will cry.This film should have get more attention. Can't understand why it didn't...

Comment Head: Of the thousands of movies I've seen this one is hands down the best!
Comment Body: After seeing this movie again there isn't any words that I can think of to adequately describe what a truly great movie the Shawshank Redemption represents.  Every human emotion was perfectly portrayed right down to the coldness of the Shawshank's concrete and steel.  This is Morgan Freeman's best movie to date and likely Tim Robbins best movie ever.  The cast's acting job is top notch.  The period and setting, perfect. Thomas Newman's music score, perfect.  Supporting cast, perfect.  I think that this is the only movie that I can not think of one single thing that would improve it. Nothing.  Owning this movie would be the crown jewel in anyone's collection.If you haven't seen this movie stop reading this now and go to the nearest video rental place, rent this movie, and come home and spend the best 2+ hours you will ever spend watching a movie. Really!  Stephen King is King. I can't understand what this movie is only #2 on IMDB and not #1.

The Shawshank Redemption is a great movie that has kept my attention from the first to the one hundredth time that I have watched it.  This was the first movie I had ever seen Tim Robbins in and I have like him ever since. Not too often can I watch a movie over and over again, but this one does it for me.  It is a very powerful movie with many touching parts.  Great movie overall...if you have never seen it before, I highly recommend it.

Comment Head: A very touching and wonderfully told story
Comment Body: A marvelous film that reaches in and touches your heart like no other movie has done before. After I watched this movie I was so moved by it that I sat there and stared at the screen after the credits rolled up. That is how excellent this movie is. This is a movie that everyone in the universe should see. An absolutely incredible film. An easy 10/10

...that if you've never seen this movie, that you'll take the time to watch.Even if it's from the beginning, the middle or the last 20 minutes. I watch this movie when it's on TV. Morgan Freeman is one of the finest actors in America, and his portrayal of Red's journey of friendship and to freedom is touching. His words, "get busy living or get busy dying," never fail to hit home.  It's just a good story that Frank Darabont turned into an excellent movie. The performances are all good - Freeman deserved an Oscar. Absolutely one of the best movies ever.

Comment Head: Not the greatest, but too good to miss

Comment Body: Anyone who has seen this film will understand why I cannot justify with words.Anyone who has not seen it; I feel sorry for you.10/10

Comment Head: One of the top two films ever made
Comment Body: This film didn't win the Best Picture Oscar?  It would have been under-appreciated even if it had won, an Oscar isn't worthy enough to be associated with this amazing film.  They should have created a separate award for this movie--"The Best Film Ever" award.

I must say this is one of the most touching movies I have ever seen - and without a doubt one of the best. Although it doesn't resemble the usual Stephen King writings, it helps to show his diverse talent as a writer.

To say that The Shawshank Redemption is an exquisite piece of film-work doesn't even begin to scratch the surface of how this film can and will affect those that choose to view it.  Yes, some points are brought violently to the surface, yet throughout Shawshank, there is a subtlety to the relationships between all of the characters, not just the lead roles.  I have read a copy of the original screenplay, and although many "adjustments" were made by Frank Darabont, I honestly believe that absolutely nothing could be added or even taken away to improve this work in any way.  And as strange as it may seem to my friends who ask, yes, being a woman, The Shawshank Redemption is my favorite film of all time.  And yes, "hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things..."

Comment Head: The only perfect movie ever made.
Comment Body: This movie is absolutely perfect.  If you have not yet seen it, you must get up from the computer and rush to the video store NOW.  It is a wonderfully crafted tale of hope and the human spirit.  I love this movie, and consider it the #1 movie of all time.  I feel sorry for you if you have not yet seen it.
I'm a big King fan and I loved the book.  This is the best screenplay of King's work in my opinion. Brilliant cast and acting. Exceptional story from one of the great writers of our time.

Comment Head: Maybe the greatest and best made movie of all time

Comment Body: This film is an absolute beauty, but no-one seems to have picked up on the music. It's a fantastically atmospheric and sparsely written piano/strings score by Thomas Newman, and does exactly what a good film score should do: enhances the atmosphere 110 percent without ever intruding on, or detracting from, the visuals. Quality stuff!

Comment Head: a grand escape and passion drama....
Comment Body: well...what can i say about that movie...it's just a dramatic galore..it takes you in a side..and then pull you the hell from the other side..i think morgan freeman was great...i liked him much here:))) also the music was great..it is really a 10/10 movie..

Comment Head: It's a crime this film didn't sweep the oscars.

Comment Body: I missed this when it came out, and probably wouldn't have gone even if I had heard about it. I expected this to be what "The Green Mile" was. That is, I thought it would be heavy-handed, pretentious, self-consciously high-minded, and boring. It is anything but these. It's an engrossing story and very entertaining story of two men and how they overcome their past lives. Freeman and Robbins give wonderful performances, and the supporting cast measures up. There are plenty of funny moments in the film, and the ending is intensely satisfying. It is a great movie.

This movie is uplifting and it is amazing and there are so many adjectives I could use to describe it so I won't waste your time...Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are amazing and the story is amazing, considering that I'm not a fan of King's works...I rated this a 10/10 for that wonderful film...

It's fun to watch this movie a second time and pick up some things you never noticed the first time. So many things simply went unnoticed (Andy writing into the wall, his little geology tool, the "sex symbols throughout the decades" posters) and suddenly wind together to grab our attention and make this a wonderful movie. The film was fascinating in the fact that it showed us how "lifers" could only witness the change of culture in the outside world by observing the prisoners that come and go over the years, and this being the only glimpse on how the world is changing, they become institutionalized, and actually fear their freedom. I actually found myself feeling sorry for murderers, and I debated with myself on whether or not they should be released if they truly become rehabilitated. The determination and hope transpired by Andy brought our hopes up: Most movies bring our hopes up only to bring them down, but when we see him running through the pond and standing in the rain with his arms raised and the great music accompanying the scene, our hopes our fulfilled. This is one of only about three or four films that had great smarts and left me completely satisfied. 10/10.

Comment Head: The most inspire movie about human determination
An excellent piece of story telling!

Comment Body: This film's high ranking on IMDB is both a testimony to its greatness and a spotlight on how embarrassingly out of touch the Oscar Academy is.Congratulations to all of those involved in making one of the truly greatest films of all time.

This movie has to be the most electrifing movies of all time.  This short story (originally written by Stephen King) gives a heart pounding reality of an innocent banker who uses hope, courage, and brains to OUTsmart the pison walls of Shawshank.    Morgan Freeman plays an exceptional character (Red) who claims that being "institutionalized" can keep a man from being truly free.  This movie displays one of the best one-liners I have ever heard and the best ending life has to offer-(if you listen close to what Red has to say he fore shadows Andy's greatest stunt.) I enjoyed SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION and I enjoy IMDB, they display all the memorable quotes that I enjoyed and I gave this movie a Rating of 10!!
One of the greatest movie I've seen. It tuched me deep in my heart. Absolutely brilliant.Congratulations King.

The Shawshank Redemption made me spend a good evening when I watched it. Though quiet common, the plot has a good rythm. The beginning of the movie is even very common, with the scene of a murder and the following trial. The story in the prison goes rather slowly. The actors are good, especially Morgan Freeman. It is a good entertainment, but nothing more.

Comment Head: Brilliant! The greatest drama since Citizen Kane!
Comment Body: Shawshank Redemption is one of the greatest flicks I have ever seen. Morgan freeman and Tim Robbins put on an award-winning performance.  I think this film would have received more Academy Awards if the subject matter had not been so dark and it had not been facing Forrest Gump and Pulp Fiction. I watch this film time and time again and still have the same anxiety of the first time.  I have ruined three video tapes of the Shawshank Redemption by excessive viewing.  Each purchase of a new tape is worth it!
This is what it's all about! The creation of a movie that will move us all. A great story, great actors, great filming, but most of all:A superb plot. Absolutly superb.

Just saw this for the first time on TV and I will definitely get a DVD copy for watching again and again.  A really great movie! I was mesmerized by Freeman and Robbins acting ability.  I felt like they were my personal friends by the end of the movie.  I could relate to their inner thoughts and deeds.

I saw this movie for the first time a year and a half ago.  I liked it, but I didn't remember how much until it was on TV today.  Everything comes together so well at the end, and on repeated viewing, there is a whole new level to it.Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are both exceptional in their roles.  Robbins plays Andy Dufresne, a convicted murderer who goes to Shawshank Prison where he is befriended by Red (Morgan Freeman), who has already served 20 years there.  Despite the hardships of prison, Andy refuses to lose hope, and he tries to inspire Red to feel as he does.I can't think of one scene that was wasted.  Everything helped build to the movie's conclusion.  Every character was important, as was every line of dialogue.I actually cried at the end.  This movie really makes you think and touches your heart.  Next to Pulp Fiction, the best movie of the 90's.

The Shawshank redemption is one of a very few movies that lives up to the book it is based upon. Many Stephen King books become almost unrecognizable on the screen, but this one, like 'The Green Mile', stays true to the feel and rhythm of the book. Every time I watch it, I appreciate it more. One of the best.

I want to say that this film is one of the best ever:THE REASON IS SIMPLE...........................ACTING IS AWESOME!!!!!!!!!! Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are simply the BEST!!!!!!AS FOR FORREST GUMP.......................DO YOU REALLY BELIEVE THAT IT WAS BETTER THAN THE "SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION"??????NO WAYYYYYYYYYY! FORREST GUMP IS A SIMPLE FRAUD!!!!!!!!TOM HANKS IS AWFUL,AND SO IS THE ENTIRE FILM...................

You've heard the rule, the book is always better than the movie.  Here is the only exception I have found.  This movie is better than the book.  A great book - Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption, by Stephen King. The movie is even better.  It could well have been named, the Shawshank Exception.

This must be one of the movies I have enjoyed most at the cinema. I can't find one bad moment in this masterpiece. Both Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman delivered their parts as if they were living them. Morgan Freeman's thought's was interesting listening too. My feeling for this film can't be expressed in words so I let the rest of the audience decide whether they like it or not. But as You already imagine, this is one of my favorites. 10 out of 10A must see......................

Comment Head: It doesn't get much better than this.

Comment Body: I have no clever thoughts or ideas about this movie.  I am not going to discuss the plot, acting, or directing.  It is just the best movie I have ever seen.  Period.  End of story.  See ya.  .

The Shawshank Redemption was a beautifully directed movie. The actors portrayed their characters to the greatest extent and i thoroughly enjoyed this movie. The best scene in the movie was the huge tree...each of its branches catching the suns rays as Morgan Freeman finds what Tim Robbins left for him...anyone who doesn't remember that better watch the movie again.

This film is based on Stephen King's story Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption. It was part of a collection of four short novels, among them Apt Pupil (adapted by Bryan Singer) and The Body (made into Stand By Me by Rob Reiner). Shawshank was a great story and the film adaption by Frank Darabont is brilliant. The film is highlighted by the strong performances of Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins.This movie has everything you could want in a film: inspiring story of people persevering through bad times, strong directing and acting (two of the very best actors of today) and one of the classic endings I've seen in a movie.Shawshank is well-made and inspiring. It has joined my personal movie hall-of-fame, which includes The Grapes of Wrath, High Noon, Goodfellas, L.A. Confidential and Bugsy. I also reccomend The Green Mile, Darabont's most recent King adaption.

I really enjoyed this movie. There was obviously a lot of thought put into the script and it delivers brilliantly. The directing is also wonderful, and the actors fit the part perfectly. This is a gruesome account of prison life in the 1950's-60's that is very violent, although this was necessary in the film. A very good movie, and a must-see!

In my book this is the best movie ever made, or at least my favorite.  I know that may be going out on a limb, but it is that spectacular.  It makes me smile every time in the end, it actually brings me near tears which very few movies have ever done.

Comment Head: By far the easiest movie to watch over and over again!
Comment Body: Arguably Tim Robbins' greatest performance to date.  Coming from someone who tends to appreciate movies set behind bars, this movie is every bit worth 10 stars!  I was astonished to find out that this is adapted from a great Stephen King short story, Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption.Before writing this review, I sat down, with a bowl of popcorn and a cold one (Pepsi), and watched this great movie again.  It has come to my opinion that there is absolutely nothing wrong with this movie, or the way it was put together. Everyone prisoner should be allowed to watch this movie, and hope that their warden would allow them to keep after the books, and then use that position to break out.  But, after all, this is Hollywood!

This is one of the best films I have ever seen in my life the acting and story are superb. If you have not seen this movie go see it RIGHT NOW! This movie has wone 7 Oscars I think and it deserves ever one of them.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are a great team together

This simply is the best movie I've ever seen. With 2 of the greatest actors (Tim Robbins & Morgan Freeman) and such a great ending, it will be difficult to beat (in my case). This movie will be the standard for 'jail-movies' for a very long time!

This movie was a little overrated, but it was still wonderful.  What can I say that hasn't already been said.  It was a lot like the Green Mile, only it has some more interesting plot twists and such.  It had a great ending. It deserved to be nominated for Best Picture, and I enjoyed it more than Forrest Gump (which, I think won that year), but I think Pulp Fiction should have won that year.

Comment Head: powerful, but could have been less intense
Comment Body: There is no doubt in my mind that this is a very powerful and important motion picture.  But, due to the R rating, there are certain situations that are somewhat shocking in nature.  A few cuts might have helped move the story along, too.  Otherwise, an ok film.

I was so surprised and glad to see this movie as high as it is on this site's list.  It is one of my favorite movies and so many people missed out on it because of GUMP, which I personally feel is an inferior movie.Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman give incredibly moving and restrained performances that moved me to tears more than once. The direction and timing were flawless, and the story itself inspirational. It is so nice to see a Stephen King movie done right for once.This is simply a wonderful movie, worth watching over and over again.

Comment Head: Hands down the Greatest Movie ever made

Comment Body: Someone please tell me why this film is number two when it has a 9.0 user rating. Perhaps the mafia has an insider here to keep the Godfather number 1. Anyway this film deserves to be number 1 for so many reasons. Just see it and you will know why.

A beautiful film.  I must have seen it twenty times.  No joke.  Thomas Newman's haunting musical score still touches me with every viewing.  This is one of those films that plays on TV almost constantly and yet you still find yourself watching it every time.  I guess its because of its epic scale and like a great painting you can find some new in it each time you view it.Frank Darabont does a great adaptation of Stephen King's novella from his 'Different Seasons' collection.  I guess the theme of each novella in the book relates to the different seasons.  The quote 'hope springs eternal' is at the preface of the Shawshank section of the book and if you've seen the film you know hope is the movie's central theme.Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins make a great pair in this, probably the best on screen pair since Redford and Newman.  See this film and you may become a Shawshank fanatic like so many other people.

Comment Head: Gets better every time I watch it

Comment Body: ...movie and like another of my favorites, "Fried Green Tomatoes," one that I could see over and over again and still find something new to appreciate. This is a jewel of a movie and one that I'm sorry didn't receive the recognition it so richly deserved. James Whitmore should at least have been nominated for Best Supporting Actor; that he didn't is a disgrace. Morgan Freeman gives his usual awesome performance. Rent this movie! Then a few months later, rent it again. This movie is so poignant and says so much about friendship and hope that I defy anyone not to be moved by it.

If more people would watch the Shawshank Redemption before putting on a film maker hat and providing the public with the crud that's out there, I am convinced that the world would be a much better place! This film is just simply UNREAL! Great job all around and no wonder it's in the top 5 of the IMDB's all time best 100.

Comment Head: An inspirational reflection of life's own tribulations
Comment Body: This and Clint Eastwood's "Unforgiven" rank side by side at the summit of my all-time favorites list (and no, I am not a Morgan Freeman freak).This is the kind of movie that starts out solid and keeps driving at you...solid. It does not make any insultingly wrongful turns in logic nor does it infringe on your conception of what is believable and what is excruciatingly unbelievable.This is a no-frills story of a man who is wrongfully accused of murdering his wife. The film's glorious irony, that his 19-years-long jail sentence is the best thing to happen to him in his life, slowly manifests itself.

Comment Head: A spectacular debut unfortunately followed by a lackluster sophomore effort
Comment Body: After being slightly dissappointed by "The Green Mile", I decided to check out Frank Darabont's first adaptation of a Steven King prison story once again. "The Shawshank Redemption" remained as much of an enjoyably original modern classic after this second viewing. In this second viewing, I appreciated even more the sparklingly sharp dialogue between Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. Like in "Green Mile", Darabont set the scene of a depression-era prison extremely well. The director was also well-served to use King's vivid character descriptions to make the supporting characters as memorable as the leads. The result was an instant, uplifting classic about hope brought to the most hopeless locations.

Comment Head: Well deserving of it's number 2 IMDb ranking!
Comment Body: I do not normally consider myself to be much of a drama fan, having always preferred the action-adventure genre. "The Shawshank Redemption" is the film that changed that feeling for me, and reading the other comments and reviews, for a lot of other people as well.  Frank Darabont made a giant leap forward from his previous efforts in the "B" horror film world when he came up with this gem.  Tim Robbins turned in his best performance as Andy Dufresne, and Morgan Freeman was brilliantly cast as Red.  This is a "Feel-Good" movie of the first order, and well worth it's number 2 ranking on the IMDb top 250.  Everything works in this film, the score, the acting, the realism of the prison scenes, absolutely  everything!  "Shawshank" is as close to a perfect film as you will ever see.  If you do not already own a copy of this masterpiece, run, do not walk, to the video store and purchase a copy.  It should be in the library of every movie fan.  A 5 star, 10 out of 10, classic movie!!

this is the greatest movie i have ever seen.  by reading the plot you may think of it as just another prison movie. it's more of a friends movie. the greatest portrayal of how wonderful a friend is i have ever seen.  i love this movie and have seen it a million times and will see it another million times.

Comment Head: Best Prison Movie Ever? Heck, Best Movie Ever. Period.
Comment Body: Okay, I will not reiterate what praises others have said about this movie. I think it's brilliant and touching, and others have expressed this more eloquently than I can. See for yourself.  I just wish IMDB had a 1 to 100 scale for rating movies, instead of 1 to 10. Then I could give this movie a perfect 100, while giving something like "Cinema Paradiso" a 94 or 95. As it stands, I gave both movies a ten, but I think Shawshank is a shade better, and I wish a new ratings could reflect that opinion.

Comment Head: Inspiring, fulfilling; the best movie I've ever seen
Comment Body: For me, the best movies inspire emotion.  This movies does just that for me, better than any other movie to date.The message here is one of mostly one of hope with a dash of justice thrown in.  There is hope for the unjustly incarcerated, and justice for those who do wrong.  Andy DeFresne, despite all the odds against him, never lets the situation get to him. Red finds his hope through Andy.The onscreen performances are superb. Every character has dimension and adds to the message.  The screenplay, the most important component of any movie, is simply flawless.

Comment Head: The Greatest Film Ever? Could Be.

Comment Body: I have many films that I regard as my personal favourites and it is difficult to put these in any order.  However the number one in my list is easy - The Shawshank Redemption. This film has addictive qualities - if this film is on a screen you have to watch it no matter how often you've seen it. I think I'll go and watch it again now!

Comment Head: If ever a film deserved a bag of Oscars, this is it!

Comment Body: An intelligent, resourceful man survives in a brutal prison during the 1950's and 60's. Emphasis on character development rather than enviroment place this film ahead of others in this genre.  A fine example of the triumph-of-human-spirit-over-adversity theme. (Rating: A)

This film is so beautiful and so touching I had problems seeing it without crying. Who knew Stephen King could write like this and the first film of Frank Darabont(later he directed The Green Mile)was to be one of the greatest films ever made. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins are excellent in this movie and the way the story itself is told is pure genius.It`s a brutal and violent film ,but still it`s the most beautiful and loving film I`ve ever seen. It`s a story about friendship and hope and the road to freedom.The greatest scene in the film is when Andy and his fellow-prisoners work at the roof,and Andy is nearly killed by captain Hadley, but ends up drinking beer in the morning sun with his friends "like free men".

Comment Head: A human being's spirit can be the most powerful thing of all.
Comment Body: An all-time favorite.  I am a college professor, and have used this film in sociology, science of success, and various legal classes that I teach.  The reactions of students are almost always extremely poignant.  An inspirational prison movie.  Unbelieveable.

This film is destined to become a classic. It shows the human spirit in full force. The story is terrific with many wonderful characters. Morgan Freeman delivers a truly brilliant performance that received a well-deserved Academy Award nomination. Bob Gunton gives a wonderfully villainous, intense performance as Warden Norton. Darabont's direction is solid. The climax is wonderfully uplifting. On a personal note, I thought this film slowed down at times but these sequences were essential to the plot, they just seemed to distract me. This film is definetly worth a look.

I remember wanting to see this movie because I saw the promotional shot of Robbins standing in the rain; I thought it was a beautiful scene.  It is a minor scene in the movie.This movie is, for lack of a better word, perfect.  Every moment holds meaning, every performance is dead on.  I have watched it more times than I can count, and it always seems new and wonderful to me.  More than any movie I have seen, it brings real emotions to the audience and brings comfort to the hopeless.Sometimes I think a great work of art is one that brings change to the audience.  This movie is transforming.

This is the best movie ever made.  If you haven't seen it yet, stop doing whatever it is that you are doing, go to your local video store, shell out the three or four dollars to rent the videotape or DVD, go home, put some popcorn in the microwave, put the movie in, turn on your home entertainment center, sit on the couch, and WATCH THIS MOVIE.  If you have friends who haven't seen it yet, tell them to come over and watch it with you.  You will not be disappointed.  They will not be disappointed.  This is the best movie ever made.

Comment Head: Calling it a masterpiece is an understatement
Comment Body: This movie is brilliant.  There is no need to go into detail about the reasons behind my saying so.  It is a film that everyone should simply take the time out to watch- to try to describe its qualities would be at best an injustice to this piece of treasure.  I have never encountered a single person who regretted watching the film, and come on lets give it some more 10s so it can beat out the godfather! (which I haven't seen so maybe once I do I'll be singing a different tune)...but regardless, this film is amazing, and not many can compare to it at all.

This film ranks as one of my top 10 films of all time .Superb performances by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins , they cast this film wonderfully , From the crafty warden , to the prison guards , to all the inmates , And what a terrific ending to a superb film .This film was nominated for Best Picture but lost to Forrest Gump , had it not been for Gump , this film would have surely won Best Picture.I have watched this film 20 or so times and never get tired of it , No question it is the best Prison Film ever made ( Escape from Alcatraz close second ).

This film is, with no shadow of a doubt what so ever, the best movie that I have ever had the wonderous pleasure to view. Films like Shawshank are what allow me to love movies and to cherish wonderful stories. I can say that I'm a critical gremlin- I'm constantly attempting to find faults, flaws and plot holes in every movie i see- yes, I'm that guy who always says it was only an ok movie when you loved it- But... this one is so powerful, so beautiful, so absolutely inspiring that I couldn't care if there was a plot hole or a flaw, its just too good of a film to attack. To Hell with Forest Gump for winning over Shawshank, to Hell with Titanic, Shakespeare in garbage, The English Idiot, and Forest Dump- these movies all sucked, sucked, sucked to begin with but compared to the diamond jewel of Shawshank, they look as good as sitcoms made by Fox. So anyway, my favorite movie of all time and only one of three movies worthy of a ten rating.

i really dont have any more to say - except read the other reviews - they really say it for me. In other words - this is one of the greatest movies of all time. This is an absolute masterpiece and it will be definitely a film that i will gladly show to my grandchildren in the mid-21st century - IT'S THAT GOOD... watch it and learn.....

It's a great thing when you can finally find a movie you can definitively call "your favorite".  This is mine.  "The Shawshank Redemption", based on Stephen King's short novella entitled "Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption", is an excellent adaptation of said literature...I will go out and say it; I've read the story and seen the movie, and although the movie took some parts out (in the story, there were three different wardens over the course of the story, and Red was Irish, not black), it expanded the detail greatly, covering parts the novella never bothered to touch on (such as Andy getting a new set of clothes and a shiny pair of shoes from the Warden ^_^).  The characters are all detailed and alive, not once did I find a character unbelievable. And I've never EVER seen an ending so incredible.  My eyes were wide, I was chanting "Oh My God" over and over...This movie makes you feel good all over and gives you a new perspective on life and freedom. This movie is nothing short of a masterpiece.  The only fault I find is that it came out at the time as Forrest Gump, which had a lot more advertising and thus beat this great movie out in the box office.  Had it come out a few months later, it would have been much more successful.

This film is truly one of the greatest of all time.  Much like the other works based on Stephen King novels, there is a main storyline to follow, and then another deeper story.Morgan Freeman does a very impressive job portraying a man who has been held prisoner by his own fear of the outside world, and who is eventually freed by hope.  Tim Robbins also did an excellent job, but Frank Darabont really deserves a lot of credit for fleshing out this beautifully written script into a great movie.This is a movie that warrants multiple viewings.  Four stars!

Comment Head: The Most Worthy of All Movies!
Comment Body: This was one of the very first movies that got me choked up.  I first saw it on a Pay television network, then decided that I had to have it.  To think that such a worthy film in all categories (Acting, Directing, Etc.) did not receive not one Oscar.  Yes! I was p***ed off as well.  It was much better that Forrest Gump, but hey I don't decide what wins and what doesn't. This is a definite movie for everyone!

All my friends had the same reaction to this movie as I did when first viewing it .. how come I never heard more about it? It was great! The acting was fantastic. The storyline flowed perfectly. The writing and editing couldn't have been better.  Clearly, if not pitted against "Forrest Gump", "Little Women", "Nell", "Quiz Show" and "Pulp Fiction" (wow, what a line-up), I'm sure this movie would have won more awards. Morgan Freeman was great, and Tim Robbins was nothing short of amazing. If you like acting, this movie is a must!

I have read the short story (novella?) by Steven King and seen this great film and I have to say that this is one time when Hollywood did a better job then the author. I've seen tons of prison movies (some with good plots and others that are complete B movies) and this has to be the best one out there. Usually when I like a movie, I can watch it a bunch of times. And I have seen Shawshank many times, but none of the repeated viewings were as good as the first. Clancy Brown (he was great in Highlander too) once again steals the show as a Hard A--- prison guard who gets his just desserts in the end. Chances are you've already seen this, but if you haven't, I fully recommend you give it a chance.

The Shawshank Redemption was a film that I was always on my way to the theater to see, but unfortunately, I got sidetracked each and every time. Critics felt that the long title kept people away, I guess I was in that category, no matter how great I heard this movie was. I finally saw the movie the day it hit videotape. To this day, it continues to dominate the number one position on my list of favorite films of all time. There is so much to love about this film. Especially the writing by Frank Darabont. This is one of the few films that does Stephen King's material justice. It's a very uplifting story, one that you can't really articulate with words. This film is about the experience. I'm proud to say that I own a copy of the movie, a copy of the screenplay, and a copy of Different Seasons, in which the original story derived. This is the one picture I recommend to people, even strangers, on a regular basis.

To begin with,  The story is pretty well cliched.  Like most prison dramas hope and struggle seem to be the element that put the plot together.  For once this is probably the one time that such a cliched plot actually worked. I have personally seen this movie over 20 times just to figure out how and why it works so well.  First of all the story is deep and thought provoking. Morgan Freeman's voice over narrative lets you see it through his eyes (the movie is really about him).  The acting is flawless the whole picture is shot as a true epic.  This is one great film about friendship and hope that does not dwell to much on pathos and mindless sentimentality.  A true modern day classic!

I remember seeing The Shawshank Redemption back in '94 and thinking how absolutely out of the ordinary it was for a Hollywood picture. No soft soap ending, no moral message and no "Whey-hey isn't America great" that you usually get from Hollywood pics. The fact its a Steven King is remarkable to, out of his usual style, I think. It's photographed beautifully and makes no bones about the harsh reality of prison. I don't really know much about Frank Dufont but I would really like to see his other pictures based on the strength of this one.

Comment Head: The best film of all time.
Comment Body: It is almost impossible to glorify this movie more than it deserves because, simply I believe it is the greatest ever made. The story, characters, music are absolutely mesmerizing. The story of the never say die hope of a wrongfully convicted man sent to prison for life is awe-inspiring and poignant.  Watch this with someone you love and cherish. **** stars

This movie is absolutely superb. You watch it and all the simple, unremarkable details just cumulate and you realise that this movie, by being unflashy and ordinary is telling a powerful story about hope and redemption. Andy seems to be the main character but it is Red who finds himself, who is redeemed.The Shawshank Redemption was overlooked because it looked unremarkable. But this movie has to be seen. My friends are action movie fanatics but they were all stunned by this movie. Stephen King should be thanked for writing the novella and the director should be praised for bringing it to the screen in such fine form. Forget Forrest Gump, this was the Best Picture of 1994.

Comment Head: One Of The Best Movies I Have Ever Seen.
Comment Body: Morgan Freeman at his absolute best, Tim Robbins - better than ever - it must be a good film!!The Shawshank Redemption grabs you tight and pulls you into its depth and drama. It is definitely worth a look if you haven't seen it.This film shows the story of how hope can set you free. It is a beautiful film with excellent actors, an good story and shocking (but excellent) dialouge. The Shawshank Redemption definitely deserves it's place as my no. 5 favourite film and IMDb's no. 3 user rated film.My rating : Obviously 10/10.

I happened to see this film on TV not too long ago.  My husband was watching so I thought I would sit down and watch.  I was absolutely blown away by this film  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman were super!!  It was well acted well edited.  This is one of the most outstanding movies I have seen in recent years.I purchased the video and have watched numerous times.  The conclusion of this film had me on the edge of my seat.  JUST OUTSTANDING!

This would have to be THE best movie that I have ever seen. The story of a wrongly convicted man. And the story of a man searching for meaning. And the story of an institutionalised man. This movie takes several different stories and turns them into one fantastic film.Watch it a number of times to see all the stories come together in an inspiring manner that touches the soul. I can't recommend this movie enough. Morgan Freeman's performance of the narrating Red, and explanations of prison life are truly touching. Tim Robbins' portrayal of Andy is near perfect, no, it IS perfect.Watch it, then watch it again.You won't be disappointed.

Comment Head: A testament to the spirit of Hope...

Comment Body: This is a story with drama, injustice, pain and real friendship. Both performances ( Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins ) were wonderful, they have made the movie even more interesting!!! No doubt, one of my favourites so far...really it is just to watching it too many times with no possibility of getting bored!!!

This is a 'must see' movie. Very strong emotionally and with great actors that perform at their best.But this movie makes you think, think about life and specially about hope, and the final is well worth seeing it.After all, isn't Shawshank our prison to us all?

When it comes to analyzing the true meanings of movies I'm no expert, but this movie really gave me a feel of inner hope and confidence. I mean, put your self in Andy Dufresne's(Tim Robbins) position. If you were in prison for something that not only did you not do but was being accused of murdering someone that you loved and cared for. And you go to prison for what 30? 40 years? and day after day you dig and you dig and you dig, and with what?? a spoon!! I know I would have gone nuts by then. BUT Andy gave hope, and he also gave Red(Morgan Freeman) hope. And I think that was the main aspect of the whole movie. Which is, in no matter what type of circumstances there is always one Andy Dufresne giving hope. Go find yours!!!!I gave this movie a 8/10.

The movie had plot up the wazoo! The acting was superb. Robbins and Freeman were at their highest in this movie.  There were so many emotions flying through it and there was so much about the human mind.  It will leave you in awe.

Comment Head: Sticks around in your mind a lifetime.
Comment Body: It's not the easiest thing in the world to describe with words how perfect THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION really is.                              Well, let's try. It won't take long, read other comments for closer details and views. This is a fantastic unforgettable movie where a banker (Robbins) gets his life changed, when he get a double life-sentence because of the murder of his wife and her lover. The first years gets to be a pure hell, he gets harassed, and he doesn't fit in. When he meet Freeman and his pals and starts a friendly relationship the movie starts up. Memorable and entertaining movie with big lifts by most of the fantastic cast. And this is coming from Stephen King?                               10/10

Recently, the quality of movies seems to have gone down.  There are too many action flicks and cheap comedies and not enough really good movies.  There are very few that have been made recently that are moving and contain powerful messages.  The Shawshank redemption is one.  I can honestly say that I look at many aspects of life differently because of this movie. And yet it saddens me that so many people that I know have never even seen it. I have always thought of it as under-appreciated.  It was because of seeing this movie ranked 3rd on the top 250 that I became a member of this site. It stands out as one of the best movies ever made.

Comment Head: The best movie i have ever seen
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption, is and always will be one of the greatest films ever.  Tim Robbins portrail of Andy is enough to melt the coldest heart. The secound i saw this on DVD i just had to buy it.  I give this film a rating of infinity out of 10 as it deserves it.

Yeah I agree this is not a bad film. Its got a story that sucks you right in and it plays its hand very well but it really doesn't stand up too closely to scrutiny in my humble opinion. The plot is rather riddled with holes (do you really mean to tell me that after all those years in prison and the searches the prison guards never found a tunnel behind the picture....Puhleeease... How stupid are we meant to think those prison guards are)and it really is just a well-made feelgood movie. Look, I enjoyed the movie but after reading many of the comments on this website it sounded like it was directed by God Almighty and starred his only-begotten son. A bit of critical judgement please.

Comment Head: The most powerful and influential movie ever made.
Comment Body: No other movie like it! The greatest tragedy about this movie is that it never won an oscar! Out of 7 nominations it did'nt even pick up one. I ask what is wrong with these people?? It is very rare that a movie such as Shawshank comes along and has such an influence on the lives of many who have watched it. It touches the heart and is an inspiration for us all. What makes it such a masterpiece is its unpredictability right till the very end. In my opinion this movie should be re-released and nominated again for an Oscar.

Comment Head: A Masterpiece of Modern Film Making
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is one of the best movies I have ever seen.  There is so much to this story and if you blink once you'll miss something. Behind every color and object there lies a message. Watching this movie only once is an injustice. It is a great movie and I highly recommend it.

Comment Head: One of the best prison dramas available!

Comment Body: "The Shawshank Redemption" is an uplifting movie about hope. What I got out of the movie is that as long as you have hope you will always be O.K., I felt good after watching this movie, it puts that sense of hope inside you. I was actually cheering during the scene where Andy finally escaped from prison,it was a very unique moment. This is a film that anybody can watch and anybody that does watch it it will touch them in a special way, I guarantee it.

If you haven't seen the Shawshank Redemption by now, it's likely that you live in a cave and haven't been in touch with society for the last five years.  This is one of the best films ever made because it captivates your attention from start to finish.  I can throw it in the VCR and it doesn't matter what scene may be playing, I'm instantly engaged.  A strong story, solid acting and some glorious cinematography create a film that I cannot go more than a month without watching it.  I will likely wear the tape that the film is captured on out and I will be forced to replace that tape and I can honestly say I won't mind having to do so.

Comment Head: Hope springs eternal for Andy Dufresne and Hollywood
Comment Body: A beautiful film, finely crafted, and completely deserving of the cult status it has gained since losing the Academy Award for Best Picture (unjustly) to "Braveheart" in 1995. Tim Robbins will never top his performance as the wrongly-convicted Andy Dufresne, and Morgan Freeman delivers the most effective voice-over narration in film history. I defy anyone not to be moved by the touching relationship between the two men, who grow old before our eyes as they serve out their sentences. One for history. I'll still get teary-eyed when I watch this fifteen years from now.

Comment Head: "watch this, for ye not know when the master of the house cometh"
Comment Body: I first saw The Shawhank Redemption a year back and I was totally blown away. this film is perfect in EVERY sense, from acting to story to score,to costume to cinematography. in fact i think they should have made a new academy award, best feeling film or something.This film was clearly ripped off at the 1994 oscars. forrest gump IS a good flick i agree, but if u look at character development,story and acting shawshank comes out on top.If for some reason u aint seen this film watch it now... it truly IS the greatest.and remember hope is a good thing maybe the best of things.....and no good thing ever dies....and nor will shawshank.6.58x10^96 is what i give it out of 10

Comment Head: Sticks around in your mind a lifetime.
Comment Body: It's not the easiest thing in the world to describe with words how perfect THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION really is. Well, let's try. It won't take long, read other comments for closer details and views. This is a fantastic unforgettable movie where a banker (Robbins) gets his life changed, when he get a double life-sentence because of the murder of his wife and her lover. The first years gets to be a pure hell, he gets harassed, and he doesn't fit in. When he meet Freeman and his pals and starts a friendly relationship the movie starts up. Memorable and entertaining movie with big lifts by most of the fantastic cast. And this is coming from Stephen King? 10/10

This was an awesome movie. I didn't expect it to be that good, when I first started to watch it. First time I saw it I fell asleep. It must have been because I was tired. Because now it was a wonderful movie. And if anybody from Mt. Vernon, Iowa reads this. It's great to watch it as we were supposed to do it in a class there last year but weren't allowed to because of the rating (R).

Comment Head: The Best Film I Think I've Ever Seen!!!!!!
Comment Body: I can't even go into words about how this film moved me.  The themes of hope and friendship are the powerful strings that tugged at my heart through out. A flawless masterpeice with excellent performances by Freeman and Robbins. For years, I've heard a lot of talk about this movie.  Damn, I'm glad I finally saw it.  10 out of 10....to say the least.

Comment Head: Excellent! Definitely on my top ten list!
Comment Body: Only those who have been in prison can appreciate best the dreams and hopes that keep folks in there going. Most are merely pipe dreams - never to be realised. I think this flick hits the nail on the head, pardon the clich√©. 10 outta 10!

Comment Head: You shall know the truth, and the truth shall set you free
Comment Body: I have no doubt in saying that this is undoubtedly the best movie I have ever seen. "The Shawshank Redemption" is a tale of suffering and despair, but also one of hope and redemption - as the title suggests. The truth of life lies within each one of us - just as it lay within Andy Dufresne - all we have to do is find it. Once you know the truth, it will set you free. The message of this film is that there is always hope, there is always truth, and together these two bring redemption - even in Shawshank!

Comment Head: Ranks right up there with To Kill a Mockingbird

Comment Body: I'm kind of lost for words for this movie. I saw it last night on my DVD-player and what I saw was brilliance. The story is about a banker Andy (Tim Robbins) who get prisoned for murdering his wife and her secret lover. In prison he says he's innocent, which makes the other inmates break out in laughter. No one is innocent in prison they say. `They've all been f***ed by lawyers.' What follows is a fight for justice. A inmate (George Freeman) who calls himself Red (the other inmates call him that because he's `irish') finds something special in Andy. They connect soon and becomes good friends. What strikes me about the main characters is that hope and belief is something that they always have. Even though they go through some very tough times in prison, they always have that good confidence in themselves. Go see this movie, if you love the concept of feeling free. There's no let downs or grief ending this movie. You have to see it for yourself.

Comment Head: A heartwarming tale of hope and human spirit
Comment Body: Hope, love, belief, friendship, feeling. Watch this film and re-establish once again what is good about the movies. If you don't particularly like watching films, I urge you to watch this and experience something unlike you have experienced before. This, alongside AMERICAN BEAUTY, is one of the greatest films ever made.

Any movie that you can see over 30 times and doesn't get old, doesn't become prone to having mistakes found in it and still keeps you anticipating the ending even though you know what's going to happen is a great movie. Flawless is the only word I can use to describe this movie.  From the acting of Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins to the screen play by Stephen King, this film doesn't have one flaw in it.  This film has one of the all time best endings if not the best ending I've ever seen.  A definite master piece of a movie.

This movie is definitely on my best of the decade list.  It borrows heavily from a couple movies and makes a fresh, dramatic approach to story telling. Excellent directing, writing, and acting.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are awesome in this film.  This is film-making at its best.  I own the VHS and DVD versions of this film, and I highly recommend this film to everyone.

Comment Head: In my top 3 of the best movies of all time.
Comment Body: This is one of the best movies of all time; an absolute masterpiece!  It brings me to tears every time I see it and I never tire of it.  It is a shame that this movie came out in 1994 because Pulp Fiction and Forrest Gump stole it's thunder.  Had it been released in '95, '96, '98, or '99.  It surely would have been a front runner the best picture oscar.  I exclude '97 because nothing could have beat the almighty Titanic.  Everyone should see this movie because it is the best example of good people triumphing over evil and that hope still exists.  The ending will put you in a good mood, I guarantee it!

I love just drifting through the IMDb just to read others opinions on certain movies, and having checked out the comments on Shawshank Redemption, I'm amazed that some of the latest reviews are from people who have who have only just watched it in the last few weeks. I'm even more pleased that they acknowledge it as one of the best films made, and that it lived up to the hype that has passed via word of mouth. It is a criminal offence that it did not win a single Oscar but at least it not one of those films that will be classed as an undiscovered gem. Career best performances are brought out of all members of the cast: Clancy Brown, Bill Gunton and Bill Sadler will surely never hit those heights again. It may not have been a box office hit but all associated with the movie should feel proud. The cliche is true of The Shawshank Redemption: they don't make them like that any more. Spread the word!

Ya know, I never heard of the Shawshank Redemption before I came to the IMDB. I looked at the top 250 and saw it ahead of 1994's Forrest Gump and in the number 2 spot all time and thought, "man, what is this?" I found out a couple weekends ago and I'm not in the least bit disapointed. It was great, I loved it. I can say nothing that hasn't been said already. Great film, I wish I had seen it earlier. Awesome! Haven't seen it? SEE IT!

Comment Head: nothing out of place. it all fits together perfectly
Comment Body: this movie is one of only 3 that I have on dvd right now, and I am so glad that I own it.  anyone who is a movie fan of any kind should see this. this is an amazing movie shows what someone can do when they hope.  andy duphresne was a character who had hope and kept it alive for 20 years even though he was in prison for life with a crime he didn't commit.  every aspect of this movie: the camera work, the acting, the dialogue, and the story work together in a perfect blend of drama.  the best part was when red came in for his 3rd parole hearing.  his first 2 times, he had just told them what he thought they wanted to hear.  "yes, I believe that i'm entirely cured.  i believe that i am no longer a danger to society."  he was rejected those 2 times.  but the third he was honest, and the outcome was far different.  A nearly perfect movie.

Getting to see The Shawshank Redemption was for me a lengthy process, but when I finally caught it it was more than worth the wait. In the history of movies there have been many impressive debuts from promising directors. With The Shawshank Redemption, Frank Darabont has vaulted himself into the ranks of Orson Welles and John Huston. There has not been a more memorable movie experience in the last decade, and it gratifies me to see that users of this site regard this film as highly as it ought to be.

After hearing all of the comments on this one, such as, "Greatest Ever Made," "I loved it," "why didn't it win movie of the year?" I had very high expectations upon seeing it.I was not in the least disappointed. This movie IS all it's made up to be. Yes, without a doubt, you SHOULD see this movie.The story is a thought-provoking one of hope, and how to find meaning in order in the apparent chaos of life. Andy escapes from the prison in an attempt to find himself, after his good friend Brooks, who has been released after decades of living in the prison, runs into bad fortune. Andy's other friend who is also released manages to find himself like Andy did through his help. This is a story of the torture humans inflict on one another and how it is escaped through hope.10/10

Wonderful, wonderful movie, one of the greatest stories ever told. Terrific acting, and some of the best dialogue that I have ever heard before in a movie.  Brillant screenplay and excellent directing.  Why didn't this movie win Best Picture?

I had heard so many good things about this movie, that I just had to see it. I was not disappointed.  This is probably one of the best movies I have ever seen. Period.  Tim Robbins was outstanding, simply outstanding. Morgan Freeman was wonderful and I did not know that Gil Bellows had so much in him.  This movie was absolutely breathtaking.  The scenery, the realism, the characters, everything was simply outstanding.  I sat through the entire movie, spellbound by the whole thing, and then I rewound it and watched again.  I've seen 6 times since, and I always find new and wonderful things everytime I see it.  I loved it.  It was amazing.  This movie is not just about prison, but it's about friendship.  A 20-year-long friendship between two inmates.  I recommend this movie for anyone who needs to find out what real friendship is all about.  This is truly one of the best movies ever.

Comment Head: Hope is a good thing, Brooks was wrong...
Comment Body: This is my favorite movie of all time. It is about one man's struggle of trying to cope with his life in prison sentence for a crime he didnt commit. This movie make prisoners look like true human beings, not just savages. You really learn about each of the characters. Morgan Freeman gives a great role as Red, who stands by Andy in every instance.

The greatest movie ever made.  The script is amazing.  Tim Robbins is amazing.  Morgan Freeman is amazing.  The rest of the cast is amazing, particularly the guy who played the villain in Highlander.  The film is just amazing and it is tragic that it was overlooked by the academy.

too bad it came out in '94 with gump and fiction.  deserved to win some awards.  compelling flick based on a s. king short story that proves he is not a hack.  (Check out Different Seasons which also has The Body (Stand By Me) and Apt Pupil.    The movie follows the short story well with a few embellishments. Good casting, though i think tim robbins might have been an alternate choice.  star quality deliveries by morgan freeman and bob gunton. in an era when we see much garbage find its way to the screen, swhawshank represents what movies should strive to achieve.

This film sortta runs along and while your watching you dont know why your watching but you cant stop and then when it finishes you think WOW and have the funny feelin in the pit of your stomach and all up your spine, the feelin you get when you know you have watched a cinema masterpiece, i only wish i had been able to see this in the movies rather than on vhs, but it will soon become an addition to my dvd collection.The acting is superb and the storyline just gives you hope

Comment Head: A superb production makes Shawshank a must-see!
This movie is better than the novel
Comment Body: That's my feeling when I finished reading the novel recently. Frank Darabont obviously made a lot of major modifications. The ending scene is one of them. Forrest Gump is good. Pulp Fiction is good too. But this movie is even better. And I'm glad that I saw it in the theater, not on the videotape.

The Shawshank Redemption never made it to the big screen in Sweden, at least not what I heard of. And I really can't understand why. It is excellent. It's a calm and unsettling story of a man's (Robbins) life in jail, of the friendship between him and his fellow lifer, Red (Freeman) and the disgusting life in a corrupt prison in the 50's and 60's. Excellent performances, great camera angles and one of the very best endings of any film.Stephen King wrote the story. Why should I be surprised? His novels and short stories make for great films - but most are turned into crap, like It. This one, however, is one of the best movies there is.

This is much more than a prison film.  This is a film about how the human spirit can conquer the most unspeakable abyss and come out clean at the other side.  In addition, the story at the heart of it, of Andy (Tim Robbins) and Red (Morgan Freedman)is simply a story of two men's friendship -- something seldom explored in cinema, and rarely as well.  Lastly, the theme of hope echoes and throughout the film and reverberates in the viewer's minds like an aria against hard prison walls.

Comment Head: One of King's, and possibly one of the, best.
Comment Body: I read Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption as part of Stephen King's Different Seasons, and loved the story.. to see just how much one person can go through, and not only remain sane, but keep his morals about him, even in the purgatory of a corrupt prison. The book was incredible. But the movie took it one step further, with incredibly well chosen actors and a beautiful sense of the book that is hard to set to a movie, as well as lines that I still remember at the drop of a hat. Incredible, and one of my favorite movies of all time.

Hey, I have to say that this movie is one of my favorites.  It is up on my top 10.  Anyway, this movie is amazing.  The story, the acting, and anything else you can think of make this movie a classic.  Morgan Freeman (plays the character red) did an excellent job on his role.  I think he was totally robbed when he didn't get the Oscar for best supporting actor.  To get back on the movie, if you looking for a good one to watch, you have to see this. The movie is wonderfully played.  Also hats off to the great job Tim Robbins did playing his main character Andy Dufresne. If you haven't seen this one, your missing out!!

Comment Head: Not just a prison movie but a movie that gives hope
Comment Body: After seeing this movie for the first time I was stunned.  Living in Maine i was very interested in the whole story.  The prison featured in the movie is very similar to our own Thomaston State prison.  This is not just a good movie, but a great story as well.  It keeps you wanting to see Andy set free throughout the whole thing.

I first saw this movie on TBS one night, and wasn't all that interested in it at first. But as the movie progressed, I found myself totally glued to the TV. This movie is quite possibly the best movie I've ever seen. Every single thing in this movie is perfect, the acting, chemistry, plot. Its all so wonderfully done. The ending of this movie was really great.  Its really hard to describe how good this movie is. Just go get it, you'll never regret seeing it.

I'm not going to elaborate on what has already been written by others - except to say that the popularity for this film is enormous.  I don't think I know ANYONE who didn't like it - it will be recognised as one of THE films of the 90's.

This movie was deeply moving.  I have seen it about six times so far and cried the first four times I saw it.  As a person who has at times felt as if I was sentenced to "the hole", I could relate to Andy and to Red. Perhaps that is one reason the movie has touched so many people.The message and heart in this film is profound.  When Red said, "I hope....." at the end of the movie, I was hoping too.

OK, so I am a huge fan of Stephen King as well as of the cinema itself, and it took me almost 5 years to finally see The Shawshank Redemption.  I think I was one of the few people on the planet who did not see this fantastic motion picture.  Everything about this film exudes greatness, from the performances of Freeman and Robbins to the masterful screenplay, cinematography, cast and especially the direction.  I agree with most people who fume over the fact that films such as this one (perfect in every sense) rarely, if ever garner an Oscar win.  Its a shame that the big budget over - hyped (and often mediocre at best films) win all the awards while a gem like The Shawshank Redemption comes up empty.  You never grow tired of watching this film and its introspective ending is just perfect.  If you are one of the 4 remaining people who has yet to see this masterpiece, find 2 hours of quiet time and watch it.  You will thank yourself afterwards.

Comment Head: It was much better than Cats...
Comment Body: What amazes me about the Shawshank Redemption is that I can watch it over and over again without losing interest.  Normally for me, even with movies I enjoy, once is enough.  However, when I'm channel surfing and I flip across Shawshank, I almost always leave it on and watch it to the end.

Comment Head: It's just BETTER than other movies...
heartfelt comments of the best film that i have seen of its ilk
Comment Body: my comments of this film will be brief. it is a quite simply a rewarding film in which the acting is very moving and the actual storyline is superb iwas engrossed in the film from start to finish. it was a drama of what life can throw back at you in the extreme.not been a writing man i will close with the words i think describe this truly great film.      moving,thought provoking,and one of the best films of its kind.

Comment Head: This film is like an excellent, five-course meal.
I dedicated a lot of time to this comment, but I still hate summaries.

Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is one of my all time favorites. Robbins and Freeman in particular, but everyone else as well delivers an outstanding performance in this one. Few films, if any, captures your mind like Shawshank does. I just hope my DVD copy don't wear out...

I must say that this is the best prison films of all time. I couldn't believe that this film didn't win any Academy Awards. This film could have win at least one or two. Also, I thought that Tim Robbins could have earned an Oscar nomination. He gave a superb performance. But the one who was powerful in this film is Morgan Freeman. He gave one of the best performances that I have ever seen in film. It was heartwrenching. I like that tagline: Fear can make you prisoner, Hope can set you free. Frank Darabont did superb filmmaking in this film. By the way, I found out that Allen Greene, the person that Frank dedicated at the end, was the director's agent and his close personal friend. If you want to see a film that takes place in a prison or dramatic films, then see this film. You will never regret it. It is the best prison film since Midnight Express. SEE IT!

Highly reccommended.  Best if you watch by yourself.  I cried at the end, and I never cry.Love the friendship between Andy and Red, great performances by both.  The plot moves along perfectly, I felt what the characters felt.  Rivals "Seven" for one of the best endings I have ever seen.

Comment Head: The fact that this movie didn't receive any major Academy Awards (nominated for several!) is UNFORGIVABLE!
Comment Body: If an alien who knows nothing about the Academy Awards were to suddenly land on earth and then introduced to the Academy Awards and asked to watch the nominated movies for 1995 and then shown the results, she would have absolutely no respect for the Academy Awards.  Shawshank Redemption is pure genius at every level: acting, script, cinematography, character development, and on and on and on.  Movies don't get much better than this!The moral of the story is that there are great movies and performances out there that have not been properly recognized by the Academy, so make sure an award is not the only criterion you use when searching for a truly great film.

This is one of the best movies around. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins are great in this movie. I'm fifteen, and the only part of this movie I didn't appreciate is the part about the homosexual rapist gang. That part I can do without, but the rest of the movie is flawless. Rent it, buy it, steal it, borrow it, do whatever it takes to see this movie.

Comment Head: The Best Movie of All Time!
Comment Body: This film is by far my favorite movie to date. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman have great chemistry. Once you watch this movie a second time you see how all the small details that you may have seen as insignificant fall into place. My personal favorite is how the rock hammer was in the starting pages of the book of Exodus from the bible.

I've seen this movie only once, and I think that's the main reason why I like this movie very much.  I have not been able to forget it.  I has remained in my mind ever since I saw it.  When I saw this movie, it made a tremendous impact on me.  This is a beautiful movie about triumph and the power of friendship.  Among other things, this movie contains terrific performances.  Perhaps the best performance is that of the great Morgan Freeman, as a prison inmate.  And of course, Tim Robbins also shines, playing the lead character.  There are so many memorable scenes in this movie.  One particular scene that stands out is the moment when Robbins' character breaks free, and you see him standing in the rain, shirtless and with his arms stretched out.  But what is the most memorable scene is the ending--a fitting ending to this touching and haunting story.  If you haven't seen this movie, definitely do so. This movie is so powerful that you only need to see once for it to move you.  This movie is definitely one of the best movies ever.

This movie is a work of art , it is a movie that makes you think about how great it is to be alive and free , and how other peoples may have a struggle each day to stay alive and free ,  in the mind of themselves ,for a start .

This is one of my fave movies because its so beautiful. The acting , the story and the filmmaking. This is how all movies should be made...with heart. The story is so simple but its shaped and made a master piece.If you have not seen this movie, and you are 15 or 55 years old,I'm telling you that you are missing a lot.I give it ********** out of ********** because it moved me so much, the way its showing the human nature, the good and the ugly side of it.

Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are in a dynamic role in this film. I could not imagine a lot of innocent people inside a gigantic prison of history. When I saw Clancy Brown first time, looked so tough, he's big too. I also like Clancy's role, too. He should be a great fighter. What is good for Andy Dufrense (Robbins) is that he makes an unbelievable escape route to run away from prison, finally.

Comment Head: A wonderful film and a terrific story !
Comment Body: The story is excellent and the actors all perform well. Never a boring scene. Good drama. Some scenes are even funny ! The plot is superb. I thought Stephen King only wrote horror-stories, but I guess I was wrong !If you see this movie on video, sit down and watch it all and LISTEN !  You have to pay attention! And then you'll love it !

Comment Head: Great cast, great crew, great show
Probably the best movie ever made
Comment Body: Incredible.  That's all there is to say about it.  Tim Robbin's turns in a fantastic performance as does Morgan Freeman and all of the supporting cast. The story is captivating and the characters are well drawn.  All screen writers (aspiring as well as established) need to review this movie periodically to remember why they love movies.
