Comment Body: That's normally pretty hard to say, though the fact that the book is a Stephen King novella (150ish pages +/-) makes sense why the movie is better. Not bashing King here, just saying most of the movies based on his work tend to be pretty decent and novellas aren't meaty enough for my taste. Most the time when I finish a novella I wish there had been more substance.As far as the movie goes, I'm sure everyone else has mentioned why it's so great. If you love this movie check out the book, they're pretty much dead on besides a few details. Unlike other novellas of King's e.g. Apt Pupil ... the extra details in that book made it so much better than the movie.

Comment Head: Needed to be free of shame!

Comment Body: The story is about a banker (andy) innocently serving a life sentence of prison for the murder of his wife and all the incidents that come about in there. I really admired the character of andy who still has the hope of living in a free environment.His a very smart fella with lots of plans in mind about the future yet inside prison. Undoubtedly it is the best movie i have ever seen. The scenes are very delicately chosen. SO many intuitive points in this movie that i recommend multiple watch of it. I really liked the acting which was so natural.It was like a real story.I'm still amazed that why hasn't this movie received any Oscars. I thank the director for such a great movie.

I was turned on to this movie by my late uncle Ed. He is forever captured in my memories every time I see this wonderful movie or hear the soundtrack. The Harmonica and orchestra is so intense, it just lives with me forever. Our favorite track was Zihuataneho, it is where we will meet in heaven. Thomas Newmann has created so many beautiful soundtracks, but this is my all time favorite. The greatest ending of any movie, it just lets us know that in the end, justice will be served... When I think of this movie my favorite line is get busy living or get busy dying. Tim Robbins and the warden, am I being obtuse.

Comment Head: One of the most moving Films ever made
Magnificent is the way to describe it.
Comment Body: Yes this is simply a magnificent piece of work which remains powerful and moving and probably always will.It's been 14 years but who can forget such a masterpiece.This is a movie about how strong the human faith and spirit can be.Even in the most difficult moments we have to remain strong and believe in justice.This is what Shawshank is all about.I have never read the Steven King novel but he definitely should be proud that a director such as Frank Darabont has the passion and desire in making a powerful and faithful adaptation to King's work.A moving film with superb performances from all the actors but the real credit goes to Tim Robbins as the wrongfully accused Andy Dufresne whose spirit and will help him find freedom and Morgan Freeman as Ellis 'Red' Redding who serves a life-long sentence but hopes he can be freed from guilt.Throughout the movie we witness much suffering,injustice and sorrow but that's what makes the characters so pleasant and worth sympathizing for.Andy's desire to become a free man again is truly a magical but also difficult adventure.But he never loses his hope and that is what helps him succeed.The final scene when Andy and Ellis meet each other outside the steel cage prison is phenomenal and touching.It is a real shame that a movie so great didn't win a single Oscar although it had 7 nominations.–ê real unfairness cause this movie is indeed better than Forrest Gump.In conclusion I'll just say that Shawshank is a timeless masterpiece and deserves to be in the top 10 greatest films of all time.

Comment Head: Stunning. The best movie i have ever seen
Comment Body: The shawshank redemption is the greatest film of all time, in my opinion. Having read great reviews for the film, i was determined to watch it myself. And that was probably the greatest film decision ever made by me. I will never forget the engrossing intensity of this masterpiece, it will stay with me and many others for years to come.It centres around a wrongly convicted prisoner Andy Dufresne and another nicknamed Red by his friends. After Red sees the wrongful imprisonment he becomes Andy's best friend and they create an unbreakable bond that is the core of the film. Years go by in Shawshank prison and the pair live with the tortures of shawshank. The neglect, the murder and the horror.But Andy changes this. He does extraordinary things for the inmates. HE befriends the guards, builds a big library and helps people with their problems. He saves them from institutionalisation.In the end an incredible series of events allows Andy to turn these factors on the prison and to get the responsible people imprisoned themselves. Andy escapes and leaves for a new life abroad. Red is released soon after and follows him. The ending sees them reunited.This is a definitive tale of how the human spirit can be denied nothing.

Comment Head: This is simply one of the best movies ever with superb acting
Comment Body: I simply do not know how some people out there voted this movie anything less than a 6 or 7, but a small percentage had the audacity to vote it a "ONE"! There are always that small percentage. Sometimes I believe people vote down other movies in some attempt to get THEIR favorite movie into a certain spot. The fact that people put that much effort into doing so amazes me. I'll take the time to comment on a movie and give my 2 cents worth of opinion. This movie was a classic the day it premiered and the 2nd place showing overall demonstrates that without fault. My hope is those who voted it down somehow obtain a clue.

Comment Head: Well deserved place in the top 250 movies of all time
Comment Body: This movie is well deserving of #2 of all time, if not it should be #1. This movie has #1 most votes cast for any movie, and as anyone should know, the more people that vote, the more accurate the rating should be. As of now May 24th 2007, there is 255,456 people who have rated this movie. 150,715 rate it 10/10.This movie is not over-rated and remains my favorite movie of all time. Why? I can pop this movie in at ANY time and thoroughly enjoy it. There is no other movie that does this for me. And thus will most likely remain my favorite movie of all time. If you have not seen this movie yet, what are you waiting for. BUY IT NOW. You will certainly love it.

This film was so deep. Suicide, murder, innocence, friendship and of course hope.I watched only a bit of this film at one point and thought its alright. But i looked at its rating being no.2 and thought "really". I was then desperate to see what makes this film the top of the nineties. Watched it with my family and it simply blew me away. The way it was sad was happy just realising that Andy difference (who was arrested for murdering his wife and her lover when drunk) was all this time innocent after spending 19 years in shawshank prison. its the police that show who are the good guys but in this its the other way round and the way it was done was exciting and intelegant.The scripts was fantastic, the acting was sensational and most of all the story was one the best ever explained in a film (infact the best ever).we all have our opinions but if you think this film is rubbish for no specific reason then there is something wrong with you.

Comment Head: Whenever you need to feel some hope
Possibly the greatest film ever made
A masterpiece which words cannot define...
a decent movie but not my Number 2
Comment Body: I saw this movie mainly because it was rated so highly in IMDb. It was a decent movie but it should not be number 2. It has Morgan Freeman and his wonderful voice so that's certainly a plus. The messages of the bad guys getting it in the end is nice as well as keeping one's hope alive in adverse circumstances. I didn't really think the gestapo like guard, who is able to kill anyone on a whim, was very believable. Even convicted felons have loved ones who would want answers. Besides, guards know that one day the tables may be turned on them and this usually tempers their cruelty. Vicious guards are usually "dealt with" by the inmates, so I don't believe a guard like this could last long, and certainly not over 20 years. And how is it that the warden and chief guard are in the same job at the same prison for over 20 years? I don't really buy the massive kickbacks the warden was getting continuously either. Prison labor in the USA usually involve trash picking, farming & soap making for institutional use and license plate stamping. These are not highly profitable industries. Neither was I too thrilled by the subtle cynicism aimed at the Bible and those who read it. Lots of convicts "get religion" and it is generally a good thing. Also, the quick series of mini-scenes leading me by the hand through the resolution (baptism by sewage, screaming headlines, screaming sirens, arrests and suicide) seemed fairytale like. At least you can say that the movie raises awareness of the fact that there are wrongly convicted people in prison and that savage inmates beat and rape each other. I did like the demeanor of the main character, Andy, our victim cum hero. A mix of being quiet, brooding, deliberate, cautious, willful, sly and subdued. This is a nobler hero than what you see in many Hollywood movies. And Morgan's performance as Red reminds us that, felon or not, inmates are still quite capable of humanity. So in general, I didn't mind watching this movie. It entertained me. I just wouldn't include it in my list of best movies. I would not want to watch it again.

Comment Head: Didn't really do it for me, I'm afraid
Comment Body: I remember when I first watched this film being surprised at how highly regarded it was by my work colleagues (and by many other people too), so I must have missed the point. Can someone really dig his way out of prison in the manner that "our hero" did? I thought there was generally a policy that people were moved around from cell to cell over time; and what about the suspect premise that he was able to keep his escape tunnel hidden with posters - which no-one ever checked behind! How did he keep them in place whilst he was in the tunnel? How did he dispose of the material he dug out? Surely it's all too far-fetched. Am I being too pedantic; should I really just be acknowledging the film's uplifting storyline? Some people I spoke with told me that it was based on a true story - it's not .On balance, I far preferred Mr King's "The Green Mile".

This is by no means a bad movie, but it's certainly not as great as many people claim. I have watched it a couple of times already now and I just don't see what's so brilliant about it. The story is good, but not excellent. The acting of the biggest part of the cast is good, but I really can't identify myself with Andy, the main character. He is sentenced to life imprisonment, while being innocent. Though, he just doesn't do it for me. You would expect me to feel sympathy for him, because of his situation. To a certain degree I do of course, as I do with anyone who is done injustice. But that is not enough, that's why I think this movie is overrated.

Comment Head: this is the greatest movie of all time
Comment Body: This is the best movie of all time. It has a great cast in Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. This is the greatest movie based of a book I have ever seen. Every character filled every role to the best they could and they all did great. When you first watch this movie you think the story is about Tim Robbins character but when you watch it a second time you actually see that its a story about Morgan Freeman. I love this movie and always will. Watch this movie its the best there ever was. Also Tim Robbins should have won an Oscar for his performance in this movie. I give this movie ****/****. This truly is the best movie of all time, it is definitely better than The godfather.

One of the most satisfying movies ever. Anyone who has seen this film is being gradually overwhelmed by the injustice towards a single man; and while the scenario unfolds a grim, but also an unpredictable future, the hero reveals at the end his so far unrealistic stance in everything inside the prison. Redemption is not a utopia on this film. A scarce thing to see in the majority of today's movies. It perfectly reflects an every day person's point of view in assessing things and his life by "get busy living or get busy dying". And although it contains some dramatic characters, it gives the final sensation to the audience that hope can really change things, no matter the costs involved. A sensation that is amiss from today's movies, which try to present a realistic ending or character. Movies were not made to be totally realistic and this movie proves it magically.

First of all i enjoyed this film immensely. It was well shot, highly emotive and contained two great lead performances, but the fact remains that this movie is perhaps too overrated in the grand scheme of cinema.It must not be forgotten that this film is an adaptation of a short story and as such the narrative requires a little more depth. One should also take into account the film's cult status as a sleeper hit (which never the less underlines its definite quality) as reason to be cynical over its actual significance in American popular cinema.However, the film is undoubtedly one of the finest examples of the prison genre, certainly ranking alongside the likes of Cool Hand Luke. The relationship of the main protagonists is perhaps one of the reasons for this as is the movies themes and contextual references. As a result this is a fine picture which inspires its audience to question justice and honour in a non too clich√©d way.

I can't believe I waited 11 years to see this film. I often saw commercials advertising the film on TNT, but never had enough interest to sit and watch until I bought the movie for my fianc√©e. I'm so glad I finally got to see this film. This is easily one of the greatest films of all time. I couldn't believe the outstanding job done by all of the actors. I've seen very few scripts on the level of this one, but have never seen so many strong performances from the entire cast.Morgan Freeman is incredible as Red and narrates the action better than any other voice-over I've ever heard. I was very surprised with Tim Robbins. For some reason I still thought of him as Nuke Laloosh and never dreamed he had this kind of acting ability. The story is incredible and the dialogue keeps the entire film rolling. Two and a half hours go by like nothing. I also have to applaud William Sadler, who showed great versatility (watch Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey or Die Hard 2 to see what I mean). The film is intriguing as well as inspiring at the same time. I found myself inwardly cheering for Andy to escape from Shawshank and was even happy when he is shown emerging from the sewer tunnel. His reunion with Red is almost tearjerking. The movie managed to have a happy ending without it seeming to be another unrealistic Hollywood Ending.This film is definitely a must-see. I have seen Braveheart, and though I thought it was fantastic it doesn't come anywhere near the power of Shawshank Redemption. I doubt another cast ensemble of incredible acting talent will ever match this one. Easily a 10 on the IMDb.com scale.

Comment Head: This is surely one of the most incredible movies in history...
Comment Body: This movie can not come recommended highly enough, the fact that it is constantly near to, or at the top of the Internet Movie Database's top 250 poll, is surely testament to this.This is definitely one of my favourite movies of all time. If you are reading these comments, and have not seen this life changing movie (for both the film's characters AND the viewer), i truly envy you.It is one of the few movies that I would wish that I have never seen, purely so I could have the pleasure of seeing it again for the first time and re-living how i felt after the credits rolled. It really is that good.

This is the greatest film ever made ..... bar none! It has everything you could ever want in a film and more! The story is quite different to the short story by Stephen King but thats not necessarily a bad thing as the Green Mile followed the book closely and wasn't nearly as good as this! It says if you can to think of a film to compare it to but its in a genre all of its own. Other good prison films I could suggest are "Against the Wall" and "Killer: A Journal of Murder". Both of these are good but lack the depth of characters portrayed in Shawshank. For a good prison televisual drama then "Oz" has to be the best thing to come out of America after the Simpsons, it has the characters and plots to match Shawshank but generally without the feel good factor thrown in.

Comment Head: A Great film, Outstanding Acting and Story! Instant Classic!
Comment Body: This film gave me a great feeling at the end. My mother thought it wouldn't be my typical everyday action movie, I saw the recommendations and had a look at it. I was amazed, and so was my mum. At the end I saw her on the edge of her seat yelling at Morgan Freeman to do what Tim Robbins had said.I recommend this movie very much. It is a sad, funny at times and it is most importantly, Heart warming. For those of you that haven't seen it I tell you now, this is the best movie of the Nineties.Just another thing, I saw Forrest Gump and that was not as good as this. The Shawshank Redemption should have won the Oscars!

Comment Head: This is my view of The Shawshank Redemption
Something about this film caught me
Comment Body: This movie became my favorite movie of all time, before i had even seen the whole thing. Has this happened to anyone else? I had seen parts on TV and that was it. The day i finally rented it, i was practically jittery with excitement. This just tells you about my unique subjective experience with it. After it was over, I wasn't dissatisfied in the least. It is truly a great film all around. It is one of those things where part of me wants everyone in the world to see it, but another part of me feels like my personal experience with it makes it my own. I don't want to write an extensive review and put it under some kind of lens and analyze it. I'll just say that from that day forward, The Shawshank Redemption had profoundly affected the way I view movies and it his been the gateway into my current passion for films.

This film is one of the top 5 in my own ranking. It's just amazing, and if you get the chance to see this movie, don't miss it. In particular, it would be the best choice if you don't want to see the typical super production from Hollywood. The plot makes you think about life, its pleasures and its pains.I took one clear message from this masterpiece film: everything is possible with patience and constancy. Trust me -- you'll enjoy the greatest cinema ever. Enjoy!!

Comment Head: A pirate DVD of the 10th anniversary edition from China

Comment Body: Spoiler Alert Shawshank Redemption hit the movie world in 1994.It touched the hearts of the filmgoers like no other movie.It is no longer just a movie but has become a vivid legend .I love this movie very much, it is the story of a lifetime.It tells a story that Andy Coufresne, a banker ,who has been convicted falsely of murdering his wife and her lover.But he never lost his faith to be innocent again.Through two turbulent decades of his life in jail,viewing the darkness of jail and the coldness of the world.He learnt to deal with loneliness ,desperation ,unfairness.Exactlly,Andy is the embodiment of an era, an innocent at large in a world that is losing its innocent.But his irony strength and kindness known what he could.Armed with his high IQ ,irnoy will and kind nature to versus the world's cruelty.I admire his strong character and faith,Andy is a person of great determination,who is burdering the greatest insult and facing the fallen from a freeman to a personier.No one can see the beauty of the world and touch the gender of the sunshine but Andy.The movie give the inspiration to us all and a sense of the redemption in our soul.In this movie ,friendship is also brilliant,Red ,a black, Andy , a white, they communicated from the bottom of the heart to corss the racial discrimination.At the end of the movie,we can see that they embrace warmthly by the seashore .A prefect ending in the background with blue sea and white sky.Everything is in harmony ,as beautiful as a rainbow after storm."Hope is a good thing,maybe the best of the things,no good thing ever dies." Andy said to us. This is a kind of spirit we need in our way to be self-esteem.All in all,Shawshank Redemption is the movie we need in our lifetime.

Comment Head: I like this movie,and Andy,his spirit is my aim for my life!
THE BEST I HAVE EVER SEEN

Comment Body: Like picasso,chaplin and the beatles the sycophantic veneration of this "icon" is a complete mystery.Its a decent film - but it certainly isn't a great one,its no better than escape from alcatraz,brubaker,i escaped from a chain gang, but that doesn't matter to the cinematic lemmings vainly looking for prestige and kudos about a run of the mill film glorified by movie luvvies.Even trailer park trash have got in on the act" my favorik filum iz da shawshank regemshun". -thats when i knew the farcical proportions of overrated glorification this film had reached.Its supposed to be about "liberation,emancipation....blah blah you know the usual poncey guff thats trotted out for meaningless symbolism and metaphor.Luvvies love a movie voice over commentary,aka scorcese - why ,who knows?.But the film does have a potent manipulative power - which was also used by another weakish film -the shining, and that is the pathos laden empowering music score- this is what so brilliantly fools gullible viewers sadly.In the final analysis how can a film be great when it contains a ridiculous scene of a prisoner(robbins) immobilising a whole prison full of violent incarcerated males by playing opera- and yet he doesn't even receive a rightly deserved mother of all beatings

Comment Head: The movie named the shawshank redemption told us a story about a banker called Andy Dufresne who is convicted and jailed for the murder of his wife. His life is changed.
This movie tells us a tale that takes place during the 1940's in a horror prison called Shawshank.
The second most perfect non-action film...

Comment Body: I know that other people's votes shouldn't influence mine, either way--but geez, No.2 of all time? What are the IMDb demographics that create that overblown result?I thought this was a very entertaining movie, somewhere around 8 points. But the script is kind of sugary and the characters lack the subtlety you would expect in a truly great drama. The ending reminded me of The Great Escape.There are several good performances that aren't quite able to shake loose the limitations of the script and become stirring.Cute, but not the greatest prison drama ever. I think there must be a lot of teenagers voting on IMDb.

Comment Head: This is supposed to be good???!!!???

Comment Body: yes this movie is one of the greatestThis movie changed my thinking about people who go to prison. I believe that everyone deserves a second chance no matter what it is. They need to be given a chance to change themselves. Morgan Freeman did justice to his role i was really touched at the end part when he's there for the parole and the words that came out of his mouth. Tim Robbins was tremendous, its the first time i noticed him as an actor and he's one of the best.prison is terrible place to be its like a whole new world and my perspective has changed about that. I rate this movie 10/10 its the best, the story is great and the director does a great job. well done

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever
Comment Body: If you haven`t seen this film, watch it as soon as you can. Maybe you`ve had the chance to do it, but just skipped it because you thought it was one more story in prison. Yes and no! YES because most part of "Shawshank Redemption" happens in a prison, but NO, it's not like the others. It's much better.The story, you may know more of it in the Plot Outline, is really interesting and the performances are just impossible to forget. There is a little of everything: drama, friendship, violence, love and dream..."Dream of Freedom". That's the title in Portuguese.My Rate 9/10

Comment Head: There are some truths everyone agree like this film for everyone a MASTERPIECE
Comment Body: Some truths not much but a few are accepted by nearly every people. You may not love Lord of the Rings, Star Wars,Braveheart, Love stories, Grease or any big movie but YOU LOVE THIS. LOOK in IMDb it is in the second place but look how many people voted, more than 120000 voted so this is the secret first movie. It stimulates your neurons, something changes inside you. White, black, yellow, American, European, African all people meet in some ways. THE BIGGEST EXAMPLE IS SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION, everyone likes it -few exceptions. I sometimes think that we are all humans that are created in a way that we love this movie (or Darabont-director is not human so he made the movie for us to love it)Go talk to others ask about films then ASK ABOUT SHAWSHANK and see the change on their features then catch the smile of people when you talk about SHAWSHANK.Some truths not much but a few are accepted by nearly every people (beginning as finish) (finish as beginning)

This Is My Absolute Favorite Movie Of All Time. When This Movie First Came Out In Theaters, I was still in Middle School And Thought That It Looked Pretty Stupid, Boy was I WRONG! Some Of the Best Performances I've Ever Seen Given In A Movie, Heart Wrenching Emotion, And Most Of All Hope. No Matter What Never Give Up Hope. This Movie Changed My Life. Before I Saw This Movie I Was A Troublemaker Who Did Poorly In School. After I saw This Movie I Tried Harder To Be A Better Person, A Person Who Always Did My Best. I Believe This Movie Has Helped Me Get To Where I Am, A Happy, Hard Working, Hopeful Person, & That Is Perhaps The Best Of Things. I Would Appreciate Any Feed Back From People Who Appreciate This Film As Much As I Do.

Comment Head: You've got to be kidding me (but I know you're not)...
Comment Body: I am dumbfounded by the exorbitant praise for this movie. It is almost frightening--like a cult.  I watched it last night and was completely underwhelmed.  This did not have have half the emotional charge of a dozen other prison flicks, not to mention other dramatic categories.  Yes, the story was OK, good (not great) acting, but I found it to be largely insipid and predictable.  It just did not grab me like other stories of redemption such as A Christmas Carol or It's a Wonderful Life.  As you can see by my citing these two films, I am not offended by cheesy sentimentality, if well done.  Shawshank simply had nothing new to say or a new way to say it.  The only reason I am writing this review is to demonstrate that there are indeed some people who are not swept away by this movie.  Otherwise, I would not have bothered.  The film simply was not interesting enough.

I can understand why this film is loved so much, but I can equally understand, although I do not agree, why it is despised. People say it is life affirming, brings hope and happiness, and it does, others say it is sentimental crap, and at times it is. But I've always been a sucker for sentimental movies, ones which have the power to genuinely move the viewer, and not hide under a cheap plot and a tragic death. Being another King adaptation, there is violence, and hardness to counteract the sentimentality, and the prison, although not as horrifying as those seen in Midnight Express and other movies, breaks the human soul to the point that it relies on the prison for survival. Heartbreaking, tear jerking, brutally funny, all phrases used repeatedly to describe this film, all appropriate. A film everyone should love. Great Quotes: Andy. 'I have to remind myself that some birds aren't meant to be caged' 9 out of 10

Well... this is the cat out of the bag. Pandora's box opening. Why did I ever find a critique site. I'm one of the most opinionated stubborn sh...uhh so and so's.... in the world.So I guess first and foremost did I like it. No!..........Just kidding. How can you fail to? Its my favourite movie of all time. It has just occurred to me that this may be my first ever sober critique of the film. It's one of those movies confined to the small, smokey, pokey corners of a pub when the issue of greatest film of all time comes up. There's always a 'goodfellas' and a 'Godfather trilogy' and an 'Empire Strikes back' 'Labyrinyth' (?) Voice in the crowd ,(I mix in strange circles) But its fairly unanimous, everyone likes this film. So why?Where do I start. Morgan Freeman...Goes without saying. Tim Robbins...Not sure anyone else could play Dufresne now. Bob Gunton....Born to play evil. William sadler...Under-rated.But it's not really the actors or the Director/photography etc. It's the script. Beautifully constructed. It flows like liquid perfection. Morgan Freeman's VO helps no end. (Brad Pitt described it in 'Se7en' commentry as the voice of god).I had the fortune to watch this before the hype. I got it out on video the day it came out cause I was a fan of Morgan Freeman. I sat there in silence for fifteen minutes after the final credit had scrolled past my screen. It's that good. Breathtaking. (spoiler) When Red wanders across that beach and we see Dufresne there, and the camera slowly pans upwards and away, you know you've been part of something special. I'm not a fan of sickly sweet 'hollywoodised' endings but every now and then they get it right.I should stop now cause I could go on for ever. (The 'record' scene, Brook's parole, the 'beers on the roof', the 'poster', the 'salvation comes from within' rock hammer).I better stop there. Need to take a tablet. See thats why they shouldn't make movies this good.Yeah I quite liked it then.Don't mind and comments/critique/feedback. The e-mails there.

This film offers pretty visuals, good-acting and an interesting screenplay.But it¬¥s a movie very overrated among IMDB users, who put it at the 2th place on best movies list.The explanation is simple the old "fight for your dreams", "never give up" motive, which thrills and delight audiences.SPOILERS AHEAD For me, the movie doesn¬¥t work in this way. At the end, the protagonist is old, he had been raped, bitten, etc. The final doesn¬¥t work for me in a full happy end, the main time of his life has already gone!

I first saw SR in america when i was 12. I walked in on the tariing scene and had to stay up untill two in the morning to finish watching it. I was hooked! When i came back to england i rushed out and bought the Video in order to see the beginning part. it is such a great movie. i have seen the movie about 250 times since then and have read the short story about 100 times. it is so good! if you haven't seen it yet, make sure you do. You are missing out on one of the greatest cinematic treats in history!

This film is based on one of my favourite Stephen King novels (albeit a 'novella') The original book contained four long 'short stories' one which became 'Stand By Me' (another great movie) and 'Rita Heyworth & The Shawshank Redemption' which has been (full marks to the director& production team)lovingly rendered into a true cinematic masterpiece. Staying true to the printed word, it follows the prison life of Andy Dupree from sentence to freedom with care and sympathy, never revelling in his hardships or flouting his attempts at beating the system. The film concentrates on his will to survive and his hope for eventual freedom. Tim Robbins & Morgan Freeman were born to play their respective parts in this film. If neither had ever made another film, it would not matter because this film will always be their mark in movie history. No major action sequences, no breathtaking special effects and no outrageous subject matter. Just a great movie, based on a great story, acted convincingly with great skill by two men who could really be the best of friends the story requires them to be. Superb.

Comment Head: Beautifull,inspiering and an emotional ride of hope and freedom!
Comment Body: I love this film so much,it is my all time favourite movie,and I really dont think any film will have such a profound effect on me.It almost inspires you to do almost anything,and the tagline alone has a mystic and philisophical feel about it(Fear can hold you prisoner,Hope can set you free!).The great thing about this film is that it can represent anything that has happend in your life,good or bad.I think that is what gives an edge to this film,of which many films forget to include!It's quite funny to think that this film was a huge flop at the box office,and that it wasnt untill the film came out on VHS that it really got the world wide recognition that it so truly deserved!Beautifully made,inspiring and an emotional ride of hope and freedom!I absolutely love it,best film ever!!!!!!!!Stu.

Wonderful touching story that will make you cry AND feel extremely good inside. STEVEN KING proves that he is one of the best story writers EVER.Superb acting by Freeman et al. Wonderful narrative, music, cinematorgraphy and backward looking story that escalates throughout the film.A work of genious, J

Comment Head: The Greatest Movie of all Time !!

Comment Body: I watched this movie today, and while it was good it certainly IS NOT the #2 best Drama of all time.  I hope that more people will sign up for IMDB after seeing this and start to post your user ratings as I would give it a good rating, but certianly not a 9.

This is perhaps one of the best movies I have ever seen and no doubt the best of Stephen King. Director Frank Darabont created a masterpiece.It is a very intelligent story telling us how hard prison life can be. It critics the judgements of innocent prisoners. But the most I liked is that every time there is another interesting story that develops in this prison. At the last third of the movie we can enjoy the big surprise or the dessert. This novel is very nice told and it merits standing ovation. I and my wife rarely see such films. This is quality of film making and today where we are?   8.5/10.If you liked this don¬¥t miss another masterpiece from the same director called "THE GREEN MILE".

Comment Head: The best movie i've ever seen
Comment Body: The shawshank redemption is probably the one of the best films ever depicted in cinematic form.  It is the most controversial and sad film I've ever seen; second is American history x.  I loved this film and I thought Tim Robbins was excellent and Morgan Freeman as well.  Let me just say to that everybody should see this film.  I give it 4/4

Comment Head: The Greatest Movie That I Have Ever Seen
Comment Body: **SOME MINOR SPOILERS**I was like some other people in that I have had never seen "The Shawshank Redemption" until 2 nights ago.  Now, I just got done watching it for the 2nd straight night in a row.  How anyone can say that this movie is overrated is beyond me; it is almost like they want to say that to be different!The acting is outstanding by everyone involved including Robbins, Freeman, Sadler, Gunton, Brown, etc.  Maybe the most chilling scene is when Tommy reveals to Red and Andy about how he had a cellmate at another prison reveal to him about that time "he killed that golf pro and that b*tch he was knocking up".  There was something about that scene in how Darabont filmed it with the lighting and the laugh of that guy.  It left an impression on me.  It also was the turning point of the movie, although you could tell from the very beginning that Andy was not like any other convict.One thing that sorta bothered me was near the end when it was revealed to the press about all the stuff going on at Shawshank, how it was so quick for Norton, Hadley, etc. to get theirs.  I mean how did Andy really accomplish this without giving himself away and how did they not trace his whereabouts or question him?  Oh well, I guess wondering about one thing like that is not too bad.  Normally, there are like 5 things or more that I wonder about in every movie, but that is why it is a movie, I guess.At any rate, don't let the above paragraph ruin it for you...I'm just a weirdo after all...:)  The music, camera angles, lighting, acting, etc. are all outstanding.This is a movie that needs to be watched over and over again and should be treasured.  There is a reason for it being ranked #2 all-time, people. It's that good.  If you wind up enjoying this movie, I recommend another Darabond movie based on a Stephen King work in "The Green Mile".  It is a little-bit more fantasy than Shawshank but it is an outstanding movie.

Comment Head: Why does everyone think this is so good?
Comment Body: I've seen this movie two times now, and must say I quite enjoyed it. But when I see all the user comments, consistently expressing how ingenious and brilliant this movie is, amazement overwhelms me.The storytelling is rather one-dimensional and straightforward, something like a story for children. I fail to see any brilliance at all in the plot.(spoilers)What is the deal with the David vs Goliath story anyway? You can beat everyone as long as you have hope and patience? And why is everyone talking about this "get busy living or busy dying"? Come on, people, that's philosophy for teenagers, you can do better!What if the warden, for instance, would have ordered to remove the posters after one of Dufraisne's wrongdoings? I know I would have! And what if, somewhere during those 19 years, anyone would have heard him digging? I know I would, with the great acoustics such a prison should have, and how silent everything is at night?Bottom line: this story is far from brilliant and really isn't very deep. Within 10 years it will disappear from the top 50 (when all the voters have grown up and lower their score by two or three points).

Comment Head: One of the most overrated movies of all times!!
Comment Body: Don't get me wrong i think the movie is good. but it's not great i mean there were much better movies in 1994 "Ed Wood", "Heavenly Cratures", "Pulp Fiction", etc. i mean there is nothing special about this movie it's very conventional..... i give it *** 0ut of *****

Comment Head: Quite simply the most beautiful film ever made
Comment Body: Although a long film, and for the most part not light hearted, I am able to watch "The Shawshank Redemption" again and again and to this day I can't find fault with it. It was a brave film to make because if it hadn't been made and acted so well, some parts could have been very tacky. One thing I like about the film is the way in which it shows the convicts to be normal people who have made mistakes, not monsters. It emphasised how everybody deserves rights, even if they are in prison. It is an emotional rollercoaster for me making my heart break or swell with happiness. That sounds tacky, but it's not if you've seen the film.

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever done
Comment Body: This is a great movie. At first, when I heard that Stephen King was one of the authors I didn't expect it to be this good, I don't enjoy horror movies but later I understood that it wasn't a horror movie so I watched it and I enjoyed every minute of it. Excellent performances by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins.

A movie about life, about freedom and about friendship. This movie is just perfect. I've seen it a lot of times and I just can't get enough of it. Each time i see it, i learn something else. This movie gives you a different meaning about freedom. Great performances of Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins, and perfectly directed too.

Comment Head: Andy Dufresne - Christ figure? Just a thought

Comment Body: Proof, along with _Delores Claiborne_ and _Stand by Me_ that Stephen King can spin a fine tale when he sets his mind to it. Even having read the book (this is one case where the movie is better), Robbins and Freeman's performances were so captivating that the ending still took me by surprise. Definitely one of the best.

Comment Head: Excellent, One of the Best of all time
Comment Body: What an excellent movie!!!  This has to be one of the best of all time. Morgan Freeman is excellent as always.  Tim Robbins was superb.  I've always believed Robbins was a decent actor, but he superceded any expectations I had.  The movie is a real feel good movie.  I recommend it for anyone over 15.

I run the risk of disappointing new viewers of this film by praising it as one of my all time favorites. One should view this movie with little preconception, and let it do its thing in its own time and way. People critique it for being slow paced, but time plays such an important part of this film--the pacing is hardly accidental. This is one of those films that is hard to fault for technique or failure to convey intent. About the only way you can object is if you don't agree with its outlook on life. I too, am surprised at how many of my friends and family list this as one of their top films--independent/prior to any cajoling on my part! I'm eagerly anticipating the DVD release of this film--I've purposely kept from watching my VHS copy any more so that I can experience the movie and its wonderful score all over again on DVD.

This film is a masterpiece. It manages to wrench the viewer through every emotion possible. With Morgan Freeman's ardent narration and Tim Robbins' masterful expressions, Director Frank Darabont has taken a short description by Stephen King and crafted it into something that deserves to be seen by everyone.

Stephen King's stories usually do not translate well to movies (Carrie, The Running Man), but occasionally, a King story is done right (Shining, Stand By Me).  This movie is probably the best of the group.  It's a brilliant story matched with a brilliant screenplay.  The cast was great from the professionals (Robbins, Freeman) to the relatively unknown actors.  This movie is about a man's will to survive even when his future looks the darkest.  One of my all time favorite movies.

Comment Head: Robbins and Freeman excellent with magnificent supporting cast

Comment Body: quite simply, the shawshank redemption is my absolute, long-standing, favourite film, and i know it always will be.  it is a timeless masterpiece that transcends genres, a film that can appeal to everyone with its simple message - hope is important.
One of the most beautiful movies I ever seen. Everyone has to see it.

This survey proves that the American Film Institute's "Top 100" and Hollywood's "Academy Awards" are nothing but a fraud.  Like many others, I did not go see this movie in the theater because Forrest Gump was out at the same time, hogging all the publicity. What a shame.  This movie should have swept the Oscars for best picture, best acting (lead and supporting), best directing, best screenplay....etc.I simply could not believe it when I saw that the AFI Top 100 did not include this picture at all.  It is simply the best film ever made.  Given the highly different tastes of individuals, it is rare that you can ask friends and acquaintances what the best movie that they have ever seen is and consistently hear the response: "The Shawshank Redemption."  Everything, every scene, in this movie works.  With the exception of special effects (this film does not need them), this is the movie all others should be measured against.

Comment Head: One of the best films of the 1990's

Comment Body: Okay, i am obviously in the minority here, but i would not place this movie even among my top 100. Nevertheless, the Shawshank Redemption is a good movie and solid entertainment, filled with a compelling story, good actors and an accurate script. But i honestly can not see why this movie is appreciated so well; the cinematography is not that great and i have seen many more emotionally involving/uplifting movies as well, just think of The great dictator, The celebration (Festen), Leaving Las Vegas, etc.. 7/10

Comment Head: the greatest motion picture ever made
Comment Body: This film truly captivates the way hope can set anyone free from their obstacles.  I truly enjoyed this movie.  It is most probably the greatest film there is.

Simply put, this was one of the most brilliant, unbelievable films I have ever seen.  I had never read the Stephen King novella, but in a way I'm glad I didn't.  I honestly can't think of a single thing I would criticize about this movie:  the acting was amazing, the dialogue incredible, the score moving.  I knew a lot of people who hadn't seen this, and I recommended it to all of them.  Most of them came back and told me how much they loved it and they couldn't believe they hadn't seen it sooner.  This is one of those movies that will be remembered forever by those who have seen it.  Those who haven't are definitely missing out on a superb piece of work.  I enjoy it more every time I see it, and can't believe it didn't win the Oscar (it deserved many!) when it first came out.

Comment Head: Words aren't enough, you just have to see it
Comment Body: One of the most wonderfully perfect movies of all time, you wouldn't want to change a single frame.Paul

I've read the novella from "Different Seasons," and feel that Frank Darabont's screenplay was an excellent refinement of King's story.  It pretty much sticks with the original plot while eliminating some portions which didn't add much to the story as a whole.  The only part I wish they would have included (that they didn't) was Red's tales of other breaks at Shawshank Prison, if only for the novelty of them. Regarding the movie alone, I thought the grand aerial views of the prison combined with Thomas Newman's score (especially the 'Stoic Theme') were quite wonderful, almost breathtaking in their scope and power.  I would have to say this is by far Tim Robbins' best role to date while it at least is among Morgan Freeman's top three cinematic performances. I have seen this movie several times, and although I'd say the first viewing is the best, I never tire of experiencing the story of Andy and Red, their story of hope.
This is one of the best movies I've seen. I was never bored, or lost interest, even though it's not an action movie. I'd recommend it for anyone. Proof that Stephen King doesn't just write horror.

The Shawshank Redemption is a beautiful film about the power of hope. Andy Dufrense (Tim Robbins) is one of those rare characters in American cinema that inspires one to live with conviction, tenacity, and poetry. The relationship between he and Red (Morgan Freeman) echoes the deep friendship found in the Biblical story of Jonathan and David. Truly a film to watch again and again. "Get busy living, or get busy dying."

Comment Head: The key to it's greatness is the deeper meanings
The second best movie of all time.

Comment Body: It makes me wonder how people can bash this movie and then rate such mediocre films above it. One thing we have to remember - yes, it's rated #1.  Why? Because it is rare to find a person out there who hated it. Thus, it makes sense that it is ranked #1 - it has the highest AVERAGE RATING of all films voted upon here.I loved the movie.  And I didn't think that it was that hard to believe that there are men in prison who regret their crimes - much less that there were men in prison in the 60s that regretted their crimes.Incredible that people use this space to rip on the movie because of it's number one status instead of giving it an honest review. Love it or like it, Shawshank is a good movie.

Comment Head: Without a Doubt, One of the Greatest Movies I have Ever Seen
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is an absolutely terrific movie that shows why Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are two of the finest actors alive today.  I predict years from now Shawshank will be held up as a true American classic. This is a flawless film.  My one regret is that I never saw this on the big screen.  (I think the odd name 'Shawshank Redemption' and the fact that it was a Stephen King story kept me away initially [thank goodness for cable TV])  I urge anyone who reads this to please see this movie.  It is the best film I have ever seen about life and hope.

Comment Head: I'd rate it higher, but 10's the top.
Comment Body: Wow!  This is a great film, one which surpasses anything I or anyone else could ever say about it.  Truly one of the best films ever.

This movie was a great adaptation of a great novella.  Unlike many other movies made from books, this movie captured was almost an exact match.A great commentary on how a person's environment can make them do strange things.  I think Andy said something like "I wasn't a criminal until I got to prison."Great movie!

Absolutely the best movie I have seen in my lifetime.  I'm a hardcore action fan, but I sat and watched this movie and never checked the time.  This movie is compelling.  Tim Robbins gives a great performance nonetheless, but it is Morgan Freeman's character that adds such emotion to the movie.  I always catch the movie on TNT and I watch it to the end.  The end is fantastic, and it leaves me with tingles (if you know what I mean). Morgan Freeman's line "Get busy living, or get busy dying..." is one to remember. He adds so much feeling to the movie, and the entire thing is flawless. There isn't a line or scene out of place in the entire thing.  I sat there thinking hard about the movie for a while, but then I got up and headed to the nearest shop.  That movie was going to be my own.

Shawshank may not be the best film of all time, but for me it was perfect. A film is perfect (for me) if it shows a character who wins against insurmountable odds (Robbins). Another essential ingredient for a perfect film is a character who, by his actions, changes the life of another human being for the better (again, Robbins). The last 15 minutes of the film are so gripping: we don't know what is going to happen to Freeman, but we are so involved at this point that any other ending would be unthinkable. I loved this film!

Comment Head: Folks using the IMDB know what they're talking about!
Comment Body: If anyone has any doubts about how great this movie is...just look at the number of votes, the average of them, and read all the user comments.  It was a crime not to award this movie the Oscar in 1994.  I have used the IMDB for two years...at least...and Shawshank is consistently in the top three; the only exceptions being when one of those over-advertised "hype" movies is fresh in the box office.  To anyone who has not witnessed near perfection in movie-making, just rent this movie and think about how you feel as the credits start to roll at the end.  I'd go out on a limb to say that anyone who isn't moved emotionally to a higher level after seeing this movie is probably a robot.In my opinion, it's not the number one movie of all time (please see Holy Grail) but it is a very close second!  And, I believe the AFI should pay attention and make this movie its first amendment to the top 100 of all time.

I rented the Shawshank Redemption after reading many of the comments on this very page, and I have to agree: this movie is absolutely brilliant: great acting, great direction, great writing, and one of the most moving story lines ever. I give it a 20 out of 10.

Comment Head: EXCELLENT. Shawshank Redemption is a phenomenal film about the human condition and a man's battle to not lose his humanity.
living in china is somewhat like living in shawshank,
Comment Body: i'm sorry for watching this great film by a pirate video cd, that's the only way i can approach movies like this, because i live in china. in this place, you can only see a hollywood movie like "true lie" those having radical actions in it. i watched this movie when all my family were sleeping, for none of them likes this movie, they have no patience to continue watching movie like this with no action. and i really touched, in some extents living in china is somewhat like living in shawshank, you need hope and endurance to keep on, i got a lot from this movie, thanks to the director to tim robbins and morgan freeman,and the vendor who recommend the video cd to me.

Such a gripping story -- innocent people do get locked up, 'ya know -- and it's so very sad...  I loved the end of the movie.  Very realistic, I'm afraid -- I pray it makes criminals think twice before thinking that prison is tolerable - and I wish our criminal justice system would wake up and make some corrections.  People need rehabilitation, not torture.

This is an amazing movie.  The acting is incredible and the screenplay and direction are amazing.  Extremely powerful and pretty depressing, it actually has a pretty heartwarming kind of ending and the way everything ties together at the end is simply brilliant.  You must see this movie, definitely one of the better movies I've ever seen.

Comment Head: One of the best films I've ever seen.
Comment Body: I've been watching 15 to 30 films a month for the past 5 to 10 years, and I evaluate a film by its ability to captivate my senses, regardless of how many times I've seen it. I don't have to tell you, then, how much I've adored this film. I suppose, for the sake of public appeal, Forrest Gump deserved the Oscar win, but Shawshank deserved the nomination, and Tim Robbins should've at least been nominated for best actor. What can I say? See the film- it's pure artistic perfection.

Comment Head: OVERRATED! I don't feel sorry for anyone in this movie!
Comment Body: Shawshank is by far the most grossly overrated films of all time. To say that this is better than Lawrence of Arabia, better than Alien, Better then Saving Private Ryan, is just ridiculous. This movie is weak, as are all the characters in it. I'll never forgot the scene where the old man hangs himself after leaving prison and the piano symphony kicks in. Why should I feel sorry for him? Try living in Africa buddy and tell me how hard your life is. This movie is for weak people who love to shed a tear for prisoners and overall just weak people. Now I love the director of this and Stephen King, but im sorry, this isn't a masterpiece, it's forcing the audience into the characters emotional problems that few can relate. Go see the Green Mile instead.Rating = D-VideoGameHollywood.com

Comment Head: One of the Most Overrated Films Ever Made!
Comment Body: It seems that every time a movie comes out with an exceedingly positive and uplifting message or story, the average moviegoer is blind to any other problems or shortcomings the film might have. Every moment of this film feels phony and hollow. The character of Red (Morgan Freeman) is just a vehicle to keep the plot moving and doesn't seem to even exist as a whole person. His narration is embarrassing with its phony regional dialect and forced folksiness. The prison life depicted, while brutal and violent in a few scenes, is overromanticized by the picturesque cinematography and florid music. The plot is fairly clever but, like bad American television, everything that happens is in service of the plot. There's no behavior from the characters that doesn't help bring you to the film's stunningly maudlin final scene. And there are logistical problems, like the fact that you can't make a hole in a thick metal sewer pipe by hitting it with a rock three times. They could have solved this problem by just showing a shot of a clock moving forward. The best character is a relatively brief and peripheral one, Brooks (James Whitmore). Whitmore doesn't seem to know he's in such a shallow, contrived movie and gives the character a realism and three-dimensionality the other characters don't have in his short time on screen. In the montage-type scene in which he's trying to cope with life out of prison, however, he suddenly seems less intelligent and more of a stereotype of a befuddled old man. Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne is somewhere between good and mediocre, seeming to force weird expressions onto his face like he just read the character description in the script for the first time. Bob Gunton as Warden Norton is over-the-top and seemingly one-dimensional, but it works because Bible-thumpers are often over-the-top and seemingly one-dimensional. He's actually believable and interesting to watch. The prison guard Hadley (Clancy Brown) is realistically sadistic, but his type of comically crude sexual language sounds too contemporary for the time. The final scene is just so unrealistically over-the-top happy and sunny it's an insult to the viewer's intelligence and, I think, ruins much of the film. This film obviously has developed a huge following over the years, but I think that's largely just because of it's sentiment of hopefulness and positivity, and that doesn't necessarily indicate a well-written, well-executed, well-acted film. Some of the worst crap in theatres and on television has a hopeful, inspiring, uplifting message. Of course a film doesn't have to depict a realistic world. In fact, I like surrealism in movies. But it should at least show an interesting version of a world, and to keep any intelligent viewer's attention the characters have to be fully realized, seemingly existing in a world outside of the film's plot.
It deserve 8-9 stars in my opinion, but no way this better than godfather, no way this deserve to be the top movie ever made in history
So nice very supper then see-able movie So nice very supper then see-able movie So nice very supper then see-able movie So nice very supper then see-able movie So nice very supper then see-able movie

Comment Head: Entertaining Prison Movie Isn't Nearly as Good as Its Rabid Fan Base Would Lead You to Believe

Comment Body: I did not see a "goof" submission area, so I feel compelled to comment on this movie's fatal flaws.Andy's cell was consistently laid out even right up to the night of his escape as he sat on his bed staring at the Rachel Welch poster. There in lies the flaw. If Andy crawled through his snug tunnel as depicted, with his clothes in tow, how did he get that poster to lay so flat to where it even appeared to be glued to the wall? It was so flat that even the Warden's commotion (rock throwing) in an open-air cell never moved that poster once. Given that, what about the sanitation pipe area that was equally open and subject to drafts and air movements, which would have easily moved the poster. Nailing, tacking, Velcro, and taping are out too. Even if he had tried to exit feet first he would have had to move some furniture, given the height of the tunnel's access off the ground. The guard found nothing unusual in the cell, as if Andy had vanished into thin air!The sanitary pipe leaves a lot to be desired as well. A thick-walled pipe of that diameter would need to be saw-cut in two places and have the section removed in order to allow enough room for Andy's body to fit. Armed with only a rock it would have taken Andy another year to get through the pipe. The director would have been better off installing a manhole access.Last but not least, the wool suit Andy wears in the bank looks spectacular for being crumpled up in a plastic bag only hours before the bank opened. Given the location of his rain soaked prison clothes and the time of day after a 500 yard crawl, Andy would have hastily changed in the rain and that suit would have been ruined. Unless he was packing a London Fog topcoat with him he would have had to make a visit to a dry cleaner and had a two-day wait on his clothes at best. I wish he would pack for me on my trips!"Redemption" is a good movie, but not a great one.

This movie is terrible from the awful performance from Morgan freeman to the lazily put together story it was hard to sit through this. The dialogue was trash and the movie looked bland and boring. The poster is the main reason the movie sucks tho because I don't like how like how the poster looks

Comment Head: One of the Worst "Films" Ever Made!
I really liked this film but...

Comment Body: When i first saw this I came away thinking it was an entertaining piece of movie making but nothing particularly special. I simply cannot understand why it features so highly in many top movie listings. Yes the story is good and has a nice happy ending. Andy is a character who is easy to identify with against the nefarious, sadistic warden. This unchallenging hackneyed dichotomy is helped by Andy's buddies vs the nasty gang who's leader is intent on a slightly different kind of relationship with Andy.The actors all shine and it's well photographed but is simply nothing special, it certainly doesn't warrant it's apparent stellar position in film history. I think it is the most overrated film of all time, no question. It isn't even a standout in it's own genre and is way way too long in it's telling of a tale that is unoriginal and intellectually undemanding .

the all-time #2 is WAY high for this flick. NO great acting performances(they're OK but not a miracle!!!!) the story lacks logic in parts and the final sequence is a little too much. very good movie to watch a must see anytime but NOT all-time #2

The movie is about an accountant who is accused of murdering his wife and her lover and as a result is sentenced for a life in prison. The movie is filled with deep meanings but unfortunately it is very boring and directed in a very lame way. Plus the musical score is preety bad and does not spark any emotions from you. In this type of movie an emotional and memorable musical score is very important but somehow the filmmakers did not seem to care.

This movie was inspired by the brilliant Stir Crazy starring Gene Wilder and Richard Pryor. As an essay on prison life, Shawshank Redemption fails on every level that Stir Crazy managed to succeed on.Shawshank is nowhere near as funny as Stir Crazy. There is not a woodpecker suited bank robbery to be found. There is no Grossberger, no homosexual black man hassling the heroes, no silly mania scenes. There is nothing here that even remotely comes close to emulating its predecessor.The obvious links to the original are still there: Morgan Freeman in the Richard Pryor role and Tim Robbins as Gene Wilder. However, Robbins and Freeman are nowhere near Wilder and Pryor in the acting stakes and we end up feeling disappointed at their lack of conviction (no pun intended) in the roles.

i cannot believe someone would call this movie great i would give it a 3 but the fact it is the highest rating movie ever on this site makes me go crazy how pathetic can this be this is the most overrated movie ever created made with a low budget it seems all that happens is a guy that went to prison gets raped several times escapes and meets his friend from prison back when he was out ending 99% of the movie was made in prison where all that happened was he gets raped and washes some clothes seriously how can you even compare this near to godfather dark knight etc? ...and the bad director just killed himself at the end his wife gets killed he isn't even sad about it 20 years in prison has some money not that much and is happy how nice

i pretty much hated this movie. its a prison movie, so plot is basically Tim robins gets framed than raped and eventually escapes. Morgan freeman is locked up and i don't know he just acts like a kid in this. i understand he's suppose to be locked up since he was a teen but really he's giving the same performance here as his role as god in Bruce almighty. even though he's miscast he honestly carries the movie, mainly because Tim robins does nothing in this movie. some other subplots include Tim teaching some idiot to read or something, some old guy hangs himself, they deck a roof,freeman sneaks in a hammer and robins makes chess pieces, i'll stop the the point i'm making is this movie is excruciatingly boring. number one on IMDb, are you kidding me? even from a technical standpoint this movie blows. everything is just dull and unimpressive, hell it looks more like a TV movie than a film. i'd describe the tone of this as Disney's take on jail movies. it's to concerned with being safe and classy to accurately represent prison life. everyone's favorite part of this is the ending, and that sucked too. Tim robins apparently escapes prison with a rock hammer, after digging through his cell wall for like twenty years. his hiding place is a poster? really? to make matters more hilarious he has crawls through a tunnel of poop and emerges from a poop lake in a failed attempt to move the audience. Morgan freeman gets paroled by basically insulting the judges, than he goes to a rock in some random place that Tim told him to visit, and than goes to Mexico and finds Tim on a boat. reunited and roll credits, oh yeah Morgan freeman also married his step- granddaughter. that's the dumbest ending ever written. there's so much better stuff you could be watching instead of shawshank like porn or riki-oh.

I wait for the day when this film is no longer in the top 200 of IMDb, as it deserves.  Please, if any film was passed over in favor of Gump at the 1995 Oscars--it was the best film of the nineties--PULP FICTION.

Is there anyone who does not like this film?  If there is, I've never met them.  "The Shawshank Redemption" is a film that doesn't sound too interesting when you first hear about it.  A banker who protests his innocence after his wife and her lover are killed befriends a group of prisoners and changes everyone's life for the better.  It does not sound that great to most people, but when you see this film you will honestly come away loving every frame of it.  Tim Robbins is great, Morgan Freeman is greater, and the supporting cast are all perfect.  William Sadler, Bob Gunton, Clancy Brown, and Gil Bellows stand out as well.  James Whitmore, who has been in acting since the 1940s, gives his best performance as Brooks and should have at least received an Oscar nod.  If you haven't seen this film go and see it.  I can't think of any movie I'd rather watch on a rainy afternoon, or at anytime for that matter.  Frank Darabont, who had been involved in horror films before this, became a big-time name after this film.  Unfortunately, "The Green Mile" is nowhere close to comparing to this film which will be remembered forever.  A great achievement.  5 stars out of 5.

Comment Head: The movie that deserves to be on the 1st place.
Comment Body: Shawshank Redemption is a film which follows the events of Andy Dufresne while he has to live, or more like, survive, at Shawshank Prison.This film has it all. The scenes, the camera angles, the actors, the dialogue, story... It's all tied in in a way that few films do. The movie continues its narrative perfectly, and the actors do an amazing job at portraying the characters.I don't want to do a review with spoilers, but I'll tell you, if you're having doubts on watching this movie, don't.

Amazing,Mindblowing !I didn't intend to see this movie at all: I do not like prison movies and I don't normally watch them. I work at a branch library and one day as I was checking The Shawshank Redemption out to one of our older patrons, she said to me, "Whenever I feel down or depressed, I check out this movie and watch it and it always makes me feel better." At the time, I thought that was very strange. One day there was nothing on TV except things I absolutely would not watch under any circumstance or things that I had seen too many times already. I remembered what she said, so I watched it. I have watched it many many times since then and it gets better with every showing.

I have never seen such an amazing film since I saw The Shawshank Redemption. Shawshank encompasses friendships, hardships, hopes, and dreams. And what is so great about the movie is that it moves you, it gives you hope. Even though the circumstances between the characters and the viewers are quite different, you don't feel that far removed from what the characters are going through.It is a simple film, yet it has an everlasting message. Frank Darabont didn't need to put any kind of outlandish special effects to get us to love this film, the narration and the acting does that for him. Why this movie didn't win all seven Oscars is beyond me, but don't let that sway you to not see this film, let its ranking on the IMDb's top 250 list sway you, let your friends recommendation about the movie sway you.Set aside a little over two hours tonight and rent this movie. You will finally understand what everyone is talking about and you will understand why this is my all time favorite

Comment Head: Not as good as the 'Family Guy' parody...
Comment Body: I don't recall the first time, or subsequent times I have seen this movie, but doing my rankings, my memory of it gave it a 4/10 (3 stars- means I may watch it again, but I don't really want to, 4 stars- I will watch it again, with no plans to, 5 stars- ordinary, will neither discourage or actively encourage people to watch...).I watched it again last night because of it's IMDb ranking to see if the world is right, and I am an a contrary prick... the answer- the world is wrong.Basically this movie has been reviewed too many times by sentimental @$$holes who are too much in love with the richness and satisfaction of Morgan Freemans voice and the lulling of a placid soundtrack.It has some great stars, Clancy Brown is unbelievable, menacing and awesome. Probably one of the only people you can have speak in a Morgan Freeman movie and think- "What a great voice!" Robbins, I found to be a whimsical toss, his years of rape didn't make sense, if he was such a good guy, such a smart guy, why he couldn't have solved a 3 year gang rape run? Also, 'Andy' is put in the hole for almost a month and in that time, the guards didn't destroy his poster, a criminal didn't take it down or stick their d@#$ into it? His room never got tossed? The poster never got touched in the dozen years he had it up? He openly talks of his geology skill and his knowledge of cutting rock, and the guards/warden/convicts never saw a 'red flag'?This is just an overly sentimental, Vaseline around the lens 'bow of the Titanic moment' movie, with no wit, grit or heart. I guess I have seen too many realistic and quality prison shows, movies, documentary's to take this dated circle-jerk seriously, it is absolutely no 10/10.A guy spends a decade plus being gang raped, doing tax returns and legal favors for the guards that abuse and in at least one case kill the inmates? This movie is no 'Green Mile' and 'Green Mile' isn't as good as a single episode of 'HBO's- OZ'!I give it an extra star, raising it up to- 5/10, because there is nothing bad about it, and I wouldn't discourage someone from watching it. But don't ask me to score this soft and mushy pointless 'love story', that is too chicken to actually 'show' the love scenes between the two main characters a 10/10 when it's not even as good as the 'Family Guy' parody...

There are a lot of good movies, and then there are movies that have the power to change your life. The Shawshank Redemption is just an extraordinarily inspirational movie. It just isn't a normal prison break story; a very deep implicit definition is buried in every scene of it. The main theme is the presence and the belief in hope by the main character of the story, Andy Dufresne. Repeatedly saying "hope is a good thing", Andy finally gets what he always wanted: an escape and a new start in the Pacific, something that was always described as impossible by the other prisoners. I guess that the element that triggered the viewers' attention the most was the optimism and mysterious character of Andy Dufresne. Watching the movie, we weren't really able to read what was going on his mind even though we had implicit clues of the clever and beautiful things he kept to himself. The choice of Tim Robbins as the main persona was well thought by Frank Darabont as he doesn't show a lot of emotions on his face. The bond that connected the inmates, especially Red and Andy was very strong, leading to sacrifices and promises. The friendship between the two men lasts beyond the walls of Shawshank and finds itself reincarnated in Zihuatanejo, the country with no memory. Another thing that strikes the spectators is the enjoyment and the love of the small things in life. This concept was seen in the "opera music scene", where the beauty of the music and the voices of the Italian ladies went past the skins and through the souls of the prisoners. The excitement felt by all these men was the only pleasing element that wasn't taken from them in this dangerous place. The most important piece of The Shawshank Redemption was the message that inspired all the movie lovers: every man has value and importance in the world. This message personally helped me slide away from my negative attitude and helped me enjoy every moment of life. For this incredible adaptation of "Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption" by Stephen King, I would like to gratefully thank Frank Darabont sharing his work of art to the world.
