Comment Head: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.
Comment Body: With a legion of titles like Pet Sematary, Firewalker, Sleepwalkers, Maximum Overdrive, and Children of the Corn, it's reasonable not to expect much from Stephen King-inspired motion pictures. Adaptations of the prolific author's work typically vary from mildly entertaining to virtually unwatchable. There are a few notable exceptions, however; two of which Stand by Me, Misery were crafted by widely-respected director Rob Reiner. While The Shawshank Redemption is not a Reiner movie per Se, it is a production of Castle Rock Pictures Reiner's film company, and ranks among the best filmed versions of any King stories to date. This statement has not changed since I first wrote it in 1994.Spanning the years from 1947 through 1966, The Shawshank Redemption takes the "innocent man in prison" theme and bends it at a different angle. Instead of focusing on crusades for freedom, the movie ventures down a less-traveled road, concentrating on the personal cost of adapting to prison life and how some convicts, once they conform, lose the ability to survive beyond the barbed wire and iron bars. As one of the characters puts it: "These prison walls are funny. First you hate them, then you get used to them, then you start to depend on them."Filmed on location in a disused Ohio prison, The Shawshank Redemption is set in a place of perpetual dreariness. What little color there is, is drab and lifeless lots of grays and muted greens and blues, and there are times when the film is a shade away from black-and-white give credit to cinematographer Roger Deakins, a longtime Cohen brothers collaborator. It's ironic, therefore, that the central messages are of hope, redemption, and salvation.First time feature director Frank Darabont helms a fleet of impressive performances. Tim Robbins, as Andrew Dufresne, plays the wrongly convicted man with quiet dignity. Andy's ire is internal; he doesn't rant about his situation or the corruptness of the system that has imprisoned him. His unwillingness to surrender hope wins him the admiration of some and the contempt of others, and allows the audience to identify with him that much more strongly.Ellis Boyd Redding Morgan Freeman, or "Red" as his friends call him, is the self-proclaimed "Sears and Roebuck" of the Shawshank Prison for a price, he can get just about anything from the outside. His is the narrative voice and, for once, the disembodied words aid, rather than intrude upon, the story. Serving a life sentence for murder, Red is a mixture of cynicism and sincerity - a man with a good soul who has done a vile deed. His friendship with Andy is one of The Shawshank Redemption's highlights.William Sadler (as a fellow prisoner), Clancy Brown as a sadistic guard, and Bob Gunton as the corrupt warden all give fine supporting performances. Newcomer Gil Bellows, in a small but crucial role that was originally intended for Brad Pitt, brings the poise of a veteran to his portrayal of Tommy Williams, Andy's prot√©g√©.Ultimately, the standout actor is the venerable James Whitmore, doing his finest work in years. Whitmore's Brooks is a brilliantly realized character, and the scenes with him attempting to cope with life outside of Shawshank represents one of the film's most moving - and effective - sequences.Unfortunately, following a solid two hours of thought-provoking drama, the movie deflates like a punctured balloon during its overlong denouement. The too-predictable final twenty minutes move a little slowly, and writer/director Darabont exposes a distressing need to wrap up everything into a tidy little package."Salvation lies within," advises Warden Norton at one point. It is the presentation of this theme that makes The Shawshank Redemption unique. Prison movies often focus on the violence and hopelessness of a life behind bars. While this film includes those elements, it makes them peripheral. The Shawshank Redemption is all about hope and, because of that, watching it is both uplifting and cathartic.

I have never seen such an amazing film since I saw The Shawshank Redemption. Shawshank encompasses friendships, hardships, hopes, and dreams. And what is so great about the movie is that it moves you, it gives you hope. Even though the circumstances between the characters and the viewers are quite different, you don't feel that far removed from what the characters are going through.It is a simple film, yet it has an everlasting message. Frank Darabont didn't need to put any kind of outlandish special effects to get us to love this film, the narration and the acting does that for him. Why this movie didn't win all seven Oscars is beyond me, but don't let that sway you to not see this film, let its ranking on the IMDb's top 250 list sway you, let your friends recommendation about the movie sway you.Set aside a little over two hours tonight and rent this movie. You will finally understand what everyone is talking about and you will understand why this is my all time favorite movie.

Probably Stephen King's best adaptation ever. Of the kind to make have a change of mind those who consider King as a minor writer only good to work in the horror. Having seen this movie and then "The Green Mile" and "The mist", one thing's for sure : Frank Darabont should be the only one authorized to turn Stephen King's writings into movies. I regret that this magnificent movie received no Oscar, in spite of its nominations numerous. The Oscar of best actor for Morgan Freeman, best score for Thomas Newman and best cinematography for Roger Deakins would not have been stolen. I would have also awarded Bob Gunton as best actor in a supporting role

This movie is so inspiring and will never get old, like the saying "Old and Gold", it will be forever be watched now and after 20 years, they won't and can't do a movie like this. When i was a kid, and my father showed me this movie, i actually didn't understood it(i was 12 years old but still), when i grew up(i did forgot about the movie), i was searching for a film like this, i just couldn't remember the name of it or who's playing in. I found it again by mistake, and had a deja-vu, i was like, hmm I'm pretty sure i saw this movie(after watching the trailer), first thing what came in my head was the name of my father when i looked at the trailer, then i knew it, its the movie that i couldn't understand when i was little. I saw it, now understood it, and began to laugh for a bit cause i remembered how my father tried to explain me and i didn't understood it. This movie will be always nr1 for me, and I'm pretty sure out there are many others who things the same. Respect and Love for this "Golden Movie".

Comment Head: One of the best motivational movie ever.

Comment Body: This is surely in top 10 of the movies I've watched. I find almost unbelievable how people can put themselves together in jail and be even more productive than outside the jail, opposite of the expectations. This topic is really interesting, when people are left with nothing but communication with each other and it makes them stronger and give them hope to live the next day. Hope is good, as Andy would say... Filled with phrases to remember, it strongly contributes to the quality and impression of the movie. Robbins and Freeman fantastic, as always. I'm not surprised this is on top of IMDb ranking list, it's a masterpiece. I wouldn't feel sorry watching it several times, it's totally worth it.

TRUE STORY!!!FREEDOM matters!!!Morgan Freeman. He's a man beyond my judgement skills!!!

The Shawshank Redemption is hands down one for the history books. This movie is based on the friendship of two people (Tim Robbins & Morgan Freeman) in prison.If for some reason you are unfamiliar with this movie I'll give you a basic run-down.A guy is accused of murdering his wife and boyfriend she was cheating on him with. He is sent to jail and makes friends with one guy(Morgan Freeman) he does well and goes in charge of the library and eventually moves to the prison managers bank accountant. A few guys give him trouble and the rest is for you to find out.This film is definitely a must see. (13 years+)9/10- For incredible prison realism, plot line, movie ending.+IMDB no1. Rated movie of all time

The Shawshank Redemption is a timeless classic that is compelling material for any adult-age generation.Andy Dufresne is a great leader who's management style is to lead by example. He is the voice of reason in a world of chaos, the source of strength against unsurmountable adversity, the genius among the wicked and witty.Frank Darabont is nothing short of brilliant in his execution of a perfect screenplay, which is eclipsed only by flawless directing and unbeatable casting and acting talent.It doesn't get better than this.

What more can be said about this movie? There is a reason that it is number one on IMDb...a Website that is a database of every movie ever made...and it is still number 1.When this comes on, no matter what time of the day, I know that I will be sitting and watching til the end. Great actors--I love Robbins and Freeman in this and the supporting actors are just as good , great story--(taken from a great short story)Even after reading the book the story is still exciting to watch unfold on the screen, and just amazingly filmed from start to finish! This is one of my number 1 movies as well!!!

Comment Head: A story about two men who bond over a number of years while imprisoned and learn the value of friendship, hope, and redemption.
Comment Body: This is by far the best film I have ever had the pleasure of seeing. It is a story that consists of friendship, love, hope, and suspense. The entire premise and sub plot is essential and deliberate in making this movie the best. I've cried every time and will continue to the next time I see it. Some scenes bring tears, others are just there to give it better context. It has a great plot twist as well as a climax, neither will be seen coming if you pay attention. My favorite scene is towards the end once Andy has left and Red is struggling with his absence. During his wonderful narration, Red throws excuses to why he is sad, in the end he just misses his friend. Give it a chance, take the time to experience yet enjoy it! I have seen over 700 movies and counting, this kills them all.

It is a strange comment to make about a film set inside a prison, but "The Shawshank Redemption" creates a warm hold on our feelings because it makes us a member of a family. Many movies offer us vicarious experiences and quick, superficial emotions. "Shawshank" slows down and looks. It uses the narrator's calm, observant voice to include us in the story of men who have formed a community behind bars. It is deeper than most films; about continuity in a lifetime, based on friendship and hope.Interesting that although the hero of the film is the convicted former banker Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), the action is never seen from his point of view. The film's opening scene shows him being given two life sentences for the murder of his wife and her lover, and then we move, permanently, to a point of view representing the prison population and particularly the lifer Ellis 'Red' Redding (Morgan Freeman). It is his voice remembering the first time he saw Andy ("looked like a stiff breeze would blow him over"), and predicting, wrongly, that he wouldn't make it in prison.

Comment Head: A young and successful banker is sentenced to life in prison for a crime he never committed
Comment Body: In 1946, Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a young and successful banker, has its radically changed life to be put to life in prison for a crime he never committed: the murder of his wife and her lover. So he is sent to a prison that is the nightmare of any detainee: Shawshank State Penitentiary. Andy will be presented to Warden Norton (Bob Gunton) - the corrupt and cruel prison director, and the captain Byron Hadley (Clancy Brown) - which treats the prisoners like animals. Andy befriends Ellis Boyd Redding (Morgan Freeman), a prisoner who is serving 20 years and controls the black market in prison. It's a film about friendship, with great acting, showing that friendship can emerge in the most unexpected places.

Comment Head: It Is A Good Movie But It Doesn't Deserves To Be At No.1 At IMDb Top 250
Comment Body: There are much much better movies than this in the universe who can be considered at that position. I saw this movie only because it was at No.1. And truly and very honestly i believe that it is not the right place for this. I found that even the first seasons of Prison Break are much much much better than this movie, and if all four seasons are considered, than this movie wont' stand anywhere near it in excellence, direction, story and almost everything. I think it should be somewhere above 200 or even if it is not in the top 250 list, no problem. And the reviews people are giving for this movie, i am totally surprised, how can they give 10 stars to it...! i mean it matters to me so much.. i watch 80% of the movies after getting its rating from IMDb which should be above 6.5 to qualify for my viewing. So people don't' waste your stars just because its on the top of IMDb 250 movies, its a good movie but not the best, the top position is for the best. Hope to see this one removed from there soon.

Comment Head: One of my all time favorites !!!!!NOT

Comment Body: I admit it, not being a fan of prison movies and being puzzled by the strange title, at first glance this film wasn't very appealing to me, but it ranks #1 on IMDb and that made me curious. I also admit that at first I was disappointed, the beginning seemed like another Hollywood clich√©: man falsely convicted for murder, and it all looked like yet another fight-for-your-proper-rights movie. But after the first half hour I started realising that this is not a prison movie, neither is it a movie about hope or friendship. The background story is irrelevant for the main point of the film and could be exchanged with any other story where someone finds himself in a place of desperation. What is the true beauty of this movie is that it comprises the wisdom of thousands of years of human history, starting with the philosophical school of the ancient Greek and Roman Stoics and Cynisists and leading to the modern work of psychologists like Viktor Frankl. The film even plainly states the message in one scene, where Andy says that the one thing they cant take away from you is the freedom of thought and the freedom to chose your attitude. The first night in prison, Andy does not utter a syllable, although everybody expects him to break down as the apparent wimp he seems to be. Andy truly lives Stoic principles, never loosing it, always ahead of everybody's games. Because he is focused, not trying to change the things he cannot change, like the sadism of the wards or the fact that he most probably never will get parole, but step by step changing the things he can, while being observant of the little tweaks and holes he can exploit to his own advantage. At the end of the movie you realise that he had a plan from day one, and with endurance and focus managed to pull through. Also he never lets go of his guiding principles, which makes him incredibly strong in such a harsh environment. Andy does not simply hope to get released one day, he does everything in his power to regain freedom, and through this attitude creates a leverage so strong that he is even able to crush his enemies in the end. At the end also Red gets it, instead of trying to manipulate the committee into giving him parole by telling them what he thinks they want to hear, he speaks of the only thing he had the power to change, his attitude towards life, and promptly gets released. The topic alone would be sufficient to propel this movie into the top ten of the best films ever made, but it is further enhanced through a captivating story and narrative, wonderful photography, and a superb acting performance of practically every actor involved. Morgan Freeman sticks out for me, because I admittedly have a weak spot for him, but that does not diminish the contribution of the rest of the cast. I guess it will always remain debatable which movie is "the best", I think one should not taint the extraordinary contribution of this movie to film history with such petty discussions. Without the slightest doubt this is one of - if not the - best movie(s) I've ever seen.

Comment Head: An amazing accomplishment, but with a serious lack of Jeff Goldblum
over-hyped, but stirring & lovely tale nonetheless

Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is one movie, that every person should watch at least once during their lifetime. It's a classic drama/crime movie, which starts in 1946 with Andy Dufresne, a banker being wrongly accused and convicted of his wife's and wife's loves murder. He is sentenced to life at the Shawshank Prison, He arrives at the Shawshank prison and befriends a fellow prisoner Red who finds Andy's acts rather daring as well as amusing during his time at the shawshank prison. Using just a small Hope and Time as his tools Andy finds out a way to escape from that hellhole, emerging as the most extra-ordinary prisoner of his time.The story revolves around friendship, strength and hope. Andy gains respect among the fellow prisoners and makes the passage for his escape so cleverly which even the warden himself could not figure out till the end, The climax of the story is what makes it a huge hit amongst the masses. Only after watching such a master piece by Stephen King can one actually find out why It tops the list of IMDb top 250.

Movie is good to watch. But I wonder how did it make to no.1 position on 250..!! Lots of better movies are there..!! And also it copies some scenes form "Escape from Alcatraz (1979)"..!!that i would give 8/10 Again am telling you that movie's climax is good..!!People already watched this movie made their ratings 10. Why all the people has made it a 10, even it hasn't any specialty..!! The movie is just an o.k movie..!! it doesn't deserve even in top 100..!!The performances are truly above average but I think that the characters are not near as memorable.I wrote this comment only to encourage people to do the ratings wise fully .Many very good movies are under rated..!!please make your sense..!!

Comment Head: One of the extreme few i give 10 out of 10

Comment Body: It contains everything important: - tension - good story - twists - good acting It's one of those movies, you'll think about long times and wont forget. This movie shows us, that we don't always need explosions and special effects. There are just some prisoners talking about life and freedom. And its still exciting and heartbreaking. One of the reasons I became a member of this site, was to rate THIS movie. It's my favorites and I recommend it to everybody. An other reason why this film is so grate, is that the viewer only looks from the outside. He is as surprised as the other prisoners itself. But at the end everything makes sense. It's like a perfect puzzle.

The plot is very nice. I have seen a very few movies with such a strong plot. The recent being "Boyhood (2014)." Tim Robbins was very nice at acting (9/10) and Morgan's narration was more than perfect (10/10). I always love to see the movie again and again due to perfect story line, extra focused direction, perfect camera work, and exceptional acting. By focusing on the main story line, Frank Darabont has tried his way best to direct the movie from every possible angle to give every scene a real look and he successfully did it. I would love to see Mr. Tim Robbins and Mr. Morgan Freeman to be cast for another sequel of this movie with Shawshank Redemption 2, with another strong story line and more suspense/thrill.

When I was studying in B. Tech first year I started watching movies. I watched so many movies. After watching a movie "TROY" i said to myself that this is my best movie. Then I saw "Titanic" i said this is my best movie. After sometime i saw "Braveheart" then again i said now this is my best movie. But when i saw "The Shawshank Redemption" i said to myself that this is my best movie. Till yet i didn't found the replacement of this movie. This movie gives so much lessons for life to live. This movie never bored me while watching. I have seen this movie 5 times till yet. The best part of this movie is to fight with the situations. There will be always unfavorable conditions in life and you will meat bad people but you have to handle it.

For a film to make you feel so emotionally attached to alleged criminals, it must be something special. Special is exactly the word for The Shawshank Redemption. A film so captivating and emotionally driven, it will stay with you for longer than you can imagine. The Stoic Theme carries the film in no way done before in the history of cinema, mixing both ingredients of film and music it provides a masterpiece. Compelling me to learn it on piano, to much degree of failure. The characters - beautiful. The Visuals - stunning. I do not see one flaw in this film, and I hope that no one else does. This movie is not cinema, it is an experience.

Comment Head: One of the best movies that humans ever conceived...
Comment Body: Well, it's out to be said although many have said it already, but this movies is one of the best movies that humans ever conceived. I do not think this movie is about a conman escaping or even about finding redemption in a prison cell in the common way. I think that this movie is about fighting for what's right in the face of adversity and acknowledging what you really are deep down inside. Many of the inmates knew that deep down inside they were free men, even while surrounded by high trapping walls. Maybe that's what kept them living day after another. All in all, it's a great movie that surpassed and overshadowed many other ones.

Comment Head: The process of life better manner explained
Comment Body: The idea of this film is to convey the state of solitude that man is, it's like the myth of Sisyphus which the Greeks and then Camus highlighted in his works. I must say that the character Andy Dufresne develops patience achievement, because with patience and look for the right time, the freedom that comes slowly after years in his master plan is won.Such feelings which we know must bend to make the right decisions and it is there that this film achieves an impeccable staging, making paraphrase of life itself.Speaks also of how one should live their best under the conditions, and evidently speaks about sacrifice because often we lose our status quo to achieve a goal or purpose.In conclusion, it is a poetic film a delicacy of philosophical study of easy digestion.

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever made
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is a movie that would move you to tears. Comment Head: One of the greatest movies i've ever seen
Comment Body: The thing is this film is similar to Forrest Gump in that it is narrated by someone and it takes place over 30 years. There are also historical events that are mentioned in both films. The difference was that Gump opened like gangbusters and was packed weeks into its run while Shawshank did not. Roger is right, it needed to be left in theaters and build on word of mouth and then it would've played a year. Columbia, a big studio, wasn't interested, which is a shame. Seeing this film again recently I couldn't stop watching because you see what prison life is like and how it operates and takes lives from people like Brooks and Red, who become institutionalized. It is sad when films can't seem to build word of mouth and even in today's climate, they don't play many weeks.

Comment Head: yes! likely the all time best
Comment Body: Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) uses his banking skills to win favor with the warden and the guards, doing the books for Norton's illegal business schemes and keeping an eye on the investments of most of the prison staff.Red (Morgan Freeman)and Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) are amazing actors that make this movie one of the best of all time. Central to the film's success is a riveting, unfussy performance from Robbins. Freeman has the showier role, allowing him a grace and dignity that come naturally. Based on a story by Stephen King, The Shawshank Redemption was the directorial debut of screenwriter Frank Darabont.

This movie is simply powerful. Just thinking about the fact that this was based on a short story by Steven King was surprising. I'd never suspect THIS based off of his work. I don't want to waste time on talking about how much this movie moved me, but once you watch this brilliant movie, you will see why I am praising it so much. This movie contains: Fantastic Directing, Brilliant Story Telling, Superb Acting, Great Cinematography, Music That Fits the Mood, and the last item on this list is... Everything You Want in a Movie. I am NOT going to tell you about this movie, I would want you to watch it your self, and witness all of this film has to offer you. This movie inspired me so much and is a perfect example to other movies how to make a PERFECT movie.

This may not be the best movie ever made in the history of cinema, but it certainly has its merits and is definitely worth a watch. For one thing, Shawshank is a fresh take on the Prison genre and it introduces a bit of color in the 90s. Ironically, this happened to hit the Oscars the same year as Forest Gump and Pulp Fiction, which also featured black-white protagonist pairings. Even better, this is one of the best, if not THE best film adaption of a Stephen King work. I was genuinely pleased with the cinematic liberties taken to make a story that was more than simply an adaption of a short story. In fact, this could be an example of a movie that is better than the source material.

Comment Head: Andy was a successful man but he was convicted murdered his wife so he was sent to jail. First few years he finds it hard to stay in there but then he make some changes.
Comment Body: Currently I am studying Film Critics at university and I was suggest to watch and write a review on The Shawshrank Redemption. The film is about Andy told by Red, Andy's good friend at the prison called "Shawshrank". I must say that I'm pretty positive about this movie at the beginning because of Morgan Freeman. My expectation wasn't fail but i felt a little bored at the end. However, i thought the plot was going to be more complicated than this. The movie gives a lot of survival feeling though which makes me quite into the movie. Besides, the whole plot was very touching especially for the scene that Brook commit suicide. It seems like the guys who went in there can never find happiness when they came out. I believe this movie gives out motivation to be strong and really learn what living is really. It shows mood incredibly well for the depressed part but sometimes I find the story goes very slowly so I get bored.

Comment Head: Definitely deserves to be in the top 250!
Comment Body: One of the best movies I've ever seen. Only down point if any,I would say would be the twist at the end which was quite predictable to me,which it maybe wasn't 20 years back. Other than that,awesome movie,must watch at least once :) The acting,direction,script,everything was top notch by the 90s standards. Bit slow paced initially but then works very well for the movie and helps the viewer engross entirely with it. Morgan Freeman,as usual was at his best no doubt,love almost all his movies. One of the best actors of this time.Go for it if u wanna experience the #1 movie of all time :)

Central to the film's success is a riveting, unfussy performance from Robbins. Freeman has the showier role, allowing him a grace and dignity that come naturally. There are times when The Shawshank Redemption comes dangerously close to sounding one of those "triumph of the spirit" notes. But most of it is eloquently restrained. As the uptight banker, Robbins does some of his subtlest acting to date. As his hardened but resilient friend, Freeman is simply miraculous, giving the role so much depth, dignity, and good humor that you feel that you've known this man forever. If the film is perhaps a little slow in its middle passages, maybe that is part of the idea, too, to give us a sense of the leaden passage of time, before the glory of the final redemption. Some of "The Shawshank Redemption'' comes across as outrageously improbable. Yet the film keeps pulling you back with its sense of striving humanity slowly turning the tables against evil.

This is truly one of the best movies ever made! Stephen King is an amazing writer and this movie reflects his abilities to a T. I cannot pick a favorite between this and The Green Mile. It could not have better done!!! The movie was perfectly casted. All of the actors were superb in their acting. It followed the book rather well, with very few changes made. If you love Stephen King, you will love this movie. I love Andy and Red's relationship the most. And it had a perfect ending. I have told everyone I know to watch this movie at least once, just for the experience. Everyone I have told to watch it has thanked me for telling them to, saying they too loved this movie. Even my children love this movie and will sit through its entirety without complaint. Absolutely a 10 out of 10!!!!

Top250 years will take place in the first place. I think the world's best film. Excellent script, great players. Red's narration of the story allows him to speak for all of the prisoners, who sense a fortitude and integrity in Andy that survives the years. Andy will not kiss butt. He will not back down. But he is not violent, just formidably sure of himself. For the warden (Bob Gunton), he is both a challenge and a resource; Andy knows all about bookkeeping and tax preparation, and before long he's been moved out of his prison job in the library and assigned to the warden's office, where he sits behind an adding machine and keeps tabs on the warden's ill-gotten gains. His fame spreads, and eventually he's doing the taxes and pension plans for most of the officials of the local prison system.

I have to admit, I never read the novel this is based on. But I'm guessing the people who don't like the movie at all (which is fine), either haven't read the book or don't like the book. I'm saying this, because what you are getting here, is very close to adult films. Something people in Germany (censors that is), do not have a problem with (the movie is rated 16+).I can only guess the movie will be NC-17 (if they rate it) in America. There are explicit images of male genitalia, a lot bare breasts (though mostly of our main female lead). With all that said, I went into the movie with the impression I wouldn't like it at all.

Shawshank Redemption is quite possibly the best movie ever made. This includes all time frames and genres. There are no flaws in this story; only brilliance. It's simply a remarkable story. It's a timepiece feature with an amazing cast. Character development is top-notch. The story line and delivery are extraordinary. I wish I could re- watch this movie over again as if I had never seen it before, so do yourself a favor... if you're watching this movie or plan to watch this movie for the first time... turn off your phone, dim the lights and be prepared to be amazed. It's an enriching story with adult content that is suitable for older kids. You will laugh. You will cry. You will get angry. And... you will feel love, hope and redemption unlike any movie you have ever seen before. Shawshank Redemption is unforgettable.

I decided to make a review about a fantastic film, which I personally think it should deserve a lot better, it was forced to be re-released to reach more than the budget. The Shawshank redemption a movie directed by Frank Darabont The Shawshank Redemption is an American drama film made by writer Stephen King from the beginning, with Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman in the lead roles. The film is about the successful banker Andy ( Tim Robbins ) who is wrongly convicted for murder of his wife and her lover. He is sent to Shawshank Prison for life. This is one of the toughest prisons in the United States during the 1940s. There he meets Red ( Morgan Freeman ) as they quickly becomes very good friends. Years after years Andy just gets more and more famous among the guards, and the prisoners, and it ends with Andy helps a guard to get $ 25,000 as a gift. Then the police- officer Norton realizes that Andy might be useful, so he started taking care of the prison economy. It causes him to get control of what happens in the prison and it gives him great opportunities to escape from the prison. The film has a strong and important purpose that you should never give up and always have hopes for what will happen. That trust is a big impact on relationships, The film can be viewed by anyone of any age and it is a very good and interesting movie. It defiantly deserves better because it is a touching movie and very inspiring.

Comment Head: A rating over 9 on IMDb - That is impressive
Comment Body: This movie is just awesomely brilliant. Okay, English teachers may not like that description, but simply put, this movie is one great movie. This movie is about a prison in Maine named Shawshank. A wealthy banker, Andy Dufrense (Tim Robbins) is arrested, charged, and convicted for murdering his wife and her lover. He claims that he did not do it, but the evidence points directly to him. He claims that he is innocent, but so does everybody else in Shawshank. Andy, though, proclaims his innocence right through to the end. He says "the only time I became crooked was when I came to Shawshank".The Shawshank Redemption is adapted from the Stephen King novel "Rita Heywood and the Shawshank Redemption", and as is typical for Stephen King, the horror comes not from the supernatural but from the natural. The horror here is of being thrown into prison an innocent man, and then never being able to leave because of the corruption all around. Andy is clearly innocent by the closing stages of the movie, but by that time he is such a key element to the Warden's plans, that there is no way he is ever going to be allowed to leave. Ebert speaks of the horror of time and of daily routine here, but more so there is the sense of alienation. Once one is inside the walls one can never really leave. When one prisoner, Brooks Halten (James Whitmore) is released, he kills himself due to the fact that he is free. Red (Morgan Freeman) says when he is finally released, that without the strict routine of the prison system and with the freedom of daily life, he just cannot cope.Andy is different, he has hope, and he retains this hope right through until the end. We do not see the big picture until the end of the movie, when we are revealed all, but Andy remains calm, patient, and resolute, knowing that in the end he is going to be free. He is also an opportunist, he sees an opportunity and he takes it, and when he does, he gains the friends that he needs to survive in the prison. He is not a pushover, for when the sisters seek to violate them, he fights, and he fights brutally, but he knows that in the end he will be out and he puts up with it.This movie is about hope. It is not a fantasy: Red says "if this was a fantasy then he would have fought them off and everything would have been fine, but it is not." This is real and King has pulled no punches. Yet also the hope is there; we see real characters with real fallibilities. Even Andy falls occasionally and is blackmailed into submission, but he has that hope and he always looks forward to freedom.

Comment Head: Stuck in the middle for me

In that case he played his role perfectly but I don't think its a wise choice to have a... main? Character like that? I'm not sure if Red was the main character, he is our eyes and ears so...Either way the film shows cinematic genius and truly amazing story telling. I enjoyed every second of it, some say certain areas of the story dragged on too long but hey its prison. Every moment in prison is dragged along. But I don't know about being the greatest film on IMDb. I would say Citizen Kane should be number 1. Citizen Kane is so amazing its actually art. So again loved Shawshank Redemption and I wish more movies were like it, but I don't know about greatest film of all time.

Comment Head: I used to think this was the best

Comment Body: It has long been my contention that it is the movie-maker's task to hold the viewer's attention, not to burden him with his self-indulgent, difficult-to-follow symbolisms. That having been said, I find it difficult to find another movie I would recommend more highly than The Shawshank Redemption. Without any high- adrenaline action sequences or steamy sex scenes (two sure-fire ways to get the viewer's attention), this film somehow has the power to make you sit through all 142 minutes without for a moment getting bored. And I challenge anyone who has seen it to delete any scene, even any minute, from the final edit. The fact is, you can't. Because every single scene is an essential element that contributes to the final result: a masterpiece that captures the drama of enduring friendship and resiliency of the human spirit more powerfully than any other film ever made. Even those who normally do not watch movies with a critical eye will find themselves so drawn into this experience. I really can't say enough about this film. Suffice it to say that this is certainly the Greatest Movie Not to Win an Oscar. (Since Citizen Kane, at least. )Actually, I can forgive the Film Academy for not honoring this film with the Oscars I firmly believe it deserved. But when the American Film Institute in 1998 put together their list of The 100 Greatest Movies of all time (covering the period from 1896-1996), and so myopically overlooked Shawshank in favor of such titles as Rocky, Dr. Strangelove, Network, and Jaws, well, I thought that was absolutely ridiculous.I wouldn't hesitate to put it in the top five of all time.

Comment Head: The most overrated hyped up movie I have ever watched but its good.
Comment Body: I cannot believe that it took me 17 years to see this movie and was it worth the wait well here's what the film is about.The story is about a young banker played by Tim Robbins who was convicted of murdering his wife and her lover and is sentenced to life in Shawnshank prison where he meets a former crook named Reed played by the brilliant actor of our generation Morgan Freeman. The two become inseparable as they deal with prison life and the guards betting the HELL out of some of the prisoners; one got killed to death by the guard while the other hanged himself to death.Everyday they have to dig up holes and eating disgusting food, but will Andy(aka Robbins)ever get out of prison and did he really kill his wife and her lover in cold-blood?Bottom line is this; I'm 22 years of age a female who hates watching these kind of movies as there really not my cup of tea,I'm sort of a romantic/fantasy/cartoon/drama/weepie kind of chick and I hate watching violent movies,but this movie was really good;but seriously is it the best movie in the world? well for me its not in fact its all about dealing with prison life and the whole motto is get busy or die trying. Overall I did enjoy this movie but I wouldn't be watching it again. Once is enough for me.SO I'm giving it a 7.5/10

In my opinion this movie is far from the greatest movie of all time. Thou, it's a thrilling story, includes great acting and visually constitutes of some extraordinary cinematography. The overall impression you're left with after watching the shawshank redemption does not make a lasting one. I don't know if it's the relatively dull undertone or the mainstreamness of its story style, which makes it a rather ordinary movie experience. I believe the Godfather was a better choice for the number one spot, however there are a lot of other great ones out there. I don't regret watching this movie, it's well worth its 2,5 hours and I recommend you to watch it for the movie classic it is. But I wont bother to see it again.

Comment Head: Finally a Steven King short stories plays out better on screen
Comment Body: Never has perseverance played such a strong character on film. The respect and friendship that came from it were against all odds, but to do so one would need hope. Tim Robbins' Andy Dufresne manages that intangible saving grace over decades while falsely imprisoned and it's Morgan Freemans' Red who narrates for us and in constant perspective against the institutionalization of the Maine State penitentiary. The symbiotic relationship between the two is perfect cinema chemistry. The ending is quite fantasy, but makes for good afternoon drama on TNT who, I believe bought the rights for a cheep price, and that's a happy ending for Ted Turner!

Comment Head: Morgan Freeman is a man without freedom but gets it in his own little way

Comment Body: It's a good movie. I love this film. It's a story about hope and dreams and one whose emotional impact is as great as the Pacific Ocean is blue. An amazing movie. Easily one of the best movies made during the 90s and definitely one of the top 'prison' movies of all-time. Pretty much everything about this movie works and works extremely well! I have not read Stephen King's novella (his first non-horror), but some of the movie's deficiencies, such as the old-fashioned morality tale and portentous message about camaraderie and redemption--must have been in the source material. Darabont explores the range of human kindness and cruelty as he lovingly and patiently sculpts his large cast of characters against magnificent scenery.

In 1946, a banker named Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins) is convicted of a double murder, even though he stubbornly proclaims his innocence. He's sentenced to a life term at the Shawshank State Prison in Maine, where another lifer, Ellis "Red" Redding (Morgan Freeman), picks him as the new recruit most likely to crack under the pressure. The ugly realities of prison life are quickly introduced to Andy: a corrupt warden (Bob Gunton), sadistic guards led by Capt. Byron Hadley (Clancy Brown), and inmates who are little better than animals, willing to use rape or beatings to insure their dominance. But Andy does not crack: he has the hope of the truly innocent, which (together with his smarts) allow him to prevail behind bars. He uses his banking skills to win favor with the warden and the guards, doing the books for Norton's illegal business schemes and keeping an eye on the investments of most of the prison staff. In exchange, he is able to improve the prison library and bring some dignity and respect back to many of the inmates, including Red. Based on a story by Stephen King, The Shawshank Redemption was the directorial debut of screenwriter Frank Darabont. ~ Mark Deming, Rovi

Comment Head: May change your view on the justice system.
Comment Body: I would recommend this film. It has a good plot and in the end all the small things you never noticed all add up. So overall it's a good film. They could have made it more realistic, since everything else was done to perfection.Should you watch it? Absolutely.Should you give it a 9/10 rating? I am not so sure.

Comment Head: The Shawshank Redemption: An Utter Travesty
Comment Body: Let me start out by stating the fact that I am a HUGE Morgan Freeman fan. I absolutely adore most of his work, however, The Shawshank Redemption is the only exception as to just how far my love of Morgan Freeman will go. First of all, in the opening scene, when Morgan is getting rubbed down by two husky white men in the shower, the hot water handle should be facing the LEFT, unless this film was shot in Canada or Utah, I see no reason for this subtle inaccuracy. Second, why did Bruce Willis decide to concentrate his fire strictly on the escapees of the prison?! Why not on the inmates that were tucked safely in their cells?! Finally, the third and final problem that I had with this movie, is this: Hadley is arrested for murder, crying like a little girl as he is taken away, while the Warden decides to shoot his brains out.While the others would talk about Andy's exploits, Red just listens. One day he receives a blank postcard from the Border, knowing that his friend made it there in one piece.Red manages to pass the next parole hearing with an angry honesty that was missing from his past meetings, and is sent to the halfway house used by Brooks. He is lost on the outside and would like to return to Shawshank, but instead he fulfills his promise to Andy, and follows his friend's plan to find the tree he mentioned, and a black box containing a wad of money and a letter.Red breaks the law to violate his parole, and takes the bus down to the border. At the end, on the beaches of Zihuatanejo, we see Andy working on a boat, about to be joined by another free man, Red. Honestly, if you're even considering watching this movie, please spend your time elsewhere. It's terrible.

Comment Head: Not all that it's cracked up to be.
Comment Body: This film is no. 1 on the top 250. I would have to disagree with that. The reason why I don't think it deserves to be 1 or even 25 for that manner is...Tim Robbins acting and this might be coming from a biased point of view because I have never liked Tim Robbins in any one of his films. I have never liked him because of his slow delivery that makes him sound a little bit like Robert De Niro in Awakenings. Also another reason I don't think it deserves to be no. 1 is because of it's plot. This plot is completely unoriginal. I mean wow an African-American man and a white man become friends in pre civil-rights movement America. One of the few things I did enjoy was the whole middle part (i'll try not to give too much away.) The middle part consists of Morgan Freeman getting out of jail and searching for Andy Dufrane (Tim Robbins). Also one of the few things that is fantastic about this film is the supporting acting and the Directing of this film. Overall I would put "Shawshank" at about 35 on this list.

Comment Head: One of the best films of all time, but entirely predictable!
Comment Body: Firstly, as you probably know, this film is great! There's no two ways about it, this film is great and always will be for many decades to come.The casting is perfect and the performances of Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are just brilliant. The film also has a message which all viewers will relate to in one way or another and the last half an hour is probably the best period in the film.However, the plot of Shawshank is entirely predictable and the movie is way too long with periods where absolutely nothing is happening.All in all, Shawshank Redemption is a great film, if not the best of the last century. It has many things going for a bit but is let down by a few dull scenes and a predictable story line.

Beginning as a story about a man named Andy, who is sentenced two life sentences for killing his cheating wife and the man with her. Except he didn't do it. Beginning as a simple story, it develops. And slowly but surely, it rises and builds. He meet's Red, a inmate in the prison. He builds a library, a prison and a friendship. And he loves getting beer. Even with out suspense, it's kind-of suspenseful. The ending is very satisfying. It is not a okay movie. It is a great film. One of the best. 8 out of 10. A fine rating for me. As good as King's story. If you have not seen it, give it a try. It deserves it's high rating. In my top ten films. As it is known as a masterpiece, I have to say, it is. And as it has trolls, I have to say, they are so wrong.

Essentially, The Shawshank Redemption is about the survival of the human spirit---in a colossally adverse situation. The brutality and corruption which goes on in Shawshank Prison...never hits the viewer right between the eyes (like it should). Thats due to the calming tones of our narrator...Morgan Freeman. Mans in-humanity to man....is on full display here...and its this strange mix of violence, upright stoicism and high morality that makes for a heady brew. Lets not under-rate the narration of Morgan Freeman---this was a huge reason why this movie is now considered to be...a Classic. So, why did it bomb when it was released ? Maybe it needs a couple of viewings for all the gears to mesh (Who knows?) My major criticism , is that i thought the two leads needed to be a bit more edgy , a little bit more angry. After all ..they weren't Saints. However, the messages that most people take from this movie are positive (me included). I do not think its a Classic------but it sure is a powerful movie ... and a very good one.

Having not read the book initially, this movie blew me away. With such intricacy to detail and screenplay which kept the viewer gripped The Shawshank Redemption was one movie which ranks as most appealing to me.The whole time I, as a viewer, did not expect that the ending was going to be like that, to that extent. The acting was indeed superb and the way of expressing the changes in character and settings was impeccable.To reiterate to an audience what was occurring inside of the jail, and to depict changes in emotions and feeling with such clarity definitely justifies that the director of this movie was more than the average one in Hollywood.1994, 18 years ago, was when this movie was made but to the level to which it takes one is truly outstanding. One is absorbed by it, and there is no confusion about what is happening but rather thoughts in the viewers' minds about "What is gonna happen next?" These thoughts are present when watching a horror/ thriller movie for the most part, but for aficionados of different genres to all like this movie proves that this was one heck of a movie.Cannot miss this movie; it is one that makes one think, learn, and be entertained simultaneously.

Comment Head: Thanks for everyone's high rating. I adapted the short story for the screen
Not Bad but doesn't deserve to be number 1 in my opinion
Comment Body: This the most overrated movie I have seen, how this movie is number 1 on IMDb is beyond me. Now this movie isn't bad it's just that the movie is so over rated that there are movies not in the top 250(Jurassic Park) that I'd rather watch than this. And that are more ground breaking than this movie was. Now the best part of this movie in my opinion is Morgan Freeman he is just SUCH a talented actor in the position he plays in this movie. He is the main reason I watched this movie. This is not Morgan's best movie but certainly not his worst. The reason I gave this a 7 is how over rated it is. I'm not saying I hate this movie, which I don't, I'm just shocked at the fact that its number 1?! There are a lot more movies out there that deserve more credit than this film.

Comment Head: Shamelessly old-fashioned, manipulative entertainment with Biblical connotations
Comment Body: The year is 1947 and "tall glass of water with a silver spoon up his ass" Andy Dufresne is sentenced to serve two back-to-back life sentences in Shawshank Penitentiary for the 'cold-blooded' murder of his wife and her lover. We are shown flashbacks to the events leading up to their slaying, but not enough for us to convict Andy along with the judge and this makes for an intriguing character watching the movie for the first time 'round. Inside the walls of Shawshank, Andy still claims his innocence, only to find he isn't alone. But it isn't long before he approaches go-to-guy Ellis 'Red' Redding for a rock hammer and Rita Hayworth poster, eventually becoming best buddies with him.The theme of the piece is freedom and what it means to the men inside. The elderly 'Brooks' Hatlen is what Darabont calls "the spine of the story", who walks the straight and narrow path upon his release from prison but whose institutionalisation holds him back from enjoying free life and participating in the outside world. Red is also "an institutional man" whose constant rejections from the parole board have led him to believe that hope is a bad thing. Whereas seemingly infinite oasis of hope Andy, who after being raped constantly by 'the Sisters' and being sent way down in the hole a buncha times, still maintains his spirit. "Salvation lies within", as the Warden says.However, there is also a physical journey Brooks, Red and Andy take. Prison represents Hell in this very symbolically Christian story, the halfway-house Brooks and Red go through, Purgatory, and Zihuatanejo, the "warm place with no memory" is of course, Heaven. Andy is even baptised after escaping the walls of the prison when he falls out of the sewage pipe into the water of the crick in the pouring rain. The most seemingly Christian man in the movie, Warden, is actually the Devil with sadistic Captain Hadley as his Beelzebub. Writer and director Frank Darabont uses posters of sex symbols Rita Hayworth, Marilyn Monroe and Raquel Welch to mark the passage of time Andy serves (just under twenty years) inside, while Andy uses them to cover up his escape route. 'The Shawshank Redemption' may appear to be in colour at first, but it is very much a black-and-white old-school Capra story, with modern blood, profanity and references to sodomy. Bad guys are bad guys and good guys are good guys. The Hollywood way is a timeless thing. People climb out of sewers without a trace of turd on them and show no visible signs of ageing in twenty years.The movie has the same values of Capra, whom Darabont acknowledges as a major influence, and that isn't a bad thing when you stand it up against the largely nihilistic or simply stylistic movies of it's era, ergo all of QT's work, Scorsese's gangster pictures of that decade etc. The American film industry of the time's fondness for the downer ending, or lack of one was probably what drove the public out to the rental stores in the mid-nineties in search of this after the perhaps off-puttingly schmaltzy Gumpfest of this movie's year in the cinema failed to relate to many on a human level. 'Shawshank' has the necessary grit and real-life situations for a modern audience to get into it, but it also tells them what to think and feel with it's near constant narration and score like a movie from the forties might have. This is perhaps why it is such a firm favourite of the casual viewer, as it carries them along rather than allowing them to figure anything out or decide on their own ending. What the enormous popularity of the picture proves is that viewers would rather not be challenged but rather placated.

Comment Head: Excellent movie, but just goes to show ....
Comment Body: This is one of my favorite movies, but it does just go to show the importance of a great script, good casting and good direction. By that I mean that, for example, in this movie, the Tim Robbins character looks like someone who's admirable in every way in the world. But in real life, I saw Tim Robbins on some TV show where he was interviewed, and he came across as about as smart as a doorknob. I rate the movie an 8 and rate Tim Robbins a 5. What a jackass. Morgan Freeman is topnotch as always, and so is James Whitmore. Real professionals. So is Bob Gunton, the warden. To Tim Robbins credit, this was one of the best jobs he ever did, and maybe the very best. Also an unusually good job for Stephen King, who, in this flick, took a break from his usual moronic horror stories.

Comment Head: Is it really a great movie?
Comment Body: I heard about this movie very much some use to say "this is the greatest ever movie" but after watching it I started saying "what a movie(I mean awful)?There is nothing great about this movie its a boring 2 hours crap.The story is about a guy called Andy(Tim Robbins) is convicted with crime which he has not committed.The whole movie describes Andy life in prison and finally how he escapes from the prison which takes almost 20 years for him to escape.If anyone has a very high expectations about this film then please erase it.Its just a ordinary movie there is nothing in this movie.If someone want to kill a time then watch it.I m going with 6/10 for this movie.Not so good,Not so bad.

I don't get how this movie could be the best rated in the IMDb. Sure it's good, maybe great, but come on, there are so many movies more meaningful, more groundbreaking, more shaking... That's a clever story with an amazing end. Actually, it's probably one of the happiest movie end. Maybe that's why people like it so much. Sure there is some message about justice, perseverance and courage, but all in all very classic and easy, not to say shallow. So I rated it 7 as an efficient entertaining movie. Nothing really special in the photography, nor in the acting, nor in the staging, nor politically. No complexity in the feelings nor in the characters. Really, it does deserve good critics, but certainly not being ranked best movie ever. I suppose the shawshank fanatics would also give the litterature nobel prize to Stephen King?

Comment Head: "Shawshank" is probably the most perfect movie ever!
Best Story for a Movie ever Written
Best Movie - what attitude of a man (ANDY) can
Comment Body: Really Fantastic,Nicely presented movie.Many positives only.No negatives No regular features.Immeterial of the place and situation,what a difference a person's(Andy's) attitude & initiatives can bring for himself and his friend RED who is a hopeless person.The Warden considered a worthy good person in the jail premises suppose to monitor all.He is good only in the eyes of the public and Law,but practically not so.The Director and the people who voted positive needs to be appreciated for their bold initiative of supporting such a low budgeted movie with emphasis on reality.Watching this movie by any person and in any situation can bring happiness to him/her and the people around.

Comment Head: Finally registered on IMDb just to give this a 10/10.
Best Movie I have ever seen!
Comment Body: This movie was clearly the best movie I've ever seen. I watched it because it was number 1 on IMDb. Turns out my favorite movies like the return of the king, Forrest Gump, or the dark night didn't even come close to it. Why can't movie directors now days make such a good movie like this anymore? I would definitely recommend people to watch this if you like serious movies or meaningful movies. But if your the type of person who has ADHD and can't stand watching a talking scene for 10 seconds, i wouldn't recommend this to you. I would warn you that this is a long movie and it's not meant to watch it in birthday parties unless if your friends are all nerds or serious people. Also don't let your parents see it because there are many swear words in it, with some violence and almost a gay sex-scene. Other wise this movie is great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Comment Head: Excellent but ultimately shamelessly aims to please the audience
Comment Body: Don't get me wrong,I loved this movie. It's a beautiful and powerful fictional story, beautifully and powerfully told. Incredible job by everyone involved,and this is a very rich movie,it goes everywhere and never misses,and the control and confidence with which it is driven forward by Darabont reminded me of Coppola. It also reminded me somewhat of The Hill,Pappilon,Brubaker which are one of my favorite films about incarceration.Which brings me to my only discontent about Shawshank Redemption: the fact that Andy Dufresne succeeds in solving everything so completely. Revenge,freedom,happiness,reward for his patience and determination, all with one precise blow. And fate somehow cooperates.Well,that's too much for me.The happy ending was nice,but it was a bit too happy.It really goes straight for that pure part of our being that would want everything to be spectacular and complete, which gives us great emotions but ultimately "insults" our common sense.Andy Dufresne managed to beat the system. It took 18 years but he did it. Beautiful but I don't buy that. Makes for a great movie but doesn't leave much room to meditate.However I wouldn't even think of rating this one less than 9 and really deserves top marks. However,looking around me and thinking about my fate and the fate of others and the fate of the world, I see no Andy Dufresne's. I see the warden, I see Red and I see almost all characters but not Andy.He's like Tristan or Heracles to me,and I don't believe in those hero myths.So,almost perfect movie,but I'll make and take a point by rating it 9.

Not the greatest but definitely up there. It has power and presence within several characters and grips you into a mind boggling reality of what could be and how any routine, even in a prison, can become all that one in the situation comes to expect. A very thoughtful outlook. After a while, what some on the outside "looking in" may consider outrageously profound comes to be the only reality worth acceptance to the one stuck on the inside of it all. After decades of being trapped, several men sharing life's toughest and most eye-opening experiences behind the same old walls come to realize that there may be even less opportunity available within boundary once they are ultimately freed.

Comment Head: Good movie but 9 is too extreme,Thomas MC Fadden you are too extreme
Comment Body: Good movie but 9 is too extreme, is certainly one of the masterpieces of cinema, but like many Hollywood movies there is some bad things, when the protagonist moves down the sewer pipe, in reality it would be caught bad. A very nice movie that you can refer to the way that each of us must do just to get out of certain problems. After all you put poor grades to great films, especially horror. Hardly comes out of jail in a tunnel of excrement, jail and violence and degradation but you can get out mainly in Italy. However great interpretation of Morgan Freeman, many sentences are historical and should keep in mind. In the movies there must be some humanity in this film there is too much violence

Comment Head: Not Number 1 Material, But Still Good
Pretty good movie...one of those that you do not really need to watch from beginning to end.
perfectly horrifying until 80% of the way through

Comment Body: I started of watching this movie without any 'hype'. I knew it was a good film since it claimed the #1 spot in the IMDb top 250 movies.But after the credits rolled down,i very well understood why it claimed the #1 spot. This is a gem of a movie. If you missed it, then go watch it. It doesn't have speedy car chases,gripping war sequences or thumping action. But it conveys a strong & warm story to the viewers holding them close. I cant stress more. This is a 'must watch before you die' movie. or you'll cry in the heaven,having missed out this masterpiece... Morgan freeman & Tim Robbins are outstanding. They make the movie unforgettable with their outstanding performance.Each & everyone contribute their best in this movie.The background score is also superb,although it is less. I give it 9.5/10

I rated this movie a 6 mainly because not only is this based on a Stephen King novel, but it is also IMDb's No.1 rated movie! I had very high expectations and presented this movie to watch with friends during our "movie night". I have to be honest, my high expectations did lead to a slight disappointment.I feel the movie was quite slow paced, it is about 2 and a quarter hours long and I felt a few parts could have been cut. The acting was definitely excellent, Morgan Freeman delivers his best all the time and the storyline and plot were very clear. One main thing though is that I don't understand how almost everyone is rating this a 10/10 when I feel there are many more movies probably more deserving? Could be classified as a good movie, a really good movie but certainly not a great movie.

I was feeling a little discouraged the other day so I decided to put "Old Faithful" in the DVD player. Sure enough, after watching it--for who knows how many times--I felt inspired again. This movie is the best movie I've ever seen and maybe the best ever made. It's for anyone who needs to understand the power of hope--which means it's for everyone everywhere. I'm so proud it is the top movie on IMDb's Top 250, it sooo deserves it. I'm so glad it has touched others the way it touched me. If you haven't seen it--first of all, what planet are you on? lol--but seriously, go rent it. This is a movie that can change a life. If it doesn't do something to your insides, you probably don't have a pulse. I'm so grateful to Stephen King for writing it and to Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman and the director and others for making it such a classic film. THIS is what movie-making was supposed to be.

Very wrong. For so long, I avoided watching this film. I already knew what it was going to be like: the slightly above average movie with themes about hope and freedom. An all-out American flick which only a sentimental American could enjoy, and thus I resented it for holding the title as the best film ever. When it came to the themes I wasn't wrong; hope & freedom are the skeleton on which this film is built but the way it is executed far surpassed any anticipation I could have mustered, had I actually looked forward to watch it. Morgan Freeman is sublime as always, Tim Robbins perhaps even better. It slowly develops and unfolds, which is refreshing compared to all too many fast-cut films where it seems that the idea is that fast pace equals quality. I swallowed Shawshank Redemption whole, and even though I do not agree with its No. 1 ranking, I can now understand. Great movie!

Most of the movie is great, but i think that the ending was bad. Dufresne telling Red about the field and Zihuatanejo makes it too to figure out that they'll both end up free and happy :) A very dramatic movie until then and with some funny catch lines from time to time. Great acting by not only Tim and Morgan but by most of the actors. The small "stories" besides the main one makes it great, too. The library, Red's tries to get released, the boy who had met the one who committed the crime that Dufresne was sentenced for and such things help the movie going on without making it boring. I also think that it isn't a movie that can be seen a lot of times but i'm not sure before having seen it a couple of times more

Comment Head: A good movie? Definitely...Deserving of the #1 spot of IMDb's Top 250? No
not nearly close to greatest of all time
Comment Body: I can see why this movie is loved because it is moving and a great emotional experience, however #2 on the IMDb 250. Is this madness? It doesn't deserve to be mentioned in the same sentence as the Godfather. In comparison to the Godfather lets see:1. Is it better directed than the Godfather? Not even nearly close come on this movie didn't even get a nomination while Coppola has directed a masterpiece for all time.2. Is it better Acted than the Godfather? Please Morgan Freedman vs. Brando No question and the Godfather has better supporting actors all around.3. Better Screenplay? That is a joke, Mario Puzo owns it4. Better Music? Forget about the Godfather music is famous.5. So is it all around? not a chanceAs for the movie overall, I did like it but it is good not GREAT. I found it moving and a good film for the triumph of human spirit (its not better than a flew over the cuckoo's nest either) and I found it to be a good movie. On AFI's top 100 list, it was at 72 which is a more appropriate for it. I only compared to the Godfather because the Godfather and Shawshank are in the battle for #1 when its no contest. The ending was a fairy tale too. Yeah sure people always break out of jail with a rock chipper and then move to Mexico with their pal that they met in the joint. Please.

Comment Head: Absolutely brilliant, a masterpiece of the 1990s
Comment Body: The direction, the acting, the writing, absolutely everything about this film is masterful.To start off with, the acting is excellent.Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman both give what are arguably the performances of their career. Robbins acts with subtlety and understatement, speaking his lines and manipulating his body language with an effortless grace. Freeman's acting and narration are brilliant, in particular his monologue near the end.The direction is some of the best, a surprising and resounding foray into big budget films by Frank Darabont.And of course, the writing is the true shining feature. The creativity of the story, and the twists that give us the ultimate satisfaction are rarities among modern American films.This movie, is unquestionably one of the best films of the 1990s, and perhaps one of the best that has ever been made

I enjoyed this movie, but I still regard it as one of the most vastly over-rated films of all time. The villains in the film were 2-dimensional caricatures. There were no shades of gray in this film whatsoever. I can accept such villains when some element of the fairy tale, some element of the supernatural is introduced. For instance, it was okay for Chigurh to be cartoonish in No Country For Old Men because he was clearly supposed to be a symbol, a force of nature. The warden in Shawshank Redemption, on the other hand, isn't a force of nature, merely a poorly-written character. Honestly, the Shawshank Redemption was absorbing, but it wasn't a "great film" (in the capital-letters sense) by any stretch of the imagination.

Comment Head: the best film ever made!!!(one of the only movies that i cried)

Comment Body: I wasn't sure if I wanted to see this movie or not, but my brother kept raving about it and finally made me watch. I'm tremendously glad he did.The acting is perfectly accurate and plot leaves no gaps or unbelievable events that spoil the whole movie. This movie was amazing and was instantly my favorite movie. Morgan Freeman is absolutely perfect and so are Robbins and the rest of the cast. Wonderfully well put together as Freeman narrates his character's (Red) thoughts which I thought was pretty cool.I've never written a comment on IMDb, but this moment compelled me to write one. By far my favorite movie of all time.

Comment Head: Fear can hold you prisoner. Hope can set you free.
A brilliantly written and filmed masterpiece
only perfect film i have seen
Comment Body: i first heard of the shawshank redemption whilst watching the Oscars in 1994 and i was filled with the usual negative pre conceptions-old fashioned film,prison film,and a long film.therefore it was another 12 months before i watched it due to every man and his dog raving about it.i was then taken back by what is probably the only perfect film i have ever seen.from the damning of andy in the opening scene,the horrific suicide and rape scenes,the central relationship between red and andy,reds parole knockbacks,the enthralling escape right up to the uplifting ending,this is cinematic perfection and i doubt that as the years pass by Hollywood will ever be capable of making a film of this calibre again

I have recently watched The Shawshank Redemption. To put it simply as possible, it is a great piece of movie history.This movie deserves to be where it is (second)on the best Two hundred and fifty greatest films of all time.The Shawshank Redemption is basically about a prisoner, who is in Shawshank prison because of a murder which he didn't commit. The prisoner is a banker called Andy dufresne. As the film shows Andy is a honest man. Andy is also a committed man. Andy is acted by Tim Robbins. Andy Dufresne makes a strong friendship with a man nicknamed Red. Red is acted by Morgan Freeman. I think this movie is on of the best I've ever seen I would rate it 9 out of 10.

I stopped to see Shawshank when I was driving through Cincinnati. The theater was speckled with moviegoers.. all unaware of what an incredible cinematic achievement they were about to witness. There wasn't the slightest sound from the audience....they were mesmerized. The Jail(was in Mansield,Oh./now torn down), the music, the fantastic performances from a slew of great actors, Whitmore as Brooks, Robbins as Andy Dufresne, and Morgan Freeman as Red,..they all did a spectacular job. This is a film(one of the few)...that will leave it's audience in tears of happiness. The narration from Freeman is written with care and this film is crafted and paced with a precision that Hollywood hasn't seen in a long, long, time. "I hope to see the Pacific...I hope it is as blue as it is in my dreams". This film addresses many moral trust issues....from being raped in jail, to finding a friend amongst criminals, to being unjustly incarcerated and then shunned when you prove your innocence.."how could you be so obtuse?".....in the end it is the simplest thing, friendship, that is synonymous with freedom. This was the last time I was in a theater that cheered at the credits....and the only time an audience...so small in numbers...ever did that. One of my top 5 favorite films of all-time. 98/100

Comment Head: One of the best films of all time?
Comment Body: I am just here stroking the ego of one of the greatest films of all time its not really a useful comment but I am sure there will be plenty of useful ones out there. I can't give it 10, its not within me to give any film a 10 seeing as nothing is perfect, and moments of this film did seem a little unbelievable...Its a great story, great acting blah blah blah the film industry is not dead as long as for every Michael Bay film coming out their is a film like this in existenceget it and watch it but don't show it to kids because it depicts suicide and violence and they might go out and kill someone......

One of my personal best films of all time, Directed by Frank Darabont (Screenplay for The Green Mile and The Blob) and wrote by Stephen King (Misery/The Shining). Morgan Freeman (Along Came A Spider/Se7en) plays an amazing roll alongside Tim Robbins (War of the Worlds/mystic river), as 2 inmates both serving life sentences at Shawshank Prison set in the 1940s. I love the film from beginning to end. It has tension and suspense all the way through which builds up to one of the best endings which you could possibly imagine,it has everything a decent film should have. Bob Gunton (Broken Arrow/Demolition Man) plays a tough prison warden alongside Clancy Brown (Starship Troopers/The Hurricane). I have not added anything to this review which may spoil the film in any way, it is merely a review of my own, personal opinion, but i can tell you that you will not be disappointed with the film. thanks for reading, hope you enjoy the film has much as i did.

Comment Head: Strong values with a lightning screenplay by Darabont
My 12 year old daughter raved about this film
Comment Body: I just saw this movie for the first time. My daughter watched it first when she was 12 when it first came out. She went on and on about it saying how great it was then in about 1995. She also loved "Trading Places". I guess the moral of both of these stories is that the good guys win in the end. I now know what she was talking about. It is a great movie, and I can see why it appeals to women.The movie is set in a prison, with the time old tradition of a close friendship over many years of an innocent young man as the hero and an "old lag" who knows all the ropes, in this case Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. This is the same formula earlier used in the films "The Count of Monte Cristo" and "An Innocent Man", both films which are highly recommended, if you liked this one.The film, although made in 1994, goes back to a time when good wins out over evil. unfortunately the fashion for a long time in the nineties movies was for bad to win out, as in "the Terminator" and other movies. The bad guys are as usual the prison boss, The Warder and his Second in Command, the Uniformed Chief Officer. There is a highly unusual twist at the end of the movie, in which the good guys win out. This is a highly improbable situation, but fantasy is allowable in movies. One character of note is that of an old man, played by James Whitmore, who rescues a tiny bird, and nurtures it for years. Thank goodness it doesn't get killed by some other evil person, as usually happens. The old man has to cope with pressures in the outside after he is released.The overarching theme of the movie is one of hope. No matter how bad things get, there is always hope that thing will get better. It also shows that it is possible to have a friendship between black and white people, as the older man, the main character's friend, is a black man. The thing that this movie gave me, is that I can see how wise my daughter already was at 12 years of age, and more importantly, it gives hope and a good philosophy for the rest of my life. I'm sure that it will do the same for those of you who see this movie too.I am unsure as to whether it deserves to be rated the best movie of all time. However movies with hope and goodness as their main themes are generally up there, take "Gone With the Wind", "Schindler's List" and "Lord of the Rings" as examples of this.

Back in high school, I had an English class where we read the short story by Stephen King and then watched the movie. The short story is wonderfully to read by itself. However, the movie manages to both perfectly capture the whole feel and atmosphere of the original story, and improve upon it. It is rare for a movie to be better than the book, yet everyone agreed it was so. In the movie, many of the characters are more developed, and the warden is made much more crooked. Much of the narration is directly from the short story, but the parts that are not blend perfectly. It is a long movie, with little action and no special effects, yet it is always mesmerizing and beautiful, a movie about hope, with an incredible surprise ending. I still feel cheated because I read the story first and knew the ending before I ever saw the movie.

Comment Head: Not your usual Stephen King story
The Greatest Movie Of All Time
Comment Body: This is the greatest movie of all time! I'm not joking! The Godfather is good, but this movie is beyond any other movie!Each and every movie ever made has to bow down to this amazing, moving, grasping and beautiful movie! It's story is greater than Forrest Gump, it's actors are greater than Marlon Brando and Al Pacino and Casablanca, it's story is greater than Star Wars(Of course the old ones!)! This is the movie should have one higher number when you vote, because it's greater than a 10, even an 11. It's the most touching story in the story of the movie industry. If you haven't seen this one, you have no idea of what you are missing! This is not a must see picture, this is the most see picture! You'll never regret watching this movie, never!Movies can hold you prisoner. But only "The Shawshank Redemption" can set you free. Only Shawshank Redemption, forever!

There aren't many films that have as much of an emotional pull on you than the Shawshank Redemption does. Emotions flood through and through as you watch this movie. One second it's sadness the next it's a feeling of optimism and hope. A movie which solely takes place in a prison is one of the most inspiring pieces of art to ever be released. A film which features a brilliant screenplay by Frank Darabont, astonishing performances by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins, an amazing score by Thomas Newman, delightful cinematography and camera work, and a film featuring some of the greatest and inspiring themes ever seen in a film.
