One of the only films to ever bring me to tears, this beautiful film will stay with you forever and leave you thinking of life, and the possibility of wondrous things to come.

Comment Head: The best movie you will see in your life
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is by far the best movie I've seen in my life. It has it all. The acting is superb and that is not just a complement every single actor that appears in this movie gave probably the best acting that they could give. The story is very rough and hard, being life in prison and all, and yet it's touching, you see the leading character, Andy, never giving up, sticking to his story even when the world seems to turn its back on him. Inside He finds that hope is the only thing that's gonna make him go on, wake up everyday. Very nice message that the movie gives you. Also the way the friendships works, the commitment, the way they stick together and help each other, very beautiful, very beautiful. So great directing, great story, great acting, EXCELLENT MOVIE! Make yourselves a favor and go rent this movie, I promise it won't let you down.

Comment Head: Aspiring objectivist empiricist made empathetic to subjective existence by this work of art.
Overrated but still a fine film
Comment Body: Top 250 material - YES #1 movie of all time - not a chance in Hell.I saw this movie when I was like 14 or 15 and thought it was the greatest film ever made. Great acting, great story, great subplots, best Stephen King adaptation ever, Morgan Freeman. The things that bother me most now are the one-dimensional characters of the warden and guards. If we could see what turned them from human beings into what they are now, that would have been helpful to the emotional atmosphere of the film. The warden was definitely one of the central characters and I didn't quite get a sense of who he was.Still a fantastic film, but I can think of 100 better ones.

Comment Head: One of the Greatest, Most Powerful, Uplifting, and Wonderful Pieces of Cinema Ever Conceived
Comment Body: This is in my opinion, tied with Goodfellas for the greatest ever made. Masterfully conceived and directed by Frank Darabont, a powerfully adapted story from Stephen King's short story, amazing acting, and one of the best musical scores ever written made this movie one of the handful of masterpieces that will never die. Along with Goodfellas losing Best Picture, choosing Forest Gump(a great movie) over the Shawshank Redemption was the biggest mistake they ever made. The movie that makes many references to redemption and hope is like Jesus himself. The film did poorly in the box office but has enjoyed one of the greatest afterlives in the history of cinema.Plot: The story is taken from Stephen King's short story "Rita Hayworth and the Shawshank Redemption" and Frank Darabont made one of the only movies better than the source material. Masterfully crafted to start with a depressing image of everything the film goes to make one of the most uplifting, happy, and powerful endings in the history of film.Acting: Narrating is Morgan Freeman who gives an Oscar-Worthy performance as Red a lifer for murder in The Shawshank State Prison. Tim Robbins likewise gives a powerful performance as the sympathetic Andy Dufresne a lifer for murder as well. Playing the cold and ruthless Mr. Norton the Warden is Bob Gunton who creates one of the greatest villains I've ever seen on screen.Quality: This film is one of the greatest ever. One of the things that really made this film was probably one of the best, most uplifting and powerful musical scores I've ever heard which also deserved an Oscar. The camera work was also fantastic opening with a sky-view of the prison.This is one of the few movies where if you don't see the genius of it I will have to question if you really seen the entire film or any of the film. This is along with Goodfellas the greatest movies ever. There are only a handful of masterpieces in history and this is one of them. Even less is the amount of films that will never die and will always stand the test of time. This is one of them. This is a film that you should just buy.11/10

The film tells the story of Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), an educated banker sentenced to life for the murder of his wife and her lover. In prison, Andy inspires his fellow inmates with his courage and humanity and has a profound effect on Red (Morgan Freeman), an older prisoner, who has given up hope.Unlike many films of the 90's, "The Shawshank Redemption" has "high concept" plot premise and is somewhat episodic compared with the tight, linear narratives of closer structured pictures. This sense of freedom in the storytelling allows the film to consistently throw up genuine surprises, as the viewer isn't constantly on guard for clues and plot points. In hindsight, we tend to forget how successfully director Frank Darabont leads us to expect a very different resolution."The Shawshank Redemption" does things well that you might not expect. It has lengthy voice-overs (that actually work well) and it has a sappy predictable ending, but yet these elements work because they are not placed in the over-used, meaningless context that movies today place them in. The voice overs are also consistently used in such a way that distinct worlds are created. There's a real world inside the prison and the surreal outside world.These two distinct worlds are created help to place the viewer inside the halls of the prison, they are no longer watching a movie, but they are also feeling it.This is a movie that will remain a favorite of the people for many decades to come. 10/10

Comment Head: A movie you can watch over and over again
Comment Body: I'm new to this so don't beat me up. I have seen this movie so may times I can not count. If it is on I'll get hooked into watching and I know I may have seen the beginning of the movie twice. Morgan and Tim friendship in the movie is what makes this movie click. It give us a good idea on what prison life was like in the 50ish years. I would assume in some aspect in prison life a lot has changed, but some stay the same. I'm a sucker for these type of movie that goes through a time line in peoples lives. I tend to want to know my characters in a movie then speed through not knowing a small history of the character It is on my top 20 must see!!!

The movie is the best I have seen so far.It is absolutely flawless.The direction is brilliant,the cast is star-studded and the cinematography is awesome.I give full marks to Frank Darabont for directing a film which made me and everybody else feel touched.The film never bores u or makes u feel sleepy.Every minute of the movie is filled with excitement.The film is begun very well and also ends brilliantly with no crap in the middle of the movie.Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman Have proved why they are one of the most enigmatic and versatile actors in Hollywood.A film like this can come only once in a century.It deserves the #1 rating among the top 250.10 out of 10 is just not enough for the film.

Comment Head: It doesn't get better than this
Comment Body: What can I say, it is films like this that just give you that great feeling. This is a perfect film for themes such as hope, friendship, freedom and corruption. Now for those who have not seen the film I won't say anything, so do not worry, but just to tell you. If you are into the themes I have just mentioned, then you will love this. Tim Robbins adopts the role of Andy Dufresne as his own and Morgan freeman plays Red in an emotional and convincing manner and really did shine throughout the film. So if you want to see a film thats emotional, intellectual, violent and warden smashing, then this film is for you. It will give you chills.

Comment Head: Absolutely the most brilliant film I've seen.
Comment Body: This movie is so much more than what one would make out of it by simply looking at actors, director and plot outline. Its the synergy of all these parts that makes it one of the greatest of all time. TSR is a metaphor for all the important questions in life. The limits we set on ourselves, the ease of falling into conformity and our fear to hope for the best for our self's. The movie is about hope, in times of struggle, in times of extreme hardships and injustices, its about enduring and crawling trough all this s*** and seek the redemption outside in the soft rain from heaven. Its simply a "to be, or not to be". I could write cheesy metaphors all night but I'm gonna stop now. I love this movie simply because it gives me hope, its helped me trough my life's hardships, heartbreak and injustice, its helped me to get trough these times and made me love life more than life itself.

Comment Head: My all time favorite movie! Along with Good Will Hunting!

Comment Body: This movie is certainly VERY well done. The plot is nice (Stephen King never fails you down) and acting is superb, in particular Tim Robbins and Bob Gunton, the director. You should see it, but in my opinion it is not very original among "jail-movie" and not worthy of such a high position, ranking on the IMDb's top 250 list.Another minor point which prevent the movie to get an excellent movie is the fact that all characters are "one-dimensional stereotype". I mean that in this movie characters can be extremely positive or extremely negative, sometimes forgetting that human beings have complex behavior.

Comment Head: one of the best stories ever told
Comment Body: this movie took my breath away. it is a thought provoking, beautifully acted, gorgeously filmed, uplifting film that never disappoints. Tim Robins and Morgan both give award winning performances and it is very odd when one realizes the lack of awards this movie received. Do not let the lack of awards dissuade you though as Shawshank Redemption is quite possibly the best movie i have ever seen, i just cant emphasize how good this movie is. Please do yourself a favor and see this film right now if you haven't already. If there was one good deed that could get you into heaven then watching this movie would be it.

Tim Robbins as a banker who goes to prison being accused of murdering his wife and her lover.Sentence: life in prison.Morgan Freeman is his fellow inmate "Red" and William Sadler is Heywood.Later a young inmate, Gil Bellows as Tommy joins in.The poster of Rita Hayworth has a big role in the film.Later it's Marilyn Monroe and finally it's Raquel Welch.Frank Darabont directed this marvelous film based on Stephen King's short story.It's one of the best movies made of King's stories.Probably the best one alongside The Shining (1980).The acting is superb.The story is fantastic.The Shawshank Redemtion is a big movie.A kind of movie we should see more often.

Comment Head: The best movie i have ever seen to this day.
Comment Body: It is a great film because of the details that are used in the film. the thing about the story and the movie itself is it is told from Red's point of view making sure you know his opinion on it and what happened instead of having to figure it out on yourself. it, to this day is my favorite movie to watch and there will never be another movie like it in my opinion. the things that andy does go through hit you hard because you always see prisoners on TV but you never see an innocent man that you know is innocent going to jail for life. the friends he make are also very good additions that help the story and shows the corruptness of prisons in captain hadley nd the warden. there are a lot of memorable quotes in the movie also. such as "get busy living or get busy dyin'". the shawshank redemption shows the hardships people can go through when throws a curveball their way and how they deal with it.

Comment Head: Great Movie - You must see it!
Comment Body: The greatness of "The Shawshank Redemption" is all the great values this film is built on - love, friendship, lending hand to another man. What is also wonderful about this film is its combination of its serious moments with the beautiful humour. In addition, the film has a third-person narrator which adds a lot of meaning to it and allows to develop a closer relationship with Red and - through Red - with Andy. As for Stephen King's story that the film is based on, it a bit disappointed me. However, after reading it I appreciated Frank Darabont's work even more - I saw how much imagination and creativity he had to use for "The Shawshank Redemption". Lastly, the score is so beautiful you can cry at moments, e.g. the piece accompanying the arrival of Andy's transport to the Shawshank Prison. I guess I watched this movie five times and think I will watch it many times more. I recommend it to everyone.

Comment Head: A Story Of Survival and Hope
Comment Body: *The Shawshank SPOILERS* In the early '20s, Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a quiet bank employee, is arrested, tried and sentenced to life in prison for the murders of his wife and her lover, murders that he didn't commit.The calm man has to rough up really soon, in order to survive life in the Shawshank prison, but manages to develop a friendship with a fellow inmate called Red (Morgan Freeman) and to be employed in the contability office by the corrupt director of Shawshank, thus helping his escape plan...When I first watched this movie, a few years ago, I was so in awe that as soon as I got out of school (where me and my classmates watched it during a morning without teachers) I went and bought it.It's an instant classic, an inspiring movie, based upon a short story by Stephen King (!), marvelously written, acted and directed, and fully deserving of being owned.The Shawshank Redemption: 10/10.

Movie right at the beginning starts showing its quality of dialogues and thats the key for bounding the viewers .Then a fine story with great actors leaves an everlasting impression. Point of life after prison is also shown with a heart touching scene.Humanity in prison is raised by another scene. Overall this movie can't be compared with others as such a style of escape can't be said to be inspired.Atlast the movie gives a message of friendship,love and hope. A way of making prisoner's life more useful to the society and how education can affect the system is suggested.Combining these all elements in a series of events is commendable.The tag line of this movie is inspiring.

Comment Head: A very good movie, but overrated nonetheless.
Not bad, but not that good
Comment Body: I am totally puzzled as to why this film is so highly rated. It is reasonably well made, has a very good cast, and it held my interest. However, it has nothing new in it. It wasn't fun. It wasn't life changing. It didn't make me want to be a better person. None of the characters in the film were particularly appealing. The protagonist's method for escaping from prison was obviously not new, since he flashed his copy of "The Count of Monte Christo." There was an unusual directness in confronting gay rape in prison, but I find it to be not that compelling a subject. I guess that leaves redemption. To me, he paid way too high a price for thinking about, but not actually, killing his wife. After she cheated on him. Perhaps the point was that he felt so guilty about her death, he wanted to be punished. By spending twenty years getting raped in prison? That's not punishment, it's just sick.

This is definitely the best film I've ever seen.Ever What pulled me in is how much you start to feel for these characters as if their real people. Another thing that I liked is how the characters change for example Andy(main character) at the start hes a healthy looking man and after 20 years he has grey hairs bags under his eyes and a broken spirit.In the end you don't care what happens to the warden you don't care if he becomes president as long as Andy escapes.In truth this is a love story but not a regular love story this is A story of two of the most unlikely candidates.There's Andy a hardworking lawyer and then there's red sent to prison at the age of 18 for murder and armed robbery two polar opposites but in the end they might as well be family.This is the single most powerful movie ever at the end I was crying something that has never happened before anyway this is a film to see before you die words cant honestly explain how great this film is you have to see it.

Comment Head: Possibly the best movie ever to be made!!!
Comment Body: I personally think that the way this movie touches me cannot be put into words. The core of this movie is hope: hope that overcomes every obstacle placed in your way, the knowing that the wronged people in life can triumph over evil. This is what Andy Dufresne achieves, and the tag line of "Fear can hold you prisoner, hope can set you free" is perfect The underlying theme is friendship, and Andy and Reds friendship is perfectly portrayed here by Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. They are both fine actors, and I feel here they give career best performances(although Morgan Freeman is generally good in everything). Morgan Freeman should of won an Oscar for his subtle approach to this role - surely his million dollar baby Oscar is a belated one for this movie too? The directing, the story and everything combine to make this a special movie - don't worry, the ratings in the all time list, which always put this movie in the top 5, are not wrong. This is a movie everyone must see!!!

Comment Head: A flawless masterpiece? I'd say so.
Can a film get better the more you see it?
Comment Body: I do think some films get better the more you view them. "Shawshank" is such a film. Whever I stumble across it on a cable channel, I am simply unable to break away from it, even though I've seen it a dozen times. The best films are "simple stories, well told." From the script, to the acting, to the direction, to the sets, and - most importantly - in its message, "The Shawshank Redemption" is absolutely first-rate. It's always fun to see a wronged man win in the end, but in this story it is the manner in which Andy prevails that is so gripping. The scene in which Tim Robbins as Andy ponders if he is in some way responsible for his fate because of his thoughts is amazing. And Morgan Freeman's greatest film moment comes when he faces the parole board one more time. Most movies blow from your mind minutes after the final credits, this one stays with you forever. I'm ready to see it again.

i've seen the top 50 films in the IMDb top 250 category and a number of times I've felt that a movie wasn't worth its ranking. the shawshank redemption fits this bill in not being placed number one. and this coming from a die-hard god father fan must surely mean something. the storyline, the cinematography and the acting are all masterpieces in their own right. the story of a wronged person accepting his fate and then changing it is remarkable, for everyone relates to it, though maybe not to the extent portrayed here. kudos to stephen king and frank darabont and the actors for a great movie. its a real pity that it won no Oscars. this is one movie i would have hated to miss. truly exceptional.

*spoilers*The first time I saw "The Shawshank Redemption",I was simply blown away by how powerful this movie is. There are no action sequences or romances, but the subtle drama of a man who is wrongly accused is easily identifiable, possibly because we realize that it could happen to anyone. What makes the main character (Andy Dufrene) find the strength to survive his term of life in prison is his knowledge of his innocence, and his friendship with Red, a convicted murderer, who is slowly reforming throughout the movie. The end of the movie is perhaps one of the most uplifting scenes I have ever watched, as justice finally prevails, due to Andy's determination and careful planning.I never get tired of this movie. From the beginning of the movie where Andy considers murder, to his incarceration for that same murder(ironically committed by someone else), and his long stay in prison under a cruel warden, and finally the best-ever use of a Raquel Welch art poster. Ever.I highly encourage this movie to anyone who hasn't seen it. It is a classic, and the acting is superb. Even smallest roles are memorable.

Comment Head: An amazing prison tale of how people can get threw the toughest times if they stay together
Comment Body: This is one of the best stories of freedom in the world. It shows how the human heart can work to get you out of the worst situations. Sure i never cried during watching it but it made me feel good.This movie tells a tale back in 1949, a man is convicted of the murder of his wife and her lover(sound familiar 'Green Mile'/Stephen King fans?). Of course with all Stephen King's twisted books/movies... he didn't do it but he is sent to prison anyway. Since prisoners were thought of lesser human in the 40's-70's if you were caught doing something you weren't suppose to(or if yo u just annoy the guards) you are beaten badly. Luckily Andy Dufrense makes acquaintances with the warden and guards. He makes friends with 'Red' Redding(Nicely done by Morgan Freeman), a man who can get you anything from the outside. They bond together with other inmates and conquer over the warden. BUT one day a new inmate comes in and tells the story of how he knows Andy is instant.The rest people can figure out for their own but they have to be careful... though this is one of Stephen King's rare dramas, it will have the evilness and twists that we all love him for. Plus look for the most feel good ending in the world. I'm honest this ending will shock you so much and make you want to know more of what happened.

Comment Head: inspirational, uplifting and a worthy top ten film ever
Comment Body: am i one of the few who watched this at a cinema? Watched at the now closed Odeon, Haymarket on a Wednesday when I had nothing better to do and know very little about the film apart from a Geordie mate kept raving about it. With limited expectations, I came out totally enthralled by a magnificent cinematic experience - one that you all too rarely enjoy. To me you have to take inspiration from Defrene; no matter how tough your situation is, you need to focus on what you want to achieve and retain the belief that your dreams can come true. The scene on top of the roof, drinking beer is tops. Only wish I knew where my son has posted the DVD! We have to watch it on video now!

I don't want to say anything about the movie. I'm sure that you will enjoy it as much as I did. There are a lot of movies showing prison breaks but by far this one is the best not by the idea of the escape but by the message that this movie is sending. Once you've seen it you will feel different. I didIf you like Prison Break, if you liked Escape from Alcatraz you definitely want to see this movie.Tim Robbins is doing an extraodrinary job and the screenplay is awesome. For sure 2 hours well spent in my life. And not only one ;)If you can grab the 2004 release. Almost every error and goofs were fixed so you'll get the better version of it !

Comment Head: Shawshank is one of the greatest films ever made, a classic.

Comment Body: A heartbreaking story fraught with Passion, Loss, A Dream, and Friendship. There's only so much i can say about a film that is loved by millions and yet misunderstood by more. It's the visual version of a musical ballad. A soft and thoughtful piece and yet created by a hard centre and churned by the brilliant hands of Frank Darabont and the great acting of both Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. A True Classic."Andy Dufresne, is sent to Shawshank Prison for the murder of his wife and secret lover. He is very isolated and lonely at first, but realises there is something deep inside your body, that people can't touch and get to....'HOPE'. Andy becomes friends with prison 'fixer' Red (Morgan Freeman), and Andy epitomises why it is crucial to have dreams. His spirit and determination, leads us into a world full of imagination, filled with courage and desire. Will Andy ever realise his dreams...?"

Comment Head: This is possibly the best film ever made.
Comment Body: This is possibly the best film ever made. Everything from the script and acting to the camera work and set are remarkable. Based on a Stephen King novella, it is easily the best adaption from a written story ever put to film. Tim Robbin's certainly deserved an Oscar for this film, his performance was moving yet not overpowering. Even though the audience is left out of the story in certain parts, we still feel strongly for his character Andy Dufresne. Morgan Freeman is perfect, even though he's not the Irishman that was intended for the role. He narrates the film with ease and we connect to his character as if we were a part of the movie. Frank Darabont, director of the film, allowed us to feel what Andy was feeling through the use of small stories and camera shots. The immensity of the prison can be felt instantly from our first viewing. The connection the audience makes to the film as a whole makes The Shawshank Redemption what it is: one of the best films ever made.

Comment Head: only movie I've ever cried while watching.
If only there were more films like this
Comment Body: After watching useless film after useless film, I always come back to this. It acts as a benchmark and I must remind myself to watch it more as I find myself become more accommodating to the rubbish which is being released these days. How many films do you find yourself counting the minutes till the end or where the media has created a publicity storm to cloak the fact their film isn't worth the huge budget they spent on it? After watching King Kong at Christmas I felt depressed, as here was a truly bloated, poorly acted, lazily directed, piece of film which was getting rave reviews from the critics and public alike. Please feel free to argue against me, but the fact that so few are willing to state the obvious, that the film wasn't great, just alright at best, highlights a continuing trend in todays society, that of applauding mediocrity.

This film really got me. As soon as Morgan Freeman got into the movie, I started to get interested and the film ended up to be a crowd cheer and a tearjerker. The story is so well done. This movie is based on Stephen Kings short novel "Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption."Vice president of the Portland bank Andy Dufrane (Tim Robbins) goes to jail for two life sentences he did not commit. When he goes to jail, the first step onto the prison ground will change his life. When he's been beaten around by the queer bull Diamond brothers, he decides to wait a few years to escape. Before these years he decides to meet the institutionalized prisoner Red (Morgan Freeman) who can get Andy or other prisoners whatever they wanted. He can get you packs of cigarettes, jack hammers, naked lady cards, and posters of Rita Hayworth, Marilyn Monroe etc. Andy wanted a jack hammer to crack his wall. Red promised Andy that if the guards find his hammer, they will never do business again. Andy never got caught and Red and him both became friends for a long time. Andy became a big hit for the prisoners and the guards when he helped them with their tax problems. In exchange he got the prisoners beers. After he got the prison library to expand. That is most of what I can say about 'The Shawshank Redemption.'Why did this film not win any academy awards? I felt this film was a lot better than the brutally charged 'Pulp Fiction' than Tom Hanks life achievements as 'Forrest Gump.' This picture sees life more beautifully and more possible. This is a great luminous character study of fortitude and friendship behind bars at its finest.

Comment Head: You'd be Obtuse not to Appreciate This Fable

Comment Body: Every time I watch this movie Its like watching it for the first time. Everything about it works the characters the story and the direction. This movie should be number 1 on IMDb.com. Tim Robbins gives an excellent performance and Andy a man accused and sent to prison for killing his wife a man she was having an affair with. Robbins provides a subtle quality to his character which has a lot of depth though not entirely apparent on the surface you can tell it is there. Morgan Freeman Plays the character red as well as narration for the story. His voice provides a very powerful way of pushing the story forward which combined with an excellent score finishes off the movie and makes it a must see for anyone.

beautiful overhead shot of prison. Roger Deakins is a god. king has never been treated so soft or tenderly. dialogue is sentimental. Too so? yeah. music is smooth and sweet. the over-all posture stood is unexpectedly tough. green mile was a sad shadow of this previous vastly superior effort.the Brooks Hatlen interlude was a welcome beat. meandering is a virtue. i get lost in it's world for a sec. which is rare. the ending makes me cry. freeman is an exceedingly wonderful actor. strange feelings of elation near ending as if something has occurred. Things which haven't. magic of pure Hollywood-style cinema. samo

Comment Head: THE BEST MOVIE IN HISTORY ! If you like to see movies, go see this first !
No way does this belong in the top 250....
Comment Body: Shawshank IS a very good film but it has too many clich√© characters and situations AND script holes that one can drive a truck through. Gee, this must be from a Stephen King story. Actually, it's from two of his short stories. With King its often quantity and not quality. Despite that, The Shawshank Redemption is worthwhile.What this film does have is terrific performances from the entire cast and a sense that an honest man can remain honest, despite the worst of circumstances. The scenes with the great character actor James Whitmore, especially those of his trying to cope after his release, are very well done.The last ten minutes is splendid and almost redeems the rest of the picture. It gives this film an 8 instead of a 6 in my scale.

Comment Head: Get busy living get busy dying!

Comment Body: I simply cannot understand why this film is so highly regarded. I wanted to watch it because it had such a good write-up, was long, had great actors and sounded interesting. And it was... relatively interesting. But probably a slightly better than average film. Like 'The Green Mile' it should have been better. It was not emotional or harrowing enough. There was some silly part of the film that descended into a fiscal documentary!!!? 'Patch Adams' is much better. The most interesting theme was that prisoners become totally institutionalised and there were some good moments but overall it was a bit too clich√©d. It would have been better with a more satisfying finale and a cracking, string-led score from James Horner or Hans Zimmer.

This movie is the greatest prison movie I have ever seen. The storyline is original and the performance of Tim Robbins is superb. The movie is about Andy Dufresne is convicted of the double murder of his wife and her lover and tells the story of his double life sentence behind bars at Shawshank prison which uses religion as a form of rehabilitation. During his sentence he is bashed constantly for three years until he meets a fellow inmate Ellis "Red" Redding who is asked by Dufresne to help him escape. With his escape comes the signature scene as Andy escapes through the sewers to freedom. The end of the film highlights the ability of two friends to overcome adversity to achieve a central goal. The screenplay is superb as this is based on the novel by one of the best or the best horror of all time, Stephen King. The movie is a movie that explores the REAL story behind bars and the ability of people to escape mentally and spiritually with rehabilitation

Comment Head: One of the most thought provoking films I have ever seen.
Comment Body: Watched The Shawshank Redemption again this evening - what a wonderful story from beginning to end and. I was intrigued at the end of the credits to see that the film was dedicated to Allan Greene. Does anyone know who he was? I would be grateful for any information. I found the story within this film demonstrated the human feelings of despair,helplessness ; anger going on to forward thinking, planning and hope. Hope that a human being could overcome the corruption and cruelty by being a lot more clever than the those who only sought to deal in the destruction of the soul. The tenacity of a man able to withstand 20 years chipping away with a rock hammer in order to attempt freedom in a place where freedom was a word never even contemplated.

Comment Head: reismark's remarks about film, and "renting" versus library
Comment Body: I wholeheartedly agree with reismark's review of the film. It is excellent. I want to note, however, as the treasurer of a library system, that people should remember that rental and purchasing are not the only options. If you learn about your local libraries, you'll find that many of them, perhaps most of them, have collections of video on VHS and DVD which rival rental stores. In most instances, these materials circulate without charge, although some libraries charge a nominal fee to rent very recent titles. In the library system to which I belong, even rental titles are potentially available free, since we insist that there must be at least ONE copy in the system which circulates without a fee.

Comment Head: A Triumph of the Human Spirit
Comment Body: I saw this movie at the end of a particularly bad and miserable day in my life and it is safe to say that I was not particularly looking forward to this one.Two and a half hours later I was on my feet again and was once more prepared to look the world in the eyes. Such is the power of this movie.Tim Robbins plays a sincere man who is sent to to jail for a crime he did not commit. Inside, he meets extraordinary human beings, all of who you will fall in love with within minutes of meeting them. Chief among these is the character of Red, played by none other than the legendary Morgan Freeman.Together with Andy and Red you learn about life and friendship and the evils inherent in human nature. You laugh with them, are sad with them and feel their pain, and in the end, when the two friends meet again on a remote beach years later, you finally break down and cry with them.This movie is emotionally powerful and reminds us once again what the movies should be.It is not sentimental in any way, and that is a rarity these days. And if you do not feel sad, and your heart does not beat faster with Morgan Freeman's soliloquoy at the end, you cannot call yourself human. For, then, you have missed one of the greatests gifts one can receive: a passion for life.

This movie is perfect in construction, with just the right amount of feel-goodiness added but not so much as to make one wretch. A portrait of the strength of the human spirit, and the awesome power of hope. I love the feeling of hope that this movie inspires in the viewer. I haven't met anyone who doesn't love it (still awaiting the DVD's return as I lent it to a friend about 4 months ago!) The only negative comment I've ever heard about it is the ending. Some die-hards think the movie should end with Red in the coach on his way to find Andy, but not show their meeting on the beach as its too corny. I disagree. I think that after the whole battle to escape, and wondering if they will etc, people needed the closure that seeing them meet offered. If they'd hugged and cried that would have been too much for me, but it was done perfectly. With Red, casually strolling down the beach towards Andy and starting to laugh. I'm getting goose-bumps just thinking about it now.My favourite movie.

Comment Head: Get busy living. Or get busy dying.
Capra-esqe Prison Yarn A Huge Cult Hit
Without any thought, the best movie i have ever seen
Comment Body: One night when i was browsing through the channels and my dad was doing laundry. The Shawshank Redemption came up and he said it was one of his favorite films. I had no idea why until i watched it. The movies performances, specifically Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, are both incredibly complex and are both Oscar quality. The set of the prison and supporting cast and extras are all masterfully organized. The story is crisp and original, and has deep emotion to it. This movie received 7 Oscar nominations and won none, i believe because Forrest Gump stole all the thunder. But if it were my choice, The Shawshank Redemption would have won Best Picture and is in my mind the best film i have ever seen.

Best movie ever made. From the beginning to the end this movie is so perfect it's hard to put it into words, every little detail is stunning. Maybe my opinion is not the most objective because this has been my favorite movie for quite some time, but however, I remembered the first time I saw it. I could't get it of my mind for a couple of days. And still, after seeing it over 20 times, I often think about it and smile. The part when Andy escapes and the next 30 minutes after that you can't stop smiling, it's so perfect. The biggest star must go to Morgan Freeman who gives this movie even more deep and feeling. To everyone who haven't seen it yet, do it, you will not regret it.

Comment Head: average movie at best and full of clich√©s
Comment Body: why is this movie considered a classic....someone please make a reasonable argument to explain this.I've seen it several times and my opinion of it remains the same. nothing special about the direction,cinematography is only OK, acting is good, screenplay is inferior to an already average short story (film is nearly 3 hrs long....totally up its own anus) and it contains every prison film clich√© in the book. people like it because of its triumph over adversity theme (man winning against impossible odds, human spirit unbroken......zzzzzzzzzzzz) its been done b4 especially in Hollywood and much better (cuckoos nest).this AVERAGE movie has got to be near the top of the list of most overrated films ever made.

Comment Head: The Best Movie I've Ever seen
Comment Body: I was very impressed by this movie. At first I wasn't sure if I should rent it or not but I gave it a try and it is the best movie I've ever seen. The acting is very good, the plot very good, and just the right amount of drama, comedy, and sadness is included. The movie doesn't leave you wanting more like some OK movies, It finishes just how it should. After seeing this I guarantee you'll think the money was worth it. I would would definitely give this a 10 out of 10 hands down and judging by its excellent rating on this site, others share the same opinion. I personally wish I could see it again for the first time as it is just great! Enjoy!

I have to say that Shawshank is THE best film i have ever seen, it was recommended to me by a friend and i have been recommending it to all and sundry ever since. You simply haven't lived until you have seen this movie and although i loved every character in this movie, Morgan freeman definitely did it for me. It leaves you realising that after a long time in prison, it must be extremely intimidating to be set free in what is a crazy world and leaving a hard but familiar life behind. I have never been to prison and never want to but its quite an insight I'm sure to how you develop a routine and a life in there. If you only ever want to see one movie in your time then make this the one, if i was doing desert island discs, then this would be the movie i take with me without a doubt. And as for which movie actor i would take with me, well thats easy.....that has to be Morgan Freeman (Red) Cheers Sarah

This for me is the best movie of all time because it shows companionship through out the movie between the two main characters (andy and red). It's true to life with the little details of when it was set and the story was genius, great twist at the end when he reveals the hole in the wall, great stuff, your rooting for Andy the whole time as we all know he is innocent. He gets his revenge in the end by out smarting the person who over looks the prison, which for me is the best part of the movie. The three sister also shine a light on how desperate in mates can get, and Red shows the craft of an experienced prisoner smuggling small goods for the rest, he takes Andy under his wing and tells him moral after moral. Great movie, i can watch it over and over again, which, normally i cant with most long movies, but this is one movie that is something that little extra special. Watch it!!!!

Comment Head: Hope is'nt always the first step on the road to disappointment.
Comment Body: ***SPOILERS***This is a great movie that shows us that hope is a great thing. The story tells us about Andy Dufrense, a man who is falsely accused for killing his wife and her lover and who gets sent to Maines strongest prison. Shawshank. In Shawshank Andy gets new friends, as well as enemies. Being the wise man that he is, he begins to inject wisdom in people. Helping them. He also meets Ellis Boyd "Red" Redding. A man also accused for murder, but on true accusations. They become great friends and together they give themselves hope. This is a wonderful movie that leaves you happy and shaken. Its an must see.

Comment Head: Hands down, the greatest film ever

Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption. Somehow for Americans it was a difficult name for a movie to get used to. From the first time I saw it, I have never forgotten it. A story of hope, friendship, perseverance. Shawshank immediately struck a chord deep within me. I think many people that have seen it and rate it very highly, will share this feeling. I have always been a big movie-fan and to the question "which is the best movie ever", I could never give an answer without summing up some 3-4 different ones. But over the years my answer has become formed and now whenever I get asked that question I can honestly say "The Shawshank Redemption".

Comment Head: The best movie ever made. Period.
Comment Body: I don't know how many times I've seen this film, and it still is as entertaining as it's ever been. The directing is excellent. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are the best choices for their respective rolls, and the story makes you wonder why Steven King ever wrote a horror novel to begin with. Even the trailer to this movie is probably one of the best I've ever seen.This is one of those movies that I've unwittingly been recruited as a salesperson for. In other words, I feel I need to show this movie to all my friends and family who haven't seen it, and I'm more than willing to watch it again. If you love this movie as much as I do, then don't forget to watch the younger brother of this film, The Green Mile. Written and directed by the same crew. It's a great film, but has a lot to live up to.

Comment Head: A Film that will touch your soul
Comment Body: I read this novella in Stephen Kings "Four Seasons" while i was doing my GCSE exams. i remember then what a profound effect the story had on me. A story of hope through extreme adversity and the power of friendship that i thought could not be found between two men. The sheer anticipation of this film being released was almost heart stopping, but coupled with the fear it would not live up to my expectations. i also remember thinking that i did not want to see it for fear of it shattering my own perceptions of the two main characters, ANDY and RED. i need not have feared a thing.....the screenplay and adaptation was done with nothing short of pure brilliance. the camera work and choice of location could not have been more suitable. perhaps it is a symbol of how well Mr King writes that, it seems, everyones picture of everything is the same!!! Thus is was quite easy to choose sets, locations and of course actors. In the book, RED is a white, Irish man......against all odds, i cannot imagine ANYONE else delivering such a captivating, believable and utterly brilliant performance as Morgan Freeman. This man deserves 20 Oscars his acting together with the small stabs of narration are mind blowing who else could have done this?!! NO-ONE!! Tim Robbins IS ANDY!....his whole movement and attitude were exactly what King had written, this was encompassed in Robbins' portrayal perfectly. together the chemistry they had was beautiful, you could see that these characters were good friends, as well as the actors that played them. The visionary pieces of the film that will always linger? well the whole film lingers, such was the effect it had on me, but the two specific points in the film? Firstly, Andy described to RED where he could find a box, near a tree in a field, under some rocks to be exact. Now this bit is in the book (obviously!!) but i remember when i read it, the picture of that tree, in that field, next to that wall. In the film it was as if they had asked ME to choose the location, a chill went down my spine and it nearly brought me to tears!!! and i am NOT KIDDING!!!!. The second bit, well its right at the end, its the smile on RED's face when he sees ANDY again. This is not a feeble lip turning grin.....NO this is a full , both sets of teeth, cheek aching smile!!!! it IS the biggest and most emotional smile i have ever seen in any film. i could go on for pages about this film, i have been a film fan ever since i can remember, sitting with my father on a Sunday afternoon (before the times of VCR's or satellite, when you watched what was on that day or tough!!!) we watched films like "The African Queen", "Bridge on the River Kwai", "Citizen Kane", "The Rear Window", etc and from then i always liked a good film with a good story, The Shawshank Redemption was already a good story, it took genius to make it a GREAT film. to date i have seen it over 100 times. this has taken me through 3 copies on Video before the DVD came out, i am now on my 2nd DVD. if i have to buy another 100 DVD's it will always always alway be my number one favourite film of all time. It is a film you can watch at any time, when you are in any mood and it is still as compelling as the first time i saw it, or indeed the first time i read the story. 20 out of 10........

In the 11 years since the release and realization of the brilliance of this film, I'm sure many, many legions of people have written reviews that summarily praise (and viscously, ignorantly degrade - you know who you are, those whose reviews appear under the "hated" tag on the reviews pages) and criticize the movie. I can't add anything that hasn't been said before, except just say how much this movie affected me and how much I love it. Tim Robbins, always a great actor, and always very, very human. Morgan Freeman, c'mon, who da man? Who da MAN?!?!? HE DA MAN!!! He DA MAN!!! He DA smooth-walkin', smoother-talking', illest muthaf***in' epitome of "cool". And not a bad actor, either, heh heh (yes, I know I am drastically understating that fact). The direction - flawless. Every shot, every camera angle, every color tone (plus the quality of the film and the cameras themselves) embody such finesse, such power. Humanity! That's what the word I was looking for, the word that describes what every frame overwhelmingly emanates, even during the "brutal" scenes (I put "brutal" in quotes because I unfortunately have seen plenty of sick s@%* in my life and am now sadly desensitized to movie violence; violence on the news and in real life though, DAMN I get sickened and angered at perpetrators). The very human friendship twixt the leads are very well handled, never turning into cutesy schmaltz or soap-y melodrama. The writing. Yes, I know. "How the hell does his cell open up into a pipe drain? That's horrible plot!!!!!!" Ask yourselves: If his cell wall didn't open up over the pipe, would he have escaped? Would the story have been the same AT ALL if his cell opened up anywhere else other than that river of s@%*? And then think about Andy. Would someone of his intelligence would have discontinued his digging and succumbed to madness if what he saw when he looked through the initial tiny hole on the other side was anything other than a road to freedom? Convenient plot twist? Sure! But not outlandish. It could happen (not like a New York Cop winning a $4M lottery ticket and tipping a waitress half, no matter how much he wanted to get with her). Very good storytelling and very tight screen writing. This movie is great. Plain and simple. It did confirm one thing in general to me, though, especially in these times of moral conflict that is dividing the "greatest nation on the face of the earth" bitterly: Those who thump the bible the hardest, usually cling to it the hardest out of fear and out of guilt. Love this film.

This is simply a film that you would struggle to find a flaw with. The performances are wonderful, the story is involving and deep, the characters are likable and understandable, and the whole climax to the story is satisfying and rewards you for having stayed the course. It's funny, it's moving, and it presents an incredible perception on the ideas of hope, freedom and the vibrancy of the human spirit.If you haven't seen this film yet, then go out, rent a copy, and watch it. If you have a friend who hasn't seen it either, then invite them round - believe me, they'll thank you for it. This is one film that really is a must-see.

Another non-award winning movie that is consider one of the best movies ever made I loved this movie and can watch it over all the time Should have one best picture not just one brilliant but two brilliant performances by both Tim and Morgan this movie is great can,t say that enough but ill hold off if you haven't seen this movie your not a movie lover you don't know what your missing kind of like the fugitive in a sense but better another wrongly convicted person and treated horrible in prison pulls off a brilliant exit and learns a few things while in the pen underrated at the time now its rated under a movie it should be above a must watch movie.

Comment Head: Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things. And no good thing ever dies
Possibly the best movie ever created.
Comment Body: Once in a while a great movie is made. In 1994, Shawshank Redemption, went up against another giant, Forrest Gump. I personally feel if it weren't for the fan appeal in that year; Shawshank would of taken best picture. If it were to go up against any movie ever created then it would easily win. Shawshank includes many twists and is depicted in a very graphic and realistic way. Once again (like all good movies) the ending is what makes this movie. The actors were awesome and quite possibly could be the movie of the century. I really can't put this movie up against any other movie and should be #1 on the top 250 list. So please vote 10 because this movie really deserves it.

After seeing The Shawshank Redemption on television, I knew I had to see the whole film. It was incredible. After that I decided to read the book, and this is one of the rare times that a film outdid the book it was based off of. Even though the ending of the book was the same (poster, escape), the film just had a certain something to it that made it amazing. Tim Robbins ad Andy is extremely captivating and he almost entirely becomes the roll of a nobody. Not just any actor can do that. I can watch this movie time and time again and to me it will never get old. The music, dialouge, acting, and plot are award-deserving parts of a film that should go down in history as a classic.

Comment Head: Andy Dufresne brings hope to the Shawshank prison
Flat out one of the most jaw-droppingly amazing movies ever made.
Easier one of the greatest films not to win an Oscar for best film, a truly great film
Comment Body: Easier one of the greatest films not to win an Oscar for best film, a truly great film. Moegan Freeman was finally awarded his long overdrew Oscar in 2005. He was not far off receiving an Oscar for his stand out role as the inmate who befriends Tim Robbens character. I think it was Forrest Gump that it lost out to in 1994 when it went up for the Oscar. And to lose out to such a film in its own right is not something to be looked shamefully on. Had it gone up in the same catorgory since then it would have more have likely have won. You would be hard pressed finding a film that has been given more complements that this, but has never received the recognition it mot truly deserves

Simply put, this is more than a movie. Sit down in the dark one night and rediscover the magic of opening up the little tin box under the old oak tree. Listen to the sounds of the lady's from Italy as they send you on a journey of musical bliss. Go numb once more as the arm goes through the wall and you learn that 'ol Andy had some business on the side that even Red wasn't aware of. And lastly, see first hand on screen how two men can have a friendship that knows only the limits that they have been confident enough to set-up for themselves. Yes, this is more than a movie. No doubt about it. For what it is, it's as perfect as a movie can be. So start livin' and smell the salt from the warm ocean blue.

Very good movie that tells a good story.Life in early 1900's prison builds some strong friendships among the inmates. Daily prison existence takes its toll on you so you do what you have to in order to make it through. Inmates learn how to make the corruption work in their favor and take full advantage of it by building on the trust the guards have in the inmates.I don't think they could have come up with a better ending to the story than what they did. This movie is a masterpiece that you will find yourself watching any time you are in the mood for a good movie.Highly recommended film. Watch it, you will be pleased.

A true masterpiece, have seen the film many times and yet every time it gets better for me.. thats a true sign of a great film.its not all about the prison break, so people getting this film to see an Escape from Alcatraz movie will be disappointed.This film is about hope and so much more. Awesome acting, great soundtrack, and even better story thats unfolded in such a great way. I wish more movies would be like this.Get busy living or get busy dieing.this should be number #1 on IMDb, if you haven't seen it yet your missing a true classic

Comment Head: "The Shawshank Redemption" is at the top of my top 10.

Comment Body: The only way to summarize The Shawhank Redemption is with one word Incredible. This movie is beautifully told and magically shown on the screen. It will bring a tear to your eye and fill you with hope. Andy Dufresne is convicted murderer. He has to spend two life terms in Shawshank state prison. There he gets brutally gang raped and meets many friends including Red the guy who can get things. If you have never seen this movie then you must be crazy. This may be a prison movie but the only crime is if you don't watch it. I strongly advice you to see this movie especially if you are having hard times this will make you feel and think so much better. You have to see this movie!!! Andy triumphs over adversity in this heartwarming movie of love and friendship.

The shawshank prison is the movie telling us not to give up hope in any circumstances. This is about the Andy who escaped from the shawshank prison. He comes to a jail because he killed his wife and her lover. But he insists that he didn't. Andy meets red who have been prisoned for 20 years because of the murder. Andy never talks and gets along with other prisoners at first. He needs time to get accustomed to prison life. Andy becomes the financial adviser for the guard and at last for the noton, captain of the prison. He gets trust from the Noton and has better life in prison. One day, Tommy , a TV thief, comes into a jail. He says that he knows the real criminal who killed the two people. Being shocked, Andy ask Noton to have him rejudged in court. But Noton gets him solitary confinement because he is afraid of losing him as a financial manager. From that time he is gonna get ready for redemption from prison. Eventually he do make it. He makes the tunnel to the outside with a tiny hammer. I think the lesson from this movie is that man should not give up hope for the better life.

Absolute travesty that it lost the Oscar to feel-good trash like Forrest Gump.I like the fact that the Shawshank Redemption didn't bother tying up the loose end of the 'real' murderer remaining free. It was sufficient for Andy that he knew he did not commit the murders. He lived his life for the future, not for the past.There is something very touching about the scene where Andy does some financial work for one of the warders, and all the prisoners get beer as a result. He just sits back and smiles - and his unselfish act has such excellent consequences for him, both with his relations with the other prisoners, the 'sisters' and the guards.

Shawshank Redemption.. Where do I start..?By far, the greatest film ever made. My eyes were glued to it the whole way through. Amazing. It was so great to watch.. I loved it. The idea and storyline of the film is just such a good idea. Finally I've seen a decent prison-life film. If you have this stacked away in your cupboard and haven't watched it, make sure you do! It's a fabulous film and I recommend it to anyone who likes watching a mystery, drama or even people who enjoy a cry.Chris Harris Number 1 Shawshank Redemption Fan

I'll go out on a limb and say this is the greatest movie ever made. The first time you see this movie and are not aware of its "secret" it seems like an average movie, with a good plot and great acting. This is the rare movie that actually gets better the more times you watch it. I've seen it more than 30 times and I just never get tired of it. If you like movies about perservering in the face of adversity and never giving up, then this movie will definitely appeal to you. Be sure and buy the DVD so you can see the extras about the location and all the backstories related to the movie. It's well worth the price. The cinematography, the writing, the acting, the direction -- everything is brilliant. This is one case where the movie is actually far better than the book or short story.

Let me try. As a former Cop injured on the job in 1998 it's sometimes easy to despair. For many of us It's almost as if, we cannot see the blessings in our life unless they are taken from us or we lose them. This movie is about Hope. That's what makes this movie so special. there is a deep lesson in this film and like a work of abstract art, it's what you chose to take from it that makes it whatever it is. For me it's the message that no matter what, it isn't over till it's over. And to quote the film. Get busy living or get busy dying. That's a message. I'm going to try to live it out. Also the entire cast are incredible in their roles.

Comment Head: This is simply the greatest film ever made
Comment Body: This is simply the greatest film ever made. when you see this movie it will take to a place of where it is not just a movie but the greatest story ever told and some amazing directing by Frank Darabont, the acting is also great and it stays strong for the whole movie. This movie deals with personal encounters and problems the characters will face, on top of that it contains unforgettable dialog and some moments you will never forget, you will be truly moved by this movie and will wish it will never end. because this is my favorite movie of all time it was not hard to get in that place because of how great it was, i thought it was even better than the classic "The Godfather". this is a movie i will recommend to everyone who like movies movies because trust me you will love this.Morgan Freeman in my opinion is one of the greatest actors and has only won an Oscar for his work in Clint Eastwoods "Million Dollar Baby". I thought he should have won and ward here and for "Driving Miss Daisy". He has just recently been in the thrilling "Batman Begins" which the best out of the "Batman" franchise. Tim Robbins is a varied actor, I'm not saying his movies are either good or bad, what I'm saying is he can play any role like in "Bull Durham" he plays a cocky baseball player and in "Mystic River" he plays a disturbed family man. But when you see Freeman and Robbins together on screen it is something very special and in this situation it creates the greatest film of all time.Frank Darbont, the man behind "The Green Mile" and "The Majestic" wrote and directed this wonderful film adapted from the Stephen King Novela "Rita Hayorth and the Shawsank Redemtion". This is the best adapted King book, only a few others are that good, Stanley Kubricks thrilling adaptation of "The Shinig" and Darbonts "The Green Mile". frank Darabont does not drag on anything in this movie because not once did I get bored, you may think that there is not much that goes on in this movie but there is always something that is happening. At the beginning you think that Andy(Robbins) will not be able to last the first night, and you see Red(Freeman) and his friends making bets on who will freak out, to their surprise it is the fatty who freaks and Hadley beats him over the head which ends up killing him. After this Andy knows he is going to have to stand up for himself, he quickly becomes friends with Red but enemies with Heywood. Heywood and his friends would beat on Andy because he is the new guy. I wont say anything else about the movie because I don't want to give any spoilers. 10/10

The godfather was the best film ever made until I saw The Shawshank Redemption. The story, performance, sound, everything is amazing in this film, even though you ask yourself who is good and who is evil but it show us that revenge is a dish that tastes better when is cold. Tim Robbins is excellent. But Morgan Freeman ratifies as one of the best actors of all times, and of course Stephen King's story is at the same level of his best. Many people talk about this picture that never get one single Oscar and compares with many of those that won that prize. And why not to talk about Frank Darabont who gives us such a picture as the green mile. For me and many people is among the best films in all times.

When I first came across the title "Shawshank Redemption" I didn't have a clue as to what it was about, since I didn't know the plot. But it had Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman as it's stars, so I figured that it was worth a peek. What a peek!! This movie is awesome!! Not the classic tale of a innocent man being sent to jail for a crime that he didn't commit, this movie was much more detailed. It shows you how cruel prison life can be. (Although, if you want a better picture of prison life today, I suggest watching "American Me") You have everything in this picture, Corrupt Prison Warden, Sadistic Guards, and a innocent man caught in the middle. You can not help but admire Tim Robbins character "Andy Dufresne" as he waits patiently for almost 20 years before he is able to rectify his situation. Talk about patience and perseverance! This is one movie that will tug at your heart. Excellent movie.

Comment Head: Well made, well-acted, great story, but not one of the greatest of all time
Comment Body: I've been meaning to see this movie for several years now, having heard all the hype and comments rating this as one of the best films of all time. It certainly wasn't disappointing- despite the relatively slow pace compared to most brainless blockbusters of today and tendency towards sentimentality that crept up from time to time. It certainly wasn't one of the greatest of all films, in my opinion, either; simply an intriguing story, with something to teach us, perhaps, very well told and very well acted. It's probably a movie I'd watch again, though not straight away, as it is quite slow paced, and, just towards the end, I felt it was getting a little too drawn out. But it's very good to look at, there are some great performances, a nice musical score from Thomas Newman, and a great plot, with a wonderful twist at the end. So, overall this is a very good movie and one I would recommend.8/10

This is simply one of the greatest if not "the greatest" movie ever made. It's a beautiful story, presented excellently by Frank Darabont, and brilliant writing in the part of Stephen King.Even though this is a fictional story, it's so well presented, that you feel like you're a silent character in the film. You are made to feel like your're in the cast. You almost expect your name to appear in the credits. The character development was excellent, from the main characters played by Morgan Freeman, and Tim Robbins, all the way to "the sisters", Although we may not have liked them, we feel that we somehow know them and can relate to their specific plights. However it was done very well, because none of them overshadow the main characters, and the main plot of the film. Undoubtedly a Classic. Should be studied as long as film exists.

Shawshank Redemption was a brilliant film that was original and believable. It was a story that truly touched my heart, about friendship, survival, Hope and trust. The twists in the film were so unexpected, Andy was an Exceptional character that grew on me as the film progressed, the character Red helped to contribute to the originality and clever thought that formed this film. I thought using Morgan Freeman (Red) as a narrator was really a different idea. The director not only thought about the scenery but also used colours and lighting in the film very cleverly The director of this film definitely deserves a pat on the Back!!! All together we give this film 10/10 I definitely recommend It!!! Sedge n Melissa.

I have to give this Film Credit, Defiently when credit is due. This Was an outstanding film. The history of this film was that it actually was taken off of short story from Steven king. and as I'm not a great fan of Steven King. I would say this movie is like a Flower that grown out of dirt. The Story is about a man. and the power that hope can achieve. In jail he accomplished things and hardships no man should suffer. he triumph in goals and achieves without deferring. and he never gave up hope. It took us on a roller-coaster and in the end it showed us that miracles can blossom where you would never expect it. It was a beautiful and it deserved a lot more then it ever got.

Comment Head: Hopeful: A Classic with a Fair Share of Flaws
One of the greatest films ever made
Comment Body: I didn't see this movie in the theaters when it came out. I had never been a big Steven King fan, and it just didn't catch my imagination. A friend brought the video over one night for us to watch it, and MAN! I was blown away. The theme of the movie is hope, and what hope, and the lack thereof, does to people. This is truly one of the most uplifting films which I think was ever made.I thought that everything in the film clicked. The acting, the direction, the cinematography, the music, all were perfect. I have read some posts where people don't like the ending, but I think the regressing shot of the two friends is right on; you see the culmination of the struggle to be free for both men, yet it's not in your face sappy.As far as the best scene, I would have to say it's a three way toss-up:1: The aria scene 2: Brook's suicide 3: Red in the wheat fieldI probably pull the DVD out once a month or so to watch this gem. JRW

Comment Head: They don't get much better than this
Comment Body: This movie is simply outstanding and is one of the best if not the best I've ever seen. Its my joint 3rd favourite with Darabont's other great king adaptation The Green Mile and Seven. This movie is flawless on every level. The key to it though is possibly the greatest ever script ever written by Darabont, and truly outstanding acting from Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. No need to go into the plot. This movie is all about hope and will inspire you to do anything. The brilliant ending is definitely the best i've ever seen and brought a tear to my eye. Watch this movie whenever your happy or sad. It doesn't matter. The film will give you so much hope and happiness. It really is that brilliant. In fact i'm watching it now.WATCH IT NOW 10/10- Probably the greatest movie ever made

This is by far my favorite movie of all time.How do I know this is it with so many other good movies out there? I thought along before I came to the conclusion. My basis..every time, yes, every time the movie is on T.V. I stop and watch it and love every minute of it over and over.I still get tears in my eyes when the movie ends. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins are wonderful in the movie.I think everyone knows but this is one of those rare movies that was really good that is based on a Stephen King book.This is a must see feel good movie!

Lord of the Rings:ROTK and Godfather are amazing films but the fact that Shawshank Redemption wasn't noticed as well as them is the reason i think this film is third and not first in the ranking.shawshank Redemption is a film that never won an award yet remains one of the best film ever. It is the most rented video and most sold video to this day and so it should be.To sum up this film its a prison drama with twists and turns and very strong relationships, its got everything you ever want in a film and then some, I urge people to watch this film if they haven't already.10/10

I loved this movie and have watched it over 50 times in a 2 year period; I believe it should have won an academy award, but its my guess that the "bull queer" scenes removed any chance of that. The dialog between Andy and Red was spellbinding at times and the interplay between them and the other guys in their clique made it seem like being in prison could be enjoyable. My wife hated the movie because of the scenes containing violence and I have to admit that some of them could have been left out, the movie really didn't need them to be successful or appear real. I originally thought I would hate this movie and didn't see it till it was on HBO TV. The other movies that come close to being most watched are Titanic and a comedy called Midnight run.

The Shawshank Redemption is an attractive film which tells friendship, hopes and dreams, Calm psychology, unyielding fighting will, wise and resourceful design , spirit working with perseverance of leading man in the film are very moving. Shawshank dared to struggle with unfair destiny and crime. Later he exposed the crime. He met how great difficulty did not surrender. I admire his courage and intelligence very much.This film which can move my heart is offer people to hope from start to finish¬°¬¢This film reveals the shady deal of the administration of justice and expresses many philosophic theory of life. Let me know: The powerhouse saves oneself. Generally speaking, this is a good film that is worth sampling repeatedly.I wish that can appreciate more similar successful films in the future.

Comment Head: The most brilliant movies I have ever seen
there is hope, there is success
Comment Body: After I enjoyed the movie that was the best one I had ever seen,my first feeling was that there is hope, there is success.Indeed,hope has a very great impact on us.When Andy was put in the prison for the rest of his life,he do not give up like other prisoners.Because in his mind there was a hope that one day he could resume his freedom. Just as Andy said"get busy living or get busy dying."So, Andy pay off in the end.Spending 19 years to dig a hole from which Andy escaped was not an easy thing, even to my surprise,his tool for digging the hole was a very small hammer--incredible!From this ,we can see that how great hope is on a person.During the long period of 19 years, Andy suffer from lots of pain,however,the powerful brief and hope made him stick to the end.I believe a person without his hope is impossible to manage it. This movie made me know that in our real life,one must have hope,especially,when he is in trouble.There is a very famous saying that fits it:No pain,no gain.

I like Andy to put ¬°¬∞Marriage of Figaro¬°¬± of MOZART very much. The holy and pure and loud and sonorous soprano wears clouds and split the silks are frozen by people who are confined firmly long. They may not know what music it is, is to the beautiful feeling, to free aspiration, everybody is the same. People look up and look at the dark blue boundless sky, the beautiful sincerity drifts with the wonderful harmonious sounds everywhere, the lens rises slowly, has shaken, all living things resume and look up at on the square, so absorbed, then with deep feeling, there is no wicked to the extreme criminal, it have it is the brutal have unless prison of conduct the alert, have the equal and harmonic in involution people, what people last existence of life very much to and origin. Andy has got drunk in music and Andy has forgotten one's own private danger that puts the music on. He closes the eye to hark on the prison warden's chair happily. Later, what he was imprisoned for fortnight imprisoned alone. It is this feeling; keep the hearts of convict and visitor forever.

When i first heard about the Shawshank redemption i was dubious because i have not really been interested in prison films. Once i had watched it i immediately went and bought the DVD. I must have watched this film dozens of times (which is very unusual for me). The acting, story-line, scenery where all amazing and when the subject of favourite films is discussed my friends and family most people have the Shawshank Redemption as there favourite or at least in their top 3. Morgan Freeman and Tim Robins are perfect as the lead characters and you become so absorbed in there characters. Thoroughly recommended as this is a classic.

Perhaps the best movie ever shot, as evidenced by its rating of #3 on IMDb's top 250 list. This movie is so good, my words will do it little justice, but alas, I will try. The music: perfect. The actors: Morgan Freeman in his best role, in a word perfect. The pacing: its long, but this accurately portrays the idea of time in prison. The theme: wonderful, and inspiring at every viewing. If you have not seen this movie, you must. You will not regret it. The "Shawshank Redemption" is the most overlooked movie in history... this movie should have won a number of Oscars, among other awards. It is just that good. Go rent it, buy it, borrow it, whatever, just see it!

Comment Head: Quite simply the greatest film ever made.
Comment Body: Frank Darabont's "The Shawshank Redemption", starring Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, is the greatest film ever made in Hollywood. Plain and simple. The film tells the involving story of two prisoners at Shawshank Prison, and their decades together under the thumb of a cruel warden and his henchman. Andy (Tim Robbins, never better) is an innocent man, who uses his accounting skills to make himself useful to the warden, and struggles to keep up hope, against the counsel of his fellow inmates. Red (Morgan Freeman, astonishing) thinks hope is a dangerous thing, and is an institutionalized man, who can't imagine life outside of the prison walls. The film also stars Bob Gunton, Clancy Brown, William Sadler, and, in a powerful performance, James Whitmore. I'll say no more, because this film must be seen to be understood.

Comment Head: A monumental achievement in film history, Argubaly, the greatest movie ever.
Comment Body: This movie has it all. The screenplay, direction and dialogue are all first class. No movie comes near it. The speeches, Morgan Freeman's acting...my oh my, just brilliant, absolutely brilliant. The movie shows how crucial it is for us human beings to live in a world of hope, and not in fear. As he says in the movie, "...so beautiful, it can't be expressed in words, some things are best left unsaid"...that line is very true of this masterpiece. I will say no more, but just bow down to possibly the GREATEST movie that there was, there is, and there ever will be!

Comment Head: what an exciting film it is!
Comment Body: It's the most impressing movie I've ever seen.I saw it coincidentally but was shocked very much by Tim and Morgan's acts.Especially at the end of the movie,I am aware of what is hope and how one can keep his mind alive.Is there anything more difficult for a single person to dig a hole through a wall in a jail within 19 years?We always consider it as one out of ten films that men have to see in his life(certainly it's on top).It's very pity that the Academy Reward neglected it,Tim should win all awards in 1994.Although few people have heard it before but if one is asked to see it ,he is surely very fond of it and thinks it is the best .I believe that Redemption will stay as long as I live on my mind.

Comment Head: The Best Movie ever made, "Ain't No Doubt About It...."!
Comment Body: One of those very rare movies, that even though you may have it on DVD or tape, you'll still stop and watch the WHOLE movie to the very end if you find it playing while 'channel surfing'. I, like everyone else I know, found out about this movie from someone else; I did not see this at the movies. So, I rented it and was (like everyone else apparently) blown away by this true cinematic masterpiece. Over the past ten years my wife and I have probably seen the movie a couple of dozen times each. If someone out there needs a 'pick-me-up' movie' (we ALL do sometimes!), then this is YOUR movie. It's always guaranteed to always remind one that "Hope is a Good Thing...."

This is by far one of the best movies made. It talks of hope, patience, the will to prove the truth and above all, friendship. Andy's fight with hopelessness and the tragedy that he is forced to face is truly inspiring. Not once do we see him beaten down by the situation. He not only saves himself but also puts back new life into the likes of Red and Tommy. A few scenes like the time when Andy plays the music over the loudspeaker, "Brooks was here, So was Red", the climax are all unforgettable. The dialogues and the performances are flawless. Andy is wrongly accused of killing his wife and her lover. He ends up in Shawshank, a place where a normal being would succumb to the helplessness. But Andy fights it out. The "change" Andy brings about in the situation in Shawshank is probably impossible. The story is narrated by Red, Andy's best friend inside and later. Truly, an amazing movie!

Comment Head: No matter how you slice it, it's the best movie ever....
Comment Body: I am a movie buff, seen just about all the classics, new and old, but Shawshank is number 1. I think LOR attempts, in a much more complicated manner, to deliver a similar theme - hope even in the most bleak of times. Shawshank delivers this message even more effectively than LOR, and crystalizes the message of hope as the single most important thing in our lives, even more than love. Many of us do not have love in our lives - but hope makes us continue, search for a better life, a better day. I like to put it this way, nothing ever good in this world ever came from quitting, giving up. All that is good in this world, came through persistance, hard work, determination.....hope. No other piece of movie making has ever reflected this message better than The Shawshank Redemption.

Eight or nine times now I have marvelled at this masterpiece. Every character is right on the money, the main performers especially Freeman are simply outstanding. However it is the smaller characters like Brooks and Heywood that add the subtle ingredients that most pictures miss out on. The story of redemption is an old one, the performances and soundtrack to say nothing of the grimy screenplay lift this way above the genre.
