It is almost impossible to pick a highlight, but perm from the Mozart scene, the bottle of suds, the letter from Brooks and the denouement and you have a cocktail of perfection. It is adult, it is moving and it is hugely satisfying, everyone should see this at least once and the fact that it bombed at the box office first time round says more about the audiences and press reviews than the movie itself. It should have won 7 Oscars, but who cares they are a plastic Hollywood manifestation, for anyone with an ounce of taste this is the finest movie of all time, by a mile.

I honestly don't know what it is about this movie. I've seen it somewhere around 40 times and I never tire of it. If I'm in the middle of watching something else and I happen to see that Shawshank is on again, I'll completely forget about whatever else was on and stay glued to this one.It was the first DVD I ever purchased and I picked up the anniversary the moment it was released. It's always good to have a backup copy in case I wear out one of them.The actors did an absolutely splendid job in this one. Tim Robbins was absolutely brilliant. Morgan Freeman played the best Irishman I've ever seen on the screen. All of the smaller player were just excellent. And all of this from a 'prison' movie.Hope, friendship, life ... what a story.

Comment Head: A story that holds onto hope in the the face of hopelessness.
Comment Body: I picked this up on video seven years ago. The movie bombed in the UK. The story inspires hope, whether your male or female. The rich characterization is skillfully handled by Robbins and Freeman. Darabont's script sets up quite a gripping visual antagonism that wholly rewards the audience with a feel-good ending. It made me weep, time and again. And when you lose hope the film's portrayal of redemption over adversity can lead to your own redemption. The power of the visual and the word of hope make this a great film. It has already spurned the box office in favour of the people. It is more than just a commercial venture it is a damn good yarn that provides inspiration to those who need it. It is the William Blake of scripture, dividing heaven and hell, and the corruption of good. My video copy wore out earlier this year so I'm happily in possession of the 10th anniversary DVD. Best movie in 75 years. Buy two copies your sure to get one stolen.

don't get me wrong. i am 100 percent GUY. just as this is my first topic and comment in this forum. i just wanna devote my FIRST time to my favourite film. fancy seeing everyone here, and happy to be your FRIEND( have you ever seen "FRIENDS?). i don't want to talk something about this movie. you see, i am just a newbie here, i don't want to be snob in your eyes. all i have known about film is only it is good or not. i cant say much about it. anyway , give me a hello if you like. oh, it looks i could stop here. morethan 10 lines....OK, over. by the way, how will Andy go out if his cell isnot at one side?

I have seen this movie several times, and love it. I even own the VHS. It wasn't until today that i realized that it is very similar to a story from the Christian Bible, specifically, the Gospel of Luke, chapter 18, verses 1-8. The story of the Unjust Judge and the persistent widow. The prison warden is the Unjust Judge. Red is the widow, so is Andy in many cases. But, most importantly, Andy is the example of persistence and faith. It was not prayer or faith in God that he exemplified in the movie, of course. But, it was persistence in his innocence, in digging through the sandstone for so many years, in gaining his freedom. Persistence in getting books for the library to the benefit of self and so many others. He had faith, he had persistence. And who says the Bible doesn't relate to real life today?

Comment Head: How can you be so obtuse as to not think this is the best movie ever?

Comment Body: I would by lying if I had to rate this film less than 8/10 but then if I was asked "what's so great about it?" I would have to reply "well, nothing really - it's just a good film".I very much doubt that anyone who looks critically at movies can really see this as anything more than a really good made-for-TV movie. It's like the Bjorn Borg of movies: you can't fault it but what else is there to it?We need more "McEnroes" and "Agassis" with flair and style which go beyond what we expect from movies that are simply good.Mungflesh Factor 8/10

Comment Head: Will this film stand the test of time?
Comment Body: The criteria for a classic film to become timeless is very simple. It must speak to every generation that comes in contact with it. Films like the The Wizard of Oz and Gone With the Wind, both which were released in 1939, have obviously aged well. The Wizard of Oz, like The Shawshank Redemption, was not an immediate success and yet it grew an audience. The Shawshank Redemption is a well told story that seems to connect with people on a basic level. It has also subsequently grown in viewership in its first decade. It will be very interesting to see how it fares 50 years from now. Will this film stand the test of time? Will this film always remain a favorite among audiences?

Its interesting to read the comments on this movie. I don't think any film has polarized users as much as this one has. Almost 53% gave it a 10! 10 is perfection in cinematography, acting, screenplay etc. This movie is not perfect. Granted it tells a heartwarming story and is entertaining enough, so I charitably gave it an 8 and I think that's fair. Is this movie the second best of all time? NOT! I think 53% of the voters have been blinded by the redemption scene and the twist at the end, sure it was neat but check your warm n' fuzzies folks. Other movies that are overrated at IMDb because of a neat twist at the end are The Usual Suspects and The Sixth Sense. A twist does not make it Perfect.

This movie has always fascinated me and I have always counted it as one of my favorite movies if not the favorite. I was pleased therefore to find it #2 at IMDb top rated movies of all time. No matter how hard I think I can't really find much fault with it at all. Characters, main and secondary, are all fantastically well played, the plot unfolds at just the right tempo, the surroundings are as realistic as it gets etc etc. The whole movie, though set i a prison with all the violence and dreary atmosphere it brings, still left me with a positive feeling afterward. It's the kind of movie that doesn't leave you, you remember it over and over again with a smile on your lips. 10/10Cyberik

Comment Head: Watch it, you won't be sorry!
Comment Body: To be honest, this is ABSOLUTELY my favorite film!! Frank Darabont (director) did really great work. The film has absolutely NO violence, but it isn't boring at all!!! The dialogs are perfect and the music is wonderful!!!So, a big compliment to Frank Darabont, who is also the director of Misery, which is also written by Stephen King.And then, last but NOT least, there are the actors Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman. They're acting so convincingly, you'll never forget them. So, if you would ask me, I give 10 stars of 10!P.S : I'm sorry if you find some mistakes in my English grammar, but i'm a beginner ;-).

Comment Head: my favorite movie of all time
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption fills me with joy and hope every time I watch it, which must be well over a few dozen times now. Tim Robbins' acting is excellent as the emotionally repressed banker in jail but Morgan Freeman, who is consistently superb in all his roles, carries the weight of this movie's intelligently uplifting spirit, its pathos, warmth and humanity. Freeman narrates the story and it's his rich voice that details the life in jail and with his majestic, patient compassion adds color to what otherwise might have felt abjectly bleak. Whenever I feel down I watch this movie for inspiration. This is the sort of movie I think people of all ages can enjoy, many times over, seeing it with new eyes at different times in their lives.

Currently, on the IMDb top 250 Movies of All Time list, the top two movies both hold ratings of 9.0. Of these two, "The Shawshank Redemption" has roughly twenty thousand more votes in its favor. Ergo, I do believe that "The Shawshank Redemption" should finally ascend to its rightful place on this web-page, and hopefully cinema history, as the Greatest Film of All Time. That having been said, I wish now to give my own thoughts on this film, thoughts which will be hitherto corrupted by myriad spoilers.The acting is astounding. Tim Robbins as Andy Dufresne delivers the perfect combination of hope and despair, so that you can love his character without ever truly knowing what he shall do next. Morgan Freeman brings subtlety and depth to a character who would perhaps otherwise be much simpler. Bob Gunton allows you to genuinely fear Warden Norton, and if James Whitmore's performance does not make you lachrymose, nothing can.The plot is beautiful, describing the redemption of many an inmate. Red, though he does not escape institutionalization, becomes a good man. Tommy Williams does the same. The best of all endings however, is Andy's, as he goes through so much to come out clean in the end, something expressed both allegorically throughout the story and literally at the end.The greatest film I have ever seen.

I enjoyed this film because it shows the way I believe our Judicial system should be;tough, and stern. The two main characters,Red and Andy, form a friendship bond that carries them through the ordeal of prison life. They stick together and help one another.The great scene I enjoy, is when Red comes up for parole and the last time, they set him free. The officials may have thought He served his time enough, and He was older anyway.Red gave a great speech, how he regretted what he did and was very sorry.When he said he would "talk some sense" into that guy who committed that crime,I think that moved the officials to change their minds.Morgan Freeman is wonderful in this film and I love Robbins' performance,here.

There are some movies that come along that truly make a difference in cinema and in peoples lives. In my opinion, this is one of those films.***spoilers*** (minor)The movie is about a man wrongfully accused of a crime. He is sentenced to life in prison. He ends up at Shawshank. A prison with a lot more going on than what shows on the outside.There are quite a few things that make this film a masterpiece. One is the story and its qualities and values. Another is its amazing acting by all cast members in the film. The music was great and the cinematography is creative. I don't believe there's a flaw in this movie.11/10 haha!

Comment Head: The Best Film from a Stephen King Novel
Arguably one of the greatest movies of all time and an absolute classic.
Comment Body: Superb acting and brilliant performances from Tim Robbins (Mystic River) and Morgan Freeman (Million Dollar Baby), who play as inmates, Tim Robbins playing a man framed for the murder of his wife and the man who she had an affair with. The two inmates develop a friendship over the twenty odd years spent in the prison.This movie portrays an ugly, though bearable life in prison through the 40s, 50s, and 60s.It's a strong piece on how far one will go to redeem himself, even if those things that must be redeemed are not by any means loathsome. See it if you haven't.

Comment Head: The truth set him free! (Spoilers in solitary confinement)
Comment Body: Morgan Freeman as Red was truly inspired (even if the original story had a white guy), they even used his son for the photo of the inmate as a young man...Tim Robbins as Andy DuFresne was marvelous understatement, Clancy brown as the on/off guard-friend of Andy was a good touch and a boost for his career apart from Starship Trooper... Now, Clancy is in HBO's "Carnivale" series and has his own website! As for the warden and "sisters,"  they were equally well-cast and the plot of the movie flowed despite what fan-sites may or may not nit-pick about.It is a tribute to perseverance and determination combined with patience and retribution couched in careful long-term planning that any true financial head is accustomed to (remember, Andy was a Bank Manager, that knowledge saved him more than once)...Justice sometimes comes from beyond the law if you can wait long enough! This picture is second after "Casablanca"!!

Comment Head: This could be the best one
Comment Body: When a movie makes you feel passionate and caring about murderers and thieves, you know you are watching a good one. The Shawshank Redemption may very likely be the best movie i have ever seen. Not only because of the mentioned fact, but because it has the every basics a good film needs. No movie making mistakes really are found through my eyes. This movie is rough, sad or even happy at moments. It makes you feel like you were there experiencing what the characters do. Superb acting by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman and Frank Darabont's direction too. The Screenplay is not really by any way too predictable and from the first two minutes you know you are watching something special. I really can't of any movie that beats this one...

Comment Head: No matter what rating it got !

Comment Body: A film I can watch over and over again - great storyline, beautifully filmed, top-notch acting - I always feel good about myself after watching it - there's hope for us all, even the most downtrodden nonentities in this miserable world of ours! cinematic brilliance. Tim Robbins plays the lead character's role with such a classy understatement, & Morgan Freeman delivers a powerful and nuanced performance that always lifts my soul as well as the great performance by all the supporting actors. I will be the first person to admit to having a slight eclectic taste in films, but this still ranks as one of my favourite films of all time. This truly is my definition of cinematic brilliance - pity we don't get more films like this anymore.

Overall, this is one of the finest films I've ever seen. Frank Darabont's masterful screenplay rendering of Stephen King's marginal novella brought every possible human emotion into play. And, every actor in the film did a superb job of translating this fiction into a believable reality.On a scale from 1 to 100, I'd rate this movie a solid 99. Only one thing was lacking in the film to raise that score to 100 ... but this is just a personal thing.POSSIBLE SPOILERS FOLLOWS:During his time in prison, Andy Dufresne learns the identity of the man who killed his wife - a man named Elmo Blatch. And, he learns enough information about Blatch to render him "trackable" by an investigator. If 2 brief scenes had been added to the film, I'd have rated it a perfect film:ADDED SCENE #1 - Shortly before his escape, Andy is seen talking to another inmate who gives him contact info for a person on the outside who does contract murder.ADDED SCENE #2 - Shortly before Red's release from prison, we see him reading a newspaper story on the murder of an ex-con named Elmo Blatch.Between the time of Andy's escape and Red's release, there would have been ample time for Andy to hire a private eye to track down Blatch and, afterward, hire a contract killer to kill him. Had I been Andy, I'd not have felt truly free of the suffering I'd endured in prison unless I knew the real killer got his just due. What Andy did to the Warden and Hadley is all well and good. But Blatch's death would settle all scores once and for all.

Comment Head: It Will Alter You In Some Way
Comment Body: The finest movie ever made, no question. If you can sit through this and not be moved by the sheer power of the story, performances and imagery you are not of this earth. I had already read the Stephen King short story so the ending was no surprise but, guess what, it didn't matter ! That was just the cherry on top of a supreme masterpiece of chocolate cake. This is the current yard stick by which all other movies should be measured against. The basic foundation of the film is so strong that all the other parts must have dropped into place with ,seemingly, effortless ease. Hopefully one day something better will come along that will shift the goal posts once again. But for now, The Shawshank Redemption is a more than worthy No. 1 on IMDb.

Although the acting and directing was brilliant, the movie retained a somewhat unrealistic vibe. There is a very low chance that one will find as many civilized friends and people in a maximum security prison. There was no sign of any violent or aggressive behavior in many of the inmates. The only thing that reflected real prison life were the cells and the sisters. Do not take this wrong. I loved the movie immensely. It showed great imprisonment and in many ways was realistic. The acting from Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman was perfect. The institutionalization of Brooks was very well portrayed. This movie had many great factors but not completely perfect. Overall I give this movie a 8.5.

Spoiler My opinion is that this movie is the best movie ever made (next to gangster,mob movies which would over all be my favorite) But the Shawshank Redemtion is a kickin movie that i could watch everyday i love the characters and the whole theme of the movie i love the sets and everything its so real it puts you right there in prison and it shows you that prison is no fairy tale. the lighting is great i just love everything about this movie, at the beginning when andy gets convicted for a crime that he didn't commit and he was sent to jail for it you kind of feel sorry for the guy but at the end when he breaks out and he is living in his dream place you don't feel so bad for the guy after all you kind of feel like it was all worth it for him

I have seen this movie dozens of times and thoroughly enjoy it each time. I've seen people commenting that this is simply a remake of an earlier film, and I don't see how one can come to that conclusion. The original work was in the form of a novelette by Stephen King, part of the book "Different Seasons." You may also remember the movie "Stand By Me" which was adapted from that same book. Being that I am a fan of King's work, I originally had high hopes for this movie. Often I am disappointed after having read a book and then going to see the film version. Not so in this case. The filming location was here in Mansfield, Ohio, and the Reformatory used for much of the filming is an historical site which offers tours (it is also rumored to be haunted, but you can believe what you wish.)

To me this is one of the best films ever to grace the big screen, it has the lot. I have seen the green mile as well but this film stands shoulders above it, It made me laugh, shed a tear and smile from ear to ear, its truly a magnificent piece of cinema magic and i recommend this film to everyone. Stephen King knows how to write suspense and horror and Frank Darabont knows how to direct. The characters are brilliant and there performances a sight to behold, Morgan freeman is brilliant as the man who can get you anything (in my eyes this is his finest performance as an actor) The music as well adds to feel of the film and makes it an absolute pleasure to watch.I think the film will appeal to anyone and will carry on being a classic for many many years to come, i don't think i have seen a film that has meant so much to me, it makes a change to watch a truly awe inspiring, golden film such as The Shawshank Redemption instead of the normal Hollywood action flick.

Comment Head: What this film means to me (Spoilers)
Comment Body: I first saw this movie when Channel 4 showed it in the UK in September 2001. I had just come back from a wonderful holiday in Ohio, USA and had never heard of this movie before. I just happened to flick to channel 4 and caught a glimpse of Morgan Freeman watching Tim Robbins make his entrance into Shawshank. I had missed the opening scene with the court case. My first impressions was that this was going to be a typical prison drama but I reached for the TV guide and read more about it. It starred Morgan Freeman who I remember from Along Came a Spider and Deep Impact and Tim Robbins who I have heard of but never seen on screen before. The TV guide gave it a good rating and review so I thought i might continue to watch it.In the opening scenes, I predicted possible rivalries between Andy and Heywood, however I was glad this was not the case as both characters became well-liked throughout the film. I even thought there would be tension between Andy and Red, but I was delighted that they became best friends throughout the movie. Along the way, I found the movie becoming interesting with many plots running alongside each other and beautiful photography. I held my breath when Hadley almost threw Andy off the roof and Morgan Freeman's story telling was first rate. Another scene that moved me was Andy playing the Mozart record and giving hope to all prisoners in Shawshank. I even went out to buy the fantastic soundtrack with the song as well as the superb score by Thomas Newman. I must say I was concerned when Andy got in trouble for that stunt, as I thought eventually the warden was going to help him solve his case. All the characters gave memorable performances and I was moved by Brooks taking his own life as he couldn't cope on the outside. I was shocked when Tommy revealed Andy's innocence and equally curious when the warden refused to help him. Nothing prepared me for the way Andy escaped, I was so glad he did but felt for Red at the same time. I was thrilled when Red got his parole and just hoped he didn't feel institutionalised like Brookes. I thought Red blew it when he talked up to the parole board but had a chuckle when he finally left Shawshank. Other moving scenes were Red reading Andy's letter and making his way through the fields surrounded with grasshoppers. The scene that took my breath away the most, was the shot of the bus as it made its way along the road with the brilliant sunlight, it looked just like the area where I had just come from in Ohio, as well as Red and Brookes in Main Street, Mansfield which I recognised. This film is long, but it certainly didn't seem that way to me, it is a movie you wish would go on for a bit more longer. I was stunned at the end, very moved, very happy and almost in tears. This film is truly a work of art, probably the finest movie ever made with superb acting from all of the characters, beautiful music, cinematography and so much better than the novel it is based on. I cannot believe it did not win any Oscars despite many nominations. It gives the viewer a sense of hope, happiness and satisfaction all in one and anyone can see this movie whatever mood they are in. The movie is also funny, who can forget Hadley with his, "if I hear anything more than a mousefart..." or Tommy explaining when he got arrested and had to drop a TV set. This movie makes you feel great to be alive and as Red says this movie is "so beautiful it cannot be expressed in words". I bought the DVD for my family to watch and their stunned silence at end confirmed my suspicions that they loved this movie too.Shawshank Redemption is going to be re-released in the UK in September and I would encourage anyone who hasn't seen it before to go and see it and hopefully feel the same way I felt when I first saw this movie. There is so much to appreciate about this movie and everytime I see it again, I love it even more.

A wonderfully made movie. The best thing about movie is it never looses its pace. Neither it gets fast nor it gets slow... Rightly placed at #2 on IMDb.Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman makes a great pair in the movie. Villain, Bob Gluton, the Jailer performs his role very well. "Hope is good thing, probably one of the best thing, and no good thing ever dies" is the central theme of the movie according to me. Calm, Placid banker Andrew Dufresene lives his life with hope without loosing his temper. and that's the movie is all about. Frank Darabont did an amazing job adapting from Stephen King's short story, and he deserves as much praise for it as possible. Nobody, not even my favourite writers such as the Coen brothers of Quentin Tarantino (partly for the fact that the first only writes comedies and the latter only fares in blood spatter) could have achieved this amazing script, which completely uplifts and spellbinds the viewer.

Comment Head: One of the best films of the 90's, my 9th favorite film!!
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is without a doubt one of the best film's of the 90's. Morgan Freeman has another outstanding performance just like he had in Glory. The plot was as good as ever along with the dialouge. The music was nice and the atmosphere in the film felt like it was in the 40's, 50's, and 60's. Beautiful full of triumphant acting. This is Frank Darabont's best movie, even better than The Green Mile which I also though was really good. This is one of the most recommended films of the 90's and you definitely will enjoy it. I mean come on guys, it even got in the 250 movies of all-time with a 9.0 and it got #2. Excellent film!!10/10!!

Well what can I say about this modern day classic that hasn't been told already. It seems that most of us who have been lucky enough to watch this gem have been profoundly moved by this story. Not hearing anything about the release of this film in '96, I rented this out without any idea what to expect, other than it was a prison drama. Now I love prison flicks and my favourites are Brubaker, Birdman of Alcatrez and Stir Crazy, but after watching Shawshank Redemption I can say this is one of the best films ever made, and one of the very few movies that made me cry, and it takes a lot for me to shed a tear. I think the last time I cried was at my grandpas funeral, but that was a different emotion to the one I felt watching the Shawshank Redemption. The ending was filled with a great deal of satisfaction and hope that you rarely get in any film today. If you want to watch a film that has a story that covers human survival, struggle, bonding and hope and want to be uplifted than this is the one to watch.

Comment Head: a film par-excellence. Full of emotions and thought
Comment Body: When viewers see a young banker's character (Dufresne) convicted of a gruesome murder, and later when they see him vindicate himself with the help of pure courage and hope, it evokes high emotions like triumph and hope. Each scene is skillfully written with viewers' perspective considered all through the film. Excellent work due to which Frank Darabont never need prove himself as a director again, because this one goes down in the history books as one of the best dramas ever written.Dufresne's character does what's on his mind says and never shows feelings of captivity while at Shawshank. The character is carved out meticulously displaying traits like intelligence and a mind determined to surviveMorgan Freeman ('Red') delivers a brilliant performance, deserving the Academy Award that year which ultimately landed up with Tom Hanks ('Forrest Gump').

It's weird to see a good rated movie only after ten years and find yourself smiling happily at the end. There are less and less movies able to provide that feeling.The Shawshank Redemption is one great movie that reaches to your heart and mind and makes them both better. I won't go around comment about how it's like or how it's been made. I just wanted to share what it made me feel like.If you haven't seen it, go out, rent it and watch it. It's definitely worth the time and the money. I finally understand why its rating is that high.

After watching it a few time, this film has become my favourite! Each time I watch it I get more and more into the characters and I love it even more. On the contrary of what you might think at first the plot is not about escaping from the prison. If it was only that it wouldn't be anything special as there have been a lot of films on that subject. What the film is about is the development of the characters themselves.I don't want to spoil it at all so I won't say any more about the story. All I can say is that I don't see to this day anything wrong with the film. Everything is brilliant from the acting to the music. I don't see how it is possible for somebody not to like it. I'd recommend it to anybody. It's one of those films which make you realize that you don't need CGI and big explosions to make a great film. But on the contrary big budget films are often the worst...

Comment Head: A 10/10. Let me repeat that if it wasn't clear. 10/10!!!

Comment Body: Andy Duffrane ---- the greatest hero ; Stephen King ---- the greatest scenartist ; Wooden Norton ---- the greatest villain ; Tim Robbins ---- the greatest actor ; Morgan Freeman ---- the greatest minor role ; Brooks ---- the greatest victim ; the hole --- the greatest miracle ; Freedom --- the greatest spirit .make it the greatest film ,But I don't know why didn't it win any Oscar ?

Shawshank Redemption Is as Perfect as a Film Can Get This film has everything , Tim Robbins (Andy Dufresne) Has played His ace in his acting life With this film He plays his part so close to perfect it hurts , Morgan Freeman (Red) also played a massive part in the film and his acting at times was amazing together with tim robbins they made the film as good as it was, but even Bob Gunton (Warden Samuel Norton) played a superb ruthless warden Together with  Clancy Brown (Capt. Byron Hadley) They made acting seem so easy and it was joy to watch them , also this movie had u thinking whats gonna happen next will he or wont he. It Was just one them movies that was always destined to be massive Hit with many great quotes and smooth as u can get storyline with an amazing twist to the plot that will catch u off gaurd anyone who has not seen this sould watch it soon as possible to see how films sould be made 10/10Fear Can Hold U Prisoner. Hope Can Set U Free.

Quite simply, the finest film that I have ever had the pleasure to see. It's a classic take of good overcoming the bad, and takes viewers on an emotional journey through the lives of inmates, particularly Andy Dufrene and Ellis Redding, at Shawshank jail.I have seen this movie at least ten times, and is one of the few films that I could honestly watch over and over again - always more to look out for, always more ways to enjoy it.The story, direction, casting and acting are all second to none, and together create a nigh perfect cinematic experience.I urge anyone who has not seen this movie to watch it as soon as possible.

Comment Head: Some of my film friends wouldn't agree
Laugh, Cry, Gasp, Cheer, Be Amazed and See One Of The Greatest Movies Ever Made

Comment Body: this has been said so many times before i may be mad watching this at alow ebb this film works for heart and soul of the individual watching this film is utter perfection and yet immediately after watching this i watched EDUCATING RITA now call me mad but i found these films quite similar in a way that RITA is also a prisoner trapped by her life surroundings wanting to become educated her motto as well is GET BUSY LIVING OR GET BUSY DYING back to shawshank this film is as i said pure perfection if you havent seen it WHY ?

Sucked into this movie by his earnest persona, I watched despite the (apparent) certainty that he would live out his whole life in prison for a crime he says he did not commit : a depressing thought but a totally upbeat movie as his character Andy moves from surviving to molding the lives of others in a positive way. Told from the viewpoint of fellow prisoner recounting his experiences with Robbins' character (Morgan Freeman - another delight to watch) This movie, like its protagonist, is a champ! Watch this movie! I've seen it four times and still channel-stop on it.(PS Be sure to hiss at Bob Gunton as the truly evil and hypocritical warden! A real contrast to Andy's good nature and philanthropy.)

I would only put this movie behind the LOTR trilogy (I consider them one movie). It is a great tale and even though you know something good will happen, you don't know exactly how, though when looking back it was pretty clear. I value movies by how entertaining and captivating they are. This one was both. Many people like to put on their "film-maker" hats too much. This movie doesn't really show great symbolism or tricky camera work. Its just a very good story with very good acting. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are unreal, and all the supporting characters (Brooks, the prison guards, etc.) make the film complete. It took my a long time to see this movie, even though its on TNT and TBS like every weekend. I must say I was thrilled. Just excellent. 10/10 easy.

Comment Head: One of the best movies ever (spoiler)
Comment Body: No wonder this movie is on second place in the top 100 movies here on imdb.com This is one of my absolute favorite movies of all time and i still haven't met anyone who doesn't love it as much as i do. And if i do i will probably look at them funny and ask what is wrong with them. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman are both excellent in this "innocent man wants his freedom" movie. This film is about friendship, freedom and justice. A man is sent to Shawshank prison for something he didn't commit. Here he meets a man who will become his best friend. They stick up for each other against the corrupt prison system and other inmates. You really have to see it to understand how fantastic this movie is. I rate this movie 10

Before you start reading my comments on this movie, please keep in mind there are very minor spoilers, so if you haven't seen it.what are you thinking, go and watch the movie, you won't be disappointed.This is the first time I've written a comment about a movie on this website, but I think it will be my first of many as I have so many favourite movies I love to share my opinion about on the message boards.I only just stumbled across 'The Shawshank Redemption' about a year ago, I had noticed it was ranked number 2 and thought I'd give it ago. I've heard people talking about it and how great it is, so I bought the movie and I watched it. I admit that I had to watch it twice before I fell in awe of this movie, but now it's become one of my favourites.This movie is about hope. There is nothing set in stone. Someone may be able to take away everything you have in life, but whatever you think, whatever you feel they can never take away your thoughts, they can never take away your hope and that's what happened with Andy. He may have sunk to the bottom of the hole, but he never gave up hope that he would get out.This is a true masterpiece and it is well written, well acted, well directed, well it's just brilliant. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman produce a great friendship in this movie. It may not have won the Oscars, as it lost to another great movie, but it certainly left an imprint in the movie world and to me.One more thing, watch out for James Whitmore as Brooks, he's sure to break your heart and move you to a place you don't go too often.Remember, if you didn't like it the first time, give it another chance and watch it again, I promise you, you won't be disappointed you will notice little things and the scenes that you have overlooked. It's sure to turn your head and mesmerize you.

this is one of the greatest movies ever made. I have watched this movie over two dozen times. I never tire of seeing "Andy Get Them". the lack of awards that this movie recieve was a true travesty. Tim Robbins performance ranks as quite possibly his best and considering who we are talking about that is saying alot. Morgan Freeman talent overshadow the fact that he was not like his character in the book. The rest of the cast though for the most part nameless is extraordinary. Chief among them though is Ron Perlman. There cant be anyone who didnt feel a great swell of joy when they heard the chess piece go through the poster. This is one of the greatest cinema moments i have ever witnessed. This film taps into you and elicts a great emotion. This is something few movies have or ever will do, but it is what makes this one of the greatest films ever made.

I dont know from where to start talkin about this movie.. i saw this movie around 4yrs bak. i have never been so involved in a movie before.. this totally took me by surprise .. everything about this movie be it the performance of the actors.. the story telling is excellent.. the situation of the prison life being shown really touches you.. and the climax was more than an icing on the cake.. its background score is just awesome.. esp the part of "brooks was here " i cant get enuff of that piece of music.. all in it easily comes as the best movie i have eva seen.. and one thing i usually do is make other people also watch this masterpiece.. its brilliant..

My Rating: ***1/2 out of ****. SpoilersIn many ways, I am more than a little shocked at the overwhelming popularity of The Shawshank Redemption. I am not in anyway saying that it is a bad film, in fact its a great film. However, I never thought Shawshank would appeal to so many people. It just seems odd that it has received over 112,000 votes (More than the Godfather) and it is #2 on the Imdb top 250 list. I do not think it deserves this high position but it is nice to see the film get alot of notice.Shawshank deserves high marks in these categories: Directing, Acting, Cinematography, and Writing. This was the debut feature for Frank Darabont and he chooses to let Shawshank unravel at a slow pace. This is the perfect choice for the film. It moves slow but it is nevertheless compelling. There is only one time when the slow pace actually interferes with the film.Darabont also gets some highly impressive from his cast. Tim Robbins gives a strong, subdued performance. Morgan Freeman, who was nominated for a Best Actor Oscar, does an equally strong job here. The chemistry between them is effective too. As strong as the two leads are, they do not outshine the supporting cast. All of them are excellent but two of them deserve to be singled out. James Whitmore gives a brilliantly moving performance. Bob Gunton also deserves mention as the warden in charge of Shawshank. Cinematographer Roger Deakins should be given a lot of credit. He finds the perfect mood for the film. Shawshank is not a colorful place at all. He creates a dreary atmosphere that fits the film perfectly. There alot of uses of the color, gray that is used to create this atmosphere.I have heard a couple of complaints that the film gets a little preachy at times. I cannot find where it does. In my opinion, Shawshank Redemption is a well-written film. There are numerous memorable quotes.Shawshank does have one flaw. I think it begins to drag near the end. This happens after Morgan Freeman is released from prison. These moments are the only times when the slow pace interferes with the film.While I do not think the film deserves its high spot on the 250 list, it is a compelling and moving film. Shawshank does enough things right to overlook its sluggish ending. I recommend the film to everyone.

If this is not the best movie of all time, it is no doubt an amazing phenomenon and possibly the most beloved movie of our time. I have heard literally hundreds of people talk in glowing terms about this movie and mention it as their favorite, and I'm not even conducting a poll. I was blown away when I saw it ten years ago in the theater and to me it's still the best movie I have ever seen. Best ever? Who cares. The votes on this site speak for themselves. This movie has gotten where it has without hype or pretense; it just is what it is - the most beloved movie of our time.

Comment Head: The best film I have ever watched
Comment Body: It's sad it's uplifting. It's right it's wrong. but most of all it's the greatest film of our time and everyone should have this in their collection. Everything from the heartache that tim robbins character faced to the power of friendship with one mans struggle agains a wall of oppression he made his path to the top and he fool them all. This is with out a doubt the greatest thing I have ever watched and I feel that everyone should know about it and watch it at least 20 times, for there are some valuable lessons to be learnt but dont take my word for it go there and see for yourself. This film set the marker for what prision films aspire to. These guys should be knighted and given the key to the world never mind the city.

This perfect prison drama has everything except women.  Tim Robbins gives a truly majestic performance and should've been nominated for an Oscar alongside co-star Morgan Freeman (he's good, too).  It's a whole lot better than other prison movies you see nowadays.  The film is honest, deep, and shows that you can find hope in the most unlikely of places.  I would give this movie ten thumbs up if I had ten thumbs.  But since I don't, I'll just give it two.  I wish Stephen King could write more honest stories like this one.  Remember, this movie came beforere 'The Green Mile', and everyone knows classics are always better. It's nice to see that Hollywood can produce movies that aren't complete garbage.

This is a very fine movie that was unfortunately somewhat overlooked when it was first released. Word of mouth and critical acclaim has resulted in the movie becoming one of the best known and loved films of recent times.The story tells of the imprisonment of Andy Dufresne (Robbins) at the harsh Shawshank prison. Gradually over time he befriends Red (Freeman) who is the fixer in the prison who can get hold of any items at a price. Andy channels his frustration into making things better at the prison. The smallest achievement is celebrated and used as impetus for the next challenge. The film should really make the viewer treasure the things that we all take for granted on a day to day basis. The other interesting aspect of the film is the institutionalisation as portrayed with Brooks. he has been in prison for so long he cannot (and does not want to) survive on the outside. 9/10

In this moving and dramatic portrayl of the imprisonment of an influencial man (Tim Robbins) in Shawshank prison. This man builds up strong relationships and is a benefit to the lives of many in the prison.Tim Robbins plays his character with superb acting, backed up by an equally amazing supporting cast. The story takes the main character, Dufrain, and his friends on a journey through the rigures of prison life.Wonderfully directed and produced, this film topped the box office chart and was quite rightly rated extreemly highly among imdb users when it first came out. This fantastic film has new suprises at every corner. Do not miss it!

This movie is the best movie ever made. I'm not a fan of drama, but this movie is just amazing. It incorporates some comedy in there, too. The plot is outstanding. In a nutshell, it is the best movie of all time.

Comment Head: It goes in line of "The Green Mile" in which it stirs your soul and moves you.
Comment Body: I thought it was a very well made prison movie with a nice suprise at the end.  In my opinion, it is going a bit to far to say that this is the best movies of the 90's.  Very good movie indeed, but I view it as just another well done prison movie.  It goes in line of "The Green Mile" in which it stirs your soul and moves you.

This is the most enjoyable movie ever made. With many one liners that can fill ones life with hope.This movie came out the same year that Pulp Fiction and Forrest Junk came out, the only reason this was not a Best Picture winner. Vote 10 if you can.

Comment Head: Truly, the greatest film ever made
Comment Body: Upon seeing The Shawshank Redemption, I realized that a movie can be so good and so powerful that it can keep you in awe for a long time. I saw Shawshank years ago and have probably seen it fifty times since then and not once have I been bored or uninterested. I have been blown away by this movie since the first time that I saw it. There is truly no movie better that The Shawshank Redemption. There is no better story and there is certainly no better theme. Redemption, hope and friendship have been displayed in the finest form leaving you filled with the two former. Truly, the greatest film ever made.

Comment Head: Just the tiniest flaw in an otherwise masterpiece

Comment Body: I really wish that I had never seen this film as I have wasted so much of my time in front of the tv watching this wonderfull film. I must have seen it about 100 times, and bought the video or DVD 5 times for myself and friends. Well done to Frank Darrabont for making an excellent film from a very small book, I can hardly believe that 2+ hours of my life have gone so quickly. (As they say time flies when your enjoying yourself! )

Comment Head: Yank your heart out and stamp on it
Comment Body: An emotional rollercoster that plods along for almost 3 hours.  It's only a few days later you realise how good a film it was and how it alters your perception of life itself.You almost have to watch a second time just to try and understand what it is that you like so much, unfortunately, I still dont know why it has such an impact on me.  I have now seen it 6 times and it still makes me cry in wonder!
Why is this movie only first-runner-up? This movie is without a doubt the best movie ever created! All I'm saying is GET BUSY LIVING OR GET BUSY DYING... Thumbs up!

Shawshank Redemtion combines great acting with a fantastic story, good editing, and good direction to make this the best movie ever in my opinion! In fact, one of my favorite things to do is watch this movie with someone who has never seen it.  I highly recommend seeing this movie, multiple times!

Comment Head: one of the best movies ive ever seen
Comment Body: this is truly a masterpiec of acting and storytelling and it is one of my favorites.  It has such an amazing and powerful story of friendship and survival and that ending! a tad sentimental but so what! a movie like this needs to be sentimental.  It cheers me up everytime i see it

What can I say this movie is the top of it's class. The Story is great the acting is great . You really care about these characters. Morgan Freeman's performance  is the glue that holds the movie together and Tim Robbin's breaks out in this movie showing that he is a great actor. If you like prison films this is the best!

Can anything be said? surely one of the greatest films of all time, it has tremendous acting and some very sad moments in the film, throughout, the script is solid. The acting immense. WELL DONE TO ALL INVOLVED! Any comments email me- subject title SHAWSHANK.Cheers.

Comment Head: One of the greatest films ever made.
Comment Body: I put this movie on when I'm down in the dumps, and each time I watch it I get uplifted by the pure beauty of the film. It gives me so much hope and light into the world, and it has to be one of the greatest films ever made. The acting was soft and emotional yet powerful. I adore it.

I really do think that this movie has earned a place in the illustrious halls of Imdb at the number two position. This movie gives you more each time you see it.  It is not an exercise of the mind, rather a true introspection of the spirit, that reveals to each of us what we can only hope to become.However, I do think that Fraggle Rock deserves a place at number four.

Comment Head: A movie so beautiful it became My favorite film of all Time!
Comment Body: What can I say...Flawless, spectacular, wonderful, brilliant, great, classic, wondrous, an achievment beyond words!  This movie, is without a doubt wonderful.  I remember seeing only a few moments of it on TV, when I was twelve.  I rented it, and found myself ASTOUNDED by the magnitude of its emotion.  I didn't cry, but I felt as though someone had pierced my heart with an arrow.  It felt good!!!  I have never seen anything in my life so affecting.  This is my favorite film ever!  Nothing will ever beat this as my number one.  I love Citizen Kane, and I think it is "the best film ever made" on a critical standpoint, But I love this just a little bit more. Cinematography, music, writing, directing, acting.  EVERYTHING PERFECT! It is spectacular.  I will never forget "The Shawshank Redemption".

This is a fantastic movie! A strong friendship in a tough prison, a strong movie in the feelings, and a critical comment to American prisons. And a surprising ending!Fantastic play from Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, in every way a great movie.Andy Dufresne: Mr. Hadley, do you love your wife?10 out of 10!

Comment Head: Pure cinematic Quality on all counts from the page to the screen
Comment Body: How the hell Forest "Dam" Gump won best picture over this Gem of a movie, is totaly beyond me. It just shows how the critics and hollywood itself can get it sooo wrong sometimes. Thankfully like all great movies that often sleep at the box office.. true quality shines through,  and its great to see that the public recognise and all round great movie, regardless of what some overpayed over inteligent critic would have them believe. For me it's the kind of film you just don't want to end.. it's 2 and half hour long but it never drags, and when it ends, you know you've seen "A GREAT MOVIE" and you feel full like you've just dined at the Ritz

A truly great film. Probably the best prison movie ever made. Even thought it's the only prison movie I've ever seen. Anyway, I think this movie deserves the rating it has on IMDB. Now to get Saving Private Ryan's rating up there. Okay I'll stay on topic. Morgan Freeman is at his very best in this movie playing the "man who can get stuff for you" or Red. Tim Robbins was also great as Andy Dufrense. Not only was the acting great, but so was the story. The message here was one that I will never forget. But I won't tell you what it is, you'll just have to watch the movie. 10/10. As I always say to all my favorite movies, great job.

it is, if not, the greatest movie i have ever seen. it is inspiring, a tribute to the great acting skills of morgan freeman and tim robbins. there are maybe two or three movies i would give a 10 to, and this is one of them. if you have never seen it before, you should watch it. movies like these are rare.

This movie really moved me when I first saw it on TV. A great plotline, actors with perfect acting skills and the impressive reflection of social problems and humanity. The most amazing point is that I can barely find an actress throughout the play. Except for Andy's wife, no women have ever appeared on focus. Despite this, Shawshank Redemption has become one of the world top movies, while nowadays too many directors just want beautiful actresses to attracting the audience.

What can I say, If you are feeling rather downbeat, watch this movie. It literally lifts the spirit, an emotional roller coaster.What surprises me is, it did not win any Oscar. Well there it proves awards are not the end-word on a movie. Five cheers to Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins acting.

When i went to see this movie, i expected boring crap, and came out from the theaters with glaced eyes and thougt, best film in history. (Im 19) the movie has it all, GREAT acting, great directing, great(and so on) The one thing that could pull this movie down is the ending,*Spoiler*>>>they shoud never have joined up again at the very end, to audience friendly.9/10[Sorry for any bad english]

One of Hollywood's greatest movies!  If you're even the slightest fan of the awesome Morgan Freeman, then you'll love him at his best as "Red" .  The fact that he didn't win a best supporting Oscar is one of the Academy's biggest shams!!  Great work by Robbins as well as all of the supporting cast.

(very minor spoilers) I had to add this to my previous comment after reading a more recent review here on IMDb. The review stated that Christian fundamentalists hated the movie because it showed the true hypocrisy of the Warden, along with his oft quoted Bible and the stitched verse on his wall "Judgment cometh..." behind which he kept his ill gotten gains. But I am a Christian conservative who loved this movie for that very reason. It shows that God looks at the heart. The Warden had a wicked heart, regardless of what came out of his mouth and what he hung on his wall - and clearly his judgment did come! Andy was kind at heart, offering friendship and help to any who would accept it, and well, he got what he deserved in the end. When Red gave up trying to pretend something before the parole board, trying to tell them what they wanted to hear and instead just spoke the truth, he gets his parole. Both Andy and Red refuse to give in to the despair of prison life - instead doing what they can to bring a bit of beauty to the prison. Andy never loses his humanity, and helps Red find his again. They keep hoping till the very end, but don't just sit around waiting for justice, but actively seek it. The ending makes the movie.My husband will not watch it - having a strong aversion to "prison flicks" but I have seen it several times, and reading some of these comments has made me want to see it again.It is one of my all time favorite movies - I never get tired of watching it since I went out and bought the DVD. The first 30-45 minutes are full of heavy language and prison violence, but that only makes the contrast between those who have given up their humanity and those who have held onto it. Not appropriate for young children, but for those able and willing to look at the reality of life - it is beautiful!

Comment Head: Spectacular! - Morgan Freeman Plays a Stellar Role...
Comment Body: For years this was one of my favorite movies that I found myself watching over and over again. Then, I went out I bought the DVD when it was released and haven't watched it since. They chose just the right actors to play each of their roles. Tim Robbins best movie by far and another one to add to Freeman's resume, not that he needs one. Bob Gunton, who might not be as well known as he should be, playing a great warden with his usual personality that fits in perfect with this flick. If there is anyone who has NOT seen this film, I recommend at least giving it a chance by renting it. You are really missing out on something special.

Comment Head: Problably the best King movie ever made
Comment Body: I saw this movie a few years ago and thought it was amazing. A couple of weeks ago I saw the book Different Seasons where the story first appears and read it and found to my great suprise that the film is way better then the story. I¬¥m a big Stephen King fan and have read many books by him and seen many films based on his work but I have got to say that this is the best film I have seen based on his work.

Comment Head: Fantastic film, definately the best Stephen King adaptation to date.
Comment Body: Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman give possibly the best performances of their careers in this adaptation of a Stephen King story.  The build is slow but the payoffs are plentiful in this prison drama about friendship and redemption.  This is also one of those great movies that get better with each viewing.

You must see this film. It¬¥s a homage about friendship, freedom. Wonderful cast, great script. Memorable moments. An excellent chemistry between Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. You will be astonishing, at the end of the movie. To see it, enjoying every minute of the story. Enchanted, gorgeous, emotional.

This is one of those rare, rare movies that almost forces you to stop what you're doing and watch it through to its conclusion each time you come across it on WTBS or one of the other movie stations, even though you've seen it many times and you own it on both VHS and DVD.  Put succinctly, it's remarkable.  There have been many comments of praise on the movie as a whole and on the uplifting and thrilling ending (beginning with Andy's escape and continuing through to his reunion with Red) and so anything I might add would be superfluous, but just I've got to single out the scene on the rooftop where Andy ingratiates himself with the brutish and sadistic chief guard by showing him how he can avoid paying taxes on his inheritance. It's the turning point of prison life for Andy and ultimately Red, and the scene is flawlessly written and executed.

The Shawshank Redemption (1994/Frank Darabont) **** out of ****"I have to remind myself that some birds aren't meant to be caged. Their feathers are just too bright. And when they fly away, the part of you that knows it was a sin to lock them up DOES rejoice. Still, the place you live in is that much more drab and empty that they're gone. I guess I just miss my friend."- Red (Morgan Freeman)This is the ultimate story of friendship. It tells the story of Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), a young hot-shot banker who is railroaded for a double murder in 1947. He is then sent to Shawshank Prison, where he soon befriends Red (Morgan Freeman), a man 'who can get things'. The movie spans almost 20 years, and shows the growing friendship of these two men. Joining them is the old pro James Whitmore as Brooks, who does a great job as a man who "lives in fear". This is the best "feel good" movie of all time, and one of the best of the 90's. It is flawless in a departments. It is based on a short story by Stephen King, and is masterfully put onto the big screen. Freeman turns in his best performance, and has many great lines as the stories narrator. In fact, the film is well written and projects deep meanings of triumph and hope. Many critics have complained that the film is too long. Whomever truly believes this can not call themselves a film critic. The film is slowly paced to show the long growing friendship of Andy and Red. It's pacing is what makes it so real and excellent.SPOILERS: The ending is the best part of the film, and has probably the best scene in motion picture history: Andy's Escape. The film's music plays a big part in this scene, showing Andy's determination and endurance. You end up rooting for him all the way. Another great scene is when Andy talks to Red after he gets out of the "hole". Red reveals his weaknesses and fears, but Andy has hope.This film is a masterpiece of story telling, and should not be missed. Like I said in the beginning of the review, not only is the film flawless in all departments, it excels in every way. You will believe in hope.-30-

Forgivness is releasing a prisoner, and realizing that prisoner is you. This movie might be the best movie that I have ever seen. You will laugh, you will cry, you will want to hug somebody. It is so hard to believe that this tale came from the horror novelist of our time. Do yourself a favor and buy this film. It's a keeper.

Comment Head: Could Be the Most Important Film of the Decade.
Comment Body: I have nothing but praise for THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION.  It is touching, high-spirited and full of motivation.  Tim Robbins plays a banker who is wrongly convicted of the murders of his wife and her lover.  He is sentenced to life in prison and eventually befriends another lifer (played by Morgan Freeman in a powerful role) who has just been denied parole.  It may sound like a simple story, but Frank Darabont's direction, along with endearing performances and a cheerful climax, makes the film so energetic and magical. THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION is a breath-taking masterpiece.5 out of 5

I have just finished watching this movie, and I have no words in how to describe this movie.  It is absolutely the best movie I have ever seen.  I have given this movie a 10 because the story is almost life changing, and differs the views of people about the world.  Everybody should get a chance to watch this movie, it is life changing! Ten out of ten should definitely be the number 1 movie of all time, because it is such a good story, with such moving acting.

Comment Head: Makes you feel all into it!!
Comment Body: In one word: Magnificent! This movie is a masterpiece! It soaks you up and it leaves you behind feeling hopeful for ways which at first didn't seem to be there.. a really fantastic movie you definitely should see! Morgan Freeman, once again, showing how much of a big actor he is! *thumbsup to the cast & crew*

Okay, couldn't Morgan Freeman have at least TIED with Tom Hanks for that Best Actor Oscar?  This film works on so many levels.  Freedom,  innocence, aging, prejudice, masculinity.  My only "but" is this:  Having seen the television show 'OZ,' it seems that in prison the lines of good and bad, friend or foe, are very blurred.  In this movie, they seem a little too cut-and-dry.  Other than that, I can't think of a single other critique, nor can I come up with any other words to do it justice.  If I had to pick from either this film or "The Godfather" only, it'd be this, hands down!

Comment Head: Shawshank Not an Original idea but...
Beautiful storytelling at its very best.

Comment Body: When it comes to what really matters. This movies got it all. The cast of the two main characters is perfect. The whole cast makes a hell of a job. The music the story. This is my all time favorite movie.

No movie can beat this movie. The actors in this movie are so good, that when you start this movie, you can't stop! I've seen many, many movies, but this one is just the best. Tim Robins is in this movie just great. I think that if you've seen this movie, you would agree with me.

The famous British movie reviewer Barry Norman said "Your favourite film must be one that you can watch whatever mood you are in." This is simply the case with this movie. Whenever I am down, up, crying, laughing or whatever I can watch this film and feel even better. Tim Robbins plays Andy Dufresne to perfection. A film with so many twists where you think "That's it, he's gonna kill himself" but it carries on and you see all the characters develop, even Morgan Freeman who plays the emotion-less 'Red' (brilliantly, I might add) at the beginning who doesn't give a hoot about anybody other than getting the other inmates what they want turns out to be a person who accepts that there may be hope. A film which is great throughout and has a fabulous ending.

Comment Head: Destined to be All Time No.1 - The question is only - When ?
Comment Body: A Simple $ Appealing Story with a Beginning, Middle & End.And yet, so Rewarding to so many !Why ? Because it simply connects with more viewers than any other film !What more can anyone ask for ?Please see it & give it the vote it deserves ! (ie. 10).

There isn't much I feel needs adding to the praise already given to this film. But I know exactly what another reviewer meant when they said they wished they hadn't seen this movie, so they could enjoy it for the first time all over again. It really is such a complete film, with an ending which has likely caused many to privately shed a tear and then deny it afterwards down the pub..... :-)

Simply put, ShawShank is the best movie ever...bar NONE.  A very good story, excellent directing and production and a stellar cast.  Was robbed by the Academy when they gave best picture to Forrest Gump.  A great movie for the family (13 and over) and surely a movie you will watch again and again.

This movie can be summed up into just that word, WOW.  I mean out of all the movies i have seen in my life this one i have loved from the first time i watched it to the last time watched it.  Everytime this movie is just as exciting and interesting as the time before.  It has a great cast and story and truly captures the fight of oppression and the challenges of the Human Spirit.  Very inspirational and a timeless classic.

Comment Head: An Amazing Movie in All Areas

Comment Body: This movie is brilliant. Fantastic screenplay, very nice music, and best of all; Morgan Freeman. One of the worlds best actors ever.This movie should really be in every DVD collection all over the world. It's really that good. I'm a big fan of "prison" and "war" movies though, but anyways, this movie is absolutely brilliant, and I think most people would find it very good.10\10

Comment Head: The best movie in the category!!!!
Comment Body: This movie is the only one that make me hang over the edge of my sit!!! The history, the actors, the scenes were just  perfect!!!!I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT

Every single frame of The Shawshank Redemption is designed with extreme care. I think it is the best movie of all times. Such a movie can be produced once in every century. This movie should be watched once in every month. Although I watched it many times, when I re-watch it, i still get the pleasure that i got at the first time. It makes me grab the life more strongly. If you have never seen this film, you must be a criminal in spirit.I don't claim to be a free man, but I am sure of that I am greatly inspired and excited when Andy escapes from Shawshank, and I feel like a criminal who eventually sees the sunlight from the blue sky and smells the fragrance of freedom on a grassland.
