Comment Head: The most moving drama I have ever seen.
Comment Body: This is by far my favourite movie, though sometimes it's hard to explain exactly why.  It could be the amazing work which each and every actor did, or the wonderful script and direction from Mr. Darabont, but whatever it was, it changed me.  Honestly, I am not kidding.  I never watched movies the same after seeing this film, everything had to now be compared to Shawshank. Not since Star Wars has there been a film which has had such a huge impact on how I watch and comprehend fiction, including film, TV, and books.

Its really a great movie to watch. I don't know how many times i have watched it but still i would like to watch again. In my view its better that God Father which is on the top of imdb.com ratings. You watch it and you can know your self. Its all about great Friendship, Hope and Dedication...fantastic movie....

Comment Head: One of the best movies out there
Comment Body: I didnt need IMDB or anything else to tell me if Shawshank is a good or bad movie.  This is one of those movies you will never forget and i have watched it five or six times and everytime the film gets to me, and thats why i consider this a masterpeice.  You cant get better acting then this..

Comment Head: Good movie, but not a masterpiece
i address this to the university eleitests who quote wells etc

Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption improves with every watch, so much so that u almost imagine your place or your role in the prison and try to understand how that lifestyle would affect you. Frank Darabont may all the praise for adapting this novella into such a masterpiece fall on your much deserved shoulders because your style of filmmaking is unique in these times of unsubtle blockbusters. The background to this story is probably too well loved for me to go into but Tim Robbins delivers a painful, regretful, intelligent performance that u cant see coming from any other star. Morgan Freemans brings so much comfort and bitterness to his turn as red that as u reach the end of the film when his smile starts to show and they embrace u know u have just sat through something special. An enriching experience.     10/10

Comment Head: Every bit as good as its reputation
The best because of the simplicity
Comment Body: This movie does one thing, but it does this in excellent way. All actors in the movie are awesome. The movie easily stands by itself as the best movie of all time. Many will disagree with this because they have an internal defend against new age movies abd they preffer to consider favorites the old ones of 60's and 70's. This movie is simply the best out there because it has absolutely no disadvantage.Stephen King's Movies will either be the "worst of all time" or the "best of all time" as happens with his books. This is the case of this movie. Best of all time whatever they say.

This movie is absolutely great!!! It would be impossible for me to tell how many times I've seen this film... To anybody who hasn't seen this incredibly movie, i can only say: "what in the world are you waiting for, step away from your screen and go buy/rent this film immediately"... Anyway, it definitely deserves to be #2 on the list...

The story will always touch my heart. The courage, the endurance, the friendship, the goal make the best chemestry. Hail Mr. Freeman as Red! Hail Mr. Robbins as Andy! Mr Darabont makes the best adaptation ever from Mr. Stephen King's novels.

This movie was actually filmed partly in my hometown.  Plus, my dad's in it. So, I'm a little partial to it.  But, I have NEVER talked to someone who hasn't absolutely loved this movie.  It's definitely a must see!

This is wonderful filmmaking filled with gut-wrenching emotion and drama. I do not agree that this is the 2nd greatest movie of all time.  Perhaps it belongs in the top 50.  This film as well as Director Frank Darabont's follow-up The Green Mile are based on Stephen King short stories and I honestly cannot say that one is better than the other.  Masterful direction, acting, and storytelling.  I am very, very particular about the films that I give a perfect score.  I go for more thought-provoking plots rather than well-told melodramas like Titanic.  This is certainly an excellent film with its triumph of the human spirit theme and I believe that it is worthy of a 9.  Excellent film experience.  ****1/2 / *****

The Shawshank Redemption is one of the best movies I have ever seen. This is a true Stephen King film. Darabont's effort in the screenplay was astonishing. I love this film. The whole story has twists and turns and surprises in every corner. The best prison movie, most definitely. Robbins delivered a powerful performance. He should have won an Oscar for this film. I loved it and I hoped, I'm sure, that everyone else loved it. I give this film a solid, gold TEN. Highly recommended for those who have taste in movies. If you have any comments for me, please e-mail me at tylerripen@yahoo.com.

(spoilers)What I experienced in watching SR was close to a miracle. No, nothing religious about it. What I mean is, nearly ten years after its release, I was able to watch it without having heard anything about it before, including the "big twist". All I know is that it ranks #2 in the IMDB poll, and I share the puzzlement expressed in one of the comments (not that the film does not deserve ranking high....but THAT high?).Watching it on TV and interrupted by numerous commercials hopefully did not take too much away. But what can I possibly say that has not been said in the one thousand one hundred twenty-five comments posted to-date on SR? Well, in my complete ignorance, I was led by the name of King to believe that this was a horror. When this misconception was soon dispelled, I continued to try to make up my mind as to whether the film falls into any specific genre and perhaps sub-genre (as High Noon created a sub-genre in Westerns). I was also not quite sure whether I was supposed to be made to think deeply or to be entertained. Then came the big escape, and I was enormously entertained.If I were to mention just one thing about SR that impressed me most, it would be the character of Andy Dufresne, played by Tim Robbins: an endurer, but not a martyr; a hero, but not squeaky clean; a loyal friend, but not a passionate man. Whatever he is or is not, one image emerges clearly: he is cool!A fantastic film, and hats raised to Tim Robbins.

Their are two great things in this world muhammed ali and the shawshank redemption.It is without doubt the best film ever made.A bold statement you say well watch it and then tell me it isnt.Why is it the greatest well thats hard to put a finger on.For one thing the acting superb robbins and freeman give standout performances.The sweeping score and look add to that.Stir in a brillant uplifting story evil villians and a great twist and shawsank can bellow out i am the greatest.

Comment Head: The strength of this film is in its simplicity (possible spoilers)
Comment Body: Most viewers do not want to go to overly "artsy" movies because usually they try too hard to be intellectually stimulating but fail miserably because it is a difficult feat to pull off.  Movies like American Beauty and Am√©lie are few and far between.  And then there's The Shawshank Redemption: simple, honest, without pretense.  It appeals to the viewers heart and soul and not his/her head.  No one cares if the prison conditions are 100 percent believable.  It's fiction for a reason!  I never even noticed the clich√©s until I read a detailed post describing them, and frankly, I'm content to ignore them.  The spinner bait that hooked me on this movie was the relationship between Andy and Red.  Watching this movie for the first time (and dozens of times since) I found these two characters to be two of the most likeable characters I could think of.    The climax of this movie is in my top five of all time (TSR, Memento, Usual Suspects, Se7en, The Manchurian Candidate).  In general, people like happy endings.  I am a big fan of tragedies like The Deer Hunter and Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, but I cannot watch them continually with the same emotion.  Watching Shawshank for the Xth time, I experience the same emotional roller coaster as the first time viewed it. People dislike the fact that so many people give this movie a 10/10 rating.  I feel quite comfortable giving this movie that rating because it is my favorite movie.  It is not a perfect movie, but the rating system doesn't go by technical merit.  People should rate films based on their opinion as a whole and not solely upon how well the director uses cinematic techniques.  Personally, I couldn't care less

Comment Head: Get Busy Living, Or Get Busy Dying
The Greatest Movie Ever Made. Will Ever See. For me.

Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is the best movie ever made.  I first saw this movie last summer and really didn't know what to expect, given all the stupid early 90s movies that are out there. But once about 10 minutes in a realized that this was going to be a great movie, and it was. It, in my opinion, portrayed what it really would be like to live in jail and, for me, how unfair the justice system can be given andy was obviously innocent. They way he escaped was pretty cool too. So, if you have not seen this movie as of now go out and rent it. It is definitly worth it. ***** outta *****

Comment Head: Can there be enough compliments to describe this film?
Comment Body: Complete void of spoilers herein, only read on if you like ridiculous praise of a movie on a mammoth scale.I just watched The Shawshank Redemption for the second time, and for the second time it took my breath away. There is just no real word to describe the extraordinary piece of cinema that has been created here.It tells the story of wrongly accused murderer, Andy Dufresne (Tim Robbins), and his story of survival inside a maximum security prison, aided by his friendship with 'the only guilty man inside Shawshank', Ellis 'Red' Reddings (Morgan Freeman). Along the way it branches into at least six different side stories that, halfway through the movie, while still entertained, one wonders what they have to do with the plot. The answer is everything, as becomes apparent by the end.I won't bore you with details of the individual craftsmanship that went into this movie, but I will advise anyone who has not seen it to see it, and as soon as possible. Keep watching until the end, and there is no possible way you can be disappointed. It is absolutely masterly directed by Frank Darabont, and while I thought that his other Stephen King-based film, The Green Mile, was fairly slow and self-indulgent, this isn't. It is drawn out and long, but absolutely impeccable and amazingly inspirational. It delivers the message that even in the face of abject adversity, hope will always prevail. This message was recently hammed up quite terribly in "The Two Towers", but in The Shawshank Redemption, just one very simple quote sums it up: "Hope is a good thing. Possibly the best thing. And no good thing ever dies"This is one for the ages. I cannot imagine that the uplifting effect of this movie will ever die. There is no possible way it could be better. The only possible reason I can think of for not liking or being inspired by this movie is that you just don't want to. There are no two ways about it. Even after nine years, this holds strong as an absolute masterpiece of film-making, and a staggering achievement. Five stars out of five.

I don't know why it took me so long to see this film but I finally did. I've seen a lotta films in my day, but I think this is definitely one of the top 10. Indeed, it's rated by the viewers as the #2 film of all-time on this database, just behind The Godfather. This film is a powerful story of hope and despair, love and hate, institutionalization and corruption. There's not much violence in it, although there is strong (homo)sexual content. This story takes place almost entirely in a maximum-security prison. The story would be powerful even with no "brand-name" actors in it, but Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins both do a magnificent job in this film. This is a film that should not be missed!

The IMDb rating of this pedestrian story which relies on the audience manipulation formula "prisoners good /prisons bad" has proven to me that we are neck deep into the decline of all things cultural. When they sell more prints of the Elvis,Bogart, and Marilyn Monroe version of Edward Hopper's "Nighthawks" we know we have a problem. When the people who have the Elvis version see the real "Nighthawks" and get confused, we have additional problems. When Stephen King's name is bandied about as someone's favorite "author" we have Code Red. When Tim Robbins is regarded as some sort of screen presence that can catapult a movie to a # 2 spot we have meltdown.There hasn't been a movie with this much depth since "The Longest Yard." I read a comment earlier by a poster who said that this movie will drop off the list when the IMDb reviewers grew up.Sadly, their bodies already have, and their minds which will never catch up. Pass the Velveeta...

Contains minor spoilers"The Shawshank Redemption" has a lot going for it. The cast and acting are absolutely top-class, the main characters (Tim Robbins & Morgan Freeman) are very likeable and the "bad guys" (warden + guards) are really evil.In terms of story, I found this movie to be good, but not that special. It has some truly touching and emotional scenes, some good jokes and the twist at the end is surprising and satisfying. Also, you've GOT to admire the persistence and positive attitude of Tim Robbins' character: NOTHING gets him down, no matter what things happen to him, he always keeps believing in himself and fighting back in his own way. But overall, there also were some pretty dull scenes and prison movies cliches in this movie..things like the rapists or the old man with the bird, and the whole new guy/old wise mentor thing have been before. Also, the pace is a bit slow at times.All in all, this movie certainly was entertaining and refreshing, and it left me with a good feeling, but honestly, I didn't find it THAT special. At least not special enough to warrant a #2 position in the top 100. Oh well, it's all a matter of taste I suppose.***1/2 out of **** stars

This is one of the best movies ever made.Do you know that feeling, you walk out of the cinema and think your still in the movie? dream of it at night, think of it over and over again, discuss it with your friends? and if someone asks you; " do you know a good movie? " and recommend that one as the first?well, this is one of them.So, if you haven't seen this one, go out and see it!!!

This movie is brilliant, if you haven¬¥t seen it, don¬¥t read or try and find out things on this movie, just rent it and find out for yourself... It¬¥s the most uplifting movie about human spirit overcoming adversities i have ever seen

This is quite simply,the best film ever made. Taken from a short story by Stephen King,it turns out to be a true cinematic masterpiece. It takes you through just about every single emotion possible,happiness,sadness,elation,fear and jubilation at the end. The more you see this movie,the more you appreciate just how amazing it is. Each time you watch it you pick out something extra that you hadn't noticed before,and that only adds to your appreciation of it. Tim Robbins' character is one you sympathize with right from the word go,you're rooting for him all the way through the movie,when he has his run-ins with Boggs and his cronies,to when you see him on the beach and he sees Red walking towards him. I know nothing about lighting,editing,or abstract plot development. But I know an awesome movie when I see one,and this is most definitely one of those. See it,be amazed,then see it again and be even more awestruck by its magnificence

Comment Head: Don't have to explain why you like. You just do....

Comment Body: This film in my opinion is one of the best ever made. When I went to the video store one time in 1999, I was in the mood for a drama. It was a toss-up between Shawshank and some other movie. I chose Shawshank. The plot outline on the back of the movie box was very intriguing. It is most definetly the best movie I have ever picked out at a video store. I liked the movie so much that I went and bought it the next day. Few movies have as much talent and drive as this one. Two of the best actors in my opinion, Morgan Freeman and Tim Robbins. What an excellent acting duo. It's a shame that this movie lost Best Picture to 'Forest Gump'. Gump was good, but this one was much better. I gave it a 10. What a great movie!

Comment Head: One of the best films I ever saw.

Comment Body: Having read Stephen King's short story when it was first published I never would have predicted it would be made into a movie.  The movie adaptation is also alot more interesting than the original story, mainly because the characters are better developed and the story is livlier.  This is one of the few movies that surpasses the book.  The weakest point of this movie is the rather one-sided view of the penal system, even in the dated version of this story.

Few movies can grab the soul like this one. For me, every time I watch The Shawshank Redemption, I remember the music. I remember the framing, how each scene is perfectly constructed and put together, displaying the lives of the criminals. Every oily moment with the warden, every frightening vision with the `Sisters,' and of course, every point of pontification by the venerable Andy Dufresne. While I do not consider this the greatest movie ever, it is awfully close o the top. The performances by the likes of Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Clancy Brown (who was doing Dr. Pepper commercials at the time) and Bob Gunton as Warden Norton were all exceptional. One thing that always keeps me coming back is the score by Thomas Newman. While he has based his entire style off this memorable score (listen to The Road to Perdition and Shawshank back to back, and you'll see), the subtle movements and piano keys turn this into one of the best films of all time.

Comment Head: An interesting adaptation of a surreal story
Comment Body: I find it very interesting that this movie has ranked so high in this database.  One professional reviewer elsewhere had referred to it as an "overrated cult film," and I can see why.  It is one of those movies that is so unique that it just grabs hold of some people while doing very poorly with the general public at the box office.   But to be ranked as one of the best movies of all time?  I honestly don't see why.Personally, I thought the Stephen King story it was based on was much better.  True to his style, it was a very surrealistic tale about something that couldn't possibly happen in real life.  SPOILER AHEAD!  Come on, it is sheer fantasy to think that someone can dig himself out of prison with a rock pick over the course of many years without someone catching on to what he is doing.  I think that's why the movie is so popular:  it's a feel-good fantasy that pretends to be a prison drama.But it is very entertaining, and keeps you wondering if Andy really did kill his wife.  The ending is too predictable, though.Overall it is a very well-acted and directed movie.  However, the objectionable language and the homosexual rape scenes were totally unnecessary to the plot.  It would have been MUCH better if those aspects of Stephen King's fertile imagination had been left out of the movie.  If not for those parts, I would heartily recommend anyone to see it.

"The Shawshank Redemption" is a good movie, but there are definitely a number of disconcerting aspects to it, such as foul language and violence. It takes a lot in a film to actually offend me. I'm a reviewer, so I have to tell what I thought about the movie. Very foul language does tend to bother me a bit, because it gives all the characters of this movie a self bad image, in addition to that, the Bible says `Do not let your mouth coarse foul language because it involves sinful speech'. "The Shawshank Redemption" could have been better, but we hear very bad words and an overdrawn narrative throughout the whole movie. Spoilers: This movie is mostly about a man who is in jail and has to face evil people including the mayor who wants to make his life miserable, but he's very smart and gets ahead in life by trying to break a wall with a hammer to escape from jail! Probably this movie moved many people simply because the main character (Tim Robbins) was intelligent and brave, however the whole movie doesn't tell much, only the main character's life in jail and his effort to get rid of it by hope and boldness, which I didn't find very annoying! The ending was somewhat farfetched and predictable, in addition to that we never knew if the man who killed the main character's wife was punished, however I thought that this movie leaves an interesting message at the end which is to have hope when everything seems impossible. 7/10

Comment Head: Doesn't stand the test of time
Comment Body: I saw this movie when it first came out 7-8 years ago and loved it. I was 15 at the time. Saw it again recently on TV and I didn't like it nearly as much. There's really not much to criticize, it's an excellent work, very well acted, nicely executed but it's just....idunno.....too plain and safe. Nothing really daring or new about it, and on second viewing many scenes seem needlessly melodramatic.Still well worth seeing, but nowhere near the classic status that some reviewers here were quick to bestow upon it.

This movie takes you like a storm, starting of easy, but as the movie moves along you get pulled back in your seat just enjoying the fine acting, and story..Morgan Freeman, and Tim Robbins does some of the best acting i've ever seen...THIS IS A MUST SEE!!

Just a comment about something that I didn't see anyone else mention recently. (I didn't read all nine billion comments on this movie) I thought that the character "Red" was a white man in King's story. Now, there's nothing wrong with casting Morgan Freeman in that part, and he was great in it. (He was cast as President of the United States in "Deep Impact" and carried that off very well. I thought it was kind of neat to cast a black actor as President and make absolutely no reference to his race throughout the movie. Would that we could be that way in reality.) But TSR was set in a particular time, (1947-1968) and I find it hard to believe that there was utterly no racism in a Maine prison in those days. Sort of undercuts the realism that seemed to be done so well in every other aspect of the movie. Just a minor quibble. Everything else I have to say about TSR has already been said. Grade: A+

Comment Head: Good, but not the best ever.
Comment Body: Very good performances from Freeman and Robbins. Good writing.  The best move ever?  Nope.  I gave it a 8 out of 10.As a libertarian, my own feelings about freedom, power, and corruption are apparently quite a bit stronger than either Darabont or Stephen King.

Comment Head: One of the greatest movies of all time!

Comment Body: Beginning in the late 1940s comes this gripping, poignant, one of a kind prison saga from director Frank Darabont. Freeman is brilliant as a slick but cynical inmate who's spent most of his life within the cruel prison system of Shawshank; Robbins is riveting as a hotshot banker-turned-new inmate with whom he forms an unbreakable bond, and comes to admire for his will, determination, and endless grasp of hope that allows him to transcend his turbulent surroundings. Their deep, emotional bond is the focus of this long, arduous, and compelling journey that showcases friendship and the power of the human spirit unlike any other film of its time. A remarkable, in-depth, and unforgettable story that is sure to be remembered for years to come. ***¬Ω

Comment Head: As Pandora knew with hope we can survive anything
Comment Body: I went in to give blood- the staff was watching this.. needless to say several orange juices and cookies later I was still at the blood bank, laughing and crying with the staff.  This is a remarkable movie for its subtlety- I like the fact that no one ever knew Andy was digging a tunnel- I like how he tells his friend to look a certain place if he ever gets out- and I like the message of hope for those who feel hopeless. Stephen King outdid himself with the story and Robbins and Freeman do wa wonderful job with the script they were given. Just to see the words " brooks was here" and then "so was Red" add those little touches that makes a movie great. A movie that deserved more accolades.

Comment Head: Touching, But a Theft Is a Theft
Definitely good but deserves no pedestal
How do you get any better than this?
Comment Body: Imagine yourself in 1940's Maine, accused of a despicable crime of revenge on your wife and the man you recently found out was her lover, sent to a corrupted prison with a two-faced warden, where inmates are murdered for knowing information that would help an innocent man off the hook, or for crying on their first night of imprisonment. Where popularity with the guards gets you special privileges and crossing the warden while just trying to get the freedom you deserve gets you thrown into 'the hole' for a month. The only light of hope is the special friendship with a fellow inmate by the name of 'Red' and a rock-hammer hidden inside a Bible. "Salvation lies within." You can take my word for it, one thing that does lie within this movie is an incredible story of hope that will bring you to the point of tears at some points and enrage you at others. The acting is brilliant, the screenplay is superb. This drama places a new sense of hope in you that you would never have felt before. "The Shawshank Redemption" is absolutely the movie of choice for anyone who appreciates excellency in film-making.

This movie just rocks, I really don't get it that some people think that movie is just for entertainment.This movie is a lot more than entertainment, it has a deeper meaning that you got to see. It contains a lot of stuff to think about. - Innocent but decides to live with it - The dead of Brooks Hatlen - The decision of Red to follow Dufresne to MexicoThis movie has got 2 of the finest actors (Tim Robbins & Morgan Freeman) in their line-up who play their bests parts untill now (that is what i believe).This movie is just a must see

It was given by a friend as a marriage gift, I loved this movie right away. everything is soo perfect, the music, the narration, the end. When I feel down here is the dvd.... and I am perfectly in a good mood. I really thank my friend for giving me this movie.

The Shawshank Redemption is a beautiful film. The last fifteen minutes are so wonderful it made me cry - and the only other film that has made me cry is the climax of The Truman Show. This is a film that makes you see life in a completely different way - a hopeful way. Don't watch some shallow nonsense like Mission Impossible II, watch a film that you'll remember your entire life. Watch The Shawshank Redemption. It's got 9 out of 10 for a reason, you know.

Comment Head: Feeling depressed? Watch this movie. Only one flaw.
Comment Body: I won't go into all the good things about the movie, since pretty much all of the other posts do, I'll just say I agree.  There was only one thing wrong with it.  Are we supposed to believe that in a prison in 1948, a black guy was best buds with a bunch of white guys?  Oh well, this was made when it wasn't politically correct to have a movie with an all white cast.  If you can get past that one flaw, this movie is a 10.  If you can't, the movie is still an 8 or 9.If you're depressed, this is an excellent movie to watch.  It focuses on when life has really beaten you down.  No matter what happens to him, he tries to get the best of the situation.

I'm sure we all agree, the Shawshank Redemption is the best movie ever made- The Best Picture of all time. A must see movie that is simply amazing. The story and acting will dazzle you. A movie at the end that will make you rewind it and watch again. An absolutely incredible film!!!

Comment Head: No finer story-telling in the movies!
"Get bust living - or get busy dying"

Comment Body: Friendship.  In a word, this movie is all about friendship.  Great casting makes the characters believable.  Extraordinary acting makes them come to life.  The bond developed between Andy (Tim Robbins) & Red (Morgan Freeman) is so real that you feel it.  If you're not a sensitive male going in, you will be one coming out.  Go BUY this movie.  It'll make you laugh, cry, and -- most of all -- hope.  The supporting cast is almost as good as Andy & Red.  The warden is diabolically evil.  And his #1 minion (Clancy Brown) turns in a first-rate performance.  Much attention was paid to the sets. Not much left to say except . . . what a movie!!!  There is no comparable film work out there.  I "hope" someday there will be.  'Til then, The Shawshank Redemption is the best-in-show.

Comment Head: This is the best film ever!!!!!!!!!!
Comment Body: How can anybody dislike this film. It's definitely the best drama film I've ever seen. If you haven't already seen this film, don't rent it, BUY IT!!!!!. I don't know of anybody who dislikes this film. Its very similar to the 'The Green Mile' but only better, I do like the Green Mile though but this is far better. This film should be number 1 instead of the 'The Godfather'.

I'm not going to rattle on for hours about how good this film is, as I can't say anything that hasn't already been said. The plot twist in this film is second to none, just a pity it was ruined for me.... This film is a masterpiece and my third favourite film of all time, second only to The Godfather and Schindlers List. The Shawshank Redemption, 9/10. The second best film of the 1990's.

Comment Head: Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies"
Comment Body: This movie is the greatest piece of work ever put on video cassette.  If you haven't seen it get to the nearest video store and rent it.  It can change the way you feel about life totally with just a few quotes and actions by the characters inside Shawshank Prison.  Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman put on a great show and make this movie the best movie I've ever seen.

Comment Head: Surely movies don't come any better than this.
Comment Body: The Shawshank Redemption is different from any other movie in one most obvious way...there is nothing wrong with it.  Tim Robbins is fantastic as the reserved and to some extent mysterious Andy Dufresne, and Morgan Freeman's portrayal of 'Red' is just as good.  Stephen King shows he is more than a horror guru by teaming up with Frank Darabont to produce one of the greatest movies of all time.  There's humour, there's sadness, there's action, there's drama.  This film has it all.  10/10.  Shawshank is a fabulous tale and it is a shame that it won none of the Academy Awards it was nominated for.  If you haven't experienced The Shawshank Redemption, stop what you doing, leave your house/office and go and either rent or buy this video.  An absolute classic.  The best. Darabont's work has been limited since this film but his last directing sensation was The Green Mile.  Starring Tom Hanks, this too is a fabulous film and both feature in my Top 5 of all time.  Watch them both.

The Shawshank Redemption is a movie that slid through the Theatres without drawing much deserved attention. It made no real impact at the academy award either. So why is this movie currently holding the second spot at the imdb top 250, only beaten by the untouchable "Il Padrino"? First of all, I believe the movie is spot on when it comes to the description of human endurance, persistence, and adaptation. The development of the characters also indicates that imprisonment and freedom can't always be divided by walls alone. Sometimes the highest walls and the worst conditions aren't enough to stop the human spirit, other times the absence of boundaries and even the prospect of something better, can break you down if you lack some of your primal needs. This is where I believe the greatness of this movie really shows. It perfectly pinpoints the vast scope of the human mind, and how we react both similar and differently to challenges in life, and the movie does so in a simple, straightforward way! As "Red" says upon the climax of this marvellous movie: "Every man has his breaking point"

I am surprised at how many people have not seen this movie. It's spectacular. I have two favorite movies. This is one of them. I have friends who have no interest in seeing Shawshank, but after I make them watch it, they all love it. No exceptions. I can't believe Forrest Gump won best picture in '94. The Oscars lick.

The Shawshank Redemption was in the better sense of the word perfect. It reflected on the true life in the solitary confinement of prison. This movie was so powerful that it changed my direction of life. I went from wanting to be a fireman to a movie director and now I am living my dream because of this amazing film. Frank Darabont and Stephen King worked at their best to write this amazing story, added with the amazing acting by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, this is a must see for any movie fanatic. I give this movie a perfect score!

Comment Head: The best movie I have ever seen
Comment Body: Words cannot describe this movie. I feel this is the best escape/prison movie ever made. The analogy to the human situation is uncanny and it is this fact that makes this movie great and not just very good. Now I know what it means to be institutionalized. ESCAPE WHILE YOU CAN !!!

I think this movie is my favorite of all time.  The reasons are (1)I watch it every time it is played on television in rerun even though I have it on tape (2)It gets an emotional reaction from me every time I watch it and (3)I never notice how long the movie is because I am so entertained by it.

amongst so many films that are really well known and stink and blockbusters that stink. This is not a blockbuster but a classic to all movie buffs and it is becoming more and more known and appreciated. I love this film. I have seen it the for the third time recently and still it brings tears into my eyes at some points. The cast is great, with Morgan Freeman and a great Tim Robbins. I still do not know what to think of Andy (Robbins), did he do it or didn't he. There are several hints in the film but I still do not know, for Andy is a hard man to see through.WATCH THIS MUST SEE8 out of 10

Some movies really need more than 2 hours to develop their story. I think "The Shawshank Redemption" would have been more successful if it was not so long.  The story is truly excellent...moving, intense, and joyous at the same time.  I think it could have been improved by editing out a few scenes which were redundant to the purpose of the mood they were establishing.

Comment Head: Quite possibly the best movie ever made
Comment Body: With all due respect to the people that complain of it's too stark good vs. evil characters, simplicity and so on... you are missing the point. Having been raised on a steady diet of Hollywood crap, this was first, and only, movie that has been truly inspirational and moved me to tears.  This is NOT standard Hollywood material. It has been pointed out that, in general, optimism is equated with ignorance.  I was of that opinion as well, but this was truly a LIFE-CHANGING movie for me.  This wasn't a movie so much as it was a wake-up call.  I've seen all the classics.  But nothing I've encountered has conveyed such a message of positivity and hope as this movie, without being contrived or obvious. To all those who pour negative reviews on "Shawshank", stop being a critic, and start being human.  To everyone else, I think we're all better people for having seen it.

Comment Head: Every once in a long while a truly inspiring film comes along that is a must see for virtually everyone. The Shawshank Redemption is one of these films.
The second place (Top 250) is unfair for this movie!
Comment Body: At the beginning i thought, this would be an another annoying movie, but now i've a totally different opinion. I saw it yesterday, it was amazing, absolutely amazing! I've got to add this one to my favourite list of movies, which is very short ;): (Finding Forrester, Shawshank, Adrenalin: Fear the rush) The Shawshank should be on the 1st place in the "Top 250", that's the right place for it! 1 of 10, i gave it 10! It's fair enough!

Comment Head: A Story about triumph over adversity
Comment Body: In years to come the Shawshank Redemtion will be seen as a classic and rightly so. The is a wonderfully moving story about a bonding friendship between two men who are locked up in Shawshank prison for differing reasons. Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman deserve any praise that can be heaped apon them because i feel it is them more so than the story that hooks you from the first time you meet the characters.You feel for them and you hope that thing turn out for the best . If i had to critisise the film for anything it would be the lack of an ageing process that the men go through but that is nit picking. A film you could watch over and over again. 9 out of 10

This is one of the best films of all time, and I'm not kidding you. Yes, you're welcome to your Godfathers' and Citizen Kanes' but this is a film everybody can experience, preferably through the medium of cinema, for what it is, a truly great story, backed up by top notch performances by Robbins and Freeman.Everyone I have ever spoken to has enjoyed this film and they were as surprised as me to find out that although nominated, the film did not receive one single Oscar. Why is it so, that a good film like Forrest Gump can win so many but a truly great film like Shawshank wins nothing?Words cannot describe how great this film is, one to see again and again, and not just for the triumphant twist at its conclusion! Watch it!!

Comment Head: "Put your trust in the Lord ¬ñ your ass belongs to me"
Great story with a surprising finish
Comment Body: This movie I can see again and again and again...

The Shawshank Redemption is a masterpiece. It is certainly the finest work of Tim Robbins' career, and Morgan Freeman even surpasses his usual lofty standard of excellence. This is one of those few movies that one can watch many times over and never get tired of it. It is hard to believe that the story is based on a novel by Stephen King. Every aspect of this film is first rate. It's the closest to a perfect film I've seen in the decade of the nineties.

Comment Head: This Movie Can Never Be Seen Too Many Times (Some Spoilers, But Not Many)
Comment Body: I first rented this movie because I had heard it was good and because it was there. Through the first half hour, I thought it was entertaining at most, but after the scene where the one man is beaten and nobody cares, I was totally engulfed in this film. There is nothing wrong with this movie. Every action, every word spoken is absolutely perfect. After seeing it half a million times, I can quote it word for word. I still smile with utter joy in the end and get choked up during the scene with Brooks. Frank Darabont is one of the greatest directors I have ever seen, and it is a shame that he has only made a few movies. The music in this movie is also perfect. If you haven't seen this movie, which I am surprised to hear that many people have not, you should rent it immediately. Nevermind, don't just rent it.... buy it. You will not regret it. Ten out of ten! >

Comment Head: good but number one of all time??

Comment Body: You must see this movie.  Great plot, awesome acting.  I can't believe it didn't win an Oscar.  It should have beaten Gump that year.

Comment Head: Without question the greatest movie of all time.
Comment Body: Well, Shawshank Redemption is a perfect movie.  There is no scene out of place, no piece of music that stands out, the moral is very clear, and it doesn't even need to be spelt out for you. The acting by Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman complete the movie and make it the heart-warmer, the tear jerker, the nail biter, and the perfect movie that it is. After I saw it for the first time, I was instantly touched and a fan for life.  I've only seen it three or four more times, but each time I see it, I learn something new, or discover a new angle of the story. I'd say that if you only see one movie for the rest of your life, it would have to be Shawshank Redemption.  And if, after watching it, you can tell me that it isn't the best movie in the world, then I'd say that there is something seriously wrong with you.

Comment Head: Perhaps the best movie of all time
Comment Body: It's always difficult to choose a favourite movie out of all the movies I have seen, but I really believe that this is the one. When I first watched it, I had not read the Stephen King novella, and had no idea what was going to happen, which made it much more enjoyable to watch. Of course, like any movie, this was not flawless, but was such a terrific emotional experience for someone who is seldom moved by cinema. This was such a cinematic triumph, and I couldn't believe that it didn't win any of its seven nominations at the Oscars. The performances were wonderful, captivating the mood of the film to sheer perfection. Nothing against Forrest Gump, but it should have been easily outclassed for Best Picture. It was also a good movie, but just nowhere near as memorable as this one.

Comment Head: Very good, but hardly the best movie ever made.

Comment Body: How the hell did this get voted number one in the top 250? Meandering adaptation of a tight little King short. Typically hammy performances and so sugary you could drop it into the world's water system and everyone would go hyper.It's okay, as adaptations go, but there is soooo much better out there.Steev

This film was good, don't get me wrong, but in a million years it would never have occurred to me that this film would rank # 1 in the Internet Movie Database's top 250 films [ I hope this doesn't last - it's april 1999]. It is ridiculous.  It is a good story, has good acting/character development, medium cinematography/music/everything else etc.....As enjoyable as any other half decent film - but not number one in MY top 250 - probably not even in my top 250.

Comment Head: The best darn picture ever made
Comment Body: This truly has to be the greatest film ever made.  This film has you hooked from beginning to end and never loses its edge.  And to think that it came from "Stephen King" although this is not the first time King has given us such a great flick ("Stand By Me", "Misery", "The Shining").  Whats more unbelievable is that it was snubbed of the Best Picture for both the Oscars and Golden Globe.  Sure "Forrest Gump" was a great film but it's not often that you find a movie so captivating and can have such a beautiful, edgy and realistic storyline.  Even the AFI's "100 movies 100 years" didn't include this in their list.  Both critics and audiences have had positive things to say about this movie.  I think that if you haven't watched it yet, then you truly can't understand what true movie-making is all about.

Comment Head: The Best Prison Movie I Have Seen Yet!

Comment Body: No, this is NOT the greatest film of all time.  I don't think you could pinpoint one single film as that but "The Shawshank Redemption" is one of the most powerful and moving experiences of the 1990's (other masterpieces include "Schindler's List", "Dead Man Walking", "The Piano", "Glengarry Glen Ross", etc.) "The Shawshank Redemption" is the harrowing story of a man wrongly convicted of murdering his wife and her lover.  He is sent to prison to serve two life sentences.  There he meets Red, who becomes his best friend.  The film speaks loudly about hope and its unending importance in life and that is a lesson we too often forget.  This film is a marvelous reminder, with remarkable performances by Tim Robbins and Oscar-nominated Morgan Freeman.  It is beautifully written and expertly directed and a fine film in several aspects.Regardless of whether it IS the greatest film of all time, the greatest film of the decade, or the greatest film of 1994, it is not to be missed for it holds wisdom and is great fun.

Comment Head: Perfection: hope, emancipation and the inviolability of the human spirit
Fine film, but not best of all time
A Friend in need is a Friend indeed.
Comment Body: I remember the first time I saw this movie. It was on the big screen. Let me say something about how movie-goers in my country watch their movies at the cinemas. They always leave before the credits at the end of the movie is up. But it was different with Shawshank Redemption (S.R.) Most of the audience just sat on although there were not many because it was a working day. All who stayed on for the ending credits were obviously moved by the movie. I stayed on to learn who wrote the story. As I left the first thing on my mind was "I've got to get hold of the novel from which this movie is made. Some years later the VCD version is in the market. I have watched it in the comfort of my home several times and find that I still enjoy it at every viewing.  I am puzzled how a movie this good could let Forrest Gump sweep all the price. It makes me doubt the credibility of the Academy of Performing Arts. This is a story about Friends. When one has a true friend, no matter how bad the situation is it makes life tolerable.
